title: Broken Hill Mundi Mundi Bash
description:
The Broken Hill Mundi Mundi Bash is Australia's ultimate outback music festival, set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Mundi Mundi Plains, just outside of Broken Hill, NSW. This all-ages, family-friendly event is a celebration of iconic Australian music, camping, and adventure, drawing thousands from across the country to experience the magic of the outback.

Held annually, the Bash features a stellar lineup of legendary Australian artists. Past performers have included household names like Icehouse, Hoodoo Gurus, The Angels, and Missy Higgins, creating an electric atmosphere under the wide open skies. Beyond the music, the festival offers a variety of quirky activities such as the famous 'Mundi Undi Run' and the world-record Nutbush dance attempt—both raising funds for the Royal Flying Doctor Service. Festival-goers can also get involved in the "Big Blue Day" supporting mental health charity Beyond Blue.

Perfect for caravanners, campers, and road trippers, the festival is a BYO camping event with designated areas for families and dog owners. Facilities include composting toilets and food stalls, but the real highlight is the chance to disconnect, relax, and soak up incredible sunsets over the vast, unspoiled landscape.

The Broken Hill Mundi Mundi Bash is more than a festival - it's an unforgettable outback adventure, blending music, mateship, and Aussie spirit in one of the country's most iconic desert settings.

title: Perfect Light Film Festival
description:
Held in the iconic film town of Broken Hill, the Perfect Light Film Festival is a free three-day annual event.

The Perfect Light Film Festival kicks off with a launch, the night featuring an Independent Aussie Feature Film, followed by a Q&A at Silver City Cinema.

On Saturday, the popular short film festival will run at the Civic Centre in Broken Hill. Up to 15 short films will be screened and awarded monetary prizes by a panel of celebrity judges.  Enjoy food, live music and films!

The ​Perfect Light Film Festival advises that films are unclassified, and some are suited to 15-plus years.

The Sunday features a filmmaking and acting symposium held at the Civic Centre in Broken Hill, and is a chance to learn from industry experts about the industry.

See the website for more details.

title: Saltbush Country | Broken Hill
description:
Saltbush Country provides a rare opportunity for audiences across regional South Australia to experience the works and worldviews of Aboriginal women artists practising independently in the state. In this statewide touring exhibition, seven regional artists tell stories of their culture, community and connection to Country. Often personal and occasionally raw, their work reflects the world as seen through their eyes – a contemporary articulation of Aboriginal life in regional South Australia.

Saltbush Country, curated by Tarnanthi Regional Curator Marika Davies, was one of the highlight exhibitions of Tarnanthi 2023 when it was presented at Port Pirie Regional Art Gallery and in Adelaide at the Kerry Packer Civic Gallery at the Hawke Centre, UniSA City West campus.

Artists: Josephine Lennon, Marli Macumba, Juanella McKenzie, Deanna Newchurch, Lynette Newchurch, Sandra Saunders, Heather Shearer

The artists’ works are the result of a series of community workshops, mentoring and professional development opportunities catering for prominent regional artists and supported by Country Arts SA and Tarnanthi.

title: Mutawintji Cultural Festival
description:
Celebrate the vibrant living culture of the Pantjikali, Wanyuparlku, Wilyakali and Malyangapa people at the Mutawintji Cultural Festival, held in the spectacular Mutawintji National Park near Broken Hill, NSW. 

This two-day event showcases the rich traditions of Aboriginal dance, music, language, storytelling, and art in one of Australia's most culturally significant landscapes.

Set among ancient red cliffs and sacred rock art sites, the festival offers visitors a chance to connect deeply with Aboriginal culture through performances, guided tours, bush tucker tastings, workshops and cultural conversations. The program is family-friendly and features both traditional and contemporary Aboriginal arts.

A highlight of the festival is the opportunity to experience corroborees under the stars — a powerful and moving expression of cultural continuity. Local Aboriginal guides lead interpretive walks through country, sharing stories and songlines passed down through generations.

Camping is available nearby, and all visitors are encouraged to respect and celebrate this special place.

Don't miss this unforgettable cultural experience in the heart of the NSW Outback. Bookings essential.

title: White Cliffs Camel Cup and Bikekhana
description:
Welcome to the White Cliffs Camel Cup and Bikekhana - A fantastic event run by the Gymkhana and Rodeo team.  Imagine Camels roaring down the straight racing for a chance to win the big Cup. In between Camel Races, there are motorbikes racing in a bid to win a ribbon. Tiny tots on their motorbikes with smiles from ear to ear.

People come from far and wide to compete and watch. Free camping and showers all weekend are included with your entrance wristband. Catering and entertainment throughout. 

This is a great outback family weekend. You are invited to come and enjoy this outback event.

title: White Cliffs Gymkhana and Rodeo
description:
The White Cliﬀs Gymkhana and Rodeo is one of the last remaining bush events in the Western Division of NSW. 

The Gymkhana has been held annually for more than 130 years and is one of the few continuing successful weekend outback events. The weekend is packed full of Gymkhana Events catered for all ages and the Rodeo to top it off.  

People come from far and wide to compete and watch.  Free camping and showers all weekend. Catering throughout. This is a great outback family weekend.

title: Enngonia Races
description:
Enngonia is located on the banks of the Warrego River, 97.3 km north of Bourke. The Enngonia Races are a yearly event encouraging patrons from all over Australia to attend a great day of fun.

The races are steeped in history.

Official racing is recorded as far back as 1877, with the Enngonia Jockey Club holding meetings twice a year.

The Enngonia Amateur Race and Enngonia District Race clubs succeeded and held meetings until the First World War.

It was in 1922 that the current race club was formed, which is now known as the Enngonia Picnic Race Club and held a two-day meeting apart from the Second World War in 1939.

title: Wentworth Angling Club Fishing Competition
description:
Fort Courage Caravan Park is the host for the fishing competition and Saturday night evening dinner.  

Usual rules for the fishing competition apply and prize categories.  

A delicious evening meal will be prepared for your enjoyment. 

A great night out with family and friends so come along and enjoy the fantastic company. 

Please respond if you are coming  by phoning.

title: Virus Shawl Crochet Workshop
description:
Come along and create  a virus shawl, this  is a crocheted or knitted shawl characterised by its unique, triangular shape that grows with each row, resembling the spread of a virus. 

Supplies provided as well as afternoon tea supplied by Lock 10 and Weir Restaurant.

title: Wentworth Racing Club Vegas Night
description: Come along to The Wentworth Racing Clubs Vegas Night. Get set for a fun filled night out. Play mock casino games with your outback bucks then use your winnings to bid on auction items.

title: Junior Code Breaker Missions
description:
Calling all junior code breakers. 

Become a Junior Code Breaker with a mission at the Wentworth Military Museum.

Successfully decipher hidden messages warning Darwin of an imminent attack or assist the allied invasion on D-Day.

Get rewarded with an Official Junior Code Breaker certificate and drink voucher redeemable at the Royal and Crown Hotels.

title: Life and Light Photography Competition Display
description:
Western Local Lands Service will be displaying the photography from the 2024 "Spirit of Country" competition in the gallery.  

Be inspired to enter the 2025 Life and Light Photo Competition.

title: Wentworth Pre-Show Horse Show
description:
This event showcases horses in action, children's novelties, topsy ring, show jumping, equestrian and hacking. 

All are welcome to watch these amazing horses and their skilled riders.

The Pre Show program is available on the Wentworth Show website in the Horses Section.

title: Wentworth Show
Issi Dye - Johnny O'Keefe 40th Anniversary Rock 'n' Roll Show
description: Come along and enjoy all the hits including: Shout!, I'm counting on you, Sing Sing Sing, She's my Baby!  Also including the ultimate tribute to Roy Orbison with Glen Douglas.  Free entertainment in the lounge bar.

title: Back O Bourke Stampede - Peter Simmonds Memorial Pro Rodeo
description:
The backcountry’s premier rodeo event is back in business and will be bigger and better than ever. This year, the Back O' Bourke Stampede pays a special tribute to one of Bourke's own sons and favourite cowboys—Peter Simmonds!

This Pro Rodeo is proudly affiliated with APRA9 Events, The Bull Ride, Saddle Bronc, Bareback Bronc Ride, Rope and Tie, Steer Wrestling, Team Roping, Barrel Race, Breakaway Roping, Junior Barrel Race, and the Peter Simmonds Memorial Shoot Out. 

Full bar facilities, a variety of food stalls, live entertainment and official Stampede merchandise.

title: Australia Day in Bourke
description:
Join the Bourke Shire Council, the Rotary of Bourke and the Bourke community to help reflect, respect and celebrate during the breakfast and awards ceremony.

The 2026 Australia Day official ceremony and ambassadors' address starts at 9 am in Darling Park Bourke – corner of Sturt and Mitchell Street.

All community members and visitors to the town are invited to attend and help celebrate the morning. Don’t forget about the giant Lamington Tower cake after the ceremony.

Following the breakfast celebrations, you are invited to head to the Bourke Pool Complex for free entry and slushies to help shake the summer heat. 

The entire family can participate in pool activities and games in the afternoon.

title: Christmas in the Park
description:
Every year the Bourke Community hold a wonderful market night. This year it will be held at the Darling Park and Wharf Precinct.

The event has many activities on offer! Santa makes an appearance with his elves and other entertainment is provided. Food and drink stalls are available, as well as a wide variety of homemade treats. 

Come along to the 2025 Christmas in the Park markets.

title: Brewarrina Blizzard
description:
Ice skating and 'snow' is not what you'd expect to find in one of the hottest and driest regions of NSW, but that's exactly what's on offer in the remote community of Brewarrina every July.

The Brewarrina Blizzard is a free weeklong winter wonderland in the heart of outback NSW, with a full-sized ice rink, snow experience, food vendors and more,  offering locals, surrounding regions and travellers an unforgettable experience that would usually be out of reach.

The Blizzard is open daily, offering free ice skating sessions, with skates and penguin skate aids included. Plus, there's plenty of food and drinks available and ample spots for mum and dad to sit back, relax and take in the action. 

After you've hit the ice, take the time to delve into the rich culture, heritage and spectacular outback vistas of the region. 

Just around the corner from the Blizzard, you'll find one of the oldest human construction on earth, the ancient Baiame's Ngunnhu. These remarkable stone fish traps, hold great cultural and spiritual significance, and are still used today. Discover more about this sacred site, and immerse in First Nation culture, with a tour of the Brewarrina Aboriginal Cultural Museum.

You'll also find breathtaking landscapes, prime river frontage, some of the best fishing in the state, and ample opportunities to escape into nature.

title: Australia Day in Cobar
description:
The Great Australia Duck Race is a reason to make Cobar Memorial Swimming Pool your destination for Australia Day! The ducks (yellow rubber duckies) are numbered  1-200 and have to swim the 50 metre length of the pool. 
First duck to reach the shallow end and touch the wall is the winner!

Enjoy the rest of the activities at the pool including the giant inflatable obstacle, the water slide and score a BBQ  lunch by one of the local community groups.

Soak up the atmosphere of the pool and the celebration of local heroes being awarded Australia Day honors for their amazing work.
host: The Great Cobar Museum & Visitors Information Centre

title: Lightning Ridge Opal and Gem Festival
description:
The Lightning Ridge Opal and Gem Festival is a four day event that includes the Opal Queen Ball, Opal and Gem Expo, IOJDAA Trade Show, and IOJDAA Jewellery Competition which is held biannually. 

The event attracts approximately 4000 people over the four days, and the event is the largest on the Australian opal events circuit. The indoor and outdoor stalls feature a wide variety of cut and polished gemstones, jewellery and lifestyle products.

The festival is run by the Opal and Gem Festival Committee and is a not-for-profit event with approximately 15 percent of the profit donated back to the local community.
host: LIGHTNING RIDGE OPAL AND GEM FESTIVAL INC

title: Lightning Ridge Opal Festival
description:
The Opal and Gem Expo boasts over 100 stalls with a huge range of products including gemstones, tools, lapidary supplies and lifestyle products.  

Jewellers, buyers, wholesalers, miners, rock hounds, lapidary enthusiasts and tourists are invited to experience the best Lightning Ridge has to offer with this culmination of information, spectacular jewellery, collectables, great deals and fantastic networking opportunities.

title: Let's Dance Carinda Festival
description:
It was 1983 when David Bowie travelled to our tiny NSW outback town of Carinda to film his now iconic video for "Let's Dance" in the Carinda Hotel. The Australian video for the smash worldwide hit proved the perfect companion for the ground-breaking song. The bonus of the scenes filmed in Carinda and the Warrumbungle National Park created the magical backdrop for what many regards as Bowie's most distinctive and powerful video. Since that date, the pub has become a mecca for Bowie fans from all over the world, looking to stand and be photographed in the same spot where Bowie filmed his video. The town itself has now embraced this historic connection and hosts an annual "Let's Dance Carinda" festival paying tribute to and celebrating David Bowie and his remarkable music legacy.

​

title: Let's Dance Carinda Music Festival
description:
The Lets Dance Carinda Music Festival is unique to the country town of Carinda. In 1983, David Bowie visited Carinda, where he filmed his iconic song 'Let's Dance' in the Carinda Hotel. This special event enticed the town to create this one-of-a-kind festival with unique ties to Carinda, something that no other town can claim. The festival is held annually over the October Long Weekend.

On Saturday, the main program features a lineup of artists and bands, workshops for visitors, demonstrations of sheep shearing and crutching, and a dog jumping competition. The festival encourages attendees to dress up as David Bowie, with competitions for the best-dressed lookalikes in male, female, and children's categories. One of the highlights is the 'Red Shoe Tent,' where visitors can paint their old shoes red and participate in a colouring competition for children. 

On Sunday, a reenactment of the Let's Dance film clip is performed at the Carinda Hotel, where this incomparable event showcases exactly where Bowie stood, with the original wall tiles behind him. 

Additionally, the festival hosts a street parade on Sunday of the long weekend, where many enthusiastic participants dress in David Bowie-inspired costumes. 

This event aims to enhance local community engagement, foster social connections, and encourage fans of David Bowie to enjoy a fun-filled weekend, travelling to the Country and Outback region of New South Wales.
host: Let's Dance Carinda Tribute Committee Incorporated

title: Mungindi Show
description:
The Mungindi Show promotes the local community as well as engages other community groups and provides social opportunities and development.

The main event this year is a Header/Picker Demolition Derby on Saturday afternoon, the very first event of its kind in New South Wales! 

The show will also feature the amazing Crack Up Sisters, and Crocodile Encounters. There is a car demo derby, lawn mower races, woodchop events, Bubble Muffin Cooking classes, Mungindi Aerial lolly drop, U-Beaut Ute comp, sideshow alley, and rides and fireworks. The pavilion will showcase all ages of creativity in the community. 

On Sunday, the day begins with the Poets Breakfast followed by the pet parade and dog high jump, billy boiling competition and grain shoveling.

Bring the whole family along for a weekend you will not want to miss!

title: Mungindi Races
description:
The Mungindi Cup, held in early July each year, is country racing at its best! This event was first held in 1872 and the tradition continues with a six-race strong meeting that is generously supported by our local sponsors.

The Mungindi Races are perfectly timed with the school holidays for a great family day out. Along with a day of racing, there will be a President’s Luncheon, food stalls, a jumping castle and foot races for all ages.

Live entertainment and a fully licenced bar will be operating into the evening for all racegoers. Fashions-of-the-field remains a key event and attracts many entrants adorned in both traditional and cutting-edge winter races styles. Bookmakers and a TAB are also available for punters on the day.

The Mungindi Jockey Club, a volunteer committee, are delighted to host the Mungindi Cup and look forward to welcoming you trackside!

For more information visit the Mungindi Jockey Club website,  or 'like' the Mungindi Races Facebook page.

title: Booligal Sheep Races
description:
Enjoy a great fun family day out at the annual Booligal Sheep Races.

Relax on the green lawn of the Booligal Cricket Ground, enjoy the barbecue and the thrill of racing your sheep. There are great prizes throughout the day.

The day kicks off with the Best Decorated Sheep Judging and then the races begin. Don't worry if your sheep is not a finalist as there is a chance to buy a sheep in a heat in the sheep auction in the middle of the day. Get a syndicate together and your sheep could be the winner of the Booligal Cup!

It's a great event to get involved in as all proceeds go to local charities. Come along and see how the locals have fun in the outback.

Camping spots available. Entertainment also at Booligal Hotel.

title: Come-by-Chance Picnic Races
description:
Come-by-Chance is located about 100 kilometres north-west of Coonamble in the Walgett Shire, and about 250 kilometres from Dubbo. 

The event features racing, food outlets, Fashions on the Field, kids entertainment, a live band and a fireworks display. 

Each year the population of Come-by-Chance swells with their famous picnic races. Come and visit this tiny village and find out why it has become one of the most popular picnic races in the region!

title: Annual Hay Show
description:
Everyone loves a country show and Hay has it all happening.

The pavilion is filled with wonderful homemade goods and cooking competitions, children's artwork and Country Women's Association scones. A cup of tea and a chat! 

Take a stroll along the grassed area, smell the barbeque steaks and watch the dog jump and children's pets. 

Side show ally is a must for everyone big and small.

Finishing off the evening with a wonderful display of fireworks.

title: Hay Glow
description:
Come along to the annual 'Hay Glow' evening. Pack up the family or bring your friends to what is leading up to being a wonderful afternoon/evening of fun and entertainment.

This year, an element of difference, they will be hosting markets, lantern workshops and live music. The whole pond at the Hay Park will be a glow with lanterns, including a giant turtle, sun, star, rainbow, Murray Cod and this year's surprise. 

This is a fantastic evening with live music, food and entertainment. BYO rug and refreshments, soft drink will be available to purchase from the food vans.

title: Hay Races
description:
The Hay races are the biggest day on the Hay social calendar as the town swells with racegoers. The Fashions on the Field is the largest in country NSW, and the Hay Gold Cup attracts horses from across the State. 

Racegoers can choose from a variety of hospitality packages from umbrella packages right through to fully catered marquees. A day not to be missed for anyone who loves a day at the track.

title: World Bowls Champion of Champions Singles Tournament
description:
The World Bowls Champion of Champions Singles event is bringing the best singles bowlers in the world to Barham. 

The event is broadcast on several social media platforms and creates a significant advertising opportunity for destination tourism for the Murray River region to a State, National and International audience.

There will be approximately 60 bowlers from over twenty Nations.

title: Lake Cargelligo Annual Show
description: The Lake Cargelligo Annual Show showcases exhibits of livestock, produce, art and manufacture from the local district. It's a fun-filled day where community members, family and friends gather in one place to have a great day.

title: Tottenham Gymkhana
description:
Tottenham Horse Sports and Gymkhana has been held annually for over 40 years, and they know what it takes to have a great day. There are events for all of the family, from tug-o-wars and horse events to quick shear and track events.

Where else can you take the family for such a cheap day out and have them involved in a wide range of old-fashioned activities? They can even win back their entry fee in some of the competitions. Foot races, pushbike races, apple-bobbing, billy-cart derby, tug-o-war, dog high jump; the list just goes on.

If you have older children, or for the young at heart, there is a shearing competition, a challenge event between teams of horse, bike and foot runners, adults' tug-o-wars, and adults' dummy spitting.

There is a bar and a barbecue, all with prices that reflect a great family day out.

title: Tottenham Picnic Races
description:
Enjoy one of the Central West's leading country picnic race meets at the Tottenham Picnic Races.

You can expect to enjoy a complimentary lunch followed by the race program. There will also be free entertainment for children throughout the day.

There is a courtesy bus running from the Tottenham Hotel to the event or there will be camping available.  

Tickets are are only available at the gate - no presale.

title: Yellow Mountain Cross Country
description:
Save the date! The first weekend in August is the Yellow Mountain Cross Country, a fast paced enduro race held between Condobolin and Tottenham each year.  

This year the race will start in Tottenham on Saturday for the approximately 240 km ride to Condobolin. Riders will return from Condobolin to Tottenham on Sunday.

title: Toganmain Woolshed Precinct Open Days
description:
Step back in time and explore the iconic Toganmain Woolshed, its outbuildings, and a range of historical displays.

While they won't be running formal tours, knowledgeable volunteers will be stationed throughout the precinct to share insights and answer your questions.

title: Moree on a Plate Food and Wine Festival
description:
The North West New South Wales community of Moree will dish up some of its best regional fare at the annual Moree on a Plate Food and Wine Festival.

The well-established event enjoys a reputation as one of the region's premier food and wine festivals, showcasing a smorgasbord of producers from across New South Wales and South East Queensland.

Featuring national food icons such as Fast Ed, Marion Grasby, Ben O'Donoghue, Lyndey Milan and Matt Golinski as past celebrity guests, Moree on a Plate aims to promote the thriving boutique produce industries evolving from the North West's black soil plains.

From fresh locally grown olives, pecans, oranges, pasta and wines, plus a dedicated Kids Korner and live entertainment, Moree on a Plate is certain to satisfy.

For more information on attending or exhibiting at this year's Moree on a Plate, please visit the website.

title: Roger Knox & Toby Martin - Moree
description:
Join Uncle Roger, a proud Gomeroi Songman and Elder, born in Moree, with beloved Australian musician and songwriter Toby Martin, for an entertaining evening of song and storytelling under the stars. Be moved and entranced as you listen to powerful tales and melodies, and preview some songs from Uncle Roger's new studio album Buluunarbi and The Old North Star. Don't miss this uplifting evening in the BAMM garden, gathered around the fire pits, under the winter night sky. 

Roger Knox was raised on the Toomelah Aboriginal Mission Station on the bend of the Macintyre River. Charlie Duncan taught him how to play guitar at an early age and Roger also loved to sing with his mother and grandmother in the church choir. Although Gospel music was his first love, once he found his way to Tamworth in his late teens Roger's passion for Country music grew and he began to invest it with his own Aboriginal style. 

Now in 2025, as a seasoned entertainer and story teller, he tours nationally and internationally, performing in mainstream and across First Nation communities. 

Toby Martin is a musician and songwriter. He is perhaps best known as the lead singer of Sydney/Gadigal band Youth Group, with whom he has released five albums, toured the world, won an ARIA, and had a Number One single in 2006 with 'Forever Young'.

title: The Moree Father's Day Special Markets
description:
The Moree Father's Day Special Markets are a separate, one-off event held annually in celebration of Father's Day. This market is typically held on the first Sunday of September at Jellicoe Park, offering a unique mix of local crafts, fresh produce, food stalls, and a variety of products perfect for celebrating dads. It's a vibrant community event with a family-friendly atmosphere, featuring live entertainment and activities for children.

In addition to the markets, the event often includes the Father's Day Show and Shine Car Show, organized by the Moree Motor Enthusiast Club. This car show features an impressive array of vehicles, from vintage cars and hot rods to trucks and motorcycles, attracting car enthusiasts from across the region. It's a great opportunity to admire classic cars, enjoy the lively environment, and indulge in some delicious food and drink from local vendors.

For more information on the Father's Day event, it's best to check with the Moree Motor Enthusiast Club or the official Moree tourism website closer to the date.

title: Moree Markets
description:
Take a leisurely stroll through the monthly Moree Markets held each month. There will be something for
everyone, including, but not limited to, books, plants, clothes, handmade goodies, local produce, tasty delights, beverages, and much more.

title: Tullibigeal Picnic Races
description:
Experience the exhilarating annual Tullibigeal Picnic Races, where the thrill of racing meets the warmth of camaraderie. 

It's the perfect occasion to revel in spirited competitions while bonding with cherished family and friends, creating cherished memories amidst the vibrant ambiance.

title: Pave The Way to Gular Street Art Festival
description:
Pave The Way to Gular Street Art Festival (PTWTG) is a vibrant festival revitalising Gulargambone's walls and spaces with exciting public art.

The festival offers two days of visual, interactive, and educational experiences, hosting visiting and local artists. Each year, the event aims to foster artistic expression and accessibility, inspire emerging talent, and contribute to the cultural vibrancy of the region.

title: Musica dal Vivo
description:
'Musica dal Vivo' has outgrown its venue!

This year, Limone will celebrate the Taste of Italy – Griffith Festival at Piccolo Family Farm with live Italian music.

Three-course set sharing menu. Bookings are essential, and full payment is required upon booking.

Bus transport is available. Secure your way to and from Piccolo Family Farm with buses departing from Griffith Visitors Information Centre at 5.45pm and 6.45pm, and returning after the event. This option can be selected when finalising your booking.

title: Wee Waa Show
description:
Returning in 2025!

Wee Waa's Annual Show is renowned for featuring some of New South Wales' finest sheep and cattle. It is also features the wonderful exhibits of handiwork, fine art, cooking and photography in the main pavilion, live entertainment, pet shows, campdraft, fireworks and much more!

title: Griffith Agricultural Show
description:
The Annual Griffith Show will bring all the fun of the fair to Griffith! 

There will be something for everyone including entertainment, Horse Ring events and Show jumping, Wood Chopping, Tractor Pull, Demolition Derby, Showgirls, Dog Show, Reptile Show, Animal Nursery, baking and art displays, Rides and Sideshows, live music, fireworks and more.

title: Griffith Australia Day Celebrations
description:
Experience the vibrant spirit of Australia Day at the Griffith Australia Day Awards and Citizenship Celebrations. Join this unique celebration where exceptional individuals are honored, and new citizens are welcomed into the diverse Australian family.

At this remarkable event, witness the presentation of the prestigious Australia Day Awards by an esteemed Australia Day Ambassador. It's a chance to be part of an inspiring moment and celebrate the outstanding achievements of fellow citizens.

But that's not all – expect to be entertained throughout the festivities. Captivating performances have been arranged to enhance your experience and make this day even more memorable.

Australia Day in Griffith is a day of unity, pride, and belonging. Join in as the community comes together to commemorate the rich tapestry of our nation. It's an opportunity to embrace the Australian spirit and connect with the heart of the community.

Don't miss out on this extraordinary celebration. Join on Australia Day for a day filled with recognition, entertainment, and the shared joy of being a part of this great nation.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Griffith
description:
In 2021, Andrew Hamilton spent four months in two of Sydney’s maximum-security prisons for the commercial supply of psychedelic drugs. While incarcerated, Andrew began noticing the transformative power of laughter. After all, if a joke can make you forget you’re in prison, what else can it do? 

Upon his release, Andrew took up stand-up comedy, initially under strict bail conditions where his parents had to come with him to shows, and he had to be home in time for curfew. 

A year later, Andrew performed his debut solo show ‘Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison’, at the 2023 Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Andrew’s show garnered him critical acclaim, along with a nomination for Best Newcomer.

title: Griffith Rotary Market
description:
The Griffith Rotary Market is held every Sunday morning. A car boot sale will also be offered at the market on the first Sunday of each month.

Meet the local growers and makers at the weekly Rotary market. Seasonal fruit and vegetables, bread, cakes, Italian biscuits, jams, relish, olive oil, eggs, honey, plants and much more are what you will find when you head to the Griffith Rotary Markets.

Entry by gold coin donation.

title: Griffith Easter Party
description:
Griffith Easter Party is an annual celebration of fun, family-friendly festivities over the Easter long weekend. 

Celebrate the end of the grape vintage in our bustling wine-producing region with an abundance of local food & wine, cellar-door experiences and countless events on offer. 

Explore the charm of Griffith through an array of attractions and indulge as you taste the culture of Griffith this Easter.

title: Seniors (Legends) Pro-Am Golf Tournament
description:
Griffith Golf Club will be hosting the Seniors (Legends) Pro-Am Golf Tournament to be played on the picturesque lush but challenging Griffith Golf Course. 

This event allows local and visiting amateur golfers to participate and play alongside Australian golf greats such as Peter Lonard, Andre Stolz, Peter Senior and Mike Harwood. 

The PGA Legends Tour donates one per cent of total prize money to Police Legacy. Last year, the PGA Legends Tour staged 76 events worth AUD1.9 million, numbers they hope to better in 2025 and Griffith Golf Club is proud to be one of these participants.

title: Glow2680 - Sidewalk Sale
description: Join the Glow2680 Sidewalk Sale and shop ‘til you drop! Wander the local Banna Avenue and pick up a bargain at the local retail stalls on the sidewalk.

title: A Taste of Italy Griffith - Sidewalk Sale
description: Join the Taste of Italy's Sidewalk Sale and shop ‘til you drop! Wander the local Banna Avenue and pick up a bargain at the local retail stalls on the sidewalk.

title: Griffith Spring Fest - Real Juice Company Citrus Sculptures
description:
Join the Griffith Spring Fest and see more than 70 larger-than-life sculptures created with over 100,000 oranges and grapefruit along Banna Avenue, Griffith.

An army of more than 800 volunteers came together at sunrise on October 12 to construct this unique display which has been creating an amazing site since 1996.

The Citrus Sculptures are on display in Banna Avenue for two weeks, and they encourage you to park in the Griffith Tourism Hub car park and then wander through the sculptures and admire the citrus industry in the region.

The Sculptures are the hero event of the Griffith Spring Fest. Also, visit the open gardens, join in the festivities at the Launch Party or book a seat on the garden tour bus. There is plenty is going on in Griffith during Spring Fest.

title: Multicultural Festival Of Griffith
description:
The Multicultural Festival has become a beloved tradition, showcasing the incredible diversity of the community.

People from all walks of life come together to celebrate and be part of the unique customs, traditions, and cuisines that make the region and in particular, Griffith, so special.  Brought to you by the Multicultural Council of Griffith Inc. The Multicultural Festival, is a celebration of people and cultural richness, through dance, music and delicious food.

Located in Memorial Park, this family day with free entry, food stalls, traditional songs and dance with traditional costumes.

A day of fun, including a spaghetti-eating competition, flag ceremony, and other activities.

Griffith is home to such diversity of different cultural groups who participate in the festival

title: Griffith Spring Fest
description:
There is so much to see and experience during the festival, such as their amazing and unique Citrus Sculptures, the Open Gardens which features beautiful gardens that have been created and nurtured by very hard-working and talented gardeners, as well as garden workshops and talks for attendees.

Garden bus tours are available so you can sit back, relax and enjoy the scenery and gardens. Join them at the Launch Party and indulge in delicious local food on offer, entertainment, and local wine and beer by the sculptures.

Taste the culture of Griffith with an abundance of entertainment and experiences to enjoy during Griffith Spring Fest.

Griffith is a wonderful multicultural community, with friendly people and great attractions.

Visit the Griffith Tourism Hub where the wonderful team can assist with your Griffith experience.

title: Griffith Spring Fest - Open Gardens
description:
Visit Griffith's best open gardens when they celebrate 33 years of the Garden Festival.

Enjoy the large expansive gardens unique to the Griffith region. Some are set amongst the citrus orchards or the vineyards, others located close to town. Experience genuine country hospitality from the local garden owners, who love visitors coming to enjoy their space. You will meet so many people who love gardens while supporting their local charities along the way.

The Garden Festival allows you to join in on many workshops and demonstrations while supporting Griffith's foodies, arts and culture along the way.

title: Griffith Spring Fest - Street Party
description:
Join in celebrating the Citrus Sculptures and Open Gardens with a lively street party right amidst the sculptures! 

There will be an array of children's activities, games, and entertainment suitable for the whole family to enjoy. 

You can also savour delicious dishes available for purchase while admiring the stunning sculptures. It's a family-friendly event featuring a Beer and Wine Bar, Food Stalls, as well as a lineup of fun activities and entertainment. 

Don't miss out on this exciting festival kick-off!

title: A Taste of Italy - Griffith
description:
Prepare to savour the tastes, sights and sounds of Italy over one delicious week in August as A Taste of Italy combines everything on offer in Griffith. 

Salami, gnocchi, music and more – showcasing their authentic Italian culture and providing you all with a complete and memorable week in Griffith with the many Italian-themed events and experiences for the whole family to enjoy.

The first Italian migrants brought their viticulture, market gardening skills and passion for food and cooking to Griffith. Old traditions like salami making, preserving olives and sauce days are continued enthusiastically. 

A Taste of Italy Griffith is a week-long celebration of the Italian culture and heritage that is so unique to Griffith. There is a huge range of events and experiences to enjoy as you taste your way around Griffith.

title: Griffith Spring Fest - Garden Bus Tours
description:
Griffith Spring Fest, Garden bus tours are back up and running for this year’s Griffith Garden Festival.

Departing the Griffith Tourism Hub. The day will consist of exploring four exclusive open gardens as well as a light lunch around midday.

Tickets will be released in August 2025.

title: Clay Target Shooting Deniliquin
description:
The Deniliquin Clay Target Club are affiliated with the Australian Clay Target Association and shoot on the third Sunday each month at the racecourse reserve range.

The club facilitates, encourages and develops clay target shooting in a safe and supportive environment.

title: Condo Oktoberfest
description:
Dress in your finest  Dirndls and Lederhosen and enjoy a spring afternoon of live music and entertainment, German beer, and more at the Condobolin Sports Club. 

Gather your friends for the annual Condo Oktoberfest, promising to be an unforgettable event this year!

title: 'Let Me Be Myself - The Life Story of Anne Frank'
description:
'Let Me Be Myself - The Life Story of Anne Frank' Exhibition is on display at the Peppin Heritage Centre Gallery.

In 2015 the Anne Frank House has introduced a new generation of travelling exhibitions: "Let Me Be Myself – The Life Story of Anne Frank".

Apart from the story of Anne Frank and the historical context of her time, it specifically highlights the contemporary relevance of the story of Anne Frank.
Anne doesn't just keep a diary during her time in the Secret Annex. She also writes short stories and some of her "Tales" she reads aloud to the people in hiding.

title: ArtOut Easter Market
description:
Part of the Easter in Deni Program, the ArtOut Market is run by Edward River Council and draws locals and visitors alike to the centre of town for a leisurely market experience.

Local artists and artisans come together in the beautiful Waring Gardens on Easter Saturday Morning. The open-air sales event includes all types of creative art, sculpture, textiles, gourmet produce, and vintage clothes from across the region and beyond. The atmosphere is lively as visitors and locals are encouraged to meet the makers at the exhibitor stalls.

title: Anh Do - Deniliquin
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'
Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.
When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Condobolin Show
description:
The Condobolin Show Society is conducting the 129th annual Condobolin Show!

The show will host competitive classes for horses (five rings including 2 Showjumping and ASHS), Merino sheep and fleeces, cattle and all the traditional pavilion classes. A Championship Dog show also takes place at the adjacent location.

title: Condobolin All Breeds Championship Dog Show
description:
The annual Condobolin Dog Show is run over 10 days each year. There will be plenty of dogs on show as this is an All Breeds Championship.

Drop in to the arena near the Riverview Caravan Park on Diggers Avenue to watch the canine action at any time during the show.

title: Condo SkyFest
description:
Condo SkyFest is a free festival celebrating 65,000 plus years of Wiradjuri Culture, Creativity and Continuity at the Wiradjuri Study Centre in Condobolin.

The festival will be a day full of entertainment and activities including, live music, dance performances, boomerang throwing, Wiradjuri language, bush tukka, face painting, art exhibitions, astronomy and sky stories.

title: Condobolin Picnic Races
description:
The Condobolin Picnic Races are held annually in Condobolin. 

Visitors are welcome to join in with the fun of all of these wonderful bush events. This is a fun-filled day of racing, socialising and fashion.

title: Milby Sports Gymkhana
description:
Milby Sports Day is a day of fabulous fun for all the family. 

You can't go past it for an authentic Aussie bush experience at the iconic Milby Sportsgrounds.

There will be a gymkhana and horse events, steer rides, wood chopping, foot races, the Bushmen's challenge, novelty events for all ages, fabulous food, music, a publican's booth and children's entertainment. Milby Sportsday has it all!

title: Black Dog Ride
description:
Black Dog Ride's mission is to raise awareness of depression and suicide prevention. The organisation works toward this goal through a variety of initiatives, including the Annual National 1-Day Ride, the Annual National Long Distance Ride, and Community Awareness Campaigns. 

While fundraising plays a vital role in supporting these efforts, the primary focus remains on raising awareness. In 2019, Black Dog Ride launched the Community Grants Program to direct funds to community-based projects that create a meaningful, nationwide impact.

title: Pallamallawa (Pally)  Bush Markets
description:
The Pally Bush Markets feature a selection of fresh produce, handmade goods, and community-focused stalls. 

The market offers a friendly, laid-back atmosphere where visitors can explore unique local products and taste regional life. It's a great place to support local vendors and connect with the community.

title: Tullamore Agricultural Show
description:
Experience the vibrant blend of farming excellence and community celebration at the annual Tullamore Agricultural Show.

This fun filled family event features a diverse range of attractions including ring events, sideshow alley, horse and show jumping events, livestock judging, poultry, crop competition and speed shearing competition. The Championship Dog Show is always a crowd favourite and one not to be missed. 

Discover a truly great agricultural show that’s also a must-attend social highlight of the year.

title: Rich River Rod Run
description:
The Rich River Rod Run is held in the border towns of Echuca Moama, in March every second year (in even years) and attracts entrants from all over Australia. 

Hosted by the Rich River Rod and Custom Club, entrants are hosted to a weekend of fun, with the general public invited to a colourful Show n Shine on the Sunday featuring over 300 vehicles.  

For full details please visit the website.

title: Tour de Gorge
description:
The famous Tour de Gorge in the Pilliga Forest will be held at Dandry Gorge next September. 

Starting with a briefing, there will be short and long routes on family-friendly trails through the beautiful bush. 

Make a morning of it with various stall holders in attendance and a barbeque by the Baradine Central School. 

If not riding, you could enjoy the three-kilometre Sculptures in the Scrub walking track or bring a camp chair and book to relax while you wait. 

Further information and details to be confirmed. For enquiries or to be added to the emailing list, please email the Pilliga Forest Discovery Centre.

title: Weethalle Show
description:
The Annual Weethalle Show is an event that is not to be missed! 

Featuring horse events, poultry, sheep and wool, and pavilion displays of farm produce, flowers, photography, arts and crafts, cooking and schoolwork. 

Attractions also include the tractor pull, homebrew competition, ute competition, bike decorating, machinery displays and stalls.

title: The Riverina Classic Fishing Competition
description:
The 2026 Riverina Classic Fishing Competition is an annual event.

The Riverina Classic Catch and Release Fishing Competition is a great three-day of fishing over a weekend in February each year. As a charity event proceeds are distributed to a chosen charity each year and also used to re-stock the Murrumbidgee River with native fingerlings securing a healthy and sustainable fishing future.

As a full photo entry competition, anglers have better flexibility on fishing hours and the entry of oversized cod can be accepted in the competition as the survival rate of catch and release fish is increased by reducing the amount of time the fish spends in captivity. ­

title: Riverina Vintage Machinery Club Rally
description: Enjoy going back in time with a range of cars, tractors, trucks, machinery, stationary engines and memorabilia on display. Starting off the dragline and an exciting tractor pull.

title: Perricoota Pop and Pour Festival
description:
Situated in the scenic Perricoota Wine Region, the Perricoota Pop and Pour Festival welcomes you to indulge in a one-day celebration featuring the best brews and culinary delights of the region. 

Board their fleet of festival buses and embark on a personally customisable adventure through the dynamic Murray River scene of Perricoota. Explore five of the area's top venues, each offering a unique taste of local craftsmanship. Whether you're indulging in the refreshing wines inspired by the river's tranquility or sampling small-batch spirits that capture the essence of the fertile lands, there's something to please every palate.

Enjoy the freedom to hop on and off the buses at your leisure, where you can enjoy live entertainment, exclusive drink offerings, and delicious food options at each stop.

As the evening sets in, the buses will return you to the townships of Echuca or Moama, ensuring you can continue the festivities into the night.

Join them as they raise a glass to Echuca Moama at the Perricoota Pop and Pour Festival—an unforgettable celebration of brews, eats, local music in this Murray River setting. See you at the ultimate Festival on Wheels!

title: Moama Motorama
description:
Get ready for a fresh new event that brings together the best of the automotive scene - welcome to Moama Motorama! Set to launch in the beautiful Echuca-Moama region.

Designed to celebrate everything on wheels, Moama Motorama welcomes all makes and models - including stock vehicles, modified cars, unrestored originals, and timeless classics. It's a celebration of motoring in all its forms, and everyone is welcome to be part of it.

The weekend-long festival will feature a diverse range of activities, including vibrant street displays, a fun and interactive mystery run, a judged Show n Shine, live music and entertainment and plenty more, with a strong focus on family fun and community involvement.

This is a fresh new event designed to bring motoring lovers and families together in a relaxed, vibrant setting.

Festivalgoers are encouraged to secure accommodation early, as the Echuca-Moama region is expected to fill fast with visitors.

Keep up to date at the website and please voice your opinions and suggestions via the Facebook page.

title: Run Echuca Moama
description:
Run Echuca Moama is a 21.1-kilometre, 10-kilometre and 5-kilometre run, walk or wheel (mobility aids only) event. The unique and beautiful course weaves its way across the old bridge and new bridge covering both states Victoria and New South Wales. 

This event was previously known as Johnno’s Run. It is an annual fundraising event organised by Community Living and Respites Service (CLRS), dedicated to raising funds for the Opening Doors Project.

Through these projects, they build homes for people with disability in the local community. To date, these projects have built three homes and 12 units, supporting 22 people with disability to live with greater independence and inclusion within their community.

title: Moama Market
description:
The Moama Market has an outstanding atmosphere and something on offer for everyone!

Live music, over 120 plus stalls, hot food and coffee, dog friendly, free parking and an amazing natural setting at Moama Sound Shell.

title: The Bok Lecture
description:
The Bok Lecture, a highlight of Starfest, features renowned astrophysicist Krystal De Napoli, who brings her deep passion for Indigenous sciences and astronomy as a Gomeroi woman. 

During her talk, Krystal will delve into the cultural significance of lunar cusps for marking seasons, explore Aboriginal traditions associated with the Pleiades, and share insights into Muruwari astronomy. 

Visitors are encouraged to dress warmly and bring additional comfort items like a torch, chair, and blanket. A marquee will be set up in case of adverse weather conditions.

title: Oktoberfest
description:
Dust off your dirndls and lederhosen – Oktoberfest at Whitton Malt House is back and bigger than ever!

Set in a lively marquee on the picturesque lakeside grounds of Whitton Malt House in the heart of the Riverina, this is your chance to experience the fun, flavour, and festive spirit of a traditional Bavarian celebration with a regional twist.

Enjoy a jam-packed day of live music, authentic German fare, steins of locally brewed beer, whisky tastings, and crowd-favourite competitions – all in true Oktoberfest style. From bratwurst and pretzels to local beer and whisky, your tastebuds are in for a treat.

Whether you're here to soak up the atmosphere, dress up for best-dressed prizes, or dance the day away with friends, Oktoberfest at Whitton Malt House is not to be missed.

Perfect for foodies, beer lovers, groups of friends, and anyone looking to enjoy a unique cultural experience in the Riverina.

title: Melbourne Cup at Whitton Malt House
description:
Get ready for a day of elegance, excitement, and exhilarating horse racing at The Whitton Malt House Melbourne Cup Celebration, a spectacular celebration of Australia's most prestigious horse race.

Don your finest attire and embrace the tradition of race day fashion. Ladies, flaunt your best fascinators and stylish dresses. Gentlemen, suit up and add a touch of class with your sharpest looks! 

Kick off the festivities with a glass of sparkling champagne and a selection of gourmet canapés. Mix and mingle with fellow race enthusiasts as you soak in the sophisticated atmosphere. 

Enjoy live music performances that will keep the energy high throughout the day. 

Watch the race live on big screens, feel the thrill and excitement as the horses thunder down the track and cheer on your favourites. 

Join Fashions on the field and showcase your race-day attire. Prizes will be awarded for the most stylish and creative outfits. 

Get in on the action with their sweepstakes. Try your luck and see if you can pick the winning horse.

Dance the night away in the lakeside marquee with a bar after the race action concludes.

title: Whitton Malt House Twilight Markets
description:
As the sun sets over the lake, the Whitton Malt House Twilight Market comes to life with an inviting mix of local flavours, artisan stalls, and family-friendly entertainment.

Set in the heart of the Riverina, this seasonal twilight market is a celebration of the region's best — from handmade homewares and gourmet produce to street eats, live music, and unique gifts you won't find anywhere else.

Wander through the lakeside market precinct with a drink in hand, enjoy a relaxed atmosphere, and connect with passionate makers, growers, and creators. It's the perfect way to spend a spring evening with friends, family or visiting guests.

Entry is free. Everyone's welcome.

title: Nosh Narrabri
description:
Narrabri’s own biennial food and drink festival celebrating and promoting local and regional produce and products,  and the providers who grow and make them!
 
The event will be held along the Narrabri Creek shared pathway (behind Hogan and Leitch Ovals)

Nosh food and drink festival will deliver the traditional Nosh events with the Nosh barbeque cookoff, cheesecake, and home brew competitions all set to feature at this event. There will be plenty of kid’s activities too, so everyone in the family can come and enjoy Nosh. 

Sunday will be the Annual Long Lunch.

title: Narrabri  Rotary Markets
description:
Set along the back of Hogan Oval, the local artesian markets sell local pottery, handcrafts, clothing, fruit and vegetables, chickens and birds, hand-crafted jewellery, plants, local fundraising, and so much more.  

This market is held once a month on the first Saturday.

title: Under the Gums Gilgandra
description:
It's on again! Epic live music, flavoursome food, cold brews, good vibes and an iconic location!

Celebrating its fifth year, Under the Gums brings the best in live music to the iconic banks of the Castlereagh River in Gilgandra. An event designed for the young and the young at heart, there's something for everyone this October Long Weekend!

Whether you're from back roads or beach tracks, grab your crew and get ready for an event you won't forget.

More information including artist line-up and ticketing will be available soon.

title: Goin' to Gil Festival Weekend
description:
In conjunction with Under the Gums, they can't wait to welcome you to Gilgandra with a wide lineup of activities over the Goin' to Gil Festival Weekend!

Goin' to Gil is more than just a festival - it's a celebration of community, history, and the unique charm of Gilgandra. 

The festival's diverse lineup includes iconic events such as Under the Gums, a major live music spectacle featuring top Australian acts and local talent; the exciting opening of the Gilgandra Speedway season; and a range of community activities like watermelon eating contests and a lively street parade. There's something for everyone during this action-packed weekend!

Keep an eye out on the website and Gilgandra Region socials for more information.

title: Narromine Dolly Parton Festival
description:
Put your cowboy hats on, saddle up and get ready for the ride.

The Narromine Dolly Parton Festival celebrates the greatest all-time Dolly Parton. American singer-songwriter, musician, actress, philanthropist, and businesswoman, Parton is known primarily for her decades-long career in country music.

title: Mungery Picnic Races
description:
Get trackside for the annual Mungery Picnic Races. It is a six-race program with TAB and bookmakers, fashion in the field, a mid-race auction, Mungery Dash for Cash and children's entertainment with a jumping castle and more.

Enjoy a catered lunch in the Mungery Marquee. For those wanting a more casual meal or snack visit one of the food vans, the coffee van or barbecues. You are welcome to bring your own picnic lunch as well.

title: Barellan Show
description:
The Barellan Show returns this year, bringing with it a vibrant celebration of rural life, community spirit, and good old-fashioned fun. Held at the Barellan Showgrounds, this much-loved annual event showcases the best of the region with livestock displays, home-grown produce, arts and crafts, and friendly competitions for all ages. 

Families can enjoy a full day of entertainment, including rides and amusements. From the excitement of the show ring to the charm of local exhibits, the Barellan Show promises a true taste of the country and a warm welcome for all who attend. 

Perfect for locals and visitors alike, the show is a highlight of the Riverina calendar and a proud tradition that continues to grow every year.

title: Good Old Days Festival
description:
The Good Old Days Festival is one of the nation’s most unique events authentically recreating and celebrating the nation’s pioneer heritage.

The Festival is also the largest gathering of harnessed draught animals – horses, bullocks, camels, donkeys, mules and goats – in Australia.

Held on the long weekend in October each year, the not-for-profit event is run by volunteers and contributes funds back into the regional community.

Early farming practices showcased include horse and bullock-drawn ploughs, binders, wool wagons and a mallee roller.

The Good Old Days Festival also celebrates the iconic water cart with a Furphy Festival featuring rebarrelling demonstrations, Furphy collectables and Furphy trains.

title: Poppers in the Pines
description:
Get ready for an action-packed weekend at Poppers in the Pines – a two-day celebration of vintage tractors and machinery in Burcher, Central West, NSW! 

Experience the thrill of tractor pulls, showcasing these powerful machines in action, and explore an impressive display of historic trucks, classic vehicles, and vintage machinery. Stroll through market stalls offering everything from local goods to delicious treats, and enjoy live entertainment that adds even more fun to the festivities.

It’s the perfect family day out or weekend getaway! With on-site camping, you can make the most of this exciting event and soak in all the charm of the countryside.

title: Siding Spring Observatory Open Day
description:
For one day of the year, Siding Spring Observatory opens its telescopes to the public. It's your chance to take a closer look at the operations of Australia's largest optical telescope site.

Tour the telescopes with ANU staff and hear talks by world-famous astronomers. Watch 3D films in the Exploratory Centre and see science displays on the AAT main floor. Enjoy activities for the whole family including local market stalls, solar viewing and much, much more!

title: Eulah Creek Vintage Machinery Day and Cast Iron Chef  Weekend
description:
If you are a budding bush chef or think you have a winning camp oven recipe, this is the event for you. Categories include open and junior Cast Iron Chef, Cast Iron Dessert Chef and open and junior Billy Boiling Champ. There will be novelty games and Farmers Challenge with dinner.

The Machinery Day is a perfect family day out with working heavy horse demonstrations, vintage working machinery, small motors (and big ones too), tractors, vintage cars, street rods, blacksmithing and historical displays, draught horses, and sheep shearing. Art and craft stalls and a barbecue lunch for sale.  
Devonshire Tea and scones, coffee cart craft, children's entertainment and much more.

title: Leeton Sunrice Festival
description:
The Leeton Sunrice Festival is held biennially at Easter during the rice harvest. The festival celebrates the importance of the rice industry to the community. 

The five-day event provides plenty of live entertainment and family-focused activities. Events include the nostalgic street parade, Festival on Mountford, the nationally recognized Balloon Glow, skate championships, busking and street performers and much, much more!

Immerse yourself in Leeton's hospitality while enjoying its heritage, natural beauty, outstanding restaurants, cafes, boutique shopping, wine and an endless abundance of local produce!

title: Leeton Farmers and Makers Markets
description:
Experience the Leeton Farmers and Makers Markets on the first Saturday of each month in Mountford Park. 

Enjoy fresh produce, handcrafted treasures, live music, and family-friendly fun. Connect with your community and support local farmers and artisans.

title: Leeton Moon Fest
description:
Join them for the enchanting Leeton Moon Fest, where the night comes alive with the sounds of fantastic music and the aromas of mouthwatering food stalls. Experience mesmerizing live performances that stir the soul, engage in interactive workshops that ignite creativity, and be captivated by stunning light displays that dance across the night sky. 

This magical evening under the full moon promises to be an unforgettable experience. Mark your calendars and let the moonlight guide you to a night of wonder and connection!

Visit their website for more information.

title: Leeton Eisteddfod
description:
Leeton Eisteddfod is recognised as one of the most outstanding cultural events in western New South Wales. This event is a showcase of talent in music, ballet, speech and drama, literature, and highland dancing. 

The Leeton Eisteddfod will be held in the newly refurbished Roxy Theatre.

Programs are available from Leeton Trophy and Gift Centre, Leeton Newsagency and from the website.

This is a wonderful event for the family!

title: Light Up Leeton
description:
Light Up Leeton is a Christmas carnival and community concert that sees local homes and businesses join together to celebrate the festive season. 

Following the festivities in the park, locals and visitors alike are invited to take a drive to see 200 or more homes lit up in celebration of the season.

title: Leeton Show
description:
The Leeton Agricultural Show will be held over two days and showcases the Shire in a display of agriculture, entertainment and local achievements. 

Pavilions at the Leeton Showground will be filled with displays such as arts, crafts and flower exhibitions, school displays and cooking exhibits. Mini trots and team yarding along with Stockman's Challenge make for great fun for both children and adults alike.  

The Leeton Show reflects the community as a whole – a place to create and celebrate life in the magical Leeton Region from an agricultural, business, cultural and social point of view. The Leeton Show is the district on exhibition. It not only promotes fine produce from the area, the talent of local craftspeople, and the expertise of local animal husbandry but also Sportsmanship, Community Spirit and what it means to live in Leeton.  The Show is a fantastic community event for all to enjoy in future years, with thanks to the Local Business Community.

For more information, please visit the official website.

title: Yanco Village Markets
description:
Yanco Village Markets are on the last Sunday of the month.

They are held in the Yanco Hall and feature handmade crafts, jewellery, baked goods, plants, fruit and vegetables, bric-a-brac, and much more. Get in early to bag a bargain!

title: Jerilderie Gold Cup Races
description:
Jerilderie Gold Cup Races offers a day of country racing at its finest with a six-race program including the famous Jerilderie Gold Cup.
 
Highlights of the day will include metropolitan and local bookmakers, bar and catering facilities and free children's entertainment. Marquee and Umbrella Packages are available. 

Top prizes will be on offer for the Fashions on the Field.

A courtesy bus will operate throughout Jerilderie and buses are available from other surrounding towns.

title: Coonabarabran Cup
description:
Come and enjoy a day of country racing at its best at Coonabarabran Jockey Club. 

The Club strives to maintain the family-orientated atmosphere of the day. Over the years they have had very generous support from their many sponsors which has helped greatly in attracting strong fields and they appreciate their support. 

They have Fashion On The Field from Turf Tots (3 to 10 years) through to Silver Selection for the more mature and elegant racegoer. There will be a range of entertainment scheduled for race day, including TAB and Bookmakers on course for all meetings. 

The Club runs a full bar and food is available on course. If you want to get as close to the horses as possible then this is the track for you, with amazing grounds to enjoy. Head along to any of their three race meetings throughout the year and see why it is known as ‘The Friendliest Race Club In The Bush’.

title: Bunny Bazaar
description:
Held every year on Easter Saturday, the Bunny Bazaar is a morning of fun and entertainment for the whole family.

The main street is closed to traffic and locals and visitors alike can meander the street, enjoying the many street stalls, musical entertainment and great shopping specials. 

There is entertainment for all and plenty of food stalls to tempt the tastebuds.

title: Science in the Pub
description:
Join MC Matt Dodds and a lineup of stellar guest panellists for a fun-filled evening discussing the mysteries of the Universe.

Panelists this year include Sara Webb, Andrew Battisti, Sarah Caddy, and Brad Tucker.

Please check the Starfest website for further details.

title: Peak Hill Agricultural Show
description:
Discover the charm of the Peak Hill Agricultural Show, a fun-filled two day event for all of the family. 

Experience the thrill of ring events, cattle and horse judging, and explore a diverse range of activities including a bustling sideshow alley, a champion dog show, and a stunning fireworks display. Stroll through impressive pavilion exhibits and cheer on the contestants in the annual Showgirl competition. 

This exciting family event promises an unforgettable day of fun and festivity, making it a must-visit highlight for your social calendar

title: Choirboys - Run To Paradise - The Stories of Australian Rock N’ Roll - Dubbo
description:
As young twenty-something-year-olds, Choirboys formed in 1978, growing up on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The wild, hedonistic lifestyle the band witnessed of the youth in the 70s is ultimately what gave birth to their seminal rock anthem, Run To Paradise. It’s all about the stories that sound all too familiar within the culture widely assumed of the music industry - “sex, drugs, and rock ‘n’ roll” and they tell it all.

Run To Paradise is a “spilling of the beans” of sorts. It’s part story, part song that chronicles through some of the wildest, most risqué, outrageous, and downright hilarious stories of Australian Rock. All, as these Oz pub-rock icons recall it.

And behind the narrative are the classic songs that define the musical landscape of rock music in the ’70s and 80s, including Deep Purple’s “Smoke On The Water”, Chuck Berry’s ‘Never Can Tell’, TMG’s ‘Jump In My Car’, Dragon’s ‘Are You Old Enough’, AC/DC’s ‘Long Way To The Top’ and of course the Choirboys hits ‘Boys will Be Boys’ ‘Never Gonna Die’ ‘Struggletown’ and the pub-rock anthem ‘Run to Paradise’, to name a few.

title: Strawberry Fields Festival
description:
Strawberry Fields Festival annually celebrates music, art, wellness, and community among the pristine bushland of the River Murray. Originally conceived to provide a platform for emerging artists, the festival has blossomed into a gathering of 13,500 attendees from around the world.

Adventure into the Wildlands to experience a kaleidoscope of musical genres from emerging and established live and electronic artists across multiple stages. In addition to the diverse musical offerings, the festival fosters an immersive atmosphere brimming with interactive art installations, workshops, and wellness activities. From sunrise yoga sessions at The Beach to twilight salt baths at the Bush Spa, complemented by an extensive array of food and retail outlets, attendees can indulge their senses.

Furthermore, Strawberry Fields nurtures a sense of community, with attendees forging enduring connections amidst the enchanting natural backdrop. Embracing sustainability, the festival ardently promotes eco-friendly initiatives such as recycling, renewable energy, mindful consumption and their Rewash Revolution.

Whether swimming, camping and enjoying time with friends, discovering new acts, or delving into artistic expression, Strawberry Fields Festival beckons participants to revel in the enchantment of the present moment and celebrate the boundless creativity that dwells within. It transcends mere festival status, embodying a harmonious fusion of artistry, nature, and collective spirit, leaving an enduring impression on all who embark on the journey into the Wildlands.

title: Exhibition - Changemakers: Crafting a Difference
description:
Changemakers: Crafting a difference consists of an exhibition of textile banners that represent a range of historical and contemporary activist movements, together with banner-making workshops facilitated by artist and craftivist Dr Tal Fitzpatrick. Aesthetically, the works draw on the history of textile banners as artefacts used for activism, including the women's suffrage campaign, as well as banners displayed in town halls and churches.

The exhibition demonstrates that Australian women's quest for freedom and equality is ongoing. Many of the social issues raised by early activists remain vitally relevant today, including equal pay, sexual harassment, family violence, and female representation in Parliament and business.

Changemakers focuses on women's empowerment and demonstrates that crafting — traditionally considered 'women's work' — can be used for political expression and social change.

Changemakers: Crafting a difference is a travelling exhibition from the Museum of Australian Democracy at Old Parliament House, sponsored by Commonwealth Bank as part of CommBank Next Chapter, a program helping victim survivors of financial abuse achieve long-term financial independence.

title: From the Vault - Frontpage
description:
Using our collection of archived local newspapers, Frontpage explores how newspapers, and their front pages have evolved over the last 150 years. Before the advent of radio and television they were the main form of mass communication providing access to news, entertainment and commerce, helping to shape public opinion. Over the decades newspaper front pages have undergone considerable change, reflecting broader trends in technology and communication, making for a fascinating insight into shifting cultural attitudes.

From the Vault is supported by Create NSW.

Curated by Simone Taylor.

title: Between Waves Exhibition
description:
Between Waves amplifies concepts related to light, time and vision – and the idea of shining a light on the times – expressed by the Wurundjeri Woi Wurrung word 'Yalingwa'. 

The exhibition variously explores the visible and invisible energy fields set in motion by these ideas, to illuminate interconnected shapeshifting ecologies within, beyond and between what can be seen.

Through a range of contemporary artforms including video, installation, poetry, projection, photography, painting, sculpture, sound, printmaking, and a digital commission, the invited artists have developed reflective and site-responsive projects which explore and experiment with the intersection of material and immaterial realms of knowledge and knowing.

Participating artists embrace the push and pull dynamics that flow beneath the surface, navigating ideas of presence and absence, the known and unknown, transgenerational and collective consciousness. Together, their reflective and site-responsive new commissions, traverse internal and external worlds, embracing the sensory and cyclical rhythms of light and sound, thinking, and feeling, listening and seeing, interwoven with ideas of material memory.  

Between Waves is an exhibition developed by the Australian Centre for Contemporary Art (ACCA) touring nationally with NETS Victoria, curated by Jessica Clark. 

This project has been supported by Creative Victoria through the Yalingwa Visual Arts Initiative and the NETS Victoria Exhibition Development Fund; and the Australian Government's Visions of Australia program.

title: Waste 2 Art Regional Showcase
description:
The 2025 Waste 2 Art Regional Showcase will feature winning artworks from Waste 2 Art competitions held by participating Councils across the NetWaste region. Waste 2 Art is an annual community art exhibition and competition that features artworks created by community members using recycled and unwanted materials. The results are imaginative and thought-provoking with the artworks showcasing recycling and sustainable living.

With this creative use of waste materials, Waste 2 Art also provides an innovative approach to waste education. Schools and community groups take up the challenge and create artworks out of materials that might otherwise be thrown away.

The theme for this year's exhibition is Toys.

Dubbo Regional Council is a proud NetWaste member and supports commitment to re-use and recycle through creative expression.

title: Exhibition | Clementine Belle McIntosh: Sowing and Sewing
Dubbo Art Fair
description:
For two days, the gallery will be home to over 40 emerging and regionally based visual artists selling their work. 

Connect with creatives and support the region's diverse arts and culture. There will be live entertainment and activities for all so come along and discover your creative spirit.

title: Exhibition - Dubbo Stories: Peoples, Places, Possessions
description:
The history of Dubbo is told through the people who lived here. Stories of hardship, perseverance, ingenuity, tragedy and joy – Dubbo’s past is at once surprising and enlightening.

Telling the story of a place and its people is made easier by examining the myriad of ways we document, express and articulate our experiences. For a museum, the photographs, books, objects and official records help us to record history. The archives held by the WPCC allow community members to access this material for research or general interest. From diaries and ledgers to photographs that transport us back in time, the WPCC Collection provides a unique portal to our past.

This is a permanent exhibition.

title: Orana Outdoor Show
description:
Discover your next adventure at the Orana Outdoor Show at Dubbo Showgrounds; the number one outdoor event in Dubbo!
 
Loads of entertainment for the whole family, camping oven cooking, four wheel drive display, bike show and much more.

Discover your next adventure at a Rural Scene Event.

title: Dubbo MotorFest
description:
The Dubbo Motorcyclists and Drivers Club presents the Dubbo MotorFest at the Dubbo Showground.

The event will feature a swap and sell, demonstrations by industry traders and loads of opportunities to network and share knowledge and expertise regarding the maintenance and restoration of unique motor vehicles and bikes. There will be a massive show and shine, concourse arena, aerial motocross, helicopter rides, children's activities, live entertainment, market stalls, an art exhibition and bar service.

Dubbo Regional Council is a proud sponsor of the Dubbo MotorFest.

title: Titan Macquarie Mud Run
description: The Titan Macquarie Mud Run is an annual obstacle course event in Dubbo, offering a fun, challenging experience for all ages. Featuring the Titan (9.5-kilometre) and Mini Titan (4.5-kilometre), it promotes fitness, teamwork and community spirit.

title: Crooked Mile Show and Shine
description:
The 2025 Crooked Mile Show and Shine is a family fun day offering something for everyone. The Show and Shine is a static display of motor vehicles and bikes. The program includes trophies and prizes for a range of vehicle and bike categories, market stalls, activities for children and refreshments onsite. 

Back again for another year is the dyno challenge. The performance of the participating vehicles is measured and recorded in a controlled environment across a range of engine categories.  The vehicle engine performance chart is displayed for spectators to see the torque curve and horsepower figures, and the owner is provided with a print of the result and crowned dyno champion.  

Pre-event registrations are not required but are welcome. Further information is available on the Club's Facebook page.

title: West Wyalong Hearts Of Gold Festival
description:
The Hearts Of Gold Festival features engaging activities and entertainment for all ages. The festival begins with an action-packed night of fun for the whole family. Music, entertainment, rides and a number of food trucks offering a variety of cuisines for all tastes.

The festival includes an exclusive Golden Gala Formal evening at the Regal Estate, get frocked up and enjoy divine food and drinks surrounded by the beautiful winery. 

Saturday includes a brunch and browse through West Wyalong's Main Street with plenty of entertainment for kids and stalls to browse. Sunday concludes with a colour run and barbecue. 

And every year there will be a surprise event.  In 2023 it was the Guinness World Record attempt of most people panning together.  Keep an eye on the West Wyalong Hearts of Gold Facebook page to see the surprise event for 2025.

title: West Wyalong Show
description:
The annual West Wyalong Show is one of the most significant events in the Bland Shire. Residents of West Wyalong, Wyalong, and Tallimba enjoy a half-day public holiday for the occasion.

It's a fun-filled day for families, offering a variety of entertainment for children and teenagers.

There are numerous activities for all ages, including horse jumping, a dog show, a reptile display, an animal nursery, cattle and poultry competitions, and plenty of rides.

Experience a true country show in the heart of the countryside. It's a day you won't want to miss!

title: West Wyalong Rugby League Knockout
description:
West Wyalong can’t wait to see Ron Crowe Oval filled with bush footy’s biggest fans as the 52nd West Wyalong Knockout takes place!

Held over two days, watch some of the best teams in Country Rugby League battle it out to be crowned 2025 champions.

Full bar and canteen, one of the best fields to play and spectate.

title: Bingara Orange Festival
description:
In 1998 it was decided to hold an annual festival to emphasise the importance of Bingara’s orange trees whilst celebrating Bingara’s cultural heritage. The Bingara Orange Festival provides an entertaining two days of festivities for the community, surrounding district and visitors.

The festival features street markets, street parades, pageants, sporting and cultural activities and has grown enormously in stature since its inception. Now considered one of the major events on the Bingara community calendar, the event attracts crowds in excess of 1500.
