Each year the bar is raised even higher, with the inclusion of new initiatives, keeping the festival fresh and attractive year after year. However, one thing that never changes, is the memory of those who have fallen and for whom the orange trees represent.

The Orange Festival is held the Saturday following the Orange Picking Ceremony, either at the end of June or early July each year. Stall holders are encouraged to attend by contacting the Bingara Visitors Information Centre.

title: Wyalong Chicken Races
description:
The Top Town Chicken Races is a family-friendly event held at Redman Oval in Wyalong. This community gathering offers residents, family, and friends a chance to enjoy a fun-filled day together.

Highlights of the event include Chicken Races, a Kids zone, Market Stalls, Farmer's Relay and a Tug-a-war.

The Top Town Chicken Races are a one-of-a-kind outback experience that you won’t forget.

title: Community Bank Narrandera Cup - Narrandera Race Club Inc
description:
Community Bank Narrandera Cup - Narrandera Race Club Inc
Narrandera Race Club is excited ahead of another wonderful winter of racing. 

The time-honoured Community Bank Narrandera Cup will be the Narrandera Racing Club's feature race meeting of 2025.

The Community Bank Narrandera Cup Race Day is headlined by the time-honoured $70,000 Community Bank Narrandera Cup - a qualifier for the $3 million Big Dance. There will also be fashions on the field, entertainment and plenty more.

Stay tuned for more details on the Narrandera Race Club Facebook page.

title: Narrandera Ex-Serviceman's Club TC Lee Memorial Community Race Day
description:
Narrandera Race Club is excited ahead of another wonderful winter of racing. 

Rounding out the season is the Narrandera Ex-Servicemen's Club T.C. Lee Memorial Community Race Day. 

In 2025, patrons can enter any race day for free, and Narrandera Race Club is looking to give back to the local community after three very successful seasons.

Additionally, joining as a member is only $10, and members are entered into the draw to win $500 at any of our three race days.

For more information and updates see Narrandera Race Club Facebook.

title: Narrandera Rod Run Cruisin' No Boozing
description:
Held every Easter weekend this is a fantastic family-oriented fun weekend, showcasing an amazing array of beautifully restored classic and vintage cars, amid a festival atmosphere abounding with live music, market stalls, activities for children, and much more.

Each year approximately two to five hundred vehicles will be cruising up and down East Street on Saturday evening, starting from 5pm and continuing until late. Food stalls and entertainment round out the event for a great family-oriented evening.

title: Narrandera Koala Festival
description:
Meet Australia's cutest koala colony at the Narrandera Koala Festival - a weekend of epic bushland experiences, wildlife encounters, and nature-fuelled fun in the Riverina. 

Since 1972, Narrandera's koala colony has grown from 20 reintroduced koalas to over 300 roaming the riverbanks and river red gums. This is your chance to get up close, get involved, and be part of one of Australia's longest-running conservation stories. 

It's not just about spotting koalas (trust us, you'll spot plenty). Think riverside bushwalks, nature-craft workshops, live music, food vans, and a killer light show under the stars. Pack your camera and your sense of adventure - this is one weekend you'll never forget.

title: Narrandera Rod Run Show 'N' Shine
description:
Held every Easter weekend this is a fantastic family-oriented fun weekend, showcasing an amazing array of beautifully restored classic and vintage cars, amid a festival atmosphere abounding with live music, market stalls, activities for children, and much more.

Each year approximately two to five hundred vehicles will be on display at the Show 'N' Shine on Easter Sunday at Narrandera Sportsground. Bring the whole family along for an unmissable day out!

title: Mendooran Turf Club Races
description:
Enjoy a six-race program with an on-course bar and food facilities, ensuring a delightful day at the racecourse. A free courtesy bus is available to and from the venue, making your visit convenient and stress-free. The event also features Fashions in the Field, on-course tote, and both local and metro bookmakers.

Buses are welcome, and families will find plenty to keep the kids entertained, with a jumping castle, face painting, and various activities. A free camping area is located nearby for those who wish to extend their stay. 

Come and enjoy a fantastic day out while celebrating over 160 years of racing tradition!

title: Boggabri Drovers Campfire
description:
Boggabri Drover's Campfire will be celebrating its 20th Anniversary in April 2026! 

The Boggabri Drovers' Campfire has become a much-anticipated feature for caravanners, motor home, camper, four-wheel drive, ute, tent or swag owners and travellers along Australia's highways and byways. The event was the brainchild of Lion, Geoff Eather and was developed with the support of the Boggabri Lions Club. It is a fabulous, fun-filled weekend with lots of terrific activities for the whole family.  The event is always held in the last weekend of April.

Events at the Boggabri Drovers Campfire weekend include a big campfire, camp oven cooking, shearing demonstrations, tours of the district and local attractions, bush poets, craft stalls, whip cracking, antique machinery display, bush band, nightly entertainment, plus much more and most importantly, get to know the locals. This event takes place at the Boggabri Showground.

Boggabri is located on the Kamilaroi Highway between Gunnedah and Narrabri.

title: The Mirrool Silo Kick
description:
Bring on the 2025 Mirrool Silo Kick!

The Silos triumphed again in 2022, but who will rise to the challenge this year? Many have tried and failed, with only a select few possessing the skill and power to conquer the Silos!

Since Geelong’s Billy Brownless launched the first successful kick in 1992, the annual Mirrool Silo Kick challenge has become a post-season tradition. The concrete silos stand 30 metres high and 10 metres wide, with a walkway on top adding a few extra metres.

The event has expanded to include:

Junior Kick (5-11 years and 12-16 years)
Ladies Kick
Men’s Over 40 Kick
Are you planning to attend or participate this year? It promises to be a fun and exciting event!

title: Binnaway Races
description:
Have a great day out at the Binnaway Races or make it a weekend to enjoy the quaint country town..

Available at the races is Sky and Tote, Lions Club Barbecue, Rifle Club Afternoon Tea, Bowling Club and Tooheys Bar, bus service running from Binnaway for gold coin donation! Also Best Dressed award.

Accommodation and free camping are available just on the outskirts of the township.

title: Urana Bird Sale
description:
Caged birds from many parts of Australia are bought and sold in the historic Urana Soldier's Memorial Hall.  

This event is a fundraiser for Urana Progress Association.

title: Homegrown Parkes
description:
The Biannual Homegrown Parkes event provides over 50 market stalls selling local and regional products, along with educational workshops and engagement through art, music and drama.

Homegrown Parkes is the only event of this type in the Central West, combining opportunities to learn through workshops and displays, be entertained by local artists, enjoy the best products from our local and regional producers and enjoy freshly prepared food and refreshments throughout the day. 

Homegrown Parkes promotes local and regional stallholders and food vendors. 

This day is provided free to the community in the beautiful, green and leafy surrounds of Cooke Park located in the Centre of town. Parkes welcomes visitors who would like to experience the beauty of the Central West and all that it has to offer.

title: Urana Vintage Machinery Rally
description:
Come and celebrate the spectacular Urana Vintage Machinery Rally - where they showcase all kinds of vintage machinery.

Free camping and showers all weekend (limited powered sites available – on a first come basis)

Cabins and powered sites available across the road at the Urana Caravan Park

Fully catered all weekend

title: Grazing Down the Lachlan
description:
Grazing Down the Lachlan will make a return to Forbes.

This multi-award winning foodie adventure is set alongside the picturesque Lachlan River and celebrates produce native to the Central West NSW region, prepared by local restaurateurs and caterers.

 ‘Grazers’ are free to wander along the designated corridor of the nine-mile reserve between six stations offering delicious food with a matched beverage.

What makes this dining experience truly unique is the underlying commitment to delivering a no-waste, environmentally responsible event.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Forbes
description:
In 2021, Andrew spent four months in two of Sydney's maximum-security prisons for the supply of psychedelic drugs. He had a great time.

Best Newcomer Nominee – Melbourne International Comedy Festival, 2023

title: National BBQ Championships
description:
Forbes Shire Council is excited to hold the National Barbeque Championships for 2025.

Set across two sizzling days - join the competition judging the best barbeque beef, chicken, lamb and pork.

The event features market stalls, local live music, children's entertainment and a pop-up bar – something for all to enjoy!

Come down and watch the cooking demonstration, get your team together and register today!

title: goodnessgravel Parkes
description:
Join goodnessgravel Parkes, with three options to pick from 130 kilometres with plus 1,200 metres of ascent, 110 kilometres with plus 1,000 metres of ascent or 50 kilometres with plus 350 metres of ascent.

There is so much gold in the Parkes Region. It is not just the event loops but there is also the riding out to 'The Dish', Bogan Gate (seriously) and Peak Hill. Come out and enjoy this fantastic area, lovely community and super-gravel roads.

They cannot wait to share even more goodnessgravel with you and looking forward to seeing you in 2025 to show off this glorious region.

title: Buckinbah Park Family Markets
description:
Visit the markets on the first Sunday of each month at Yeoval Museum/O'Halloran's Cottage. 

Discover fresh farm produce, homemade items, CDs, DVDs, records, crafts, potted plants, toys, and books.

title: Back to Buckingbah Festival
description:
The Back to Buckingbah Festival in Yeoval promises a full day of family-friendly fun, with something for everyone to enjoy. 

Visitors will have the chance to win a AUD1,200 Lucky Gate Prize just by attending, while those feeling competitive can take part in the pie and lamington eating contests, the camp oven cook-off, the billy boiling challenge, and the always-popular Small Paws Sprint. 

Throughout the day, families can enjoy free entertainment including horse and carriage rides, jumping castles, and mechanical bull rides. A wide variety of food trucks, market stalls, and local treats will also be on offer, making it a great day out in the heart of the community.

title: Cumnock Markets
description:
The Cumnock Markets are held at Crossroads Park (across from the General Store) on the third Saturday of each month.

Stalls include fresh fruit and vegetables, drinks, plants, cakes, jams, pickles and more.

title: Brighter Access Inverell Sapphire City Festival
description:
The  Brighter Access Inverell Sapphire City Festival runs over ten days with activities for the whole family. 

Some events include Inverell's Got Talent, Holy Trinity Race Day and Inverell Art Prize.

The Festival Finale will be held in Campbell Park, and is full of entertainment for the whole family and concludes with a fireworks display off the Town Bridge.

A full program of events will be available from Tourism Inverell or the festival website.

title: Eat Drink Live New England Market Day
description:
Eat Drink Live New England Market Day showcases local and regional food and drink products that are grown and produced in the New England Region of New South Wales.

Held every two years in Inverells Cultural Precinct in Evans Street, a block of Evans Street is closed off to traffic, creating a market atmosphere with a diverse mix of market stalls operating on the day offering tastings and sales to the public. 

Live entertainment for the whole family to enjoy will also be running throughout the day.

Please be prepared for all weather, as the Eat Drink Live New England Market Day will proceed in all weather conditions.

title: The Dinomaniacs - Inverell
description:
Join Shaun and Tara for a fun-filled afternoon with their award-winning kids' show! 

The Dinomaniacs! Fresh off winning two national awards at the 2024 What's On 4 Kids, this show is packed with laughs, music and hands-on dino fun.

Say hello to Trixi the Triceratops, cheeky Tru Blu, Naughty Joffrey, Aussie favourites Ozzi and Oi, and the newest baby dino, Olive the Parasaurolophus.

Perfect for ages 1-8, this interactive experience includes lifelike baby dinosaurs, singing and dancing, Up-close dino encounters and fun photo ops!

See ticket prices in the link attached

title: Anh Do - Inverell
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'
Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.
When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Gunnedah Weeks of Speed Festival
description:
Gunnedah’s annual Weeks of Speed Festival takes place in March, showcasing a program of heart-thumping speed-related activities and motorsports. 

Festival highlights include the speedway racing titles, vintage car and hot rod displays, motorbike racing, 1/2 mile sprints, 1/8 mile drag racing, Billy Boiling Competition, Fishing and Shooting Competitions, Clash of the Sirens and Whip cracking Championships. The program also offers a range of live entertainment and local venues to kick on the festivities after each day of action. A festival for the rev-heads that’s not to be missed.

For individual events and the current program, contact the Visitor Information Centre.

title: Cumnock Show
description:
Held over one day, the Cumnock Show is a small family-orientated Agricultural show that celebrates and promotes the local produce and talent in the Cumnock area.

Find more information on the website.

title: Tunes On The Turf
description:
Tunes On The Turf is a music festival booked in for the second weekend in November every year at the Dunedoo Sports Club. 

Friday night features live music on the verandah. Browse the local Farmers Markets Saturday morning, then 12 hours of non-stop music featuring artists from around New South Wales. 

Play a relaxing round of golf to finish off the weekend! Hot food and cool drinks are available for visitors to indulge in. Families are welcome with a playground for the kids to share and much more..

title: Aon AgQuip
description:
Aon AgQuip is Australia’s largest and premier primary industry field day.  

In 2024 AgQuip celebrates its 51st anniversary (1973 – 2024). 

The nation’s biggest agricultural event showcases over 3,000 companies and attracts over 90,000 visitors over three days from across the nation and overseas.  

AgQuip is one of the world’s most significant agricultural events and is recognised as Australia’s number one field day. 

It is organised and promoted by ACM Rural Events, the organisers of major events in regional and rural Australia.

title: Australia Day Celebrations Gunnedah
description:
Celebrate Australia Day the Gunnedah Way!

Get ready to embrace the Aussie spirit at Gunnedah Shire's Australia Day celebrations—where mateship, community pride and good times come together in true-blue style!

In the lead-up, join the fun at the Australia Day Trivia Quiz at the Golf Club, then head to Club Gunnedah on 25 January for the Chess Challenge and Bowls Triples Comp.

Australia Day Eve features the Citizenship Ceremony and Australia Day Awards at the Civic Theatre, followed by a stylish Cocktail Party and DJ Night at the Courthouse Hotel from 7pm.

Australia Day kicks off with the Triathlon, Rotary BBQ brunch, and the Great Aussie Bake-Off, alongside athletic events, a lively Touch Footy Match and the fast-paced Dash for Cash.

Make a splash with free entry to the Gunnedah Pool, or enjoy Aussie breakfasts in Shire villages. The Rural Museum opens its doors, and the Civic Theatre screens classic Aussie movies to wrap up the day.

There's something for all ages across Gunnedah and its villages.

For the full program and updates, visit the Gunnedah Shire Council website or follow us on Facebook.

Celebrate local. Celebrate Australia. Celebrate Gunnedah!

title: Anzac Day Services - Gunnedah
description:
Veterans, servicemen and women from across generation of armed conflicts as well as the community come together to pay tribute to the sacrifices made by men and women of war in a number of events and services throughout the Gunnedah Shire.

Dawn Service will be held at the following locations the Cenotaph Memorial, 5.30am Conadilly Street, 5.15am Curlewis at the Cenotaph and 5.30am Tambar Springs.

Anzac Day Service and March Gunnedah from Marquis Street at 10.30am. The official Service is held at the Cenotaph Memorial at 10.45am, in Breeza at the Breeza Cenotaph at 8.30am.

title: Massive Murray Paddle - MMP415
description:
The Massive Murray Paddle is an amazing five-day paddling adventure paddling race that raises funds to assist local community-driven programs.

This paddle is 415 kilometres over five days down the Murray River. 

The event starts at Yarrawonga and finishes at Koondrook Wharf, passing through beautiful towns like Cobram, Tocumwal, Moama, Echuca, Gunbower and Koondrook.

This iconic paddle has been running for 56  years and assists many people and community groups in need. You can paddle the full distance of 415 kilometres or you can choose to paddle only one day or choose your distance challenge. 

You can paddle a canoe, sea kayak, surf-ski, outrigger, stand-up paddleboard, surf boat,  prone paddleboard or any homemade paddle craft you have made in your shed.

Day One -  Yarrawonga to Tocumwal
Day Two - Tocumwal to Picnic Point
Day Three - Picnic Point to Moama
Day Four - Moama to Torrumbarry
Day Five - Gunbower to Koondrook 

Join the Massive Murray Paddle for this amazing five-day adventure. Between the 2016 and Nov 2024 events, paddlers have raised over AUD1,150,000 for charity and community services, with most of these being regional causes.

title: INXSive the INXS Tribute Show
description:
Mulwala Water Ski Club is proud to present INXSive Australia's leading INXS Tribute Show free to see. Their performance needs to be seen to be believed. INXSive are a must-see for all INXS fans and lovers of classic Australian Rock music. 

 INXSive is a Melbourne-based band that has been touring Australia-wide since the late 90's and this is your chance to see them at Mulwala Water Ski Club live and free.

A fabulous night's entertainment at Mulwala Water Ski Club kicks off early with Me and the Girl as the support band. Me and the Girl performing all the hits you know and enjoy both before and after INXSive deliver all of the smash hits of INXS.

title: SOS - A tribute to the songs of ABBA
description:
SOS is a high-energy ABBA show. Performing greatest hits from the Swedish super-group mixed with a selection of the hottest disco tracks from the 70s, SOS creates a show that takes audiences on a wild ride back to the party decade where ABBA ruled the dance floor!

Armed with fantastic costumes, incredible vocal talents, animated ABBA dance moves and crazy Swedish accents, SOS creates a show that is both exciting to watch and even more exciting to be part of.

The music of ABBA lives on and on and on with SOS.

title: Screamin' Eagles
description:
Screamin' Eagles are named after their favourite Harley-Davidson high-performance parts, and that's what they bring to every gig- high performance! 

If you have seen them before you know you won't want to miss this. If you have never seen them do yourself a favour and see them.

title: Crooners of Las Vegas - Fabian Maurer
description:
Spend the Weekend with Fabian!
Join international performer Fabian Maurer for a trip down memory lane with the best hits of the best artists from Frank Sinatra to Engelbert Humperdinck, Neil Diamond and more. Fabian is a true professional, bringing a lot of fun and energy to his performances. Come along for a great night out!

title: One Night in Vegas
description:
One Night in Vegas is a star studded tribute to many of the greatest musical artists of all time!

Joe Piastrino is renowned for his authentic and unbelievable tributes to Roy Orbison, Elvis Presley, Buddy Holly, Dion & the Belmonts, Paul Anka, The Drifters, Del Shannon, Ritchie Valens and the Everly Brothers, embodying the heart and soul of the greats that he pays homage to as a performer.
Joe not only looks like the greats, but lives, breathes and brings back to life all of the greats in image, character and voice.

One Night in Vegas will transport you back to a time when music was in its purist form. Don't miss this sensational event with classic hits from classic artists of a bygone era!

title: Burning Red - The Australian Taylor Swift Tribute Show
description:
Burning Red: The Australian Taylor Swift Tribute Show is a family-friendly concert experience designed to honour the magic of all Swift's diverse musical eras. Complete with 'Taylor-made' Swift-inspired costumes, an incredible live band, dancers, and enchanting stage designs, this musical expedition is not to be missed!
The show features Taylor's much-loved hits, including: 22, Cruel Summer, Love Story, Willow, Anti-Hero, Look What You Made Me Do, and many more from Swift's debut album right through to TTPD. This fun and energetic show will have you singing and 'shaking it off' to Taylor Swift's hits!

title: The Herberts
description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, The Herberts!

The Herberts are a '60s concept band that play all the popular dance songs of that decade. The band wears the uniform of the era and not only sound great but look great as well. 

The Herberts are great to listen to, awesome to dance to, funny and entertaining for those who just like to sit back and watch the show.

Their appeal is widespread as they have chosen songs that were hits in the '60s but have also been re-covered by bands in the 80s, 90s and 2000s.

title: Kids Festival at ClubMulwala
description:
As part of the Yarrawonga Mulwala Kids Festival, ClubMulwala is offering a range of Bistro specials and Kids activities to please all of the family during the July school holidays.

Throughout the Festival ClubMulwala is offering great specials at Diggers as well as aTaylor Swift Tribute Show, Family Bingo and Kids Discos.

title: The Everly Brothers - Buddy Holly and Rock n Roll Hall of Famers Tribute Show
description:
The Rock n Roll Hall of Famers Show takes you on a journey back to the 50's & 60's when rock'n'roll was king!

The show features an endless array of classics hits from iconic artists such as Elvis Presley, Roy Orbison, Buddy Holly, The Everly Brothers, Dion & The Belmonts, Bill Haley & His Comets, Del Shannon, Johnny Cash, Chuck Berry, Ricky Nelson, Jerry Lee Lewis, plus many more.

The Rock n Roll Hall of Famers Show stars Rick Gauci & Steven Burns who lovingly recreate the biggest hits from the Golden Age of Rock & Roll. Rick and Steven have extensive experience as live performers in such acts as "The Everly Brothers & Buddy Holly Tribute" "Back to the 70's & 80's" "SOS Australian Abba Tribute Show" "Tusk Fleetwood Mac Storybook" and "The Australian Midnight Oil Tribute Show".

Rick and Steven are life-long fans of 50's & 60's music and are passionate about continuing the legacy of the above-mentioned music icons and sharing their wonderful songs with modern audiences.

title: Dragged to Bingo - Christmas in July!
description:
Ho Ho Ho! The Queens are calling. 

Dragged To Christmas in July! Featuring Opal Essence and introducing Annie Social.

Dragged To is decking the halls at ClubMulwala with a Christmas in July Drag Bingo party like no other! Returning to the stage is the stunning Opal Essence, and making her fabulous ClubMulwala debut – the sensational Annie Social!

Get ready to jingle those bells with dazzling performances, outrageous holiday cheer, and three glitter-packed rounds of bingo! Expect fierce festive fun, cheeky games, and enough sparkle to light up your sleigh ride home.

title: Explorers Prize Meeting
description: Join the Lockhart Explorers Rifle Club Open Prize Meeting for a day of thrilling competition, camaraderie, and exceptional marksmanship. Don't miss your chance to win exciting prizes!

title: Lions Club Lockhart 's Light up Lockhart
description:
Join the Lockhart Lions Club as they light up Lockhart's Hodgson Park for a magical evening of joy, connection, and festive cheer!

Enjoy the delicious barbeque—perfect for the whole family! Be entertained with live carols that’ll get everyone in the spirit. Don’t miss Santa’s grand arrival—it’s sure to delight!

Gather together as they illuminate the trees in a dazzling display of holiday magic!

title: Spirit of the Land Festival
description:
The Spirit of the Land Festival is a colourful and vibrant celebration of the land. With fine and Indigenous art, photo exhibitions, extensive high-quality markets, fabulous foods, open gardens, live music, farm tours, vintage vehicles and the Leeton Lions train rides, the Festival is a fantastic experience for friends and family to enjoy. 

A highlight of the Festival is the National Farm Art Awards, featuring an incredible display of farm art sculptures fashioned from recycled metal, rusty old farm materials and elements of the land. With a substantial prize for the overall winner, these unique sculptures are more than good, they are amazing!

title: Lion's Club Lockhart Australian Army Band Kapooka
description: Experience the powerful and dynamic sound of the Australian Army Band Kapooka! Based at the Army Recruit Training Centre since 1952, this full-time military band showcases a variety of musical styles, from marching tunes to jazz, rock, and concert performances. Don't miss this electrifying event featuring some of Australia's finest military musicians.

title: V8 Superboats
description:
Action-packed adrenaline-rushing V8 Superboats are back in Temora for day and night racing. Come and cheer on Unlimited Superboat enthusiast, Temora's Scott Krause. 

Grab a chair or picnic blanket, don't forget a hat or umbrella, and pack your favourite snacks—get ready for a fun-filled day out!

title: Cumnock Community Family Fun Day
description:
Cumnock Community Family Fun Day has entertainment for every age with almost 100 market stalls, live music, free kids activities and much more. There's also a huge array of raffle prizes!

Come and enjoy the quaint village of Cumnock and see why the locals love it.

title: Eugowra Canola Cup and Family Picnic Day
description:
Racing at its best, the day features live music, fashions on the field, pony races, a dash for cash, jumping castles, horse and carriage rides, food vans, and of course the Canola Cup feature race.

Book a space at The Canola Cup Garden Party Marquee. Located on the home straight off the track, it features catering, beer and wine, garden tables and an umbrella.

title: Eugowra Show
description:
The Eugowra Show is gearing up to showcase a range of highlights, including agricultural competitions. 

These competitions will feature a variety of categories such as cattle, sheep breeds, prime sheep, lambs, grains, seeds, hay, and more. In addition, you can also expect exceptional crafts and arts displays, woodchopping competition, demolition derby, lawn mower racing, dog high jump, yard dogs, showjumping, barrel racing, arm wrestling, live music and fireworks. 

The community events emphasise the town's resilience and spirit, as seen in its recent recovery from floods. 

This event is a celebration of local talent and community strength in Eugowra!

title: Veterans Touch Footy Carnival
description:
If you love to play touch football and are you over 30 years old, head to Coolah and have a great weekend at the Annual Coolah Veteran's Touch Footy Carnival. 

After a great day of competition, join the party atmosphere on Saturday night with all hotels and clubs providing live entertainment. Activities will be arranged for the Saturday night of the touch carnival at the Coolah Sporting Club (at Bowen Oval), Coolah Valley Hotel and the Black Stump Inn.

title: Bundawarrah Centre Annual Live Exhibition Day
description:
The Rural Museum will once again present an engaging and diverse program of demonstrations and exhibitions, both from its own collection and from visiting artisans. 

The Rural Museum’s Annual Exhibition is fully catered, with food and light refreshments. 

Off-street parking is also available adjacent to the museum.

title: Now Showing at Amusu Theatre
description:
Experience the historic  Amusu Theatre and Movie Museum at Manildra with a monthly film screening on the third weekend of every month. 

The theatre is a rare, purpose-built Art Deco theatre that has been continuously operated since it was built in 1936. 

The Amusu still boasts the original carbon projectors, original seating including the 'Love Seat', original flooring, curtains and for a special touch, original old movie posters of yesteryear decorate the walls.

title: Tenterfield Railway Markets
description:
The Tenterfield Railway Markets are held on the first Saturday of February, April, June, August, October, and December at the Tenterfield Railway Station Museum. 

Stalls vary but generally sell arts and crafts, books, clothing, toys, tools, second-hand items, homemade baked goods and preserves, plants, etc. 

Be sure to check out the Tenterfield Railway Station Museum while you're there!

title: Gravel n Granite - Tenterfield
description:
Ready for an unforgettable gravel adventure? Set in the stunning region of Tenterfield, Gravel n Granite takes you on a journey through rugged and spectacular landscapes, while testing your endurance, skill and spirit! 

Gravel n Granite offers something for everyone. Whether you're a seasoned gravel rider, a weekend enthusiast or an adaptive rider, you'll experience epic views, rugged roads and a sense of camaraderie like no other. 

Choose your challenge from a range of course options: The Range Rumble - long course (91 kilometres), The Wellington Rocks - medium course (66 kilometres), Basket Swamp Bash -short and adaptive course (38 kilometres), Mt Mackenzie Frenzy (24 kilometres) and Curry's Gap Dash – family-friendly course (11 kilometres)

Gravel n Granite welcomes gravel bikes, mountain bikes, e-bikes and adaptive riders on hand cycles. The course is designed to be accessible and carefully crafted to offer the perfect mix of difficulty and beauty, with options for all skill levels.

The fun doesn't stop when you cross the finish line! Join your fellow riders at the Race Village for the post-race party. 2026 GnG will be held in May, to make the most of the cooler weather and beautiful autumn landscapes.

title: Jubilee parkrun
description:
A free, weekly, timed five-kilometre event every Saturday morning at Jubilee Park in Tenterfield, NSW, where everyone is welcome!

Please register before you first come along. Only ever register with parkrun once, and don't forget to bring a scannable copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

After each event, grab a post-parkrun coffee at The Courtyard Cafe in Tenterfield.

title: New England Spring Garden Trail - Tenterfield
description:
Following the very successful 2024 New England Spring Garden Trail, organised by the New England Garden Festival team, this is their third traverse of the New England region. 

The Trail travels across beautiful countryside in six days, opening approximately 15 cool climate private gardens to visitors. The Trail begins in Tenterfield and then journeys to Glen Innes and Guyra, followed by the Armidale two-day New England Garden Festival before finishing in Uralla. 

Each town will open their three gardens. Visitors are encouraged to stay in each town the night before to make the most of the gardens' opening hours. 

After the gardens close, take the opportunity to admire and photograph the stunning natural highlights and explore the town's must-visit local spots before heading to the next town.

Over six days, immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of the New England in spring—truly a delight for gardening inspiration or a relaxing break from a busy life! 

Specific garden details will be published on their website closer to the event.

title: Tenterfield Farmers and Producers Market
description: A community-supported local area market encouraging community members to make it, bake it, grow it and sew it. Come along for a great morning of markets held on the grounds of the charming Presbyterian Church Hall in Tenterfield.

title: Grenfell Show
description:
Save the date for the 2025 Grenfell Show.

In previous years, attendees enjoyed a range of activities and events including Pavilions displays, the Red Shed Bar, giant sandpit, tractor pull, guinea pig races, live music, fireworks, horse and livestock events, reptile display, Junior Showgirl and Stockman, members raffle, market and food stalls and so much more.

A few exciting additions to the program include the Dashound Dash and the Homebrew competition!

Can't wait to see you there!

For more information on this years show check out The Grenfell Show on Facebook or visit their website.

title: Weddin Mountain Muster
description:
Kick off your shoes, pull on your boots, and dust off your Akubra. 

Get ready for the Weddin Mountain Muster in 2025.

The Weddin Mountain Muster is a five-day trail ride, based at the Grenfell Showground, taking you on daily rides around the Grenfell District. You can nominate to ride for the week or selected days.  

Join them for a fun-filled week of relaxing, guided horse rides and novelty events.

title: Henry Lawson Festival of the Arts
description:
Start planning an extraordinary June long weekend trip now to the artistic heart of the Central West with a swag of competitions to enter in the lead-up to this iconic Grenfell event.

The festival is a tribute to Lawson’s legendary Australian stories and poetry were acclaimed throughout his life and showcases the region’s heritage and tourist attractions with entertainment for everyone including a vibrant street parade and party, market stalls and performers.

This year will see the introduction of a Friday Dinner and Show with a dedicated Henry Lawson show presented by Jason and Chloe Roweth.

Saturday's main event will see the return of the festival's much loved street parade and then the party gets started with roving street entertainment, live music and an array of market stalls.

title: Acquisitive Art Prize Exhibition
description:
The Annual Cabonne Acquisitive Art Prize has returned for 2025. It is an annual art prize and exhibition that aims to foster a sense of identity, pride and place in Cabonne whilst encouraging and showcasing the high calibre of creative talent in the region.

Don't miss the exhibition, and the opportunity to vote for your favourite work.  See website for entry details, and exhibition dates.

title: Molong Village Markets
description:
The Molong Village Markets, presented by Molong Advancement Group (MAG), features a barbeque breakfast and various market stalls. From food, coffee, fresh produce, craft, clothing and much more. There will be a BBQ breakfast from 8 am with the market stalls open from 9am.

For more information, please visit the website.

title: Downside Bush Dance
description:
Downside Bush Dance is currently operating from Euberta Hall.

Everything is in good working order; the dance floor is sound, the acoustics and lighting are just right and when the monthly bush dance is in full swing, a very precious part of Australia's history comes to life with an atmosphere non-existent in larger metropolitan areas.

The Downside Bush Dance has been running continuously, on the first Saturday of each month since 1971, yet it maintains that 1970s (and beyond) feel to it.

This is a great time for the whole family and just 20 minutes out of Wagga! Join in and enjoy a night of music and dancing at the Euberta Hall every month (except January).

title: Molong Show
description:
The 160th year of the Molong Annual Show returns at the Molong Showground. 

Featuring home grown produce, home made arts and craft and hand reared animals. There will also be showbags, rides and amusements and market stalls. A jam-packed day!

title: The Rock Show
description:
Get ready to experience the excitement and charm of The Rock Show — the ultimate country day out!

Immerse yourself in the heart of the action with time-honoured traditions like the Miss Showgirl and Master Showboy competitions, marvel at the finest Poultry exhibits, and don't forget to grab your favourite Showbags!

They're taking it up a notch with exciting attractions, including a jaw-dropping Live Reptile Show, an incredible demonstration from the talented Hawkesbury Working Kelpies, and the delightful Hey-Ho Animal Nursery—perfect for families to get up close with friendly farm animals.

But that’s just the beginning! With heaps of entertainment, tasty treats, and unique experiences for visitors of all ages, The Rock Show is the perfect destination for a memorable day out. Mark your calendar and come see what makes The Rock Show a must-visit event this year!

title: Corowa Rotary Federation Festival Fireworks
description:
The Corowa Rotary Club provides a free Firework display for the community on the Australia Day Weekend each year,  as a part of the Federation Festival Weekend of activities. The event is held at the RSL Park, enabling many to walk to the venue or see the display from their homes.  

Enjoy a picnic in the park prior to the Fireworks.

We  thank Club Corowa,  our major sponsor for the Fireworks.

title: Corowa Rotary Federation Festival
description:
Enjoy the colour and musical extravaganza of the National Federation Festival, scheduled over the Australia Day long weekend. 

Visitors are treated to an array of fabulous bands, music and festival activities with markets, buskers, food and wine experiences, Federation Festival Ball, and the old fashioned grand parade along Sanger Street.

title: Corowa Rotary Federation Festival Parade
description:
The final event is a weekend of festivities to celebrate Corowa as the Birthplace of Federation. 

Floats prepared by local businesses, sporting clubs, schools and community groups join several bands in a parade down Sanger Street, Corowa.

Pipe and Brass Bands from NSW and Victoria provide music for the parade and later at the market in Bangerang Park. 

Come along and cheer the floats and bands along as they make their way down Sanger Street.

The Parade finishes at Bangerang Park where the Federation Market will be underway with plenty of  stalls, food options and drinks available.

There are four AUD250 prizes awarded to the best floats in their category.

title: Corowa Rotary Federation Farmers and Variety Market
description:
Come and join Corowa Rotary on the first Sunday of each month, at Bangerang Park in Corowa, for a great family day out.

There will be a great range of stalls selling a variety of goods including; garden ornaments, plants, tools, candles, soaps, heat packs, jewellery, wool and knitted goods, clothes, handbags, trinkets,  books,  fruit and vegetables, honey, salami and much much more. 

Food stalls and a coffee van are regulars at the market, and the APEX miniature train operates on most market days. There is also a great playground for the children. 

Entry to the market is by donation, and all proceeds go towards the Federation Festival Weekend Parade, Entertainment and Fireworks.

For more information, phone the number provided.

title: 46th  Annual Corowa Swim-In and Military Vehicle Gathering
description:
Annually a group of ex-military Vehicle Collectors gather at Ball Park Caravan Park in Corowa on the beautiful Murray River to display their lovingly restored military vehicles. As well as participate in a parade, a vehicle display and a swap meet at the Corowa Showgrounds. Travelling to local schools and places of interest both in Corowa and the surrounding areas. 

People are encouraged to pre-enter and pay an entry fee, with participants receiving a participant pack if they enter early (visit the website for cut-off dates). 

The event attracts collectors from throughout Australia and the World. There are clubs in each state and the organising association is Khaki Vehicle Enthusiasts Incorporated.
host: GPA Swim-In and Ex-Military Vehicle Gathering

title: Australia Day Corowa Rotary Federation Festival Market
description:
A bigger market than their regular monthly market and running over Sunday of the Australia Day Long Weekend.

There are the usual Food, Farmer’s Market and Variety Stalls and also entertainment from a number of the bands that are in Corowa for the Federation Festival Parade on Sunday morning. 

There is a great playground and some games for the children. 

This is one of the many things on in Corowa over the Australia Day long weekend as part of the Federation Festival. This Festival aims to provide a weekend of activities to mark Corowa's place as the birthplace of Federation that are suitable for all ages and abilities.

title: The Cudal Show
description:
Come on down to the Cudal Show and enjoy this annual event. 

Enjoy rides, show bags, stalls, food and entertainment in a great country atmosphere. 

There will be displays on locally grown produce and stock including the best that Cudal has to offer. 

Contact the Cudal A and P Society for further information.

title: Cudal Show
description:
Following on from last year's popular festivities including roaming entertainers, daring bike displays and the inaugural dog jump, plus all the traditional favourites such as the pavilion, horse and poultry events, this show aims to be bigger and better! 

For more information see the website.

title: Deepwater Cup
description: The Deepwater Cup is back in 2026 with a highly anticipated six race program. A great day out with fashions on the field after the last race, live music till late, full bar service with locally brewed Deepwater Brewing beer on tap.

title: Richard Moon Winter Jewellery Workshops
description:
Bring an idea, a design and/or a precious stone and make your unique piece of sterling-silver jewellery under skilled supervision in Deepwater. Richard Moon (resident silverworker at The Makers Shed) offers studio-workshop options for a strict maximum of six people, where you get to decide what you'll create! 

Get across the entire silver-working process with Richard as your guide, from cutting, soldering, heating, cold-connecting, fold-forming, bezel-setting and polishing. The cost includes enough sterling silver for one ring, pendant, brooch or pair of earrings; and a limited selection of raw materials and stones: vintage linoleum, copper, leather, moonstones, freshwater pearls, etc. Design and make something special!

title: Art and Words at Makers Shed
description:
Head to Deepwater for an afternoon of art and words, including the opening of a new art exhibition by Peter Champion, and ABC New England's Kristy Reading launching a new book 'Diving Into Deep Water' written by the High Country Writers Group and published by a new local imprint, High Country Books.

Come for a free drink and a nibble, with 10% of all sales donated to Westpac Helicopter Rescue. 

Situated on the New England Highway at Deepwater, The Makers Shed is a showcase of the region's finest artisanal creations, including handmade jewellery by Richard Moon Wearable Silver & Silverware and the books of author Michael Burge.

With a range of new fiction, non-fiction and kids' books; ceramics, glassware and textiles; condiments, body products and MORE, this is Deepwater's destination for gifts, special reads, homewares and something unique that has been made locally.

title: Central West Trail Supported Cycle Tour
description:
The popular Central West Cycle Trail takes cyclists on a loop through NSW's Central West region. 

There is everything you would expect from rural Australia, including sweeping views, lonely roads and charming towns packed with character, Indigenous history, and relics from the gold rush era. 

During the trip, an escort vehicle and driver will ensure you have peace of mind as you make your way between towns. Picnic lunches will be prepared during the cycle day, and their representative offers daily briefings and dinner suggestions. 

Otherwise, you are free to cycle at your own pace and take in the ever-changing landscape of grazing country, national parks, and reserves. 

They have handpicked accommodation in a combination of country pubs with shared bathrooms and family-run motels with private facilities, with friendly hosts and tasty food options.

title: Saturday Skywatch
description:
The Rock Regional Observatory hosts a free Saturday Skywatch event every Saturday, open to all ages. 

Participants can explore the night sky through telescopes, learning about stars, planets, and constellations.

title: The Rock Triathlon
description:
The Rock Triathlon is back. The event caters to all ages and fitness levels and is included in the Riverina Tri-Series. Proceedings for the day include a sprint, enticer, walkathon, junior and sub-junior. Teams are welcome.

Come along and enjoy a great day out in beautiful, natural surroundings. All events will start at The Rock Recreation Ground, Victoria Park in Wilson Street, The Rock.

All entries must be registered online.

title: The Rock Christmas Markets
description: Join a vibrant Saturday morning market! Browse over 100 stalls, enjoy delicious food and coffee, kids' entertainment, and great vibes. This is perfect for market lovers!

title: Rock for a Reason | Cocktail for a Cause
description:
Gather your friends and head to The Rock for an unforgettable evening, all in support of some amazing causes. Enjoy live music from Radio Velvet, guaranteed to get you up and dancing.

Guests will be welcomed with a complimentary cocktail on arrival and treated to delicious canapés throughout the night. Try your luck in the raffle or place a bid in the silent auction — all proceeds will help raise much-needed funds for Ronald McDonald House, Black Dog Institute, The Rock Preschool and The Rock Central School.

Don't miss this chance to have fun while supporting local schools and vital charities.

title: Melbourne Cup at Gooree
description:
Each year Gooree Park is known for throwing some of the most prestigious events to engulf Mudgee and its visitors. This year is no different!

The Spring Racing Carnival is finally here, and with that comes champion thoroughbreds and breath-taking racing. If you can't experience Derby Day or Melbourne Cup trackside, then Gooree Park is the next best thing and where you need to be.

A must attend event for all horse lovers and racing enthusiasts!

title: Derby Day at Gooree
description:
Each year Gooree Park is known for throwing some of the most prestigious events to engulf Mudgee and its visitors. This year is no different!

The Spring Racing Carnival is finally here, and with that comes champion thoroughbreds and breath-taking racing. If you can't experience Derby Day or Melbourne Cup trackside, then Gooree Park is the next best thing and where you need to be.

A must attend event for all horse lovers and racing enthusiasts!

title: Gooree Cup
description:
The Gooree Park Mudgee Cup is one of the most anticipated race days on the calendar – and this will be no exception. Proudly presented by Gooree Park, renowned for its premium wines and world-class thoroughbred breeding, this event promises a day of excitement, elegance, and elite racing.

Now in its 45th year, the Gooree Park Cup is steeped in history and tradition. Mudgee Race Club will once again come alive as it hosts this iconic race meet, drawing top-tier trainers, champion horses, and passionate racegoers from across New South Wales and beyond.

Whether you're there for the racing, the fashion, or the celebration, the Gooree Cup is not to be missed.

title: Annual Uranquinty Folk Festival
description:
Uranquinty Folk Festival will be back again this year, with  a great line up of artists, campfire sessions, concerts and dances.  

Please join them for a great music filled  family orientated festival this October long weekend.

See website for further details.

title: Glen Innes Anglican Church Christmas Services
description:
Come and join in celebrating the birth of Jesus the saviour at Christmastime in Glen Innes. 

Christmas Eve: All in morning service.

Evening Family service.

Late 1662 Book of Common Prayer Communion Service.

Christmas Day: Morning Communion Service.

Please contact the Anglican Church for Times.

title: Holy Trinity Anglican Church Fete - Floral Display and Quilting Exhibit
description:
Welcome to the Annual Holy Trinity Anglican Church Fete - Floral Display and Quilting Exhibit.

Food: Gourmet barbecue, hot chips, steak and sausage sandwiches, fairy floss, mini pancakes, dessert and ice cream bar, coffee and cakes and sweets and treats. 

Stalls: Plants, Cakes, Produce, white elephant, pre-loved clothing, toys, books, floral display and craft and handiwork.

Entertainment: School performances, Local dance groups, Musical performances, Kids corner, Face painting and games.

title: Little Fishes at the Museum, Canowindra
description:
Join some science fun at the Age of Fishes Museum on the first Friday of the month. 

Each month, the little fishes study a new topic through fun activities, play and hands-on experiments. 

Registration is recommended.  Also includes free entry to the Museum.

title: Blackville Arts and Market Day
description:
Blackville is a small farming community in the heart of the Liverpool Plains. It will take you about 40 minutes from Quirindi or 55 minutes from Willow Tree and take you through scenic rural settings. The event is at the Blackville Public School, where you will find the artwork inside the hall and market stalls outside. Local as well as guest artists are exhibited, and all artwork is for sale.

The market stalls offer homewares, clothing, gifts, artisan-made wares, accessories, jewellery gourmet foods and delicious treats. You will find local produce as well as produce sourced from afar. 

These markets have a real country feel and the musical entertainment invites to stay and have a chat to the locals. A beautiful day out for the whole family.
host: Liverpool Plains Visitor Information Centre (Liverpool Plains Shire Council)

title: Social Tennis at the Glen Innes Tennis Club
description:
Social tennis on Tuesday mornings is a fun way to keep fit while enjoying great tennis and friendly conversation.  All are welcome – doesnt matter if you are a bit rusty as players of all abilities are welcome.

Doubles matches are played (ladies, mens or mixed depending on who turns up) and the tennis is enthusiastic but non-competitive.  

Just turn up and have fun.

title: Home Ground Sounds Canowindra
description:
The ethos behind Home Ground Sounds is simple yet powerful—raise money for community groups through unforgettable live music events. 

With food trucks and top-notch entertainment, these concerts promise to be an enjoyable experience for everyone. 

But it's not just about the music—it's about supporting and strengthening local communities. With events like Home Ground Sounds, the power of live music and community spirit is taking centre stage across Australia.

title: Glen Innes Cottage Markets
description:
The Glen Innes Cottage Markets are held each Saturday in Lion's Park located on the corner of East Avenue and Ferguson Street in Glen Innes. 

You'll find a range of stalls selling items such as good quality farm fresh fruit and vegetables, plants, crafts, art, honey, cakes, fresh juices, coffee and more.

title: Canowindra Show
description: This year's show includes show jumping, a range of arts and craft competition judging, esky races, fireworks, car shows, horse ring events, animal nursery, dog shows, and more.

title: Canowindra Show Esky Ball
description:
Esky Ball 2025 – Let's Party for a Good Cause! 
Hosted by the Canowindra Show Society.

Back for its second year, the Esky Ball is ready to rock the Showground once again!

Grab your mates, fill up the esky, and get ready for a massive night of fun, food, and fantastic music – all in support of the Canowindra Show Society.

Kick off the evening with tasty grazing boxes, followed by hot, mouth-watering eats from the legendary Fat Parcel Food Van.

Live music from Bathurst's own K'nOath – they'll have you on your feet with their energetic spin on your favourite hits!

Camping is available through the Showground Trust – why not make a weekend of it?
All proceeds go toward improving the Canowindra Show and upgrading local facilities for the future.

title: Canowindra Esky Ball
description:
Join the Canowindra Show Society for their 2nd annual Esky Ball. 

Pack your esky as it is strictly BYO (18+ event) and grazing boxes to start, followed by delicious hot food from the Fat Parcel Food Van.

Great live band from Bathurst - K'nOath - will have you rocking the night away to their signature take on many of your favourite tunes. Camping is available through the showground trust.

So grab your group, pack the esky and help raise some money for the show society to improve the annual show and maintain and improve the facilities for years to come!

title: Canowindra Yard Dog Trial Championships
description:
Come along to the Canowindra Showground for this year's Yard Dog Trial Championships.   Across two action-packed days, handlers and their loyal companions will compete in Maiden, Novice, Improver, and Open classes, showcasing the incredible teamwork and instinct that define this iconic rural sport.

With two rings running simultaneously and events starting from 7am each day, spectators can expect non-stop excitement, skillful stock handling, and a true celebration of country life. Whether you're a seasoned trial enthusiast or a curious newcomer, this is your chance to witness the heart and soul of the bush in motion.

Bring the family, meet the dogs, and enjoy a weekend steeped in tradition, talent, and community spirit.

title: The Lone Piper at Glen Innes Town Hall
description:
A member of the Glen Innes Pipe Band performs at the front of the Glen Innes Town Hall each week to showcase Glen Innes' rich Celtic heritage and traditions. 

Come along to experience a performance of traditional and modern Celtic tunes outside this beautiful heritage building on the main street of town. 

Please note: This is a voluntary performance and, at times, may be subject to availability.

title: Australia Day Glen Innes
description:
The local Australia Day festivities will begin with a free breakfast being served at a Community Hall, TBA, followed by a morning tea at Glen Innes and District Services Club in Glen Innes. 

After morning tea, they will continue with the official ceremonies and award presentations. There are a number of awards being presented on that day. Organisers said, they are sure the quality of some of characters or the level of their abilities will be remarkably high and that it will make it difficult for the judging panel to decide on a winner once again, in many of the award categories. 

Australia Day in Glen Innes is brought to you by the Australia Day Committee of Glen Innes Severn Council.

title: Community Harmony Day Event - Glen Innes
description:
Join them for a morning filled with delicious food, entertainment and great company. This event is all about bringing the community together and celebrating our diversity. 

Come and be a part of this special day where everyone comes together to promote unity and understanding.  

Let's create a harmonious community together.

title: Australian School of Celtic Learning - Scottish Gaelic Lessons
description:
Join them for an hour of friendly casual Scottish Gaelic learning. They recommend you bring pen and paper to make notes. Be ready to have fun!

No need to book – just show up.

title: New England Spring Garden Trail - Glen Innes
description:
Following the very successful 2024 New England Spring Garden Trail, organised by the New England Garden Festival team, this is their third traverse of the New England region. 

The Trail travels across beautiful countryside in six days, opening approximately 15 cool climate private gardens to visitors. The Trail begins in Tenterfield and then journeys to Glen Innes and Guyra, followed by the Armidale two-day New England Garden Festival before finishing in Uralla. 

Each town will open their three gardens. Visitors are encouraged to stay in each town the night before to make the most of the gardens' opening hours. 

After the gardens close, take the opportunity to admire and photograph the stunning natural highlights and explore that town's must-visit local spots before heading to the next town.

Over six days, immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of the New England in spring—truly a delight for gardening inspiration or a relaxing break from a busy life! 

Specific garden details will be published on the website closer to the event.

title: The Grafton to Inverell ProVelo Cycle Classic
description:
The Grafton to Inverell Cycle Classic returns to the Glen Innes CBD. Experience the excitement as elite riders race through Grey Street, with a live broadcast capturing every thrilling moment. There will be live entertainment. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere with buskers adding to the energy of the event. Support a great cause with a sausage sizzle, all proceeds going back into the community. There will be a live broadcast. Hear the race live in the Town Centre.
 
The best and safest viewing area is on the west edge of Grey Street, from Wentworth Street through to Town Square. Riders will be passing through between, with the final support vehicle (Sag Wagon) marking the last of the race.

Don't miss this action-packed cycling event, cheer on the riders, enjoy live entertainment, and soak up the festival vibes in Glen Innes.

title: Glen Innes Men's Shed Car Boot Sale and Markets
description:
Welcome to the Glen Innes Men's Shed Car Boot and Markets.

Join them every fourth Saturday of the month for a fantastic inclusive community event where you can find hidden treasures, unique bargains, something to eat and a great atmosphere.

Glen Innes Men's Shed Car Boot & Markets are proudly working with the Glen Innes Motorsports Club this year in October. 

So join us at the Glen Innes Showground for an unforgettable day hosted by the Glen Innes Motorsports Club. Tiple Challenge Show and Shine.

Feast your eyes on a stunning display of cars, trucks and motorcycles.

Savor delicious food and explore these vibrant markets.

Whether you're a rev head or just looking for a fantastic day out, this event is not to be missed. 

Bring your friends and family and come share the excitement.

title: Riverina Schoolboys Football Carnival
description: A highlight sporting event in Junee is held annually at Laurie Daley Oval. The Riverina Schoolboys Football Carnival is a rugby league round-robin competition for girls and boys aged 6-15 years.

title: Viewco Xmas Party Races
description:
A great afternoon of celebrating the end of the year in style. 

With a range of hospitality options on offer, you can reserve an area for your group.
There will be a range of hospitality options on offer for you to reserve for your group, plenty of music and entertainment on the day, plus a kids entertainment area. 

Book your Xmas Party in at the Viewco Xmas Party Race Day, held at the Murrumbidgee Turf Club.

title: Tradies Race Day
description:
Join the Murrumbidgee Turf Club for a thrilling afternoon of summer racing and entertainment with Tradies Day.

Good Talk (non-profit organisation) will also be on course, raising much needed awareness and funds for bipolar disorder research.

There will be music, great racing and drink specials to kick off the festive summer season.

title: Wagga Gold Cup Carnival
description:
The Murrumbidgee Turf Club is proud to present the 2026 Wagga Gold Cup.

Tickets will be on sale January 2026. Please keep an eye on their website and Facebook for details.

title: Junee Show
description:
The Junee Show has been a part of the community for over 125 years and serves as a platform to exhibit the shire's finest. The show is an excellent day out for people of all ages with activities to appeal to everyone. They have events ranging from animal exhibitions, pavilion exhibitions, the bushman's relay, showgirl events and of course the ever-popular sideshow alley. 

The first Junee Show was held in 1888,  with each event being bigger and better than the last one. The wide variety of activities and entertainment ensures there is something for everyone at the Junee Show!

The team works hard year-round to make sure they bring quality entertainment that will keep you coming back year after year. 

Held annually in October at the Junee Showgrounds.

title: Gourmet Fiesta Glen Innes
description:
The annual Gourmet Fiesta brings celebrity chefs, demonstrations, tastings and market stalls to the Glen Innes Show to showcase the region's delicious produce and food and beverage businesses. 

This year, Gourmet Fiesta welcomes celebrity chef Matt Golinski - a professional chef with a passion for creating cuisine using fresh, seasonal and local ingredients.

Friday the stalls open and cooking demos for schools and Gourmet Lunch followed by more demos for all.

Saturday the stalls open again, Gourmet Lunch, more cooking demos and then the exciting auction of Rangers Valley Station beef and local produce.

title: National Tree Day Wagga Wagga
description:
Please join them for National Tree Day.
 
You will be helping to revegetate the old disused roadway restoring the canopy, understory, and ground cover layers.  There are 1000 plants to go in. These plants will supplement the existing roadside vegetation. 
 
Roadside vegetation is recognised as providing important habitat in a mostly cleared agricultural landscape. It can be a stepping stone between remnant vegetation patches.  Roadside vegetation faces many threats including: dumping and litter, illegal firewood removal, overgrazing, and loss of tree hollows. 
 
This site contains critically endangered Box Gum Grassy Woodland. 
 
All ages welcome, must be prepared to get your hands dirty.  Free BBQ lunch provided.  

Parking for this event has been kindly provided by Wagga Model Aero Club (Olympic Hwy just past Dunns Rd intersection, South bound from Wagga Wagga on left) and a free short shuttle bus ride is kindly provided by Thomas Bros to take volunteers from carpark to planting site

title: Sweet Pickins with Mick Harrington
description:
A fantastic way to celebrate the start of the strawberry picking season. This four-hour, family-friendly event will be jam packed full of fun, entertainment and strawberries!

This event will feature acclaimed Australian artist Mick Harrington, runner-up on The Voice 2021, performing as part of his Australian Songbook Tour. With a repertoire celebrating the works of Paul Kelly, Crowded House, Goanna, John Williamson, Men at Work and more. Mick's performance is one you cannot miss! Having up and coming local artists Mitch Salan, Maggie Lawerence and Hannah Behan will create a culturally rich and distinctly Australian experience in this iconic rural setting.

For the first time, attendees can bring their own picnic dinners. Alternatively purchase food, drinks, and desserts from the farm café and licensed bar.

How amazing it will be to pick strawberries to live music, creating memorable conversations between food, land, and community.

title: Wagga Par 3 and Driving Range's Third Birthday
description:
Join them as they celebrate three years of fun, family, and fairways! Their 3rd Birthday Bash is set to be the biggest yet — packed with golf galore. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just in it for the vibes, there's something for everyone. Come swing, sip, and celebrate with them at Wagga's most exciting outdoor party of the year!

Don't miss it — it's going to be par-tee time!

title: Minerama Fossicking, Gem and Jewellery Show
description:
Minerama is a must-attend event for gem nuts, rock hounds, and lovers of bling and shiny things!

With indoor and outdoor trade stalls selling gemstone rough, fine jewellery and everything in between, workshops and demonstrations, fun activities for kids, and delicious food and drink, there’s something for everyone.

It's a great weekend and fun for the whole family, with a wealth of gems just waiting to be unearthed.

Held at the picturesque Glen Innes Showgrounds, attend the show for an exciting day trip or a weekend away in the beautiful Glen Innes Highlands.

title: Australia Day at the Murrumbidgee Turf Club
description: Enjoy Australia Day at the Murrumbidgee Turf Club in Wagga Wagga. There will be plenty of entertainment for the whole family including games, pony rides and a sausage sizzle for the kids, plus live music and prize giveaways on the day.

title: Ted Ryder Cup
description:
Join the Murrumbidgee Turf Club for a thrilling afternoon of summer racing and entertainment with the Ted Ryder Cup.

There will be music, great racing and prize giveaways just in time for the Christmas break.

title: Demonstration Gardens - Vegetable Swap and Buy
description:
Come to the Demonstration Gardens, bring fruit or vegetables to swap, or purchase fresh vegetables from the community garden. 

Held every Saturday morning weather permitting. Please support the local community.

All proceeds go to the Community Gardens.

title: Bidgee Bricks - Wagga
description:
Bidgee Bricks is a creative community event that celebrates building, imagination and play. This family-friendly experience invites people of all ages and abilities to come together and enjoy hands-on brick building activities in a supportive and welcoming space.

Visitors can explore interactive build zones, admire inspiring displays and enjoy the dedicated kids corner, designed especially for younger builders. The event encourages creative thinking, problem-solving and social connection through the shared joy of building.

Bidgee Bricks is proud to be an inclusive event. The program is designed to support participation for people of all abilities, including individuals living with disability and their families. It is a celebration of creativity, belonging and community spirit.

Organised by Brick Envy, known for its inclusive building programs and workshops, Bidgee Bricks stands out for its commitment to accessibility and connection. Whether an experienced builder or someone who simply enjoys creative play, visitors will find something to inspire and engage.

title: Brick Envy
description:
Brick Envy offers inclusive and creative building experiences designed specifically for adults aged 18 and over. Regular groups and workshops provide a safe and welcoming space where participants can build, connect and belong.

Sessions invite adults of all abilities to enjoy hands-on building activities, working independently or alongside others in small, supportive groups. The focus is on creativity, communication and confidence-building. Each group encourages imagination, social connection and a sense of achievement.

Brick Envy is known for its commitment to inclusion. Sessions promote self-expression through building, while encouraging problem-solving, teamwork and positive social experiences. All whilst enjoying something to eat and drink.

What makes Brick Envy unique is its focus on connection. Groups are not competitive. The emphasis is on creativity, belonging and shared enjoyment. Every person is welcomed and valued for who they are.

Whether attending for fun, friendship or personal growth, participants experience the simple joy of creating in a relaxed and supportive environment. Brick Envy continues to build positive experiences where every brick tells a story and every builder matters.

title: Wagga’s Biggest Ever Blokes Lunch
description:
Wagga’s Biggest Ever Blokes Lunch is an annual event to raise funds to support prostate cancer research, the prostate cancer regional specialist nurse programme, the Wagga Wagga Prostate Cancer Support Group and the local CanAssist. 

The event features a comedian as MC plus a special guest speaker, Included in the ticket price is a 3 course meal and wine, beer and soft drinks. There is an opportunity to win good prizes in a raffle or bid for items in an auction.

title: School Holidays: Sunshine Storytime at Riverside
description:
Storytime at the Riverside Precinct is everything you already love about Storytime, but in the beautiful surroundings of Wagga's Riverside Precinct.

There'll be picture books, songs, and craft. Stick around afterwards and use the Agile Library van, which lets you browse, borrow, return, and make reservations, just like the regular library branch.

No bookings required. Find them near the Riverside Adventure Playground.

title: Riverside Markets
description:
Enjoy strolling through the popular Riverside Markets which is a community-based market, offering choices of food, drinks and beautiful handmade products. Stalls include arts, and crafts, local produce, children's activities, entertainment and much more.   

They are set alongside the Visitor Information Centre and Murrumbidgee River overlooking the historical churches.

If you are looking to support the local community and find a special something please join them. They have something for everyone.

title: NAIDOC Week 2025
description:
The theme for National NAIDOC week for 2025 is The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy!

This year's theme celebrates marks a powerful milestone: 50 years of honoring and elevating Indigenous voices, culture, and resilience. The 2025 theme "The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy" celebrates not only the achievements of the past but the bright future ahead, empowered by the strength of our young leaders, the vision of our communities, and the legacy of our ancestors.

Please refer to website for full list of festivities from bbq lunches to celebratory balls and live performances.

title: Wagga Wagga Orchid Society Gathering
description:
The Wagga Wagga Orchid Society meets every month at the ARCC Hall. There are orchid displays each month, together with raffles of plants, demonstrations and general information.  Periodically throughout the year, they have auctions of plants.

They warmly welcome visitors to Wagga Wagga who would like to gain knowledge on orchids, or like-minded enthusiasts to join them.

Tea and biscuits are provided.

title: Wagga Wagga Audio/Visual
description: Wagga Wagga Audio/Visual is a snapshot tour of Wagga's homegrown media history. From newspapers to radio and television, and beyond; go back to a time when media was completely local - hear the stories of those who worked in the industry and see the technology they used with professional precision in light on an ever changing media landscape.

title: Photo Booth Time Machine
description:
Step back in time and join the Museum of the Riverina – Historic Council Chambers Site for a special activity that lets you experience media history like never before.

During two sessions, you'll have the chance to: Pose in the recreated 2WG radio studio, complete with authentic vintage equipment. Record yourself reading real historical news articles. Snap a selfie, or go old-school and take home a Polaroid photo (gold coin donation). Bring your curiosity, bring your smile—and travel through time with them.

title: Tom Castro: The man who never was
description:
In 1865, Wagga Wagga butcher Tom Castro stepped across the threshold of his shop and into the history books. Claiming to be the long-lost heir to the Tichborne family's Hampshire estates, Tom unwittingly set in motion one of the greatest cases of disputed identity in recent criminal history. Man, myth, would-be baronet, peep show oddity and pauper, who was Tom Castro, and did he ever really exist?

The Museum of the Riverina brings this amazing story to life in the wonderfully evocative surrounds of our Historic Council Chambers. View the Nathan Hughes painting 'The Great Tichborne Trials' alongside objects from the Museum's Tichborne collection, believed to be one of the largest in the Southern Hemisphere.

title: Museum of the Riverina Retro Arcade Gaming
description:
Wagga Wagga AUDIO/VISUAL isn't just about how news media evolved — it's about the ever-changing relationship with technology and communication. Now, you can experience one of the biggest leaps in entertainment history: arcade gaming!

Come and play the classic arcade hit that captured a generation — Frogger! Test your reflexes and see if you can beat the high score in this retro gaming challenge. Bring a friend and compete in one or two-player mode to prove who's got the ultimate vintage gaming skills.

No booking required — just drop in and play! Perfect for all ages and guaranteed fun.

title: Australian Celtic Festival
description:
Renowned as the premier Celtic event of New South Wales, The Australian Celtic Festival is the only festival in Australia to recognise different Celtic nations each year and has the unique atmosphere of being located at the Australian Standing Stones National Celtic Monument in Glen Innes.

In 2026, the festival will celebrate its 34th year and highlight the Celtic nation of Scotland.

In addition to a craicing good lineup of national and international music artists, the annual program includes pipe bands, dancers, markets, food and beverage stalls, competitions, official ceremonies, live-action performances and re-enactment groups, children's entertainment, a host of fringe events around the region, and so much more!

Set in the New England High Country of Northern NSW, 4.5 hours' drive from Brisbane and seven hours from Sydney, vibrant autumn colours provide a picturesque backdrop for exploring and savouring the beauty of Glen Innes Highlands.

The Australian Celtic Festival is proudly brought to you by Glen Innes Severn Council and supported by the Australian Standing Stones Management Board.

title: Summer Solstice at the Australian Standing Stones
description:
A solstice occurs when the sun appears to reach its most northerly or southerly excursion relative to the equator.  

Solstices occur twice a year - once in June and once in December.  For the southern hemisphere, the summer solstice, indicating the longest number of daylight hours, is on or near to December 21.

The Australian Standing Stones Management Board will host the annual passing of the solar noon shadow across the marker plaque on this day.

This is a free public event and all are welcome to attend.

title: Autumn Equinox
description:
The Autumn Equinox reflects the changing seasons and the imminent return of winter to the southern hemisphere.

 At the Australian Standing Stones, the sun's noon shadow point on the 21st of each month is marked by a series of ground-level plaques. 

Watch the solar noon shadow align with the point of the ground plaque, and listen to the piper along with an explanation about solar noon and the changing of the seasons.

Lunch is available at The Croft at your own expense.

title: St Patrick's Day Flag Lowering
description:
St Patrick is the Patron Saint of Ireland - one of the featured Celtic nations in Glen Innes.  

Everyone is welcome to attend this free event. Listen to tales of St. Patrick and toast the Patron Saint as the Irish flag is lowered.  

You may even share a few Irish jokes! Raffles and traditional Irish treats available for purchase.

title: St Piran's Day Flag Lowering
description: St. Piran is the Patron Saint of Cornwall, one of the featured Celtic nations in Glen Innes.  All are welcome to attend this free event, toast St. Piran as the flag of Cornwall is lowered. Raffles and some Cornish treats available for purchase.

title: St David's Day Flag Lowering Ceremony
description: St David is the Patron Saint of Wales - one of the acknowledged Celtic nations in Glen Innes Highlands.  The Australian Standing Stones Management Board will conduct a flag lowering ceremony to honour St David. Join in the celebration, hear about St David's exploits, and enjoy a toast to the Patron Saint and some traditional Welsh cakes.

title: Moorbel Hall Markets
description:
The Moorbel Hall markets are a monthly market where people can purchase home-cooked cakes and slices, jam and pickles a range of soaps, and hand sewn items for the house.

There is an array of fresh food including sausage or rissole sandwiches, egg and bacon rolls, and more.

Devonshire tea is also available.

title: Travelling Film Festival Wagga Wagga
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Wagga Wagga! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, and Sydney Film Festival at Forum 6 Cinemas. 

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Plus the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle, hilarious indie hit Racewalkers, Cannes Grand Jury winner Sentimental Value and much more!

The festival weekend will also screen six more acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: Chocolate Freckle Making
description:
Junee Licorice will teach the children to create a freckle masterpiece - sticky fingers and all.

Children will take home a delicious handmade chocolate freckle.

No need to pre book, simply turn up!

title: Wagga Wagga Show
description:
The Wagga Wagga Show is celebrating its 158th year!

There will be horses and cattle, show dogs, fluffy chooks, and lots of categories to enter for prizes as well as lots of food, show bags, rides, and prizes.

There will be some new events this year including jetpack demonstrations, a stockman show and a secret act!

Don't forget, Canberra’s Clockwork Circus, Troppo Bob, My Pet Dinosaurs WOW Reptile Encounters, Walter the Whip,  Old Kentucky Farm animal nursery and of course fireworks to end both nights.

title: Hamish Tait Piano Solo
description:
Join the Riverina Conservatorium of Music for a free lunchtime performance by pianist Hamish Tait, featuring Beethoven's Piano. 

Sonatas No. 5 and 6, Opus 10/1 and 10/2, along with J.S. Bach's Partita No. 1 in B-flat Major, BWV 825.
