Beethoven's sonatas are filled with dynamic contrasts and emotional depth, while Bach's Partita showcases intricate counterpoint and elegant ornamentation. Through Hamish Tait's expressive performance, these masterpieces will come to life, offering a rich exploration of classical piano repertoire.

title: Christmas on Broadway
description:
It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas… Kick of the festive season in Junee with a fantastic afternoon and evening of markets, entertainment and community spirit.

The kids will be in their element with loads of activities, rides and amusements and let’s not forget a visit from Santa and his helpers.

Proudly presented by Junee Business and Trades. Christmas on Broadway is the premier event on the Junee event calendar.

title: Wagga Wagga Swap Meet - Classic and Historic Automobile Club of Australia
description:
A mixture of 850 stalls both inside and outside selling all sorts of items originally based on cars but now also includes bric-a-brac , hobbies, home made items from scrap, and food vendors.

This year Retro Wheels will present Show and Shine for pre 1994 cars, bikes and commercial vehicles.

Please join them for this great day out and grab yourself a bargain.
host: Classic and Historic Automobile Club of Australia, Wagga Wagga region Inc.

title: RACE HUB Australia - Wagga 10
description:
Join the inaugural Wagga 10 kilometre at Riverside Precinct, located on the banks of the Murrumbidgee River.

Choose from a 10 kilometre, 5 kilometre or 2 kilometre Family Dash with all races running along the picturesque Wiradjuri Walking Track.

Bring the whole family along to Wagga Beach for a day of fitness, fun, and community spirit at the Wagga 10.

All event finishers will receive a unique Wagga-themed medal, post-race snacks, sponsor giveaways and an online finishers certificate.

Please join in for this amazing day of being active.  See the website for registration details.

title: Christmas with the Con
description:
Join them for the fourth annual Christmas with the Con, proudly presented by the Riverina Conservatorium of Music.

Experience the magic of the season at Wagga Wagga's Riverside Precinct stage with over 200 performers, including the RCM Orchestra, massed choirs, instrumental ensembles, and talented vocalists. Enjoy a festive program of beloved carols, Christmas classics, and holiday favorites—from traditional to contemporary.

More than a concert, this event is a celebration of community, joy, and generosity. We're proud to continue our partnership with Country Hope, a local charity supporting children with cancer and life-threatening illnesses. Your attendance helps raise awareness and brings hope to families in need.

Returning this year are our audience sing-along and two large screens, ensuring you don't miss a moment of the magic, no matter where you're seated.

To conclude the night, enjoy a spectacular fireworks finale, perfectly timed to live music performed by the RCM Orchestra—filling the sky with light and the air with festive cheer.

Christmas with the Con 2025 promises a magical evening of music, celebration, and togetherness for the entire Riverina community. Don't miss this cherished holiday tradition!

title: Book launch - Chok: Uzbek Architecture in Needlepoint
description:
Discover how Natalie Fisher transforms ancient Uzbek architectural motifs into contemporary needlepoint tapestries as she sits down with Sam Bowker to explore her unique creative journey. From the ornate decorative tiles of historic Uzbekistan to the intimate craft of needle and thread, this conversation and exhibition will reveal the fascinating intersection of cultural heritage and modern artistry.

Chok is the Uzbek word for 'stitch'. Chok is the sister book to Natalie's first release, 'Ghorzah: Islamic Architecture in Needlepoint'. Both books will be available for viewing and purchase on the night. 

You can also view Natalie's latest needlepoint works inspired by Uzbek architecture - on exhibition for one night only. 

This evening will delight anyone interested in textile arts, Islamic architecture, Islamic art, visual culture, travel. It promises rich conversation, beautiful art and some surprise treats!

title: Junee Rotary Farmers Markets
description:
This wonderful market is held on the first Sunday of each month in the car park of the Junee Ex-Services Memorial Club. The market features freshly baked, handmade and fresh-picked goods from all over the Eastern Riverina region. 

Regular products include wine, olives, cheese, flowers, bread, pastries, green groceries, organic beef and condiments.  This is a child-friendly market with musicians, food stalls and a great atmosphere.

title: Smuggler Compass: Caribbean (Port 5)
description:
One Night. One Port. No Questions Asked.

The Smuggler's Compass returns for another unforgettable evening—this time, charting a course into the untamed heart of the Caribbean. In this world, rum flows deeper than water, recipes are passed down in whispers, and every island holds a tale best told over a strong pour.

This isn't just another night out—it's an escape into the wild, soulful spirit of the Caribbean underground.

Guests will be treated to rebellious cocktails, bold island bites, and a secret menu inspired by beach shack staples and pirate-worthy potions. Each dish and drink is a tribute to the region's rich, untamed flavors—crafted to surprise, delight, and transport.

Passports are stamped. Glasses are raised.

The first rule of the Smuggler's Compass? Don't ask what's in the barrel. Just drink it.

The evening promises glamour, mystery, and exceptional taste. It's a celebration of secrets, spirits, and stories shared under the cover of night.

Seats are limited. Reservations are essential.

Because the only law tonight? Make it to the next port.

title: Fresh Farmers Market
description:
Come along to this Fresh Farmers Market, every Saturday for your fresh seasonal produce.

Picked fresh from their farm in North Wagga, they have a variety of fruit and vegetables for you to enjoy.

Also available, freshly baked sourdough.

title: Giro de Cassilis
description:
The Giro de Cassilis is a two-day gravel cycling event in the heart of the Upper Hunter, designed to showcase Cassilis as a prime cycling destination. 

On Saturday, riders will take on the challenging Triple Crown, an 88-kilometre course with rugged gravel paths. 
Sunday's ride offers a more relaxed 48-kilometre route, mixing gravel and tarred roads, including some hill climbs. Both rides are out-and-back courses, allowing cyclists to choose their own distance and turn around when they feel ready.

The event caters to cyclists of all abilities, with the option of shorter routes providing a more leisurely experience. This flexibility encourages participation from both competitive cyclists and those looking for a fun ride while also promoting community engagement and supporting local businesses in Cassilis. Riders will finish both days at the Royal Hotel, where they can enjoy a well-deserved meal and refreshments.

Whether you're chasing the challenge of the Triple Crown or simply enjoying a scenic ride through the Upper Hunter, the Giro de Cassilis offers something for everyone. Come for the ride, stay for the community and local flavour!

title: Clarice Beckett: Paintings from the National Collection
description:
Clarice Beckett: Paintings from the National Collection presents an intimate, rarely seen group of works by one of the most original artists of early twentieth century Australia.

Deeply sensitive to the effects of colour, light and atmosphere, Beckett painted the life and scenery of her coastal home in south-east Naarm/Melbourne with an eye for the commonplace and fleeting effects of nature. Her work captures a world on the cusp of modernisation, evoking both the natural environment and simple pleasures of suburbia.

In 1972, the artist's sister Hilda Mangan donated a group of Beckett's works to the National Gallery. It is this collection that will be on view for the first time, their freshness and vitality recently restored by extensive conservation treatment.
Clarice Beckett: Paintings from the National Collection is a National Gallery Touring Exhibition supported by The Australian Government through Visions of Australia.

Curators:
Elspeth Pitt, Senior Curator, Australian Art
Deirdre Cannon, Assistant Curator, Australian Art

title: Greg Carosi - House of Cards
description:
House of Cards, an exhibition developed in consultation with WWAG curator Andrew Halyday, will explore the fragility of our human condition through a theatrical series of large-format acrylic on aluminium paintings that invite viewers to become the figure in the landscape. 

Maintaining a tension between the grounded limitations of human experience and the capacity for art to lift us out of the here and now, the exhibition will seek to embody feelings of existential precarity that permeate life in the 21st century.

title: Aunty Fay Clayton and Uncle Bill Wallace: Riverina
description: This exhibition brings together paintings, created over past decades from Wagga-based Elders Aunty Fay Clayton and Uncle Bill Wallace. The paintings explore the life experiences and culture of both artists, and are an important means of truth-telling, for these members of the Stolen Generations. Artworks on display are drawn from public and private collections.

title: Arthur Wicks - Paintings
description:
In glorious colour - rarely seen large abstract paintings from the personal archive of groundbreaking colour field artist Arthur Wicks.

Arthur Wicks is a formidable contemporary artist, practicing across painting, sculpture, performance and print-making. Born in Sydney 1937, Wicks has been a resident of Wagga Wagga for over 40 years.

Following early studies in science at the University of Sydney, Arthur went on to study Fine Arts at the Australian National University. His first solo exhibition was held at the Nundah Galleries in Canberra in 1966. Thereafter, Wicks travelled and studied in Europe and New York. He was awarded a French Government Scholarship in 1967 to study printmaking with renowned British printmaker Stanley Hayter at his Paris studio. Wicks returned to Australia in the mid-1980s, producing art, teaching and exhibiting in metropolitan and regional galleries.

This exhibition celebrates Arthur's exceptional, colour-field abstract paintings, produced on the eve of the founding of Wagga Wagga Art Gallery, 50 years ago.

title: 50 Years / 50 Treasures: Treasure #1 - The National Art Glass Collection
description:
In 2025 Wagga Wagga Art Gallery celebrates its 50 year anniversary.  Pivotal to celebrations is the Gallery wide exhibition program 50 Years / 50 Treasures which surveys important artwork from the Gallery's collection including, glass, painting, print, sculpture, ceramic and textile art.

This collection features treasures from the National Art Glass Collection.

title: Canberra vs the Government: Prints from the archive of Megalo Print Studio
description:
Guest curated by printmaker and Megalo founder, Alison Alder, Canberra vs the Government: Prints from the archive of Megalo Print Studio that, through the lens of printmaking, reclaims the identity of Canberra beyond its political structures. By drawing on the rich history of Megalo Print Studio's archive, Canberra vs the Government provides an insightful exploration into the medium of print as a tool for describing and building communities both locally and internationally.

With the youth unemployment rate surging to 23.2% for 15-19 year olds and 13.4% for 20-24 year olds in Canberra in 1980, Megalo International Screenprint Collective was born. Canberra, home to around 180,000 people, primarily young families, was suffering and one organisation, Jobless Action, was busy setting up enterprises with the aim of providing spaces for young people to create their own jobs.

Housed in the laundry of a former migrant camp on the flanks of Mt Ainslie, right behind the Australian War Memorial, Megalo started out producing screenprinted posters advertising community events and services, agitating for social change and championing political action.


Showcasing works from the early, and often very raw, screen prints to beautifully sophisticated lithographs, Canberra vs the Government is an exhibition not to be missed.

title: Patricia Murray, Susan Buik, Tina de Jong: Hollow - Not Nature's Empty Places
description:
Not Nature's Empty Places program is supported by Create NSW through NSW Government.

Please join them for this wonderfully inspiring exhibit, not to be missed.

title: Family Movie Friday
description:
Stay warm in the Library's Children's Area with some of our favourite family films! No need to book, just pop in, get comfy and enjoy!

All screenings will be G-rated and family-friendly. Screening begins at 10:30am, and film runs approx. 90 mins.

Please note: children under 16 require a responsible grown-up to remain for the duration.

No need to book just meet them at the library.

title: Orchestral Magic With The Sydney Symphony
description:
Experience the magic of live orchestral music with the Sydney Symphony.

In this enchanting concert designed especially for school-aged children and their families, be inspired and delighted by magical classical favourites by Mendelssohn, Ravel and more.

Music has an extraordinary power to inspire and delight, and in this concert you will experience the magic of Mendelssohn's A Midsummer Night's Dream, Ravel's playful Mother Goose, Falla's rousing The Three-Cornered Hat and the simple gift of Copland's Appalachian Spring.

Conducted by Benjamin Northey with Timothy Constable as your presenter and musical tour guide, the young (and young at heart) won't be able to resist the magic of some of the most beloved classical music of all time.

title: One Book One - Wagga
description:
Come along to celebrate One Book One Wagga with award-winning author Shankari Chandran!

Shankari, one of Australia's most exciting contemporary fiction authors, will share insights into her latest novel, Unfinished Business, and the creative process behind this explosive thriller. Don't miss this opportunity to gain a unique perspective into Shankari's storytelling techniques. This a rare chance to engage directly with a Miles Franklin Award-winner.

The event wraps up with canapés and a chance to mingle with fellow book lovers, meet Shankari in person and get your copy of Unfinished Business signed!

Shankari Chandran is an Australian Tamil lawyer and author of Unfinished Business, Chai Time at Cinnamon Gardens, Safe Haven , Song of the Sun God and The Barrier. Shankari has spent two decades working as a lawyer in the social justice field, on national and international program design and delivery.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Wagga Wagga
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  
Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   
It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Balgarra
description:
Shining light on the creativity and strength of the next generation.

Balgarra, is a NAIDOC Week celebration shining a light on the creativity and strength of the next generation at the Wagga Wagga Civic Theatre. Meaning "emitting sparks" in Wiradjuri, this special event brings together  talented young people to celebrate this year's theme. The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy, through art, music, dance, and storytelling.

Featuring performances by Philly, Beacho2710, Local Wiradjuri dance groups and much more.

From powerful performances to quiet moments of reflection, Balgarra is about sharing culture, celebrating strengths, and embracing the future with pride.

title: Teddy Bears Picnic
description:
Join Saffron, E.B White-Bear, and Dan Brown-Bear for a Teddy Bear Picnic in the Library. There'll be bear stories, songs and craft.

Bring your teddy, picnic snacks and drinks, and a small picnic rug (optional).

Please book one ticket per family. Maximum six people.

A parent or guardian is required to remain for the duration of the event.

Please see website for bookings.

title: Festival of W
description:
Lights, ice skating, live music, winter eats and more. Move into winter in Wagga Wagga.

Held during the school holidays for the whole family to enjoy.

Start planning your winter adventures to our city and stay tuned for full festival details and line-up for this great 2025 event.

title: Wagga Wagga Road Runners - Saturday Runs
description:
Wagga Wagga Road Runners club is a non-profit community group of families and individuals who engage in running and walking activities throughout the year. 

A major aim is to encourage runners and walkers of all abilities to enjoy exercising for fitness and health.

See their website for details on full year calendar run on locations and times.

title: Paper Pulp to Pictures - Family Workshop with Em Shannon
description:
Kick off the winter school holidays together as a family with a fun art experience at Wagga Wagga Art Gallery! Kids of all ages welcome with their grown-up companion.

Join resident RAD artist Emily Shannon in her E3 residency space and explore everything about paper from pulp, to mark making to collage. Emily's art practice centres on sustainability and place and she'll be sharing some of her creatively made, eco-conscious art supplies with participants in this fun and engaging workshop.

Booking essential, limited spaces

title: Roller Discos
description:
Twin City Skate, the largest roller skating club in New South Wales, run regular Saturday night and Sunday afternoon roller discos in Wagga Wagga!

Think cool tunes, fancy lighting and a giant disco ball! Bring your own skates or hire them at the venue.

Birthday party bookings are also available. There is no extra cost for a party booking for each participant. Twin City Skate will reserve you a space and provide a table for you to decorate and cover with food/cake however you wish. 

There is a venue limit of two party bookings per disco, so if you would like to book a party for the weekend of your birthday, you can book ahead online.

title: Blaze of Creativity - A Community Art Exhibition
description:
Experience "Blaze of Creativity" a special art exhibition celebrating the hidden talents and emerging artists of the Orange region as part of the 2025 Fire Festival.

This charming exhibition features a diverse range of artworks in various mediums from local artists, showcasing not just their creative expressions but also what art has brought to their lives. Open to all ages and all mediums. 

The exhibition will be held in an old apple packing shed, which will be magically transformed into a gallery space. This exhibition promises to bring together the community to celebrate art and creativity. This event is not ticketed.

title: Kitchen Whiz Kids
description:
Yes, chef. Grab your aprons and join in the school holiday fun at Wagga Marketplace.

Make your own world class burger at a Grill'd Masterclass these school holidays or learn how to make sushi and become a sashimi superstar with Sushi Hub.

Please join them these school holidays for fun in the kitchen.

Session times and bookings via website.

title: The Bidgee Blues and Roots Club Open Mic Afternoon
description:
The Bidgee Blues & Roots Club will be holding the monthly Open mic afternoon, the first Sunday of the month.
This is open to all musicians of all capabilities & genres. Just bring yourself, your instrument & your friends and enjoy the afternoon listening to local talent. Hope to see you there.

title: Infusion Games Trivia and Karaoke
description:
Enjoy a fun filled night where you get to test your knowledge and join in the fun testing your singing talent.  

Arrive a little earlier and enjoy a wonderful meal in the restaurant.

Join a great night out.

title: River & Wren Markets
description:
River & Wren Market is Wagga Wagga's premier handmade and artisan market, offering a vibrant and welcoming shopping experience for locals and visitors alike. Held at the Wagga Wagga Showground, River & Wren brings together a carefully curated selection of talented makers, creators, and small businesses from across the Riverina and beyond.

Each event showcases a stunning range of handmade homewares, fashion, art, gourmet food, unique gifts, and more — all thoughtfully crafted with quality and creativity at their core.

More than just a market, River & Wren is a celebration of community, creativity, and connection. Visitors can enjoy browsing beautifully styled stalls, meeting the makers, discovering new treasures, and experiencing the warm, friendly atmosphere that makes River & Wren so special.

Whether you're looking for the perfect handmade gift, something delicious to take home, or simply a fun and inspiring day out, River & Wren Market offers an experience you won't want to miss.
host: Emma Grant & Bill Robbo - WWT2 for Ronald McDonald House

title: Wollundry Saturday Markets
description:
Come along to the Wollundry Saturday Markets in the heart of Wagga at the second Saturday of each month.

With over 30 stallholders, including a variety of food purveyors, fruit and vegetables, and homewares, there is much to choose from. You can grab a great egg and bacon roll and a hot beverage while you're here.

There is plenty of room to relax and listen to local musicians while enjoying the atmosphere.

Come join them and while you're here maybe drop in a gold coin donation to help their Rotary Club support their community.

title: Jail Break Fun Run
description:
Start your Australia Day off with a bang and register to be part of the annual Jail Break Fun Run.

Whether you’re a runner, walker or wheelie (bikes, scooters, prams) it’s guaranteed to be a fun event for all. Enjoy the 3.5-kilometre track as you wind your way through picturesque Junee.

The run commences from the Junee Correctional Centre and finishes at the Junee Recreation and Aquatic Centre, followed by a barbecue breakfast for all competitors.

title: Riverina Producers  Market
description:
Riverina Producers Market is a market run by producers to connect with those who love good food. 

Various stalls sell fresh and prepared foods, food-related products and complementary homewares.

Products include meat, fruit, vegetables, cheeses, bread, honey, jams, berries, pickles, sweet treats, chocolate and more, directly from the producer to you.

title: Wheelchair AFL
description:
Wheelchair Sports NSW/ACT's Mission is to change the lives of people living with a disability through participation in Sports. 

Announcing the launch of a Wheelchair AFL hub.

Anyone can play wheelchair AFL, an adaptive sport that anyone can play; it offers an excellent opportunity for everyone to engage, have fun, and try something new.

title: PCYC Wagga Wagga Activities
description:
PCYC NSW runs a variety of safe, fun, creative and inclusive activities for primary and high school aged youth. The structured programs have a selection of sport and creative based activities to ensure they offer something for everyone!

From multi-sport, gymnastics and boxing to painting, dance and crafts, they have lots on offer!

View their website for full program, pricing  and to make bookings.

title: PCYC Wagga Wagga Pickleball
description:
PCYC NSW hosts pickleball events for community members who are looking for a fun and easy way to stay active while enjoying the thrill of competition.

If you haven’t heard of pickleball before, you’re not alone. But fortunately, the premise is quite simple! The game is a mix between tennis, badminton, and squash, and it’s similar to each of those sports in that you use a racquet to hit a ball over the net. It’s fast becoming a cult activity, gaining huge popularity across the state.

Visitors welcome.

Please join them for this fun activity everyday except Sunday.

title: Spring Jam
description:
A family-friendly day out jam-packed with activities, from hands-on creative workshops, roving performers, and music curated to appeal to the diverse interests of children and youth.

Perfect for 2–12-year-olds.

title: School Holidays: Botanic Gardens Sunshine Storytime
description:
Storytime at the Botanic Gardens is everything you already love about Storytime but in the beautiful surroundings of Wagga's Botanic Gardens.

There'll be picture books, songs, and crafts. Stick around afterwards and use the Agile Library van, which lets you browse, borrow, return, and make reservations, just like the regular library branch.

No bookings are required.  Bring your own picnic rugs

title: Willans Hill Miniature Railway Rides
description:
Situated in the Botanic Gardens, the model railway runs through the garden and features an authentic station and booking office. The track runs through woodlands, a tunnel and over a bridge.

The railway was established in 1978 by Raymond Catts, who advertised for interested persons to form a club for the display and use of models.

Public Run Days are operating on the first and third Sundays of the month. Tickets can be purchased from the Ticket Window.

title: Meet and Greet Encounters at Botanic Gardens Zoo
description:
The zoo will be running meet-and-greet encounters daily during the school holidays.

See the dingos and reptiles, walk around the zoo, including emu feeding, deer interactions and camel feeding - meet near the wombat enclosure. 

Mini pony walks around the gardens with a photo opportunity and pats.

Enjoy all the zoo has to offer these school holidays.

title: Museum of the Riverina Aussie Animal Origami
description:
Drop in to the museum for this fun free activity for all ages! With a range of different Aussie animals to create, get folding and see how many you can make.

While you're here, enjoy the beautiful new galleries and other free activities on offer.

title: Christmas in July at Stockman’s Ridge Wines – Fires, Wine & Festive Vibes
description:
Embrace the winter magic all July long at Stockman's Ridge Wines with cosy fires, festive cheer, and family-friendly fun. Enjoy a complimentary glass of mulled wine with every ticket, unlimited hot chocolate for the kids, and an extra free drink for anyone rocking an ugly Christmas sweater!

With live music and laid-back vibes, it's the perfect way to warm up your winter in the Orange region.
Whether you're sipping wine by the fire or enjoying the festive atmosphere with family and friends, Stockman's Ridge is the place to celebrate Christmas in July. 

Available every Saturday in July.

title: Wagga Stamp and Coin Fair
description:
Wagga Stamp and Coin Fair is back again this year with a friendly stamp and coin fair with seven dealers in attendance for buying, selling and providing free valuations.   

Stamp and Coin Club bargain table.

title: Strawhouse Shindig - Winter Fire Festival
description:
Strawhouse, as part of the 2025 Orange Winter Fire Festival, will be having a Shindig.

Join Meg Simpson and Justin Byrne of Strawhouse Wines and guest musicians, Trouble with Johnny, for some chilled classics from the last half century and light up the afternoon in and around the Strawhouse Tasting Room and Deck. 

The ticket includes a welcome glass of wine and the band. Kiss Kitchen will be dishing up some delectable treats to keep you fuelled for the day.

title: NAIDOC Deadly 3x3 Gala Basketball NSW
description:
In partnership with Mawang Gaway, this Basketball NSW event is aimed to provide an opportunity for members of the community to try basketball and connect with others in a fun and inclusive day celebrating the meaning of NAIDOC through basketball. Skills sessions for young first timers and a 3x3 basketball tournament for all. All skill levels and abilities are welcome.

There are skills session for five- to ten-year-olds followed by game play for all other age groups.

You can expect 3X3 basketball games, shooting competitions, prizes, free haircuts and braids, a variety of off-court activities, a DJ with music all day, a free sausage sizzle and refreshments.  

Registration is now open.  Please email with any enquiries.

title: Riverina Long Lunch and Good Food Weekend
description:
The Riverina Long Lunch & Good Food Weekend celebrates the region's best food, wine, cocktails, and produce while connecting guests with the growers and makers behind it all.

Hosted by Farm Door Riverina on their family farm, this gourmet weekend offers something for all ages—whether you're after a countryside escape, an immersive food experience, or the perfect insta-worthy moment.

Day One: Riverina Long Lunch 
Register early to secure your seat at Farm Door Riverina's signature long lunch. Arrive to a welcome cocktail in a secret paddock location, then wander through the trees to a local grazing table. Enjoy delicious treats and inspiring conversations before following the trail to your long-table feast—crafted over fire and coals by Terra Firma Dining. End the journey with desserts in the trees. All local, all delicious, and all a little bit magical.

Day Two: Riverina Sunday Drive 
Mid-canola season is the perfect time for a Sunday drive! Register for a free map and Gather & Grace Tote, unlocking access to a pop-up farm gate market, vouchers, special offers, and tastings at all the district's highlights. Bring the kids, grandparents, or city friends for a taste of the Riverina's finest.

A weekend of good food and total immersion in nature. Register your interest now!

title: Lonely Mountain Ultra
description:
All trails lead to Orange NSW in Spring where runners of all abilities take on the slopes of Gaanha-bula (Mount Canobolas). 

The Lonely Mountain Ultra (LMU) offers trails ranging in distance including 11 and 22 kilometres for beginner to intermediate runners, 32 and 50 kilometres for the serious enduros, a 50-mile and 104 kilometres for the hard-core and a 100-mile for the elite. 

The LMU also offers a 2 kilometres and 4 kilometres kids race making it a great opportunity for the entire family.

title: Burrumbuttock 150th Celebration 2025 "From then to Now"
description:
Celebrate 150 years of community and history at the Burrumbuttock 150th Celebration – "From Then to Now". This special event brings together locals, visitors, and past residents for a weekend of festivities, heritage displays, live music, food stalls, and family-friendly fun.

Discover the town's rich past through historical exhibitions and storytelling, while enjoying the vibrant spirit of Burrumbuttock today. A great country celebration not to be missed!

title: Markets by the Lake
description:
Enjoy the regular Markets by the Lake, with yummy food and drinks available for purchase including bacon and egg rolls, sausage sandwiches, steak and onion sandwiches, cold soft drinks and water.

Stalls also include arts, crafts, local produce, children's activities, entertainment, and much more all on the shores of beautiful Lake Albert.

title: Wagga Lake Run and Ride
description:
The Intersport Warehouse Wagga Lake Run and Ride is a free run, walk or ride community participation event. 

Walk, run or ride 5 kilometres or 10 kilometres through the streets of Wagga and around the shores of Lake Albert.

Join Wagga's largest free community participation event.

title: Riverina Iris Farm Open Garden and Iris Display
description:
Riverina Iris Farm welcomes you to the wonderful world of Irises, located on the edge of sunny Wagga Wagga. 

Tall Bearded Irises captured their attention and imagination in 2012 when they started the collection and they now now sell over 1500 varieties of irises, so you can enjoy these plants which are perfectly suited to easy care gardens, particularly in the drier regions of Australia.  

In October and early November the rainbow of beautiful colours makes a wonderful site and amongst the tranquil rural setting you can sit, relax and enjoy morning or afternoon tea with your friends (on weekends) or on weekdays for groups by arrangement - donations toward charity such as supporting the Adopt a Koala.

They also have 200 Day Lilies which flower from December to March (call for an appointment to view these).

They are looking forward to welcoming you to the open days in October and November.  Relax, enjoy and be inspired to create a beautiful garden.

title: Sculptures in the Garden - Mudgee
description:
Sculptures in the Garden is an exciting event that combines garden design, large-scale Australian sculpture and traditional art mediums in beautiful rural surroundings within a private garden and vineyard in Mudgee.

Now in its 15th year, Sculptures in the Garden is Mudgee and regional NSW's largest and most renowned outdoor sculpture exhibition. The outdoor exhibition runs for 16 days. Sculptures in the Garden has become a hallmark event on the Central West's artistic calendar and a major tourist attraction, showcasing sculptures from emerging and established artists. 

Founded by art director and owner of Rosby, Kay Norton-Knight, Sculptures in the Garden was her dream child. Kay was passionate about providing a new and unique platform for the exhibition and sale of sculptors' works. 

Sculptures in the Garden is a not-for-profit organisation and as such any profits are distributed between the establishment of a sculpture walk in Mudgee and the local charity, Support Group of Guide Dogs NSW/ACT.

title: October Long Weekend Live Music
description:
Kick off spring and celebrate bud burst in the vineyard this October long weekend at Vinifera Wines! 

It's the perfect time to soak up the sunshine, and welcome the season with live music and delicious drinks. No need to book - just roll up, grab a spot on the lawn or at a table, and settle in for a laid-back day; Darsharni Martins will keep the tunes flowing, their bar will be stocked with organic wines, local craft beers, and Baker Williams G&Ts, and grazing platters will be available to order on the day. Spring in the vines doesn't get better than this!

title: Mudgee Farmers' Markets
description:
The Mudgee Farmers’ Market is the home of the Mudgee region’s best range of local produce.

Held in Robertson Park every third Saturday of the month, the Mudgee Farmers’ Market boasts an array of relishes, preserves, olives, honey, oils, local wine, sweet treats, flowers and more!

Grab a bacon and egg roll, teamed with a freshly brewed coffee, as you browse the great range of stalls.

Chat with the specialist producers before taking home a selection of delicious Mudgee produce.
An authentic farmers market, all products have been grown, reared, caught, brewed, pickled, baked, smoked, or processed by the stallholders themselves.

The markets are always on – rain, hail, or shine!

title: Mudgee Makers' Market
description:
The Mudgee Makers’ Market is a combination of all the best local producers of food, wine, and art in the region.

Browse more than 50 stalls, showcasing the region’s best creatives and producers. 

Wile away your Sunday morning with a relaxing stroll around the Mudgee Makers’ Market – grab a coffee and some brunch and find a spot on a picnic rug in the sunshine.

Discover a wealth of regional produce, alongside a diverse, quality range of art, candles, fabrics, jewellery, clothing, and more.

Come and meet the makers, have a chat about produce, purchase a unique gift and support local industry and traditional handmade art practice.

title: Food over Fire by Nashdale Lane Wines x Union Bank
description:
Nashdale Lane and The Union Bank Orange invite you to an evening of flavour and warmth. Enjoy food cooked over flames by Union Bank Executive Chef Dom Aboud, award-winning wines, live music, and a cosy wood fire atmosphere.

This event includes a glass of red, white, or pink, plus a fire-inspired menu featuring dishes like smoked corn and prawn chowder, grilled Kinross Station lamb cutlets, and other seasonal local bites (menu subject to chef's discretion).

The cellar door bar will be open to purchase additional wines by the glass, plus beer and soft drinks available. Please advise of any dietary requirements in advance.

title: Mudgee Classic
description:
Ride through one of New South Wales' most picturesque wine regions at the Mudgee Classic – a premier Gran Fondo cycling event offering something for everyone.

Held over two days, the event features the Dirty Mudgee gravel ride on Saturday, followed by four scenic road courses on Sunday, ranging from 35km to 170km. 

With incredible countryside, gourmet local food, and a vibrant event village, the Mudgee Classic is more than just a ride – it's a cycling experience to remember!

title: Church Markets
description:
On the first Saturday of each month, the Church Markets are held on the grounds of St John’s Anglican Church. 

A country town just isn’t a country town without markets to explore. Why not time your visit to coincide with one of the regular monthly markets and discover a range of stallholders to grab some locally grown and made produce, handmade textiles, arts and crafts, jewellery, pre-loved books, clothes, knick-knacks and more.

title: Lawson Park Markets
description:
The Lawson Park Markets are held by the river in the picturesque Lawson Park, every second Saturday of the Month. 

Why not time your visit to Mudgee NSW coincide with one of the regular monthly markets and discover a range of stallholders to grab some local produce, arts, crafts, knick-knacks, vintage clothing and more.

title: Sunday Sessions at Rowlee with Lueth Ajak - Fire Festival Edition
description:
As part of the Orange Region Fire Festival, Rowlee Wines presents a special edition of their popular free monthly event, Sunday Sessions at Rowlee.

Visitors are invited to enjoy an afternoon of live music featuring the return of acclaimed artist Lueth Ajak, set against the backdrop of Rowlee's picturesque estate. The event will feature cosy
firepits, seasonal beverages including Rowlee wines, mulled wine, cocktails, and hot drinks, along with a hearty winter menu from the Rowlee Dining & Bar kitchen.

This is a family-friendly event with free entry. Food and beverages will be available for purchase on the day. Guests are encouraged to bring a picnic blanket or chair and dress warmly. Tables and seating will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. Well-behaved dogs on leads are also welcome.

Please note that BYO food and drinks are not permitted.

title: Illabo Show
description:
Considered the best one-day show in NSW for its size, the Illabo Show is an excellent day out for people of all ages with activities to appeal to everyone including animal and pavilion exhibitions.

The show is held on the second Saturday of October.

title: Illabo Vintage Speedway Meet
description:
Not just for the car enthusiasts, events at the Illabo Speedway are a great day out for all.

For all Vintage Speed cars, Compacts, Modified, Sprint cars, Classic Rear Engine F 500’s and all other AVCSNB sanctioned categories.

Vintage speedway events take place four times a year in March, May, August and October. Entry is open to all members of the public.

title: Sunday Sessions at Canobolas Dance Hall
description:
Canobolas Dance Halls Sunday Sessions are here! 

Come along for great live, local music, beautiful wine, beer and food, while you enjoy the gorgeous outdoor setting by the dam on the second Sunday of each month.

Family Friendly.

title: Let us entertain you! Williams Vs Matchbox 20
description:
Get ready to push the pedal down and crank up the nostalgia – The Handpicked Band bringing the anthems of Robbie Williams and Matchbox Twenty to life for one night only!

Expect to dance, sing and sway your way through Angels, Let Me Entertain You, Back 2 Good, If You're Gone and more of the fire-powered hits from two of the most iconic artists of the '90s and 2000s.

Woodfired pizza & dessert, full bar, handpicked merch are available for purchase on the night.

Book now — this one will sell out!

title: Fireside Feast at The Oriana Gardens
description:
Experience a cosy winter evening at Fireside Feast in The Oriana Gardens, enjoy an evening of fire-cooked food, mulled wine, and winter cocktails under twinkling fairy lights and starry skies.

Gather around the firepits, explore the garden by night, and enjoy comforting dishes from the woodfire kitchen, with drinks available from the Martini Bar.

Food and additional drinks available to purchase on the night.

title: Rainbow Festival
description:
The Rainbow Festival will transform the city of Orange into a colourful celebration promoting diversity and inclusivity.

The city's LGBTQIA+ festival will feature a bumper five-day program.

Drawing visitors from across the region, the festival fosters acceptance and encourages the community to embrace equality as it promotes Orange as a welcoming and inclusive community.

Orange City Council will host signature events, the Rainbow Walk and Community Gathering, and the 18+ Pride Party.

title: Orange FOOD Week
description:
What started out as an idea dreamt up by a small group of passionate local foodies three decades ago to showcase the provenance and rich diversity of the Orange region's produce and to celebrate its producers and vignerons has blossomed into a festival of national standing.

From humble beginnings in 1991,  the Orange FOOD (Food Of Orange District) Week festival is now Australia's longest running regional food and wine festival and delivers a rich tapestry of events held over 10 days each April, during the local Autumn harvest and vintage season.

It is a celebration of the region's abundance, embracing an ethos of sustainable practices and community spirit. FOOD Week are committed to championing the provenance of the Orange region's produce, celebrating local heroes and positioning the region as one of Australia's most aspirational culinary tourism destinations – where every week is food and wine week.

Head to the Orange FOOD Week website for further information and ticketing.
host: FOOD OF ORANGE DISTRICT WEEK INCORPORATED

title: Orange Region Fire Festival
description:
Every August, the Orange Region's Fire Festival showcases local artists, musicians and producers through a series of collaborations spanning a ten-day program. 

Food and wine venues become performance spaces and cultural venues open their doors to fire-inspired dining, wine events, artistic workshops, exhibitions and film screenings.

Fire, warmth and light thread through it all, set against the stunning backdrop of the Orange Region. Reconnect, feast, be creative and lean into the region's country hospitality - the perfect Winter antidote.

title: Orange FOOD Week - FOOD Train
description:
This weekend package is FOOD Week's premium experience. Hosted by local foodies and regional hospitality faves, join a three day guided trip from Sydney to Orange enjoying some of the region’s best food and wine experiences. The FOOD Train will showcase the international influences of Orange's food and wine in a feast of flavour and fun. 

Departing Sydney’s Central Station on Friday, the FOOD Train weekend includes tickets to the renowned FOOD Week's most sought-after event, Forage, plus local tours, selected FOOD Week events and dining at some of the region's favourite restaurants.

Head to the Orange FOOD Week website for the full itinerary and ticketing information, announced early December.

title: Orange FOOD Week - Sampson Street Lunch
description:
Inspired by an English late summer long lunch, the Sampson Street Lunch is a unique food and wine celebration bringing together some of Orange’s best-known and emerging chefs and foodies, wine producers and fun makers.

Under a canopy of Autumn coloured Plane trees in all their glory in one of Orange’s prettiest streets, guests can enjoy this once-a-year special long lunch event which includes three courses with paired wines plus canapes and drinks on arrival.

Through special arrangements with Orange City Council and the residents of Sampson Street, the Sampson Street Long Lunch has become one of FOOD Week's most sought-after events.

So, dress up and expect a relaxed afternoon of contemporary food and wines with frivolity and flavour.

This event is for adults 18 years and over only, with the exception of children under age 1 not yet mobile and in a baby carrier or pram.

title: A Night in Nashville - Orange
description:
A Night in Nashville is an all-American-themed country music festival celebrating cowboy boots, country roots and a strong quintessential Nashville vibe. 

Conducted in the country town of Orange, the whole festival is considered one performance with artists, organisers and attendees all contributing to a great night of American country music, styling, costumes, entertainment, food and southern hospitality. 

Bull-riding, Line Dancing and set lists and sound will fit the ‘Nashville’ theme and complement each other to a standard that would be worthy of the Music City itself.

title: Culcairn Show
description:
The Culcairn Show will be held over the October Long Weekend.

Planned activities for show day include the junior showgirl and showboy, sports group activities, displays, sideshow rides, demonstration wood chop competition, horse events, shearing competition, school’s art competition, and so much more. 

It is sure to be a fun day out for the family!

title: Orange Chamber Music Festival
description:
Enjoy four days of world-class performances, fine dining events and a free community event, Cultured.  

The Orange Chamber Music Festival celebrates the unique features of the Orange Region, New South Wales. The colour city is boundless with award-winning cellar doors, restaurants and boutique accommodations as the backdrop to a spectacular selection of Australian artists and ensembles. 

Rich in culture and with a diverse range of modern and restored establishments, Orange is the perfect destination for art and music lovers.

Details and tickets for the 2026 event will be released soon.

title: Art Exhibition at Dirty Janes
description:
The Corner Store Gallery has just opened a second exhibition space at the brand new Dirty Janes in Orange. You can explore an eclectic mix of vintage and antique furniture, retro collectibles, books, art, records, toys, jewellery, clothing, and so much more, all in one place. 

They'll have an ever-evolving mini exhibition of work from their stockroom on display at Dirty Janes, showcasing some of their best work.

title: Currabubula Boutique Market
description:
Currabubula Boutique Markets are held twice a year at the Currabubula Recreation Ground.  

Over 180 stalls showcasing their amazing products.  

Markets are held on the first Sunday in May and December.  All money raised goes to the wonderful bush school and preschool.

title: Rhythm and Brews at Badlands Brewery and Taproom
description:
Come along on Sunday afternoons for Rhythm and Brews at Badlands Brewery and Taproom.

Featuring live music from local artists along with some great food trucks. 

The Taproom is the perfect location to catch up with friends or bring the family when you need to escape the house! There are games for the kids, a warm and cosy atmosphere.

Badlands Brewery and Taproom offer 14 taps of beer, local wines, tasting paddles, growler fills, brewery tours, merchandise, food trucks, board games, darts and live music.

title: Piano Bar Night - Badlands Brewery
description:
Michelle Griffin has been tinkling the ivories from the cabaret stage to the concert hall for more than 20 years. As head of both the keyboard and vocal departments at Mitchell Conservatorium, Bathurst, Michelle has trained in a wide range of styles.

For their Live at The Taproom shows, Michelle will be bringing a mix of classic piano bar hits and popular favourites to brighten the Badlands Brewery.

Enjoy hits from Elton John, Billy Joel, Van Morrison, Nora Jones, Lady Gaga, Alicia Keys, Missy Higgins, Regina Spektor and many more. As always, they will have a delicious dinner created by the culinary team at the Orange Pie Co and a great range of beers and wines for you to select. Gather your friends and grab tickets for a night to be remembered.

title: Faulty Towers - Confetti and Chaos
description:
It might just be the worst wedding reception you'll ever go to–and you're all invited! 
It was meant to be a surprise party but it's turned into pandemonium–with secrets spilling out as family members bust in, bust up and bust a move. Audiences become guests caught in the crossfire in this totally immersive and highly improvised comedy.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Orange
description:
In 2021, Andrew spent four months in two of Sydney's maximum-security prisons for the supply of psychedelic drugs. He had a great time.

Best Newcomer Nominee – Melbourne International Comedy Festival, 2023

title: Killer Queen Experience - Orange City Bowling Club
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Orange Wine Festival
description:
The annual Orange Wine Festival celebrates the vibrant wine and food culture of the Orange region, renowned for its exceptional cool-climate wines.

Held over three weekends in Spring, the festival offers a colourful and diverse program of over 40 events. These events showcase the finest wines of the Orange region, catering to everyone from experienced wine enthusiasts to newcomers eager to explore their palates.

Visitors can indulge in a variety of experiences, including intimate wine tastings, gourmet food and wine pairings, and vineyard tours that offer a behind-the-scenes look at the winemaking process. The festival also features masterclasses led by expert winemakers, providing a deeper understanding of the unique characteristics of cool-climate wines.

Whether you're exploring the picturesque vineyards, savouring exquisite wines, or enjoying the region's culinary delights, the Orange Wine Festival offers a perfect blend of relaxation and excitement. It's an opportunity to connect with fellow wine lovers, learn from industry experts, and appreciate the unique charm of the Orange region. With something to delight every palate, don't miss this chance to experience the best of cool-climate wines and the rich culinary offerings of Orange, where every drop is truly "A Drop Above."

title: Ros Auld Insight Figure and Landscape
description:
In this new series of works, local ceramic artist Ros Auld investigates the relationship between the figure and the landscape. 

Known for her richly textured vessels and ceramic sculptures that embody both the strength and fragility of the Australian landscape, Auld is one of the Orange region's most accomplished artists. 

This latest body of work continues her exploration of the landscape, now shifting focus to the figure within it. By integrating clay with found metal artifacts, she examines the co-evolution of the landscape and its inhabitants, crafting a dialogue between material, experience and place.

title: July School Holiday at Orange City Centre
description:
Hello, it's time to enjoy school holiday fun at the Orange City Centre. 

Get ready for some teddy bear magic!  Stufflers will be set up outside Big W, ready to help your little ones create their very own cuddly friend!

Choose your bear, help stuff it, and make memories these school holidays with this hands-on, heartwarming activity. Perfect for kids (and kids at heart)!

Mark your calendar and don't miss out!

There is plenty to do, see you at the Orange City Centre!

title: Orange FOOD Week - Forage
description:
Embark on a magnificent 4.1-kilometre stroll through some of Orange’s most picturesque vineyards, taking in breath taking views of the rolling landscape all the way to Mount Canobolas.

Along the way, enjoy a specially curated nine-course degustation menu, featuring local wines and tasting plates that showcase the best of the region’s produce. Live music will set the tone as you relax and indulge in the flavours of Orange.

You’ll be guided by knowledgeable locals, ready to share insights about the unique cool-climate region and its renowned vineyards. It’s a perfect blend of nature, food, wine, and local expertise.

Tickets include transport to and from the event site, departing from and returning to the centre of Orange.

Forage is proudly sponsored by the NSW Department of Primary Industries and Regional Development (NSW DPIRD).

This event is for adults 18 years and over only, with the exception of children under age 1 not yet mobile and in a baby carrier.
host: FOOD OF ORANGE DISTRICT WEEK INCORPORATED

title: Night Market - Orange Wine Festival
description:
Kick off the Orange Wine Festival with locals winemakers and producers of the Orange region as they proudly present their award-winning cool climate wines. 

Joined by the regions talented Chefs and cooks showcasing the rich provenance of local produce, meander through the park under the canopy of Robertson Park tasting the region's best food and wine.

Relax and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere with sounds from local musicians, surrounded by family and friends at long communal tables. It's an occasion designed for everyone to gather and indulge in the region's best offerings.

This event is proudly sponsored by Orange Cellars. 

Tickets on sale end July.

title: Orange FOOD Week - Night Market
description:
Start your Orange FOOD Week experience at the ever-popular Night Market; an evening that brings together the best of the region’s food and wine beneath festoon lights and the autumn canopy of Robertson Park.

Stroll through nearly 50 vibrant stalls, featuring award-winning food from local chefs, cooks, and caterers, alongside cool-climate wines, ciders, spirits, and craft beers from the region’s talented winemakers, brewers, and distillers.

Conveniently located in the heart of Orange, the Night Market offers a lively atmosphere filled with delicious food, refreshing drinks, and live music. Whether you're sampling local delicacies, sharing a meal with friends and family, or simply enjoying the community spirit, this fun-filled evening is perfect for everyone.

title: Orange FOOD Week - Sunday Producers Market and Brunch
description:
Join the final festivity for FOOD Week 2026! Come along to one of Orange's most spectacular settings in Cook Park to enjoy brunch prepared by well-known cooks and producers. Stroll the market to meet and greet with the producers' taste and purchase their local produce to take home.

Visit the FOOD head quarters tent and grab your lucky tickets to the Producers Hamper raffle – drawn at 11.00am.

title: Orange FOOD Week - Shine the Light on Producers
description:
A handpicked series of show, tell and taste workshops that highlight the iconic flavours of the region’s produce. Local producers alongside local chefs and cooks create food conversations and share their stories, tips, tricks and samples.

Learn about the produce, hear the stories, share recipes, and taste delicious samples. ​Enjoy a glass of local cool-climate Orange wine for the perfect finish to the morning and take the opportunity to purchase the produce to take home.

title: On The Move
description:
Journey into an interactive world of transport in this new children's exhibition at Orange Regional Museum.

Design your own dream vehicle out of LEGO®, test your skills flying paper planes, and find out how transport has changed over time, with plenty of amazing facts to learn along the way!

For ages 3–8.

On The Move is a travelling exhibition from Museums of History NSW. 
In collaboration with James Gulliver Hancock.

title: Creative Collections Showcase
description:
In January 2025, Orange Regional Museum selected three NSW-based artists to develop a creative response to objects from the collection.

Hear from Liss Finney, Laura Baker and Elaine Camlin about the objects they selected, their creative process and see the final product.

At this event, they will consider collections, local history and memory and how creative responses to historic objects can breathe new life into them.

title: Orange Regional Museum - Inherit: old and new histories
description:
The Inherit: old and new histories bring together both familiar and less well-known stories from across the Central West. 

Exploring the region’s history, the exhibition highlights big events and significant personalities, as well as the lives and experiences of everyday people. 

Told through more than 100 objects, these are the stories that have shaped the region's past and present.

title: Travelling Film Festival Orange
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Orange! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, Berlin and Sydney Film Festival at Odeon 5 Cinema. 

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Enjoy the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle with featured contender Toby Wilson in attendance in Orange, plus the Berlinale Silver Bear winner The Blue Trail, Cannes Grand Jury winner Sentimental Value and much more!

The festival weekend will also screen six more acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: 9 x 5
description:
This 9 x 5 exhibition features the work of six local artists and landscape painters.

Though modest in scale, the work captures a sweeping sense of place, evoking the rhythms of light, terrain, and atmosphere. Created in direct observation through en plein air and memory, the artists work within the constraints of a uniform scale.

The compact dimensions reference the tradition of the 1889 Australian 9 by 5 Impression Exhibition, where artists embraced the size of a cigarette box lid to capture fleeting impressions of the natural world.

These paintings find the essence of what is felt rather than seen in the landscape.

title: Winter Salon Exhibition
description:
Discover the Winter Salon Exhibition - a curated showcase of original artworks and handmade pieces by talented artists from across Australia. 

Held in Orange, NSW, this vibrant group show brings together painting, ceramics, sculpture, and artisan wares, celebrating the diversity and craftsmanship of contemporary Australian creatives.

title: Mini Series Art Prize and Exhibition Opening
description:
Join the Corner Store Galler in Orange for a special evening to unveil the winner of the 2025 Mini Series Art Prize.

Artists from across Australia are invited to submit a cohesive three-piece series in any medium (excluding video), to be judged by a panel of esteemed industry professionals.

The winning artist will be awarded a solo exhibition at The Corner Store Gallery in 2026. Two Highly Commended artists will each receive an online exhibition next year and an invitation to join the gallery's represented stable of artists.

Open to both emerging and established artists who have not previously held a solo show at the gallery or been a Mini Series finalist, the exhibition promises to showcase some of the most original and exciting series works from around the country.

Selected entries will be on display from 6–17 August 2025, with the winner announced on Opening Night Friday 8 August as part of the Orange Region Fire Festival.

title: July Salon Exhibition
description:
Explore a thoughtfully curated collection of Australian art and handmade wares in Orange, NSW, showcasing the work of skilled artists and makers from across the country. This unique exhibition celebrates the beauty of Australian craftsmanship, blending fine art, ceramics, sculpture, and artisan goods into one inspiring space.

Visit the gallery in Orange, NSW, to shop in person throughout the year, or browse our full collection online to discover one-of-a-kind Australian-made treasures.

They welcome new arrivals every week from our established community of artists. Their complete range of wall art, handcrafted ceramics, and contemporary sculptures is available to view and purchase through our online store—bringing authentic Australian art to homes across the country.

title: Whitney's Restaurant & Bar ~ Happy Hour
description:
Whitney's proudly support over 90% local wines all to enjoy in their casual lounge with a warm open fireplace. Whether it is a glass of bubbles or an expertly made cocktail you are after, they have you covered.

Whitney's has been awarded the NSW Sommelier's Wine List Awards 2022-NSW President's Award for Outstanding Support for the NSW Wine Industry, AGFG Readers' Choice for Regional Central NSW Winner 2022, and Australia Wine List of The Year Award Two glasses!

Best way to end your working day!

title: Gnoo Blas Classic Show
description:
The Gnoo Blas Classic is an annual three-day event to be held on the second weekend in Orange for enthusiasts and like-minded supporters of Classic Vehicle of all makes and models.

The Gnoo Blas Classic event keeps alive the history of the original racing track that featured world champion drivers Jack Brabham and Alex Meldrum to name a few from 1953 until1961. 

Day 1-Commences with a street parade in the Main Street of Orange and a visit to a winery for a meet and greet of show entrants. Following the Show, there is a Dinner that is held at Orange Ex-Services Club. Special guests for 2025 include Ray Berghouse, Publisher - Colin Bond - Motor Racing Driver - Wil Hagan - Motorsport commentator.

Day-2 Classic Vehicle event is held within the site of the original racetrack. at Sir Jack Brabham Park.

Day 3- An organised Drive of classic vehicles around the Orange region. Drive ends up at Waratahs Sports Club where pre-ordered meals are enjoyed in the club, and the vehicles are displayed in the car park.

title: Cowra Community New Years Eve Beach Party
description:
The Cowra Community New Year's Eve Beach Party and Fireworks Spectacular is an annual event, eagerly anticipated by the Cowra community. 

Featuring crowd favourites such as Jumping Castles, a Mud Pit, Dunking Pool, Sandpit and Live Music, this is an event not to be missed! 

Enjoy a family-friendly evening, bring a picnic or spoil the family with a night off cooking and enjoy a scrumptious takeaway from the food vendors onsite.

title: The Cootamundra Cup
description:
The Cootamundra Cup, hosted by the Cootamundra Turf Club, is a 1600 metre race held at Cootamundra Racecourse in New South Wales each year. 

The Annual Cootamundra Cup meeting boasts a  Full TAB and bookmakers.

 Fashions on the Field is a highlight and hotly contested.

Bar and food are available through out the day.

The Cootamundra Cup is always a great day for horse racing and socialising.

title: Cowra Parkrun
description:
A free, fun, and friendly weekly five-kilometre community event on beautiful Wiradjuri Country. Walk, jog, run, volunteer or spectate – it's up to you!

The course is 5000m long. This has been accurately measured by us with a professional measuring wheel. The course is at the Cowra Breakout Cycleway and Walking path, Corner of Evans Street and Sakura Avenue, Cowra. The course is run entirely on concrete paths. Some sections of the course may accumulate mud, leaves and puddles after rain. Depending on availability, marshals will be at key sections of the course, or signs will be in place. 

The parkrun is free to enter, but please register before you come along. Only ever register with parkrun once, and don't forget to bring a scannable copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't be given a time. 

Every week, grab a post-parkrun coffee in the Rose Garden Coffee House- next to the Cowra Visitor Information Centre.

title: The Bushwackers | Hats Off To Country Festival
description:
The Bushwackers, Australia's most beloved folk and country band, are set to ignite the Wests Blazes stage with another standout performance this July. 

With a resurgence in popularity after their sensational run on The Voice Australia in 2023, The Bushwackers, led by the dynamic Dobe Newton and Roger Corbett, have become synonymous with the heart and soul of Australian music.

With tunes drawn from the shearing sheds in the bush and original songs such as ‘I Am Australian’ and ‘Beneath The Southern Cross’ to ‘Friend For Life’ and ‘Another Trip to Bunnings’, their foot-stomping music and heartfelt lyrics have united generations, celebrating Australia’s cultural heritage.

The Bushwackers have won three Golden Guitar Awards, created 26 studio albums, been inducted into the Australasian Country Music Roll of Renown and in 2024, won the Contribution to Folk Music Award at the Folk Alliance Australia Awards. They continue to sell out shows and attract fans spanning multiple generations.

The Bushwackers' legendary performances promise an unforgettable experience at Wests Blazes during the Hats Off to Country Festival, where they’ll be bringing all the humour, stories and music which has made The Bushwackers perennial festival favourites, and will create an afternoon to remember.

All Ages.

title: Killer Queen Experience - Club Cowra
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Ladysmith Tourist Railway
description:
Ladysmith Tourist Railway was formed in 1995 to restore the Ladysmith Railway Station precinct to its former glory and reopen parts of the Wagga to Tumbarumba as a tourist attraction.

Special displays and exhibits have been set up in the precinct with many items on loan from Transport NSW including an Edmonston ticket punch machine, electric staff machines, document draws and a safe.

All the vehicles operating have been restored by Ladysmith Tourist Railway.

Ladysmith is one of the few stations remaining on the old line. Visit their heritage station and museum, with trikes on display and available for rides on the second Saturday of each month from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Groups and school excursions on request.

title: Hats Off to Country Music Festival
description:
Hats Off to Country Music Festival is a cool mid-year festival in the region of Tamworth. Venues in the region welcome you to four days of country music.

The Hats Off festival complements the annual Tamworth Country Music Festival offering cooler temperatures, a hub for singer-songwriters, and a haven for good times. In 2017, the addition of the Cowboy Crawl was introduced as a fun and safe way to see up to five artists across multiple venues in one evening. 

Hats Off features mostly free events with a handful of ticketed shows. Numerous Golden Guitar winners participate as well as individual singer-songwriters and members of the Tamworth Songwriters' Association, a song writing retreat, the CMAA Junior Academy, the Australian Bush Balladeers' Association's Bronze Bust fundraiser, the annual Dare 2 Dance Line Dance Social, the Capital Country Music Association's tribute concert, and dozens of events and activities throughout Country Music Capital and the surrounding region.

title: Travelling Film Festival Tamworth
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Tamworth! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, and Sydney Film Festival at Forum 6 Cinemas.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Plus the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle, the hilarious indie hit Racewalkers, Cannes Camera d'Or winner from Iraq The President's Cake and much more!

The festival weekend will screen nine acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Tamworth
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Tamworth Community Saturday Markets
description:
Tamworth Community Saturday Markets (TCSM) is a not-for-profit organisation.

Their mission is to add value to the Tamworth community by offering a space to connect people to producers and suppliers who are offering a range of products that are locally produced, seasonal, ethical, fresh, handmade, repurposed and/or that little bit different.

title: Toyota Country Music Festival Tamworth
description:
Proudly supporting and nurturing Australian country music talent, the Toyota Country Music Festival Tamworth is an ungated event of ticketed and free shows rated in the top 10 in the world.

The pinnacle event of the festival is the Golden Guitars - the Country Music Awards of Australia, held on the second Saturday of the festival where the who's who of Australian country music gathers with country music fans to see who will win a coveted Golden Guitar Award. 

Visit FanZone to get up and personal with some of the country's favourite stars, or Family Zone where the kids will have the time of their lives with rides and attractions. Experience Toyota Zone for one of the famous festival straw hats, listen to buskers, or browse stalls throughout the Central Business District.

Toyota Country Music Festival Tamworth - it doesn't get better than this!

title: Australiana - The Sky is the Limit Exhibition at Burrangong Gallery
description:
Embrace the local environment through the Artists' view at the Australiana Landscape Art and Photography Exhibition at the Young Visitor Information Centre.  

Exhibiting a diverse array of subject matter including native flora and fauna, natural bushland and expansive landscapes captured through the artists' practice with Art and Photography. The possibilities are endless under the vast skies captured by the Burrangong Gallery members.

Various items are for sale and would make a perfect gift.

title: The 75th National Cherry Festival
description:
The National Cherry Festival in Young is a celebration of the town's rich history and its title as the Cherry Capital of Australia, set within the stunning Hilltops Region. In 2025, the festival marks its 75th anniversary, making it an extra special occasion.

Held over three exciting days during the first weekend of December, the festival brings the town to life with cherry orchards at their peak and streets buzzing with excitement. It honours the deep-rooted connection between Young and its cherry-growing heritage, which spans over 150 years.

Visitors can enjoy the taste of cherry pies, the sounds of live music, vibrant markets, and the chance to pick fresh cherries straight from the orchards. The festival also features thrilling amusement rides and a range of fringe events, adding to the excitement and fun for all ages. The National Cherry Festival is not only a celebration of the iconic fruit but also of the community that makes Young and the Hilltops Region so unique.

Whether a long-time local or a first-time visitor, all are invited to join in this milestone celebration and experience its rich history, the freshest cherries in Australia, and a weekend full of fun for the whole family.

Visit the National Cherry Festival website for further information.

title: Tamworth Vibe Festival
description: Tamworth Vibe Festival is a vibrant celebration of creativity, cultural heritage, and community spirit. Held across iconic Tamworth venues, the program features visual art showcases, Indigenous and multicultural music performances, interactive craft workshops, and thought-provoking panel discussions. Visitors can explore hands-on experiences such as weaving, dot painting, and wood carving, guided by skilled artisans and cultural mentors. A dynamic cultural marketplace offers regional food and handmade crafts, supporting local creators and enriching the visitor experience. This multi-day event fosters cross-cultural dialogue, encourages artistic innovation, and strengthens community connection through immersive, educational, and entertaining programming.

title: Lions Community Market
description:
Held on the fifth Saturday of the month at Anderson Park, with a wide variety of local fresh produce and diverse stallholders.

Stalls galore at the Lions Community Markets hosted by the Lions Club of Young.   At their Markets, you can find handmade crafts, plants, art, jewellery, vintage treasures, homewares, gift ideas and much more.  Along with delicious food and drinks, you will find the Lions' delicious barbecue, coffee cart and home-baked goods.  Kids will enjoy the face painting while you enjoy the live music and fresh air.  

The Markets are a great place to meet up with family or friends. You can browse the stalls while enjoying a coffee, cake or a sausage sandwich.

title: Hilltops Off the Beaten Track
description:
Discover the vibrant heart of regional creativity during the Hilltops Off The Beaten Track Arts and Cultural Trail. Held over nine days in March, this immersive event invites you to explore artist studios, galleries, exhibitions, and cultural spaces scattered throughout the picturesque Hilltops region of New South Wales — including Young, Boorowa, Harden-Murrumburrah, and surrounding villages.

Meet local artists, makers, and performers in their creative spaces, see behind the scenes of working studios, and enjoy pop-up exhibitions, workshops, live performances, and local hospitality along the way. Whether you're a seasoned art lover or a curious traveller, the trail offers a unique way to connect with the people, stories, and landscapes that shape this creative region.

title: Coota Beach Volleyball
description:
Get ready for an epic weekend of sand, sport, and community spirit! Every February  (third weekend) Cootamundra transforms into an inland beach for the Coota Beach Volleyball Carnival. 

With 10 courts and over 900 tonnes of sand in the heart of town, this event brings together players of all levels for thrilling matches, fun activities, and a vibrant festival atmosphere.

Whether you're competing, cheering from the sidelines, or just soaking up the beach vibes, there’s something for everyone. Plus, with local businesses getting involved, great food, and live entertainment, it’s more than just volleyball—it’s a celebration of Coota’s community spirit.

Don’t miss out—dig, set, and spike your way to an unforgettable weekend!

title: Wattle Time Festival Of Lights
description:
Get ready to experience Cootamundra like never before at the Wattle Time Festival of Lights, a magical celebration that brings the heart of our town to life with colour, creativity and community spirit!

This vibrant event will transform Parker Street into a glowing wonderland, filled with dazzling light installations, live entertainment, market stalls and food vendors offering a feast of local flavours.

The Wattle Time  Festival of Lights will be a highlight of the Wattle time season – a time when the region bursts into bloom with golden wattles, symbolising renewal and connection. As night falls, the event will come alive amongst the fairy-lit trees of Parker Street, creating a truly enchanting setting for an unforgettable evening.

Enjoy the sounds of live music floating through the air, browse through handcrafted wares and delicious treats at the market stalls, or simply soak up the festive atmosphere with family and friends. Kids will love the fun activities and interactive displays, while adults can indulge in gourmet bites and enjoy the buzzing vibe of our community coming together.
