Whether you're a local or visiting for the weekend, the Wattle Time Festival of Lights is an unmissable night of joy, inspiration, and celebration in the heart of Cootamundra.

title: Cootamundra Sunday Markets
description:
Experience the charm of the Cootamundra Sunday Markets, held on the second Sunday each month (excluding July) at Fisher Park. 

Organised by the Cootamundra Girl Guides, these vibrant markets feature handmade crafts, fresh produce, plants, clothing, and more. 

Enjoy a hearty breakfast from the Cootamundra CanAssist BBQ while supporting local creators.

title: Lebanese Feast at Banksia Orange
description: A monthly pop-up restaurant night at Orange's new premiere event space, Banksia Orange, featuring a lavish shared-style feast inspired by the Lebanese culture and cuisine, and curated by Union Bank and Banksia Orange executive chef Dom Aboud.

title: The Poems, Prayers & Promises of John Denver
description:
Multi-award-winning performer Darren Coggan returns to his country roots with "The Poems, Prayers & Promises of John Denver", delivering the vocal authenticity of one of the most passionate performers of all time.

In a personal reflection, Darren respectfully honours the indelible voice behind songs that the whole world sang along with, such universal anthems as Take Me Home Country Roads, Rocky Mountain High, Annie's Song, Perhaps Love, Thank God I'm A Country Boy, Calypso, Leaving On A Jet Plane and many more. 

Re-live the voice of a generation, in a celebration of one of the most inspiring and prolific singer-songwriters of our time, remarkably re-created live, by Darren Coggan.

title: AgriTourism Summit
description: The highly anticipated AgriTourism Summit will be hosted in Orange this year, one of the most dynamic regions in Australia for agri-tourism. This year's event promises to be bigger and better than ever, thanks to the generous sponsorship and support from Destination New South Wales who are fully invested in regional tourism and Orange City Council. The event will also feature an exciting addition to the program with famils (familiarisation tours) on Day 2, allowing attendees to walk through top local tourism hot spots and gain invaluable insights directly from the people who manage and operate them.

title: PBR Monster Energy Tour Tamworth Iron Cowboy
description:
A sport like no other. A showdown of the greatest. Heart-stopping action. It’s man vs. beast, where every second matters. 
 
The biggest names in Australian bull riding go head-to-head in a new season of Professional Bull Riders, delivering a competition like no other. Join us for an unmatched entertainment experience at the PBR Monster Energy Tamworth Iron Cowboy  at AELEC Arena. 
 
Buckle up for the toughest eight seconds in sports—It's bull time!

title: Jindera Lantern Festival
description:
Celebrate Jindera's German heritage by participating in a traditional German Lantern Festival. 

Children and adults create paper lanterns, participate in a 'der Laternenumzug' lantern procession and are entertained with burning effigies. There will be music to lead the procession, culminating in the Village Green with a presentation of burning figures, twirling poi and a rendition from the Australian Choir. German food and beverages will be available at the Village Green.

Lantern-making workshops will be available before the Lantern festival so that all will be able to walk with a lantern at the festival.

Following the Parade, adults can enjoy the Museum's Wine Bar. There they can enjoy a range of food and a selection of cocktails, mulled wine and other beverages. The atmosphere will be enhanced with the open fire and our local musician.
host: Jindera Pioneer Museum & Historical Society Inc.

title: Cootamundra Show
description:
The Cootamundra Show is an annual event that captures the vibrant community spirit of Cootamundra and showcases the region’s agricultural heritage and local talents. It is held at the Cootamundra Showground and offers a wide range of activities and attractions suitable for all ages.

Livestock Exhibitions: Farmers from the area exhibit a variety of livestock, such as cattle, sheep, and poultry.

Equestrian Events: Riders participate in show jumping, dressage, and various equestrian challenges.

Agricultural Competitions: Categories often include the best produce, flower arrangements, and homemade goods, reflecting the agricultural richness of the area.

Show Rides and Games: A family-friendly midway with carnival rides and games adds excitement, especially for children and teenagers.

Food and Craft Stalls: Visitors can enjoy an array of local foods, homemade treats, and handcrafted goods from regional artisans and food vendors.

Entertainment: The show features live music, performances by local talent, and sometimes more unique acts such as magic shows or dog demonstrations.

Wood Chopping and Tractor Pulls: Traditional rural sports like wood chopping and tractor pulling contests draw enthusiastic spectators and celebrate the town’s roots.

Fireworks Display: The evening often culminates in a vibrant fireworks show, a favourite way to close the event with excitement and colour.

title: The Yoga Circle at the Chinese Tribute Gardens
description:
A friendly, accessible yoga class designed to support balance in body, mind, and spirit; enhanced by the healing presence of nature.

Led by experienced Dru and Hatha Yoga teachers, this 90-minute practice includes gentle warm-ups, postures, flowing sequences, deep relaxation, and meditation.

Motivations are provided for all levels.
Please bring your own mat and props.
New students, please call ahead in case of weather or other related changes.

title: Hill End Analogue
description:
Hill End Analogue is an analogue photographic art festival by the Hill End Arts Council Inc in the Central West NSW village of Hill End.

It will showcase, celebrate and connect Contemporary analogue photographic artists from regional, rural, remote and metropolitan Australia.

Comprising exhibitions and workshops, the festival will promote community awareness, appreciation and engagement in analogue photography.

It will serve as a discussion about the past, present and future of analogue arts.

title: New England Spring Garden Trail – Guyra Gardens
description:
Following the very successful 2024 New England Spring Garden Trail, organised by the New England Garden Festival team, this is their third traverse of the New England region. 

The Trail travels across beautiful countryside in six days, opening approximately 15 cool climate private gardens to visitors. The Trail begins in Tenterfield and then journeys to Glen Innes and Guyra, followed by the Armidale two-day New England Garden Festival before finishing in Uralla. 

Each town will open their three gardens. Visitors are encouraged to stay in each town the night before to make the most of the gardens' opening hours. 

After the gardens close, take the opportunity to admire and photograph the stunning natural highlights and explore the town's must-visit local spots before heading to the next town.

Over six days, immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of the New England in spring—truly a delight for gardening inspiration or a relaxing break from a busy life! 

Specific garden details will be published on their website closer to the event.

title: Wine & Warmth: An Evening At Mayfield Vineyard
description:
Mayfield are firing up the outdoor oven and uncorking their best drops this Fire Festival.
 
Head out with the whole family for a relaxed afternoon of wine, pizza and live music from Central West favourite, Sam Coon.

title: Woodstock Memorial Show
description:
The Woodstock Memorial Show  is held annually on the first Sunday in September, the first day of spring, Fathers Day. The Show was instigated in 1946 initially as a gymkhana with the sole purpose of raising funds to support the ongoing maintenance of the Woodstock Soldiers Memorial Hall, to this day this remains just one of the objectives of the annual event.

The show encourages the development of pastoral, agricultural, horticultural, viticulture, industrial and cultural pursuits of Woodstock and the surrounding district. The Show provides prizes including cash and trophies.

​The beneficiaries of the annual show include the Woodstock War Memorial Hall. The show also makes numerous donations to the community or other charitable organisations in Woodstock and surrounding districts.

The Show also provides the opportunity for community groups to raise funds through activities on Show Day.  The success of the community event has been recently recognized by Agricultural Societies Council of New South Wales, with the show receiving the Innovation Award for 2016.

The show is run by the community for the community. It is a great day out for the family. Affordable and Fun!

title: Work with the Winemaker - ChaLou Wines
description:
Participants will have the unique opportunity to shadow winemakers Nadja and Steve, immersing themselves in the daily rhythms of vineyard life. 

The day begins with a hands-on vineyard experience—grape picking, touring the property, and gaining insight into the season's operations. 

Guests will pause to enjoy a vintage lunch with the team, savoring a harvest spread that brings everyone together. The afternoon shifts to the winery, where participants will take part in punch downs and sample wines in progress, getting a firsthand look at the craft behind each bottle. 

The day winds down with a well-earned refreshing drink—whether a beer or a glass of Skinny—offering a perfect toast to an unforgettable experience. 

Included in the day are various wine tastings, a generous harvest meal, and the camaraderie of the ChaLou team. Be sure to bring your work boots and a readiness to get hands-on!

title: End of Vintage Feast
description:
Nadja and Steve are passionate about sharing their love for winemaking and showing you what makes ChaLou Wines so special.

Each year, at the end of Vintage, you have the opportunity to join them for an unforgettable evening at ChaLou Wines.

Gather around the table for a five-course, family-style feast that celebrates the season's hard work and the incredible community that supported it.

Think vibrant, delicious plates—crafted to transform into a feast to remember. And of course, ChaLou Wines, included in your ticket, will be perfectly paired to complement each dish.

title: Duval Dam Buster Trail Run
description:
The Duval Dam Buster Trail Run is a trail running event held in the beautiful Mt Duval and Dumaresq Dam areas near Armidale, in the NSW New England High Country. 

A distance for everyone - a 3 kilometres family/kids run/walk, 8 kilometres, 16 kilometres , 32 kilometres and 50 kilometres ultra.

title: My Own Two Eyes
description:
My Own Two Eyes: People, Places, and Things is a captivating photographic exhibition by digital nomad Robyn Flemming. Through her lens, Robyn captures stunning scenes from her travels across the globe, including Malaysia, Türkiye, Europe, and beyond.

Robyn has been travelling the world since 2010. She is a freelance editor and the author of Skinful: A Memoir of Addiction. She takes photographs to record the different things she sees and to see familiar things differently. She has made a home base on a crocodile-infested river in the Malaysian state of Sarawak on the island of Borneo.

title: Kiewa Street Market
description:
The Rotary Kiewa Street Community Market is a joint venture between the Rotary Club of Albury North and the Rotary Club of Belvoir Wodonga.

The market is held every Sunday. Stalls are situated on the ground floor. Pedestrian access is available from Kiewa Street and Hume Street. All sites are wheelchair accessible. Smoking is not permitted on the ground floor or upper floors of the parking structure.

Almost anything can be purchased at the market from worm farms to woollen socks, flowers to fishing tackle, and pottery to fresh produce. Entry is by gold coin donation with all proceeds from these donations as well as site fees collected going towards local and international Rotary projects.

Visit the website to find information on hosting a stall including costs, conditions, and contact detail.

title: Yinarr Journey
description:
Yinarr Journey is the art journey of Patricia Cerminara a Gamilaroi woman, who has discovered that art can help heal the connection between culture, people and Country. 

Over the years Trish has used many art forms to tell her ancestors stories and has found that art forms like weaving can help thread back together the links to Country that were broken by colonisation. Come along with Trish on her Yinarr Journey.

title: Birds Eye View: Images from the AlburyCity Collection
description:
The Birds Eye View: Images from the AlburyCity Collection exhibition showcases photographs captured from the iconic Monument Hill.

Go beyond the familiar landscapes and discover hidden details, and breathtaking vistas, from this beloved landmark. This exhibition offers a unique journey through Albury's history and beauty, all seen from a truly elevated perspective.

title: Millthorpe Fire Fair
description:
The historic village of Millthorpe comes alive each year for the opening night of the Orange Region Fire Festival. Held along the main street of Millthorpe under ambient festoon lights and a star-lit sky, this is an annual event event for all ages.

Sample delights from local food producers, wineries, brewers and Millthorpe's local businesses, all while soaking up this historic town's beautiful village atmosphere. Bring your winter woollies and cosy up by one of the many fire pits lining the street. Good vibes are guaranteed with live music, marshmallow roasting, kids activities, late-night boutique shopping and more.

title: Jimeoin - Pandemonium - Albury
description: A Stalwart of Australian comedy and all-round likeable rogue, comedian Jimeoin happily imparts his clever and quirky observations on everyday suburban life in his trademark devil-may-care style.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Albury
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  
Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   
It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Mirusia 'Celebration' Tour
description:
Performing your favourite classical songs and arias in a very special concert.

From a young age, Mirusia knew she was destined to sing and entertain and share her passion for music. Her journey to international stardom began when she was discovered by the legendary André Rieu, with whom she toured the world for over a decade, captivating audiences of hundreds of thousands with her breathtaking performances.

Now, with 12 critically acclaimed and chart-topping albums and a flourishing solo career, Mirusia has become a global star in her own right. This milestone 40th year is more than just a birthday—it's a celebration of an extraordinary career filled with unforgettable moments and music that has touched the hearts of fans worldwide.

Get ready for a sparkling celebration as Mirusia takes you on a journey through her illustrious musical life. With iconic songs, heartwarming stories and her signature grace and passion, she will perform the songs that have defined her career, from classical masterpieces to beloved contemporary favourites.

Don't miss this once-in-a-lifetime event that honours her incredible legacy, while offering a glimpse into the exciting future still ahead!

"The Angel of Australia" – Andre Rieu

"A once in a generation voice" – David Prior, ABC Radio

"Australia's Songbird" – Denis Walter, 3AW

Youngest Winner of the Dame Joan Sutherland Opera Award.

title: The Traveling Wilburys Collection - Albury
description:
Harrison. Petty. Orbison. Dylan. Lynne.

The Traveling Wilburys. Four years, two mega albums, a slew of hits, and a Grammy.

But the one thing they never did was tour. That is... until now.

The Traveling Wilburys Collection bring together the collective talents, excitement, and magic that the original had to offer. 

Live, on stage, like never before.

Featuring all the hits of the Traveling Wilburys plus the classics from each individual artist – Harrison, The Beatles, Petty, The Heartbreakers, Lynne, ELO, Orbison, and Dylan.

Join a night of fun, nostalgia, and unforgettable hits!

title: Sketch Club
description:
Murray Art Museum Albury (MAMA) invites you to join a fun monthly drop-in sketching session for drawing enthusiasts of all skill levels. 

Held in different galleries every month, you'll be guided to sketch your response to an artwork, study an artist’s technique, illustrate an architectural detail, or be left free to hone your general drawing skills.

The positive psychological impacts of sketching are widely known; even doodling has been shown to improve analytic and problem solving abilities, reduce stress, enhance mood, improve your communication range and boost self-esteem. If you are curious about drawing and are yet to try it for yourself, then this is the perfect introduction and encouragement!

There is a brief introduction to the exhibition and share relevant drawing approaches for context and consideration, before commencing a 45-minute sketching session.

title: Marley Dawson: Fizzy Drinks / Material Links
description:
The popular MAMA Kids Gallery welcomes its fourth artist commission – Fizzy Drinks / Material Links by artist Marley Dawson.

The new space, designed specifically for young people, playfully combines materials like brass, aluminium, glass and stone that the artist has used throughout his career. Other components refer both to Dawson’s artistic palette and his childhood spent in Albury. There are bowling balls, gym crash mats, and significantly, a 10,000-year-old section of river red gum salvaged from sand quarries on the Albury Wodonga causeway.

Combined in a steel structure resembling a 1980s jungle gym, the pieces form a time capsule of an artist’s life and work - the “material links” that have connected his work for years are presented with the “fizzy drinks” excitement of a children’s playground.

About the Artist

Using chemistry, mechanics and construction techniques, Marley Dawson creates sculptures and installations that highlight aspects of our world and selves that can be uncanny, surreal and extraordinary. Canberra-based, Albury-raised, Dawson has been exhibiting extensively for over a decade in Australia and internationally.

title: The Mik Maks Live at SS&A Albury
description:
The multi award-winning family band and YouTube stars, The Mik Maks are coming back to the SS&A these July School Holidays!

Join Al and Joel, Joel's daughter Ava and loveable friend Drums the Panda for a 50-minute musical extravaganza that's perfect for children aged 2-8 years.

This stand-alone performance will be a unique blend of Mik Mak classics and new songs. Don't miss your chance to dance, giggle and meet The Mik Maks at the SS&A!

Following the performance, Social Dining will be hosting a Family Fun Daywhere kids can get their face painted and take home a balloon animal!

title: Car and Bike Show
description: Community event bringing lovers of cars and bikes together for a chance to win a prize in the event at the SS&A Car and Bike Show.

title: Washpool World Heritage Trails
description:
The 16th running of the Washpool World Heritage Trail Race is at the Washpool and Gibraltar Range National Parks in New South Wales.

The Washpool and Gibraltar Range National Parks have incredible variety, from world heritage-listed rainforests to clear rivers flowing through flowering high country heathlands, dramatic granite outcrops and wild river gorges. 

The area also features an extensive network of well-formed trails to make it ideal for trail running and great natural campsites.

The event boasts a stunning 50-kilometre trail run on Saturday and a 9-kilometre, 25-kilometre trail run on the Sunday.

title: Winter Race Day - Albury Racing Club
description:
Come and enjoy an afternoon of local races at Albury Racing Club!

With seven races set to run throughout the afternoon, with the first race to start at approximately 1pm.

Pick a spot on the grandstand to watch the live action of the horse races.

Food and Beverages available to purchase. 

General admission is free for this Race Day.

See their socials or website for updated times on races and more information.

title: Tyalgum Music Festival
description:
Three days of music will fill the tiny village of Tyalgum at the Tyalgum Music Festival. 

Mozart's Opera The Magic Flute, The Lark Ascending and Peter and the Wolf, The View From Madeline's Couch, The Australian Haydn Ensemble, Alex Raineri, Karin Schauup and the Riverside Guitar Ensemble and Richard Narroway.

title: NSW Senior Open Championship
description:
Visit Thurgoona Country Club Resort - a spectacular 18-hole championship course located in the popular regional town of Albury.

W﻿atch some of the most legendary names in Australian golf compete for the title of 2025 NSW Senior Open Champion, including Matt Goggin, Peter Lonard, Peter Senior, Mike Harwood, Peter O'Malley and more!

Free parking is available at the course, and the modern clubhouse has many dining options, including a bistro, coffee shop, and bar.

title: New England Spring Garden Trail – Uralla Gardens
description:
Following the very successful 2024 New England Spring Garden Trail, organised by the New England Garden Festival team, this is their third traverse of the New England region. 

The Trail travels across beautiful countryside in six days, opening approximately 15 cool climate private gardens to visitors. The Trail begins in Tenterfield and then journeys to Glen Innes and Guyra, followed by the Armidale two-day New England Garden Festival before finishing in Uralla. 

Each town will open their three gardens. Visitors are encouraged to stay in each town the night before to make the most of the gardens' opening hours. 

After the gardens close, take the opportunity to admire and photograph the stunning  natural highlights and explore the town's must-visit local spots before heading to the next town.

Over six days, immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of the New England in spring—truly a delight for gardening inspiration or a relaxing break from a busy life! 

Specific garden details will be published on their website closer to the event.

title: Seasons of New England Expo
description:
The Seasons of New England Creators, Makers and Producers Expo is doubling up for 2026, connecting you with over 160 makers, creators and producers from right across the New England, across two very different days.  

If it's made in New England, this is the place to find it! The Expo brings together over 160 businesses from right across New England for just one weekend, to give you a taste of what the region has to offer and entice you to return again and again to keep discovering it all.

With the New England area increasingly becoming known as a gourmet's paradise, the Seasons Expo is fully licensed and brings together the region's wineries, distilleries and breweries as well as some very talented growers and foodies.

With an already established reputation for the Arts, particularly in the event's hometown Uralla, the event is filled with talented makers and creators of beautiful products to discover for the home, garden and the family.

Musicians from across the region also come together to create a great atmosphere.  So much more than a market, the Seasons Expo is a great way to discover and celebrate the little towns and the people that make them amazing.

title: High Country Markets
description:
Explore an impressive collection of local products from freshly brewed coffee and handmade crafts to artisanal cheeses and fresh bread and the High Country Markets held at Uralla Showground. 

Every first Sunday of the month, wander over 30 stalls to find everything from golden honey, fragrant soaps, and homemade jams to stylish clothing, inspiring artwork, fresh fruits, vegetables, and even plants. 

And for a unique local experience, be sure to visit the Poultry Auction starting at 9:30 AM.

title: Winter Markets
description: Enjoy a vibrant market filled with local produce, artisan crafts, and delicious food. Bring your friends and family for a fun-filled day in the heart of Holbrook.

title: Spring Markets
description: Enjoy a vibrant market filled with local produce, artisan crafts, and delicious food. Bring your friends and family for a fun-filled day in the heart of Holbrook.

title: Just a Farmer
description: Just a Farmer is a moving film that tells the story of farmers' challenges, focusing on the importance of mental health in rural communities. It portrays the reality of grief, loss, and resilience, making it a film that resonates deeply with audiences.

title: The Bald Archy Prize
description:
The Bald Archy is an Australian art prize, a parody of the Archibald Prize, an important portraiture award. It usually includes cartoons or humorous works making fun of Australian celebrities. It is judged by Maude, a cockatoo. It was founded by director Peter Batey.

Although created as something of a joke, the Bald Archy Prize has become an icon on the Australian art calendar, particularly because of the absurdist nature of the event, calling for irreverent comic and satirical images of well-known Australians.

title: Peach Blossoms Picnic
description:
Visit Southview Peach Orchard!
 
Come along, bring your family and friends, as well as your own picnic blanket, and enjoy a fun day out witnessing the beauty of the peach blossoms. Pizza and soft drinks will be available to purchase.

Limited to 100 people per date so make sure to get in and secure your place now!

title: Carcoar Running Festival
description:
The Carcoar Cup Running Festival is a grand challenge on the Australian running calendar. 

Held in the first weekend of November in the historic Central West NSW town of Carcoar, the Carcoar Cup is a fantastic weekend for both runners and family. The Carcoar Cup was conceived to bring runners and visitors from all over Australia and overseas to showcase the beauty of Carcoar and the surrounding region.

The Carcoar Cup is run over a course which has been described as one of the toughest and most beautiful in Australia. This is the ultimate family running weekend, with events for all abilities and ages. For a small regional event, the Carcoar Cup prizes are remarkable – but first and foremost, this is the ultimate family event, with adults tackling the longer events and the children their own special Carcoar race.

Regular updates about the event will be posted on the Carcoar Cup Facebook Page.

title: Spring Garden Trail – Armidale Gardens
description:
Following the very successful 2024 New England Spring Garden Trail, organised by the New England Garden Festival team, this is their third traverse of the New England region. 

The Trail travels across beautiful countryside in six days, opening approximately 15 cool climate private gardens to visitors. The Trail begins in Tenterfield and then journeys to Glen Innes and Guyra, followed by the Armidale two-day New England Garden Festival before finishing in Uralla. 

Each town will open their three gardens. Visitors are encouraged to stay in each town the night before to make the most of the gardens' opening hours. 

After the gardens close, take the opportunity to admire and photograph the stunning  natural highlights and explore the town's must-visit local spots before heading to the next town.

Over six days, immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of the New England in spring—truly a delight for gardening inspiration or a relaxing break from a busy life! 

Specific garden details will be published on their website closer to the event.

title: Village Markets Tarcutta
description:
Come and enjoy Tarcutta's monthly markets, featuring a large range of community-led stalls. You will find homegrown products, plants, homewares, jewellery, pre-loved goods, books and much more. 

There is always a barbecue sizzling for those after a sausage sandwich, and various food options from treats to beverages are also available.

title: Harden Murrumburrah Community Markets
description:
Enjoy a day of local delights! Explore a wonderful mix of stalls showcasing handmade goods, fresh produce and unique treasures. You can savour a barista coffee, grab a bite at the BBQ and enjoy music that sets the perfect atmosphere. Whether you're hunting for a special find, supporting local businesses or just soaking in the community spirit — there's something for everyone.

The market is held on the third Sunday, every second month and new stallholders are always welcome. If you have handmade goods, fresh produce, unique treasures or a passion for sharing something special, consider joining this vibrant market community.

Come along, bring the family and make it a market day to remember!

title: Armidale Farmers' Market
description:
The Armidale Farmers' Market occurs on the second Sunday of the month in Curtis Park. Head along to buy fresh, local, seasonal produce, homemade gourmet food, wine and plants. Get a hot cup of organic fair-trade gourmet coffee and catch up with friends, or relax under a shady tree in the park. Find a real bargain and help reduce landfill by buying second-hand treasures at the car boot sale.

The Armidale Farmers' Market is a great outing on a Sunday morning. Come on down and have some fun shopping for seasonal produce or that special bargain.

title: Armidale Sunday Markets in the Mall
description:
Armidale Markets in the Mall are held on the last Sunday of each month with more than 50 different stalls making a regular appearance and live music.

A variety of stalls offering a huge range of quality handmade and handcrafted items, cupcakes, candles, bath and body products, skincare and makeup, handmade clothing, bags, shoes, linen, pottery, woodwork, plants, art, homewares, toys, puppets, stamping and scrap booking plus so much more.

The markets are held in Beardy Street, Armidale and are run by the Armidale PCYC.

title: Armidale Running Festival
description:
The Armidale Running Festival is more than just a race weekend – it's a celebration of community, movement, and everything that makes Armidale special. With events for all ages and abilities, from a 1-kilometre Kids Dash to a half marathon, it invites everyone to get involved and experience the beauty of the high-altitude landscape.

But the festival goes far beyond the track. Held in the heart of town at Civic Park, the event will feature live music, local food, community stalls, and a massive market – the biggest the region has ever seen. With kids' activities, play areas, picnic zones, and space to relax, it's designed as a full-day experience for families, locals, and visitors alike.

The running schedule includes a 1-kilometre free fun run for kids, followed by 3-kilometre, 5-kilometre, and 10-kilometre runs on Saturday, with the half marathon taking place on Sunday. These options offer something for every fitness level and make the weekend inclusive and accessible for all.

This is Armidale on show – welcoming, active, and full of heart.

title: The 20th Harden Kite Festival
description:
The Harden Kite Festival is an affordable, family-friendly annual event held in the beautiful Hilltops Region of NSW, celebrating its 20th year in 2025!

This community event has free activities and entertainment for all ages, such as exciting cultural performances, kite decorating workshops, kids activity alley and a petting zoo.  

Browse the great range of interesting market stalls, enjoy the all-day ride pass for unlimited rides or simply sit in the shade and enjoy the fun.  Bring your own kite or buy one on the day. There will be a variety of tasty food and good coffee available, or feel free to bring your own picnic.

This is an alcohol free event.

Look forward to seeing you there!

title: Arcadia Winds - Australian Wind Music
description:
Arcadia Winds, Australia’s leading wind quintet, takes the stage with a captivating program celebrating the artistry and versatility of wind instruments. Featuring works by Pēteris Vasks, Anne Cawrse, Holly Harrison, Miguel del Aguila, and Valerie Coleman, the concert journeys through vibrant soundscapes, rhythmic innovation, and heartfelt expression.

With their bold approach and exceptional musicianship, Arcadia Winds promises an afternoon filled with energy, creativity, and unforgettable moments.
host: NEW ENGLAND CONSERVATORIUM OF MUSIC LIMITED

title: Trio Isimsiz
description:
Hailed as one of the UK’s most exciting ensembles, this piano trio brings together breathtaking interpretations of classical masterpieces with bold, contemporary works. 

The program includes Schubert’s lyrical and lighthearted Piano Trio No. 1, Brahms’ deeply expressive Piano Trio No. 3, and Francisco Coll’s Piano Trio—a contemporary gem celebrated for its ear-beguiling inventiveness. 

This is chamber music at its finest, blending timeless classics with fresh perspectives, performed by musicians who are redefining the piano trio for a new generation.
host: NEW ENGLAND CONSERVATORIUM OF MUSIC LIMITED

title: The Dinomaniacs - Armidale
description:
Join Shaun and Tara for a fun-filled afternoon with their award-winning kids' show! 

The Dinomaniacs! Fresh off winning two national awards at the 2024 What's On 4 Kids, this show is packed with laughs, music and hands-on dino fun.

Say hello to Trixi the Triceratops, cheeky Tru Blu, Naughty Joffrey, Aussie favourites Ozzi and Oi, and the newest baby dino, Olive the Parasaurolophus.

Perfect for ages 1-8, this interactive experience includes lifelike baby dinosaurs, singing and dancing, Up-close dino encounters and fun photo ops!

title: Plinth Show, Blayney: Bradley Bradley
description:
Showcasing local artist and photographer Bradley Bradley.

He is a self taught artist based in Blayney. His work took a profound turn in 2020. His wife Shelley passed away suddenly from ovarian cancer. In the wake of this loss, he turned to photography as a way to navigate the experience of grief. His work explores the fragile space between memory and presence. 

Arts OutWest's Plinth Show will highlight a different artist, with their work displayed on portable plinths, at a different visitor information centre around the Central West each month for 12 months.

title: Sculptures by the Bush
description:
Sculptures by the Bush is a tourist trail of outdoor creative artworks that will dot the scenic landscapes around Blayney over the April School Holidays every year.

Creative local residents, schools, businesses and community groups create sculptures in one of three categories: Hay Bale Art, Farm Art and Scarecrows.

It is a great opportunity to enjoy the country landscape, visit some of the small villages and see some creative displays.

Locals are called upon to get creative and build sculptures. A digital map and list of entries will be available on the Blayney Shire Council Website and Sculptures by the Bush Facebook Page closer to the event.

title: Black Gully Festival
description:
In its 14th year, this free, family-friendly event celebrates the vibrant spirit of Armidale as the weather warms up. It offers a day filled with music, art, environmental, and community engagement. The festival promises an entertaining experience for attendees of all ages. It is located in the scenic Black Gully Reserve (behind NERAM, on the south side of the creek).

The heart of the festival lies in its live music performances, taking place from 10am to 8pm across three stages. Showcasing the exceptional talent within the region, local bands, soloists, and small groups will captivate audiences with a diverse range of musical styles presented by The Musicians of Armidale.

title: Garage Sale Trail - Blayney
description:
Get ready to shop the everyday essentials you need and the pre-loved gems you want in your neighbourhood.

With thousands of items going up for sale, at more than 30 garage sales, you’re bound to find one-of-a-kind pieces that tell a story and are easy on the budget.

From designer fashion to furniture, cookware, vinyl, kids stuff, tools, collectibles and everything in between, there's a bargain for everyone on the Garage Sale Trail.

Search for sales near you.

title: Steampunk New England
description: The inaugural Steampunk fashion and technology festival for the northern tablelands region centred on Armidale - where electricity was used in public lighting in 1872 - a first for Australia.  But this festival is just as much about the fashion as it technology!!

title: New England Garden Festival - Armidale
description:
The 2025 New England Garden Festival (NEGF) will be held at the Armidale Racecourse, with visitors on the New England Garden Trail also passing through on their way south. 

The big weekend encompasses all those gardening activities that gardeners love to see and do. Stalls, stalls and more stalls with plants, gardening tools and equipment, gardening products, garden sculptures and everything gardeners dream of - and more!

Workshops and demonstrations will be available so gardeners can learn and improve their gardening skills and knowledge. It is a real community event that includes many local organisations.

Stunning private gardens will be open and accessible by car.  And the icing on the cake – live music, food vans and coffee!

title: Popped Up at Kimo Estate
description:
Be sure not to miss this fantastic Christmas boutique market day at Kimo.  

Spend a beautiful day wandering through the gorgeous grounds of Kimo Estate Homestead. With over 90 store holders with art, clothes, garden wares, homewares, flowers, wine, and many more amazing products.

This is not your average market with all stall holders hand-curated for their quality goods.

title: Richmond Valley Cup Race Day
description:
Enjoy all the action at the Casino Racecourse at the 2025 Richmond Valley Cup Race Day.

The five-card meeting will be an exciting event offering a full TAB bar and food facilities. Dress your best and enjoy a day in the field! 

Enjoy a great day of racing and socialising this October.

title: Casino Show
description:
The Casino Show promotes local and interstate producers and exhibitors with an array of events such as cattle judging, horse events and demonstrations, poultry exhibitions, a range of art and crafts, as well as providing a carnival atmosphere with side show alley and market stalls.

Running for over 127 years, the Casino Show is one of the signature events of the Richmond Valley area. It is a grass roots event which embraces the agricultural foundations of the show movement.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Murwillumbah
description:
In 2021, Andrew spent four months in two of Sydney's maximum-security prisons for the supply of psychedelic drugs. He had a great time.

Best Newcomer Nominee – Melbourne International Comedy Festival, 2023

title: Makers & Finders Market Murwillumbah
description:
Found in the heart of eclectic Murwillumbah, this Northern Rivers market brings together local makers, growers, artists, recyclers and vintage collectors into a spacious community park with an adventure playground, to create a vibrant hub of handmade and preloved goodness.

The market is a great place to find local produce, vintage, collectables and pre-loved goods. Take the time to relax in the park, throw a blanket on the grass and and enjoy the live music while the children play in the newly renovated adventure park, go for a skate or play a game of tennis.

Across the street, inside a classic art deco building, you will find the M-Arts Precinct, a place where makers and artisans come together. Discover beautiful handmade objects, chat to resident ceramicists, illustrators and sculptors, see live studio demos and explore the shipping container studios throughout the day.

If you're a lover of all things handmade, vintage and flea then look no further than this northern rivers market. Come along and experience it for yourself.

title: Anh Do - Murwillumbah
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'

Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Bentley Art Prize
description:
The Bentley Art Prize has been held annually at the Bentley Public Hall since 1985. “The Bentley” is a vehicle for emerging artists to showcase their talent to the wider community. All proceeds raised from the event go toward the upkeep of the Bentley Public Hall, a focal point for the Bentley Community.

The Bentley Art Prize is a community event that attracts all ages from surrounding districts, the attraction being the diversity of artwork created locally and from afar. The family-orientated event has grown over the years into a great benefit for the Bentley Community.

title: Painting Life:  Margaret Olley and Works from the Collection
description:
Painting Life: Margaret Olley and Works from the Collection celebrates vibrant still life paintings by Margaret Olley in the Tweed Regional Gallery collection, together with contemporary responses to Olley's home studio re-creation that is on permanent display at the Margaret Olley Art Centre. 

Alongside Olley's still life paintings, the exhibition features responses by artists Nicholas Harding, John Honeywill, Guido Maestri, Lewis Miller, Adam Pyett, Monica Rohan, Pam Tippett, together with recent still life acquisitions by Laura Jones, India Mark and more.  

The contemporary still life responses to Margaret Olley's home studio re-creation provide a fascinating insight to Olley's enduring legacy and further shape the ongoing narrative around Australia's most celebrated painter of still life.
host: Tweed Regional Gallery & Margaret Olley Art Centre

title: A Monet in Murwillumbah: Sharing the National Collection
description:
Claude Monet's Meules, milieu du jour [Haystacks, midday], 1890 is the first of five works to be shared with the Tweed Regional Gallery as part of the National Gallery of Australia’s Sharing the National Collection initiative. The remaining works – three by iconic Australian artist Margaret Olley as well as Natura morta [Still life] 1956 by Giorgio Morandi – will be shared with the Tweed.

Between 1890 and 1891, Monet painted his Haystacks series exploring the nuances of light, shade, tone and colour across the seasons and at different times of the day. Meules, milieu du jour [Haystacks, midday] 1890 is a glorious work from this series, filled with dazzling light and luminous colour.

The Sharing the National Collection initiative will see major works of art from the National Gallery of Australia’s collection exhibited across regional and suburban communities.

This work of art is on long-term loan from the National Gallery of Australia with support from the Australian Government as part of Sharing the National Collection.
host: Tweed Regional Gallery & Margaret Olley Art Centre

title: Nourishing Yin Yoga and Crystal Bowl Sound Bath
description:
Immerse yourself in a morning of deep relaxation and rejuvenation at the Nimbin Bush Theatre with Nourishing Yin Yoga with Chrissy followed by a transformative Crystal Bowl Sound Bath with Karolynka. Let Chrissy guide you through gentle yin yoga postures designed to restore balance, release tension, and nourish your body and soul while being enveloped by the ethereal sounds of Karolynka’s crystal bowls, creating vibrational harmony that soothes the mind and spirit. Set against the serene backdrop of the Nimbin Bush Theatre, this unique experience is the perfect way to unwind, reconnect, and recharge. Don't miss this magical journey of sound and stillness!

Please bring a mat, light blanket, water bottle and pillow.

title: Perfume - Movie Screening
description:
Enter a world of dark beauty and obsession — Perfume: The Story of a Murderer screens at Nimbin Bush Theatre.

Come early, grab a bite, and immerse yourself in a chilling sensory journey through scent, desire, and madness.

Rated MA15+.

title: Being John Malkovich - Movie Screening
description:
Step into the surreal and bizarre — Being John Malkovich screens at Nimbin Bush Theatre.

Come early, grab a bite, and prepare for a mind-bending cinematic journey into identity, obsession, and the unexpected.

Rated MA15+.

title: Yin Yoga Classes
description:
Nourish the soul with Chrissy's Yin Yoga. Relax, Restore, Reconnect.

Are you seeking balance, relaxation, and deep restoration? Their Yin Yoga class offers a peaceful space to slow down, stretch deeply, and connect with your body and mind. Yin Yoga targets the deep connective tissues, promoting flexibility and mindfulness through long-held, gentle postures.

Calm your mind and ease tension in the body. Release tightness and enhance joint mobility. Cultivate presence and mindfulness. Support emotional well-being and restore energy.

Whether you're new to yoga or looking to deepen your practice, this class will guide you toward a place of relaxation and self-discovery.

title: Cacao Ceremony and Sound Journey Meditation
description:
Join Lisa for a transformative cacao ceremony that nurtures the heart and soul. 

Experience the magic of ceremonial cacao, guided meditation, and intention-setting in a sacred, welcoming space. 

Immerse yourself in ambient music by Michael Skinner as you connect deeply with yourself and the moment. 

Let this ceremony be a time for reflection, healing, and opening to new possibilities.

Please bring: Yoga Mat and Cup

title: Twilight Time Movie Screening and Q&A
description:
Twilight Time - Film Night and Director Q&A with John Hughes

Join the Nimbin Bush Theatre for a special evening of cinema and conversation. This event features a screening of short films followed by a powerful feature film.

Acclaimed Australian filmmaker John Hughes will be in attendance for a live Q&A after the screening, offering unique insights into his creative process, themes, and behind-the-scenes stories.

An engaging night of film, culture, and community set in the heart of Nimbin. All are welcome.

title: Nimbin Market
description:
Interact with the diverse reality and vibrant community that is Nimbin.

Sumptuous multicultural food, coffee, unique artisan wares, recycled inventions, spinning and crafty arts, innovative ideas, books, spiritual concepts, clothes and furniture are just some of the things you can feast your senses on. The wares are hand-grown, hand-made, Fair Trade, and recycled.

Nimbin Market is held every 4th and 5th Sunday of the month.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Nimbin Sustainable Living Hub Workshops
description:
Be inspired at Nimbin's Sustainable Living Hub with weekly workshops and farm tours, demonstrations, garden tours, education on alternative building, recycling, plus access to a community tools library, plant nursery and seed exchange.

Each month, they offer a variety of workshops along with regular sessions. The Spinners and Weavers workshop takes place on the second Wednesday of each month. The Knitting Group meets on the third Tuesday of each month, while the Crafters Group gathers on the fourth Wednesday of each month.

Bookings are essential for special workshops via email.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Nimbin Spring Arts Exhibition
description:
The annual Spring Arts Exhibition has been a feature presentation on Nimbin's cultural calendar for over 20 years presenting an incredible variety of works by Nimbin's fine artists, craft workers, designers, photographers and installation artists.

It is held annually during the Spring school holidays when Nimbin hosts thousands of local, interstate and international visitors.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Nimbin Farmers Market
description:
The Nimbin Farmers' Market is held every Wednesday afternoon. 

A great opportunity to buy fresh produce directly from local growers and producers. Products available include bread and baked goodies, meat, vegetables, tofu, cheeses, desserts and seasonal fruit and vegetables.

All produce is grown locally, for the enjoyment and health benefits of locals and visitors to the village.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: The Elton John Experience - Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Tweed Heads
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Seventh Wonder performs Fleetwood Mac with Brisbane Pops Orchestra - Tweed Heads
description:
Hailed as one of the world's leading Fleetwood Mac shows, and managed by Former Fleetwood Mac manager Dennis Dunstan, this show has been applauded by critics and fans, including Mick Fleetwood himself: "On first hearing Seventh Wonder Orchestrated… it gave me goosebumps."

This world-class performance, led by the incredible Bloom, brings together a star-studded band and the exquisite strings of the Brisbane Pops Orchestra to create an unparalleled tribute to Fleetwood Mac's music.

The evening will showcase the entire Rumours album, performed note-for-note, alongside the band's greatest hits. This masterful production promises to captivate fans of all ages and celebrate the legacy of one of the most beloved bands in music history.

Seventh Wonder Performs Fleetwood Mac rises above mere tribute—it's a celebration. Featuring meticulous, note-for-note recreations of Fleetwood Mac's greatest songs, the show has won acclaim for its authenticity, emotional resonance, and powerhouse performances, catapulting the band into being regarded as one of the World's Leading Fleetwood Mac shows.

Dennis Dunstan, who managed Fleetwood Mac for over a decade, adds his stamp of approval to this exceptional production: "Fleetwood Mac's music is timeless, and this show is the perfect celebration of their artistry. The addition of the Brisbane Pops Orchestra's strings elevates it to a whole new level. It's a must-see for any music fan."

title: Australian Eagles Show - Tweed Heads
description:
The Internationally celebrated Australian Eagles Show soars back in 2025 with Their 'Life In The Fast Lane' Tour. 

Prepare to be dazzled as the renowned Australian Eagles Show, fronted by the talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne, returns with an all-new production in 2024. Having wowed audiences in sold-out theatres across Australia, America, Europe, and South Africa, this world-class extravaganza is now making its triumphant return to Australia.

The Australian Eagles Show, featuring a stellar five-piece band, is set to intricately recreate the timeless classics that catapulted the Eagles to global stardom. From the melodic 'Desperado' and the high-octane 'Life in the Fast Lane' to the soulful 'New Kid in Town,' the heart-warming 'Take it to the Limit,' and the electric 'Heartache Tonight,' you'll be treated to an authentic Eagles experience. Additionally, the band will pay homage to the solo hits of Joe Walsh, Don Henley, and the late Glenn Frey.

The Eagles, formed in Los Angeles in 1971, achieved legendary status with an impressive list of accolades, including five number-one singles, six Grammy Awards, five American Music Awards, six number-one albums, and over 150 million records sold. Their 'Eagles Greatest Hits' album remains one of the best-selling albums of the 20th century.

It's a night of timeless music you won't want to miss.

title: An Evening with Murphy's Pigs - Tweed Heads
description:
A big brand, a big sound and nearly an acre of suit fabric. This is the award-winning Celtic-Rock ensemble that the Department of Foreign Affairs & Trade is warning everyone about. Throw caution to the wind and set forth on a musical journey through the lands of the Celts as Murphy's Pigs drag you headfirst into their world of rugged mountains, stormy oceans, fearsome battles, unrequited love and a drop or two of the whiskey. 

Their unrehearsed style breathes new life into old favourites and firmly places their unique stamp on contemporary treasures … and some not-too-shabby stuff they've written themselves. Mildly humorous onstage banter, an insane number of instruments and robust, manly voices unite to create an experience that will, unfortunately, be seared deep into your memory long after the performance is over. Boisterous chorus songs and lilting ballads compel the tone deaf to sing fervently while spirited jigs, reels and hornpipes spur the uncoordinated out onto the dance floor. 

After selling out their last six shows, you won't want to miss a great night's entertainment with these twelve charmers and their accompanied dancers (who are even more charming).

title: The Australian Bee Gees Show - Tweed Heads
description:
After 24 years and over 6,500 performances in over 55 countries, The Australian Bee Gees Show is the toast of Las Vegas. The show has been in residence at Excalibur Resort and Casino on the Las Vegas Strip since February 2011 and has been voted twice, The Best Tribute Show in Las Vegas. The Australian Bee Gees Show also tours Worldwide throughout the year.

The show features a chronology of the greatest hits from the wonderful music of the Brothers Gibb, including More Than A Woman, Night Fever, Stayin’ Alive and How Do You Mend A Broken Heart, just to name a few.

The Australian Bee Gees Show have captured the look, the sound and the personality that defines one of the most successful and adored acts in musical history. For one night only, be a part of the magic that is, The Australian Bee Gees Show.

title: Choirboys - Run To Paradise - Tweed Heads
description:
As young twenty-something-year-olds, Choirboys formed in 1978, growing up on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The wild, hedonistic lifestyle the band witnessed of the youth in the 70s is ultimately what gave birth to their seminal rock anthem, Run To Paradise. It’s all about the stories that sound all too familiar within the culture widely assumed of the music industry - “sex, drugs, and rock ‘n’ roll” and they tell it all.

Run To Paradise is a “spilling of the beans” of sorts. It’s part story, part song that chronicles through some of the wildest, most risqué, outrageous, and downright hilarious stories of Australian Rock. All, as these Oz pub-rock icons recall it.

And behind the narrative are the classic songs that define the musical landscape of rock music in the ’70s and '80s, including Deep Purple’s “Smoke On The Water”, Chuck Berry’s ‘Never Can Tell’, TMG’s ‘Jump In My Car’, Dragon’s ‘Are You Old Enough’, AC/DC’s ‘Long Way To The Top’ and of course, the Choirboys hits ‘Boys Will Be Boys’ ‘Never Gonna Die’ ‘Struggletown’ and the pub-rock anthem ‘Run to Paradise’, to name a few.

title: The 8ft Bash
description:
The 8ft Bash is a high-energy, action-packed longboard surfing event that celebrates the unique challenge of riding 8ft boards in a competitive format. 

Designed to blend classic longboarding style with an aggressive, high-performance approach, this one-day surf showdown will bring together both professional and amateur surfers for an intense, skill-driven competition. 

The event will take place at D’Bah on the NSW/Qld border, a premier surf break known for consistent waves, ensuring the perfect conditions for stylish carves and powerful maneuvers.

title: The Rylstone Sunday Morning Community Markets
description:
The Rylstone Sunday Morning Community Markets is a community-based event supported by locals. Wander down the main street stopping at all the shops, cafés, bakery and markets.

Markets are located at The Globe Gardens and Historical Society grounds.

title: Anh Do - Tweed Heads
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'

Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Casino Golf Club Markets
description:
Come along and find a treasure at the Casino Golf Club market day. There will be crafts, jewellery, bags, clothing, plants, food and lots more. Enjoy a scrumptious breakfast in the Club House to start your day right. 

The markets are a not-for-profit organisation benefiting the community and raising funds for local charities.

EFTPOS is available in the Club House.

title: Casino Spring Orchid Show
description:
Casino  and District Orchid Society presents it's annual Spring Orchid Show. Come along and enjoy the fabulous flowering orchid displays, share with your fellow enthusiasts and enjoy the judging.

Tea, coffee and snacks will be available.

title: Richmond Valley Christmas Street Party
description:
Set in the heart of the Richmond Valley, the streets of Casino will come to life with the spirit of Christmas when Richmond Valley Council hosts it's annual Christmas Street Party. The CBD will be closed for great entertainment.

Visitors can enjoy Christmas carols, amusements, markets, pooches on parade, delicious food, face painting, Christmas tree light-up, fireworks, and of course a visit from Santa and his Elves.

This event is a wonderful celebration of everything Christmas and brings together thousands of local residents and visitors from the region and beyond. There will be something for everyone with lots of fun things to see and do for young and old!

title: Grabine Freshwater Fishing Competition
description:
This August sees the return of the annual Grabine Classic Freshwater Fishing Competition which is held at Reflections Holiday Park Grabine Lakeside in the last full weekend of August each year. 

The Freshwater Fishing Competition has been running successfully for many years and continues to grow. Prizes for fish will be for longest Murray Cod, Golden Perch, Silver Perch, Catfish, Carp and biggest bag of Carp caught over the weekend, with both senior and junior divisions for all fish.

Native fish are Catch and Release with photographic entries so make sure you or someone you are fishing with bring a digital camera or a phone that can take a nice clear photo of your fish. Details of fishing competition rules can be obtained from the tournament website.

For an enjoyable weekend away with the whole family, or with some fellow fishermen, head down to Reflections Holiday Park Grabine Lakeside!

title: Anh Do - Casino
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'
Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.
When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Casino Lions Farmers Markets
description:
Casino Lions Farmers Market is on every Saturday at Crawford Square.

The markets feature live entertainment and more variety of fresh local produce every week. The casino is home to a variety of locally grown fruit, vegetables and meat. From peaches, avocados, mangoes, and coffee to local beef and eggs you are sure to find something you like. Support local and be rewarded with fresh produce!

title: Gundagai Producers Market
description:
Relax and explore the great range of local produce and grab some gifts for your loved ones at the Gundagai Producers Market held in Carberry Park. 

Check out the exciting collection of stalls attending - ranging from local products, baked goods, handmade soaps, home decor, plants and so much more. Drop in and support the amazing local producers and grab some goodies.  

The Gundagai Producers Market is hosted by the Gundagai Visitor Information Centre.

title: Gundagai NAIDOC Ball
description:
The Gundagai NAIDOC Ball is a vibrant annual celebration of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture, hosted by MAWANG Inc. 

The event brings the community together for an evening of music, dance, cultural performances, and guest speakers. Held at the Gundagai Services Club, the ball celebrates the strength, pride, and resilience of First Nations peoples and is open to all members of the public.

title: Casino Gold Cup Race Day
description:
For over 100 years, Casino Racing Club has brought the thrill of horse racing to the Northern Rivers, and this proud history lives on today. Come along for a fun day of racing and fashions at the Casino Gold Cup. Enjoy all the action at the Casino Racecourse as the Casino Racing Club hosts this popular race meet.

There is plenty of fun to be had getting dressed up and having a great day out with friends.

title: Teddy Bears Picnic at Abercrombie House
description:
Experience a magical day at Abercrombie House during the Winter in Bathurst celebrations with the teddy bears' picnic this international Teddy Bear Day. Children and families can bring a favourite teddy, lay out a picnic rug and enjoy a day of fun in a heritage setting.

Visitors can explore the historic house and gardens at their own pace. Inside, vintage decorations, twinkling trees and cosy fireplaces capture the charm of Christmas in July.

Little ones will enjoy story time sessions presented by Bathurst Library, plus live music by Bathurst Academy of Music. Enid's Emporium adds extra delight with teddy bear displays, competitions and more.

There are plenty of tasty food options on site. A sausage sizzle, coffee cart, cupcakes and warm pumpkin soup make it easy to settle in for the day.

Abercrombie House offers a unique family day out filled with stories, music and nostalgic charm.

title: Christmas on Sheridan
description:
Christmas on Sheridan is a festive community event held annually in Gundagai, bringing the town together to celebrate the holiday season. 

Taking place on Sheridan Street, this event transforms the heart of Gundagai into a lively hub of holiday cheer, with local businesses participating in late-night shopping, kids ride, market stalls and live entertainment. 

Families can enjoy activities such as face painting, and a visit from Santa Claus and Mrs. Claus, creating a magical atmosphere for children and adults alike. 

The event not only highlights the town's strong sense of community but also supports local commerce and spreads joy during the Christmas season.

title: Festival of Gundagai
description:
The Festival of Gundagai returns this year as a spectacular celebration of light, storytelling, and community pride. This immersive event transforms Gundagai's historic main street and parklands into a dazzling canvas of large-scale projections, roaming performances, and interactive light installations.

Wander beneath illuminated buildings inspired by the flowing Murrumbidgee River and Gundagai's rich heritage. Enjoy live music, storytelling, and dance performances, then treat your tastebuds with gourmet street eats, regional produce, and local wines at the food precinct.

With local performers, art installations, and a strong community spirit, the Festival of Gundagai is fast becoming one of the Riverina's must-visit cultural events.

title: Gundagai ANZAC Day
description:
Anzac Day is one of Australia's most important national occasions. It marks the anniversary of the first major military action fought by Australian and New Zealand forces during the First World War. 

In Gundagai, the day begins with a Dawn Service at Anzac Grove with the Gundagai 7th Light Horse Troop in attendance.

The Main Street service takes place at the Cenotaph Memorial in Sheridan Street. Locals and visitors are invited to meet outside the Family Hotel to begin the march/walk up the main street to the Cenotaph. The march is led by service people, schools and community organisations. 

After the march locals and visitors are invited to enjoy a game of Two-Up at one of the licensed establishments in town.

title: Murrurundi Festival - Art in the Landscape
description:
The Murrurundi Festival is an exciting event that celebrates arts, culture and heritage in Murrurundi. The three-day program is packed with unique art experiences and exhibitions. It features a classical concert and the Art of the Kite, to fill the sky with colour.

Murrurundi will be wrapped in a vibrant display of hessian and twine, with bunting and yarn bombing. A Fairy Picnic set in the beautiful Paradise Park will provide fun for all ages, with storytelling, face painting and games. The Cobb and Co Coach will bring a touch of history to the streets. 

Immerse yourself in a weekend of art and culture at the Murrurundi Festival.

title: Newbridge Art Show
description:
The Newbridge Art Show is a vibrant and growing celebration of art and creativity in a historic village in the heart of the New South Wales Central Tablelands. 

Held since October 2022 as part of Spring into Art at Newbridge, the Newbridge Art Show features an evolving set of classes across art and photography. From still life to mini to a class specifying content from within 10 kilometres of the village of Newbridge, the show has something for every viewer and artist.

title: Secret Valley Festival
description:
Secret Valley Festival is an immersive, multi-day celebration of music, art, and community, set in the stunning landscapes of Mudgee, NSW. 

Designed to awaken a sense of wonder, it blends live performances, interactive experiences, and wellness activities to create a truly unforgettable escape from the everyday.

title: Sculptures by the Bush - Newbridge
description:
Participating in Blayney Shire's Sculptures by the Bush annual competition, the villagers of Newbridge have several entries on display in the Scarecrow competition.

As a reminder, the Scarecrow Challenge is to create your best scarecrow or series of themed scarecrows, perfect for residents who live in town and don't have as much space as the Hay Bale or Farm Art Challenges demand.

title: New Year's Day Races
description:
Bring in the New Year at one of Australia's most famous country towns with the Gundagai-Adelong Racing Club's New Year's Day race meeting.

Come along to the picturesque Gundagai Racecourse on New Year's Day in 2025 and celebrate with a great fun day out and a flutter or two with the friendly locals. Bring the family and have a very sociable and fun day out.

There will be a strong bookmakers ring as well as excellent catering and bar facilities.

title: Battle on the Bidgee Stockmans Challenge
description:
On the banks of the Murrumbidgee River, witness Australia’s best women and men compete in a three-day Stockman’s Challenge.

The first two days of the challenge consist of the challenge preliminary events Stock Handling, Packhorse, Whip Crack, Dry Work Pattern, Bareback Obstacle, Horseshoeing and Cross Country.

On day three of the challenge, the top Open Competitors will compete in a wild horse catch and poley buck jump. The top Lady Competitors will also compete in a wild horse catch and a working cow horse event, while the top  Junior will battle it out in a time trial and steer catch.

AUD10,000 Open Campdraft on the Saturday, Plus Live Entertainment and Kids Activities.

title: Snake Gully Cup Carnival
description:
Taking its name from the famous “Dad and Dave” radio program, the popularity, prize money and prestige of the Snake Gully Cup Carnival has grown dramatically in recent years, with thousands of racegoers converging each November on the picturesque Gundagai racecourse.

The Gundagai Adelong Racing Club is excited for this year's Snake Gully Cup Carnival! The day is also about fashion, hats and racing glamour- what racing carnival would be complete without Fashions on the Field.

title: The Sir George Markets
description: Celebrating regional food and wine, creativity, community and local artists, the seasonal Sunday markets at The Sir George Hotel are held approximately four times a year - check the Sir George website for information and specific dates.

title: Family Kelly Pool at Kandos Hotel
description:
Join them at Kandos Hotel for a fun Family Kelly Pool Competition this Sunday. Open to all ages, it's a relaxed and welcoming afternoon of casual competition with a cash prize for the winner.

Kids can enjoy the Kids Meal Special, which includes pizza, a soft drink and ice cream with topping. 

No bookings or registration required — simply turn up and enjoy.

Perfect for families, friends and anyone looking for an easygoing way to spend a Sunday.

title: Trivia Night at Kandos Hotel
description:
Trivia Night at Kandos Hotel is your monthly chance to test your knowledge, share some laughs, and enjoy a top night out in Kandos. Dates change each month, so keep an eye on their socials to see when the next round of fun is happening.

Gather your family and friends, grab a table and settle in for a relaxed evening with plenty of friendly competition. Entry is free, with great prizes up for grabs and their bistro serving up all your favourite classic pub meals to keep you fuelled.

Whether you're a trivia buff or just in it for the banter, Kandos Hotel's trivia night is a brilliant way to break up the routine and enjoy the warm, welcoming vibe of your local country pub.

title: Live Music at Kandos Hotel
description:
Join a fantastic night of live music with Peter Van Sint Jan, bringing his rich vocals and acoustic style to the heart of Kandos.

From laid-back favourites to toe-tapping classics, Peter's setlist is the perfect backdrop for a Saturday night with friends. Settle in with a great meal from the bistro, enjoy a few drinks, and soak up the warm, country pub atmosphere.

Bring your mates, book a table, and make a night of it at Kandos Hotel.

title: Gundagai Rodeo
description:
The Gundagai Rodeo is a premier event on the national rodeo circuit, being held at the Gundagai Rodeo Grounds.

As the final event on the ABCRA calendar, competition is fierce for those last national championship points, and the nation's top cowboys and cowgirls will all be in town as part of their quest for a coveted national title. Spectacular action is guaranteed, from the finals of the blue-ribbon Open Bull Ride under lights in the main arena, down to the aspiring young cowboys in the Poddy ride.

See Australia's best cowgirls 'turn and burn' in the Barrel Race and experience all the thrills and spills of the Rope, tie and Steer Wrestling finals.

Enjoy the live entertainment later in the evening after the events have been completed. A full bar and canteen facilities are available.

title: Gundagai Adelong Racing Club - Sky1 Race day
description:
Soak up the atmosphere of regional racing at its best with the Gundagai-Adelong Racing Club. Throughout the year, the Club hosts exciting race days that bring locals and visitors together for a true country experience. 

Enjoy a relaxed day trackside with bar and dining facilities, TAB access, and local and metro bookmakers. Whether you're a racing enthusiast or simply looking for a fun day out, Gundagai's race days offer the perfect blend of sport, hospitality, and country charm.

title: Nundle  Twilight Christmas Market
description:
Experience a European-style Christmas market complete with Christmas lights and music, food, quality handmade products, games for children, plus a visit from Santa Claus and a re-enactment of the nativity scene. A great outing for everyone whilst doing Christmas shopping! 

Why not make it a day trip? Spend the whole day in Nundle and walk through the village and visit the shops as well as the Gold Mine Cafe and Museum, Court House Museum, Nundle Woollen Mill, CWA Art Show before heading to the Nundle Twilight Christmas Market.

title: Savour The Tweed
description:
Savour The Tweed is a new food and drink event.

Over five days, celebrate culinary excellence where fresh-grown goodness is on the menu and delicious times are guaranteed.  

Savour The Tweed features a stunning program of over 20 distinctive events, showcasing The Tweed's gourmet offerings and those who bring them to life, from First Nations storytellers and passionate chefs to talented distillers, brewers and baristas, cheesemakers, farmers and an endless list of artisan producers. 

Co-curated by Tweed-based chef and author, Christine Manfield and local food advocate Amy Colli of Straight To The Source, the inaugural event will spotlight local and visiting chefs, serving up menus inspired by locally grown and made foods, as well as the growing list of Tweed-made drinks.

title: Kingscliff Markets
description:
Kingscliff Markets are held in Jack Bayliss Park on Marine Parade Kingscliff the second and fourth Saturday of every month from 8am to 1pm, with the picturesque backdrop of Kingscliff Beach. There is plentiful parking with public toilets.

With a beautiful beachfront location and an array of local produce, Kingscliff Markets in Northern NSW Australia are truly enjoyable for all ages. Spend a relaxing Saturday morning strolling through the vast array of gourmet food, produce, craft, artwork, fashion, jewellery, flowers, gifts and food stalls.

Why not pick up some fresh fruit and vegetables and have an afternoon feast or swim after browsing through the stalls?

title: FEAST
description:
In 2024, BMEC launched East – A Celebration of Asian Cultures in Bathurst, a vibrant and joyful event that received strong community support. Following a period of reflection on its successes and areas for growth, a debriefing process has highlighted the need for a broader strategic approach in 2025—one that embraces greater diversity and is informed by deeper community consultation.

The proposed evolution of the festival will see it reimagined as FEAST—a celebration of diversity, performance, flavours, and ideas. The opening day will coincide with the International Day of Sign Language, with Auslan being recognized and incorporated throughout the festival. Planned events include a free community picnic and concert, culinary "taste" experiences, a Dangerous Ideas-style keynote, ticketed performances and films, a community photographic exhibition, and more. To shape the festival's direction, organisers are currently conducting a community stakeholder survey to gather ideas and suggestions.

title: Bathurst Spring Spectacular
description:
This annual event is held on the last weekend of October of each year. 

The 10 gardens opened in the Bathurst area range from large country gardens to small suburban gardens with lots of variations in between. 

Enjoy live music, market stalls and displays. Raising monies for local charities.

title: The Channon Craft Market
description:
The Channon Craft Market is one of the most colourful and vibrant in Australia. It is a popular must-visit event for visitors with around 200 eclectic stalls offering a wide range of unique items.

Market-goers are entertained with music acts, kids' rides, craft workshops and a great variety of buskers. Among the shade of the established trees in Coronation Park, there are delightful alfresco areas to enjoy the delicious and aromatic food stall offerings.

The Channon is a 20-minute drive from Lismore, in the heart of the hinterland.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Challenge Bathurst
description:
Challenge Bathurst is an exclusive opportunity to drive your own street car or track racing car on the famous Mount Panorama Racing Circuit this November.

With the most exhilarating 6.2 kilometres of bitumen on the planet open for your speeding enjoyment, you won't want to miss your chance to see what motor sport legends rave about.

title: Reliance Bank Carols by Candlelight
description:
Reliance Bank Carols by Candlelight is a wonderful night for all the family. Bring your chairs, rugs and a picnic.  

Bands from the Bathurst City and RSL Band Association and the Allegri Singers will lead the community carol singing.  Many other local performers will entertain and celebrate the Christmas season.

There will be a special appearance by Santa. Glow sticks and candles will be on sale.

title: Bathurst Autofest
description:
The Mountain is set to Rock again when the Bathurst Autofest returns to the world-renowned Mount Panorama Racing Circuit, Bathurst NSW in March. 

The Bathurst Autofest was again a huge hit this season and with the 2025 event mostly sold out they have now extended this event out to three days and two nights this proves that the Bathurst Autofest is only going to get bigger. But remember, they have said they have a cut off of just 350 driving event entrants so get yourself booked in and submit your entry form early.

So forget the hustle and bustle of the City and get yourself trackside to take in the sights and sounds as these weekend warriors unleash onto Australia’s best venue for a weekend of horsepower, action and carnage where only the strong survive.

title: The Dinomaniacs - Bathurst
description:
Join Shaun and Tara for a fun-filled afternoon with their award-winning kids' show!
