The Dinomaniacs! Fresh off winning two national awards at the 2024 What's On 4 Kids, this show is packed with laughs, music and hands-on dino fun.

Say hello to Trixi the Triceratops, cheeky Tru Blu, Naughty Joffrey, Aussie favourites Ozzi and Oi, and the newest baby dino, Olive the Parasaurolophus.

Perfect for ages 1-8, this interactive experience includes lifelike baby dinosaurs, singing and dancing, Up-close dino encounters and fun photo ops!

title: Repco Bathurst 1000
description:
Welcome to the pinnacle of the Repco Supercars Championship – the 2025 Repco Supercars Bathurst 1000! Immerse yourself in the ultimate motorsport experience, designed exclusively for racing enthusiasts.

Set against the breathtaking backdrop of Bathurst, Australia, this legendary event is more than just a race – it’s a celebration of speed, skill, and determination. Feel the adrenaline as drivers conquer the iconic Mount Panorama Circuit, pushing limits and making history.

Secure your spot for this action-packed adventure and prepare for a once-in-a-lifetime journey. Experience the excitement of the 2025 Repco Supercars Bathurst 1000 like never before – in true style!

title: Bathurst Swap Meet
description:
The Bathurst Historic Car Club has operated the largest and longest-established Swap Meet in Bathurst. 

This very popular event will be held at Mount Panorama which is the home of motorsport in Australia and will be a most fitting venue for the Swap Meet.  

The event has gained a strong reputation as a genuine swap meet for enthusiasts, featuring car, motorcycle and machinery items, parts and tools. 

It attracts genuine buyers and sellers from a very wide area. 

The gates will open at 6 am, free parking will be available within the grounds and food stalls on the Sunday will be catered by local service clubs.

title: Seventh Wonder performs Fleetwood Mac - Bathurst
description:
Hailed as one of the world’s leading Fleetwood Mac shows, and managed by Former Fleetwood Mac manager Dennis Dunstan, Seventh Wonder has been applauded by critics and fans alike, including Mick Fleetwood himself.

Don’t miss the opportunity to witness the magic as Seventh Wonder brings Fleetwood Mac’s iconic music to life.

With an “electrifying” and “captivating” performance, Seventh Wonder delivers an authentic portrayal of one of the most iconic bands in rock history.

Immerse yourself in the timeless melodies of Fleetwood Mac’s legendary album “Rumours” brought to life in its entirety by Seventh Wonder. From the spirited rhythms of “Go Your Own Way” to the ethereal allure of “Dreams” and the infectious energy of “Don’t Stop” every note resonates with the spirit of Fleetwood Mac. Additionally, Seventh Wonder will take you on a journey through other cherished hits like “Little Lies” “Gypsy” and “Say You Love Me” ensuring an unforgettable musical experience.

Led by the extraordinary vocal talent of Bloom, whose voice has been described as “a force of nature” Seventh Wonder brings the essence of Fleetwood Mac’s sound to life with unparalleled precision and passion.

title: Old Government Cottage Museum and Colonial Garden
description:
The building known as Old Government Cottage is a rare, intact example of an early Bathurst home. This historic building is located at 16 Stanley Street on the western side of the Macquarie River in the area of the old Government settlement.

The building was reopened after its recent repair and refurbishment in July 2012.  This was the first major work on the building since the mid-1960s. Bathurst is a historic city, and it is imperative that historic buildings be saved such as this building.

Old Government Cottage was opened as a museum in 1965 by Sir Eric Woodward, Governor of NSW, as part of Bathurst's sesquicentennial celebration. It was believed at the time that the cottage had been built in 1817 as the residence of the Commandant of the Bathurst Settlement, established in 1815 by Governor Macquarie. Subsequent research has established that the Commandant's residence, also known as Government House, was a short distance away. However, the origins of Old Government Cottage remain a mystery, but worth the opportunity to visit.

title: Bathurst Edgell Jog
description:
The Edgell Jog is an annual community fun run held in Bathurst in September. The circuit is 7.5 kilometres, starting and ending at the Courthouse. 

The Edgell Jog commenced in 1976 and is the biggest fun run in country New South Wales.

title: Winter In Bathurst Kids Day
description: Bring the little ones along for a magical day of fun with non-stop activities. They'll love meeting friendly farm animals, getting creative with arts & crafts, enjoying a spin on the ice rink, and laughing their way through kids amusement rides. With market stalls full of treats and surprises, plus plenty more to discover, it's the ultimate winter day out designed just for them.

title: Winter in Bathurst @ The Greens
description:
A Magical Winter Wonderland! 
​
Get ready to experience the ultimate winter celebration as Winter in Bathurst transforms The Greens on William into a sparkling wonderland! Whether you're gliding across the ice rink, indulging in delicious treats from the food markets, or enjoying the exciting children's activities, there's something for everyone to enjoy! 

Across the two week school holiday period the Greens on William will be hosting the MacDonalds Bathurst Ice Skating Rink along with a range of events that are sure to warm up your winter.

title: Winter Ball - A Black Tie Winter Affair
description:
Guests are invited to step into an evening of refined elegance and seasonal enchantment at the Winter Ball, a celebration designed to capture the magic and sophistication of the season.

The night promises a luxurious experience, beginning with a selection of exquisite canapés followed by a decadent three-course meal, thoughtfully crafted by acclaimed chef Drew Bolton, whose reputation for high-end culinary artistry ensures a dining experience of the highest calibre.

Throughout the evening, the smooth and soulful sounds of the Maple Creek Duo will provide a captivating musical backdrop, setting the perfect tone for an unforgettable night of dining, dancing, and winter celebration.

This is an event that embodies grace and glamour—a truly unmissable occasion for those who appreciate the finer things in life.

title: All Abilities Day
description:
Head out to the McDonald's Bathurst Ice Rink at the Greens on William for All Abilities Day, a celebration of inclusion, connection, and winter fun for everyone.

The ice rink and surrounding activities will be tailored to ensure a safe, supportive, and enjoyable experience for people of all ages and abilities. Come dressed as your favourite superhero and be part of a community that celebrates every kind of strength!

With sensory-friendly sessions, accessible facilities, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, it's a day where everyone can participate, play, and feel part of the magic. Make some winter memories—together.

title: ESSSENSSSE - Exhibition Tours
description:
Join a free, guided exhibition tour by BRAG staff.

Free, all welcome, RSVP online or at gallery reception.

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents ESSSENSSSE, a joyful work about healing and new beginnings by acclaimed contemporary artist HOSSEI (NSW), guest curated by Tesha Malott.

ESSSENSSSE is an aquatic ecosystem that explores the tenacity of the human spirit, stripping away corporeal human qualities and revealing what's underneath. ESSSENSSSE follows HOSSEI's exploration of creating costumes that 'heal'. Featuring a cast of 16 other-worldly sea creatures, ESSSENSSSE transitions from a series of dynamic and joyful performances into a sensory, large-scale installation, in which visitors are surrounded by a playful, 100% tactile landscape.

A Verge Gallery exhibition, touring in partnership with Museums & Galleries of NSW, supported by the University of Sydney and proudly funded by the NSW Government. Verge Gallery is supported by the University of Sydney Union.

title: ESSSENSSSE - Opening Event
description:
Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents ESSSENSSSE, a joyful work about healing and new beginnings by acclaimed contemporary artist HOSSEI (NSW), guest curated by Tesha Malott.

ESSSENSSSE is an aquatic ecosystem that explores the tenacity of the human spirit, stripping away corporeal human qualities and revealing what's underneath. ESSSENSSSE follows HOSSEI's exploration of creating costumes that 'heal'. Featuring a cast of 16 other-worldly sea creatures, ESSSENSSSE transitions from a series of dynamic and joyful performances into a sensory, large-scale installation, in which visitors are surrounded by a playful, 100% tactile landscape.

A Verge Gallery exhibition, touring in partnership with Museums & Galleries of NSW, supported by the University of Sydney and proudly funded by the NSW Government. Verge Gallery is supported by the University of Sydney Union.

title: School Holiday Workshop - Make Your Own Sea Slime!
description:
Join Bathurst Regional Art Gallery these school holidays for a workshop where children will learn how to make aquatic themed slime!

All materials are supplied, including ocean themed add-ins to help make your slime more fun and unique. 

A small, guided tour of BRAG's current exhibition, ESSSENSSSE, is included to help inspire and encourage this creative activity.

Ages 6-17
RSVP essential

title: Mystery of Missing Westerlies - Artist Talk
description:
Hear from Ecological Gyre Theory's Chantelle Mitchell and Jaxon Waterhouse on BRAG Foyer Space Exhibition, Mystery of Missing Westerlies

Please note: this event will be live streamed at Bathurst Regional Art Gallery.

Free, all welcome, RSVP essential

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery presents Mystery of Missing Westerlies by Chantelle Mitchell and Jaxon Waterhouse (Ecological Gyre Theory).

Mystery of Missing Westerlies is a body of work emerging in response to a news article from 1950 which details "extraordinary weather"; a local manifestation of global atmospheric change, being the disappearance of westerly winds across New South Wales in response to planetary changes sweeping the northern hemisphere. Working across installation, video and intervention, Mystery of Missing Westerlies considers pasts, presents and futures in an interconnected planetary atmospheric frame.

The disappearance of the westerly winds is itself both a historical anomaly and a planetary omen. We treat this climatic rupture as an atmospheric case file, a study in atmospheric disappearance, inviting consideration of the interplay between absence, evidence, and the forces shaping our world. Here, wind becomes both subject and metaphor—an invisible actor whose movements carry sediments, shape deserts, and drive oceanic currents, but also a narrative force whose disappearance tells of shifting global patterns. Embedded within this body of work are material traces of evidence and investigation, material clues in a wider investigation of climate, memory, and time.

title: School Holidays Workshop - Sew your own plush toy!
description:
Join Bathurst Regional Art Gallery these school holidays for a workshop where children will learn how to design and sew their own aquatic-themed toy!

All materials are supplied as well as a small, guided tour of BRAG's current exhibition, ESSSENSSSE, is included to help inspire and encourage creativity during this activity!

Ages 6-17
RSVP essential

title: ESSSENSSSE - Sunday Sketch and Make Sessions
description:
Head to BRAG each Sunday during ESSSENSSSE for a self-guided Sunday Sketch and Make Session!

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents ESSSENSSSE, a joyful work about healing and new beginnings by acclaimed contemporary artist HOSSEI (NSW), guest curated by Tesha Malott.

ESSSENSSSE is an aquatic ecosystem that explores the tenacity of the human spirit, stripping away corporeal human qualities and revealing what's underneath. ESSSENSSSE follows HOSSEI's exploration of creating costumes that 'heal'. Featuring a cast of 16 other-worldly sea creatures, ESSSENSSSE transitions from a series of dynamic and joyful performances into a sensory, large-scale installation, in which visitors are surrounded by a playful, 100% tactile landscape.

A Verge Gallery exhibition, touring in partnership with Museums & Galleries of NSW, supported by the University of Sydney and proudly funded by the NSW Government. Verge Gallery is supported by the University of Sydney Union.

title: ESSSENSSSE - Talks and Tea
description:
Join Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) Volunteer Guides for a spotlight talk and walk through of exhibition ESSSENSSSE!

This is a social series for visitors to learn more about the current exhibitions, Bathurst's vibrant art scene, and to meet like-minded locals!

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents ESSSENSSSE, a joyful work about healing and new beginnings by acclaimed contemporary artist HOSSEI (NSW), guest curated by Tesha Malott.

ESSSENSSSE is an aquatic ecosystem that explores the tenacity of the human spirit, stripping away corporeal human qualities and revealing what's underneath. ESSSENSSSE follows HOSSEI's exploration of creating costumes that 'heal'. Featuring a cast of 16 other-worldly sea creatures, ESSSENSSSE transitions from a series of dynamic and joyful performances into a sensory, large-scale installation, in which visitors are surrounded by a playful, 100% tactile landscape.

A Verge Gallery exhibition, touring in partnership with Museums & Galleries of NSW, supported by the University of Sydney and proudly funded by the NSW Government. Verge Gallery is supported by the University of Sydney Union.

title: Mystery of Missing Westerlies - Opening Event
description:
A BRAG Foyer Space Exhibition by Ecological Gyre Theory

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents Mystery of Missing Westerlies by Chantelle Mitchell and Jaxon Waterhouse (Ecological Gyre Theory).

Mystery of Missing Westerlies is a body of work emerging in response to a news article from April 7, 1950 which details "extraordinary weather"; a local manifestation of global atmospheric change, being the disappearance of westerly winds across New South Wales in response to planetary changes sweeping the northern hemisphere. Working across installation, video and intervention, Mystery of Missing Westerlies considers pasts, presents and futures in an interconnected planetary atmospheric frame.

The disappearance of the westerly winds is itself both a historical anomaly and a planetary omen. We treat this climatic rupture as an atmospheric case file, a study in atmospheric disappearance, inviting consideration of the interplay between absence, evidence, and the forces shaping our world. Here, wind becomes both subject and metaphor—an invisible actor whose movements carry sediments, shape deserts, and drive oceanic currents, but also a narrative force whose disappearance tells of shifting global patterns. Embedded within this body of work are material traces of evidence and investigation, material clues in a wider investigation of climate, memory, and time.

title: ESSSENSSSE - Artist and Curator Talk
description:
Join ESSSENSSSE artist HOSSEI and guest curator Tesha Malott in conversation at Bathurst Regional Art Gallery.

FREE, all welcome, RSVP essential

Bathurst Regional Art Gallery (BRAG) presents ESSSENSSSE, a joyful work about healing and new beginnings by acclaimed contemporary artist HOSSEI (NSW), guest curated by Tesha Malott.

ESSSENSSSE is an aquatic ecosystem that explores the tenacity of the human spirit, stripping away corporeal human qualities and revealing what's underneath. ESSSENSSSE follows HOSSEI's exploration of creating costumes that 'heal'. Featuring a cast of 16 other-worldly sea creatures, ESSSENSSSE transitions from a series of dynamic and joyful performances into a sensory, large-scale installation, in which visitors are surrounded by a playful, 100% tactile landscape.

A Verge Gallery exhibition, touring in partnership with Museums & Galleries of NSW, supported by the University of Sydney and proudly funded by the NSW Government. Verge Gallery is supported by the University of Sydney Union.

title: Bathurst Swap Meet, Car and Bike Show
description:
The Annual Bathurst's Biggest Expo and Christmas Markets incorporates a Swap Meet, Car and Bike Show. 

This is a family oriented event with over 200 market stalls, kids' rides, food and drink stalls. A fun day out for all the family!

title: Bathurst Outdoor Expo and Christmas Markets
description:
Bathurst’s Outdoor Expo and Christmas Markets is an annual event which has been running for over 20 years. They aim to bring a wide variety of exhibitors together for this event. Held at the Bathurst Showground, they try to cater to everyone’s taste.

The event has diversified over the years to incorporate many aspects. Three beautiful pavilions are packed with a variety of stalls including jewellery, home wares, gift wares, toys, books, crafts, beauty products, clothing and much more.

Outside they aim to create a festival atmosphere with a variety of food and market stalls, entertainment and childrens’ rides. The event also caters for the outdoor enthusiast with camping, boating, 4WD accessories, fishing, camper trailers, caravans plus much more.

title: Bathurst Arts Trail
description:
The Bathurst Arts Trail is a collective of artists throughout the Bathurst region who open their galleries and studios to visitors on the first weekend of each month. 

The Arts Trail Open Weekends offer a fabulous opportunity to meet all the local artists, to see their works and hear their stories.

The painters, potters, photographers, sculptors and printmakers look forward to welcoming you and showcasing their incredible works and studios.

Look for their golden flags which indicate a Studio entrance.

Visit the Bathurst Arts Trail website for an interactive map of gallery locations and more information about the artists and if they will be open each month.

title: Reckless Western Winter
description:
From the ashes of Winterfests' Brew & Bite comes a brand new, first-of-its-kind event: Reckless Western Winter.

Whether you're a die-hard local or just passing through, this is your chance to shake off the chill and dive into three days packed to the brim with the best beers, killer tunes, and so much more.

With all local Beer, Wine & Spirit producers as well as a range of local food options, Reckless Western Winter is your ultimate excuse to embrace the season—Reckless style.

title: Dane Ballinger Memorial Truck Show
description:
The Dane Ballinger Memorial Truck Show is taking place at Bathurst Showgrounds. There will be plenty to see and do for the whole family, including over 200 market stalls, food stalls, entertainment and kids' rides.

Make a weekend out of it with the annual Bathurst Swap Meet Car and Bike Show being held as part of the same event.

title: Northern Sounds Karaoke
description:
'The real appeal of karaoke is that it isn’t exclusive just to those who can sing well – it’s an invitation for anyone, anywhere, to belt out a tune that the audience will probably recognise and sing along with too! It brings people together to appreciate music and creates a fun and connected atmosphere.'

Northern Sounds Karaoke hosted by Mary-Ann De Hoon is on at the club on the first Saturday of every month. Come down, have some fun and be the star of the show!
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Walcha Farmers' Market
description:
The market includes produce, pastries, espresso coffee, baked goods, cheeses, body products, condiments, honey, edible by-products, plants, a breakfast barbecue and a community stall.

Enjoy live music and kids activities.

See the website for further information.

title: Walcha Antique Machinery and Truck Show
description: Walcha Antique Machinery and Truck Show is hosted by Oxley Riders and includes a tractor trek, street parade, vintage - trucks, bikes, cars, engines, chainsaws and more.  Late model trucks and forestry machinery, a tractor pull, market stalls, swap meet, food stalls and kids' corner.

title: Winter in Walcha
description:
Winter in Walcha - 10 Degrees Cooler is a collection of events that embrace the cold and deliver on the crispness of high-altitude life. 

Held each year across three crisp Sundays in the heart of the New England High Country, these winter events bring together local artisans, makers, growers and foodies under a shared celebration of cool.

One day each month of June, July and August, McHattan Park, in the heart of Walcha, will become a winter village square - covered in snow, firepits crackling, music playing, locals and visitors wrapped up for warmth, clutching a hot chocolate and having a yarn.

Welcome to Winter in Walcha, where we love the frost, light the fires and celebrate the vibrancy of winter.

title: New England Tourist Trophy
description:
The New England Tourist Trophy (NETT) is a brand-new, closed-road targa-style GT race designed to position Walcha, NSW, as a signature drive tourism and motorsport destination. 

Scheduled for April 2026, the event will utilise a 22 kilometre section of Thunderbolts Way and feature competitive time trials in a high-performance, Targa-style format. 

It aims to attract visitors from across NSW and beyond, blending adrenaline with scenic beauty and small-town hospitality. NETT is designed to scale into a flagship annual event, serving as both an economic stimulus and a cultural showcase for the region.

title: Elders Love Lismore Show
description:
The North Coast National Lismore Show is coming back this year! Mark your calendars for the highlight of the year, as the Lismore Showgrounds come alive with three incredible days of fun and festivities.

The Show has been at the heart of the community since 1885 and is where memories are made. More details to be announced, stay up to date with updates on the website and social media pages.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Organic Market
description:
The Lismore Organic Market is a weekly market committed to providing local organic produce, reducing the carbon footprint. 

Stallholders have travelled an average of 20 kilometres rather than at least 1000 kilometres you would expect from most supermarket produce. 

Enjoy the atmosphere - this toddler/child-friendly market not only supplies you with the freshest vegetables you are likely to find anywhere (except your own garden), you can also get growing tips as you do your shopping.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Farmers Market
description:
The Lismore Farmers Market is a fabulous place in Lismore to get fresh fruit and vegetables directly from the growers. 

They have a large garden section with plants, mulch, compost, raised planters and worm wee. There are also honey, nuts, pork, lamb, boutique salami, eggs, bread, pastries, cakes, chocolates, spices, jams, pickles, sauces, kraut and kombucha.

There is plenty of parking as well as undercover shopping, kids entertainment, coffee, cakes and breakfast. Start the weekend with a scrumptious breakfast and coffee while listening to live music. Dogs on leads are welcome.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Doggy Day at Two Mates
description:
Calling all Furry Mates. Join Two Mates every Sunday for a pawesome day for you and your dogs! The Lismore taphouse is open to doggo visitors.

Little 'human' mates eat for free with every adult Mates meal each Sunday! Purchasing one adult meal means you get one free kid's meal.

You can bring the entire family along this Sunday at Two Mates Brewing
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Parkrun
description:
Lismore Parkrun is a free, fun, and friendly weekly five-kilometre community event. Walk, jog, run, volunteer or spectate!

Be there for the briefing at 6:50 am, ready to start at 7 am sharp!

All children under 11 years of age must be accompanied by an adult, guardian or other designated adult and participants can bring one dog on a short lead.

Bring your printed barcode to get your result at the end of each run. To register and print out your barcode, click sign up on the Lismore Parkrun Facebook page.

It's a great community event run by many passionate volunteers who love giving encouragement and enjoying each day. Best of all when your parkrun is finished you can join other park runners for a coffee.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Splendour in the Grass
description:
Running for more than two decades, Splendour is one of Australia’s premier music festivals. This iconic Byron festival draws in crowds nationally and is one of Australia’s largest festivals hosting genres from pop, indie, rock and more. 

With plenty of on-site camping, Splendour creates its own community for a weekend that is a heady mix of contemporary performing arts. Loved by music fans as much as by musicians, the festival offers plenty of other attractions beyond the main stages, including markets, after parties, comedy and much more. 

Please visit the website for more information.
host: SPLENDOUR IN THE GRASS PTY. LTD.

title: Lismore Supper Club
description:
The Supper Club Soul Band, featuring some of Australia's finest musicians, plays the best of blues, R&B, soul and funk every week to full houses at Lismore's unique, boutique music club (proudly sponsored by Planet Music). 

The band features Laura Nobel (voc/keys/flute) and Greg Lyon (bass/voc), with Geoff Wright (guitar/voc), Tony Slavich (keys/voc), Pete Wilkins (drums) and Cisco Biskit (aka Cristian Silva, percussion). Band members have played with Richard Clapton, Renee Geyer, Marcia Hines, Mondo Rock, Tina Turner, Rodriguez, Georgie Fame, Glenn Shorrock, Doug Parkinson, Max Merritt, Procol Harum and more. Regular special guests such as Matt Green, who plays guitar with Missy Higgins, are featured. 

Every Thursday at the Lismore City Bowlo, bring your own supper and your dancing shoes! For more information, follow The Lismore Supper Club on Facebook and Instagram.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Jazz Club
description:
Since 2004, The Lismore Jazz Club has been hosting live jazz gigs with local and big-city performers across an eclectic mix of jazz styles. 

Live gigs are held on the first Sunday of every month at the Lismore City Bowling Club in the Lismore town centre.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Heritage Park Railway Rides
description:
Established in November 1995, Heritage Park Railway is a 7 1/4" (184mm) Gauge Miniature Railway located right in the centre of town in Lismore. 

Heritage Park Railway has train rides running on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays as well as every day in school holidays. A wonderful day out for all the family with free barbeque facilities and plenty of play equipment for children of all ages.  

For train ride times please visit the website. Train rides are weather permitting.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Binalong Community Markets
description:
Don't miss the opportunity to experience its unique markets, which are held every second Sunday of the month at the Cafe on Queen. You'll find a variety of wonderful stalls to enjoy!

If you haven't visited Binalong in some time, why not plan a visit to explore this charming town?

title: Gremlins - School Holidays Matinee
description:
Join Cult Classic Lismore these school holidays for a special family matinee screening of this beloved 80s classic, Gremlins. 

When young Billy receives an unusual pet named Gizmo, he's given just three simple rules: Don't expose it to sunlight. Don't get it wet and absolutely no feeding after midnight. Naturally, everything goes wrong and a small town is soon overrun by mischievous, popcorn loving monsters.

These school holidays remind yourself why Gremlins has become a cult favourite across generations, a perfect mix of 80s creature charm and family friendly scares.

title: The Big Bike Film Night - Lismore
description:
Let the good times roll; they're riding into town!

The Big Bike Film Night is on a mission- bringing the best short cycling films from around the world together for you!

Cycle through 2.5 hours of thrilling and moving bike-related films that has everything a cycle-centric audience could want - action, drama, humour, and plenty of inspiration; the evening is unashamedly and utterly, utterly, utterly designed and devised for the two-wheel devotee!

The movies in the 2025 collection have been specifically sought to delight you with arguably the finest selection yet of films from the exotic location of northern Pakistan to the suburban streets of Santa Barbara in America, from the soaring mountain peaks of Austria to backcountry New Zealand to the captivating Scottish Highlands, all in the mix!

Thanks to Presenting Partner Ngā Haerenga Great Rides of New Zealand you could win a great Rides of New Zealand holiday!

Grab your mates, grab your tickets, go on…grab your bike and come along for the ride!

title: The Big Bike Film Night
description:
The Big Bike Film Night is on a mission - bringing the best short cycling films from around the world together for you.

Showcasing 2.5 hours of riveting bike films that have everything a cycle-centric audience could want – action, drama, humour, and plenty of inspiration. The evening is unashamedly and utterly, utterly, utterly designed and devised to delight the two-wheel devotee!

These short films are a great reminder of why we love to ride our bike; with stories that captivate us, stories that move us, and most importantly of all – inspiring us to get out and ride.  All celebrate the fun, adventure, and joy that cycling enables.

Listen to the voice inside you; it's telling you to go. Grab your mates, go on, grab your bike and come along for the ride.

title: Laneways of Lismore Arts Festival
description:
Laneways of Lismore Arts Festival (LOLA) is a brand-new, free event set to transform Lismore's iconic laneways into a buzzing celebration of art and music.

The inaugural festival will feature a standout line-up including live performances by Mitch Tambo, indie favourites Cool Sounds and Eggy presented by Jet Black Cat, and dancefloor energy from FLO DJ's. 

Celebrated visual artists Paul McNeil (Mambo, Deus ex Machina) and Marty Baptist will bring bold, immersive works to life across the precinct, alongside interactive lighting experiences, vintage, vinyl and art markets, a curated children's zone, food stalls and licensed bars. 

LOLA invites locals and visitors from across the Northern Rivers and beyond to experience Lismore's unique creative culture. 

Proudly funded by Lismore City Council and the Australian Government Regional Arts Fund, LOLA is set to become a highlight on the region's cultural calendar.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: LisAmore!
description:
LisAmore! is an annual celebration of Italian culture, bringing together the community and visitors for a vibrant day filled with authentic Italian food, live music, dancing, and Italian cars and bikes. 

Enjoy language workshops, and captivating Commedia dell’Arte characters, and there are plenty of activities for kids, including outdoor games, chess and soccer, Italian and Bundjalung language lessons, and creative craft fun.

Come and experience the magic of Italy right here in beautiful NSW.

LisAmore! is an unforgettable celebration of friendship, culture, and community.

title: Planet Music Live Music
description:
Get along to the Planet Music Shop Show for free shows that promotes local musicians, giving them a stage to make absolute magic!

Musicians perform on the store stage in Keen Street, everyone is welcome, so come along and enjoy the great street atmosphere.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Eisteddfod
description:
The 2025 Lismore Eisteddfod is set to take place from the end of August until mid-September. 

Welcoming more than 2000 amateur performing artists, aged from 4 to 50 years. 

The performances include: schools - choirs and bands, school dance and dramatic groups; vocalists - solo, duet and choral; instrumentalists - piano, woodwind, string and brass; and speech and drama – poetry, prose and drama, dance - solos and duets in ballet, tap, contemporary, lyrical, jazz, national character, hip hop and dance troupes.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Darrel Chapman Fun Run
description:
The Darrel Chapman Fun Run is an event that has been established in Lismore for over 25 years.

The NAB, Lismore City Council and the Lord’s Taverners team with Our Kids to make this event a reality.

There is a 4 kilometre, 10 kilometre, 21 kilometre and Virtual Marathon.

All funds raised from the Darrel Chapman Fun Run will go to ‘Our Kids’. ‘Our Kids’ is a local charity that raises money to purchase lifesaving equipment for local hospitals. Keeping kids local when needing urgent medical care.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Produce Market
description:
The Lismore Produce Market is held in the heart of Lismore's central business district with around 30 stalls selling 100 per cent locally grown seasonal goods.

Stalls include produce, seedlings, handmade cosmetics, cleaning products, candles, seafood, wines, cheeses, freshly baked bread, coffee, cakes, pickles, jams, dips, fresh flowers and other home-cooked treats.

Local musicians play each week to keep you entertained. Rain, hail or shine, the market community are there, nourishing the community with quality, local food.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: BLAKyard Music
description: Come to the Quad for an electrifying evening of BLAK music performances, by an incredible line-up of talented artists! Funded by Revive Live - an Australian Government initiative.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Fire Twirling in the Quad
description:
Join us in the Quad for free fire twirling fun for the whole family. 

This is held on the first and third Thursday of the month, after the Lismore Produce Market.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Our Backyard - Bobby Alu & Blakboi
description:
Our Backyard is a legacy program for Lismore. This free all-ages series showcases local musical talent monthly on Thursdays, after the Lismore Produce Market. 

Featuring: 

Bobby Alu - Australian/Samoan singer, ukulele strummer and drummer Bobby Alu's music makes you feel like you have your favourite drink in hand, sipping as the sun sets on a warm evening that's laden with the promise of adventure. 

Blakboi - Kamilaroi/Maori singer, songwriter and producer. A multi-instrumentalist who loops beats, keys, guitars, voice and dij. Award-winning musician, visual artist and activist, surfer and poet. Blakboi will change the way you see the world. 

Bring friends and a rug, and enjoy some free and family friendly live music in the park!
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Rural Women's Gathering Lismore
description:
The NSW Rural Women's Gathering is now open for registrations, to bring women from regional, rural and remote areas of NSW together in the heart of the Northern Rivers Region.

Attendees will be treated to a diverse range of activities and workshops, each offering new experiences and skills-building opportunities. 

Be immersed in Lismore's arts and cultural scene, feel inspired by the stories you hear and the people you meet, plus you'll be entertained and hosted like never before.

The annual Gathering is a fantastic opportunity for women living in regional and remote areas of NSW to come together and connect, celebrate and learn. You will meet new people, learn new skills, visit new places and overall, have a fabulous time.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Bright Light Habits by Converge
description:
You are invited to the opening of Bright Lights Habits, a group exhibition by the Converge residency artists, curated by Linsey Gosper.

Over the past 12 months, 11 Lismore-based artists have shared space and ideas inside an industrial building on Woodlark Street, Lismore. As part of the Converge residency program, they've been creating new work under bright studio lights—experimenting, collaborating, and engaging with the community through workshops, events, and artistic exchange.
 
Now, in the final two weeks of the residency, the artists will present the culmination of their year-long journey in a group exhibition. Spanning film, ceramics, sculpture, painting, installation, printmaking, costume design, and participatory projects, the show highlights the depth and diversity of practice within this vibrant creative cohort.

Exhibiting artists: Aaron McGarry, Adrienne Kenafake, Annie Monks, Antionette O'Brien, Chris Lego, Karenza Ebejer, Matt O'Brien, Michelle Gilroy, Paul Walker, Scott Sinclair, Stefanie Miriklis.
 
Don't miss this opportunity to experience the energy and output of this dynamic group of artists.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Collage Club
description:
Facilitated by Linsey Gosper and Hilda Wang, find us under the awning of the Lismore Regional Gallery in the Quad. Collage Club is a free creative recovery program for the community and all materials are provided. The event is wheelchair accessible, and Auslan interpretation is available upon request. Once a month, the Collage Club has an exceptional guest artist facilitator. 

The Collage Club is a creative recovery activity, presented by Lismore Regional Gallery in partnership with the Lismore Quad. This event coincides with the Lismore Produce Market so you can make art, stock your pantry and catch up with friends.

title: Archibald Prize 2024
description:
The annual Archibald Prize is eagerly anticipated by artists and audiences alike. Save the date, the Archibald Prize returns to Lismore Regional Gallery for the second time. Judged by the trustees of the Art Gallery of NSW, the prize is awarded to a notable portrait painting annually. Since 1921, it has highlighted figures from all walks of life, from famous faces to local heroes, reflecting back to us the stories of our times.

The 2024 Archibald Prize features works by Northern NSW artists Angus MacDonald, Ben Smith, and Matt Adnate.

title: Gathering Space
description:
Come along, grab a cuppa, have a yarn, and create! This monthly gathering space is open to Aboriginal artists and community members to learn, share, create, and collaborate. Kylie Caldwell, Bundjalung weaver and fibre artist, will be available to assist on the day. It is free, all materials are provided, and no registration is required. 

About Kylie Caldwell
Kylie is an experimental Bundjalung interdisciplinary artist based in Northern Rivers, NSW. Her diverse creative practice proactively seeks to delve deeper into contemporary and traditional Aboriginal values. She explores various mediums and themes, focusing on reviving and sharing cultural practices and understanding. Through her past work as an Indigenous Arts Officer, Kylie had the opportunity to work on a number of meaningful projects, including producing a weaving publication, coordinating Aboriginal art markets, co-producing a film and facilitating various weaving and creative workshops.

title: Naidoc Celebration Day at Crozier Field
description:
NAIDOC Week is celebrated by communities across Australia and is a great opportunity to learn more about culture, history and challenges the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people have faced.

This year's theme, The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy, is about looking to the future while honouring the knowledge and stories of the past. The day kicks off with a Welcome to Country and Smoking Ceremony, followed by a full program of live music, activities and stalls.
 
Local talent is in the spotlight. Mitch King, a proud Yaegl and Widjabul Wia-bul man from the Bundjalung Nation, returns to the stage with his unique blend of music, theatre and dance. He's joined by Blakboi (Tom Avery), a Bundjalung-based singer-songwriter whose sound blends folk, reggae and hip-hop with stories from Gomeroi and Māori roots.
 
Families can expect craft and hands-on cultural activities, plus more community stalls than ever, offering food, support services, handmade goods and unique finds.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Lismore Masters Games
description:
Get ready for a thrilling weekend of sport, fun, and community at the 13th biennial Lismore Workers Masters Games! Proudly supported by Lismore Workers Club, the event headquarters will be hosted at the Club, including registration and social activities.

This iconic multi-sport event welcomes mature-age athletes of all levels to compete, reconnect, and celebrate the spirit of the Games. Choose from nine exciting sports: Netball, Softball, Lawn Bowls, Oztag, Football (11-a-side), Cricket, Baseball, Golf, and Hockey. Whether you're playing to win or just for the love of the game, there's something for everyone!

The Games also boast a legendary social program, featuring live bands and entertainment, ensuring the fun continues off the field. Don't miss the Lismore Workers Club Lismore Cup —perfectly timed with the Games weekend.

Drawing over 1,000 participants from across the country, the Lismore Masters Games has been a regional highlight since 1999. 

Come for the sport—stay for the camaraderie!
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: NSW Open Golf Regional Qualifying Series - Lismore
description:
Lismore has scored a major win, confirmed as a host for the NSW Open Golf Regional Qualifying Series in both 2025 and 2026 — cementing its place on the map for major regional sporting events.

The 36-hole tournament, includes an 18-hole pro-am and two days of competitive play. It forms part of a six-event series across NSW feeding into the 2025 FORD NSW Open Championship.

Each qualifier offers a AUD50,000 purse for professionals, with the top three finishers — professional or amateur — earning a spot in the NSW Open this November. The series kicks off at Teven Valley Golf Club near Ballina and concludes in September at Queanbeyan.

Lismore's event is expected to attract top-tier talent from Australia and overseas. 

Known for its quality course and strong community support, Lismore Workers Golf Club is well-prepared to host a tournament of this scale.

Backed by Lismore City Council, Destination NSW and Golf NSW, the event further strengthens the city's growing reputation as a premier destination for high-profile events.

Professional entries are managed by the PGA of Australia, while amateur entry is based on GA handicap and submitted online.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Warbirds Over Scone
description:
Prepare for an aviation spectacle like no other! Warbirds Over Scone returns, with its most impressive lineup yet, and quite possibly the largest display of warbirds and historic aircraft seen in Australian skies yet!

Marvel at an incredible collection of iconic and historic warbirds in action, including formation aerobatic displays with the beloved Spitfire, Mustang, Corsair and Kittyhawk, just to name a few.

Beyond the skies, enjoy a vibrant festival atmosphere with amusement rides, aviation museum, vintage car displays, local markets, and diverse food stalls. It's more than an airshow - it's a family-friendly celebration of Australian aviation history and community spirit.

title: Fair Dinkum Pickleball Social Sessions
description:
Join the Fun at Social Pickleball Sessions! 

Looking for a fun way to stay active and meet new people? Whether you're a seasoned pro or a complete beginner, Social Pickleball Sessions are perfect for all ages and abilities!

Play in a laid-back, social atmosphere that’s all about enjoying the game and meeting new people.

Improve Your Game: Learn new skills, enhance your technique, and boost your fitness in a supportive environment.

Great for players of all ages – bring the kids, grandparents, and everyone in between!

In social doubles play, participants rotate partners to keep the game fresh and engaging. Friendly instructors are available to guide you and help you improve your skills. So grab your paddle and get ready to play! All necessary equipment is available for hire.

Sign up today and experience the joy of pickleball!

title: Desks of Fabric - Scone Museum
description:
A century after students carved their initials and words into two large cedar school desks from Scone Grammar School, these historic artifacts located at Scone Museum were reimagined through the This Here Then Now Museum activation program by Arts Upper Hunter. With support from the Regional Arts Fund, textile artist Sophie Cox was commissioned to respond creatively to the desks, producing an installation using rubbings and embroidery.

Scone Grammar School students played a key role, participating in embroidery workshops led by Sophie and Museum volunteers, where they stitched directly into the rubbings.

The work was recently unveiled in a temporary installation and is now on permanent display at the Museum along with these incredible desks of history. Visitors can view this exhibition during the Museum's opening hours. Visits outside these times can be arranged by appointment by phoning ahead.  

The This Here Then Now project was conceived by Arts Upper Hunter and developed in partnership with local museums.  This was made possible by the Australian Government Regional Arts Fund, which supports the arts in regional and remote Australia, the NSW Government and C B Alexander Foundation.

title: Brunswick Heads Woodchop
description:
The Brunswick Woodchop Carnival is currently regarded as the biggest wood chopping event outside the Sydney and Brisbane shows and draws international contestants from New Zealand, US and Canada.

The annual Woodchop Carnival runs every January with over 80 men, women and children set to compete in the three day event.

The first woodchop competition in Brunswick Heads was held in 1928, with the aim of raising funds to build the footbridge linking the town to the beachfront, and ran until 1932.

The second series began in 1961 when Noel McGregor, who ran the carnival, sought sponsorship to bring it back.

There is no admission cost to the carnival and everyone is welcome to come along to watch the events.

title: Upper Hunter Quilt Adventure
description:
Upper Hunter Quilt Adventure offers an opportunity for quilters to display their quilts. This is not a competition, but there will be a prize for the viewer's choice.  

The quilts will be displayed in the Scone Arts & Crafts building in Scone, NSW. This building has two halls.  The main hall will have the quilts, and the second hall will have some displays from quilt supplies.

The Arts & Crafts also has a large garden, and this is where you will find market stalls. The local ceramic group will also be opening the pot house so you can learn more about what happens there.

Light lunch and good coffee will be available over the weekend.

title: Producers’ Dinner with Lark Hill Winery
description:
The Rockley Pub will be bringing in the next instalment of their long running dinner series highlighting producers. This dinner will be held in collaboration with the award-winning Lark Hill
Winery (Bungendore); the first non-local producer to take part. Guests will indulge in a four course shared-style menu, expertly paired with a selection of exceptional wines from Lark Hill.

title: Blues, Brews and BBQ’s
description:
Get Ready for a Legendary Day of Blues, Brews, and BBQs!

Tumut’s ultimate music festival is back in 2025! Whether you're a long-time fan or a first-timer, this is the one event you won’t want to miss.

Rock the Turf and Blues & Brews BBQs is set to light up Tumut, with a killer line-up of live tunes, delicious food, and top-notch drinks. Held at the stunning Riverglade Caravan Park, right next to the picturesque Tumut River, it’s the perfect backdrop for a laid-back day of good vibes, great music, and even better company.

2025 Line Up...

Ray Beadle
Bondi Cigars
19Twenty
Nathan Cavaleri
Marshall & the Fro
The Blues Factory
Minnie Marks
Jess Crossman
Rock Solid

Bring your crew, grab your mates, and soak in the fun – this is more than just a festival, it’s an unforgettable day out.

Mark your calendars and make sure you’re there – you deserve a day of music, food, and pure joy.

See you at Tumut’s biggest party of the year!

Important: If you have reserved a site at the caravan park, they will be in touch with you directly to arrange your tickets for the event.

title: Anh Do - Tumut
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'
Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.
When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Snowy Valleys Markets
description: The Snowy Valleys Markets are held in Tumut NSW and are a collection of local and regional market stalls from produce, food to fashion and craft, find a collection of handmade gems and gourmet eats.

title: Anousha Victoire & Emmy Ryan Live at Pearces Creek Hall
description:
Folk singer-songwriters Anousha Victoire and Emmy Ryan will perform a special songwriters in the round show at Pearces Creek Hall this July. 
Returning to the Northern Rivers where they both spent their early years, Anousha and Emmy bring with them a wealth of musical stories and original songs shaped by landscapes, life experiences and a shared love of authentic folk storytelling. 
Anousha, now based in Newcastle, once attended Pearces Creek Public School and returns to the hall where she performed as a child.
 Emmy, most recently based in Alice Springs, is visiting her old stomping ground as part of her east coast tour promoting her latest release, I Ain't So Blue. Both artists recently performed at the National Folk Festival and previously shared the stage at the Tamworth Country Music Festival.
 
Audiences can expect a warm and intimate performance, with evocative lyrics, rich harmonies and acoustic folk instrumentation in a uniquely personal setting.

title: Rous Unplugged at Rous Mill Hall
description:
Rous Unplugged is a monthly live music event held at the historic Rous Mill Hall, just outside Ballina in the Northern Rivers. Set in an intimate, welcoming venue, this laid-back showcase celebrates the region's vibrant music scene and community spirit.

Each month features a fresh line-up of local acoustic artists and singer-songwriters, delivering everything from indie-folk originals to bluesy tunes and heartfelt covers. With no booming amps or big-stage production, it's all about stripped-back performances, great music, and relaxed vibes.

Doors open from 6:15pm, inviting guests to arrive early, grab a drink, and enjoy an easy-going Friday evening as the sun sets over the hinterland. The atmosphere is warm, social, and inclusive — perfect for locals and visitors looking to connect with the area's creative heart.

Rous Unplugged offers a memorable night out in the Northern Rivers, blending authentic live music with country charm. Whether you're a music lover or simply keen to unwind, it's a community-driven experience that hits the right notes every time.

title: Bangalow Market
description:
The Bangalow Markets are on the fourth Sunday of every month. It is a gathering of locals, a get-together of artists, artisans, bakers, victuallers, therapists, farmers and friends. You can hear the languages of people from far-off lands. Backpackers and celebrities alike make a day of the markets. 

The Bangalow Market is a treat for day trippers, a retreat from the city and the rush of the Gold Coast. Bangalow is a window into another world. Come for the day.

Part of the continuing success of the market is the beautiful grounds the markets are held in, which are dominated by eleven huge camphor laurel trees which provide welcome shade and rustling leaves and a magic forest atmosphere.

title: Bangalow Show
description:
Since 1897 when the first Bangalow Show was held, the Bangalow Agricultural and Industrial Society has strived to bring to the community a collection of rural exhibits and a reason for socialising and friendship.

These days the annual Bangalow Show still holds true to its agricultural roots, while also bringing exciting fun for all.

Whether it be the events in the main ring, a look at the cattle or poultry, a gentle stroll through the exhibits in the Pavilion, or being dragged through Sideshow Alley by the kids, there is something for everyone at the Bangalow Show.

For 2 days in  November each year the showground resonates with the sounds of cattle, horses,and sideshow alley. The pavilions are filled with produce, poultry and everything you could make or bake.
Head along and join them - it's fun for all the family.

title: Byron Writers Festival
description:
The Byron Writers Festival is set over three days on beautiful Bundjalung Country in the hinterland town of Bangalow, 15 minutes from Byron Bay. The festival offers writing workshops, book launches, an engaging program for children, and events across the Northern Rivers region.

For three days in August, more than 140 writers and thinkers will come together to ponder the power of stories and the written word in shaping who we are. Listen to compelling conversations spanning a mix of genres including environment, first nations, politics, philosophy, music, art, social issues and of course memoir and fiction.

The festival experience is designed for discovery and delight. There are six venues to explore – marquees,  Hakea, Acacia, Melaleuca and Lilly Pilly, a smaller conversational tent, The Coolamon, and the A&I Hall. Your festival pass includes access to all festival sessions.

Enjoy food stalls, coffee carts and bars, browse artisan markets, a sculpture walk and festival book shop. Meet your favourite writers and have your books signed after festival sessions.

3 Day or 1 Day Pass Tickets available.

title: Alstonville Agricultural Show
description:
Get ready for an unforgettable experience at the Alstonville Agricultural Show.

This year, they are pulling out all the stops to bring you two days of action-packed entertainment. Join them on Friday morning for the always exciting dog trials, and then head over to sideshow alley as the evening comes alive with a vibrant carnival atmosphere. With free entry on Friday, there's no better way to kick off your weekend.

Saturday is a full day of family fun and traditional show events, including animal displays, bull ride, pavilion displays, and children's activities. Don’t miss out on the impressive poultry displays, cattle show, and thrilling horse ring events. They also have food trucks and trade displays for you to enjoy.

The excitement continues into the night with a spectacular lineup of record-breaking entertainment, headlined by the return of the Monster Trucks, a crowd favourite. The night culminates in a breathtaking fireworks display at approximately 8:15pm, lighting up the sky in a grand finale that will leave you in awe.

They are thrilled to bring back the Monster Trucks and rodeo, promising an evening of high-octane thrills and spills. 

Don't miss out—mark your calendars and join them for a weekend of fun, excitement, and memories to last a lifetime!

title: Alstonville Quota Craft and Garden Fair
description:
Get set for a vibrant weekend of creativity, craftsmanship and green-thumb inspiration at the Quota Alstonville Craft and Garden Fair – a much-loved event in the heart of the Northern Rivers.

Explore a delightful showcase of handmade crafts, unique gifts and garden treasures, lovingly created by local artisans and passionate gardeners. Whether you're on the hunt for that perfect plant, a bespoke present, or simply after a fun-filled day out, the fair promises something for all ages and interests.

Wander through a variety of market stalls featuring handcrafted goods, original artwork and all things garden-related. Take part in garden workshops, pick up expert tips and enjoy a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere. There's a great selection of food and drink on offer to keep you fuelled throughout the day, plus activities to keep the kids entertained.

The event is more than just a great day out – it's also a fundraiser for valuable local community projects, so every purchase and entry helps make a difference.

Proudly hosted by Quota Alstonville, this event celebrates local talent, community connection and the joy of handmade and homegrown. Don't miss this opportunity to support local, be inspired and enjoy a colourful weekend in beautiful Alstonville.

title: Alstonville Community Market
description:
The Alstonville Community Markets are held at the Alstonville Showground on the third Saturday of every month.

There will be plenty to enjoy including great food, artisan crafts and products, family entertainment, clothing, local charities and so much more. Enjoy exploring the markets then wander through the main street afterwards and explore the beautiful village of Alstonville.

title: Airheads - Alstonville
description:
Australia's largest inflatable obstacle course is coming to Alstonville Showgrounds these School Holidays! 

Grab your tickets for entry to the obstacle course, mechanical surfboard, giant slide, wrecking ball, ninja wall plus the toddler playground (for the toddlers only).

Tickets price includes entry to Australia's Biggest Obstacle Course , all rides and the toddler playground.

title: Carols on the Plateau
description:
Alstonville is getting into the Christmas spirit with the annual Carols on the Plateau! Returning bigger and brighter this year and proudly presented by the combined Churches of Alstonville and Wollongbar, the Carols on the Plateau is a cherished tradition for over 30 years.

This is a wonderful event to feel the love of the community and the importance of bringing everyone together to celebrate Christmas together.

The program includes performances from local schools, preschools, and performing arts groups for a wonderful community sing-a-long. With free rides, face painting, an animal farm, and even a sausage sizzle - there is something for everyone.

So bring your family, friends, your picnic blankets, and your warmed-up vocal chords for a joyful, alcohol-free evening under the stars.

title: Newrybar Bonfire and Fireworks
description:
Don't miss the annual Newrybar Bonfire and Fireworks. A huge one for the local community and a great family night out.

Newrybar Public School is set to light up the night sky once again with its iconic, annual bonfire and fireworks spectacular. Newrybar is keeping a 35-year tradition alive with this much-treasured community event. For newcomers to this epic night, the Newrybar fireworks display does not disappoint. 

The event will be bigger and better than ever this year with a giant bonfire, food and entertainment for the whole family. So, roll up! Bring your good vibes, picnic blankets, winter woollies, and flashlights and join them for the most anticipated family event this winter.

title: Newrybar Twilight Market
description:
Every Wednesday Newrybar Hall hosts the Newrybar Twilight Market. 

The farmers market boasts a range of local produce as well as delicious local eats including fresh local produce cakes, tarts, slices, burger and chips, curries, breads, and honey. 

Bring a picnic blanket and enjoy the range of dinner options as well as sweet treats. 

This market has a great family atmosphere and is well worth the visit!

title: French Cooking Class
description:
In this exciting cooking class with Le Cordon Bleu London trained chef Katie White, you will learn how to create classic French dishes to make in your own kitchen for years to come. Roast chicken with celeriac puree, ratatouille, creme brûlée, tarte tartan, and confit garlic are just some of the classic French options to explore during the class. You will learn invaluable basic French techniques including making a mirepoix base for all your soups, classic French sauces such as jus or hollandaise to bring every meal together, and creme anglaise to accompany any dessert.

As with all Katie's classes, the focus is on seasonal and sustainable food. For example, you will learn how to get the most out of all the produce used with very minimal waste. You will also have the option to learn how to make vegetarian versions of each dish so that all your guests can enjoy. Gluten Free versions of this class can be easily adapted too, upon request.

title: Seasonal Feasts, including 5 recipes
description:
Join talented plant based chef and author Katie White as she guides you to make delicious plant-based recipes that are packed full with flavor! Each participant will receive a copy of her nationally published book, The Seasonal Vegan, from which you will work from through the class.

Depending on the season at the time, you will make recipes from the seasonal chapters of the book, helping you know exactly what produce to enjoy at that particular time of the year.
This class will give you new and exciting ways to cook incredible home made vegan meals that will satisfy everyone in the family and surprise and impress your guests! You will learn about the best and most delicious ways to replace dairy products, eggs and proteins. We will also touch on balancing meals in a healthy way, and completing them on a culinary level too.

title: Fresh Pasta Making Class
description:
Ready to embark on a fun and hands on unforgettable culinary adventure full of laughter? Look no further than this Italian cooking class led by the talented Le Cordon Bleu London trained chef and author, Katie White.
In this workshop, you'll learn how to make delicious fresh pasta from scratch and have a laugh along the way. From silky fettuccini to pillows of ravioli, Katie will guide you through every step of the process.

title: Alstonville New Year's Eve Family Festival
description:
Send off the last day of the year with the family at the New Year's Eve Family Festival at Alstonville Showground.

There will be lots of fun activities, plenty of great rides, kids character shows, food stalls and live music. The night will end with a wonderful fireworks show! And the good thing is, you will be home in time to wake up feeling great in 2026!

A fantastic evening, alcohol-free – great family night for the whole extended family.

title: Aberdeen Highland Games
description:
The annual Aberdeen Highland Games takes place on first weekend in July each year and are run in conjunction with the Scottish Australia Heritage Council's Heritage Week. 

During the day a number of events take place together with stalls providing food great coffee and Scottish/Celtic displays all of which represent traditional Celtic culture and recreation. The games are a gathering of pipe bands, Clans, dancers, heavy event participants, to help celebrate the Scottish/Celtic history of the Upper Hunter. There are a number of novelty events for children.
Parking is free attendants will guide you in.
Your tickets can be booked online.

Visit the website for further details.

On the Sunday morning a traditional Kirkin of the tartan service is held in St Marks Anglican Church in Moray Street Aberdeen.  Followed by a morning tea at the community hall in the rose garden across from the church.  All welcome

title: All Female Oceania Cup
description:
Alstonville Football Club's All Female Oceania Cup is two days of competition for females aged 10 to adult culminating in finals to determine the Oceania Cup champions in Grades 12, 14, 16, Open B and Open A.

Teams travel from various places around Australia as well as locally.

This is a great spectator sport to watch teams compete for the overall Oceania Cup trophy.

title: Winter Food Festival
description:
Come and experience the magic of winter at the Winter Food Festival, suited to all ages! 

This event offers something for the whole family. Explore a variety of food vendors serving up delicious seasonal treats and browse market stalls filled with unique finds. 

Keep the energy alive with live music on stage, creating a warm and festive atmosphere throughout the day. Plus, enjoy a range of family-friendly entertainment for visitors young and old. 

Whether you're coming for the food, the music, or the fun, the Winter Food Festival is the perfect way to celebrate the season with your loved ones. Don't miss out on a day packed with great flavours, lively entertainment, and unforgettable family moments.

title: Capertee Valley Bird Festival
description:
The Capertee Valley Bird Festival is a new, exciting event set to take place in the Capertee Valley, New South Wales. The festival will celebrate the rich biodiversity of the valley, particularly its renowned bird species. 

Designed for experienced birders and novices, as well as those looking for an experience focused on nature. The program will offer a range of options designed to educate, entertain, and inspire appreciation for birds, their natural habitats, and the environment of the Capertee Valley.

title: Byron Bay International Film Festival
description:
The Byron Bay International Film Festival is more than just a film festival — it's a 10-day cinematic celebration set in one of Australia's most iconic coastal towns.

Each year, The Byron Bay International Film Festival transforms Byron Bay and surrounding regional venues into vibrant hubs of creativity, connection, and discovery. From breathtaking dramas and groundbreaking documentaries to mind-bending immersive experiences and bold new voices in cinema, The Byron Bay International Film Festival delivers a world-class program that's diverse, thought-provoking, and full of heart.

Whether you're a seasoned film buff, a curious first-timer, or simply looking for a unique night out, you'll find something to fall in love with — from red carpet galas and filmmaker Q&As to surf films, music videos, and social events under the stars. The festival is your chance to mingle with local legends, rising talent, and global guests - and experience film the way it was meant to be: together.

The Byron Bay International Film Festival is a celebration of community, storytelling, and the power of film to spark conversation, connection, and change. Come be part of the magic — and discover why Byron's homegrown festival has earned a global reputation as one of Australia's most inspiring cultural events.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Byron Bay
description:
In 2021, Andrew spent four months in two of Sydney's maximum-security prisons for the supply of psychedelic drugs. He had a great time.

Best Newcomer Nominee – Melbourne International Comedy Festival, 2023

title: Teven Tintenbar Country Fair
description:
Head to the hinterland and grab a bargain while entertaining the kids at the Teven-Tintenbar Public School's annual Country Fair.

Enjoy a day of various kids activities including the Storm Swing, the Ninja Warrior Obstacle Course, Wild West Jumping Castle and a Giant Slide.

Visitors can try their luck at games, or snare a bargain at the bric-a-brac, toys and book stalls. 

In addition to the delicious cake, home made goods and revamped fresh produce stall, there is a wealth of fresh lunch options courtesy of the school's many gourmet cooks.

Set in beautiful grounds, and with some great musical entertainment on offer, it's a guaranteed fun day out for young and old.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Byron Bay
description:
All of reality, as we can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in our minds.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of life’s biggest questions: Why are we here? Are we alone in the universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?

You’ll laugh and you’ll learn, but you’ll never look at anything the same, once you enter… The Mind Field.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Byron Bay
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  

Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   

It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Byron Twilight Market
description:
Held at Railway Park, offering an evening filled with local artisans, vibrant live music, and a true taste of Byron's creative spirit.  

Kick off your weekend by browsing unique, handcrafted products, enjoying delicious food, and listening to live music performances. 

With its relaxed atmosphere, the Byron Twilight Market is the perfect spot to support local makers and enjoy a Saturday night under the stars.

Held every Saturday from October to April.

title: Byron Community Market
description:
Come along to the Byron Community Market, held on the 1st Sunday of every month! This original and iconic market is a true celebration of Byron Bay’s vibrant community and local artisans.

Live local, shop local, and explore an eclectic range of hand-made creations, from bespoke jewelry and homewares to unique clothing and art. There’s something for everyone to discover while soaking up the lively, welcoming atmosphere. Delicious food and refreshing drinks from local vendors complete the experience.

Each month, enjoy live performances from talented local musicians, providing the perfect soundtrack as you browse the stalls and enjoy a relaxed Sunday.

They are proud to partner with local charities at every market, helping to raise awareness and support causes that matter to the Byron community.

Don’t miss out on this iconic Byron experience! Spend your Sunday exploring the best of what Byron Bay has to offer, supporting local businesses, and taking home one-of-a-kind treasures. It’s the ultimate way to experience the heart of Byron Bay.

title: Mindfulness Escapes Byron Bay
description:
Half a day meditation and mindfulness workshop in nature.

You will learn different meditation techniques to quiet the mind and become more in control of your thoughts. The workshop includes sitting meditations and walking meditations.

They teach various mindfulness techniques that are easily applied back into your days  for a healthier, happier and stressless life.

They practice outdoors for an enjoyable experience and to discover beautiful Byron Bay.

The workshop is catered for any level, beginner to experienced.

Please visit the website for more information and booking.

title: Byron Bay Surf Festival
description:
The Byron Bay Surf Festival brings the spirit, culture and joys of surfing to the shores of Byron Bay every year since 2010. 

Considered one of Australia's most inclusive surfing events with a program of surfing competitions and surf culture that includes art exhibitions, environmental awareness, sustainability and the growth of women and children in the sport, and live gigs throughout the extended Byron central business district. 

The Byron Bay Surf Festival is aptly tag-lined "Surf Culture Now" which encapsulates what its all about and what it means to the local and interstate surf communities.

title: Yoga and Meditation Retreat Byron Bay
description:
Awaken Meditation Retreats offer quality yoga retreats in northern NSW, near Byron Bay Australia.

They specialise in private meditation and yoga classes, mindfulness workshops and health retreats in Byron Bay.

From one hour private sessions, to half-day mindfulness excursions or week retreats, they mainly focus on well being, inner peace and nature.

The week-long retreats combine yoga, healthy vegetarian food, and meditation practice with outdoor excursions to the 'must see' places of the Byron Shire to make the most of the incredible beauty of the region with its stunning beaches and rainforests. 

All meals and accommodation are included to provide a unique life changing experience.  

For more information please visit the website.

title: Tintenbar Up Front
description:
Tintenbar Up Front is held every month and gives the opportunity for performers of all kinds - musicians, poets, comedians, dancers - to strut their stuff in a wonderful old hall. 

Come see the lady from the shop, hear that guy from the mechanic's belt out a tune on the guitar, and have a drop with your neighbour.  Bring the kids for the Friday wind down.

If you have been before, you know there will be quality in all the performances.  From delicate finger-picked songs to intricate arrangements of classical and contemporary recorder pieces, from well-spun yarns to humorous poems of the bush.

Bev Singh's provides a delicious Indian banquet but you must book to ensure you get a meal. Indian banquet starts 1 hour prior to the show. 

This is a wonderful community event, so grab some friends and enjoy a night out.

title: Mate V Mate Fishing Challenge
description:
The inaugural Mate V Mate Fishing Challenge will be one to remember!!

The Mate V Mate Fishing Challenge will be held at Lake Burrinjuck. 
Anglers will compete in a weekend of friendly rivalry, testing their skills for exciting prizes. This thrilling event offers participants the opportunity to create lasting memories while enjoying the stunning lake surroundings.

Heaps of prizes, live auctions, music from Stewart Batron and your chance to meet the Cod Tales Pod Cast Lads.

Every entrenat will go into the draw to win a Quintrex 360 Wanderer, so get your tickets now!

title: Vibes on the Green
description:
Vibes on the Green is a small-scale music festival with local and traveling artists on the greens of the Portland Golf Course. 

This celebrates local artists and provides much-needed entertainment at very reasonable prices for the surrounding small communities. 

There are multiple acts, including a children's act, throughout the day to suit everyone's needs.
host: PORTLAND COMMUNITY SPORT AND REC CLUB

title: Bowning Hill Walk
description:
The Yass Valley SPIN Foundation's annual Bowning Hill Walk returns this spring!

Take the climb for an amazing opportunity to take in the lush green views of Yass Valley. It's a great day out for the whole family.

title: Open Mic Night Portland NSW
description:
An Open Mic is a free event welcoming beginner to intermediate musicians and small bands, comedy and other acts to perform in a public space with PA equipment provided. 

The performers gain experience and confidence in front of a live and receptive audience. 

Tarana Hotel and local trio “Goats Can Eat Anything trio” are the hosts. Tarana is a friendly pub with modern food and traditional but quirky decor. 

The chalkboard goes up where patrons can write the name of their act in a timeslot. Perform either three songs or 15 mins of material. Music and performance artists are welcome. 

Typically, there are 10 performance slots but if more people want to have a go, they will try to accommodate. To contact them, visit the Facebook for “Goats Can Eat Anything”.

title: Dragon Dreaming Festival
description:
Dragon Dreaming Festival returns to Wee Jasper for 2025!

The festival features four days of freshly selected music, performance, art installation, and lifestyle workshops.
The event is held in the extraordinary beautiful Lake Burrinjuck, NSW.

title: Nordic Christmas This July at The Brewhouse
description:
Join Ladbroken Distillery Brewhouse as they go full Nordic this July. 

The outdoor feasting hall transforms into a Nordic winter lodge – complete with fairy-lit fir trees, hot pretzels, mulled drinks, our special Meltdown Food truck menu including the Fat Bastard Pork and fennel sausage rolls, along with sweet baked apple treats and gingerbread

Bring the whole family along for some winter fun -firepits, drool worthy hot chocolates, and toasted marshmallows. 

Saturday nights will see the Pop-Up Polar Bar dishing up glowing Vodka cocktails with a side of mountain magic.

Ho Ho Ho.

title: Tumbarumba Hot Chocolate Trail
description:
Stay warm this July by wrapping your hands around a mug of hot chocolate at one of Tumbarumba's cosy venues.

Discover the velvety magic of winter in the mountains with the Tumbarumba Hot Chocolate Trail – a decadent self-guided experience through our cafés, restaurants and bars all July long.

Grab your family and friends and hit the trail in search of the ultimate treat. Whether you're craving a classic indulgence or a boozy fireside twist, there's a cocoa cup waiting for you in Tumbarumba.

title: Dan Rath: Tropical Depression - Ballina
description:
He can't focus. He doesn't know if it's microplastics, long covid or because he pays $500 a week to live in a mold experiment. 
This year, he went to a rally dressed as Boba Fett and was bashed by both police and protestors. 
He formed a parasocial relationship with a doordash chatbot and he lost all his crpyto trying to buy a mermaid skeleton.

title: Dog Drawing Class
description:
Dog Drawing in Lennox Head isn't your average life drawing session. It's a fun, hands-on opportunity to meet a new furry friend each week—dogs who are more than happy to be the centre of attention (and yes, they accept treats and scratches as payment).

Spaces are limited, and all skill levels are welcome!

The class is BYO drinks, but art supplies and a grazing board are supplied and easygoing music sets the tone.

Each class features a different canine model, offering a delightful variety of breeds, shapes, and personalities. From smooshy snouts to elegant limbs and enthusiastic tail-waggers, participants can try their hand at fast sketches or take a more refined approach with guided, timed exercises. Local artist Christina leads the session, offering tips and tricks across different media including charcoal, watercolours, and scratchboard.

The atmosphere is intentionally relaxed and welcoming. Guests are encouraged to move freely, interact with the dog, and connect with fellow artists. It's not just about drawing—it's about capturing character, sparking creativity, and enjoying a playful, social space. Sharing sketches is encouraged, and seeing each participant's unique take on the week's pup is half the fun.

New faces (both human and canine) are always welcome. Participants can even nominate their own dog to be the star of an upcoming class by simply popping the pup's name into the draw.

title: Silk Painting Workshops in Ballina
description:
Discover the vibrant art of silk painting in the heart of Ballina. Join these relaxed, creative workshops held every Saturday, perfect for beginners and experienced artists alike.
