Hosted in a welcoming studio setting, these sessions offer hands-on guidance and the chance to create your own unique silk masterpiece.

Workshops are scheduled each Saturday, and midweek sessions may also be arranged upon request—subject to availability. Simply enquire ahead to check dates.

The studio is open to the public every Saturday when the colourful open flags are flying. Drop in, explore the space, view finished works, and get inspired.

Whether you're looking to try something new or deepen your artistic skills, these workshops offer a personal and enriching experience. All materials are provided, and no prior experience is necessary.

title: Fashion Thrift Society Lennox Head
description:
Australia’s biggest curated thrift market, 'Fashion Thrift Society' is coming to Lennox Head for its prestigious Australian tour! 

They have meticulously curated over 100 unique vendors, each offering an extensive array of vintage and pre-loved clothing items. The selection includes gender-neutral, contemporary fashion for men and women, plus-size attire, designer garments, handmade clothing, footwear, accessories, home décor, products from local businesses and art pieces. There's truly something for every fashion enthusiast.

But that's not all! The event also features delectable food trucks, the best local DJ, a beauty booth for tooth gems and body piercings, a henna tattoo artist, nail bar, FTSTV interviews, free professional barber cuts and an abundance of exciting freebies in the lead-up to the event. A perfect place where you can connect and socialise with like-minded people.

title: Caringa Neon Disco
description: Get ready to glow at the Caringa Neon Disco!  Join the Caringa Community on for an accessible, inclusive and electrifying evening of music, dancing, and neon fun on The Deck. Come together to make this another unforgettable night – all welcome.

title: Rummage 4 Winter
description:
The time has come for the most anticipated seasonal gathering..
Rummage Number Four Winter is happening on the last Saturday in August in the sun filled courtyard of the Grafton Regional Gallery!

Previous Rummage days have transformed the local fashion scene, creating a vibrant community space where pre-loved treasures find new homes.
The Rummage community believes every garment deserves at least 30 wears, extending the lifespan of quality pieces and reducing fashion waste.
When you shop at the seasonal Rummage events, you're not just saving cash, you're helping reshape how the community thinks about fashion and waste.

Tell your friends, bring your reusable totes, smell the coffee, drink in the culture, share some stories, and support circular!

title: Michele Beevors - Anatomy Lessons
description:
Featuring meticulously-sculpted, life-size, skeletons, each piece – a real animal – is painstakingly measured, drawn, sculpted from steel, wire, and foam, and covered entirely in hand-knitting; a fine-art softening of the subject beneath. 

An exhibition 17-years in the making, from the towering giraffe stretching 4.4 metres in height, head raised to the windowed ceiling to the army of 50 plus delicately rendered frogs, is astounding.

Anatomy Lessons describes humanities' dark connection to the lives of animals and the living planet, expanding on the wider themes of human culpability, asking us to care. 

This exhibition will run in conjunction with Artexpress 2025.

Grafton Regional Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday and closed on Monday's. Public Holidays may differ.

title: Selvedge - Robert Moore and Sue Hall
description:
In this exhibition, Robert Moore's paintings on paper– characterised by large gestures, abstract marks, and landscapes – are transformed by Sue Hall who sews the paintings on paper into wearable forms such as shirts, bags, and hats. The result is an installation where abstraction and functionality collide.

Selvedge continues Robert Moore and Sue Hall's collaboration that began in 2021, when Hall responded to Moore's extensive collection of hand-printed fabrics from his work with Australian fashion lifestyle brands Mambo and Deus Ex Machina.

This exhibition is a Grafton Regional Gallery project.

Grafton Regional Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday and closed on Monday's. Public Holidays may differ.

title: Animal Kin - Vivid Creatures Exhibition
description:
Animals and art have a glorious history. They remain favourite subjects for most artists and provide endless inspiration for their imaginations. For some contemporary artists, animals serve as a powerful symbolic metaphor and for others they remain testimonials to the ecological disasters.

Different animals and creatures are depicted in the exhibition through paintings, drawings, and prints.

Grafton Regional Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday and closed on Monday's. Public Holidays may differ.

title: Artexpress Exhibition
description:
Featuring a selection of outstanding student artworks developed for the art-making component of the Hsc examination in Visual Arts in 2024, Artexpress 2025 provides insight into students' creativity and the issues important to them.

The exhibition encompasses a broad range of approaches and expressive forms, including ceramics, collection of works, designed objects, documented forms, drawing, graphic design, painting, photomedia, printmaking, sculpture, textiles and fibre, and time-based forms.

Artexpress is a joint partnership between the New South Wales Department of Education, Arts Unit and the New South Wales Education Standards Authority.

Grafton Regional Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday and closed on Monday's. Public Holidays may differ.

title: Residue+Response - 5th Tamworth Textile Triennial
description:
Emerging from recent global events, people are prompted to reflect on their interconnectedness, their collective past, and the futures that may lie ahead. The 2025 Textile Triennial is a celebration of 50 years of the National Textile Collection promoting and sustaining the unique cultural heritage associated with both the history and technology of textile practice.

Curator: Dr Carol McGregor. 

Artists: Daphne Banyawarra, Makeda Duong, Norton Fredericks, Fiona Gavino, Anne Graham, Blake Griffiths, Amy Hammond, Kate Harding, Dana Harris, Maggie Hensel Brown, Sophie Honess, Lucy Irvine, Kait James, Jumaadi, Kate Just and Kyra Mancktelow, Casselle Mountford, Sybil Orr, Paula do Prado and Tamara Burlando, Mandy Quadrio and Jan Oliver, Hannah Quinlivan, Joan Ross, Liz Williamson, Rachael Wellisch, Leanne Zilka and Jenny Underwood.

title: Clarence Valley Indigenous Art Award
description:
Now in its 22nd year, the Clarence Valley Indigenous Art Award showcases all entrants to this year's prize with work by contemporary First Nations artists residing on Bundjalung, Gumbaynggirr, and Yaegl Country in the Clarence Valley.

The Clarence Valley Indigenous Art Award showcases an array of artistic mediums, styles and methods that draw from both modern and traditional techniques including weaving, painting, sculpture, mixed media, digital art, and beyond.

Acquisitive Award - AUD5,000
Emerging Artist Prize - AUD1,000
Youth Prize - Art Pack AUD250

Grafton Regional Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday and closed on Monday's. Public Holidays may differ.

title: Soundboks Oz Grom Open
description:
The Soundboks Oz Grom Open hosted by Lennox-Ballina Boardriders, now in its 14th year, is a junior surfing competition. 

The Age Division Event is one of only five 10,000-point events where surfers are contending for top National rankings for the chance to compete internationally in the International Surf Association  World Junior Championships. 

The event also incorporates a 1000 point World Surf League Pro Junior competition where surfers aged between 18-21 are fighting for a ticket to qualify for the upcoming World Junior Championships. 

The Soundboks Oz Grom Open is considered one of the best junior events in the world. The event is held annually at beautiful Lennox Head - Seven Mile Beach.

The event is run very similar to a World Surf League Tour event - complete with a judging tower, a five-person judging panel, computerised judging system and priority board, athlete's area, a spectator area, live webcast featuring world renowned commentators, personalities, and athletes, along with a huge social media presence. 

The competitors get to experience what it is like to be a professional surfer, and their families, coaches, and support crew get to experience the beauty of the Northern Rivers region. 

The Pro Junior event attracts viewership through the World Surf League streaming platform of over 1 million channel subscribers from all over the world.

title: Friday Night Live!
description:
Your Friday nights at the Crown Hotel just got better with free live music every week. 

You can also enjoy a fabulous dinner in the bistro – all while taking in the view of the Clarence River.

Each week features a different artist.  See the Crown's What's On page for each weeks performer.

title: Grafton Jacaranda Festival
description:
During the months of October and November each year Grafton undergoes a metamorphic transformation, as the countless avenues of Jacaranda trees turn from green to purple.

The Jacaranda Festival celebrates this natural wonder by combining the history and pageantry of yesteryear with a new, modern and inclusive vision, ensuring the festival’s future for years to come.

Whether you’re seeking a little piece of yesteryear, where locals still line the main street of Grafton to watch (with purple icecream in hand) the annual float parade, or you love the flamboyance and pageantry of drag queen bingo – the Jacaranda Festival has something for everyone.

Walk through the town and be mesmerised as you see the trees and community.

One of the most popular days during the festival is Jacaranda Thursday when the town is given license to ‘let its hair down’.  Main streets close, local businesses dress up and people meander throughout the town centre soaking up the atmosphere. 

The final weekend marks the day of the Float Parade with more than 100 floats down Grafton’s Prince Street.

title: Anh Do - Grafton
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'

Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: The Dinomaniacs - Grafton
description:
Join Shaun and Tara for a fun-filled afternoon with their award-winning kids' show! 

The Dinomaniacs! Fresh off winning two national awards at the 2024 What's On 4 Kids, this show is packed with laughs, music and hands-on dino fun.

Say hello to Trixi the Triceratops, cheeky Tru Blu, Naughty Joffrey, Aussie favourites Ozzi and Oi, and the newest baby dino, Olive the Parasaurolophus.

Perfect for ages 1-8, this interactive experience includes lifelike baby dinosaurs, singing and dancing, Up-close dino encounters and fun photo ops!

title: Grafton Showground Markets
description:
The Grafton Showground Markets are held on the third Saturday of every month, located at the Grafton Showgrounds.

There's something for everyone at these Grafton monthly markets with a wide variety of stalls, including plants, fruit and vegetables, home-baked cakes, jams, woodwork, and hand-made crafts. As well as clothing, poultry, animals, and recycled treasures.

When you walk into the gate, you walk in knowing that you're going to find a bargain!

title: Ballina Boxing Day Races
description:
Experience the Excitement of the Ballina Boxing Day Races

The Ballina Boxing Day Races return to the Ballina Jockey Club for another thrilling year of festive cheer, live local racing and relaxed, family-friendly fun. A much-loved tradition on the Ballina Coast and Hinterland events calendar, this iconic summer race day is the perfect way to extend the Christmas celebrations.

Families are invited to enjoy a vibrant day out with free kids' entertainment, free entry for under 18s, and a relaxed trackside atmosphere ideal for all ages. There'll be live racing, full TAB facilities, and a variety of delicious bistro-style food and beverages available.

This crowd-favourite event also offers free bus transfers, making it easy to leave the car at home and truly enjoy the day. Whether you're there for the races, the food, or simply the festive vibes, it's an unmissable day in the sun.

The Ballina Boxing Day Races are a highlight of the summer social season, combining sport, entertainment and holiday spirit. Visitors and locals alike are encouraged to frock up, bring their friends and family, and make unforgettable memories on the beautiful Ballina Coast.

Don't miss out—mark your calendar and celebrate Boxing Day the Ballina way!

title: Naidoc Week - Ballina Shire
description:
NAIDOC Week is a special time to celebrate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander history, culture and achievements and is an opportunity to recognise the contributions Indigenous Australians make to our country and society.

Start the week with the Annual Celebration Walk. The walk starts from the Ballina RSL Club and proceeds along River Street then Cherry Street to the Ballina Indoor Sports Centre (BISC) for the official flag raising ceremony. 

Refreshments, BBQ, displays and games in the BISC with morning tea provided for community Elders.

The week will then continue with various events happening each day.

title: Things of Stone and Wood- Ballina RSL
description: Things of Stone and Wood, one of Australia's most loved folk-rock bands, are bringing their signature sound to Ballina RSL. Known for their heartfelt lyrics, melodic storytelling and acoustic-driven energy, the band rose to fame in the 1990s with hits like "Happy Birthday Helen" and "Wildflowers". Their music blends elements of folk, pop and rock, creating an uplifting yet reflective atmosphere that continues to resonate with fans old and new. Performing with passion and authenticity, Things of Stone and Wood offer audiences a live experience filled with nostalgia, emotion and strong musicianship. With a career spanning decades, they have earned a reputation for powerful live shows that connect deeply with listeners. This performance at Ballina RSL is a rare opportunity to experience the band's timeless sound in an intimate setting. Whether you've followed their journey from the beginning or are discovering their music for the first time, this event promises a memorable night of Australian music at its best.

title: Don't Change - Ultimate INXS Tribute Show
description:
Celebrate the music of one of Australia's most iconic bands with Don't Change – Ultimate INXS Tribute, a high-energy live show that captures the spirit and sound of INXS at their peak. This acclaimed six-piece band delivers an electrifying performance packed with all the classic hits including "Need You Tonight" "Never Tear Us Apart" "New Sensation" and "What You Need", alongside a full live rendition of the legendary Listen Like Thieves album.

Led by charismatic frontman Blair Dwyer, the show channels the raw passion, swagger and unmistakable sound of Michael Hutchence and the original INXS line-up. With authentic production, powerful vocals and a stadium-style concert experience, it's a night that brings fans of all ages together to celebrate a band that helped shape Australian rock music.

Having toured extensively to sold-out venues around the country, Don't Change has built a reputation for creating an unforgettable live experience that honours the legacy of INXS while reigniting the excitement and energy that made them a global sensation.

Whether you're reliving your youth or discovering the music for the first time, this is a show that will have you on your feet from the first chord to the final encore. A must-see for music lovers and INXS fans alike.

title: Pink Zinc Live at the Wharf
description:
Get ready for another vibrant Sunday session at one of Ballina's favourite monthly events – Wharf River Club is back, and this time it's bringing the soulful sounds of Pink Zinc to the scenic Lance Ferris Wharf.

Hosted by Wharf Bar and Bistro, this riverside gig invites the community to soak up the music and good vibes right by the water. The licensed area will be set within the restaurant, but everyone is welcome to bring a picnic rug and settle in at Fawcett Park to enjoy the show.

With an anticipated crowd of around 350 music lovers, this promises to be an afternoon filled with smooth tunes, sunshine, and that unbeatable Ballina atmosphere. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this is your perfect excuse to chill out by the river, support local hospitality, and enjoy live music in a stunning setting.

title: Wharf River Club: JB Blue Breakers Live at the Wharf
description:
Wharf River Club Presents JB Blue Breakers – Live at the Wharf.

The Wharf River Club returns to Ballina with another vibrant Sunday session, this time featuring the soulful sounds of JB Blue Breakers at the scenic Lance Ferris Wharf.

Hosted by Wharf Bar & Bistro, this monthly riverside event invites guests to enjoy live music in a relaxed and welcoming setting. The licensed area is located within the restaurant, while Fawcett Park offers a perfect picnic spot for those who prefer to spread out by the river and enjoy the show.

Attracting an anticipated crowd of around 350 music lovers, the event combines smooth tunes, local hospitality, and stunning river views to create a signature Ballina experience. It's an ideal afternoon outing for both locals and visitors looking to unwind, connect with the community, and soak up the coastal atmosphere.

title: BACCI Art and Craft Show
description:
Ballina Art and Craft Centre Inc (BACCI) are putting on their biannual show where members will show their new work. This show, BACCI is raising money for The Ballina sleepbus service.

They are raffling a beautiful wooden box hand-crafted by the late Kenneth Nunn.

There will be paintings, prints, photography, books, woven art, woodwork, sculpture, ceramics, jewellery, resin art, beautiful cards and other unique craft items. Plus they have a Pop-Up Cafe with fresh and homemade treats as well as tea and coffee.

title: Richmond Riverfest
description:
Richmond Riverfest is a month-long celebration of the rivers, cultures, and communities of the Northern Rivers region. The festival brings together Traditional Custodians, conservation groups, community organisations, artists, and educators to honour the river systems through storytelling, public events, and a shared commitment to river protection and restoration.

This year, Richmond Riverfest will launch in Ballina on World Rivers Day — a fitting location where the river meets the sea and the tributaries of the upper catchments converge. Ballina represents the symbolic meeting point for all communities along the Richmond River and highlights the collective responsibility to care for and protect this vital waterway.

The family-friendly event will feature a vibrant mix of local food, live music, educational talks, river stories, and interactive children's activities. It offers an opportunity for communities to connect, learn, and explore how cultural knowledge, science, and grassroots action can come together to heal the Richmond River.

With a focus on listening to the voices of the river and empowering community-led restoration, Richmond Riverfest is a powerful reminder that when people come together in celebration and purpose, real change can flow.

title: Riverside Carols
description:
Riverside Carols is a community event held each year, where approximately 2,500 people spend an enjoyable evening of listening to and singing their favourite Christmas carols.

This year the combined churches of Ballina and Lennox Head are thrilled to be hosting the carols again. The evening will start off with performances from local preschools, schools and dance groups, culminating in a joyful sing-along of traditional carols led by a band of talented local musicians.

There will be a variety of food and glow sticks available to purchase, so bring the family, a picnic rug and warm up your vocal cords for a night of singing for this great alcohol-free family event.

The event will conclude with a spectacular fireworks display.

title: North Coast Mud Trail
description:
A fantastic weekend where ceramicists open their studios to visitors so you can meet the artists, discuss their work and processes and find out what inspires them to do what they do.

You will be delighted and surprised by the diversity of work for sale as well as the studios themselves, many of which are in some of the most scenic locations in the region. All artists will have work for sale with no two styles alike, so you will find something to satisfy both your soul and your budget.

Journey into the world of the handmade and be sure to note the events schedule if you are keen to organise your visit around demonstrations or artist talks on either Saturday or Sunday.

title: Ballina Farmers and Producers Market
description:
Ballina Farmers and Producers Market is your local growers market.

Ballina Farmers and Producers Market is a favourite place to visit on a Sunday morning. It has the best farm fresh produce the region has to offer, in a beautiful setting by the river.

You can find freshly picked vegetables, oyster mushrooms, apples, berries, flowers and crisp salads. Alternatively, grab a punnet of seedlings and grow your own.

There is a wonderful range of artisan-produced foods: cheeses, freshly baked organic sourdough bread, pasta, cloud-like sourdough doughnuts, olives, fermented vegetables and so much more.

The market is a perfect place for you to enjoy a cup of coffee with your pick of breakfast options including croissants, doughnuts, breakfast burgers, sushi, or vegan delights, to name just a few. It is a place for the community to get together.

It's held at Commemoration Park every Sunday morning between 7-11 am, next to the Missingham Bridge in Ballina. Pack a picnic blanket and head on down.

title: Friday Live Music - Good Intent Hotel
description:
Your Friday nights just got better at the Good Intent Hotel! Join in for an evening of free live music. 

Each week, they feature a different talented artist, ensuring a fresh and exciting musical experience every time you visit. While you soak in the tunes, treat yourself to a delicious dinner in our bistro. Stay updated with our weekly performers by visiting the Good Intent Hotel's Facebook page. 

Don't miss out on the chance to discover new music and enjoy a memorable night out!

title: Ballina Veterans Week of Golf
description:
This event is conducted over four days playing one of the best golf courses in the Northern Rivers.

Experience the camaraderie, fellowship and fun with similar aged and like-minded people. Meet people from all walks of life and make lifetime friends.

All players in this event must be 55 years or older.

title: Fair Go Skate Comp
description:
Ballina’s own Fair Go skateboard competition has been running for over 23 years. It is one of the longest running skateboard competitions in the country and in previous years they have had more competitors than any other skateboard competition in Australia!

Dress up Halloween costume - Prize for best outfit.

For more touch base with the team at Truckstop Sk8.

title: Living in the 80's - Shaws Bay Hotel
description:
Step back into the golden age of Aussie pub rock with Living In The 80s, a high-energy tribute to the decade when hairspray was high and the anthems were even higher. Hosted at the all-new SHAWSY, this electrifying show delivers a nostalgia-packed night of the biggest hits from the era that defined a generation.

Think Cold Chisel, INXS, Queen, Dragon, and Bon Jovi. Picture the pounding drums, the sizzling guitar solos, and dancefloors packed with legwarmers and leather jackets. From New Wave to Stadium Anthems, Pub Rock to chart-topping Pop, this show is your ultimate 80s mixtape brought to life.

Whether you're reliving your youth or discovering the magic of 80s FM radio for the first time, Living In The 80s will have you singing along and dancing like it's 1985. Featuring hits from Prince, Tina Turner, Huey Lewis, Icehouse, Pat Benatar, Split Enz, and many more – it's a non-stop party you won't want to miss.

Grab your mates, don your retro best, and get ready for a night of good times and great tunes. The 80s are calling… and they're louder than ever!

title: Rainbow Region Dragon Boat Regatta
description:
Experience the thrill and excitement of one of the region's most dynamic sporting events – the Ballina Dragon Boat Regatta. Held on the stunning banks of Shaws Bay, this action-packed, family-friendly event is a must-see on the Northern Rivers events calendar.

Proudly supported by Ballina Shire Council, the regatta is an officially sanctioned Dragon Boats NSW event, attracting teams from across the state to compete in a display of power, precision, and teamwork. The picturesque setting of Shaws Bay offers the perfect vantage point for spectators to soak up the atmosphere and cheer on the crews as they slice through the water in a series of exhilarating races.

The event is alcohol-free, making it an ideal day out for families. Visitors can enjoy a great selection of food and drinks available for purchase, with plenty of space to sit back, relax, and take in the action. Furry friends are welcome too – just remember to keep dogs on a leash, off the beach, and out of the water to protect local wildlife and ensure everyone enjoys the day.

Whether you're a local or visiting the Ballina Coast and Hinterland, the Dragon Boat Regatta promises a weekend of fun, community spirit, and spectacular sport in one of the Shire's most scenic locations.

title: Sunset Session at Shelly Beach Cafe
description:
Enjoy Friday Sunset Sessions and watch the sunset over Shelly Beach at Shelly Beach Cafe in East Ballina. 

Popular for breakfast, brunch and lunch, Friday evening is the only time you can enjoy the sunset views from this stunning location.

Enjoy a beautiful meal and a great selection of beer, wine and cocktails.

Perfect way to start the weekend!

title: Evans Head Malibu Classic
description:
Come along to the 34th annual Evans Head Malibu Classic at Evans Head Main Beach.

Enjoy the long weekend spectating a range of aged entries with a variety of different board events. 

Watch the increasingly popular retro competition, providing all the nostalgia from the days of old.

Come along to celebrate the start of summer surfing!

title: Coutts Tavern Community Markets
description:
The Coutts Crossing Community Markets are held on the fourth Sunday of each month.

The community market is a vibrant hub of activity, offering a delightful mix of handmade goods, crafts, fresh produce, and homemade treats. Visitors can explore a variety of plants and garden essentials, as well as unique art, fashion, and homewares that cater to all tastes. The market also features an array of delicious food and coffee options, making it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy the day.

Adding to the atmosphere is live music, creating a friendly and welcoming vibe that brings people together. Whether you're a local, a visitor, or a stallholder, the market offers something for everyone.

There will be Jumping Castles for the kids and the Bistro open.

title: Melinda Schneider Live- Coutts Crossing
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Riverbank Park Run
description:
Riverbank Park Run is a free, fun, and friendly weekly community event.

Walk, jog, or run the five kilometre track, or choose to volunteer or spectate, it's up to you.

The event takes place at Riverbank Park, and requires registration prior to attendance. Attendees can monitor their lap time.

title: Jetblack 24 Hour | Rydal NSW
description:
Gear up for the ultimate test of endurance at the Jetblack 24 Hour mountain bike race, making its triumphant return to the stunning Seven Valleys region! Riders from across Australia will converge at Rydal Showground in Lithgow, gearing up to tackle the challenging trail network nestled in the picturesque Lidsdale State Forest.

The centerpiece of this event is the renowned 24 Hour Solo competition, where individual athletes push their limits on the rugged terrain, battling fatigue and conquering the clock. For those craving team camaraderie, the event also offers relay racing in the 24 Hour category, adding an extra layer of strategy and shared triumphs.

For a slightly different challenge, the 6+6 Hour option beckons, providing solo riders and teams with a well-deserved rest during the night. It's a unique opportunity to experience the thrill of night riding, adding an extra layer of excitement to this already adrenaline-charged event.

The Jetblack 24 Hour race isn't just a test of physical stamina; it's a celebration of the mountain biking community, where riders of all levels come together to challenge themselves, forge lasting connections, and bask in the breathtaking beauty of the Seven Valleys region. 

Come along for an unforgettable weekend of pure MTB bliss!

title: Ashby Markets and Car Boot Sale
description:
The Ashby Markets and Car Boot Sale happens on the third Sunday of each month. Come and relax and enjoy a peaceful market and live music.

The Ashby Hall Reserve welcomes you to enjoy a stroll around the variety of stalls on offer. Stalls include fruit and vegetables, homemade cakes and slices, second-hand goods, and the arts and crafts of the talented locals.

If you get peckish on your stroll through the array of goodies, the Bush Café has a range of freshly cooked breakfast options and homemade cakes and slices, along with Botero coffee.

title: Hume and Hovel Ultra
description:
​The Hume and Hovell Ultra is an ultrarunning event in Tumbarumba New South Wales that has attracted runners to the historic Hume and Hovell Track since 2012.

The event utilises the Hume and Hovell Walking Track, which follows the historic route taken by explorers Hume and Hovell in 1824. The course features a mix of single-track trails and fire roads, showcasing scenic natural attractions such as Mannus Lake and Paddys River Dam. This is the only ultra-distance trail running event held in the Riverina and one of a few trail running events in the region. This fast-growing sector offers ample opportunity for promoting the natural beauty of the Snowy Valleys and broader Riverina region, attracting both locals and visitors from interstate. 

The Hume and Hovell Ultra offers several race distances:​  22-kilometres, 50-kilometres, 100-kilometres and a kids race. There is also a team and relay option for the 20 and 100-kilometre races.  

For information about registration and datres and times of events, please visit the website.

title: Evans Head Farmers Markets
description: Evans Head Farmers Market aims to support local farmers, bakers and makers and provide access to fresh, locally sourced produce. Come along and enjoy a variety of hot food, fruit and vegetables, bee products, dairy and gluten-free options, cakes, pastries and bread.

title: Evans Head Rotary Monthly Markets
description:
Come along and find a treasure or two at the Evans Head Rotary Monthly Markets. Visitors will find various stalls to peruse at the markets, including coffee, crafts, bags, clothing, plants, and lots more.

Don't forget to keep an eye out for Rotary's volunteer-run sausage sizzle barbeque helping to raise funds.

title: Evans Head Fishing Classic
description:
The annual Evans Head Fishing Classic is held each year during the winter school holidays.

Evans Head offers a unique holiday experience for you and your family. Pristine beaches, local atmosphere, and a range of accommodation options to suit any budget.

Each year hundreds of people, ranging from children to the experienced fisherman, travel to Evans Head to participate in the Evans Head Fishing Classic, where they get to experience all that the North Coast of NSW has to offer. 

With draws every night, daily winners and amazing prizes - there is much to keep you entertained for the seven days.

For more information, please visit the website.

title: Oberon Chamber Music Festival
description:
Welcome to the Oberon Chamber Music Festival and what better place to make music than the gorgeous Malachi Gilmore Hall, with its superb acoustics, in this peaceful and idyllic town of Oberon?

This year’s program brings together world-class musicians, each of whom are greatly respected in their own right; by uniting them together to make chamber music in specially curated ensembles, an absolutely magical experience is created.

So welcome to this sublime part of Wiradjuri, Gundungurra and Dharug Country. Enjoy Oberon, eat the fine food, soak up the beautiful surrounds, and immerse yourself in magnificent music.

title: It's a Derryth & Dino thing at Yazzbar
description:
Yep you read that right Derryth and Dino are back again!

Playing some of their old favourites along with some new tunes you haven't heard from them before.

If you haven't seen them for a while this is your chance.

title: It's a Derryth and Dino Thing at Yazzbar
description:
Their are back again for another evening of old favourites and new tunes you may not have heard before.

Join Derryth and Dino at Yazzbar for an evening of great tunes and great company.

title: Bennie James at Yazzbar
description:
A little bit older and a little non-the-wiser, Bennie will be returing to music with his first headline show in close to a decade.

Come down to Yazzbar, enjoy a drink or two and he will play a few songs - some well known and others not so much.

He will be trying out his "Millenial indie dreams" setlist, featuring songs from Bright Eyes, Death Cab, Blur and plenty of others.  He will also be dusting off his old setlist and tracks, maybe incorporating a few newbies as well.

title: Paper Making Workshop
description:
Use recycled office waste, raw cotton from Wee Waa cotton industry, flowers and colour to make beautiful stationery.

In this class you will learn how to prepare your pulp, pull sheets of paper, press and dry them.

You will also learn how to add seeds for gift tags or try embossing your wet paper and find out about natural sizing ingredients to enhance the papers quality. The ideas for using the paper you make is endless.

title: Outrageous Oberon Scavenger Hunt
description:
Jump in your car/4WD/ motorbike and enjoy a fun day of quirky and unusual tasks and quizzes to keep you on your toes and learn about the region full of character and stories - old and new! 
Enjoy a grazing box for lunch and complete a couple of tasks - maybe get in some forest bathing before heading off on the afternoon sector of the event.
Finish the evening with a delicious meal and entertainment after the completion of the prize giving for the winners (and losers).

title: Hamilton Hume: Going Places
description:
Explore the extraordinary life of Hamilton Hume, one of Australia’s pioneering explorers, at a special 200th Anniversary Exhibition. 

From his early adventures in the Berrima and Bungonia districts to his famous 1824 expedition to Port Phillip with William Hovell, this exhibition brings to life Hume's significant role in Australian history. Learn about his remarkable leadership, bushcraft skills, and the challenges he overcame as he charted vast regions of New South Wales and Victoria.

Featuring rare artefacts and engaging storyboards, the exhibition provides a unique insight into Hume’s expeditions and his enduring legacy. Discover how his early explorations shaped the nation, delve into the story of the man behind the name, and enjoy a visit to the gallery of Curious things.

Don’t miss this fascinating journey through history at the Yass Valley History Centre!

title: Maclean Community Markets
description:
Maclean Community Markets are held on the second Saturday of each month in the main car park, near the Maclean Bowling Club. 

Stalls offer a wide range of items including jewellery, clothing, plants, craft and art items, freshly baked cookies and cakes, plants and a great range of fresh produce. 

So bring yourself and the family along and come on down to the Maclean Community Markets.

title: Maclean Enchanted Christmas Fair
description:
Step into the magic of the festive season at the Enchanted Christmas Fair, a charming twilight event in the heart of Maclean on the NSW North Coast.

Held in mid-December, this family-friendly celebration transforms our town into a festive wonderland, featuring artisan market stalls, gourmet food vendors, live entertainment, Christmas lights, and children's rides. Enjoy roving performers, local musicians, school choirs, a special visit from Father Christmas, and a major Christmas raffle – all set against the picturesque backdrop of the Lower Clarence River.

With activities for all ages and an emphasis on community connection, inclusivity, and local creativity, the Enchanted Christmas Fair is the perfect way to shop local, support regional makers, and soak up the holiday spirit.

Bring the whole family, stay the weekend, and discover the magic of Christmas in Maclean.

title: Maclean Highland Gathering
description:
Welcome to the 121st Maclean Highland Gathering. 

Grab your kilt and get yourself to Maclean, the Scottish Town in Australia. Walk among the clans that enjoy the town for the Highland Gathering every year from around the country. Witness a host of top-class Scottish musical, cultural and sporting performances in the picturesque Maclean.

On Friday, piping competitions take place non-stop at different venues, as well as drumming events held throughout the town; in the evening there will be a Ceilidh (street concert) featuring dancers, pipers and singers on River Street at McLachlan Park.

Bands parade down River Street on Saturday morning before the fun moves on to the Maclean Showgrounds for the main event with pipe bands, dancing and traditional Highland games, including the Caber Toss, to entertain crowds during the day. Choose a great vantage point under cover on the hill or mingle around the arena to experience a genuine gathering of the clans with Scottish gift, music, dancing, clan stalls, great food and a public booth.

title: Stitch Your Own Story onto a Tea Towel with Fiona Boxall
description:
Everyone has memories or stories they would like to tell and keep. Stitching these onto a tea towel can be a great way to preserve and share them. Whether you're a complete beginner or a serious stitcher, this workshop will give you the space and atmosphere to stitch away to your heart's content. Bring along those stories and Fiona will help you convert them into beautifully stitched mementos. And if you're a complete beginner, there will be some hands-on demonstrations to help you get started.

A linen tea towel and small embroidery hoop will be provided. Some reference materials and threads will be available if you need something extra.

Additional items to bring along include a sketch pad or paper, a pencil, threads in the colours you like, photos, memorabilia, ideas and stories you might like to work with.

Morning tea will be provided.

title: Impasto Acrylics Using A Palette Knife with Jennifer Forster
description:
Learn how to wield a palette knife and create interesting passages of paint and texture to engage your viewer.

Morning tea will be provided. 

For the list of materials needed for this workshop please visit the booking link.

title: Woombah Market
description:
Come along to Woombah Market. Shop up a storm surrounded by the beautiful natural environment. Woombah market is on the 5th Saturday of the month and has a wide selection of arts and crafts, handmade gifts, brick and brack. 

Featuring live music and great coffee creating the perfect atmosphere for your relaxed Saturday morning.

title: Oberon Outdoor Festival
description: This is a month-long festival with something for everyone from a teddy bears picnic for the small members of the community, to a fun run, sip and splash for the over 21's, redfin roundup fishing comp and a fossicking day out at burraga dam.

title: Lithgow Comedy Festival
description: The best comedic talent descends onto Lithgow for a weekend of laughs and fun. High profile and emerging talent all share the stages over multiple venues.

title: Lithgow Halloween
description:
Are you ready for Lithgow Halloween 2025?

Celebrate with your family, in the safety and sanctuary of Lithgow's Main Street.

This spooktacular festival is one not to be missed... There will be activities designed for every age group.

title: Time - A Pieces of Pottery Show
description:
Song, poetry, theatre... a show exploring 'Time'.

Humanity has spent its entire existence trying to explain, shape and manage time. Ancient stories grapple with the concept of time, as do our contemporary tales; think 'Doctor Who', HG Wells'  'The Time Machine' and so on.

This show will showcase talent from Lithgow and the Seven Valleys, the Blue Mountains, and beyond. Featuring original works created for the audience's entertainment and enjoyment, it invites attendees to join these artists in celebrating creativity and expression.

The event will be held at Lithgow's best-kept secret cafe and gallery, The Old Lithgow Pottery, for music and song, poetry and stories... and to enjoy the convivial atmosphere accompanied by a tea, coffee or chai, and a selection of yummy treats.

The show is for everyone who enjoys soaking in the essence of Underground Berlin, hidden within the 7 Valleys of Lithgow. Our space has drawn comparisons to the vibrant cultural scenes of underground Berlin and the Seine River Paris.

Pieces of Pottery shows are presented on the 3rd Sunday of every month.

title: Bush Family Reunion
description:
Celebrate the pioneering families of the Dalton, Gunning and Yass area. Descendants of the pioneering Bush family and other families who settled along Jerrawa Creek, between Yass and Gunning, will be gathering this October long weekend at the historic Greendale Church near Dalton, NSW. This year marks 190 years since the Bush Brothers and their families arrived in Australia. 

Participants can explore local historic sites on the popular bus tours, watch demonstrations of antique farm machinery and sheep shearing, reconnect with old acquaintances, and share stories of days gone by.

title: Snapshot of Iluka and Woombah Book Launch at Iluka Emporium
description:
Iluka Emporium as a not-for-profit organisation, is proud to present this diverse collection of photographs taken by community members that illustrate the respect and love they have for the villages of Iluka and Woombah, Biirrinba(Clarence River) and Iluka Forest Reserve within Yaegl country.

Sixty-three contributors photographed and wrote about what is significant to them: including land and seascapes, local characters, artwork, architecture, wildlife, and beloved pets.

Due to popular demand this second edition of 'Snapshot of Iluka and Woombah' is a celebration of our project, 'Workshops and Exhibitions for Iluka and surrounding district' funded by the NSW Government, Dept of Primary Industries and Regional Development."

Join the Iluka Emporium in celebrating the launch of this book with brunch and free music. All welcome.

title: Retro Fashion Destash Market Dalton
description:
Retro Fashion Destash Markets are coming to Dalton so start cleaning out your Retro clothing and bring it along to the markets. 
Share your Retro fashion and style and bring it back to life. 
Please contact Julie for more information.

title: Christmas in July Markets Dalton
description: Looking to get into the spirit of Christmas in July then why not visit beautiful Dalton markets. Handmade crafts, baked goods, preserves, woodwork, pottery, beauty products, bric-a-brac and so much more. BBQ breakfast to warm you up.

title: Dalton Gymkhana
description:
Come along to the Dalton Showground for a great family fun atmosphere with the return of the Dalton Gymkhana. Bringing back the favourites such as horse sporting, shearing, gum boot throwing, tug-o-war, dog jumping, and so much more. 

There will be something for everyone. Mark this date in your calendars, you don't want to miss this great day out.

title: Car Boot Sale Dalton
description:
Save your pennies for some great treasure to find a new home. Books, toys, vintage tools, horse gear, clothes, household wares, and so much more are on offer at the Dalton Car Boot Sale at the showground. 

Why not grab your Bacon and egg rolls, cakes, and coffee also available on the day.

Gold coin entry.

title: Eat Street Yamba
description:
Eat Street Yamba is an afternoon/evening food market being held in Coldstream Street Yamba. 

This International food market includes Rotary's barbecue, Thai, Indian, Portuguese, Indonesian, German, Baked Potatoes, Pizza, Donuts, organic foods, nibbles and ice creams. sweets and unique gourmet food products are available to purchase. Cold drinks will also be available.  

Tables and chairs are provided for you to sit and enjoy. The Yamba Eat Street Markets is an annual market event. Walk down the middle of Coldstream Street as it is closed to traffic, especially for this community event. 

What a great holiday atmosphere and a great way to spend the long weekend at the start of October during the twilight evening in the beautiful coastal town of Yamba. Celebrate the first day of NSW Daylight Savings as the evening twilight adds atmosphere to the markets. 

The markets are organised by the Rotary Club of Yamba.

title: Yamba Farmers’ and Producers Market
description:
The Yamba Farmers’ and Producers Market are a weekly market held every Wednesday all seasons across the year!.

A verified local Clarence Valley and Northern Rivers gate to plate produce, baked goods and value added products.

Market Stall food choices range from certified organic, grass fed, gluten free, sugar free, dairy, and just plain delicious. 

Weekly special treats such as house made fairy floss, donuts, gin, rum and Portuguese tarts and ice blocks.

By supporting the Yamba Farmers’ and Producers Market the public are enabling a circular economy, a 150km lochivore footprint,  food security, nutritional values and sustainability. 

With this great produce and location comes a great shopping vibe full of good vibrations, soulful connections, local gathering for family and friends.

Yamba Farmers’ and Producers Market have been looking after Yamba families nutritional needs for 12 years and love seeing you visit each week. 

Join a local food family who cares for the community!

title: Yamba River Markets
description:
The Yamba River Markets are on the fourth Sunday of the month, located at Ford Park on the foreshores of the beautiful, scenic Clarence River.

There's always something new at the Yamba River Markets, which feature around 120 stalls, and more in the peak seasons.  It's the best way to spend a Sunday morning in the beautiful coastal town of Yamba. 

The stalls range from fresh fruit and vegetables to plants, plenty of food stalls including Asian foods, second-hand furniture, books, jewellery, clothing, and arts and crafts among many others.  

The market features local and regional food and provides free live entertainment, showcasing local emerging talent as well as touring bands and musicians in a village atmosphere.

title: Laggan Village Markets
description:
Every third Saturday of the month, the Laggan Memorial Hall hosts the Laggan Village Markets, boasting an astonishing array of goods from home-baked cakes to plants and an impressive range of gift items. 

It's a wonderful place to meet some local artists and craftspeople. Intricate metal sculpture, garden ornaments, custom-made signs, ceramics, crochet and knitting, ceramics, leather goods and fine arts are all on offer. 

With up to 50 stalls at most markets, every market is different, but you can always expect the unexpected. Look out for collectables, second-hand tools, books and all sorts of pre-loved toys.  And foodies will find the selection of home-baked bread, cakes and decadently delicious sweets irresistible. You can pick up some local honey, fantastic olive oil and olives, all sorts of jams, jellies, preserves and pickles. 

The kitchenette area sells beautiful Devonshire teas and offers a place to sit for a while and marvel at the wonderful bargains you've scored!

Please note there are no markets held in January.

title: Dorrigo Handmade Markets
description:
Made in Dorrigo is the premier market for the Dorrigo Plateau.  It is held three times a year the main street of Dorrigo which is transformed into 'Creative Central'. 
There are  dozens of local artists and creatives selling and handmade jewellery, fashion & accessories, groovy kids clothing, toys, photography, woodwork, arts & crafts, gourmet food, organic & homegrown produce and much much more.

title: Dorrigo Folk and Bluegrass Festival
description:
The Dorrigo Folk and Bluegrass Festival is a three-day celebration of local, national and international acoustic folk, bluegrass and old-time music. The festival is a boutique, family-friendly event with concerts, workshops, dance and jam sessions. Patrons have opportunities to perform and learn from the best traditional, contemporary, and exploratory acoustic music exponents of these genres. 

With the festival now recognised across the globe, it attracts artists from the USA, Canada, the United Kingdom, New Zealand, and Australia,  presenting a full program from Friday evening through to late Sunday afternoon.  All venues are alcohol, substance and smoke-free zones. Environmental sustainability is actively promoted.

title: Truffle Farming - Hartley Truffles
description: Join Hartley Truffle founders Jane and Richard Austen, to experience the sensory and physical process of truffle farming during peak season. In this very rare experience, learn about the symbiotic relationship between truffles and their host trees, tour the Hartley farm and see the cultivation processes.

title: Murrumbateman Village Market
description:
Murrumbateman Village Market is a friendly market close to Canberra and Yass on the Barton Highway, specialising in local fresh food and crafts and held on the second and fourth Saturday of the month.

The market sells a wide range of local crafts, pottery and handmade goods, as well as organic vegetables, local produce from local gardens, plus bread, cakes, pastries, jams, honey, sauces, chillies, a range of meats, olives and olive oil, native plants, local winemakers and more.

Experience a great ambience at the Village Green, Murrumbateman Recreation Grounds and perhaps take in a local vineyard for lunch.

title: Murrumbateman Field Days
description:
The Murrumbateman Field Days is Yass Valley’s premier family farming event. Located just on the doorstep of Canberra, this ‘big farming day out’ welcomes thousands of farmers and families from across the region. 

There is an exciting program of family entertainment all weekend and a huge range of exhibitors with something for everyone, from farm, livestock and machinery to building, home improvement, lifestyle, shopping and fashion to local food and wine with everything in between. 

Save the date and see you then!

Tickets can be purchased online from August onwards or at the gate on the day using debit and credit cards only.  Please note, their gate volunteers are unable to accept cash.

They also kindly request that you leave your dogs at home, as they are not permitted at this event.

title: Crookwell Country Markets
description:
The Crookwell Country Market is a charming monthly event held in the grounds of the Crookwell Rail Heritage site. Every month, local vendors gather to offer a variety of handmade goods, fresh produce, artisanal products, and much more.

It’s a great opportunity to experience the warmth of the community in this historic setting, support local artisans, and enjoy the relaxed, country atmosphere. Whether you're hunting for unique gifts, tasty treats, or just a fun day out, the Crookwell Country Market is a weekend discovery away!

title: Hartley Valley Garden Festival and Plant Fair
description:
Five beautiful private gardens open to the public located in Little Hartley only 30 minutes from Katoomba and just 15 minutes from Blackheath. 

The Hartley Valley Garden Festival and Plant Fair includes food, metal garden art, artisan stalls, oil painting, rare plants, irises, trees and maples for sale from various nurseries across NSW.

These are not ordinary gardens. They are set on acreage and are full to the brim with an abundance of colour featuring Iris, lots of roses, peonies, poppies, bulbs and many shrubs and perennials.

Take in the spectacular mountain views and fresh country air as you peruse the stalls and gardens. 

Settle in for a picnic or enjoy a cup of coffee or tea.

title: Crookwell  Carols in the Park and Markets
description:
The 2025 Crookwell Carols in the Park and Markets promises to be the biggest and most exciting yet with afternoon of fun, festivities and community spirit, featuring a fantastic line up of activities and entertainment for all ages.  

Come and meet Santa, Mrs Clause and the Elves.  Keep the little ones entertained with loads of activities. 

Saviour delicious offerings from food vans and local businesses, while browsing unique goods at local market stalls.

Experience the warm, inviting atmosphere of a true country Christmas Celebration.

title: Upper Lachlan Shire Art Trail
description:
Artists of the Upper Lachlan Shire will be displaying their artistic talent across the region from their private studios to halls in their townships. With over 30 artists registered, this will surely be a weekend of amazing art on display in the Shire, from pottery, painting, to metal works.

Upper Lachlan Shire Council, supported by Southern Tablelands Arts, has organised an Arts trail that will coincide with The Crookwell Garden Festival, Crookwell Country Market at Crookwell Heritage Railway and the Upper Lachlan Mural Trail.

Expressions of interest can be found online or at the Crookwell Visitor Information Centre.

title: Tallowood Hill Farm Gate Open Day - Glenreagh
description:
Tallowood Hill Farm on the first Saturday of the month just a five-minute drive from Glenreagh main street. 

Coffee, lunch, and local produce are on offer - what more could one ask for? And with stalls, workshops and artisan pottery, there's a bit of everything for everyone. 

Kids can enjoy pony rides and other activities while adults relax and soak in the farm atmosphere. 

There is plenty of space for everyone, bring a picnic blanket and enjoy a day on the farm.

title: Shearers Showdown Crookwell
description:
Every year will feature our popular Shearers Showdown, along with a variety of market stalls showcasing local goods and talent. Attendees can expect fun activities for the whole family and we have some exciting surprises planned to enhance the experience. 

Mark your calendars for the second Saturday in September because you don't want to miss out.

title: Halfway Creek Seasonal Market
description:
Welcome Spring by visiting the Halfway Creek Market. 

Browse the wide variety of stalls inside and outside the Halfway Creek Hall including hand-crafted items; plants; local produce such as honey and eggs; books; bric-a-brac.  

Enjoy the friendly atmosphere with some yummy food at budget prices. 

New stall-holders and car-booters welcome.

title: Learn to Felt - Nuno Felted Scarf Workshop
description:
Have you ever wished you had the skills to make a nuno felted scarf? Or have you ever wondered how the wet felting process works? Then this workshop is for you. 

This three hour workshop has been designed to teach you the basic principals of wet felting and to give you the skills to create a nuno scarf. The workshop also includes afternoon tea and an opportunity to join Blackwattle after the session for a complimentary alpaca hand feeding experience (weather permitting). 

No special skills needed although it will include mild repetitive action during part of the workshop.

title: Learn to Weave - On a Rigid Heddle Loom
description:
Learn to weave on a rigid heddle loom to create your own beautiful scarf. Start weaving during the workshop and then complete your project at home.

Please note that Blackwattle are unable to supply looms for the workshop. To participate, you will either need to bring your own loom or purchase one when booking this workshop. 

This workshop includes five hours guidance from an experienced weaver; intimate small group setting with plenty of opportunity for questions and demonstration; Ashford Easy Weave Kit in your choice of colour (select at time of booking); morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea,  a complimentary hand feeding experience with their alpacas; 10% off all purchases through the farm shop on the day.

title: Travelling Film Festival Mount Victoria
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Mount Victoria! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, and Sydney Film Festival at Mount Vic Flicks.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Plus the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle with featured contender Toby Wilson in attendance, the illuminating documentary about a brave teacher in Russia - Mr Nobody against Putin, Cannes Grand Jury winner Sentimental Value and much more!

The festival weekend will screen seven acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus four award winning short films you need to see!

title: BCU Rumble in the Jungle Trail Run
description:
The BCU Rumble in the Jungle Trail Run is a trail-dedicated run with a 50 kilometre, 30 kilometre, 21 kilometre and 8 kilometre distance to choose from.

There is also a free one kilometre kids and family run.

The event takes place in the stunning Bindarri National Park. Hidden away in the mountains, the area is Coffs Harbour’s premier running destination.

Organised by the Coffs Trail Runners with courses carefully crafted to share the best trails on the Coffs Coast.

title: Blackheath Growers Market
description:
Smell, buy and taste wonderful regional food at the Blackheath Growers Market. Meet the growers and producers of a fantastic array of foods.

The Market is run in the mornings until noon on the second Sunday of each month from February to December.

title: NEXT Studio
description:
NEXT Studio is a free three-day intensive creative industries workshop teaching high school-aged students about digital art, animation and music.

The workshop will be held in Singleton Arts + Cultural Centre's digital studio, making use of the new tech available there. Students will experiment with Virtual Reality, augmented reality, digital drawing, animation, sound recording, and beat-making equipment and software. 

This exciting opportunity combines hands-on learning with professional industry skills, empowering the next generation of digital artists and musicians while fostering creative collaboration and artistic expression in the Upper Hunter region. Along the way, the participants will get to think about their artist statement, future creative opportunities and performance or exhibition.

This workshop is for everyone, regardless of skill level. Those who love to make music or art will get something out of it.

This workshop  is supported by the NSW Government.

title: Singleton Arts & Cultural Exhibition - Avian Assembly
description:
Avian Assembly invites deep reflection on the relationships between humans and birds, as well as the broader ecological systems that connect everyone. As they look toward the future, integrating nature and society remains crucial to their collective vision for sustainability and ecological responsibility. This exhibition challenges you to critically examine the human history that has shaped your interactions with the natural world.

Through its works, Avian Assembly opens a space for contemplation on themes of kinship, freedom, and confinement, urging you to recognise the responsibility you bear in safeguarding the natural world for future generations. They hope that by engaging with these works, visitors will foster a deeper connection to the environment—one that extends beyond art and inspires action.

title: Amber Lawrence – You Can Admit You Like Country Music Tour
description:
Six times Golden Guitar winner, Australian singer-songwriter, Amber Lawrence is one of Australia's most celebrated and hardest working country artists, and was announced the 2023 Female Artist of the Year at the CMAA Golden Guitar Awards. The Tamworth Country music festival also saw Amber inducted into the prestigious Galaxy of Stars – alongside legends such as Kasey Chambers and Lee Kernaghan.

With an impressive catalog of seven studio albums and three children's albums, Amber's prolific career spans two decades, marked by relentless touring and a commitment to creating relatable and engaging music. She is twice ARIA nominated, and was the highest-selling female artists in country music in 2023.

This event will be held indoors in their event venue.

A range of Tallagandra Hill wines, local beers and soft drinks will be available to purchase on the night.

Food – as this is an afternoon event, there will be snack-style cheese/meat boxes available for purchase from the bar. 

Seating will be at shared tables but with designated seating reserved under the name of the person who made the booking.

This show is part of Tallagandra Hill's We Love Local Sunday Sessions program, supporting local Australian artists and producers.

title: Alex Lloyd - Gundaroo
description:
Aussie singer-songwriter Alex Lloyd has garnered praise both home and abroad for his work as a songsmith and performer. His expertise lies in crafting reflective songs for the soul, that explore themes such as love, loss, and the human condition.

With four ARIA Awards, 1 APRA Song of the Year award, and having achieved the number one spot on the renowned Triple J Hottest 100, Lloyd's accolades underscore his talent and influence in his 30 + years in the music industry.

In his upcoming tour, fans can anticipate a captivating mix of Alex Lloyd's hits, along with a few new tunes and Alex's re-interpretation of the classics. Gifted with a voice that has been described as "heaven-sent", Alex is renowned for his emotive expression, poignant storytelling, and fine musicianship.

This event will be held indoors.

A range of Tallagandra Hill wines, local beers and soft drinks will be available to purchase on the night.

Food will also be available to purchase prior to the event and on the night. 

Seating will be at shared tables but with designated seating reserved under the name of the person who made the booking.

This show is part of Tallagandra Hill's We Love Local program, supporting local Australian artists and producers.

Doors open at 6.15pm (food service begins). Performance from 7pm.

title: Meg Washington - Tallagandra Hill Winery
description:
Craft Music presents Meg Washington with special guests.

Meg Washington is a platinum-selling, award-winning, and genre-defying singer-songwriter who fluently weaves the worlds of jazz, pop, folk and musical theatre together.

Solo, Meg's shows are an intimate, captivating spell. Alone at the piano, the soaring melodies and lyrical poetry of her songwriting are laid bare, as Meg makes her way through a selection of songs from her impressive five-album catalog. Each night is truly unique, with a setlist often chosen according to the special, connected moment that is shared between artist and audience.

A rare opportunity to hear Meg's electrifying voice up close and to experience one of Australia's best musicians in a never-to-be repeated live performance.

title: Crafting with Nature: Secret Sculptures Workshop at Mount Tomah
description:
This program invites children to stop, listen, and expand their imaginations in nature.

The experienced Guides will get the children looking down and around at the tiny, magical worlds hidden deep within the Garden. What can they see? Maybe see mushrooms that look like fairy homes, little bugs in the leaf litter, shapes and patterns in the soil. What can they imagine? Let's imagine together!

After exploring together, craft a tiny sculpture from earthenware clay and collect nature treasures. These miniature sculptures are designed to be taken and hidden in some secret place in nature. A special secret only you know about, which you can go back and visit again and again!

title: Melinda Schneider: The Tender Tour - Katoomba
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Oktoberfest at The Carrington Hotel
description:
This year, in the usual Carrington Oktoberfest style, there will be live music and entertainment, delicious German cuisine, German beer, and much more, all on the grounds of the Carrington Hotel.

If you are looking to spend a few nights in the mountains, accommodation is open for booking but be quick as rooms over the Oktoberfest weekend do sell out fast.

title: Fox Superflow - Woolgoolga
description:
Get ready to experience Gravity Enduro mountain bike racing at the Fox Superflow® at the Wedding Bells Mountain Bike Park! 

Hosted by Rocky Trail Entertainment, this event offers three epic timed stages on some of the best tracks. The park is known for its many flow trails and challenging and techy sections, ensuring a thrilling experience for all levels of riders.

Whether you’re chasing podiums or are just out for a fun day of riding, this event is all about enjoying the ride with friends. 

The format includes three stages with each one averaging 2-3 minutes. With no set track order and untimed liaisons, you’re free to enjoy the day at your own pace. You get up to five runs on each of the three tracks, with your fastest run on each stage combined for your final result. 

The event is open to all ages, with categories based on age groups, so you can race against your peers. Whether you're a young rider or a seasoned veteran “race the way you ride” and make new friends along the way! The race village will be buzzing with activity, featuring live timing, mountain bike equipment exhibits, music, and plenty of food and drink options to keep you fuelled for the day. For full event details, including trail maps, parking, and amenities, visit the Fox Superflow® website.

title: North Coast Schools Comp - Woolgoolga
description:
Get ready for an epic day of mountain biking with the Rocky Trail Academy comp at Wedding Bells MTB Park! Hosted by Rocky Trail Entertainment, this event is designed for high school-age riders to challenge themselves across three epic timed stages on some of the best trails in the region. Whether they’re looking to challenge themselves or just have fun with friends, the Rocky Trail Academy event is all about fostering growth and camaraderie. 

The event format includes three stages, designed to test a variety of skills, including endurance, speed, and technical ability. Everyone gets five possible runs on each track, with the fastest time per stage counting toward your final result. With no set track order and untimed liaisons, you can enjoy the beautiful outdoors at your own pace. Riders will also earn points for their school, with bonus points awarded for top finishers on each track.

Race categories are based on school year groups - students race against their peers and experience the thrill of friendly competition. Each track is designed to be rideable by anyone from beginners to experienced, ensuring there’s something for every skill level.

Their experienced team will be there to ensure everything runs smoothly, from registration to course marshalling and first aid services! For full event details, including trail maps, parking, and amenities, visit the official event page.

title: Drag Queen Bingo with Miss Betty Confetti
description:
Get ready for a fabulous night of entertainment with Drag Queen Bingo! Join the glamorous queen, Miss Betty Confetti, for a riotous and hilarious bingo experience. 

Expect witty banter, a dazzling performance, and a chance to win exciting prizes. 

Come, unleash your inner diva, and let the bingo balls roll!

This event will take place on the second floor. Bookings aren't required but are highly recommended due to the limited capacity of the website.

Please make a note at the time of booking tables online that you are there for the Bingo in the special request box so that your reservation can be allocated to the same level.

title: Ngurra Bayala (Country speaks)
description:
Co-curated with Dharug artist and curator Leanne Tobin, Ngurra Bayala (Country speaks) celebrates the video work of seven female First Nations artists. Ngurra Bayala will be on permanent display, as per the Cultural Centre’s opening hours for two years.

National Gallery of Australia Artists: Megan Cope, Fiona Foley, Julie Gough and r e a.

Blue Mountains Aboriginal practitioners: Aunty Sharyn Halls (with Craig Bender and Vera Hong); Jo Clancy (with Sue Healey) and Leanne Tobin.

A selection of artworks are on long-term loan from the National Gallery of Australia with support from the Australian Government as part of Sharing the National Collection.

title: Yulefest in the Blue Mountains
description:
The magical wintertime (June, July and August) is Yulefest in the Blue Mountains, where many venues offer traditional Christmas-style celebrations. While cold winds blow and the occasional snow falls, experience warm 'Mountains' hospitality, log fires, Christmas fare, singalongs and perhaps even Santa. The Blue Mountains is truly a 'Winter Wonderland'. 

Event dates differ between establishments. Please visit the website for more details on Winter Yulefest Packages.

title: Broke Village Fair and Vintage Car Show
description:
Experience the magic of old-fashioned family fun and vintage cars at the Broke Village Fair.

Broke Village Fair has been running for over 40 years, providing a day of entertainment for all the family. 

Car enthusiasts will be excited by the vintage car show, regularly attracting over 200 vehicles from dozens of car clubs. Kids will be delighted with the wandering magic show, dance performances, rides, whip-cracking displays and more. 

Don't miss the piglet races or the woodchopping event, check out the chainsaw sculptor in action and try your luck in the best-dressed dog competition or guess the weight of the goat to win! 

Take your time to explore over 70 market stalls showcasing crafts from the region and beyond, indulge in all the food offerings and enjoy live music throughout the day. Free mine tours take place throughout the day.

A big country fair with a small village feel, don't miss this year's Broke Village Fair and Vintage Car Show!

Entry by gold coin donation, money raised goes to support local organisations.
host: BROKE VILLAGE FAIR & VINTAGE CAR DISPLAY INCORPORATED

title: Bygone Beauty's Traditional Supreme High Tea
description:
Enjoy a unique and theatrical Traditional High Tea with a twist. Reminiscent of decades past, enjoy even more decadence as Bygone Beauty presents Traditional High Tea Supreme. 

Step back in time for a unique and theatrical high tea reminiscent of decades past in a charming old-world dining room. Upon arrival, enjoy complimentary champagne in crystal flutes with mini quiches, sausage rolls and vegetarian roulades. Then, grandly presented silver service on an afternoon tea tray mobile. finely rolled crustless sandwiches, an assortment of homemade tea cakes and biscuits, baby scones with freshly whipped cream and strawberry jam and your choice of speciality loose-leaf tea or coffee.

With the addition of a hot first course and a complimentary glass of champagne (Non-alcoholic available) on arrival, this experience will add an extra touch of upper-class decadence and also give guests a taste of the original High Tea, which began around 1825 and was originally a hearty meal which includes several hot dishes

title: Bellingen Growers Market
description:
For 25 years, The Bellingen Growers Market has been a cornerstone of the community, bringing together local farmers, artisans and residents to celebrate the abundance of the region.

They are proud to support their hardworking farmers and growers, ensuring they continue to provide fresh, delicious, and nutritious food for everyone.

The Growers Market is more than a place to shop; it's a vibrant hub where bonds are strengthened, fostering a more resilient and healthy community. Come for the great stalls, stay for the connections, and leave with a smile.

Bellingen Growers Market is held every Saturday morning (excluding the 3rd Saturday of the month) .

title: Bellingen Lions Club Winter Fireworks
description:
The Lion's Club Annual Fireworks for locals and visitors alike! 

It's going to be a cold one, so dress warm to enjoy the spectacular show. The Lions team will be cooking up a storm of burgers and 2BBB music will be on-site.

Bellingen Showground's visitors will be in for a treat!

title: Bellingen Artisan Market
description:
The Bellingen Growers Market presents a day of creativity, community, and connection at the Artisan Market in Bellingen! The Showgrounds will come alive with the vibrant energy of local artisans, bakers, growers, and makers. 

Enjoy a tasty tea, coffee or cacao while relaxing to the sounds of live music. Games and face painting to entertain the kids. Indulge in delicious food offerings, including nutritious organic fresh produce. From art and ceramics to clothing, jewellery, homewares, botanicals and more, there's something for everyone to discover. 

Bring your family and join in the fun while supporting talented local artisans and growers. A great opportunity to buy lovely Christmas gifts too. Don't miss out - see you there!"

title: Taranta Festival
description: Taranta Festival is a multicultural arts event in Bellingen. The festival includes theatre, art and music workshops, dance and music performances and  a street parade.

title: Bellingen Farmers Market
description:
A weekly fresh food market is held each Wednesday at Bellingen Park, Church Street, next to the tennis courts.  

Authentic farmers and producer markets of all local-only fresh fruit, herbs, vegetables, meats and seafood. Micro-greens, organic sourdough bread, pasta, nourishing snacks, meals, fermented foods, jams, chutneys, medicinal foods, hot and cold beverages, and live entertainment.  

Wheelchair accessible and loads of parking within close walking distance of the market.

title: Beyond Jazz Weekender
description:
Beyond Jazz Weekender is set to elevate Bellingen's reputation as a vibrant music destination and hotspot for wellness and nature tourism.

Presenting live concerts, DJ sets, and art across multiple performance spaces, music lovers should expect the unexpected, as jazz musicians - surely the most adaptable of all artists - collaborate in spontaneous groupings to create music in forms heard nowhere else.

Enjoy a truly immersive festival experience - be delighted by roaming performers, explore the jazz album art exhibition, go deep with live podcast interviews, and have fun with interactive art installations.

Learn some new moves from Sydney's Dance Makers Collective, then strut your stuff on the dancefloor at The Saturday Night Social. Find your groove, be it soul, funk, hip-hop or house music as their carefully curated DJ line up taps into the resurgence of dancefloor jazz under the banner of Acid Jazz & Other Illicit Beats.

After two nights of hedonism, take a mental break from the music by joining a mass yoga session and sound bath healing experience before heading out to capture one of the many breathtaking vistas found throughout this eco-certified region.

title: Bellingen Community Markets
description:
As one of the oldest, largest and most diverse, Bellingen Community Markets is abuzz every third Saturday of the month in beautiful Bellingen Park, lined with old-growth trees and meandering creeks.

Focusing on community, culture and diversity, the event showcases a large selection of stalls, consisting of local and afar artisans, crafts people, producers, growers and recyclers, alternative therapies and massage.

Tantalise your taste buds with a smorgasbord of delicious gourmet hot and cold food, drinks and coffee.

Live music plays all day with spontaneous performances and buskers throughout the park. 

There is plenty of variety, loads of energy and heaps of great buys for the whole family. It's a dynamic and friendly day and is certainly worth a visit to beautiful Bellingen and why not stay a while to embrace and enjoy their wonderful, welcoming town.

All profits made from Bellingen Markets are donated back to the community.

Bellingen Community Markets… not just a marketplace but a great place to be!

title: Bellingen Plant Fair
description:
