The Bellingen Plant Fair is held twice a year, on the 2nd Saturday of March (Autumn) and September (Spring).

This Autumn they are gearing up for an awesome day. With over 100 stalls set up under the majestic shade trees of Bellingen Park, you will find everything from soil, seeds, plants, pots, flowers, food, tools, and useful information with a focus on natives and being kind to our environment. 

The Plant Fair would not happen without the help of dedicated volunteers and they are always looking for enthused plant loving people to help for a couple of hours, so make contact if keen. 

Taste a smorgasbord of scrumptious food, drinks and coffee, and enjoy live music with the Moonlighters on stage. The Bellingen Growers Market with all their fresh produce and homemade goodies will be there, along with organic kids activities, talks on stage and workshops. 

The BEC and BPF values and celebrates a healthy environment, diversity, culture, and community. Gardeners and land caretakers are on a mission to get more beneficial plants in the ground and help our environment thrive. 

Everyone is welcome to this family friendly event, but sorry, no dogs or cats.  

For more information go to their website or Facebook.

title: Teeing Up For A Cause
description:
Come along for a memorable day on the green at the stunning Safety Beach Golf Course for Teeing Up for a Cause.

This 4-Player Ambrose charity event brings together 100 players from across Woolgoolga and the Northern Beaches to support the NSW Cancer Council. 

Tee off in an action packed 4-Player Ambrose with epic prizes for winners, runners-up, longest drives, closest to the pin—and even the wooden spoon.

Enjoy raffles, fundraising fun, and a fantastic day of networking while making a real difference in the community.
host: WOOLGOOLGA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE INDUSTRY & TOURISM INC

title: Woolgoolga Blues and Berries
description:
Woolgoolga Blues and Berries Festival is set to celebrate the vibrant fusion of music, culture, and local produce, with a special focus on the region's booming blueberry industry. 

Organized by Another Tasty Event, this annual festival has become a much-anticipated highlight on the Coffs Coast, drawing crowds eager to enjoy world-class blues music while celebrating the economic importance of blueberries to both the local and national economy.

The blueberry industry plays a pivotal role in the Woolgoolga region, contributing significantly to employment and export revenues. As one of Australia's leading blueberry production areas, Woolgoolga's blueberry farms have helped position the country as a global player in the berry market. This festival not only showcases the delicious fruit but also highlights its economic impact, from providing jobs to driving agricultural innovation.

Festival-goers will have the opportunity to participate in guided farm tours, offering an inside look at local blueberry farms. These tours will provide insights into sustainable farming practices and the journey from farm to table, educating visitors on the industry's contribution to food security and economic growth.

With live blues music, gourmet food stalls, farm tours, and family-friendly activities, Woolgoolga Blues and Berries promises to be a day filled with community spirit and agricultural appreciation.

title: Woolgoolga Curryfest
description:
Woolgoolga Curryfest is a vibrant, multicultural community festival held annually in the coastal town of Woolgoolga, New South Wales. Celebrating the town's rich Punjabi heritage and broader cultural diversity, the event transforms the town centre and beach reserve into a colourful celebration of food, music, dance, and community.

Organised by the Woolgoolga & Northern Beaches Chamber of Commerce, Woolgoolga Curryfest is a not-for-profit event celebrating community, inclusion, and cultural harmony. It's a signature experience on the Coffs Coast not to be missed.

title: Taralga Market and Car Boot Sale
description:
The Taralga Country Market is a charming monthly event held in the picturesque town of Taralga. The second Saturday of each month, local vendors gather to offer a variety of handmade goods, fresh produce, artisanal products, and much more. 

It's a great opportunity to experience the warmth of the community, support local artisans, and enjoy the relaxed, country atmosphere. Whether you're hunting for unique gifts, tasty treats, or just a fun day out, the Taralga Country Market is a must-visit for anyone in the area.

Sausage sizzle and bacon and egg rolls available.

title: Taralga Ferret Races
description:
The Goulburn and Surrounds Committee of the Children's Medical Research Institute is delighted to bring the Community for the fouth year in a row the Taralga Fun Ferret Races.

Anyone can name one of the Ferrets, for the fee of 25AUD, asking for Race Sponsors for the six races, with the top bidder being the Sponsor of the all-important Race 6.

Come along for a family filled fun day and see who will be crowned winner in 2025. All welcome.

title: Sip and Stroll - Christmas In July
description:
Woolgoolga's ultimate winter party is here and it's cooler than ever.

Sample the tastes and flavours of the world right here in Woolgoolga on Market Street as the town transforms into a festive wonderland for Sip and Stroll – Christmas in July. 
This one night only celebration invites you to gather your crew, dress in your most dazzling or hilariously ugly Christmas outfit, and take a jolly stroll between five fantastic venues.

From spicy street eats to comforting winter warmers, sample international cuisine and drinks as you enjoy live music, a venue to venue scavenger hunt, and loads of festive cheer.

Your ticket includes a wristband, clue card and drink discounts at each venue

Don't miss this magical mid-winter night of fun, food, and festive frolics.
host: WOOLGOOLGA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE INDUSTRY & TOURISM INC

title: Taralga  AP&H Show
description:
Welcome to the 140th Annual Taralga AP&H Show.

There will be a barbeque and CWA Cuppa on the Hill, a Coffee Van and an ice cream van for the kids. 

Lots of rides, science shows and kids amazing race treasure hunt for all kids to enjoy.

Saturday will see the official opening and the judging of the Sheep, Poultry, Cattle, and Home Brew entries. See the sheep counting and the Dog high jump.

On Sunday see the Horse Classes in the Main Arena, Dog Trials, Stud Cattle and Merino Sheep Judging, Show Jumping, Quick Shear, Horse Sporting Events, Poetry Competition Presentation and a Grand Parade.

Come out to Taralga Showground, fun for the whole family.

title: Southern Tablelands Vintage Farm Machinery Club
description:
Visitors are invited to the Taralga Showground to celebrate the 21st anniversary of this remarkable event, which showcases an impressive collection of restored and operational machinery from bygone eras, including pumps, vintage cars, and classic tractors.

Throughout the weekend, attendees can enjoy a variety of food and refreshments, with a barbecue provided on-site and the Country Women's Association (CWA) Tea Rooms located nearby, offering a selection of sweet treats and beverages in the general food area.

Exhibitors are welcome to stay on-site, with free unpowered camping sites available, or the option of powered sites, providing convenient accommodation for those participating in or attending the event.

The weekend promises a festive and welcoming atmosphere, with food and drinks available throughout, and a special Meet and Greet Sausage Sizzle for exhibitors taking place on Friday evening.

In addition, a Tractor Trek is scheduled for Friday, offering a unique opportunity to see these historic machines in action, followed by evening entertainment on Saturday, ensuring a lively and enjoyable experience for all.

This milestone celebration is a must-visit for enthusiasts of vintage machinery, community gatherings, and rural heritage.

title: Woodfired Pizza and Mozzarella Class
description:
Authentic Italian-style pizza, topped with homemade mozzarella and cooked in a wood-fired oven.

Taste the beauty of a Tuscan wood-fired pizza made from scratch and topped with freshly made mozzarella all made by you.

Being passionate about all things food, Lyndall loves sharing her knowledge of making food from scratch, her kitchen is filled with laughter as class participants, knead, prove, roll and dock the dough for the perfect pizza base. Then warm the milk to set the curd for mozzarella, whoever said, don’t play with your food, has obviously never made mozzarella. This cheese is a fun food to make, stretching folding, stretching folding until the curd is shiny, silky and smooth. Perfect for hand shredding to top the pizzas.

This intimate class is designed to enhance cooking skills, to improve confidence in the kitchen and the wood-fired oven. Once the pizzas are cooked they will be enjoyed on the deck, taking in the view.

title: Magpie Up Style Market
description:
The Magpie Up Style Market is what all great markets should be - a mixture of unusual, handmade clothing, jewellery, artwork, woodwork, vintage, retro, collectables, and food.

Enjoy a great bacon and egg roll, international street food including vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free. There is something for everyone and with over 100 stalls you are always sure to find exactly what you want.

The Market has three recycling stations called the recycling hub where even the food waste is used for worm farms!

title: NSW Oztag Junior State Cup
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts a Junior State Cup tournament annually. 

This is the largest tournament for New South Wales with around 300 Junior teams competing to be crowned New South Wales Champions. Associations across the state compete against each other over a three-day tournament. The Junior tournament caters for players aged 12 to 17 years old.

title: AFLW Sydney Swans vs Essendon Bombers - Round 12
description:
Excited to welcome the Sydney Swans AFLW back to the Coffs Coast. Stay tuned for more details on the Round 12 fixture vs Essendon Football Club.

"After successfully taking a home game to Coffs Harbour last year, we're looking forward to heading back to the region in what is an important opportunity to engage participants in the area." - Sydney Swans AFLW

"We've welcomed nine new players over the off-season, and the whole team has been working hard in their pre-season training, for what looks like a really exciting season ahead." - Sydney Swans AFLW

Sydney Swans AFLW Memberships are now on sale.

title: Sydney Swans AFLW Camp
description:
Get ready footy fans - the Sydney Swans AFLW team is coming to Coffs Harbour for three unforgettable days of community connection, inspiration and training.

This is your chance to meet the stars of the Swans AFLW side as they immerse themselves in the local area with school visits, library storytime, junior foot clinics, meet and greets,  and other community events.

Whether you're a die-hard Swans supporter or just love being part of the game, there's something for everyone.

Follow the website for more detailed information.  

Please note the Library Storytime has now changed to Saturday.

title: Oztag Senior NSW State Championships
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts the NSW Senior State Championships annually and the event will be held at C.ex Coffs International Stadium.

The event showcases the talent of Senior teams from all over the state as they compete against each other in the two-day tournament.

title: DoorDash National Youth Championships
description: The DoorDash National Youth Championships (NYC) is Australia's premier youth Touch Football event contested by the nation's best young players across a unique mix of school, regional, and state representative teams, all vying to be crowned National Champions in their respective gender and/or age divisions. The event features eight divisions; Boys and Girls U12, U14, U16 and U18s.

title: Oztag Senior Australian Championships
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts the Senior Australian Championships annually and the event will be held at C.ex Coffs International Stadium.

The event showcases the talent of Senior teams from all over the state as they compete against each other in the three-day tournament.

title: Junior Oztag Australian Championships
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts the Junior Australian Championships annually and the event will be held at C.ex Coffs International Stadium. 

The event showcases the talent of Junior teams from all over the nation as they compete against each other in the three-day tournament.

title: International Tag Series
description:
Thirty three Nations and 20 divisions starting from 18s and up, the countdown is on for the highly anticipated 2025 International Tag Series. 

This premier international tag event will bring together the best teams from around the world for four days of intense Oztag competition.

title: International Tag Federation World Cup
description:
The countdown is on for the highly anticipated ITF Tag World Cup. This premier international tag event will bring together the best teams from around the world for four days of intense Oztag competition.

Australia is proud to play host to this prestigious tournament, welcoming teams from fellow International Tag Federation members Ireland, Great Britain, New Zealand, and South Africa and 25+ associate member nations. 

With divisions starting from 18s and up, the event is expected to feature 200 teams and approximately 4,500 players and coaches, making it one of the largest gatherings in international tag history.

title: Oz Tag 2025 Interstate Series - State of Origin
description:
Oztag's State of Origin is set to make its long-awaited return in September.

The biggest rivalry in Australian sporting history is back on the Oztag calendar for 2026 - prepare as New South Wales take on Queensland in Oztag's State of Origin.

title: Junior Oztag NSW State Championships
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts the Junior NSW State Championships annually and the event will be held at C.ex Coffs International Stadium. 

The event showcases the talent of Junior teams from all over the nation as they compete against each other in the three-day tournament.

title: Senior Oztag Australian Championships
description:
The Australian Oztag Sports Association hosts the NSW Senior Australian Championships annually and the event will be held at C.ex Coffs International Stadium.

The event showcases the talent of Senior teams from all over the state as they compete against each other in the two-day tournament.

title: Sea Country Opening Event
description:
Sea Country - a solo exhibtion by Dylan Bolt. Dylan is a Bundjalung man , living on Yaegl Country.

Sea Country is a heartfelt exploration of Australia's marine life and the vital ecosystems that support it. Through a series of underwater ocean scapes, this exhibition draws attention to the urgent need to protect the oceans and celebrates the deep, ancestral relationship Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples hold with the sea.

Guided by the 2025 NAIDOC Week theme, The Next Generation: Strength, Vision and Legacy, this exhibition honours the enduring custodianship of Sea Country—past, present, and future. It recognises the strength of First Nations communities in continuing this care, the vision required to heal and protect these ecosystems, and the legacy being built for generations to come.

Having experienced the beauty of the Great Barrier Reef firsthand, the artist shares a vision of preservation and interconnectedness.

Sea Country is both a visual celebration and a call to action—one that amplifies the role of young leaders in carrying forward a deep cultural responsibility to protect the ocean, its creatures, and the stories it holds.

title: Stories of Spirit and Sky Exhibition
description:
Stories of Spirit and Sky explores the deep connections between land, sky, and spirit, as told through Indigenous perspectives. 

This exhibition brings together artworks that honour the knowledge passed down through generations—of constellations that guide, spirits that protect and skies that hold the echoes of ancient wisdom. Each piece is a testament to the enduring relationship between people and the cosmos, where stories are not just told, but lived.

Through art, you are invited to see the sky as First Nations peoples have always known it: a living story, woven with culture, identity, and spirit.

title: Pave The Way:  A First Nations Laneway Twilight Festival
description:
Yiigu and Welcome!

Join them for a magical twilight celebration of First Nations culture at Pave The Way Laneway Festival—a vibrant evening of art, music, dance, food, and connection, right in the heart of town.

Set on Country and grounded in the spirit of the Gumbaynggirr, Dunghutti, Biripi, and Worimi peoples, this unique event blends ancient traditions with bold contemporary creativity. You'll be swept up in the energy from the moment you arrive, with First Nations DJs kicking off the festivities and a lively market filled with beautiful arts, crafts, and delicious food from local makers and creators.

As the sun sets, the laneway will come alive with pop-up dance performances, spoken word, and projection art that lights up the walls with powerful stories and stunning visuals. Gather around the fire pit for a quiet moment of reflection or connection, where culture and community come together.

Don't miss your chance to visit The Gallery, Saltwater Freshwater's cultural hub, transformed for the night into an interactive space full of hands-on workshops. Learn weaving techniques, meet local artists, and experience live performances from First Nations poets, storytellers, and actors.

Whether you're coming to listen, learn, dance, or just soak it all in, the Laneway Festival is an open invitation to celebrate the strength, stories, and spirit of First Nations culture.  

All welcome. Come and connect.
host: Saltwater Freshwater Arts Alliance Aboriginal Corporation

title: Coffs Harbour Regional Conseratorium
description:
Coffs Harbour Regional Conservatorium has been part of the Coffs Harbour community since 1984. If you have always wanted to learn to play an instrument, sing, record or even write music then THE CON has a program to suit you.

They offer individual and group lessons, ensembles, music programs for schools, professional development for teachers, and offer performances by our students, teachers and acclaimed musicians from across Australia and beyond.

They also have amazing, regular music events and concerts so have a look and there will be a performance for you.

title: Art Exhibition - Anything Goes
description:
Enjoy the latest exhibition "Anything Goes", at the Coffs Harbour Showground Gallery, featuring artworks created by members of the Coffs Harbour Creative Arts Group. 

This is an art exhibition where Coffs Harbour Creative Arts Group members have the chance to let their imaginations run wild, with no theme restrictions and any media - pastels, acrylics, watercolours, pen and wash - the sky's the limit.

On display at the Coffs Harbour Showground Gallery, all artwork is for sale and is your chance to secure a unique, local, and original work of art.

title: Art Exhibition - Fabulous Fakes
description:
Fabulous Fakes is a popular and playful exhibition by the Coffs Harbour Creative Arts Group (CHCAG), where members reimagine and reinterpret iconic works from art history. From Old Masters to Cubists, Impressionists to Realists, this showcase is a tribute to the greats, with a twist.

CHCAG artists draw inspiration from the past to create something entirely new, using various media including acrylics, watercolour, pencil, pastel, collage, and photography. The result is a dynamic display of skill, humour, and originality.

On display at the Coffs Harbour Showground Gallery, all artwork is for sale and is your chance to secure a unique, local, and original work of art.

title: C.ex Group Coffs Harbour Running Festival
description:
The C.ex Group Coffs Harbour Running Festival is a community event with a Marathon, Half Marathon, 10-kilometre and 5-kilometre Fun Runs and a 3-kilometre Family Fun Run/Walk.

New to 2025 is an iconic Marathon and 1 lap Half Marathon course. Runners take in the Coffs Creek Walkway and Botanic Gardens before heading out to the stunning Jetty Foreshores for the first time in the event's history.

Spectacular scenery awaits on the North Wall, running out to the end of the Coffs Harbour Jetty on the way out, to the end of the South Wall and to the end of the Coffs Harbour Jetty on the way back.

Runners have a shaded finish along the gravel paths and boardwalks of the northern side of Coffs Creek Walkway.

The shorter distances are held on a flat, shady Coffs Creek walkway, with the picturesque track hugging the beautiful Coffs Creek. Runners cross floating boardwalks, through swamp forests of mangrove, casuarina and paperbark trees from the centre of town to the coast and back.

title: Coffs Backyard Ultra
description:
Challenge yourself to a new personal best in a fun, inclusive and community-focused event.

Coffs Backyard Ultra welcomes all runners – from first-timers to experienced ultrarunners. 

Complete 6.706km lap every hour, on the hour – and keep going until one runner remains.

The Coffs Backyard Ultra 'lap' occurs on the stunning Coffs Creek Walkway in the heart of Coffs Harbour, which is on shaded flat gravel paths (~80%) and easy boardwalks (~20%).

Spectators welcome: Come along and see one of the world's biggest Backyard Ultra runners in action! Cheer them on and watch as runners run to complete the challenge each hour.

There will also be food stalls and event activation in a social, inclusive space for keen and beginner runners - catch the running bug in Coffs!

title: Car Boot Market
description:
Discover a hidden gem during your visit! Join this bustling event, where you'll unearth a treasure trove of pre-loved household goods, including fashionable clothes, nostalgic toys, practical household items, sports gear, gardening equipment, and lush plants. 

It's not just a shopping experience; it's a chance to immerse yourself in the local culture while finding unique and eco-friendly souvenirs. 

Come along to snag fantastic bargains and uncover one-of-a-kind treasures that will make your trip truly unforgettable.

title: City Centre Sunday Market
description:
The City Centre Sunday Market is on every Sunday in the Castle Street car park.

Shop a range of fresh fruits and vegetables, Asian vegetables, honey, eggs and plants. With Hot food and coffee available and crafts and curios. The market is on rain, hail or shine as it is undercover.

When you finish shopping at the market, head into Coffs Central shopping centre for more shopping!

title: Travelling Film Festival Coffs Harbour
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming to Coffs Harbour for the first time in its 50+ year history! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, Berlin and Sydney Film Festival at BCC Cinemas Coffs Harbour.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island. 

Plus Australian films including the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle, and the awarding winning documentary about the most flooded area in Australia - Lismore. Director of Floodland Jordan Guisti will also be in attendance to present his film and a directors masterclass for local filmmakers. 

Don't miss all these films and more at exclusive screenings!

title: Patricia Piccinini and Caroline Rothwell Interconnected Entities
description:
This exhibition brings together two of Australia's most celebrated female artists, Patricia Piccinini and Caroline Rothwell.

Working across the shared themes of hybridity, transmutation, future technologies and biophilia, their works speak to humanity's kindred and complex relationships with the plant and animal worlds, and the inherent connection with these species and each other.

title: teamLab Flowers and People − A Whole Year per Hour
description:
In this interactive video installation a year's worth of seasonal flowers bloom over the course of an hour, continuously scattering and changing.

Flowers are born, bloom, then in the course of time, they wither and die. The flowers are eternally repeating the process of life and death. 

The artwork is not a pre-recorded image that is played back: it is created by a computer program that continuously renders the work in real time. The interaction between people and the installation causes continuous change in the artwork.

In spring in the Kunisaki Peninsula, there are many cherry blossoms in the mountains and canola blossoms at their base. It is a place of great serenity and contentment, but the expansive body of flowers is an ecosystem influenced by human intervention, and the boundary between the work of nature and the work of humans is unclear. Rather than nature and humans being in conflict, a healthy ecosystem is one that includes people. In the past, people understood that they could not grasp nature in its entirety, and that it is not possible to control nature. teamLab believe that these valleys hold faint traces of this premodern relationship with nature that once existed, and we hope to explore a form of human intervention based on the premise that nature cannot be controlled.

title: Juz Kitson Shadows Make the Light Shine Brighter
description: Shadows Make the Light Shine Brighter is an immersive ceramic and video installation that reimagines ancient Roman and Greek funerary urns, amphoras and female figurines. Meticulously hand crafted from porcelain and stoneware in real life and using photogrammetry to bring them to life in animation form, these sculptural objects merge historical reverence with a vision of a post-apocalyptic dystopian future.

title: Santa Arrival Parade - Park Beach Plaza
description: Come along and enjoy all the Christmas festivities, including a fun filled parade welcoming Santa with his live reindeer. Dancers, Pipe and Drum Band, entertainers will accompany Santa through the shopping centre until he reaches his destination - The Santa display in the main promotion court.

title: Sutton Village Country Markets
description:
This market has fresh produce and unique products, focusing on local handmade and grown products.

Enjoy the delicious food and activities on the picturesque country grounds with a variety of market stalls, live entertainment, pet friendly and free parking.

It is just off the Federal Highway eight kilometres from the NSW/ACT border.

Held on the second Sunday of each month.

title: Seasonal Observations Walk
description:
On the first Thursday of each month, plus a second event on the 2nd or third Saturday, one of the volunteer guides will lead a "Seasonal Observations walk".

Join the guide for a free walk around the garden, checking plants that are fruiting and flowering at that particular time. The photo illustrates one example and usually there are around 30 plants covered on a walk.

Meet at the cafe seats just before 10 am and join in the fun.

Please bring water and a hat and apply sunscreen and insect repellent in the warmer months.
host: THE FRIENDS OF THE NORTH COAST REGIONAL BOTANIC GARDEN INCOPORATED

title: Coffs Coast Growers Market
description:
With stalls selling local and farm fresh products such as honey, bread, coffee, eggs, nuts, skincare, flowers, herbal remedies, fruit and vegetables, herbs and more, the Coffs Coast Growers Market has something for everyone!

 Meet the farmers and producers every Thursday in the heart of the city.

title: The Beatle Boys - at Jetty Memorial Theatre - Coffs Harbour
description:
The Beatle Boys are back in 2025 with an exciting new show celebrating the 60th anniversary of Rubber Soul, The Beatles’ revolutionary 1965 album. Hailed as a turning point in their career, Rubber Soul featured iconic tracks like “Norwegian Wood” “Michelle” and “In My Life” blending innovative lyrics and instrumentation. The album spent six weeks atop the UK Albums Chart and is ranked #5 on Rolling Stone’s “500 Greatest Albums of All Time.”

Honouring this milestone, The Beatle Boys recreate Rubber Soul along with a selection of hits spanning 1962 to 1969. Combining vintage instruments, meticulous detail, and stunning visuals, their show transcends a traditional concert, delivering an immersive, time-traveling experience.

For over 15 years, The Beatle Boys—John Kater, Maddy Breen, Rod Auld, and Michael Carpenter—have thrilled global audiences, from Canada to South Africa, with their energetic and authentic performances. Music historian Glenn A. Baker describes them as “impressive with their deft grasp of the Fab Four’s entire span.” Fans agree, calling the tribute “absolutely brilliant” and “pure nostalgia.”

John Kater, portraying Paul McCartney, reflects: “The Beatles’ music remains timeless. We’re excited to celebrate Rubber Soul, an album that redefined music forever.” Whether you’re a lifelong fan or new to the Fab Four, this show is a must-see celebration of music history.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - Coffs Harbour
description:
The Internationally celebrated Australian Eagles Show soars back in 2025 with Their 'Life In The Fast Lane' Tour. 

Prepare to be dazzled as the renowned Australian Eagles Show, fronted by the talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne, returns with an all-new production in 2024. Having wowed audiences in sold-out theatres across Australia, America, Europe, and South Africa, this world-class extravaganza is now making its triumphant return to Australia.

The Australian Eagles Show, featuring a stellar five-piece band, is set to intricately recreate the timeless classics that catapulted the Eagles to global stardom. From the melodic 'Desperado' and the high-octane 'Life in the Fast Lane' to the soulful 'New Kid in Town,' the heart-warming 'Take it to the Limit,' and the electric 'Heartache Tonight,' you'll be treated to an authentic Eagles experience. Additionally, the band will pay homage to the solo hits of Joe Walsh, Don Henley, and the late Glenn Frey.

The Eagles, formed in Los Angeles in 1971, achieved legendary status with an impressive list of accolades, including five number-one singles, six Grammy Awards, five American Music Awards, six number-one albums, and over 150 million records sold. Their 'Eagles Greatest Hits' album remains one of the best-selling albums of the 20th century.

It's a night of timeless music you won't want to miss.

title: John Waters presents Radio Luxembourg at Jetty Memorial Theatre - Coffs Harbour
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: Echoes of Pink Floyd - 60 Years of Pink Floyd - Coffs Harbour
description:
Iconic British rock band, Pink Floyd left an indelible mark on the world, inspiring generations with their ground-breaking soundscapes and thought-provoking lyrics. 2025 marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style in a brand new concert production by Adelaide’s own Echoes of Pink Floyd.

Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerising journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.

Echoes of Pink Floyd stands as Australia’s foremost tribute dedicated to honouring the legendary band's monumental legacy and has garnered widespread acclaim across the country since their inception in 2009.

Since embarking on national tours in 2014, their lovingly-crafted performances have captivated audiences nationwide.

title: Choirboys - Run To Paradise at Jetty Memorial Theatre - Coffs Harbour
description:
As young twenty-something-year-olds, Choirboys formed in 1978, growing up on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The wild, hedonistic lifestyle the band witnessed of the youth in the 70s is ultimately what gave birth to their seminal rock anthem, Run To Paradise. It’s all about the stories that sound all too familiar within the culture widely assumed of the music industry - “sex, drugs, and rock ‘n’ roll” and they tell it all.

Run To Paradise is a “spilling of the beans” of sorts. It’s part story, part song that chronicles through some of the wildest, most risqué, outrageous, and downright hilarious stories of Australian Rock. All, as these Oz pub-rock icons recall it.

And behind the narrative are the classic songs that define the musical landscape of rock music in the ’70s and 80s, including Deep Purple’s “Smoke On The Water”, Chuck Berry’s ‘Never Can Tell’, TMG’s ‘Jump In My Car’, Dragon’s ‘Are You Old Enough’, AC/DC’s ‘Long Way To The Top’ and of course the Choirboys hits ‘Boys will Be Boys’ ‘Never Gonna Die’ ‘Struggletown’ and the pub-rock anthem ‘Run to Paradise’, to name a few.

title: Harbourside Markets
description:
A boutique market by the beach is held every Sunday near the beautiful historic Jetty in Coffs Harbour.

You can’t get more local than this! Your favourite food trucks, art, jewellery, clothing, beauty and lifestyle products, plants, vintage and collectible stalls. Harbourside Market’s philosophy of ethical and fair-trade, locally made, and locally grown guarantees you a unique experience.

Harbourside Markets is an all-abilities market. There are extra wide footpaths and disabled toilets close by.

Dogs are permitted in the market space on a lead and our council-approved leash-free dog beach is a short walk away if they need a good run!

Harbourside Markets offers free live music with some of the coast's best artists on the main stage every Sunday! The market is also paying members of OneMusic Australia to support the people who make the music you love.

The market space also cohosts community events like the Coffs Harbour International Buskers Festival, Summer Beach Hop Show & Shine, Youth Week, NAIDOC Week, and more so keep an eye out on our website for the next special event.

Spend Sunday by the sea and soak up the beachside local vibe.

title: Tulip Top Gardens
description:
As showcased on the Better Homes and Gardens television show, spring at Tulip Top Gardens is a blissful haven that is a must-see. Acres of stunning world-class gardens framed by weeping willows, and 1000 blossoms, paint the scene for almost a million tulips, daffodils and other flowers creatively planted.

Enjoy free entertainment on selected days. Free tea or instant coffee is available from their garden cafe along with a range of hot and cold food options. Tulip Top Gardens pancake parlour set at the base of the lookout in the gardens produces aromatic coffee and sensational Dutch pancakes with a range of toppings.

The event is pooch-friendly, just have doggie bags ready and have your pooch on a lead. There are some containers and bore taps available for drinking water.

As you wander the gardens, be mesmerised by the natural habitats of Tulip Top Gardens (birds, frogs and more) along with their hand-selected piped music.

Spend time in the gift shop, tasting local wines for free or enjoy the live entertainment or creative arts workshops.

Coach parking and group entry discounts, disabled and level entry access also available – all parking is free.

title: Sawtell Chillifest
description:
Sawtell Chillifest promises to be a vibrant celebration of food, culture, and community. Organized by Another Tasty Event in collaboration with the Sawtell Chamber of Commerce, this annual festival is a standout occasion on the Coffs Coast, drawing locals and visitors alike for a day of spicy indulgence and fun.

Located in the picturesque streets of Sawtell, Chillifest will showcase an array of chilli-inspired dishes, from gourmet food trucks to local restaurants serving everything from fiery street food to mild, flavorful meals suitable for all palates. 

Visitors can also expect to explore market stalls filled with artisanal products, hot sauces, and locally crafted goods, making it a feast for both taste and sight.

The festival will offer live entertainment, featuring local musicians and performers, providing the perfect backdrop to this lively event. For the daring, the popular chilli-eating competition will return, offering brave participants the chance to test their spice tolerance in front of an eager crowd.

With something for everyone, including family-friendly activities and a festive atmosphere, Sawtell Chillifest continues to grow as one of the region's most anticipated events, blending culinary excitement with community spirit.

title: Graham G Toole Sunday Sessions
description:
Enjoy live entertainment with musician Graham Toole, singing the songs of the greats from the 60s, 70s and 80s. 

Come along for a relaxing afternoon with great food, indoor and outdoor seating and a lovely outdoor play area for the kids.

Reserve a Picnic Patch under the shady trees or call ahead to reserve a table.

title: Gresford Billy Cart Derby
description:
Billy cart racing is merely the highlight of an action-packed day brimming with activities for the whole family!

Nestled in the scenic route from Newcastle through the Hunter Valley, the Derby promises a throwback to classic, wholesome fun for all ages. With a variety of events, rides, market stalls, outstanding coffee, and the chance to snag fantastic raffle prizes, it’s the perfect day out!

Post-race, unwind with a leisurely drink at the Beatty Hotel, a proud supporter of ours, and consider dining in their restaurant. Alternatively, the Dungog Rodeo offers an exhilarating evening for those seeking more adventure. With Easter packed with so many activities, we invite you to come and soak up the excitement.

Make sure you’re glued to our Facebook page – you won’t want to miss a beat as we post announcements, sneak peeks, and exclusive updates, all set to unfold over the next few weeks.

Get ready for a rollercoaster of excitement, community spirit, and some serious fun. The countdown has begun!

title: Gresford Agricultural Show
description:
Gresford Show continues to be the most celebrated, most fun, and most inclusive event in the district. 

On Friday at the Gresford Show, you can see the local commercial cattle competition, cattle, goats, poultry, and pavilions with sewing, cooking, flowers, arts, and crafts, fruit, vegetables, and photography.

On Saturday there is dog camp drafting, tug of war, post splitting, mixed dog races and best-dressed child's dog, ag bikes, and of course, not to be missed is the Grand Parade.

There will be fireworks on Saturday night followed by a live band until late.

title: The Winter Retreat
description:
Luxuriate in nourishing practices to free your body, ease your mind and awaken your spirit. 

Each morning will begin with breathwork and meditation to centre and connect, followed by an energising vinyasa yoga practice and leading to an eventual journey into relaxation. 

Time between breakfast, lunch and dinner will come together to explore mindfulness practices such as journaling, a cacao ceremony, walks in nature and most importantly - leisure time just for you. 

Each evening will be sealed with more restorative styles such as yin, yoga nidra and sound healing - all with an intention to downregulate and prepare you for a blissful night of rest.
host: R Want & S van der Donk

title: Spring Jazz and Wine in the Garden at Norman Lindsay Gallery
description:
Come along to Wine and Jazz in the Garden at the Norman Lindsay Gallery. Get your friends together to enjoy good music, good wine and good times!

 Spring Jazz in the Garden at Norman Lindsay Gallery returns for another sensational day of music with George Washing Machine and friends, tastings from local wineries and lively dance performances.

This year winemakers and brewers come from both large and boutique wineries. Many varieties of wines, boutique beers, local food producers and cider tastings will be on show for sampling and purchase.

Pre-purchase a cheese or antipasto platter for two and take home a special Norman Lindsay Gallery Sphinx etched wine glass.

Bookings are essential.

title: House of Ghosts exhibition by Wendy Sharpe
description:
Wendy Sharpe's House of Ghosts exhibition at Norman Lindsay Gallery features ephemeral wall paintings, oil paintings, works on paper, light installations and more.

The concept of ghosts and the afterlife appears in almost every culture. House of Ghosts explores the intersection of the real and the imagined – the seen and unseen, Imagined figures, spirits, ghosts, memories of people, or some kind of hallucination.
Norman Lindsay's beloved older brother, Reg was killed on the western front in France in 1916. Norman was inconsolable. Consequently, he became interested in spiritualism, including the use of a Ouija board to contact his brother, and this created a rift within the Lindsay family.

Wendy Sharpe imagines Norman walking around his house, in a state of grief and longing.

The theme has a deep connection to Sharpe's own family background. Her grandmother Bessie and her sister Anne were both psychic and were followers of Madam Blavatsky (1831- 1891), a Russian occultist and philosopher. Great-aunt Anne was a well-known psychic and medium in her day, who gave public readings and performances in Russia and the UK.

title: Dogs Day Out at Norman Lindsay Gallery
description:
To mark International Dog Day, you're invited to bring your dog to Norman Lindsay Gallery to discover the grounds and enjoy a range of fun activities.

Canines can channel their inner artist with dog paw painting and sit in a photo booth dressed like an artist.

There will be a stick and ball library and many other dog-related activities including displays from Springwood Dog Training club.

There will also be a Dogs Day Out Talent competition with prizes from DOGUE – Australia's leading dog boutique brand. Includes:

Best Dressed / Fancy Dress: Turn the spotlight on your dog's fashion sense in this stylish contest.
Lookalikes (Dog and Owner): Celebrate the uncanny resemblance between you and your dog in this fun competition.
Best Hairdo (Grooming): Does your dog have a hairdo that turns heads? Show off their grooming in this category.
Pre-pack a picnic to enjoy in the beautiful grounds with your pooch or purchase something tasty from the food stalls.

Special discounted ceramic dog and cat bowls with printed images of Norman Lindsay's delightful drawings available.

title: Ford NSW Open Championship
description:
Walk the fairways with some of the best professional and amateur players from Australia and around the world at the 2025 Ford NSW Open Championship, including defending champion Lucas Herbert.

This year's event will be held at The Vintage Golf Course - located in the picturesque Hunter Valley and renowned for its stunning design and layout.

In addition to seeing all the action up close, there will be lots of activities for the whole family to enjoy, including a party hole, golf clinics, and a tournament village with plenty of food and beverage options.

title: Wedding  and Wine Festival
description:
Plan your big day the fun way with your fiance and some wine in the heart of the Hunter.

Hunter Event Group are bringing couples the ultimate wedding planning experience. No stress, just fun. Meet amazing vendors, design your own flower bouquet, enjoy delicious food and drinks, be wowed by iconic wedding runway show, save on your wedding budget with lucky door prizes and exclusive vendor discounts and so much more all under one roof.

Whether you're just starting your wedding planning or ticking off your final to-dos, this event is perfect for brides and grooms at every stage. Dive into all the excitement of wedding prep and get ready for your big day in style.

Discover award-winning and emerging wedding vendors, a runway show, live music, and exciting raffles. Enjoy wine tastings from Ben Ean, plus cocktails, beer, coffee, and delicious food stalls. Take part in workshops and demos, and don't miss exclusive offers and discounts. Free goodie bags and event programs for the first 150 couples.

Turn wedding prep into the perfect date with wine, love, and the magic of the Hunter Valley.

title: Goulburn Parkrun
description:
Goulburn Parkrun is a free, weekly, five-kilometre timed run open to all ages and abilities. The run is for enjoyment so come along and join in the fun, whatever your pace! 

Please register before your first run and don't forget to bring a printed copy of your barcode if you want to be timed!

title: Hunter Valley Wedding Fair
description:
Touring over multiple locations, targeting Hunter Region’s most popular wedding destinations including Central Coast, Newcastle and Hunter Valley. Introducing our third and final stop for their Series Five Wedding Fairs, Hunter Valley Wedding Fair.

The Wedding Fair is perfect for couples throughout all stages of their wedding planning journey. They connect you with incredible local vendors and provide you with inspiration, tips and tricks, opportunities to save on your budget, plus tick-off items from your wedding checklist. 

You can expect award-winning vendors, up-and-coming vendors, free floral workshops, exclusive on-day offers and discounts, win giveaways and prizes, live music and free event programs. 

*Line-up is subject to change in the lead-up to the event.

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Springwood
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Springwood
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  
Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   
It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Kitty Flanagan - Blue Mountains
description:
Kitty Flanagan is coming to the Blue Mountains with a sneaky peak, first look at her new stand-up show. Asking but not necessarily answering all the big questions. Were we smarter before social media? Has your call ever been used for training purposes? And what exactly is an empath?

This is your chance to see the award-winning star of Fisk, Utopia and Have You Been Paying Attention? doing what she does best, stand-up comedy, live on stage at a theatre near you – like, actually near you, possibly just down the road depending on where you live. Point is, Kitty's doing all the travelling so you don't have to. Don't miss it!

title: Bloom sings Adele and Amy Winehouse Songbook - Springwood
description:
Australia’s bright shining singing star, Bloom, brings to you the songs of two amazing artists: Adele and Amy Winehouse.

Both artists amassed a legion of fans the world over, and together have sold in excess of 20 million albums.  Featuring the hits including Someone Like You, Send My Love, Hello, Rolling In Deep, Back to Black, Valerie, You Know I’m No Good and Rehab to name a few, this amazing show is sure to thrill the toughest of sceptics.

As a constant on the Australian and New Zealand touring circuit, Bloom’s vocal prowess has been described by many as “mesmerising” and “sensational” and this show will be no different.  Bloom has handpicked an incredible songbook that will have you primed for an unforgettable evening.

Be charmed by the Australian vocal powerhouse that is Bloom and celebrate all that is Adele and Amy Winehouse.

title: On Sacred Ground - Paintings by Corinne Loxton of the MacDonnell Ranges and the Blue Mountains
description:
On Sacred Ground, presents plein-air paintings made during a residency in the Red Centre and larger studio paintings. The works invite urban audiences to consider the desert’s mystical, sacred and environmental importance.

"The Red Centre holds a unique position in the psyche and mythology of all Australians. These paintings enable you to journey with me as I connect with nature and explore the majesty and extremes of the desert."

Loxton continues "Like many desert pilgrims before me, the unfamiliar environment of the desert brought me face-to-face with my vulnerability. The ancient landforms and spaciousness of the place confronted me with my own fragility, the limits of my capacity and ultimately, my finiteness. I encountered silence and space, the gentle, faithful companionship of the earth, the creatures, and trees.

Painting en plein air in that environment seemed imperative, a deeply personal journey, a pilgrimage of the soul. The works on exhibit pay homage to nature’s knowing, abiding spirit, and human experiences of struggle, endurance, and hope in that environment."

title: Handmade in the Hunter Markets
description:
Handmade in the Hunter Markets - where we make it, bake it, grow and sew it.

As the longest running and most popular, meet-the-maker market in the vineyards, you will meet and talk with the grower, maker or artist behind each of the expertly crafted and truly unique Handmade in the Hunter creations. They take great pride in the fact that when you buy something from them you are taking a little bit of the Hunter home with you. 

Conveniently located near the three major concert venues (Hope Estate, Bimbadgen and Roche Estate), wineries, restaurants and Hunter Valley Gardens, Handmade in the Hunter Markets are also held to coincide with concert dates and other major vineyard events.

Come along to see, taste, try, buy and marvel for yourself at what the vibrant Hunter Valley artistic and creative community has to offer.

title: Goulburn Thoroughbred Racing - Christmas Cup
description:
Join Goulburn District Racing Club for the Goulburn Christmas Cup Race Day, featuring the Fred Cooper Cup.

Whether you chose to book one of their hire options or bring your picnic rug it’s the perfect opportunity to gather your friends, family and colleagues to celebrate the end of year!

title: Lovedale Long Lunch
description:
The Lovedale Long Lunch is a progressive-style lunch where food and wine lovers are invited to discover the wonders of Lovedale. 

Each May, a decadent line up of the Hunter Valley’s leading chefs team up with seven of Lovedale’s finest wineries and local entertainment for a weekend of foodie fun.

Gather a group of friends, stay in Lovedale accommodation, build your itinerary, book a bus and enjoy a fun and relaxing weekend away at the Hunter Valley’s biggest food and wine event of the year.

title: St Saviour's Community Markets
description:
St Saviour's Community Markets is held on the first Saturday of every month (excluding January), in the St Saviour's Cathedral Hall. 

Come and enjoy the gourmet BBQ and browse a wide variety of Stalls showcasing local produce, wines, honey, candles, jams, cakes and slices.

You'll also find plants, antiques, bric a brac, knitwear for the whole family, and lots of jewellery including rings, necklaces and watches. All sorts of paintings, art works and diamond paintings, along with textiles, homemade sewn and embroidered articles.

Refreshments are available and everyone is welcome!

title: Bell Tower Tour at St Saviour's Cathedral
description:
Take an interactive tour and learn about the history of the bells at St Saviour's Cathedral. 

The splendid bell tower, soaring windows, and massive stonework are the first impressions one has of St Saviour's. 

Built around the old St Saviour's Church from 1874 to 1884, St Saviour's Cathedral is one of the finest white sandstone cathedrals in the Southern Hemisphere. Both the cathedral and hall were designed by one of Australia's most famous architects, Edmund T. Blacket. 

The tower was built and bells installed as per the original design in 1988 as a Bicentennial project. In 2006 the final three bells were installed, giving Goulburn the only 12 bell and flat sixth country peal in the Southern Hemisphere.

title: Horizons Exhibition
description:
Horizons explores connections between the body, the natural world and the built environment. The term horizons can indicate limitlessness, opportunity and optimism, or, conversely, be seen as a perceived barrier, feared sense of the unknown, or a warning sign. The exhibition embraces the breadth of these interpretations, looking at the ways we desire to draw close to the environment while also acknowledging the constructed physical, digital and mental barriers created between humankind and the landscape.

The idea of horizons as moments of precipice, meeting, or confrontation with the more-than-human worlds is investigated through the diverse and innovative practices of leading Australian artists living and working across Australia. The exhibition presents works by artists Gemma Brown, Rowan Conroy, Marian Drew, Lizzie Hall, Bianca Hester, Janet Laurence, Guido Maestri, Mandy Quadrio and Isadora Vaughan. Horizons features a dynamic range of media including ceramics, audio-visual works, photography, painting and installations.

The impactful works featured in Horizons will look at human intervention in the natural world in order to consider historic moments of destruction, contend with our present, and posit possible futures.

title: Markets on Bourke
description:
The Markets on Bourke have a range of market stalls with lots of local goodies to be found. Everything from local arts, and crafts, produce, plants, fresh flowers, live music and great food can all be found throughout the stalls at the hugely popular Markets on Bourke.

On the fourth Saturday of the month (the third Saturday in December and not held in January) the Markets on Bourke are held in the Goulburn Scout Hall on the corner of Bourke and Addison Streets.

No matter what you are looking for you will be spoilt for choice so make sure you are at the Scout Hall so you don't miss out!

title: Guided Tour of Sts Peter and Paul's Old Cathedral Goulburn
description:
The beautiful and historic Old Cathedral of Sts Peter and Paul's Goulburn offers a guided tour once per month. 

Join there knowledgeable and enthusiastic tour guides as they reveal the fascinating history of this Goulburn landmark, and take you on a journey spanning over 150 years of civic and religious development in the region.

title: The Goulburn Workers Annual Art Prize
description:
The Goulburn District Art Society (GDAS) Annual Art Prize is on again and is open to all with the major art prize winnerto be selected by the judge from the winners of each section.

Sections competed in are Oil, Watercolour/Pen and Wash, Acrylics, Drawing, Other Media, Miniatures, GDAS Members Only, Photography, Digital Art and finally The People's Choice Award. 

The Goulburn and District Art Society has a membership of dedicated artists whose aim is to foster art in Goulburn and its surroundings. It does this through regular painting days, workshops and exhibitions thus encouraging artists in their endeavours and bringing art to the attention of the general public.

This Art Prize Exhibition for all entrants is on display for the whole long weekend so make sure you come and view some of the finest artwork made locally.

title: Live Music with Goulburn Country Music Association
description:
Come along on the first Sunday of each month to the Goulburn Workers Club and enjoy four hours of non-stop live country music, popular soft rock and easy-listening music. There is something for everyone and a large dance floor for all who love to dance! 

Sit back, relax and enjoy yourself in the McKell Sports Bar and Lounge.

Please contact the Workers Club before attending the event as occasionally a sporting event may cause the music to be cancelled or moved to another room.

If you play an instrument, sing or have any other queries about joining the Country Music Association please contact Loz Westley on the number provided.

title: Tours and Tastings
description:
Embark on an exclusive journey through the hidden corridors of GPAC, unveiling the secrets of the stage. Finish the experience with a curated tasting of Lerida Wines, celebrating the art of both theatre and winemaking. For those who cherish culture, elegance, and a touch of indulgence, this is an evening you won’t want to miss.

Capacity is limited, so secure your spot early to avoid missing out on this unique experience!

 These events are in partnership with Lerida Estate.

title: Songs & Stories with Pat Drummond
description:
Step into The Meeting Place for an intimate evening of music, stories, and connection with one of Australia's most distinctive folk voices — Pat Drummond.

Known for his poetic lyrics and honest storytelling, Pat's songs celebrate everyday heroes and explore themes of love, change, and community. His performances invite you into a world where songwriting becomes conversation, and every lyric carries a deeper meaning.

This free event offers a rare chance to slow down, share a drink, and truly listen. It's the kind of night that makes you lean in, laugh unexpectedly, and maybe even see yourself in the stories being sung.

So come as you are, grab a drink, and settle into a space where the music is heartfelt, the pace is slower, and the atmosphere is all about connection.

title: One Act Wonders!
description:
Experience the magic of live theatre in bite-sized brilliance! One Act Wonders showcases an exciting lineup of short one-act plays performed by talented amateur theatre groups and regional artists from across NSW.

With performances ranging from 10 to 15 minutes, audiences will enjoy a dynamic mix of original scripts and classic theatre, brought to life on stage in a celebration of creativity and storytelling.

Join this unforgettable theatrical event, where emerging and seasoned performers alike share their passion for the stage. Whether you're a theatre enthusiast or just looking for an afternoon of engaging entertainment, One Act Wonders is not to be missed!

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Goulburn
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: Seventh Wonder performs Fleetwood Mac - Goulburn
description:
Hailed as one of the world's leading Fleetwood Mac shows, and managed by Former Fleetwood Mac manager Dennis Dunstan, Seventh Wonder has been applauded by critics and fans alike, including Mick Fleetwood himself.

Don't miss the opportunity to witness the magic as Seventh Wonder brings Fleetwood Mac's iconic music to life.

With an "electrifying" and "captivating" performance, Seventh Wonder delivers an authentic portrayal of one of the most iconic bands in rock history.

Immerse yourself in the timeless melodies of Fleetwood Mac's legendary album "Rumours" brought to life in its entirety by Seventh Wonder. From the spirited rhythms of "Go Your Own Way" to the ethereal allure of "Dreams" and the infectious energy of "Don't Stop" every note resonates with the spirit of Fleetwood Mac. Additionally, Seventh Wonder will take you on a journey through other cherished hits like "Little Lies" "Gypsy" and "Say You Love Me" ensuring an unforgettable musical experience.

Led by the extraordinary vocal talent of Bloom, whose voice has been described as "a force of nature" Seventh Wonder brings the essence of Fleetwood Mac's sound to life with unparalleled precision and passion.

title: Goulburn Local Live Music Showcase
description:
On the fourth Friday of each month, the Goulburn Club hosts the Goulburn Local Live Music Showcase where any local performers can get on stage and show off there skills.

Everyone is welcome to come along to listen or present an item. Musicians & singer/songwriters,are encouraged to join in and show off their talent. Soloists and groups regularly appear and the variety is always entertaining. 

A vocal PA is available to use and each act is given 10 to 15 minutes to perform, depending on the number of acts on the night. Simply turn up and put your name on the whiteboard to secure a spot.

title: Traditional Irish Music Sessions
description:
A monthly session featuring Celtic music. All levels of musicianship welcome. 

Attendance is strictly limited to Goulburn Club members only but you can signup or renew on arrival. 

There is a waiting list option on the booking site if you miss out.

title: Goulburn Regional Ukulele Band Sessions
description:
A weekly session featuring the Goulburn Regional Ukulele Bank with all levels of musicianship welcome. 

Attendance is strictly limited to Goulburn GRUB Club members only but you can signup or renew on arrival. 

There is a waiting list option on the booking site if you miss out.

title: G-AMPP @ the Goulburn Club
description:
The place for Goulburn and region creatives to meet. Stay and enjoy live music from 6pm with Garth and Friends – three hot live acts and a house band.

There’s an AMPP at the Goulburn Club every quarter. Entry is free, nibbles are provided and the Goulburn Club bar is open.

title: Bush Traditions - OZ Music Sessions
description:
An evening of Australian folk music - songs, dance, tunes, poems and more.

They encourage participation, so bring voices and instruments and join in on the first Friday of each month.  A booklet of local dance tunes has been compiled to use at the sessions or you can join in and sing along by ear. 

Enjoy a Folk Ring where they each choose an item in turn as a request or to lead.

Also, each month has a theme to focus interest on where songs and poems are hunted out, practised and performed, reflecting a different aspect of their heritage.

title: Family Folk Night Goulburn
description:
On the fifth Friday of the month, the Goulburn Club hosts the Family Folk Night Goulburn where any performer can get on stage and showcase there folksy talent.

Everyone is welcome to come along to listen or present an item. Musicians, singer/songwriters, poets, comedians or any other performer is encouraged to join in, the only rule is to have a folk flavour. Soloists and groups regularly appear and the variety is always entertaining. 

A vocal PA is available to use and each act is given 10 to 15 minutes to perform, depending on the number of acts on the night. 

Cocktail Hour runs from 6.30pm so get in early to secure your spot.

title: Goulburn Open Mic Night
description:
On the second Friday of each month, the Goulburn Club hosts the Goulburn Open Mic Night where any performers can get on stage.

Everyone is welcome to come along to listen or present an item. Musicians, singer/songwriters, poets, comedians or any other performer is encouraged to join in and show off their talent. Soloists and groups regularly appear and the variety is always entertaining. 

A vocal PA is available to use and each act is given 10 to 15 minutes to perform, depending on the number of acts on the night. Simply turn up and put your name on the whiteboard to secure a spot.

title: Sunday Sessions
description:
Sunday sessions at the Goulburn Club is an opportunity to bring an instrument or just your voice to join a group sharing songs, tunes, stories and poetry.

Sunday Sessions focuses on traditional folk songs, Australian and Celtic songs and Americana songs. Everyone is welcome to join in or listen with song sheets available online or people can lead and introduce new songs or tunes.

title: 74th Annual Goulburn Lilac City Festival
description:
The Goulburn Lilac City Festival is Australia's longest continuously-run community festival. It was established in 1952 and has occurred annually, every October long weekend ever since.

The festival is outdoors to celebrate Goulburn in the spring once again by welcoming a myriad of Carnival Rides, festival markets, music and busking, art display at the Goulburn Club, flowers, and heritage celebrations of Goulburn for the whole weekend not to mention the famous Lilac City Festival Parade.

A traditional shop-front competition will have the City's Auburn Street dotted with lilac windows while the central Belmore Park will be green, blossoming and air abuzz.

Proudly supported by Goulburn Mulwaree Council.

title: Goulburn Lilac City Festival
description:
The Goulburn Lilac City Festival has a rich history dating back to the 1950s. Today, it has become a beloved annual event for the community, spanning three days during the October long weekend. 

The festival aims to bring joy to the community by offering a wide variety of attractions and experiences. Visitors can enjoy unique markets, delicious food, beautiful flower displays, music performances, exciting competitions, and much more. 

The festival embraces new and exciting events, while also cherishing its traditional elements and keeping them alive year after year. Come and join the celebration, and experience the magic of the Goulburn Lilac City Festival.

title: Goulburn Rotary Parkside Markets
description:
Goulburn Rotary Parkside Markets is a regional produce and artisan market for the regions talented makers and producers. Held in Montague St, adjacent Belmore Park on the second Saturday of the month, the markets are a must visit!

A project of the Goulburn Rotary Club, at the markets you will find something for each of your senses – coffee, flowers, food, preserves, plants, candles, jewellery and so much more. You will be spoilt for choice!

All funds raised from the market go to support Rotary charities and projects.

title: The Goulburn Cup and Plate
description:
The Goulburn Cup is a two-day stroke competition, with an entry cost for the two days and is proudly sponsored by First National Real Estate.

The Goulburn Plate is the newest edition, which will be a two-day Stableford competition, with some great prizes up for grabs.

Both events are open to all male amateur golfers who hold an AGU handicap.

title: The Charles Ledger Alpaca Show
description:
The Charles Ledger Show has been running since 1989. It takes its name from the man credited with importing the first alpacas into New South Wales from South America in 1858.
 
The Charles Ledger Alpaca show runs for two days, and there will be exhibitors from all over Australia including NSW, Queensland and Victoria.
 
Members of the public are welcome to come and watch the judging and when opportunities arise ask questions of exhibitors.

title: Hockey Australia Masters Indoor Invitational
description:
The Hockey Australia Masters Indoor Invitational is back in Goulburn in 2025!

Women's & Men's Masters teams will come to Goulburn for the Invitational Tournament - age groups to be confirmed.

Get your invitational teams together for a weekend of Indoor Hockey in Goulburn.

Watch this space for information as its released.

title: Goulburn Physie Interclub Competition
description:
You're invited to join Goulburn Physie for a weekend of fun and friendly competition. For more information, please check out the Facebook page.

With over 130 clubs, BJP Physie is Australia’s longest-running and premier Physie organisation. Founded over 130 years ago as the Bjelke-Petersen School of Physical Culture, BJP has proudly inspired generations of Australians to exercise both body and mind through this remarkable sport. Physie is the perfect combination of dance movements designed to increase strength, fitness and flexibility. Physie is a synchronised, team-based dance sport that’s social, fun and an excellent low-impact dance and aerobic activity..

Goulburn Physie was established in 2016 and is a community-run club. In 2025 they will be hosting a friendly interclub competition in Goulburn. Clubs will be attending the Goulburn Interclub from across NSW and the ACT with a range of competitors aged from four years to over 60. Ladies and Senior (13 plus) competitions will be held on Saturday and Junior (four to 12 years) competitions will be held on Sunday.

Proudly supported by Goulburn Mulwaree Council.

title: Goulburn Model Railway Expo
description:
The Goulburn Model Expo has been organised by the Georges River Model Railway Club to be held at the Veolia Arena (Goulburn Recreation Area) in Goulburn. The Expo is being held to help promote the hobbies of model railways and plastic kit modelling, helping foster healthy alternatives for the development of our young people. There will be over 70 trade stands and exhibitors across 2 halls at the Veolia Arena displaying model railway layouts and a myriad of plastic models on display.

These vendors will carry everything from basic starter sets for a new modeller, modelling tools and paints, through to highly detailed models and accessories for skilled modellers, and all exhibitors are only too happy to answer any questions that you may have. There will also be a number of clinics where people can observe and learn how to use the modelling skills and methods being shown. There will also be a Community BBQ on offer over the weekend with all proceeds going directly to charity.

A special heritage train, The Southern Highlands Express, has been organised to do a return journey on the Sunday from Central Station to the event and then back on that afternoon.

Event facilities have off and on-street parking, disabled access and a ramp.

title: Goulburn Show
description:
Goulburn AP & H Society has something for everyone with the focus on fostering promoting and exhibiting the sustainable development of Agricultural, Pastoral, Horticultural and Industry resources of the Goulburn and surrounding districts at the annual show.

The Goulburn Show will be held at the Goulburn Recreation Area Showground, promoting a low-cost family fun weekend.

For further information please visit the website.

title: Goulburn Farmers Markets
description:
The Goulburn Farmers Market is a cooperative venture promoting local producers and makers, and for the public to discover the best foods of the region.

Come and experience the community vibe, with local entertainers among the stallholders, good coffee, as well as small workshops on how to grow food, beekeeping and making compost.

The Goulburn Farmers Market is held on the 4th Saturday of each month.

Proudly supported by Goulburn Mulwaree Council.

title: Art Exhibition - Safari Art by Neil Sloan
description:
Rusten House Art Centre presents an exhibition by Queanbeyan-based visual artist Neil Sloan, showcasing visual responses from Travels in East Africa.

Safari Art is a solo exhibition by Neil Sloan, capturing his artistic response to travels throughout East Africa with vibrant works on paper that reflect the raw energy of travel, cultural exchange, and responsive arts practice. From connecting with local communities, diverse landscape and wildlife, Neil has created expressive works layered with meaning, energy and a sense of place. Working on-site, his experiences are translated through printmaking, collage, drawing and journaled musings. The exhibition serves as both a vivid snapshot and a reflection of the region's richness, as well as the artist's deep personal engagement to the journey.

Meet the artist at their Opening Event - Saturday 31 May  2-4pm.

title: Artist-Led Workshop with Neil Sloan: Create Your Own Art Travel Journal
description:
Join visual artist Neil Sloan for a hands-on workshop where you'll explore creative techniques to document your travels. Inspired by Neil's own practice and the surrounds of Rusten House Arts Centre, participants will learn how to create their own site responsive artworks, and tools for creating a travel journal. Whether you're an experienced artist or a curious beginner, this workshop offers a unique opportunity to reflect on place, memory and experience through art. All materials and afternoon tea provided.

Neil Sloan is a Queanbeyan based visual artist specialising in printmaking and mixed media. This workshop coincides with the final day of Neil's solo exhibition Safari Art showing at Rusten House Arts Centre. The exhibition captures Neil's artistic responses to travels throughout East Africa with vibrant works on paper translated through printmaking, collage, drawing and journaled musings.

This is a Free event, however spaces are limited. Secure your spot by registering via the ticketing link now.

title: Art Exhibition - Resilience, Reflection, Renewal by Sarah Richards
description:
Rusten House Art Centre presents an exhibition of artworks by artist Sarah Richards.

Inspired by the cycles of life and the wisdom they reveal, this collection explores the journey of resilience, reflection and renewal. Each piece captures the movement of time—sometimes vast and open, other times deep and uncertain. Through shifting colours, layered textures, and symbolic pathways, these works speak to the balance of holding on, letting go, and stepping forward with courage.

title: Artist Talk: Sarah Richards at Rusten House Arts Centre
description:
In this Artist Talk, Sarah Richards invites audiences to learn about the stories behind each of the works in her solo exhibition Resilience, Reflection & Renewal. Delve into the inspiration, challenges, and discoveries that shaped each work, and gain insight into Sarah's creative journey.

A Ngiyampaa woman born on Gadigal land, Sarah Richards is a contemporary award winning artist living and painting on Ngunnawal and Ngambri countries since 2012. A collection of 12 acrylic paintings, Resilience, Reflection & Renewal marks her first solo exhibition. Drawing inspiration from the cycles of life and the wisdom they reveal, each piece captures the movement of time—sometimes vast and open, other times deep and uncertain.

This is a free event.  Please register your place via the ticketing link provided.

title: Art Exhibition - A Shifting Perspective by Lesley Sykes
description:
Rusten House Art Centre presents an exhibition of paintings by Lesley Sykes

In A Shifting Perspective, artist Lesley Sykes draws inspiration from her beautiful, light-filled studio at Mongarlowe. Cluttered with collected objects and opening out to an overgrown garden and creek beyond, this environment informs Sykes's paintings - interiors, still-life and the wild garden spaces. The works showcase a sgraffito technique - scratching into the surface rather than drawing onto it. Colour is applied and rubbed back to a translucent finish, her paintings evoke the idea of spaces and objects - where forms distort, planes tilt and and objects intersect and overlap.

Meet the artist at their Opening Event - Saturday 28th June 2-4pm.

Please Note: Rusten House Art Centre is open Wednesday - Saturday 10am -4pm

title: Make Your Own Alpaca Dryer Balls Workshop
description:
Come get your hands working with alpaca fleece at Little Valley Farm!

Join a relaxed two-hour workshop where you'll meet and feed the alpacas, then head into the train shed to clean, card, and felt your very own set of three alpaca dryer balls—made from the fleece of their beautiful herd.
