It's hands-on, satisfying, and a great way to learn the process from paddock to product. Perfect for eco-conscious homes - and your laundry will love you for it.

Why Alpaca Dryer Balls?
Because at Little Valley Farm, they believe everyday moments deserve a little luxury. Their dryer balls are handmade from the fleece of their own alpacas—gentle on your clothes, kind to the planet, and full of slow-living soul. They reduce static, soften fabrics, and cut drying time—all without chemicals. It's sustainable sophistication with every tumble.

title: Quizzame Trivia at Royal Hotel Queanbeyan
description:
QuizzaMe is a Game-Show Trivia Event that is an entertainment extravaganza!

Every event creates an exciting atmosphere where the focus is on fun and ensuring you leave with a smile!

It is held every Wednesday night in the Upper House of The Royal Hotel Queanbeyan. And it's free to join!

Check the Royal Hotel Queanbeyan's website weekly for any Wednesdays that need to be cancelled.

title: Hurricane - The Australian Luke Combs Tribute Show Queanbeyan
description:
Prepare for an unforgettable evening as we celebrate the phenomenal music of Luke Combs with a spectacular two-hour live performance. 

This show pays tribute to one of country music's brightest stars, covering a wide range of songs from all of Luke Combs' albums, from his most heartfelt ballads to his upbeat, Honky Tonk anthems.  

The Trucker Hat Appreciation Society is more than a band. It's a way of life! 

Good times, beers, bars, boots and especially cool hats. 

They just love all things country and promise the best party you’ve ever stomped a boot too. 

When it some to the band, they've got it all covered with a band chock full of some of Australia’s finest musicians. From the old school 80s and 90s of Garth Brooks, Alan Jackson Tim McGraw, Brooks and Dunn or Shania, through the early 2000s of Keith Urban, Eric Church, Zac Brown Band, Luke Bryan and Toby Keith right through to the current stars like Luke Combs, Morgan Wallen, Zach Bryan and Chris Stapleton. They play it all.

Grab your best Trucker Hat and join the society!

title: Rick Price Anniversary Tour at Royal Hotel Queanbeyan
description:
Join them at the Royal Hotel Queanbeyan to celebrate Rick Price's 30th Anniversary tour! 

In April 1995, Rick released his hit single "River of Love" from the album Tamborine Mountain, which soared to the top of the ARIA Charts. With special guest appearances by Tommy Emmanuel and Tina Arena, this album marked a milestone in Rick’s career and continues to resonate with fans to this day.

Rick will perform some of his greatest hits, including "Heaven Knows" "Not A Day Goes By" "Walk Away Renee" "To Be with You" "Bridge Building Man" and many more from his iconic Tamborine Mountain album. Don’t miss this unforgettable afternoon of live music as Rick celebrates three decades of unforgettable songs, amazing collaborations, and his lasting impact on Australian music.

Book your tickets now for a truly special experience!

title: Bon But Not Forgotten Celebrate AC/DC - Queanbeyan
description:
Get ready to crank up the volume! Bon But Not Forgotten, the world-renowned AC/DC tribute band, is hitting the road for an epic Australian tour to mark five decades of legendary and electrifying rock ‘n’ roll. This high-voltage tour will celebrate AC/DC's iconic legacy, performing timeless hits that have shaped the sound of rock music across generations.

The Australian rock titans have delivered decades of anthems like “Highway to Hell” “T.N.T.” and “Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap” and Bon But Not Forgotten is set to pay homage to these classics.

The tour will feature an extraordinary lineup of musicians, including Cynthia Gallie, one of Australia’s most versatile rock vocalists. She’ll be joined by James Morley of The Angels on guitar, Bobby Poulton of Wolfmother on bass, Eddy Santacreu of Queen Orchestrated on guitar, and renowned drummer Dave Kirby. Together, they will recreate the raw power and energy of AC/DC’s Bon Scott and Brian Johnson eras, delivering a performance that fans won’t soon forget.

Described by The Rock Pit as “the closest you’ll get to the raw power and legendary sound of the original line-up” Bon But Not Forgotten has earned a reputation for their dynamic stage presence and precise musicianship. 

This year’s tour will feature special guests, Poundcake: The Van Halen Show, amplifying the celebration of 70’s rock n’ roll.

title: T&Cs : Christmas in July
description:
Get ready to add some jingle to your mingle, Tapas & Cocktails is back with a festive twist, and you're officially on the nice (or naughty) list.

This isn't your average Christmas party. They are turning up the midyear cheer with a Christmas-inspired tapas menu curated by Executive Chef Wayne and festive cocktails featuring Wild Brumby Schnapps (and schnapps on its own, of course), mulled wine and all your favourite drinks from the bar.

Expect all the cosy, cheeky charm of Christmas, without the Christmas argument or tinsel overload. Just good food, good drinks and even better company in their beautifully styled Manhattan Room.

Spots are limited and our elves aren't holding any back.  Avoid being disappointed, book your table today.

title: Brophys Circus Queanbeyan
description:
Brophys Circus brand new 2025 show features the gravity defying Wheel of Steel, Spectacular Globe of Death, stunning aerialists, hilarious clowns and much more. 

This fast paced two hour show will have something the whole family will enjoy.

title: Hunter Valley Highland Games
description:
Come experience the Hunter Valley Highland Games in beautiful Wine Country! 

These games celebrate the deep connection between Australia and Scotland. Spend a day in the vines, hear the pipes, see the strength and watch the dance!

title: Gloucester Farmers Market
description:
On the second Saturday of each month, get fresh with Gloucester Farmers Market. Discover Gloucester’s fresh food treasure and stock up on foods that will give you energy, vitality and a twinkle in your eye. 

This is just like how country markets used to be, with locally grown fresh fruit and vegetables, baked goods, cheeses, eggs, honey, olives and olive oils, wines, cut flowers, soaps and all manner of artisan-made local produce. 

Markets like these are changing the way people look at fresh food, and you can’t buy any fresher, so get in early for the best of the best.

title: Melinda Schneider - Nambucca Heads
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Stamp, Coin and Jewellery Fair
description:
There will be a variety of stamps, covers, coins, cinderella, commercial mail, ephemera, postcards, postmarks, thematics and stamp and coin accessories. Plus kids show bags.

There will also be a good range of fused glassware, candles, china, crystals, gems, handmade jewellery and market stalls.

Refreshments are available. Free off-street parking.

title: Psychic, Fused Glass and Jewellery Fair
description:
Treat yourself to an out-of-this-world experience with local mediums and spiritualists, Psychometry, Tarot Cards, Tea Leaf Readings and more.

A good range of Fused Glass, Candles, Crystals, Gems, Handmade Jewellery,  Tumble Stones, Masseur and Market Stalls.

Refreshments are available. Free entry and off-street parking are available.

title: Vacy Country Carnival
description:
Vacy Country Carnival is an annual event in Vacy Village that is full of country fun! Come to the country and experience the rural way of life - country cooking, country people, country skills and fun. 

Jack Russell and Dachshund races, pony and camel rides, market stalls, and country food. Sheep dog trials and team penning exhibitions, blacksmithing, tractors and other traditional country crafts on show in a country carnival atmosphere. Fun for everyone.

Bring the family for a great day out!

Thanks to major sponsor Torryburn Stud.

title: Après Club ft. LO’99 & Special Guest
description:
Keep your ears to the ground…something big is coming!

Famous for the biggest mountain parties in the country, there's no better way to unwind from a day on the slopes a drink and a boogie with friends.

Thredbo practices the responsible service of alcohol – please drink responsibly.

title: Rainbow Mountain
description:
Your favourite gay ski weekend is back. Rainbow Mountain returns to Thredbo — louder, prouder, and more fabulous than ever. Get ready for an epic line-up of events including on-mountain parties, pumping DJ sets, glamourous drag acts and the iconic Pride Ride!

This three day inclusive event is for all LGBTQIA+ guests and allies – a perfect way to celebrate diversity, inclusivity, visibility, community, and love.

Thredbo practices the responsible service of alcohol – please drink responsibly.

title: Bush Doof hosted by Tess Coady presented by Monster Energy
description:
It's on again! A special guest list consisting of some of the best snowboarders from around the world are coming down under for the Monster Energy Bush Doof hosted by Tess Coady.

Get set for a non-stop, high energy snowboarding event, Bush Doof style! It's not all just snowboarding and head to the Alpine Bar after the event for a massive party ft. Little Fritter & Shimmy!

title: Après Club ft. Yolanda Be Cool presented by Hyoketsu
description:
Veterans of the Australian house music scene, Yolanda Be Cool are bringing their fun and lively party style set to the mountains for an Apre's to remember! Get set for a banger night of dance floor anthems with Mell Hall in tow, setting the tone with her thumping base lines.

Enjoy an arvo in the sun with Big Deck Energy at Black Sallees, before heading down to the village for one of the best parties of the season.

Thredbo practices the responsible service of alcohol – please drink responsibly.

title: Battle on The Bluff
description: The Battle on The Bluff is going down on Thredbo's iconic freeride terrain "The Bluff". From big cliff drops to sendy wind lips, this is the comp to show off your stuff and impress the crew! Quickly becoming one of Australia's Premier freeride competition, you won't want to miss the opportunity to take home a share of the $25k prize purse, featuring a heap of rad prizes from Oakley, Burton and Rossignol.

title: Thredbo Flare Run and Fireworks
description:
A favourite and iconic Thredbo moment, the Saturday night Flare Run and Fireworks spectacular has been a long-standing tradition and crowd favourite in Thredbo for over 30 years. Every Saturday night in winter, a team of Thredbo's expert skiers and snowboarders catch the last chair of the day and head up the mountain where they wind their way down the Supertrail with flaming flares lighting up the night sky. Shortly followed is the fireworks spectacular. Watch Thredbo's skies light up with a brilliant show of fireworks that dance and glitter across the mountains.

This must-see free event is mesmerising and is the only skiing and snowboarding flare run event in Australia, the perfect entertainment for all ages and members of the family.

The Local Pub deck is the best spot to watch this event unfold. Grab a tasty pub meal, sip your favourite drink with friends and family as you watch from this prime position, and kick off a magical Saturday night in the enchanting Thredbo village.

title: Ultra-Trail Kosciuszko by UTMB
description:
A journey through Australia's Alps, the Snowy Mountains, amongst granite outcrops and snow gum forests, Ultra-Trail Kosciuszko by UTMB is crafted to create the ultimate runner's high.

The destination delivers on the promise of epic scenery and super fun trails with snow gum forests pierced by crystal clear mountain streams, alpine meadows and spectacular granite outcrops. 

This is a unique trail running festival that honours its pedigree and welcomes friends new and old to something a little bit special.

title: Zepplin: The Life & Times of Led Zeppelin - Cessnock
description:
Zepplin brings to life the electrifying music and legendary stories of one of rock’s greatest bands. In a two-hour concert production, Zepplin delivers over 26 iconic songs, narrated stories, and rare archival footage, creating an immersive journey through Led Zeppelin’s rise to fame.

With a lineup of internationally acclaimed musicians, Zepplin captures the raw energy, intensity, and passion of the original band. Jesse Attard channels Robert Plant with powerful, controlled vocals, while Dean Blackborough stuns audiences with blistering Jimmy Page solos. On bass, Ian Graham flawlessly delivers John Paul Jones' intricate riffs, and Michael Bianco embodies John Bonham’s thunderous drumming, delivering a solo that must be seen to be believed. Lionel Caesar completes the lineup, recreating the epic soundscapes that defined Led Zeppelin’s legendary catalogue.

With rave reviews from fans and critics alike, audiences call it "as close to the real Led Zeppelin as you're gonna see" and "an absolute must-see for any Zepp fan." Don’t miss your chance to experience Zepplin—the Led Zeppelin Rockumentary

title: Echoes of Pink Floyd - Cessnock
description:
Iconic British rock band, Pink Floyd left an indelible mark on the world, inspiring generations with their ground-breaking soundscapes and thought-provoking lyrics. 2025 marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style in a brand new concert production by Adelaide’s own Echoes of Pink Floyd.

Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerising journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.

Echoes of Pink Floyd stands as Australia’s foremost tribute dedicated to honouring the legendary band's monumental legacy and has garnered widespread acclaim across the country since their inception in 2009.

Since embarking on national tours in 2014, their lovingly-crafted performances have captivated audiences nationwide.

title: Savour the Flavour - Hawkesbury
description:
Savour the Flavour Hawkesbury is an exciting new celebration of Hawkesbury's past and present as Sydney's original 'food bowl'. 

Held in Richmond Oval Richmond, visitors and locals alike will have the chance to sample and purchase a diverse selection of delicious food, produce and beverages from passionate local farmers and businesses. 

There will also be fun cooking demonstrations, art workshops for children and adults, a pie-eating competition and a great line-up of live entertainment for all ages to enjoy.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Richmond
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Subaru WRX First Tracks at Perisher
description:
Subaru WRX First Tracks is a special Perisher experience, offering a limited number of resort guests the chance to access a selected area in Font Valley before anyone else. 

Subaru WRX First Tracks run every Saturday and Sunday morning, Epic Australia Pass holders can access Front Valley from 7:30 am for exclusive first tracks, weather and snow conditions permitting.

title: Ride Dungog Social Rides
description:
Discover exhilarating mountain biking adventures in the breathtaking Dungog region with Ride Dungog. Join in on Ride Dungog's Social Rides, including the Tuesday Fosterton Loop Social Ride, The Dungog Shire Social Ride held every Friday and the Saturday Singletrack Social Ride, a weekly highlight for mountain biking enthusiasts. 

These rides are fantastic opportunities to connect with fellow riders, share experiences, and immerse in the vibrant cycling community of Dungog.

Delve into over 22 kilometers of purpose-built single-track rides that cater to riders of all skill levels, from beginners to seasoned pros. The trails are designed to maximize the thrill of riding while respecting and preserving the natural environment. For detailed trail information, explore the offerings on Trail Forks or visit the website.

Within the Reserve, riders can experience the excitement of the purpose-built fun track and tackle the challenges of the 2.2-kilometre groomed flow track. These features add diversity and excitement to the riding experience, ensuring there's always something new to explore.

Embark on pedal-powered adventures like never before with Ride Dungog. Explore the beauty of the trails, push your limits, and be part of a community dedicated to the joy of mountain biking.

title: Sculpture on the Farm Dungog
description:
The Sculpture on the Farm Dungog 2025 (SOF2025) continues the tradition of celebrating Australian sculpture in the rural community of Dungog, New South Wales.  SOF enriches the Dungog Shire by donating sculptures for public display. SOF  2025 will feature over 100 sculptures by some of Australia's most esteemed and innovative sculptors.

This year's event includes demonstrations, workshops, guided nature and sculpture trail walks.  All sculptures will be available for purchase; intimate indoor works, garden pieces and monumental works.

UFO Utopia" by Nigel Dobson stands proudly at the top of the Dungog Common overlooking the Barrington Tops.

"Collecting fur to line the nest 2" by Jimmy Rix can also be discovered in the Dungog Common.

Standing proudly guarding the Gresford Arboretum is "Kangaroo and Honeyeater" by Jimmy Rix. Such a joyous sculpture for all to enjoy, especially children as they play in the natural playground.

Don't miss "Sowelu Two" by Jen Mallinson and "Entwined" by Bob Teasdale both in the Dungog Common Reserve near the entry.

"Nothin' but Sky" by Braddon Snape greets you on arrival in Dungog atop the Lioness Park and the bronze "Kelpie" by Jimmy Rix outside the Visitor Information Centre."Theatre of the Shadow" by Peter Tilley outside the Dungog Shire Library precinct.

As one of Australia's leading small sculpture festivals, it has consolidated its place in the national cultural calendar.

title: Run Dungog
description:
Small town, big trail running festival! Indulge your senses with a breath of fresh air. With 5, 10 and 20 kilometre events on offer, there is a distance that you will love. 

From 8am you will be at the Dungog Common for the Run Dungog Trail Running Festival. With a local coffee cart, local brunch produce, kids bushcraft-rewilding-trail running activities (fully supervised while you run!), music, dog friendly and just a great atmosphere.  Kids 12 and under run free in all races.  This is a great morning day out, and with it wrapping up by midday, it allows plenty of time to depart Dungog for home.

Dungog Running Festival is organised by a volunteer committee, with all proceeds will be donated to the much-loved and much-needed Dungog Shire Community Centre.

Questions:
Rain? Yes, you still run.

Dogs? Yes, bring, no need to register, remember they have a best dressed prize!

Buying tickets? Tickets are discounted before the day of the race.  Early Early Bird, Early Bird, Third Release and Race Day pricing.

Registration brackets? Registration is 10-year groups, e.g. 20 – 29, 30 - 39, etc.

Walkers? Come! This day is for everyone! This event started as a dash and dawdle… they're heading back to their roots. Come take the opportunity to raise money for the community centre, while walking with and in their community.

title: East Coast MX Series - Round Five
description:
Get ready riders and spectators for some action packed racing at Maitland. 

Don’t miss the Nippers and classes 85cc up to 150cc races are just a sample of the range of competitors over the weekend. 

Whether you're a seasoned race fan or a family looking for a fun day out, the electrifying atmosphere of the track will be infectious.

title: Deadly Arts
description:
Deadly Arts is an initiative based on Dharug land at Nepean Creative and Performing Arts High School, delivered in partnership with the NSW Department of Education Arts Unit. Committed to supporting Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students in deepening cultural knowledge and ancestral connections, this program provides opportunities for young First Nations artists to celebrate cultural identity through contemporary art practice.

This exhibition features the works of Deadly Arts students and graduates from public high schools across Western Sydney, demonstrating what the Deadly Arts Program is all about: creativity through the uniting of art, Dreamtime, people, and Country. Having been guided by experienced arts educators, practicing First Nations artists and cultural organisations, these students engage in innovative and authentic modes of artistic expression to explore songlines, cultural identity, and ancestral ties.

Offering a platform for storytelling, empowerment and cultural pride, the Deadly Arts exhibition showcases a new generation of First Nations artists from Western Sydney, emphasising their roles in shaping a dynamic, inclusive cultural future. By highlighting the diverse, vibrant and evolving creative practices of these 'Deadly' artists, Deadly Arts seeks not only to nurture artistic growth, but to contribute to broader community understanding, reconciliation, and celebration of First Nations cultures.
host: Joan Sutherland Performing Arts Centre (Penrith Performing &Visual Arts)

title: PBR Monster Energy Tour Hawkesbury Invitational
description:
A sport like no other. A showdown of the greatest. Heart-stopping action. It’s man vs. beast, where every second matters. 
 
The biggest names in Australian bull riding go head-to-head in a new season of Professional Bull Riders, delivering a competition like no other. Come along for an unmatched entertainment experience at the PBR Monster Energy Hawkesbury Invitational at Hawkesbury Showground. 
 
Buckle up for the toughest 8 seconds in sports— It's Bull Time.

title: Nepean River parkrun
description:
It's a five-kilometre run - you against the clock! A great way to see the Nepean River and get some exercise.

Parkrun is a free, weekly five-kilometre timed run for runners and walkers of all ages and abilities, held in locations across the world. For your timed result to be recorded, register once for free and bring a copy of your unique barcode with you when you turn up to park run.

Parkrun is not a race, but a relaxed, friendly activity - run with your pram, run with your dog, run with friends, run to beat your last run! Parkrun is sweeping Australia, and the Parkrun community is very social - participants are all invited to catch up after the run for a coffee.

The course is run on a mixture of concrete paths, bitumen paths and grass. Some sections of the course may accumulate mud, leaves and puddles after rain. Depending on availability, marshals will be at key sections of the course, or signs will be in place.

Occurs every Saturday rain hail or shine. Check the Nepean River parkrun Facebook page for updates. There are two other park runs nearby - Werrington Lakes and Penrith Lakes.

title: Stomp Festival Cessnock
description:
Stomp Festival Cessnock is back - bigger, better, and bursting with flavour! Get ready to stomp, sip, and celebrate in the heart of Cessnock wine country. 

This year's event promises an unforgettable day of fine wines, delicious food, live music, and family-friendly fun. 

Whether you're a local or visiting for the weekend, Stomp Festival Cessnock is the perfect way to embrace the vibrant spirit of this wine region.

title: Dungog Show
description:
Your place for agriculture and entertainment. 

The Dungog Agricultural and Horticultural Association is passionate about educating people of all ages about agriculture and they're revitalising their Show to reflect this.

Learning exhibits tell the story of agriculture to both urban and rural people. They believe it is important that locals and visitors understand the significance of agriculture to the economy and appreciate the innovation, efficiency, and technology that supports it.

The Dungog Show promotes the involvement of youth in shows by holding competitions for young people and by encouraging the participation of young people in show societies and agricultural youth groups. 

Youth are encouraged to participate in the livestock judging competitions culminating at the State Finals for winners in Sydney at Easter.

title: Anglican Church Market Day
description: Come in and browse the markets where you will find handmade jewellery, quality arts and crafts, a selection of slices and cakes, pickles and jams and bric-a-brac.  There are sure to be a lot more great bargains too.

title: Karuah River Rally Recon Run
description:
The Karuah River Rally Recon Run, which is held in Dungog each year over the third weekend of January. This is a good event to attend for motorcycle riders that prefer sealed roads and non-camping accommodation.

Collect your map at the Bank Hotel Dungog. This rally is for motorcyclists only, and cars are not permitted unless by prior arrangement.

title: Bungendore Truffle Experiece
description:
You are invited to an 8-course menu curated by their award-winning Executive Chef Bigyan Bohara, showcasing the the finest local truffles from Turalla Truffles.

Each dish celebrates the rich, earthy elegance of truffles, complemented by premium wines from Lark Hill Wine with 7 of the 8 courses perfectly paired for an elevated dining experience.

Full information on the website.

title: Dungog Garden Ramble
description:
The Dungog Garden Ramble is a biennial event raising money for local charitable and community causes. There will be eight gardens open. Six of the gardens are in town; two of them are out of town but only ten minutes and well worth the drive.   

Here is the list of gardens and the addresses for 2023:
134 Fosterton Road - Country cottage and edible
58 Fosterton Road - old world charm and historic interest
103 Salisbury Road - innovative edible
126 Salisbury Road - modern gardening and entertaining
43 Dowling Street - cottage charm
31 Dowling Street - artistic, quirky and sustainable
33 Windeyer Street - life on the river
9 Carlton Avenue - bird-friendly indigenous cottage

All the gardens will be open on Saturday.

Entry is AUD5. Please bring cash as we don't have access to Eftpos.

Refreshments will be available at Garden 5 at a cost of AUD5. They're keeping it simple: old-fashioned slice (gluten-free options will be available) with a pot of proper tea - with tea cosy - or pod coffee, served on nice china)

Please Note: 
On Sunday the gardens at 134 Fosterton Road - Country Cottage and Edible, 58 Fosterton Road - old world charm and historic interest available are the only gardens open.

title: Dungog PedalFest
description:
The Annual Dungog PedalFest is a fun celebration of cycling and sociability in the beautiful Williams Valley. There is a selection of social, family-friendly riding, competitive racing and gravity enduro mountain bike events.

Pedalling off on Friday with the  Kids and Cobwebs five-kilometre historic ride around Dungog town.

Get your bibs on for Saturday with a social MTB ride in Dungog Common, the Fosterton Loop Ride (23 kilometres) and/or the Bandon Grove Ride (23 kilometres) in the afternoon. 

Powering on Sunday with the historic Thalaba Church Loop - the Scones, Jam and Cream Ride (20 kilometres), gravity enduro MTB race and a self-guided historic tour of the town.

There's something for everyone whether riding or spectating.

title: Dungog Local Growers Stall
description:
The Local Growers Stall brings you fresh produce grown by local farmers, market gardeners and backyard growers. 

Each week you will find different, super-fresh vegetables, fruit, herbs, cut flowers, honey, jams, eggs, and seedlings. Most of the products is fully organic or chemical-free. Bring your own shopping bags to the market to fill with fresh goods. Nearby you will find the Fosterton Farm Bakery bread van.

The Dungog Local Growers Stall supports the community and encourages local food production.

title: Truffle Hunt and French Brunch with Chef Christophe and Josephine
description:
Chef Christophe and Josephine offer immersive culinary experiences that blend French and Italian heritage with Australian charm. Their events include hands-on cooking classes, intimate truffle hunts, and bespoke food and wine tours across Australia and abroad.

At their truffle farm in Bungendore, just outside Canberra, guests can join a truly unique experience: foraging for black truffles alongside Largo, their enthusiastic Border Collie and expert truffle hunter.

Your morning begins with a warm welcome and the crisp country air. Rug up in outdoor gear and follow Largo as he sniffs out prized black truffles beneath the winter soil. Don't forget to reward him with his favourite game of fetch!

After the hunt, gather for a live cooking demonstration by Chef Christophe as he prepares egg brouillard — a luxurious French-style soft scramble infused with freshly unearthed truffle. Served on a warm baguette with fresh salad, and your choice of tea or coffee, this rustic long-table brunch is a feast to remember.

As you dine, Chef Christophe shares stories, cooking tips, and insights into the world of truffle farming. Before you leave, browse a selection of fresh truffles and handcrafted products like truffle butter and truffle salt to take home.

The experience concludes after two hours — but the memories linger.

title: Grace Gladdish | Higher Ground
description:
Suki and Hugh Gallery is pleased to present Higher Ground, a solo exhibition of hand-painted linocut prints by acclaimed Tasmanian artist Grace Gladdish.

Gladdish's latest body of work offers a striking and intimate perspective on Tasmania's alpine landscapes — a subject of deep personal resonance for the artist, whose studio sits in the foothills of Mt Wellington / Kunanyi. Through a refined process that combines relief printing with watercolour, she brings to life the rugged contours, foliage, and rocky terrain of these highland environments.

Working in varying scales, Gladdish's pieces are unified by their vibrant colour, expert composition, and textural richness. Her ability to balance stark print forms with delicate painterly gestures creates a unique visual language that will appeal to lovers of both printmaking and the natural world.

title: AGOG - A Feast Of Foreign Films
description:
Celebrating its fifteenth year, Dungog Shire's own, AGOG - A Feast Of Foreign Films festival, returns  in 2024 to the iconic James Theatre, Dungog. Since the very first AGOG in 2007, this homegrown festival of international films has developed a reputation for presenting the best of the best films from around the world.

It is a chance for everyone to experience the authentic country hospitality Dungog is known for while exploring the region and spending a day at the historic James Theatre, the oldest continuous & still running theatre in NSW. 

AGOG will launch with the Opening Night Red Carpet Event “Soirée d’Ouverture”.

title: Dungog Tea Party
description:
Held each year in September the Dungog Tea Party showcases Tea Cosy and Trivet Challenges that are great events.  In 2024, there were seven categories in Tea Cosy, with first and second prizes, also seven categories in Trivets with first and second prizes. 

Much to see with all the wonderful inspirations that have been done in the later years. Wild and Wacky, antique, farm yard, timber, ceramic, recycled materials and much more. 

 Dungog has a great cultural and natural heritage, a creative arts and crafts sector in a picturesque rural setting. The event is being organised by enthusiastic locals.

title: Sea Shanty Right Royal Singalong
description:
Come along and sing! Dress like a pirate!

Presented by Dungog Riversong Choir and Performing Artists Dungog

This is a free event with no need to book. 

The Royal Kitchen will be open on the night for dinner.

Royal Bar open for rum, Shirley Rumples and the lash. 

Various lovable local singers leading the singalongs. Lyrics provided when needed. Rollicking fun!

Money back if you aren't hoarse and happy by the end.

title: Bing Bang Ring - Cash is King!
description:
Throughout 2024, Dungog artist Helene Leane created an exhibition inspired by a beautifully ornate National Cash Register from the Dungog Museum’s collection. The resulting exhibit, Bing Bang Ring. Cash is King! is now on display, showcasing Helene’s vibrant interpretation of this historical piece.

This project is part of This Here Then Now, an Arts Upper Hunter program developed in partnership with local museums. In 2024, three Upper Hunter regional museums collaborated with resident artists: Sophie Cox at Scone Museum, Helene Leane at Dungog Museum, and Todd Fuller at Tocal Homestead. The project was made possible through the Australian Government’s Regional Arts Fund, the NSW Government, and the C B Alexander Foundation.

At the heart of Helene’s exhibition is the cash register, originally a centrepiece at Skillen’s grocery shop (now the Dungog Medical Centre). The shop served the community until 1966, when Australia transitioned to decimal currency. Inspired by the consumer culture of that era, Helene reimagined products once sold at Skillen’s and other local shops as Pop Art-style posters. She also collected photographs of Dungog’s historic shops and community members, transforming them into bold, modern pieces that celebrate the town’s retail history.

These dynamic works are on display at the Dungog Museum. Please call the Museum if you wish to view by appointment.  Visitors can visit Helene’s Gallery on Dowling, located just across the road.

title: Bloom sings Eva Cassidy Songbook - Hunter Valley
description:
With sold out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Bloom is highly applauded as “one of Australia’s finest vocalists”, some even placing her in the same company, vocally, of those very artists she pays tribute to in her stage productions ‘Adele & Amy Winehouse Songbook’ and the ‘Stevie Nicks, Carole King & Linda Ronstadt Songbook’. Bloom now extends her focus toward another soulful musical powerhouse – Eva Cassidy.

Eva’s soul-stirring voice came to prominence in 1998 after her renditions of “Fields of Gold” and “Over the Rainbow” were released… two years after her passing.

Sadly, her inability to be signed by a record label, unsure of how to market her eclectic repertoire, meant Eva only released one solo album in her lifetime – Live at Blues Alley – an album she recorded and self-released in 1996. It wasn’t until 1998 that her posthumously released recordings would pique the interest of the small West Coast folk music label Blix Street Records. Her first posthumously released album “Songbird”, became a major international hit and earnt the songstress subsequent number one albums across the globe, selling in excess of 12 million sales worldwide.

Bloom will once again enthral audiences across the country in this intimate and acoustic performance featuring all of Eva’s hits including “Songbird” “Time After Time” “Fields of Gold” “Over The Rainbow” and many more.

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Hunter Valley
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Tocal Homestead Open Days
description:
Bring a picnic to have on the lawns, enjoy the gardens, and follow the maps as you explore the site with your own audio guides. 

Devonshire teas and refreshments, along with publications and items crafted by the Friends of Tocal, are on offer at the Visitor Centre.  

No need to book, just pop on in!  

For groups of ten people or more, bookings are preferred.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Penrith
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Penrith
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: The Dinomaniacs - Penrith
description:
Join Shaun and Tara for a fun-filled afternoon with their award-winning kids' show! 

The Dinomaniacs! Fresh off winning two national awards at the 2024 What's On 4 Kids, this show is packed with laughs, music and hands-on dino fun.

Say hello to Trixi the Triceratops, cheeky Tru Blu, Naughty Joffrey, Aussie favourites Ozzi and Oi, and the newest baby dino, Olive the Parasaurolophus.

Perfect for ages 1-8, this interactive experience includes lifelike baby dinosaurs, singing and dancing, Up-close dino encounters and fun photo ops!

title: John Waters - Radio Luxembourg - Penrith
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: Beetle By Legs On The Wall - Penrith
description:
Join the adventures of Sally and her backyard friend as they set out in search of the now elusive Christmas Beetle.

Brought to life by Legs On The Wall's physical storytelling/circus, puppetry and animation created from the original artworks of beloved children's author/illustrator Freya Blackwood, be spellbound as you encounter larger than life beetles, stick insects and other critters from the Australian bush in this charming show.

A celebration of the connection to the natural world, this immersive tale of resilience and hope reminds all that even the smallest voices matter.
host: Joan Sutherland Performing Arts Centre (Penrith Performing &Visual Arts)

title: Tocal Field Days
description:
The Tocal Field Days are the premier agricultural field day event in the Hunter Region, held every year on the first weekend in May.  Located on the grounds of the Tocal Agricultural College in Paterson, just 10 minutes from Maitland and one hour from Newcastle.

Visitors include people on the land who are looking for the latest innovations, hobby farmers and enthusiasts and people just looking for a great day out.

Whether you enjoy piglet races, great food and wine, fencing demonstrations or the massive machinery that makes the world go around you can be sure the event will not disappoint. The Exhibitors bring to you all the latest in farming techniques and technologies from solar energy to fencing construction.

Tocal Field Days is a non profit incorporated association with three part-time staff members and an enthusiastic band of volunteers who look forward to welcoming you to the event.

title: Tocal Beekeepers' Field Day
description:
Bees of all sorts are the chief pollinators of the world’s flowers. The flowers that attract bees reseed meadows and forests with progeny that build soil, feed grazing animals and provide us humans with much of the beauty we see in nature and the food we eat. 

The 46th Tocal Beekeepers' Field Day at Tocal College is a free event for beekeepers and bee enthusiasts. The event will feature key exhibitors, suppliers and presenters who will give industry updates. Honey will also be available to purchase on the day.

title: Wallarobba Hall Octoberfest
description:
Roll up and enjoy the fun and music at Oktoberfest to be held at Wallarobba Hall.

Enjoy some delicious German food, sausages, sauerkraut, goulash and plenty more. Beer, wine, and soft drinks are available as well as great cakes and strudels, tea and coffee.

The events for the Sausage dog races are the Posh Dach the best dressed, and the Flash Dach will be the fastest sausage dog across the tennis court with no leash, conducted in heats depending on numbers.

There will also be the Smart Sausage which can do the best trick and an obstacle course around the tennis court for the Steeplechase on a leash, great prizes and fun.

Oktoberfest is sure to be a great time in a lovely historical hall.

title: Glenmore Park Christmas Market
description:
Glenmore Park Christmas Market returns this December with Outdoor stalls at Home Co and Indoor stalls in the adjacent Glenmore Park Community Centre.

A casual evening celebrating the festive season and supporting local micro and small businesses in the Nepean area.

With stalls, food trucks, Santa and friends, live music as well as free entry and parking.

title: Glenmore Park Indoor Market
description:
Browse the area's local sellers, small and micro businesses bringing you their amazing products.

The indoor market will go ahead in all weather and will be a regular arrangement on the last.

title: Hawkesbury Fest
description:
Hawkesbury Fest is Council's free event to celebrate Local Government Week. 

The event is a celebration of all things Hawkesbury with a variety of local markets, community stalls, emergency services, music, food, rides and entertainment.

title: Adaminaby Cup Race Day
description:
Adaminaby Cup Race Day is a great local event, held annually on the second weekend in November. This is a fantastic day of country racing. 

Enjoy fashions of the field, give-away prizes and lots of action on the race track. The feature race is the Snow Goose Cup. There are food stalls and bar facilities available, as well as a jumping castle and stalls for the children to make it a great family day out.

The rustic Adaminaby Racecourse was the set location for Phar Lap's last race in Mexico in the Phar Lap movie.

title: Snowies Multisport Festival
description:
With mother nature at her breathtaking best, here's your chance to discover this iconic destination with those who know and love Australia's high country. 

Start and finish your journey at their host resort, Lake Crackenback Resort & Spa, which is nestled in the heartland of the Snowy Mountains.  Yes, your journey will be a hardcore adventure, but before and after, it's luxury all the way with all the facilities you'd expect at one of the country's most beloved 4.5-star resorts.  And it's an even better base for all your family and friends who'll be there to cheer you on.

And now that they've got your race base sorted, get ready for an endorphin overload as you head out onto your ultimate mountain biking, trail running, and triathlon high. 

Experience epic scenery in your choice of mountain biking, trail running or triathlon events where you will immerse yourself in the Thredbo Valley as you traverse the banks of the Little Thredbo River on super fun trails where every twist and turn offers up a new high-country experience. Take in the snow gum forests pierced by crystal clear mountain streams as well as Alpine meadows and granite outcrops.  Forget the tarmac, it's just unadulterated off-road action in the heart of the Snowies.

title: Bon But Not Forgotten Celebrate AC/DC - Weston
description:
Get ready to crank up the volume! Bon But Not Forgotten, the world-renowned AC/DC tribute band, is hitting the road for an epic Australian tour to mark five decades of legendary and electrifying rock ‘n’ roll. This high-voltage tour will celebrate AC/DC's iconic legacy, performing timeless hits that have shaped the sound of rock music across generations.

The Australian rock titans have delivered decades of anthems like “Highway to Hell” “T.N.T.” and “Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap” and Bon But Not Forgotten is set to pay homage to these classics.

The tour will feature an extraordinary lineup of musicians, including Cynthia Gallie, one of Australia’s most versatile rock vocalists. She’ll be joined by James Morley of The Angels on guitar, Bobby Poulton of Wolfmother on bass, Eddy Santacreu of Queen Orchestrated on guitar, and renowned drummer Dave Kirby. Together, they will recreate the raw power and energy of AC/DC’s Bon Scott and Brian Johnson eras, delivering a performance that fans won’t soon forget.

Described by The Rock Pit as “the closest you’ll get to the raw power and legendary sound of the original line-up” Bon But Not Forgotten has earned a reputation for their dynamic stage presence and precise musicianship. 

This year’s tour will feature special guests, Poundcake: The Van Halen Show, amplifying the celebration of 70’s rock n’ roll.

title: Permaculture at the Pub
description:
The Family Hotel are celebrating the science of permaculture. 

This free event, in association with Maplewood Permaculture, will inspire budding gardeners and anyone interested in growing their own sustainable natural systems. 

Discover the design principles for animal and land management in a relaxing and peaceful environment.

Just drop in and stay for as long or as little as you like, and enjoy chatting with fellow gardeners.

title: Culture Club: Poets Society Poetry Reading
description:
Join the Culture Club's Poets Society to see local poets share poems. If you are a poetry lover feel welcome to share your own, make connections and be inspired by creativity. 

Bring your poem and a pillow to relax into the evening.

title: Maitland Rail Museum - Open Days
description:
South Maitland Railways attracts growing interest for its heritage significance, in essence, a perfectly preserved Victorian railway, seemingly immune to the new electronic age. It was the last railway in Australia engaged in the complete restoration and operation of steam locomotives for commercial purposes.

The Maitland Rail Museum has been formed to preserve, restore and display, materials and records that interpret the part played by the South Maitland Railways in the settlement and transformation of the Maitland and Cessnock region to become one of the most important coal-producing areas in the world of the mid 20th century.

The museum itself has interpretive displays as well as equipment, tools and other artefacts used by the railway.

The museum is open the first Sunday of each month and other times by arrangement.

title: Kurri Kurri Nostalgia Festival
description:
The annual Kurri Kurri Nostalgia Festival is all about Rock n Roll, Classic Cars, Hot rods, fashion, music, dancing and everything good about the 50's and 60's. 

The weekend attracts large crowds of people from all over Australia to join in the atmosphere as the town centre is transformed into all the glory of a bygone 50’s and 60’s era.
There’s a classic car and hot rod 'Show and Shine', over 150 retro markets stalls and food vans, lots of free entertainment, rock n roll dance demonstrations, main stage performances, talent quests, feature bands, fashion parades, best dressed competitions, side show alley and much more. Plus nightly events with lots of great 'rock n roll' and 'rockabilly' dances at local venues. 

The festival is free to enter and tickets to indoor shows may be purchased through the Kurri Kurri Visitor Information Centre or at the event door.

title: Western Sydney Gem  and Crystal Expo
description:
Australian Gem And Mineral Expos works closely with the Hawksbury Valley Lapidary Club to bring you an amazing weekend of jewellery, gems, fossils, minerals, metaphysical needs and more!

There are items on sale from Traders around Australia as well as the Lapidary Club. There are prizes to be won as well as activities for the kids!

If you just want to have a look, buy something special for someone or are after a point of difference; decorator piece, come along and be truly amazed by what the natural world has to offer!

title: Reimagining Histories : Artist in Residence
description:
Newcastle artist, Sarah Chisholm, the 2025 Artist in Residence at National Trust's Brough House, will be holding the culminating exhibition of her residency at Brough House.

Sarah uses discarded objects, pre-loved fabrics and hand-me-down yarns to reimagine stories from the past. Taking inspiration from the twin properties, Grossmann and Brough Houses, the Collection and gardens, Sarah is interpreting their stories through fibre and installation.

title: Earth Market Maitland
description:
On the first and third Thursday of each month, Maitland welcomes Maitland Earth Market to The Levee.

Bring your bags, stock up, and taste some of the farm produce, including a great range of pickled vegetables, fruits, herbs, eggs, honey, olives, olive products, oils and much more.

Stroll through the market and take the time to get to know the local farmers. 

Slow Food Earth Market Maitland is run by members and community volunteers who ensure access to good, clean and fair food for all is a reality in Maitland.

title: Maitland New Year's Eve
description:
Head to Maitland Riverbank, Riverside Car Park and RH Taylor Reserve, Lorn, and join New Year's Eve celebrations proudly presented by Valley Estate Agents and Maitland City Council.

This family-friendly event has a lot to offer, with free amusements, face painting, live music, activities and a disco playing all the top hits from the year.

There will be loads of food, beverage and dessert stalls available to tantalise the taste buds of all attendees.

Celebrations will conclude with a spectacular fireworks display that will light up the night sky.

title: Maitland Riverlights
description:
Maitland Riverlights will transform into a global village where you can see, taste, feel and experience over 40 different cultures from around the world. Collect your Riverlights cultural passport on the day and explore your way through The Levee’s global village.

Stop by the world stage, language lounge, groove fusion stage and the global kitchen to experience a trip around the world right here in Maitland.

Don’t miss live music and dynamic performances on the Riverlights Stage and catch the Finale Showpiece held on the riverbank along with the community lantern flotilla.

Funding for this project has been provided by the NSW Government in association with Maitland City Council.

title: Australia Day in Maitland Park
description:
Join in on Australia Day in Maitland Park for a morning of exciting activities, delicious food, and fantastic entertainment

With free barbeque, craft activities, live entertainment, along with free entry to both Maitland and East Maitland Aquatic Centres, it’s a perfect day out for the whole family!

As the sun sets and the evening unfolds, the fun after the daytime festivities continues as Maitland Pool transforms into a floating cinema for Dive In Cinema.

Grab your floaties and swimwear, or simply relax by the poolside, and immerse yourself in an unforgettable movie experience under the stars.

It's the perfect way to cap off your Australia Day celebration in Maitland Park.

title: Jimeoin - Pandemonium - Maitland
description: A stalwart of Australian comedy and all-around likeable rogue, comedian Jimeoin happily imparts his clever and quirky observations on everyday suburban life in his trademark devil-may-care style.

title: Sun Street Studios presents Youth Avenue featuring Chris Wilcox
description:
Youth Avenue finally returns to Sun Street Studios after ten long years.

Playing all their old originals and covers from the golden years, plus featuring local musician Chris Wilcox, who will join in the fun and kick off the night in style.

Mark your calendar and lets' party like its 2015.

title: Robin Hood and His Merry Men
description:
This whimsical junior production is guaranteed to provide fun for all the family.

Prince John decreed that the citizens of Nottingham pay weekly taxes or face the penalty of death. The evil Sheriff of Nottingham enforces his decrees.

The citizens think that all hope is lost until they hear word of a noble hero, Robin Hood of Locksley. Robin Hood, with the help of his merry men, robs the rich, gives to the poor, and saves the fair Maid Marian.

This comic retelling of the story includes thumb wars, missed cues, and a slow-motion fight.

title: Education Mondays
description:
Despite being closed to the public on Mondays, in 2025, during each school term, teachers and students are welcome to exclusive gallery access, workshops, or self-directed activities. The cafe will remain closed on Mondays, so there’s plenty of space indoors for lunch or breakout sessions, in addition to the spacious gallery garden.

Please contact the gallery either by phone or email to book and confirm your visit.

title: Recycled Monster Art
description:
The national organisation Clean Up Australia states that every year Australians consume about 3.5 million tonnes of plastic yet only about 13% of this plastic is recycled and every year 130,000 tons of plastic waste ends up in our marine environments.

Recycled Monster Art is inspired by the plastic that artist Darren Horsfield finds lying around the streets in Newcastle, Maitland and the Central Coast. The exhibition will feature an installation of over 100 individual plastic monsters created by Darren. During the exhibition period Darren will set up his studio in The Project space at Maitland Regional Art Gallery as artist in residence. In a series of art encounters, Darren will invite people to sit down and join him in his quest to reuse and recycle and make art with discarded plastic.

title: Shared
description:
In 2025 Maitland Regional Art Gallery celebrates its 50th anniversary. 

To commemorate this milestone, Maitland Regional Art Gallery presents Shared, an exhibition of special works from the Collection that have been Prized, Gifted, Collected and Shared by the Gallery across that time.

title: Learn How to Care for Our Water Catchment
description:
Do you love the environment and playing with water ? If you do this workshop is for you! Join staff from Council's Environment and Sustainability team to explore the movement of water through the Hunter's water catchment.

This workshop is for children four to 12 years of age, accompanied by an adult.

Children will explore how the actions of people living in the catchment can impact water quality and participate in a fun hands-on experiments.

*Children must be accompanied by an adult

title: Self Directed Activities at Maitland Regional Art Gallery
description:
There is always something fun to do at the Gallery!

If you fancy cracking a code come and try one of the much loved codebreakers. 

No bookings required.

title: Chinese Restaurant Playground
description:
Chinese Restaurant Playground is a multimedia exhibition about childhood, imaginative play, and finding joy within the frenetic settings of a family-run Chinese restaurant located in Branxton NSW.

“Having served customers for over 40 years in the Hunter Valley, my parents’ Chinese restaurant was the backdrop of my childhood. Through animation, illustration, sculpture, and archival photographs and videos, this exhibition documents my memories as a child of Malaysian-Chinese restaurant owners in Branxton.” – Steffie Yee

title: Mud to Masterpiece
description:
Far from the traditional utilitarian uses of clay, Mud to Masterpiece is an exhibition that delves into the world of contemporary ceramics, where the boundaries of tradition and innovation are pushed to their limits. Presenting a dynamic collection of works by bold artists, this exhibition celebrates the transformative power of clay as a medium for experimentation.

Mud to Masterpiece will feature the genre-defying work Wave which unites the mythic imagery and ceramics of South Australian potter Gerry Wedd and the sonic intensity of composer and performer Gabriella Smart and filmmaker Mark Patterson. Mud to Masterpiece presents work from artists moving clay around in exciting ways, from large-scale sculptural forms to the intricate and otherworldly, this electric, energetic exhibition showcases ceramic art transcending its traditional roots and entering the realm of masterpiece.

title: Sticks and Stones: Earth and Bones
description:
For millennia, sticks, stones, earth, and bones have been the foundation materials of creative expression. 

Ken Unsworth, one of Australia’s most respected artists, is well known for incorporating these materials in his sculptural installations, including his kinetic work Zone of Wistful Thoughts, which he donated to MRAG in 2023. 

They will showcase this iconic installation alongside works from their collection and a selection of stunning loaned pieces inspired by these earthy materials.

title: School Holidays Drop In Workshops
description: Free drop-in art activities for all ages inspired by the Sticks and Stones Exhibition and by Kaylene Whiskey's ACMI animation. Create your own natural installation or animation in the Gallery during school holidays with all materials supplied. No bookings required.

title: The Young Architects
description:
Get ready to unleash your creativity and design skills at this exciting workshop with Artist Jen Denzin and a talented architect student from the University of Newcastle. This is a unique hands on opportunity to explore your passion for architecture and design.

The Young Architects is for 12-16 year olds and is designed to incorporate different key learning areas such as science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics. The Young Architects will bring young people together to create, learn, and grow together.

Proudly supported by NSW Government, Cleverpatch and EJE Architecture.

title: Art & Dementia
description:
Art and Dementia sessions are creative and social visits of exhibitions specifically designed for people living with dementia and their carers. The friendly facilitator uses works of art as a trigger for conversation and self-expression, guiding people through art-making activities in a friendly and supportive environment. The dates below relate to the Community Day program for group visits. 

Bookings essential - please contact the gallery.

Group sessions are also available for people living in care facilities. Please call the gallery to make a booking.

title: Found
description:
For Hunter Valley artist Rebecca Rath, establishing a human connection with the natural world is the premise of her practice and the impetus for this body of work.

Found, in both a literal and metaphorical sense, applies to the act of painting en-plein-air, of finding or discovering unique and interesting environments, light and texture, along with the ongoing journey of uncovering meaning and self.

In this series of paintings, Rath brings to life her surroundings, seeking to find new ways of seeing what is in her own ‘backyard’.

title: Maitland and Morpeth String Quartet
description:
Maitland and its sleepy neighbour, Morpeth, are never quite the same again, all due to a middle-aged couple and their hobby of violin playing. This animated film is a delight to both eye and ear. 

Victoria Roberts’ quirky cartoons are perfect complements for Nick Enright’s cleverly constructed poem, while Ruth Cracknell’s reading of all parts adds wit and charm. Both Enright and Cracknell hail from Maitland, making this a very special Maitland and Morpeth story.

title: Summer Holiday
description: Maitland local Xander Holliday continues his abstract portrait series in Summer Holliday. In a celebration of graphic form and bold colour, Summer Holliday invites the viewer to relive their own cherished summer memories. The exhibition features pop-art portraits of colourful characters with a hint of Aussie nostalgia. Grab your towel and dive into his colour-filled world!

title: Art Sunday
description:
Free Art Sunday activities are designed for kids of all ages and, as a family, you can all join in and get creative. Each activity takes around half an hour to complete.

Art Sunday is staffed by Art Tutors who encourage parents and children to add to their experience of the gallery by accessing hands-on art-making activities in a family-friendly environment.

All materials provided! No bookings required!

Please note, children cannot be left unattended during Art Sundays.

Art Materials generously provided by CleverPatch.

Art Sunday is made possible with the support of MRAG Members.

title: 9.5 The Elliott Eyes Bequest
description:
With selected works from a private art collection usually housed in a quiet inner city terrace in Sydney, this is an exhibition celebrating a bequest by our benefactors Gordon Elliott and Michael Eyes. It features the work of artists Rick Amor, Robert Fielding, James Gleeson, Jess Johnson, Euan Macleod, Clement Meadmore, Reko Rennie, Anne Ross, Terry Stringer, and Michael Zavros.

"Knowing that our collection and estate will contribute to the ongoing commissioning of art and artists into the future is a great feeling. We look forward to an ongoing relationship with the Gallery for many years to come and feel that our legacy will live on and be an exciting contribution to artists and the Gallery’s community.” - Gordon Elliott and Michael Eyes.

title: Watered-Up By Sea
description:
Watered-up by Sea… is proposed as an alternative phrase for the word ‘flood’. In this installation, Malvika Satelker is seeking a different set of keys when experiencing ‘a flood’. She suggests that accepted language and use of the word fails to remind us that this excess of water was, at one-point, fresh clean rainwater, a blessing for all living things.

As the rainwater pours in overwhelming and inconvenient quantities, it can be a shock when this water refuses to stay inside the drawn lines on maps. 

Watered-up by Sea… also explores the ways of spiders, and how they respond to flooding. Inspired by their actions in flood events, Satelkar asks questions with her work.

title: Artist Steffie Yee and Comedian Jennifer Wong In Conversation
description:
Join artist Steffie Yee and comedian Jennifer Wong in conversation about the people and stories behind local and regional Chinese Restaurants across Australia.

Steffie Yee's Chinese Restaurant Playground is a multimedia exhibition which captures her childhood growing up with her family's Chinese restaurant in Branxton NSW.

Jennifer Wong is the co-author of Chopsticks or Fork?: Recipes and Stories from Australia's Regional Chinese Restaurants, and also the presenter of the Chopsticks or Fork? series on ABC iview.

Steffie and Jennifer will be joined by special guest Danny Yam, who was the owner of 28 Chinese restaurant in Branxton. He comes with over three decades of experience working in kitchens all around Australia and is currently a chef at Mellow Bistro in Maitland.

The book Chopsticks or Fork?: Recipes and Stories from Australia's Regional Chinese Restaurants, is in stock in the Gallery Store and Jennifer Wong will be available to sign copies after the event.

title: Exhibition Tour of Chinese Restaurant Playground With Artist Steffie Yee
description: Join artist Steffie Yee on a guided tour of Chinese Restaurant Playground to hear the stories behind the artworks and gain insight into her inspirations and practice.

title: Pottery Making with Pipers Creek Pottery
description:
Get your hands dirty… in the most creative way!

The Garden Bar is teaming up with Tammy from Pipers Creek Pottery for a one-of-a-kind pottery event you won't want to miss.

You can create your own handmade cup, mug or wine glass and your ticket includes a cocktail (mocktail) on arrival and a buffet style tapas lunch.

title: Hunter Valley Pet Expo
description: The Hunter Valley Pet Expo will be held at Maitland Showground. It's Rural Scene's Inaugural Pet Expo. A must event for all pet lovers and their friends. See all the latest in pet products and live shows.

title: Maitland Show Rodeo
description:
All rodeo enthusiasts and fans of fun entertainment are invited to cheer on the competitors of the Maitland Rodeo as they compete for the titles of 2025 in the Centre Ring.

Feel your heart race as you watch the bull rides, barrel races, and open bareback rides. 

Patrons are invited to sit in the undercover grandstand for a prime spot to view all of the action or bring a picnic rug and chairs to be seated close to the arena. 

Events include barrel races, steer riding, bull riding, bronc riding and more.

Food and beverages will be available for purchase onsite. No BYO.

The Maitland Showground and partners proudly deliver the Maitland Rodeo.

For more information surrounding the program and ticketing, please visit the website.

title: NAIDOC Family Fun Day
description:
This year marks the 50th anniversary of NAIDOC week. This incredible milestone speaks volumes about the accomplishments of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. 

The theme, 'The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy', puts a spotlight on the generations to come, projecting a powerful future ahead. 

NAIDOC week is celebrating future leaders, communities, achievements, and the ancient knowledge that makes them strong. This year it's all about showing support for the people who will preserve and empower future generations to come. 

This free event features fascinating market stalls, delicious food, free sausage sizzle, live entertainment, rides and the Elders tent. Open to all ages and ethnicities, this event embodies NAIDOC Week,  celebrating community resilience and unity.

title: Forgotten Remnants exhibition by Rochelle Summerfield
description:
Nulla Nulla Regional Gallery is proud to present Forgotten Remnants, a solo exhibition by acclaimed Northern Rivers artist Rochelle Summerfield.

In a first for the gallery, Summerfield will create a site-specific wall installation, painted directly onto the gallery wall and later erased—symbolising the temporary, vanishing beauty of nature under the pressures of climate change. This powerful act of impermanence invites reflection on the fragility of natural landscapes.

title: Kids Big Day Out at The Levee
description:
This July school holidays, The Levee will be hosting a kids activity extravaganza. With three immersive, explosive and roarsome demonstrations to enjoy, plus plenty of games and performances, it's a kid's big day out at The Levee!

Dinosaurs, reptiles and science meet at The Levee. 

Bookings essential for each session.

title: Willmot Festival
description:
Blacktown City Council and Willmot Festival Committee would like to invite the local community to their annual Willmot Festival!

The festival will be held with a range of activities and entertainment for the whole family, including stalls, stage performers, rides and workshops.

So come and join them for an exciting family day out at this year’s Willmot Festival, with great company, great food and fun.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Auslan Interpreted Gallery Tour
description:
Explore the exhibitions with a Gallery Guide and Auslan interpreter Karen Lantry. 

You will learn more about the Gallery’s exhibitions and events along with fascinating stories about the artworks on display.

Bring a friend or two for a relaxed social afternoon.

title: The Show
description: Lucy Culliton’s exhibition The Show explores the vibrant culture of regional agricultural shows through her unique lens, celebrating the people, landscapes, and eccentricities of regional life. In her work Culliton captures the energy and warmth of local agricultural fairs, evoking nostalgia and community spirit. It brings to life quirky characters, lively animals and rustic scenes that define these beloved annual events.

title: Mother
description:
‘Mother’ as a subject, concept, or idea has been explored and depicted by artists across time and cultures. In the final weeks before they farewell Ron Mueck’s Pregnant woman 

MRAG presents a selection of works from the MRAG Collection that reflect on new life, family bonds, love and loss that can all be the experience of Motherhood.

title: Between the Details
description:
Between [the] Details is a touring exhibition of video art from The Australian Centre for the Moving Image featuring works by Zanny Begg, Deborah Kelly, Jason Phu, David Rosetzky, Christian Thompson, and Kaylene Whiskey.

Showcasing six moving image artworks, this exhibition celebrates a vibrant collecting and commissioning program. Working in video offers artists the opportunity to use editing as their primary technique; mixing and matching elements from other films or their own work to tell new stories.

By remixing or rearranging footage they build different rhythms and moods, create hilarious juxtapositions, or shed new light on cultural cliches and presumed histories.

The works in this exhibition all demonstrate an irrepressible desire to bring deep themes to the surface with humour and an incredible attention to detail.

The collection of The Australian Centre for the Moving Image has a rich, 75-year history from its inception as the State Film Centre in 1946. Since its current incarnation in the early 2000s, the collection has expanded to include artworks and experimental film, and now holds a significant archive of complex, time-based media works and videogames, as well as an ever-expanding repository of digitised content and born-digital material.

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Sydney
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Luddenham Showground Market
description:
Come along and visit this gorgeous country-style market.

They have gorgeous stalls for you to look at whilst listening to authentic country music.

Grab a spot on a picnic rug and have a bite for Breakfast, Lunch or Brunch from some of the best event food providers around. Including American barbecue, gozleme, dessert choices and more.

title: Marulan Book Exchange
description:
The Marulan Book Exchange is run twice a monthly by local volunteers, providing a valuable resource for locals and visitors alike. This is one of the few Book Exchanges left in New South Wales. 

Bring your books and grab some new titles!

Open the second and fourth Saturday of the month now at St Stephen's Church in George Street, Marulan.

title: The SHARKSKIN Australian IRB Championships
description:
The SHARKSKIN Australian and Interstate Inflatable Rescue Boat (IRB) Championships are an opportunity for the best IRB crews from across the country to compete against each other over one action-packed weekend, promoting the skills required to complete a successful IRB rescue.

The 2025 SHARKSKIN Australian and Interstate IRB Championships will be held at South West Rocks, NSW.

title: Riverstone Christmas Concert
description:
Riverstone will ring in the festive season with it's inaugural Christmas tree light up and concert in the Sam Lane Community Complex, Park Street.

Residents can enjoy free stage performances by local community groups, Christmas carols, a visit from Santa and photo opportunity, barbeque and ice cream truck, free face painting and glitter tattoos.

At 8.45 pm the Christmas tree will be officially lit up, showcasing it's fairy lights and vibrant decorations.

The night will also include the launch of the Mayoress Christmas Gift Appeal.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Riverstone Food Markets
description:
Riverstone Food Markets is a vibrant food market taking place at Bambridge Lane and Market Steet, Riverstone each month.

Host to some of the best food trucks and stalls Sydney has to offer, it is a night out that the whole family will enjoy. Take your pick from burgers, gozleme, chorizo, ramen, hot dogs, Indian, Mexican and Filipino food.

In addition to food, this family-friendly event features a live DJ and free kids' games.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: All Historic Racing at Pheasant Wood Circuit
description:
The All Historic Race Meeting is an exciting and popular event to bring together bike and car enthusiasts across Australia.

The event includes pre-1963 - the period three and older solos and sidecars, and pre-1961 -  the racing and sports cars.

This event is suitable for the whole family!

title: Spot That Bird Art Exhibition
description:
An art exhibition of Bird paintings by Australia best Bird Artists, to help you identify birds for the Great Aussie Bird Count.  This exhibition is a free event, and the artists will be in the gallery painting at their easels so they can help you identify your birds their habits and calls.

There will be talks on the Great Aussie Bird count and live display of native birds.
host: Podium Enterprises Pty ATF Richards Family Trust

title: Bidwill Festival
description:
Blacktown City Council and Bidwill Festival Committee would like to invite the local community to their annual Bidwill Festival!

The festival will be held with a range of activities and entertainment for the whole family, including arts and craft stalls, food stalls, live performances, rides and workshops.

So come and join them for an exciting family day out at this year’s Bidwill Festival, with great company, great food and fun.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Maitland and Coalfields District Orchid Society - Winter Show
description:
