Leading the charge is Maitland & Coalfields District Orchid Society's annual Winter show of the most beautiful flowers, held over the 2 days in Morpeth.

Experienced growers will be on hand, eager to share their knowledge and provide invaluable advice on orchid care. Whether you're a seasoned aficionado or just starting your journey into the world of these stunning blooms, this is a fantastic opportunity to learn from the best.

Beyond the breathtaking displays, a highlight for many will be the sales tables. Here, you'll find a selection of orchids and plants for sale, along with essential growing supplies like bark, labels, plant clippings, fertilizer and perlite for sale. It's the perfect chance to expand on your collection and find that coveted orchid.

Don't miss this visual spectacle.

title: School holidays at WSI Experience Centre
description:
Visit during the school holiday break to enjoy fun and interactive activities to keep the kids entertained this holiday season. 

They know how expensive the holidays can be, so they've created a program to keep you and your family entertained at one of the most exciting projects in Western Sydney and, in fact, Australia! 

Come and explore the Western Sydney International Airport Experience Centre and let your imagination run wild as you design, construct, and create your own airport along with many other activities!

During school holidays, The Experience Centre runs a fun for all the whole family free activity program. 

There will be Naidoc Week crafts, free-build LEGO® workshops, and even build a plane crafts. Visit the website for the dates and times of each activity.

The Experience Centre is closed every Thursday, Friday and Public Holiday.  

Details can be found on the website.

title: Gladstone Quality Markets
description:
Gladstone Quality Markets are held on the third Sunday of every month along the banks of the Macleay River, Kinchela Street, Gladstone.

The market hosts quality, local, hand-picked stallholders featuring artists, ceramics, photographer; gourmet/fine foods including jams, local farm-fresh produce, preserves, chutneys and locally made muesli style products; as well as handmade soaps and locally produced organic body products and native plants.

There are also local, professionally produced barista coffee. Another taste temptation is gourmet ready-to-eat pies. There will also be entertainment provided by talented, local musicians and performers as well as entertainment for the children including face-painting and jumping castle. Come along and enjoy a day full of fun, atmosphere and guaranteed quality produce on the riverbank in the unique, historical village of Gladstone.

Fill a picnic basket with the goods on offer, find a shady spot on the riverbank, sit back and enjoy the atmosphere.

The heritage township of Gladstone also offers the benefit of some great boutique shopping and cafes to explore and dine in after the markets.

title: Mount Druitt Christmas Light Up Concert
description:
Mount Druitt will once again welcome the festive season with its annual concert at Dawson Mall. A fun and fabulous evening for the entire family!

Residents can enjoy free stage performances by local community groups, Christmas carols, a visit from Santa and photo opportunities, free face painting, and free Christmas glitter tattoos.

The evening will also showcase the lighting of  the Christmas tree with its fairy lights and vibrant decorations.

The night will also include the launch of the Mayoress Christmas Gift Appeal.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Blacktown City Family Fish In
description:
A great family event, and a great way to get the kids into fishing - Blacktown City’s Family Fish In is back!

Simply book your spot, bring fishing lines and bait and start fishing for the 600 trout released in the pool (power bait is available to purchase). 

This event is proceeding under a permit from NSW Department of Primary Industries.

Bookings essential.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Mount Druitt Pool Party
description:
Join this summer for the Mount Druitt Pool Party! Splash Out and enjoy free entry for the family at Mount Druitt Swimming Centre.

Kick back and listen to the DJ spinning chart-topping tunes whilst relaxing by the pool and enjoying the sunshine.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Jindabyne Open Mic Night
description:
Brumby Bar and Grill hosts an Open Mic Night every Friday evening. 

It is open to all artists and performers of various disciplines and styles. Beginners are welcome. A microphone, speaker, guitar cable and DJ decks are provided.

title: Anh Do - Rooty Hill
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'

Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: NAIDOC Week at Rouse Hill Estate
description:
The Next Generation: Strength, Vision and Legacy.

Celebrate First Nations cultures on Dharug Country at Rouse Hill Estate.

NAIDOC Week is a time to celebrate First Nations cultures, history and achievements. This year's theme, The Next Generation: Strength, Vision and Legacy, celebrates not only the achievements of the past but the bright future ahead, empowered by the strength of young leaders, the vision of communities, and the legacy of ancestors.

Museums of History NSW is joining forces with Muru Mittigar Aboriginal Cultural and Education Centre to bring you a day of fun activities for the whole family to enjoy. The day will begin with a Welcome to Country and Smoking Ceremony followed by dance performances and workshops.

Join elders in the yarning circle and discover more than a century of knowledge, culture and strength. Listen to didgeridoo performances and storytelling or learn weaving techniques. See how traditional tools are made, and drop in to Muru Mittigar to learn how to throw a boomerang, make art, or check out Aboriginal art and artefacts while listening to some great yarns.

Light refreshments and food available. Program coming soon.

title: Lake Light Sculpture Jindabyne
description:
Lake Light Sculpture is a spectacular outdoor exhibition held annually over the Easter long weekend on the stunning foreshore of Lake Jindabyne. Showcasing innovative and illuminated sculptures by artists from across Australia, the event transforms the lakeside into a vibrant art trail by day and a mesmerising display of light and creativity by night.

Visitors can explore diverse artworks, enjoy the natural beauty of the Snowy Mountains, and experience a unique fusion of art and landscape. With awards, interactive installations, and a welcoming community atmosphere, Lake Light Sculpture is a must-visit cultural event for art lovers and nature enthusiasts alike. 

Lake Light Sculpture invites visitors to immerse themselves in art and light while enjoying the welcoming spirit of Jindabyne and the Snowy Mountains region.

title: Clarence Town Markets
description:
The markets are located on the grounds of the Clarence Town Bowling Sport and Recreation Club in a charming little country town on the Williams River, and they love seeing people come to visit. 

There is an average of 20 stalls per month, with a huge variety of stallholders.  Happening on the last Saturday of each month with farm fresh produce, sausage sizzle, vintage jewellery, candles, second-hand goods,  tools, bric-a-brac, goat soap, cakes, jams, plants, books and much more.

title: ChinChintin Botanicals  Hands On Essential Oil Distillation Workshop at Glenmore House
description: Come and use a Hand Made Copper Alembic Still and learn how to distill Essential Oils and Hydrosols at the beautiful Glenmore House. Their award winning distiller will guide you through as you choose your botanicals, pack your still and then watch the magic happen as Essential Oils and Hydrosols are produced.

title: Blacktown Pet Festival
description:
Pet lovers mark your calendar for a PAWsome day out!

The  Blacktown Animal Rehoming Centre (BARC) is getting tails wagging by hosting this annual Pet Festival,  at their site in Glendenning.

Owners and their furry, feathery or scaly friends alike will unite for a fun day celebrating pets and the families who love them.

The Pet Festival is an initiative of BARC and is a celebration of pets of all shapes and sizes. Gather the family, pets included and join them to celebrate your ‘pet pride’!
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Hinterland to Highlands Treasure Trail
description:
The Hinterland to Highlands Treasure Trail is a unique, self-drive event designed to showcase the incredible producers, growers, and artisans in the rural communities of the Port Stephens Hinterland, Maitland and Dungog councils. Inspired by successful initiatives such as the Central Coast Harvest Festival and the Hastings Farmgate Tour, this event aims to strengthen connections between locals and entice visitors to the region to celebrate the people behind the region's food, crafts, and farm experiences.

Throughout a weekend, participants will have the opportunity to visit a curated selection of farms, boutique producers, and artisan businesses. Each stop on the tour will offer a unique experience, such as farm tours, tastings, hands-on workshops, paddock-to-plate demonstrations, pick your own opportunities and opportunities to purchase fresh local produce directly from the source.

title: Wingham Farmers Market
description:
Since 2003, the Wingham Farmers Market has been a great source of fresh local produce. Come along and enjoy the friendly atmosphere, supporting the local community. 

If it's grown, baked or made sustainably in the region, it's welcome at the Wingham Farmers Market.

title: Elephant Trail Race
description:
Coastal Track and Trail Runners would like to invite you to the Elephant Trail Race. The 25-27 kilometres Mt Cairncross course, with approximately 1455 metre elevation per lap. The race offers participants a choice of distances catering for both the novice and Ultra Distance Runner. Distances of 217 kilometre, 160 kilometre, 100 kilometre Solo, 100 kilometre 3 Day Staged, 50 kilometre, 25 kilometre, 13 kilometre,  5 kilometre and a free Kids Race 2.5 kilometre.

Elephant Trail Race attracts ITRA points for six of its eight races. 217 kilometre - Six Points,  160 kilometre - Six Points, 100 kilometre Solo - Five Points, 50 kilometre - Three Points, 25 kilometre - One Point.

The race is only a short distance from Port Macquarie, Wauchope and Telegraph Point in the beautiful Hastings Area. All racing will take place in Cairncross State Forest. The Elephant Trail Race is in it's 8th Year in 2025.

You will travel through the State Forest and NSW Crown Lands and land of the traditional owners, the Birpai People.

title: Australia Day in Blacktown
description:
Enjoy all the festivities of Australia Day at the Australia Day Celebrations at The Rooty Hill. 

Grab the family and enjoy a family-friendly day out while Rooty Hill plays host to live stage performances, amusement rides, food stalls and concludes with Western Sydney's best fireworks display!

Australia Day Concert is a licensed event and strictly no BYO alcohol.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: The Sunday Muster Artisan Markets
description:
The Sunday Muster is a roundup of creative people; artists, crafts persons, and designers, in a boutique artisan market held on the grounds at Mortels Sheepskin Factory in Thornton. 

Leave your adorable fur babies at home. It’s an outdoor market so weather permitting. The Sunday Muster is not just an event, it’s an experience to relax, discover, and appreciate the incredible talents and products of our local community. 

Explore handmade treasures, savor artisan foods, and meet the makers and designers who bring these creations to life! Shop till you drop and enjoy live music, indoor and outdoor cafe dining and the convenience of off street parking for stress free shopping.

title: Tallong Apple Day Festival
description:
A great day out for the whole family. Come and celebrate Tallong's rich apple orchard heritage, home of the Big Apple, with fun attractions, heaps of craft and food stalls, special events for children, and competitions galore!

Whipcracking, medieval battles, wood chopping, pig racing, pony rides, fleece to garment, bake-off, photography competition, car and bike show, rock climbing wall, bungee jumping, live music, puppet shows, snake and reptiles, Boral Free Kids Activity area and loads more! Plenty of food including toffee apples and apple pies. All parking will be in Tallong for the Apple Festival, just follow the signage for the allocated space, a gold coin donation is requested.

And of course, being an Apple Festival, there will be lots of apples for sale. All proceeds go back into the community to fund projects within the Tallong region.

More information can be found on the Apple Festival website.

Proudly supported by Goulburn Mulwaree Council.

title: Doonside Festival
description:
Join the lovely community at the annual Doonside Village Festival for a great family day out. 

The festival will feature activities and entertainment including live stage performers, stalls, rides and workshops, perfect for a great family out. 

This community festival has come about through the wonderful partnership of the Council, the Doonside Festival Committee and the Blacktown Lions Club.

Bring your friends and family for great food and fun.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Woodcroft Festival and Carols
description:
A festival and carols event in one, this event features a range of activities and entertainment for the whole family, including food and market stalls, live stage performances, rides, workshops, emergency services displays and Christmas performances. 

Come and join this year’s event and grab some last-minute stocking fillers whilst enjoying great company, great food and a whole lot of fun for the whole family!
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Cobbitty Village Markets
description:
Experience a true country market day with 150 stalls selling an exciting range of craft, gourmet foods, and local produce. Sit, relax, and enjoy a delicious barbeque breakfast or lunch, Devonshire teas, and a variety of gourmet delicacies.

Free parking for over 1000 cars.

Well-behaved and socialised dogs on leads are welcome at the market. Ensure you pick up after your dog and be mindful to take care in busy areas and around children.

title: Camden Haven Dragon Boat Regatta Challenge
description:
Two exciting days of dragonboat racing at Stoney Aqua & Activity Park, Telegraph Point.  

Dragonboat clubs from up and down the East Coast will compete over 200 meters, with specialty races for cancer survivors and longer distance novelty races. Paddlers from southern Queensland to the NSW South Coast will meet in fierce competition. 

Dragonboat racing is the fastest-growing team sport, attracting participants of all ages and abilities. While participants pay an entry fee, there is no cost to attend as a spectator. Food and coffee stalls will be available and a giant raffle will round out a visually spectactular weekend.

Located 15 minutes south of Port Macquarie the venue is close to accommodation, unique attractions, great food and wonderful beaches and waterways.
host: Camden Haven Dragon Boat Club Inc

title: Halloween Dusk 2 Dawn
description:
2025 will be the seventh year of Halloween Dusk 2 Dawn.

Spooky night trail running through the Cairncross State Forest. Five races to choose from over a seven-kilometre lap course.

See the gentle yellow flickers from the brave souls that dare to trick or treat running or riding through the forest. Will the runners be guided by the faint lights or growing daylight?

Midnight sees a change of direction for all runners already lost in the forest. It also sees the brave souls of the Midnight Half Marathon start. Dressed up to trick or treat through the seven-kilometre forest course. 
So take your pick or even attempt a couple of events.

Only those who are game will take on the forest, only the strongest will survive.

title: Glenworth Grazing
description:
Immerse yourself in a world of entertainment and fun that brings family and friends together. With amazing live music to get you dancing and a delicious food experience to get your taste buds tingling, this incredible festival truly has it all. 

With over 100 local vendors and the region’s top restaurants, there’s a huge range of craft beers, premium wines, handmade gins and incredible food to enjoy. And with tons of kids entertainment, it’s the festival for all ages.

Glenworth Grazing is so close. Just 20 minutes from Hornsby, or a 15 minute shuttle bus ride from Gosford Train Station.
host: Glenworth Valley Horse Riding Pty Ltd

title: Lost Paradise
description:
Lost Paradise is an annual camping festival established in 2014 and held in Glenworth Valley.

It features four stages of music ranging from indie rock to underground electronic and a "Shambhala" space dedicated to health and wellness.
host: LOST PARADISE GLENWORTH VALLEY PTY LIMITED

title: Carrington Fair
description:
Each year Carrington holds a Fair that raises much-needed funds for the benefit of all residents living at Carrington.

Now a much-anticipated annual event, the Carrington Fair has become a local tradition for people living in Macarthur.

Over the 40-plus years since the first Fair was held, it has evolved into a fun day.

With over 100 stall holders providing arts and crafts, book sales, food, music, dance performances, fire engine displays, show rides, pony rides, and face painting, there is something for everyone.

See you there, at the Carrington Fair!

title: Windellama Country Markets
description:
Windellama Hall Markets are held on the third Sunday of every month, except for January, and a  special Christmas Market event in December.

There are plenty of stalls selling homemade jams and preserves, pre-loved toys and tools, locally produced honey, bric-a-brac, various plants, gourmet foods, wooden toys, skincare products and everything for sewing enthusiasts.

Home-cooked hot food, freshly ground coffee and refreshments are available, together with fabulous cupcakes and sweet slices with plenty of parking available and disabled access.

title: Wauchope Farmers Market
description:
Wauchope Farmers Market brings the growers, makers, bakers and creatives together on the fourth Saturday of every month at Wauchope Showgrounds.

It is the place where the city meets the bush.

title: Blacktown Christmas Concert
description:
Blacktown City will welcome the festive season with its annual Christmas tree light up and concert in the Civic Plaza.

Residents can enjoy free stage performances by local community groups, Christmas carols, a visit from Santa and photo opportunity, free face painting and Christmas glitter tattoos, and not forgetting the lighting of the Christmas tree, showcasing its fairy lights and vibrant decorations.

The night will also include the launch of the Mayoress Christmas Gift Appeal.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: TASTE Camden
description:
TASTE Camden is back for 2025 at Camden Town Farm.

Join the vibrant community of Camden at this cherished event, where thousands gather to indulge in a wide array of food, drinks, and local produce. Experience a lively atmosphere filled with alcohol vendors, live music, and engaging activities for children. Throughout the day, enjoy special cooking demonstrations by a celebrity chef, adding an exciting twist to the festivities.

title: Wauchope Bonsai Workshop Group
description:
Wauchope Bonsai Workshop Group meets on the second Saturday of the month.

The meeting commences with a discussion of the display trees, followed by a presentation.  The remainder of the meeting is workshop time for members to work on their own trees and a separate one-hour session for beginners to learn the basics of bonsai.

Visitors are most welcome to drop into the meetings. The group is an excellent way to learn how to create your own, or to care for the bonsai you already have.

title: Berrima Schoolyard Markets
description:
Berrima Schoolyard Markets has 50 sassy stalls that will delight you! 

There are children's activities galore, including a jumping castle and cars, and a playground. They also have live music, and the school's very special Stephanie Alexander "Kitchen Café" is open. This is a fantastic market to buy great presents, useful items, fresh produce and other delicious food! 

Stalls include handmade, artisan, jewellery, fashion, homewares and many delicious food stalls, fresh produce, homemade jams, sauces, pies, sweets, French cheeses, charcuterie and more. Enjoy fabulous hot food such as BBQ, Japanese pancakes, gozleme, Chinese, Danish and French meals all available to enjoy on site whilst listening to live music or watching the kids play. 

The markets raise much-needed funds for the Stephanie Alexander Kitchen & Garden program, allowing students, teachers and parents to delight in weekly gardening and cooking lessons. 
​
Be sure to stop by the Kitchen Cafe on market day for delicious coffee, cakes and a mouth-watering sausage sizzle.

title: Camden Fresh Produce Market
description:
Camden Fresh Produce Markets are held every Saturday morning.

Camden Produce markets are a “Genuine Farmers Market” as all products sold must be grown, produced or made by the person selling them.

title: CommBank Emerging Matildas Championships
description:
The CommBank Emerging Matildas Championships are a key event in the Australian football calendar, featuring teams from Football Australia's nine State and Territory Member Federations competing for the national title while showcasing their skills to national team technical staff.

The tournament will span six days, showcasing the top Under 15 and Under 16 female footballers from across the country. 

The 2025 CommBank Emerging Matildas Championships is proudly supported by the NSW Government's tourism and major events agency, Destination NSW.

title: Camden Art Prize
description: The Camden Art Prize is an art competition now in its 47th year. It is held annually to promote the visual arts within the Camden Local Government Area and the Macarthur Region, and to broaden and stimulate community perception of art with particular reference to Australian works. The competition is open to anyone in Australia.

title: Heritage Train Rides
description:
Bring history to life with a heritage train ride at the NSW Rail Museum in Thirlmere. 

Enjoy a 40-minute heritage trip onboard our heritage carriages from the 1930s behind a 120-year-old steam train, or board a timber-bodied railmotor! Once onboard, experience history in motion along part of the original line from Sydney to Melbourne.

Please make sure you arrive at least 15 minutes prior to your departure.

title: Camden Crystal and Mystics Fair
description:
A family-friendly day, treat your heart and soul and meet like-minded individuals, psychic readers and an amazing variety of retail exhibitors.

There's a Psychic Readers Hub which hosts gifted and professional psychics, mediums, numerologists and astrology readers.

Relax and rebalance with one of our Wellness Healers who specialises in aura photography, reiki, kinesiology, access bars, sound and energy healing. 

There is a wonderful variety of inspiring exhibitors ranging from crystals and gemstones, jewellery, candles, paintings and artwork, dreamcatchers, spiritual gifts and beautiful handmade creations.

title: Steam Train Weekends at NSW Rail Museum
Camden Crystal Festival
description:
Crystal Festivals Australia is hosting an exhibition and sale showcasing a stunning array of items at the Camden AH & I Hall. 

Visitors can explore a diverse collection, including jewellery, gems, findings, minerals, silver rings, beads, opals, pearls, and carvings. 

The event also features an assortment of fossils, rocks, and crystals, providing a fascinating glimpse into Australian geology and minerals.

title: Street Feast - Camden
description:
Street Feast is coming to Camden this summer. A night of food trucks, dessert stalls, boutique retail stalls and music.  Full lineup to be announced soon.
 
Local vendors Street Feast would love to have you there!

title: Kids Fun Day
description: Kids Fun Day is a complimentary community event designed to captivate young families with engaging entertainment and activities specifically for children aged 0-5. The day will include a variety of interactive and enjoyable live performances.

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Camden
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Kings Langley Festival
description:
Celebrate the annual Kings Langley Festival.

Grab the family and come celebrate with the community!  

There will be plenty of market and craft stalls, arts and crafts activities, a variety of food options, live stage entertainment from local talent as well as kids games and rides. There really is something for everyone!
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: ANZAC Day Commemoration Services - Camden
description:
The Camden RSL Sub-Branch will hold a Commemoration Service and an ANZAC March to commemorate the Anniversary of the landing at Gallipoli. 

Starting at 5am for the ANZAC Dawn Service followed by the ANZAC Day March at 10:30 am and finally the ANZAC Day Commemoration Service at 11:15 am.

title: Blacktown Drive In Markets
description:
This bustling market is held every Sunday within the Skyline Drive-In located in Prospect.

Complimenting the wide variety of stallholders are food trucks and pop-up cafes and occasionally live music performances and a jumping castle for the kids.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Cowpasture Reserve Parkrun
description:
A free, fun, and friendly weekly five-kilometre community event. Walk, jog, run, volunteer or spectate, it's up to you.

The event takes place at Cowpasture Reserve - Camden every Saturday morning.

Please come along and join in whatever your pace.

title: Back to Bedrock at the Camden Valley Inn
description:
Step back in time with a Flintstones-inspired Stone Age world, where dinosaurs roam and prehistoric fun awaits.
‍
The laneway has been transformed into a rocky paradise straight out of Bedrock. Sip on specialty drinks, take part in weekly Bedrock deals, and purchase limited edition Bedrock-inspired bargains.

title: Powerhouse Materials: Textiles
description:
Guest curator Chloe Hayden selects textile objects from the Powerhouse Collection.

Ranging from a robot bull used for cattle herding to a pair of boots worn by Australian costume designer Catherine Martin, Chloe explores her sensory and cerebral obsessions and memories through a collection centred on horses, country life, fashion and the importance of difference.

Alongside Chloe's selection the exhibition will also include sewing machinery, embroidery, knitting, dyeing, weaving and patchwork from the Powerhouse's expansive collection of textiles. Pick up a free, self-guided program designed for visitors to journey through the objects and stories while building your own textile work.

Powerhouse Materials: Textiles is the first instalment in a new series exploring the Powerhouse Collection with a guest curator and a chosen material. The second instalment, Powerhouse Materials: Paper will be with renowned children's author Andy Griffiths from November 2025.

title: Future Fashion
description:
Now in its 32nd year, Future Fashion showcases the next generation of Australian designers emerging from tertiary fashion and textiles courses at four Sydney-based institutions: TAFE NSW, Torrens University Australia, University of Technology Sydney and Whitehouse Institute of Design.

This year's exhibition features outfits from the final-year collections of graduates, highlighting creativity, critical thinking and entrepreneurship in their work.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Picton
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Picton
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  
Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   
It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Powerhouse Materials Textiles Studio
description:
Drop-in to the Textiles Studio this school holidays to create your own soft toy inspired by objects from the Powerhouse Collection.

Visitors of all ages can experiment with remnant and deadstock fabrics, while discovering new techniques and connections to textiles.

This activity engages with our current display Powerhouse Materials: Textiles, the first instalment of the Powerhouse Materials series.

title: Powerhouse Academy: Curatorial Kids
description: Transform a museum exhibition from a concept to reality in this creative and hands-on full-day design workshop. Students will learn about the creative and technical processes involved in making an exhibition come to life, go behind the scenes of the Powerhouse Collection and uncover the stories behind objects. Guided by Powerhouse curators and taking inspiration from the Collection, participants will realise their idea for a curated exhibition design.

title: Morisset Shop and Feast Markets
description:
Come along to Morisset Showground for a family-friendly day out at the Shop and Feast Market in Lake Mac. Markets are held on the first Saturday of every month from, offering a fun and lively atmosphere for all ages.

This free community event features street style food trucks, non-alcoholic beverages, desserts, dog stalls, a range of handmade and pre-loved market stalls, live music, and kids' entertainment. Facilities include picnic areas, public toilets, dog-friendly spaces, disability access, and ample carparking.

Shop and Feast Markets run alongside the Bird and Poultry Auction happening right next door in the shed. 

Bring along your picnic blanket, gather the whole family (and the dog), to enjoy a snack, shop, and stroll as you explore a variety of local stallholders and discover unique finds on a beautiful Saturday morning. 

Visit the website for the full list of market dates and follow the Facebook page for upcoming vendor announcements.

title: Bredbo Truck and Machinery Show
description:
Bredbo Truck and Machinery Show has vehicles of all ages on display, from vintage trucks, engines and tractors to modern-day vehicles.

There will be a vintage tractor pull, various stalls, a jumping castle, live music and more.

title: Mid North Coast Outdoor Show
description:
In 24 years, the Mid North Coast Outdoor Show has established itself as the major event held in the region. The event has grown along with the exceptional growth in the region, and they are very proud to support not only all the community groups but also all the local and regional businesses that are involved or benefit from this great event. 

With over 165 exhibitors, loads of entertainment for the whole family, camp oven cooking, fishing demonstrations, bike show and so much more!

title: Lake Macquarie Outdoor Living, Caravan & Boat Expo
description:
Welcome to the inaugural Lake Macquarie Outdoor Living, Caravan & Boat Expo! Where adventure starts! 

A must-visit for outdoor enthusiasts for over a decade, they're now bringing the excitement to the Morisset Showgrounds. You'll find a showcase of the latest in caravans, camper trailers, 4x4 hear and boating and marine adventure – all in one place.

With exclusive show-only deals, industry experts and all the biggest brands in one place, this is your chance to gear up for your next escape. 

Whether you're hitting the road or setting sail, get ready to explore, dream and discover!

title: Glow Zone - Castle Hill
description:
What is Glow Zone?

Glow Zone is a family event filled with winter nighttime fun. 

Your entry ticket includes all amusements and a glow pack to get started!

Once inside you will find stalls to browse, lots of yummy things to eat and loads of photo opportunities. Enjoy the rides, characters, and performers or sit back grab a bite and watch the movie of the night. 

Glow Zone Highlights...
Glow Activations and Installations
Glitter Bombs
Colour Fights
DJ
Rides
Outdoor Cinema

title: The Hills Christmas
description:
The Hills Christmas is a new Christmas market being held at Castle Hill Showground this December.

A casual evening celebrating the festive season and supporting local small businesses in The Hills.

With indoor and outdoor stalls, food trucks, rides, a Christmas treasure hunt, Santa and friends, live music, as well as free entry and parking.

title: Meet the Fleet
description:
Join Transport for NSW for a free fun day out and a sneak peak at new buses coming soon to Western Sydney.
Hop on board a new bus, meet local bus drivers, grab some fairy floss, get your face painted, catch live entertainment and more. Bring your friends and family, Transport for NSW is putting on the BBQ!

title: Crescent Head Community Markets
description:
These colourful markets on the Crescent Head foreshore have stallholders selling a great variety of fresh local produce, fresh seafood, jams and pickles, homemade goods, fishing gear, surf gear and second hand wares, adult and children’s clothing and jewellery.

All the profits from the markets benefit the students of Crescent Head Primary School.

The Markets run on the second Sunday of every month.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Castle Hill
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: Bredbo CWA Village Markets
description: The Bredbo CWA Village Market is a lively market held in the small village of Bredbo on the fourth Sunday of each month. You will find various stallholders set up in the village hall, and often a sausage sizzle for a meal.

title: Jazz @ MAP mima
description:
Experience the soulful sounds of jazz in an intimate and immersive setting in MAP mima's Cube.
This special evening features a live performance by a talented local jazz band, bringing the timeless allure of jazz music to life in the unique 360-degree projection space.

title: Women's Labour performance
description:
Women's Labour is a feminist performance project that transforms domestic tools into musical instruments using embedded technology.

At the heart of this project lies a radical act of transformation: everyday household objects — symbols of traditionally gendered, invisible labour — are repurposed into musical instruments through the integration of embedded technologies.

Through participatory engagement and performative spectacle, the project challenges audiences to confront the gendered histories and cultural assumptions associated with domestic labour.

title: Art Play for the whole family at MAP mima
description:
Young families are invited to enjoy a free and exciting art program designed for all ages.
This welcoming space encourages creativity and fun for every member of the family. Each session includes a brief guided tour of the current exhibition, followed by a unique art activity that changes every month.

Art Play runs on the second Sunday of the month at the Multi-Arts Pavilion, mima.

title: Allison Moore: Fresque Grotesque
description:
Grotesque Fresco is a generative video work inspired by opera, mythology, and grotesque painting, a decorative art style from the Italian Renaissance era. The immense animated painting is a visual and digital ode to live arts, the visual composition suggests fragments of fantastic stories with a gallery of earthy characters interwoven with motifs of candelabra, foliage, flowers, insects, birds and flowers. 

Combining various digital and cinematographic techniques, such as live-action filming with costumed performers, 2D and 3D animation, and time-lapse images of plants. All visual elements are composites in a digital environment with generative animation,n with custom-programmed algorithms.

title: Friday Night at the Gledswood Homestead and Winery Cellar Door
description: Come and unwind on the first Friday night of the month, from 5:30pm at the Gledswood Homestead and Winery cellar door! Enjoy a laid-back evening featuring boutique wines, beers, cocktails, and a tasty bar menu. Cheers to the weekend!

title: The Enchanted Sanctuary
description:
Step into a world of wonder at The Enchanted Sanctuary, a breath-taking nocturnal lighting event that transforms the Australian Wildlife Sanctuary in Bargo into a glowing paradise of light, sound, and nature.  

Book tickets for an unforgettable evening where the beauty of wildlife meets the enchantment of illumination.

title: Sunday Sessions at the Cellar Door and Market
description:
Indulge in a delightful afternoon filled with wine tastings from Gledswood Homestead and Winery,  exclusive cellar door selection and a mouthwatering lunch menu featuring seasonal favorites.

 For a unique experience, consider pre-ordering a Cellar Door Picnic, complete with a picnic rug, antipasto board, and a bottle of wine to enjoy by the open fire if the weather turns chilly.

As you unwind with friends and family, live music will enhance the atmosphere, making it the perfect setting for relaxation.

 While walk-ins are welcome, reservations are required to ensure a spot for lunch reservations. Don't forget to explore their boutique local market on-site for some shopping while you're there.  

Children are welcome, but please note that they must be accompanied by a responsible adult at all times and cannot enter the bar area. 

Gather your friends and make the most of your Sunday at Gledswood.

title: Fast and Loud Festival
description:
Get ready for a blood-pumping weekend at Fast and Loud Festival!

Experience an incredible lineup of action on and off the water with exclusive live performances, exhilarating boat races, a range of food markets, car shows, roving entertainment, and kid’s activities lighting up the foreshores!

Live sites will pop up around the lake over the weekend, offering the best vantage points to watch the Powerboat and Superboat races.

For more information head to their website.

title: Emma Florence-May: From Within the Coal House and Re-Dobell
description:
From Within the Coal House is a selection of recent artwork by Emma Florence-May, a proud trans-woman and interdisciplinary artist. You are invited to her experience of transition, which cannot be untied from the intergenerational haunting of deindustrialisation that reverberates across space and time.

From within her coal house, you can bear witness to her personal struggles with haunted memories of belonging and identity. She uses collage and mixed media to bring ideas from her past, present and future into conversation with one another. This allows for the simultaneous fragmentation and re-assembly of objects of representation.

Exhibited alongside Emma's works will be Re-Dobell: A Community Re-imagining of Dobell and Self. This display is a selection of artworks created by community members who attended a series of workshops.

These workshops explore students' unique identities and sexualities through the fragmenting, embellishing, and reassembling of the portrait works of William Dobell.

title: MAC yapang Art Prize exhibition
description:
This is an exhibition of finalist artworks selected from submissions for the new MAC yapang Art Prize!

This national art prize has a total prize pool of over $40,000.

The winning artist of the acquisitive prize will be awarded $30,000, and their artwork will be acquired by the Museum of Art and Culture, yapang for the permanent collection.

It is open to artists from all disciplines across Australia, with artworks in any medium.

title: Young Dobell exhibition 2025
description:
Young Dobell is an exhibition of finalist works from the Young Dobell Art Competition

Artists aged 5 - 18 from Lake Macquarie, Newcastle, Port Stephens, Maitland, the Hunter, and the Central Coast were invited to submit work to the Young Dobell art competition.

Sir William Dobell was a three-time Archibald Prize winner who lived in Lake Macquarie and was known for his portraits and landscape artworks. His beloved pet dogs were also a favoured subject matter for Dobell.

The Young Dobell competition participants were encouraged to create either a portrait of a person or pet who plays a significant role in their life, or a landscape artwork of a place that is special to them.

title: Truth Tell
description:
To understand the present, we must confront the past. Truth Tell delves into the learned narratives of early colonisation and the deep impacts on Aboriginal people during this period. This powerful exhibition draws from the historical accounts of events during a time of dispossession of land and disruption to cultural practices and invites an exploration of the complexities of learned histories. 

Drawing inspiration from First Nations perspectives, Penny Evans, Julie Gough, Shellie Smith, James Possum Tylor and Peta Clancy uncover and re-present conflicting histories, while paying homage to the ongoing resilience and strength of Aboriginal communities.

By acknowledging the ongoing effects of colonisation, this exhibition aims to inspire conversations that foster understanding, empathy, and collective responsibility.

Curated by Jasmine Kean.

title: Billy Missi'n Wakain Thamai
description:
Billy Missi was born on Mabuiag Island in 1970. Informed by a childhood engaged with storytelling, song and dance traditions of the Wagedagam Tribe, Missi's inherited creativity, combined with his passion and experience growing up with living customary practices, prepared him for his journey into art. Missi felt the impulse to create when he first encountered the works of contemporary Torres Strait Islander artists in 1992, but it was not until 1999 that he felt ready to devote himself to artistic pursuits full-time.

With only minimal formal training on Moa Island, he rapidly worked his way to the forefront of contemporary Zenadh-Kes (Western Torres Strait) printmaking. Missi skillfully combined traditional carving techniques, iconography and his distinct fish-bone patterns with the contemporary medium of the linocut to forge a new aesthetic and print making movement in the 1990s alongside peers, an aesthetic firmly based on traditional Torres Strait Islander principles. Billy Missi gained international recognition prior to his passing in 2012.

title: Michèle Heibel: Conversations
description:
Hunter-based artist Michèle Heibel was born into an artistic Swiss-German family in 1972 and spent many of her childhood years in Switzerland's Bernese countryside. 

In 1983, after extensive travels, her family made the decision to settle permanently in Australia.  
Working in corporate design for many years in Sydney's CBD as an Art Director, Heibel returned to her artistic roots and the rural lifestyle she had known as a child, where she developed her practice, creating unique artworks through etching with a family heirloom pin. These delicate pieces are created with a whimsical quality that will often belie the serious message within.

This new body of work 'Conversations' discusses the importance of connection through all stages of our lives.

title: Glow Zone - Fairfeld
description:
What is Glow Zone?

Glow Zone is a family event filled with winter night time fun. 

Your entry ticket includes all amusements and a glow pack to get started!

Once inside you will find stalls to browse, lots of yummy things to eat and loads of photo opportunities. Enjoy the rides, characters, and performers or sit back grab a bite and watch the movie of the night. 

Glow Zone Highlights...
Glow Activations and Installations
Glitter Bombs
Colour Fights
DJ
Rides
Outdoor Cinema

title: Arcadian Artists Art Trail and Exhibition
description:
Five beautiful rural properties will open their studio doors to exhibit over 35 talented artisans at the Arcadian Artists 2025 Trail. 
Situated in Dural, Galston and Arcadia, painters, printmakers, glass and textile artists, jewellers, sculptors, photographers and more will showcase their talents.
There are plenty of local cafes and food trucks to satisfy the needs of visitors. Come and enjoy the wonderful scenery with friends and pick up treasured unique and exquisite handmade items.

title: Amazing Animals Lego Session at Hunter Wetlands Centre
description:
Kids! Unleash your creativity at this special animal-themed LEGO® session!

In this 1 hour session  you'll be building frogs, geckos, spiders and other creative creatures using special mosaics, blocks and spinning plates. Staff from Bricks 4 Kidz will be at each session to supervise and assist with designs.

Your ticket includes entry to the Hunter Wetlands Centre's grounds so you can explore our wetland's trails, enjoy the playgrounds and join in other fun and informative nature-based activities such as dip-netting!

Suitable for kids 5 years and older.

title: Wednesday Pickers Bazaar
description:
An established mid week Trash and Treasure market. Come along and check out what Sydney has stored up and ready for sale. Grab a bargain and a bite to eat with them!

One man's trash is absolutely another man's treasure!

title: Camden Park House Spring Open Weekend
description:
Join a wonderful day out at Camden Park House and Garden on the annual Spring Open Weekend.

Designed by colonial architect John Verge and built for wool industry pioneers John and Elizabeth Macarthur, Camden Park is one of Australia's most important and intact Georgian houses. Immerse yourself in history while touring the heritage house and enjoy the beautiful colonial garden at its spring peak.

Guided historic house tours, garden tours, Devonshire teas, plant stalls, gift stalls, barbeque, live music, children's activities, heritage walks, and Macarthur family history talks, or just wander at leisure and picnic in the grounds, enjoying the beautiful surroundings.

Camden Park garden is one of Australia's most important gardens, established in the 1820s. It still has many rare botanical species and is a garden not to be missed!

Bookings essential. Ticket prices are to be confirmed.

title: Country Markets at Peppers Manor House
description:
Country Markets is the latest monthly market by the Eat. Shop. Love. team, held at the stunning Peppers Manor House on the last Saturday of every month.

This delightful event promises a wonderful experience filled with an exciting array of boutique retailers, delicious food, and live music! 

With space for picnics, bring your friends and family along for a perfect day out in the Southern Highlands.

title: Exeter Village Market
description:
A country market with a vibrant community of makers, producers and sellers in one of the most beautiful settings in the NSW Southern Highlands.

The market is relaxed and easy to stroll around while listening to live music. It's a great place for a picnic, and there is plenty of seating. 

There is plenty of onsite parking, directed by volunteers. Or you can park by the croquet court beside the market, or in the village. There is also dedicated accessible parking.

Exeter Village Market is owned by Exeter Village Association. ​

title: Melbourne Cup Long Lunch
description:
Come along for a day of refined elegance and impeccable style at the Royal Hotel in Bowral. Immerse yourself in a culinary delight as you savor a three-course sit-down lunch featuring fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Elevate your experience with a flute of the exquisite Louis Roederer champagne upon arrival.

Be entertained by the soulful melodies of the saxophonist and the vibrant beats of the DJ as you watch the live broadcast of the Melbourne Cup. Celebrate this iconic racing event in style while contributing to a worthy cause, as a portion of the proceeds will be donated to the Southern Highlands Wildlife Rescue.

To add an extra touch of excitement, participate in the sweeps and Fashion on the Field competition for the chance to win a variety of coveted prizes.

Not ready for a full three-course meal? Come for the festivities and enjoy a flute of champagne on arrival and a delicious mezze plate, all included in the ticket price.

Don't miss this unforgettable Melbourne Cup Long Lunch event at your favourite highlands venue, The Royal Hotel in Bowral.

title: Bowral Classic
description:
Since the inaugural event in 2016, the Bowral Classic has become a staple fixture in the road cycling calendar. 

Set against the stunning backdrop of NSW's Southern Highlands, the Bowral Classic showcases some of the most beautiful scenery you can experience on two wheels. Riders will start from the iconic Bong Bong St Start Line in Bowral before winding through the country roads and rolling hills of the Southern Highlands' most iconic towns including Berrima, Moss Vale, Bundanoon, Robertson and Mittagong.

Grab your mates, book your accommodation and get ready for the ultimate Gran Fondo experience!

title: Red Dirt Hymns
description:
A hymnal to the country under our feet.

A living songbook more than four years in the making, Andrew Ford's hymnal brings together the words of sixteen contemporary Australian writers – poets, essayists, and folksingers. Born in a time of fire and darkness, grief, and loss, and then fragile, tender hope,  Red Dirt Hymns are songs of awe and praise, dedicated not to a god, but to the land. 

 Red Dirt Hymns is performed by the ever-daring voices of Luminescence Chamber Singers alongside two rising stars: Hilary Geddes (electric guitar), 2021 Freedman Jazz Fellow and lead guitarist of Triple J favourites The Buoys, and category-defying cellist Freya Schack-Arnott. Songs that span art music, folk song, country ballad, and Aussie rock unfold to the evocative imagery of Sammy Hawker, whose art is created within the fabric of country itself: saltwater, limestone and eucalypt.

From Ellen van Neerven's dark clouds to John Kinsella's abundant gardens, Red Dirt Hymns does what a hymnal is meant to do: it draws us closer to each other, and to the light and shade of our wide brown land.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Wentworthville
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Wentworthville
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.'

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Bowral
description:
In 2021, Andrew Hamilton spent four months in two of Sydney’s maximum-security prisons for the commercial supply of psychedelic drugs. While incarcerated, Andrew began noticing the transformative power of laughter. After all, if a joke can make you forget you’re in prison, what else can it do? 

Upon his release, Andrew took up stand-up comedy, initially under strict bail conditions where his parents had to come with him to shows, and he had to be home in time for curfew. 

A year later, Andrew performed his debut solo show ‘Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison’, at the 2023 Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Andrew’s show garnered him critical acclaim, along with a nomination for Best Newcomer.

title: Lake Macquarie Christmas Twilight Market
description: This annual event held on the picturesque Warners Bay Foreshore is a great chance to do your last minute christmas shopping. Come along and enjoy the children's amusements, specialty vendors and fabulous street food.

title: Mittagong Markets
description:
Mittagong Markets are an outdoor market with approximately 60-70 stalls.

The stalls have an amazing variety of unique gifts, local products and plants, along with food vendors.

It is a friendly, local and affordable country market.

title: Tulip Time Festival
description:
Tulip Time is one of Australia's oldest and best-loved floral festivals, attracting tens of thousands of visitors. Corbett Gardens, the centrepiece of the Festival, is mass-planted with over 75,000 tulip bulbs and 15,000 annuals, in a spectacular Springtime display. Additionally, there are another 30,000 tulips planted across the shire to create a picturesque vista.

Overall, it is a celebration of stunning tulip displays, entertainment, special events and premier private gardens. There's something on offer for both the young and the young at heart!

Tickets for Tulip Time 2025 will be available online from mid year.

title: Storytime in the Bush with John Williamson
description:
Join acclaimed Australian singer, songwriter and author, John Williamson, as he visits the Wild Koala Breeding Visitor Centre.

John will do a reading of his new book, Koala Koala, and sign copies! You can book your free ticket and pre-order your copy of Koala Koala now.

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Bowral
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  

Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   

It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Parkrun at Australian Botanic Gardens
description: Parkrun is a free, weekly, community event where participants can walk, jog, run, volunteer, or spectate in a five kilometre course through the scenic garden trail at the Australian Botanic Gardens - Mount Annan.

title: Christmas In Winter
description:
Visit the Southern Highlands for that Winter Christmas experience you've been imagining.

With a variety of different venues and dates to choose from across July, you'll love every minute.

Enjoy roasted turkeys, mulled wine, and lots of other treats.

You never know, there might even be a visit from the BIG MAN himself.

Note that the address in this listing is our Visitor Information Centre and not actually the location of one of these great Christmas in Winter Celebrations, which are being held at various venues across the Southern Highlands. Use the website to see where and when you will find Christmas in Winter celebrations across the Southern Highlands this year.

title: Crafting with Nature: Secret Sculptures Workshop at Mount Annan
description:
Explore the magic of nature this Winter with this imaginative nature craft workshop in the Australian Botanic Garden!

This program invites children to stop, listen, and expand their imaginations in nature.

The experienced Guides will get the children looking down and around at the tiny, magical worlds hidden deep within the Garden. What can they see? See mushrooms that look like fairy homes, little bugs in the leaf litter, shapes and patterns in the soil. What can they imagine? Let's imagine together!

After exploring together, craft a tiny sculpture from earthenware clay and collect nature treasures. These miniature sculptures are designed to be taken and hidden in some secret place in nature. A special secret only you know about, which you can go back and visit again and again!

title: Bottlebutt Bash Trail Run
description:
The BottleButt Bash Trail Run in 2026 gives you four different distances to experience this beautiful area. It has a distance for all abilities.​​ 

This year, they have more fun in the forest with the 'Bottlebutt Bash Marathon'. Two laps of the magical 21.1 kilometres.​

The 'Bottlebutt Bash' is a 21-kilometre bash through the magical Burrawan State Forest. Through stunning tracks and trails with lots of hidden secrets and one of these is the 'Old BottleButt' Tree.
​
'Old Bottlebutt', a grand and ancient Red Bloodwood (Corymbia gummifera) tree located in Burrawan State Forest. Old Bottlebutt is unique in its shape - its large flared 'butt' having a massive girth of more than 16 metres just above its base. At over 200 years old, Old Bottlebutt is a towering and unique attraction.

They are offering a distance for the new trail runner, to the trail runner that just wants to race or challenge themselves on the trails.

Train hard and stay focused and the reward at the end is pure pleasure.

title: John Waters presents Radio Luxembourg - Warners Bay
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: Impact Festival
description:
Step into the spotlight at Impact Dance Festival!

Are you an emerging dancer or choreographer aged 12-25? The Impact Dance Festival in Lake Macquarie is your chance to showcase your talent, connect with industry professionals, and grow your career. This is your opportunity to perform, learn, and network in a vibrant, creative community.

Apply for grants to present your choreography on stage! The festival offers funding and resources to bring your artistic vision to life.

Participate in daily workshops led by professional artists. Improve your skills in choreography, technique, and professional development.

Meet experienced choreographers, fellow artists, and industry leaders. Build valuable connections that could open doors to future opportunities.

Festival Schedule:
Workshops: Hands-on sessions to develop your craft.
Performances: Experience exciting performances by emerging and professional artists.
Networking Events: Connect with peers and mentors in a collaborative atmosphere.
Residency: Apply for grants to showcase your work 

Located between Sydney, Newcastle, and the Central Coast, Lake Macquarie offers a stunning setting with a growing arts community. Perform in unique venues like Warners Bay Theatre and outdoor spaces along the foreshore.

Don't miss this chance to grow as an artist, gain industry exposure, and be part of a thriving dance community. Apply now and make your mark at the Impact Dance Festival!
host: Canvas Events PR Marketing Co Pty Ltd

title: AgriShow Farm Field Day
description:
More than a line-up of products for sale, the AgriShow Farm Field Day is a space for people involved in all aspects of farming to get together in a community atmosphere.

The event features education and demonstrations of farming machinery, tools, equipment and supplies from tractors and other vehicles, to equipment and technology.

title: Warners Bay Markets
description:
Warners Bay Markets are held on the third Saturday of every month.

With a fabulous array of stallholders, selling everything from homewares, fashion, pet supplies, plants and street food.

Take in the scenic backdrop of Lake Macquarie whilst you browse.

Pet and child friendly.

title: Manhattan Short Film Festival | Lake Macquarie
description:
Over 100,000 film lovers in more than 500 cities across six continents gather to view and vote on Films in the 28th Manhattan Short Film Fest.

Ten short films are selected from entries from around the world and will be screened in over 500 venues across six continents during one week. Audiences at each venue are handed a voting card and asked to vote for the one film they think is best. Votes are sent through to Manhattan Short HQ and the winner is announced the following day. 

Every Film Selected for Manhattan Short 2025 will be Automatically Qualified for the Oscars of 2026.

title: Aussie Night Markets Menangle
description:
Aussie Night Markets Menangle offers a unique open-air market atmosphere full of gourmet food, fun and family. Located at Australia's longest-running harness racing venue, Club Menangle.

Gorge yourself at the international food market, teaming with over 40 international street food vendors. Feed your sweet tooth at the dessert section and browse the arts and crafts from local and regional sellers, plus there are plenty of kids' rides and entertainment.

title: Southern Highlands 7's
description:
Since its humble beginnings in 2012, this tournament has grown rapidly and is now one of the largest domestic 7s tournaments in Australia, hosting around 70 teams from clubs in regional NSW, Sydney and the ACT. 

The Southern Highlands 7s is an investment in the future, with a focus on developing junior boys and girls age groups (Under 13's, Under 15's and Under 17's), senior women's rugby, as well as the traditional Colts (Under 20) and senior men's competitions. 

The Southern Highlands 7s is an event created for the enjoyment of the whole family and they hope to see you again this year!

title: Campbelltown ParkRun
description:
Campbelltown Parkrun is a free weekly five kilometre timed run. Registration is essential before you can participate. Once you have registered online just bring a printed copy of your barcode so you can receive a time for your run.

Campbelltown Parkrun is a very popular event. Many run for fitness, to beat a personal best or just for their own enjoyment. Parkrun is for all levels of fitness, everyone runs at their own pace. Afterwards, join your newfound friends for a coffee at a local café.

Please keep up to date via the Campbelltown ParkRun Facebook page for up to date information regarding COVID-19 Restrictions.

title: Choirboys - Run To Paradise - The Stories of Australian Rock N’ Roll - Taree
description:
As young twenty-something-year-olds, Choirboys formed in 1978, growing up on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The wild, hedonistic lifestyle the band witnessed of the youth in the 70s is ultimately what gave birth to their seminal rock anthem, Run To Paradise. It’s all about the stories that sound all too familiar within the culture widely assumed of the music industry - “sex, drugs, and rock ‘n’ roll” and they tell it all.

Run To Paradise is a “spilling of the beans” of sorts. It’s part story, part song that chronicles through some of the wildest, most risqué, outrageous, and downright hilarious stories of Australian Rock. All, as these Oz pub-rock icons recall it.

And behind the narrative are the classic songs that define the musical landscape of rock music in the ’70s and 80s, including Deep Purple’s “Smoke On The Water”, Chuck Berry’s ‘Never Can Tell’, TMG’s ‘Jump In My Car’, Dragon’s ‘Are You Old Enough’, AC/DC’s ‘Long Way To The Top’ and of course the Choirboys hits ‘Boys will Be Boys’ ‘Never Gonna Die’ ‘Struggletown’ and the pub-rock anthem ‘Run to Paradise’, to name a few.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Taree
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: Taylor and the Besties – Kids Tribute Concert
description:
Get ready for the ultimate school holiday tribute show! Sing, dance, and party to the biggest hits from Taylor Swift, Ariana Grande, Katy Perry, Dua Lipa, Lizzo, and more. Join Taylor and the Besties live on stage for a fun-packed morning of music and entertainment.

You will be singing and dancing along to hits such as, We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together, Shake It Off, Love Story, Dance the Night Away, Roar, Firework, Thank You Next, It's About Damn Time, Levitating and more.

title: Garden of Earthly Delights - Bundanoon
International Dog Day
description:
Calling all dogs, hounds, pups, mutts, doggos and pooches to celebrate International Dog Day with their humans at Retford Park.

In celebration James Fairfax's adoration of his dogs, you and your furry friends are invited to join the festivities at historic Retford Park.

Activities include free gardens tours for dogs and their humans, competitions, an agility course and demonstrations.

Browse a range of stalls selling a variety of dog-related goodies and services.

title: Love Lanes Festival
description:
Explore hidden gems and discover forgotten laneways!

Love Lanes Festival is back for its eighth year! This annual event will be held in Wyong connecting us all to Valentine’s Day.

The evening festival showcases Wyong in its best light with four lanes, four stages and one park, all coming to life with entertainment.  

Guests can enjoy the sounds, colours, smells, and the hype and vibe of an outdoor community street festival encompassing the theme of ‘Love’.

Expect to see live music, roving entertainment, food and market stalls, a kid's zone, a circus precinct and more!

title: Bundanoon Markets
description:
Bundanoon Market is a fabulously friendly local market alternately held in the grounds and hall of Bundanoon Public School and in the Soldiers Memorial Hall. The market is crammed with arts, crafts and music, fresh local produce, breads, eggs and honey, plus a glorious selection of homemade cakes, jams, chutneys and sauces. 

The delicious food stalls serve up fare with an international flavour, including a range of ready-made take-home meals, and of course, there is a coffee van for your morning caffeine hit.

A market for the craftsmith! Sewers, knitters, woodworkers, photographers, leatherwork and silver jewellery, plus all you need for meals during the week. Fresh fruit and vegetables, freshly baked bread, Lebanese take-home meals, hot Indian dishes, Japanese pancakes, honey and eggs, plus a delicious assortment of cakes, pies and beautiful melting moments. Well worth the scenic drive – You will always find something new. 

Bundanoon makers market is held on the first and third Sunday of the Month. (No January market)

1st Sunday market held at the Bundanoon Primary School
3rd Sunday market held at the Bundanoon Soldiers Memorial Hall

title: Bundanoon Folk Festival
description:
The Bundanoon Folk Festival is the newest addition to the Australian Folk calendar. Held in Bundanoon in the scenic Southern Highlands of NSW, the Festival enjoys the backdrop of a country village near the magnificent Morton National Park.  

The Bundanoon Folk Festival is a vibrant weekend of live folk music, dance and poetry in seven indoor venues plus a marquee in beautiful Bundanoon.  

Embedded in the local community the festival features local and regional artists as well as much-loved national performers.  

The festival celebrates the broad sweep of contemporary and traditional music styles, which are handed down through generations of all cultures. Some of the hottest independent artists including Folk Australia Awardees.  Plus pub sessions, jams, Kidsfest and Folk Rave. Folk music is for everyone.

title: Cabramatta Moon Festival 2025
description: Cabramatta Moon Festival is one of the largest and brightest Southeast Asian cultural celebrations in Australia, which includes a huge line-up of performances, family friendly roving entertainment and delicious food capped off with a spectacular fireworks display.

title: Osborn House Fire Feast
description:
Experience the age-old South American tradition of live fire cooking at Osborn House Fire Feast in the heart of the Southern Highlands. Their talented chefs will ignite the flames of their extraordinary Asado, guiding you on an unforgettable open-fire feast journey.

With their iron dome, planchas, and infiernillo, they'll transport you on a culinary adventure, unlike anything in Australia.

Get ready to savour the extraordinary!

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Newcastle
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Burramatta NAIDOC
description:
Join Burramatta NAIDOC in Parramatta Park, a free outdoor festival with an incredible concert line up featuring Becca Hatch and Velvet Trip. Explore colourful market stalls, grab something tasty to eat and get involved with a range of hands-on cultural workshops.

Don't miss RnB powerhouse Becca Hatch, the psychedelic rock brilliance of Velvet Trip, soulful sounds from Kee'ahn and the acoustic bliss of John James on the Next Generation Concert Stage presented by Optus and the KARI Foundation.

Explore the market stalls at Burramatta NAIDOC, where you'll find everything from vibrant beach towels and adorable baby clothes to stunning jewellery, one-of-a-kind artwork and special keepsakes.

Immerse yourself in hands-on workshops led by artists and cultural practitioners, where you can explore weaving, art, traditional dance and more.

Enjoy family activities like traditional spear throwing presented by Optus and the KARI Foundation or test your kicking and handball skills at the AFL Skill Zone.

Grab something tasty to eat or a hot drink while you soak up the atmosphere.

title: Group B match (B4 v B2) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Group C match (C3 v C4) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Group B match (B1 v B2) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025). 
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Group B match (B1 v B4) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025). 
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Group B match (B2 v B3) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Group B match (B3 v B1) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Nitro Circus: Off The Rails - Parramatta
description:
Nitro Circus is coming to Parramatta for one night only!
