Created by Travis Pastrana, the world leader in action sports entertainment, the electrifying show has already mesmerized audiences worldwide with adrenaline-pumping performances and jaw-dropping stunts in Costa Rica and Colombia.

Now the Nitro Circus “Off the Rails” World Tour kicks off in Australia from October. 

Debuting a 360 Stadium Show with a 15-metre Giganta ramp, cutting-edge FMX kickers, and immersive effects. Expect a thrilling ring of fire, explosions, insane contraptions plus a lighting, pyro and special effects spectacle, delivering nonstop action from every seat.
 
Athletes will push the limits with death-defying tricks, including BMX and Scooter star Ryan Williams (AUS) defying gravity and FMX sensation Jacko Strong (AUS) soaring upside down at incredible heights.

Non-stop action, explosive special effects this is the thrill of a lifetime! Where the Impossible Happens!

title: Regency Day Out – Talks, Picnic and Vintage Markets
description:
Celebrate Regency fashion with free talks, vintage clothing stalls, special collection item viewings, access to the Fashionable Silhouettes exhibition, and lawn games in the grounds of Old Government House.

You are cordially invited to come along for an enchanting Regency Day Out this spring.

Delight in captivating Regency fashion talks by Dress Historian, Dr Lorinda Cramer and Old Government House's Assistant Curator, Anna Ridley.

Step inside Old Government House for a special viewing of the delicate and rarely seen dresses made for Anna King (wife of Governor King) in 1805.

Reserve your place for a Curator's Tour of the Fashionable Silhouettes exhibition at 1pm (booking required).

Explore the vintage clothing markets, partake in lawn games, and don't forget to pack your own picnic to savor amidst the grounds of this historic location.

title: Midwinter Festival
description:
Midwinter Festival at Ngununggula is an annual winter community event featuring Burning Man, live music, art installations, building light installations and local food and wine marketing showcasing local offerings.

Now a popular annual event for all the family. Rug up, and come along to this eye opening event in Bowral.

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Liverpool
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Markets at The Whitlam
description:
Visit the market located at The Whitlam Leisure Centre in Sydney's cultural melting pot, Liverpool.

This market houses indoor stalls, so it is an all-weather, rain, hail or shine collection of stalls selling everything you can imagine.

Hobbies and crafts, antiques and collectables, fresh produce and ready-to-eat deliciousness for you to enjoy.

Grab your favourite market mate and come along for a look at what your local small business warriors have to offer.

title: The Simon & Garfunkel Story - Parramatta
description:
Performing to great acclaim and sell-out shows in over 50 countries around the world, The Simon & Garfunkel Story is a critically acclaimed concert experience about two young boys from Queens who went on to become the world's most successful music duo.

Featuring all their classic hits, including The Sound of Silence, Mrs Robinson, Bridge Over Troubled Water and Cecilia, The Simon & Garfunkel Story charts their rise to fame and success during an intense six-decade-long friendship.

The story is woven between the songs, with evocative video projections and images conjuring up the atmosphere of the turbulent times and brings to life the lyrics and melodies that helped to shape a generation and propel the duo to fame.

Moving and powerful, The Simon and Garfunkel Story is a must see and captivating show told with warmth and feeling.

title: The Enterprise Band
description:
Come along and sing and dance with this amazing Vietnamese Band - The Enterprise Band!

Free Entertainment on every Friday and Saturday night in The Auditorium.

title: Discover your history with Parramatta and District Historical Society
description: Parramatta and District Historical Society have a general meeting and evening of historical inquiry on the third Monday of the month, from February to November. Parking is available in the grounds and street. There will be a talk of approximately 45 minutes on a wide range of historical subjects, followed by the opportunity for discussions over a light supper.

title: Tuấn’s Party
description:
PYT Fairfield presents Tuấn's Party, a chaotic election night drama set against the backdrop of Kristina Kenneally's unsuccessful 2022 run.

Election Night, May 2022. Lettuce costs 11 dollars a head. Kate Bush's "Running Up that Hill' is having a surprise resurgence. Newlyweds Tuấn and Natalia are having their first guests in their new home in St John's Park since the pandemic – their childhood best friend Kevin, who's been putting in hours at Kristina Kenneally's campaign, and his new girlfriend Nadine. 

As the night goes on and local candidate Dai Le looks set to win the seat of Fowler from the Labor Party, tensions emerge, skeletons are revealed and the friendship of these four young people will be put to the test.

title: Cabramatta Lunar New Year Festival 2026
description:
Tradition and culture are celebrated with lion dancing performances and workshops, the God of Fortune, and traditional craft activities. 

Kids and families are entertained with various activities, games and amusement rides. If you’re feeling hungry, take your tastebuds on an adventure to Southeast Asia, where food lovers can enjoy the culinary delights of Cabramatta, with local restaurants serving up their signature dishes well into the evening.

title: The Hastings Bonsai Group
description: The Hastings Bonsai Group meet on the first Saturday of the month (Excluding January) at the Rotary Community Hall. They are keen to promote interest in the hobby of Bonsai in a friendly fun-filled day; maybe you have been into bonsai for many years and retired into the area or would just like to learn something new then they would love you to drop in and say hello.

title: Travelling Film Festival Newcastle
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Newcastle! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, Berlin and Sydney Film Festival at Event Cinemas Kotara.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island. 

Plus the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle, the A24 indie hit Sorry Baby, Cannes Grand Jury winner Sentimental Value and much more!

The festival weekend will also screen six more acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: Creative Studio: Engineering
description:
Discover how civil, electrical, chemical and computer engineering impact cities in a high-energy, hands-on workshop.

Each student will receive an Engineering Kit — packed with tools to bring bold ideas to life as they design and build a fully functioning city from the ground up. Students will consider everything from wiring circuits to power homes and technological innovations to withstand natural disasters as they learn to adapt to environmental challenges.

This three-day workshop for students aged 12–16 years, is a launch pad for those ready to think bigger, build smarter and collaborate with purpose to shape a more innovative and inclusive world.

Generously supported by the Sir William Tyree Foundation.

title: Carlingford Gem and Crystal Expo
description:
The event features two full days of showcasing jewellery, crystals, fossils, minerals, gemstones and curios. Traders from around Australia come together for this amazing expo which has now been operating annually for over 30 years.

Buy direct beautiful gemstones and have them set into your choice of jewellery. Meet an award-winning local jeweller and purchase something for yourself or a loved one.

Perhaps you might like a mineral or fossil for your collection or maybe even buy that special piece to decorate the home or office. Whether you're into collecting or crystal healing there's something for everyone.

The kids will love the "kids quiz" available where they can go on a voyage of discovery around the hall and even take home a prize for their efforts.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Hornsby
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: Macca Garage Cars and Coffee
description:
Bringing together a joint meet with Old Car Social Club and Old Skool Cars Aus!

With plenty of hot coffee and snacks available at the meet to warm you up and keep you energised.

Come join and bring along your pride and joy no matter if it's a 4Cyl, V6, V8 or even a Rotary.

Carpark entry/exit is low clearance vehicle entry friendly with a heap of parking for all to come and enjoy.

title: Nitro Circus: Off The Rails - Newcastle
description:
Nitro Circus is coming to Newcastle for one night only!

Created by Travis Pastrana, the world leader in action sports entertainment, the electrifying show has already mesmerized audiences worldwide with adrenaline-pumping performances and jaw-dropping stunts in Costa Rica and Colombia.

Now the Nitro Circus “Off the Rails” World Tour kicks off in Australia from October. 

Debuting a 360 Stadium Show with a 15-metre Giganta ramp, cutting-edge FMX kickers, and immersive effects. Expect a thrilling ring of fire, explosions, insane contraptions plus a lighting, pyro and special effects spectacle, delivering nonstop action from every seat.
 
Athletes will push the limits with death-defying tricks, including BMX and Scooter star Ryan Williams (AUS) defying gravity and FMX sensation Jacko Strong (AUS) soaring upside down at incredible heights.

Non-stop action, explosive special effects this is the thrill of a lifetime! Where the Impossible Happens!
 
Head to the website for all information.

title: NRLW Magic Round
description:
NRLW Magic Round heads to McDonald ​Jones Stadium.

Your only chance this season to see every NRLW game of the round in person over one exciting weekend of footy and fun for the whole family.  ​

One round. One ground. All teams. ​​

That's magic!

title: Whitlam Prime Ministerial Home Heritage Tour
description:
The Whitlam Institute is pleased to open the Whitlam Prime Ministerial Home at 32 Albert Street, Cabramatta for public tours.

This 30-minute tour will include a talk from an expert guide followed by a self-guided walk through the Whitlam Prime Ministerial Home. Bookings are essential.

Gough Whitlam's home was intrinsically linked to his political life. As the Member of the Australian Parliament for Werriwa from 1952 to 1978, the home served as the backdrop to his service – constituents, seen approaching through the kitchen window as they walked up the driveway, were invited into the living or dining rooms to talk about their matters of concern. The home was a frequent host to political functions, celebrations of electoral victories, and sombre reflections on losses.  

The Whitlam Institute and Western Sydney University have been fortunate to get the opportunity to preserve and restore the home, and we are proud to be able to share this vital part of our national heritage with the public.

Architect : Roy H.D. Appleton
Master Builder : Harry G. Richardson
Built : 1957

title: Hornsby Twilight Market
description:
Join them for a night of great food and music at the Twilight Markets in Hornsby Mall. They are excited to invite you to a lively night out featuring live music, delicious food stalls, and more every second Saturday until December. 

Explore a variety of mouth-watering international food experiences while musicians keep you entertained.

Supported by Hornsby Shire Council, Organic Food Markets, and Hornsby Chamber of Commerce.

title: Hockey Australia Men's Masters Championships
description:
The Hockey Australia Men's Masters Championships will take place at the Newcastle International Hockey Centre in New South Wales. This national event will showcase the skill, passion, and enduring spirit of Masters hockey, with teams from across the country competing across a wide range of age divisions.

Hockey Australia gratefully acknowledges the generous support of the City of Newcastle.

title: Comic Book Day
description:
Comic Book Day will return in 2025, watch this space for more info on the date and festivities to be enjoyed by all!

Comic Book Day is returning to HJ Daley Library on May the Fourth. This is an all ages, family friendly event to celebrate graphic novels, comics and superheroes.  Come and dress up as your favourite character and join in the fun! 

Check out the full schedule of last year's events by visiting the website. 2025 schedule to be advised.

title: Hornsby Food Markets
description:
Welcome to Hornsby Food Markets!

Nestled in the heart of Hornsby, the Hornsby Food Markets are a vibrant hub where food lovers, families, and the local community come together to experience the best of fresh, quality produce. With a wide variety of stalls offering everything from locally grown fruits and vegetables to gourmet treats, specialty foods, and artisanal products, there's something to satisfy every palate.

At Hornsby Food Markets, they pride themselves on providing a diverse range of products, including organic produce, fresh-baked goods, local cheeses, cakes, and much more. Whether you're stocking up on essentials or exploring new flavours, you'll find that every visit is an opportunity to support local farmers, small businesses, and sustainable practices.

Come enjoy the sights, sounds, and tastes of the market, all while connecting with the wonderful people who make it all happen. Bring your friends, family, and your appetite—Hornsby Food Markets are the perfect place to shop, taste, and experience the best the community has to offer!

title: GLOW Fest: A Circus Arts & Lifestyle Gathering
description:
From Thursday to Sunday, the GLOW Fest program brims with arts, flow, circus and community connection. With over 100 activities from beginner to expert, plus a dedicated kids program, there's something for absolutely everyone.

Just some of the program highlights… Opening night LED jam - BYO toys! Feature Fire Performance and fire-spinning circles. Headliner Showcase plus movement and music jam space, including drum circle. Interactive art experiences and Renegade Show. As well as Sunday Funday including a pool party and giant water slide!

The new venue, Falls Forest Retreat in Johns River, is nestled about an hour inland from the previous host Waves Campground. It is a wildlife conservation area teeming with natural flora and fauna, and luscious grass areas for camping and activities.

More than just a flow festival, GLOW Fest's program is a true arts experience. Workshops go deeper than your average festival, expanding from flow and circus arts to professional development, performance skills, live art and visual arts and crafts.

Their point of difference sees great ticket value in return for one 2-hour volunteer shift from each attendee - promoting a sense of community and collaboration in creating this wonderful space. Guests that prefer to relax and take time out can purchase a Play Pass to surpass this requirement.

GLOW Fest is a drug and alcohol-free event.

title: Chill Fest
description:
Campbelltown's much loved Chill Fest is back, and Koshigaya Park will come alive with the magic of winter these July school holidays.

Come along for lots of fun activities and entertainment for the whole family. Including amusement rides, an open-air ice skating rink, light shows, marshmallow toasting and plenty of food trucks. Plus Alpine Winter Markets, roving performers, open fires, realistic snow fall and so much more.

title: Morning Melodies at The Cube
description:
Morning Melodies is a morning of sensational musical entertainment at The Cube Convention and Entertainment Centre. 

Once every two months, audience members will sing and bop along to a variety of exciting and energetic performers while enjoying a delicious morning tea. 

Head to The Cube's website for the latest line-up of performers, more information and to purchase tickets.

This show is not designed for children.

title: Campbelltown Camden District Band
description:
This July, the Campbelltown Camden District Band is excited to host the Long Island Youth Orchestra as part of their Australian Tour. 

They will be joined by the South West Sydney Orchestras for a unique and unforgettable performance at the Cube. Continuing our long-standing tradition of fostering musical talent among the youth in the greater Macarthur area, this concert promises to be a highlight of the season. 

Be sure to mark your calendars for an evening filled with the incredible sounds of three outstanding ensembles, all performing together for one night only.

title: The Ultimate Magic Show with Jonas Jost
description:
The best entertainment these School Holidays!

Back by popular demand these winter school holidays, this action-packed show features hilarious comedy and mind-blowing magic for kids and adults alike. With lots of fun audience participation and interaction, this magic show is an event not to be missed!

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Campbelltown
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Collector Con - Toy and Hobby Fair
description:
Collector Con Campbelltown returns with a treasure trove of toys, hobbies, and pop culture delights!

Discover a wide array of items, including action figures, trading cards, die-cast cars, and comics. Delve into the realms of Star Wars, MOTU, Marvel, DC, Transformers, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Funko POPS, LEGO, Living Dead Dolls, and so much more! Engage in exciting activities like crafting your own LEGO minifig or participating in a fantasy/superhero photoshoot.

Don't hesitate to embrace your inner fan by donning your favorite Cosplay attire!

title: Trails and Tails - Coopernook HQ
description:
You know dogs are man's best friend, and they hate missing out on jumping in the car and heading to a new place to sniff and explore with their best friend on the trails. So join a race where you can bring them along to the beautiful Forest Headquarters, just north of Coopernook (between Taree and Kew). 

Caravans and campervans are welcome, but please note that Coopernook HQ is unpowered and does not offer a dump station.

​​This is a seven-kilometre course around the beautiful Coopernook State Forest on the doorstep of the Coopernook village. The course is filled with lots of hidden secrets for you to find and have fun with. 

​This may be your first official trail run with your dog or you may be old pros at trail racing together. 

You have options either 21.1 kilometres, 14 kilometres, 7 kilometres or a short option for beginners four kilometres.

 If you are just starting out in trail running or an ultra runner, this course caters for all levels and skills. You can walk the picturesque course or you can run or even race it. 

Your best friends have tons of energy, but it can be a new experience consistently running alongside you in a race endurance format, so pick a race that is suited to your dog's fitness level.

title: 45th Annual Gem Show and Exhibition
description:
The Annual Gem, Mineral and Jewellery Exhibition if celebrating it's 45th year with two fun-filled days of crystals, gems, jewellery, minerals, and more!

Campbelltown and District's Lapidary Club has stalls selling jewellery from opal all the way to agates and tumbled stones!

Don't miss out on this fantastic exhibition opportunity at the Greg Percival Community Centre. Come and join along.

title: in every room
description:
Campbelltown Arts Centre presents 'in every room', an exhibition of new commissions and existing works by leading contemporary artists from around Australia. 

Featuring artists: Lara Chamas, Jagath Dheerasekara, Kuba Dorabialski, Roberta Joy Rich, Sancintya Mohini Simpson and Curtis Taylor.

title: Roger Knox: ‘Buluunarbi and The Old North Star’ Album Launch
description: Campbelltown Arts Centre and Tharawal Aboriginal Corporation are excited to partner to present 'Roger Knox: Buluunarbi and The Old North Star' Album Launch, providing a memorable cultural event for Community during NAIDOC Week.

title: Learn Your History Saturday: Parramatta and District Historical Society
description:
Come along to hear guest speakers give illustrated talks on Family History subjects. The exploration of your family history through internet, journals and reference folios are available at the Society headquarters. 

If you are looking to research your family history, come to the Saturday meeting where Society members will guide you. Meet on the first Saturday of the month from February to November.

Hambledon Cottage museum s also open on the day and the guided tour offers you a unique opportunity to experience life style of the 19th century.

title: How to find your Family History: Hambledon Cottage House Museum
description:
The Family History Group of the membership holds a meeting on the first Saturday of the months February to November in Hambledon Cottage Coach House. Afternoon tea is provided, admittance by gold coin and everyone is welcome.

Parramatta and District Historical Society supports a programme of guest speakers delivering illustrated talks on a wide range of subjects.

Family History research is conducted on Tuesday in Hambledon Cottage Coach House where a team of volunteers use the library of local history.

title: Glenalvon House Open Days
description:
History lovers will be able to catch a glimpse of everyday life in a bygone era when the beautiful Glenalvon House in the historic Macarthur region opens its doors to the public for free entry on the first and third Saturday of the month (February to December). 

Glenalvon House was built in 1841 and is described by the National Trust as 'an exceptional two-storied sandstone home of colonial Georgian design'.

The furnished two-storey colonial house provides a glimpse into Campbelltown's days early in the 19th century. 

Twelve rooms are open to the public, including the drawing room, the library, the nursery, and the children's bedroom. An agricultural exhibition featuring the actual tools from colonial times is also located on the site.

Glenalvon also features a period garden, a sandstone coachhouse house and heritage stables. The property is home to the Campbelltown and Airds Historical Society.

title: Mayfield Day
description:
Head over to Dangar Park for the fourth annual Mayfield Day.

Mayfield Business Improvement Association is excited to present the next Mayfield Day following the incredible 2024 event, reaching record-breaking numbers for this beloved Mayfield event. Best of all, this event is free for everyone to enjoy and a great way to stroll, snack and shop your way throughout the day whilst supporting local businesses.
 
Come along for a lineup of amazing stalls from community groups, street food trucks, variety of market stalls, local business pop-ups, free face painting, kids workshops and activities, special performances, live music, and a pet-friendly environment.

Celebrate the Mayfield community and enjoy the best this fabulous suburb has to offer with family and friends.

Hope to see you there for a fantastic day.

title: Rock and Roll School Holiday Supershow
description:
Rock And Roll Wrestling Australia Returns with their Family-Friendly Show this July Holidays in Campbelltown!

Rock and Roll Wrestling Australia is rolling into town, bringing the energy, excitement, and epic showdowns the whole family will love!

This all-ages, family-friendly event is packed with non-stop action, jaw-dropping moves, and larger-than-life personalities. Whether you're a die-hard wrestling fan or just looking for an unforgettable night out, this is the event for you.

Don't miss out on an evening of spectacular matches featuring some of Australia's most exciting wrestling talent. It's safe, it's fun, and it's built for fans of all ages—from kids to lifelong wrestling diehards.

Tickets are expected to sell fast, so secure your spot ringside and be part of the act.

title: Born Jovi Live
description: The idea was to recreate a Bon Jovi concert, not just a Bon Jovi "show" but, rather, an experience that encapsulated every magic moment that has lingered from the extraordinary career of this unique band. The cast were chosen and we worked tirelessly rehearsing, based on every piece of audio and visual history that would give us a glimpse into the magic of this legendary rock band in order for us to recreate it….. and the rest, as they say, is history! Spanning almost 25 years now!

title: Bicycle Education Centre Free Open Days
description:
Gear up for a wheelie good time!

Bring your bicycle, scooter and of course, your helmet! The Campbelltown Bicycle Education have free open days every Sunday plus during NSW School Holidays, Monday to Friday.

These are great days for some family fun. Pack a picnic lunch or use the powered barbeque facilities.

To ensure everyone can have fun and be bicycle safe there are some rules to follow. Head to the website for more information.

title: Anh Do - Casula
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry, and was described by Russell Crowe as 'the most surprising and inspiring read I have had in years.'

Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real-life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves an audience uplifted and quite simply experiencing… happiness.

title: Female Orphan School Heritage Tour
description:
Guided heritage tour of Australia's oldest three-storey building - the Female Orphan School.

Built in 1813 with the intention of providing shelter for the colony's young girls away from the hardships of Sydney Town, this historic site later transformed into the Rydalmere Psychiatric Hospital before falling into disrepair and neglect. Covered in graffiti and seemingly forgotten, the future of the building was uncertain until restoration efforts commenced in 2000.

Now, painstakingly restored to its former glory, it serves as the proud home of the Whitlam Institute. In addition to guided tours, visitors can explore two galleries: the Permanent Exhibition on the Whitlam Government and the Margaret Whitlam Gallery.

Built: 1813
Architect: Overseen by Lachlan Macquarie, with initial revisions and additions by Francis Greenway
Awards: UNESCO Award for Culture Heritage Conservation 2004

title: Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero - Newcastle
description:
The celebration of the century comes alive in Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero. 

Audiences will be a part of the magic of Disney as they join Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse and friends from around the Disney Kingdom on a journey through timeless tales with Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero. 

Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck and Goofy set the stage for an adventure filled with tales of heroism from your favorite Disney stories in Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero. 

Join Mirabel as she sets out to save her family's beloved Casita, all while learning that everyone has their own gifts, magical or not, and being true to yourself and loving those around you is what makes you special. See how far Moana will go when she embarks on an action-packed voyage with mighty demigod Maui in a quest to save her island, become a wayfinder. Journey alongside Anna and Elsa and the hilarious snowman, Olaf, on their quest to protect the kingdom. Dive "Under The Sea" and test the power of true love with The Little Mermaid. Get tangled with Rapunzel as she dares to explore the world outside her own. And be there as Belle boldly tames the fearsome Beast. 

Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero an experience the whole family will treasure forever!

title: Newcastle Caravan Lifestyle Expo
description:
Newcastle Caravan Lifestyle Expo is on for three big days, with over 150 exhibitors, this is the ultimate way to check out what caravan and camping is all about.

The Newcastle Expo showcases the latest in caravans, motorhomes, campervans, camper trailers, tents, caravan and camping equipment, touring accessories and caravan and holiday parks all in one great location.
 
It’s the perfect place to compare and discuss all aspects of the caravan and camping industry, gear up for your next adventure and speak to the expert exhibitors who are on hand to provide you with all the information you will need to get you on the road.
 
There’s so many reasons to come along.

title: Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero - Broadmeadow
description:
Discover the hero inside us all when Disney On Ice returns with the magical adventures of favorite Disney stars brought to life like never before.

Step inside the music and magic of Encanto with Mirabel and her family as they learn that everyone has a special gift. Sail away with Moana and Maui on their brave journey across the ocean to return the heart of Te Fiti. Join Anna and Elsa on their quest to protect their kingdom.

Be inspired by the Disney Princesses with stories of courage, determination and kindness as you swim under the sea with Ariel, explore an enchanted castle with Belle, and belt out your dreams with Rapunzel.

Hosted by Mickey and Minnie, experience world-class ice skating, iconic music, and stunning costumes that will make Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero an experience the whole family will treasure forever.

title: Anzac Day in Campbelltown
description:
Anzac Day is a day of national remembrance that marks the anniversary of the first major military action fought by Australian and New Zealand forces during the First World War.

All are welcome to join as Campbelltown commemorates the service and supreme sacrifice of Australian servicemen and servicewomen who have represented the nation in conflicts in Australasia and around the world on Anzac Day.

Campbelltown RSL's dawn service begins at 5:30am at the War Memorial in Mawson Park. 
The Anzac Day Veteran's March begins at 8:30am heading northbound along Queen Street and finishes at Mawson park.  A commemorative ceremony will happen at 9am at the War Memorial in Mawson Park. 

We Will Remember Them. Lest We Forget.

title: History Kids – The Hunt for Clues at Elizabeth Farm
description:
These school holidays, step into the past and become a history detective at Elizabeth Farm!

Dress up and go undercover as you search for clues to solve a puzzle at the house. Along the way, you'll uncover fascinating stories about Elizabeth Farm, the lives of the Macarthur family, and the Barramadagal people, the traditional custodians of this land.

Get hands-on with fun activities, explore the house in a whole new way, and complete your adventure with a refreshing drink and treat.

Are you ready to crack the case?

title: Hunter Emerging Art Prize (HEAP)
description:
The Hunter Emerging Art Prize is the leading art prize for emerging artists in the Hunter, with a prize pool of more than AUD10,000 across a range of media. This exhibition features work by the next generation of creatives across the local government areas of Cessnock, Dungog, Lake Macquarie, Mid Coast, Maitland, Muswellbrook, Newcastle, Port Stephens, Singleton, and the Upper Hunter.

The exhibition is supported by the following Silver Sponsors
Maclean's Booksellers 
Pettigrew   
Wilton Lemke Stewart 
This is Not Art

And Sections Sponsors:
Sculptures at Scratchley 
Stevens Conveyancing
This is Not Art 
Moir Studio 
The Clay Room 
and The Squires Family in memory of Jody Robinson.

title: Handmade and Homegrown - Campbelltown
description:
Join Eat. Shop. Love. for a  Produce, Artisan and Boutique Retail Market in Lithgow St Campbelltown. 

The Handmade and Homegrown Market runs on the third Sunday of the month and brings together fantastic locally-ran businesses, high quality handmade products, upcycled and refurbished items, and more! Celebrate and enjoy the amazing produce that this region has to offer as well as unique handmade goods produced by local artisans!

Grab some goodies from one of the market stalls and then enjoy a coffee or morning tea in the courtyard of historic Glenalvon House with your family while listening to some live music!

title: Soundtracks by Dungeon Big Band - Newcastle Music Festival
description:
Soundtracks – the Dungeon Big Band brings the great themes of film, TV, musicals to the Newcastle Music Festival 2025. Featuring themes from Dragnet, Batman, Pink Panther, Mike Hammer, The Incredibles…and much more. Great authentic sounds from this 17-piece big band with Heather Price on vocals.

The Dungeon Big Band is an agglomeration of 17 amazing musicians, who find their raison d'être in the power of the big band.

Since her teen years Heather Price has performed as both bass player and singer in various contemporary Australian acts, including Cotton Sidewalk, The Good, and On Inc. as well as many jazz acts with Rod Barnes. 

Experience Heather's soaring vocals with lush chords and harmonious double bass lines, as she pays homage to the many great sound tracks of favourite movies.

Image credits: Band: Photolook Newcastle
Heather Price: Alex Jack Photography

title: Rising Stars Recital - Newcastle Music Festival
description: The innovative Newcastle Music Festival Rising Stars program continues in 2025. The program encourages and supports outstanding younger performers in the region (Newcastle/Hunter Regions/Central Coast) with a paid performance opportunity in a nationally acclaimed music festival. Pianists, singers, violinists and more - with supporting artist Erin Sweetman on piano - hear the superstars of tomorrow today!

title: Senior Socials
description: Hosted by Geoff Jones, Senior Socials is a musical morning featuring all of your favourite's tunes, as well as a delicious morning tea. Special guest entertainers in June will be Donna Campbell and Tony Mazell!

title: Zepplin: The Life & Times of Led Zeppelin - Gosford
description:
Zepplin brings to life the electrifying music and legendary stories of one of rock’s greatest bands. In a two-hour concert production, Zepplin delivers over 26 iconic songs, narrated stories, and rare archival footage, creating an immersive journey through Led Zeppelin’s rise to fame.

With a lineup of internationally acclaimed musicians, Zepplin captures the raw energy, intensity, and passion of the original band. Jesse Attard channels Robert Plant with powerful, controlled vocals, while Dean Blackborough stuns audiences with blistering Jimmy Page solos. On bass, Ian Graham flawlessly delivers John Paul Jones' intricate riffs, and Michael Bianco embodies John Bonham’s thunderous drumming, delivering a solo that must be seen to be believed. Lionel Caesar completes the lineup, recreating the epic soundscapes that defined Led Zeppelin’s legendary catalogue.

With rave reviews from fans and critics alike, audiences call it "as close to the real Led Zeppelin as you're gonna see" and "an absolute must-see for any Zepp fan." Don’t miss your chance to experience Zepplin—the Led Zeppelin Rockumentary

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Wyoming
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  

Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   

It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Central Coast
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: The Australian Bee Gees Show - Central Coast
description:
After a decade-long residency headlining the Las Vegas strip with over 3000 unforgettable performances, the Australian Bee Gees Show is poised to bring their sensational brand-new show back to Australia!

Currently dazzling crowds at The Excalibur Hotel and Casino where they have been re-engaged for a further five-year contract, their unparalleled success has earned them accolades such as the title of Best Tribute Show in Las Vegas by the esteemed Las Vegas Review Journal, along with a top 10 ranking in the ‘Overall Best Show’ category.

The Australian Bee Gees Show holds the distinction of being the first Australian band to headline 1000 shows on the famed Las Vegas Strip. With over 3000 performances in Las Vegas alone, their journey has been nothing short of extraordinary, solidifying their status as the premier Bee Gees tribute act worldwide.

Marking 25 years on the global stage with over 8,000 performances spanning 60 countries, the Australian Bee Gees Show has transformed into the ultimate live celebration of the timeless music of the Brothers Gibb. From their inaugural performances in 1996 to their current status as the world’s leading Bee Gees tribute act, the group’s exceptional talent and infectious energy have captivated audiences worldwide.

title: LatinFest
description:
LatinFest is a fantastic holiday destination Latin dance festival, with 3-days of workshops (salsa, bachata, kizomba and Brazilian zouk and more!), live music with a 7-piece band from Brisbane and incredible professional performances.

LatinFest prides itself on being a inclusive and welcoming festival.

title: Gossy Weekender
description:
Gossy Weekender is a vibrant multi-venue music festival that activates Gosford CBD. 

Building on the success of the 2024 inaugural Gossy Weekender, the event will transform Gosford into a hub of live music.​

title: South West Sydney's Annual Wedding Expo
description:
The Campbelltown Annual Wedding Expo is a significant event in the Macarthur region. Held at the prominent The William Inglis Hotel - MGallery South West Sydney, this expo brings together over 80 of the finest wedding and bridal suppliers from Campbelltown and its surroundings. 

They adore the friendly, contemporary vibe that the Campbelltown Bridal Expo radiates. Bursting with colour, inspiration, fun, and superb live entertainment – the Campbelltown Annual Wedding Expo is an event not to be missed. Free entry and parking plus couples receive the exclusive 'I'm Getting Married' Gift Bag. 

The curated selection of vendors includes florists, bridal gowns, photographers, invitations, wedding cars, hens parties, makeup artists, fitness experts, men's suits, shoes, videographers, reception venues, honeymoon packages, bridal favours, candy buffets, wedding cakes, bridal jewellery, wedding planners, marriage celebrants and wedding stylists.

title: Parramatta's Annual Wedding Expo 2025
description:
The Parramatta bridal event is one of the largest of the year and is set at the prestigious Rosehill Gardens Racecourse just a heartbeat away from the Parramatta CBD. With over 120 vendors, from the greater Sydney and Parramatta region. They love the scale, upbeat, modern vibe that the Parramatta Bridal Expo brings. Full of colour, inspiration, fun and great live entertainment – Parramatta Annual Wedding Expo is an event not to be missed. 

The hand-picked creative vendors include an array of florist, bridal gowns, photography, invitations, wedding cars, hens parties, makeup, fitness, men’s suits, shoes, videography, reception venues, honeymoon, bridal favours, candy buffets, wedding cakes, bridal jewellery, wedding planners, marriage celebrants and wedding stylist.

title: Central Coast's Annual Wedding Expo
description:
The Central Coast Annual Wedding Expo is a celebrated and reputable wedding expo, nestled in the charming Central Coast region. This event takes place at a premier location known for its scenic beauty and accessibility. Featuring over 100 of the finest wedding and bridal suppliers from the Central Coast area and beyond, they pride themselves on creating an inviting, contemporary, and local atmosphere.

The Central Coast Bridal Expo is vibrant, filled with creativity, excitement, and top-notch live entertainment, making it an unmissable event. Attendees enjoy complimentary entry and parking, along with the exclusive ‘I’m getting married’ bridal bag for the couples. 

The carefully selected vendors span a wide range of services, including floristry, bridal gowns, photography, invitations, wedding transport, bachelorette parties, beauty, fitness, men’s attire, footwear, videography, venues for receptions, honeymoon planning, bridal gifts, candy tables, wedding cakes, bridal accessories, event planning, officiants, and styling services.

title: Bradbury Market on the Parkway
description:
Bradbury Market on the Parkway is an art and craft market located at Bradbury Shopping Centre.

Most of their unique items are handmade, designed in Australia and made locally. You may come across artworks, jewellery, handmade cards and more. Meet with a tarot reader or bring your furry companion to the dog-friendly cafe. Expect random raffles, face painting and lots of community spirit and energy!

The markets are usually the first Saturday of the month from February to December. Please check the Facebook page for more details.

title: Walking Soccer for Seniors
description:
Walking Soccer promotes healthy aging and is a safe, enjoyable way to stay fit, make friends, and have fun! 

This modified version of soccer emphasises walking, teamwork, and enjoyment in a non-contact, welcoming environment.

Whether you're new to soccer or a lifelong fan, Walking Soccer focuses on people who are over 60, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders over the age of 50 and people over 50 that have a lifelong disability.

title: Blockbusters at the Billabong
description:
Join them for a movie night under the stars at the Campbelltown Billabong Parklands.

Gather your family and friends, bring a cozy blanket and settle in for an unforgettable night under the stars. Enjoy Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone on the big screen with the lush parklands as the relaxing backdrop.

Their hand-picked selection of food trucks will be available along with a popcorn machine, so treat yourself to a variety of delicious eats on the night.

Come dressed in your favourite house colour, Wizard or Muggle and celebrate a family fun night at the Billabong.

title: ThurSLAY at the FunHaus Factory
description:
Your local free monthly LGBTQIA+ community hang, your night of celebration, connection, and pure joy. This is where Gosford gets its glitter on and the community shines bright. A celebration of diversity, creativity, and community spirit. It's the perfect spot to hang out with friends or make some fabulous new ones.

DJ's spinning irresistible beats, electrifying performances, drag royalty, laugh-out-loud comedy, and an open stage for local talent to sparkle. This is your night to dance, cheer, connect, and revel in the magic of local excellence.

This safe space is built on love, acceptance, and the celebration of what makes us unique. Thursday is all about lifting each other up, sharing stories, and dancing into the night because a community that slays together stays together.

So, dust off those dancing shoes, bring your fiercest vibes and join a night of fun, connection, and unapologetic queer brilliance.

title: Gosford Silent Book Club
description:
Welcome to Silent Book Club, the newest gathering spot for readers who love books, quiet company, and cosy vibes.

Unlike traditional book clubs, there's no assigned reading, no deadlines, and definitely no need to have something clever to say. Just bring whatever you're reading, ebooks, audiobooks, graphic novels, you name it, and settle in.

It all began in San Francisco back in 2012, when friends Guinevere de la Mare and Laura Gluhanich met up at a local bar to read in peaceful companionship. They loved reading, but didn't love the stress that often came with typical book clubs. So they created something different, a space to read together quietly, with no expectations, just books, friends, and maybe a drink or two.

Now, that spirit is coming to Gosford, hosted at the wonderfully eclectic FunHaus Factory. Here, you can grab a drink, order some yummy food from Beaus Burgers and share what you're reading if you feel like it, and then spend an hour immersed in your book, surrounded by fellow book lovers.

Silent Book Club is for everyone. It's bring your own book, and always free to attend. Whether you're a lifelong reader or just getting back into it, this is your space to relax, unplug, and connect in the real world.

title: Getting Started With Houseplants Youth Workshop
description:
When it comes to keeping houseplants either in your bedroom or around the house you know what's better than trial and error?

A step by step guide which shows you what to do.

You wouldn't build an IKEA flat pack without following the instructions would you?

So why would you do that with your houseplants? You could be torturing your houseplants without even realising!

This workshop has the answers, learn how to get started with houseplants and care for your very own pot plant, which you get to take home at the end.

All workshops are first timer friendly, young people of all skill levels are welcome. All materials are provided, and they will have some refreshing drinks and snacks and lunch.

Everything you learn during this workshop you can apply to any indoor house plant.

title: YAAS! Presents: Punk Pony Club Karaoke
description:
YAAS! Youth presents the Punk Pony Club Karaoke for 12-17 year olds, a full blown celebration of the loud, the proud, and the melodramatic. Think all your favourite anthems and emo bangers, made for every misfit heart, bedroom performer, and bold soul ready to belt it out, or even just bop along.

Whether you've always dreamed of grabbing the mic or you're just vibing from the sidelines, this is a zero pressure, all fun space to be unapologetically you. Come to sing, come to scream-laugh, come to hang, this is about connection, expression, and joy in all its glory.

So round up your crew, grab your glitter eyeliner, or your darkest hoodie, and join the YAAS! gang for a big singalong that's all heart and no pressure.
You don't have to be perfect, you just have to be you.

title: Funhaus Drag Bingo
description:
Drag bingo is bingo with a twist, the essence of the game is simple, you play bingo, and the numbers are called out by a drag queen, with a little bit of live performance with the art of drag combined with the traditional game we all know and love.

It’s a little bit naughty with adult-only themes, but you can guarantee adult humour and performances, all whilst playing five games of bingo. Prizes are awarded for every game, with drag performances after the final round.

Hosted by the pocket sized pop princess Foxxe Faux. Her name might be fake but she is all real baby. Small in size but definitely big on energy, you are always in safe hands watching this captivating queen bring her fierce vibes to every stage. You can find Foxxe hosting and performing at events internationally and all over Australia.

title: Mega Jam
description:
Mega Jam is the ultimate creative arts jam where you can make music with other local musicians, have a boogie, get crafty, flow and play or just get a feed and enjoy the atmosphere. Space Rock Inc in partnership with Central Coast Music and Arts are hosting a monthly get together at the Funhaus Factory and everyone is invited. Come and see your favourite local bands as they host this collaborative experience, enjoy guest sessions with industry professionals, get amongst it in the open jams, catch up with friends and make some new ones too.

Mega Jam also includes a vibrant crafternoon space. Settle into the comfy couches and get creative. Bring along your own project or dive into a rotating range of all ages craft activities like colouring, art, cotton crafts, or rock painting. No experience needed, just a love of making stuff.

title: The Welcome Choir
description:
Think karaoke in a bar singing shoulder to shoulder with friends new and old, a drop-in choir with no auditions and no need to read music as it is taught by ear. Each gathering will be a brand-new song.

The Welcome Choir is an open, safe, friendly, all-genders, all-ages singing group of all singing abilities. Coming to The Welcome Choir is a great way to make new friends, express yourself authentically and step out of your comfort zone. Focused on having a joyful and uplifting experience singing pop songs from many decades of great music together in beautiful harmony.

The start of each session will be a fun vocal warm-up helping to control the voice by the talented and experienced choirmaster, Bek Jensen.

Welcome Choir began in 2016 as a Not-for-Profit organisation in the heart of Newtown, Sydney at the Newtown Neighbourhood Centre. Starting with 20 participants that met once a week, this number grew quickly and within a year, moved to a bigger venue.

title: Brackets and Jam
description:
A monthly Sunday session of music, creativity and community.

The Central Coast's iconic grassroots music and arts event, Brackets and Jam, is bringing its legendary vibes to Fun Haus Factory for a monthly residency on the first Sunday of every month.

Kick back for a Sunday afternoon filled with live music, creativity, and connection. Grab some lunch and soak in an eclectic mix of sounds, rhythms, and performances in a welcoming, vibrant space.

For over 25 years, Brackets and Jam Central Coast have been the beating heart of our creative community. Hosting live music, drum jams, dance performances, poetry, storytelling, comedy, and open mic sessions, all celebrating the power of expression, diversity, and local talent. Whether you're an artist looking to test new material, share your brilliance, or just soak in the vibes, this is your space to shine.

Many successful artists had their first gigs at Brackets and Jam. Now, we're bringing that magic to Gosford with our new home at Fun Haus Factory.

title: KiKi Karaoke
description:
Sing boldly, connect brightly, and celebrate community magic! 

In 2025, it’s all about stepping outside your comfort zone, finding confidence, and sharing joy with an incredible, supportive community. Whether you’ve always dreamed of singing but never dared, or you’re simply looking for a space to let loose and have fun, Kiki Karaoke is your chance to shine.  No pressure, just good vibes.

Get ready to transform the mic into a tool for self-expression, courage, and connection. A welcoming crowd is here to cheer you on, whether you’re belting out a ballad, rapping your favourite verse, or trying karaoke for the very first time.

You don’t have to be perfect, you just have to be you.

title: Central Coast Craft Club
description:
Calling all creators, makers and doers.

Looking for a laid back, feel good way to spend an afternoon? Join a crafty afternoon of fun, company, good food and good times. Central Coast Craft Club has a monthly creative meet-up at FunHaus Factory, Gosford, on the first Sunday of the month.

Bring along whatever you're working on, knitting, sewing, painting, crochet, beading, sketching, or anything crafty you're into, and spend a few hours in good company making, chatting, and connecting with fellow creatives over great food, good vibes, and friendly faces.

Creative inspiration, tasty snacks, bring your own projects, friendly faces and fresh ideas. An inclusive group of all ages, genders, and walks of life.

Whether you're a seasoned maker or just curious to try something new, this is your space to create, unwind, and be part of a welcoming community of craft lovers.

title: BMANZ No way out EP release party
description:
Come through for the official EP release party of BMANZ's debut project, No Way Out.
This marks BMANZ's first major step into the rap game,  a raw, unapologetic project about breaking through doubt, blocking out the hate, and making noise as an artist on the rise.

Expect a night full of good vibes, real energy, and a stacked line up of hungry up and comers ready to leave it all on stage.

Featuring BMANZ, Mr Diaboloical, KayP, Eric, 420 Baz, and Wint3r.

title: Wahroonga Food and Wine Festival
description:
The Wahroonga Food and Wine Festival returns to Wahroonga Park.   

For 2025 they have carefully selected a wide range of exquisite wineries from NSW and around Australia. 

On the day you will be able to meet the winemakers and taste and buy their premium and award-winning wines. Taste over 130 wines from 30 wineries and enjoy an array of local produce and a huge selection of gourmet food stalls offering a variety of international and Australian cuisines.
host: margot natoli project management pty ltd

title: Sparkling Wahroonga - Food and Wine Festival
description:
Prepare for a sparkling day of indulgence! The festival producer behind the much-loved Wahroonga Food and Wine Festival is thrilled to announce a brand-new event: Sparkling Wahroonga - Food and Wine Festival, debuting in Wahroonga Park.

This unique free community festival is a celebration of fine NSW cellar-door wines, local small-batch distillers, craft brews, gourmet international cuisine, artisan produce, and live music in a vibrant community setting. Featuring 30 renowned NSW wineries, 10 small-batch distilleries, two craft breweries, and a gourmet range of food providers, the event promises a feast for the senses. 

With a lineup of talented live community music bands and an artisan producer showcase, Sparkling Wahroonga is designed to be an unforgettable day for all ages.
host: margot natoli project management pty ltd

title: The Big Koala Festival Treasure Hunt
description:
Celebrate the ninth Hello Koalas Festival Treasure Hunt, named in honour of The Big Koala in 2025. This is the world's first festival celebrating Australia's much-loved iconic koala. 

Established in 2017, the Festival is an annual cultural tourism event centred and in 2025 is centred around two 3 day treasure hunts in September & October.

The Festival has been inspired by the Hello Koalas Sculpture Trail which encompasses over 90 fibreglass one-metre-high koala sculptures, hand-painted by local artists, located in 72 locations on the Mid-North Coast. 

There is now also 'The Big Koala .. Spirit of All Koalas', a 2.5-metre koala sculpture at Guulabaa, Place of Koala in the Cowarra State Forest, being created by Forestry Corporation in collaboration with four project partners including Hello Koalas Sculpture Trail, WildNets, Koala Conservation Australia and Bunyah Aboriginal Land Council. 

The Festival Treasure Hunts are outdoor nature-based cultural experiences presented in partnership with Regional Australia Bank and Forestry Corporation of NSW. Thirty five Hello Koalas sculptures on the Trail have been selected for the 2025 Treasure Hunts around Greater Port Macquarie.

title: Hastings Arts Trail
description:
The Hastings Arts Trail is an exciting two day event which sees creatives open the doors to their studios, workshops and shared spaces throughout the Port Macquarie-Hastings region. 

Travel through Port Macquarie's bustling CBD and industrial areas, inland to Wauchope, down our stunning coastline and beyond where artists and makers will greet you with a warm welcome.

Plan your self guided experience by browsing the map, selecting your favourite makers and venues and start exploring at a pace that suits you!

Discover and connect directly with a mix of emerging and established creatives and explore drawing, painting, mixed media, weaving, printmaking, ceramics, photography, sculpture and more. You'll even have the option to purchase original pieces directly from the maker. 

The trail is a great weekend out for everyone – art lovers, families, and anyone seeking a unique experience.

Visits to studios and venues are free, with gold coin donations welcome. Almost all are open from 10 am - 4 pm each day and many have wheelchair access.

The Hastings Arts Trail is an initiative by Vivianne Hazenveld with support from the Port Macquarie Hastings Council (through a Creative Community grant) Run under the auspices of the Port Macquarie Museum with additional support from Port City Bowling Club and Gowings.
host: Vivianne Hazenveld - Artist/Tutor @ The Art Sanctuary

title: Vineyard Mélodie Port Macquarie
description:
Vineyard Mélodie is a boutique festival celebrating French gastronomy, fine wines, and live music at Innes Lake Vineyard. 

The event features curated wine tastings, gourmet French cuisine, live performances from top and emerging musicians, and immersive cultural experiences, creating a unique blend of French tradition and regional charm.

title: Fernleigh 15 Lake Macquarie
description:
A recreational running event for serious or novice runners, walkers or wheelchair participants staged on the Fernleigh Track from Adamstown in Newcastle to Belmont in Lake Macquarie. 

The Fernleigh Track was formerly a train line and has been reactivated for runners, walkers and cyclists over a 15-kilometre track that traverses the lush backyards and forest environment of Newcastle and Lake Macquarie. 

Run the lot or get a team together to take on two to four-kilometre sections. The event is a celebration of healthy lifestyles and community.

title: John Waters presents Radio Luxembourg - Port Macquarie
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: The Beatle Boys - Port Macquarie
description:
The Beatle Boys are back in 2025 with an exciting new show celebrating the 60th anniversary of Rubber Soul, The Beatles’ revolutionary 1965 album. Hailed as a turning point in their career, Rubber Soul featured iconic tracks like “Norwegian Wood” “Michelle” and “In My Life” blending innovative lyrics and instrumentation. The album spent six weeks atop the UK Albums Chart and is ranked #5 on Rolling Stone’s “500 Greatest Albums of All Time.”

Honouring this milestone, The Beatle Boys recreate Rubber Soul along with a selection of hits spanning 1962 to 1969. Combining vintage instruments, meticulous detail, and stunning visuals, their show transcends a traditional concert, delivering an immersive, time-traveling experience.

For over 15 years, The Beatle Boys—John Kater, Maddy Breen, Rod Auld, and Michael Carpenter—have thrilled global audiences, from Canada to South Africa, with their energetic and authentic performances. Music historian Glenn A. Baker describes them as “impressive with their deft grasp of the Fab Four’s entire span.” Fans agree, calling the tribute “absolutely brilliant” and “pure nostalgia.”

John Kater, portraying Paul McCartney, reflects: “The Beatles’ music remains timeless. We’re excited to celebrate Rubber Soul, an album that redefined music forever.” Whether you’re a lifelong fan or new to the Fab Four, this show is a must-see celebration of music history.

title: Echoes of Pink Floyd - 60 Years of Pink Floyd - Port Macquarie
description:
Iconic British rock band, Pink Floyd left an indelible mark on the world, inspiring generations with their ground-breaking soundscapes and thought-provoking lyrics. 2025 marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style in a brand new concert production by Adelaide’s own Echoes of Pink Floyd.

Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerizing journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.

Echoes of Pink Floyd stands as Australia’s foremost tribute dedicated to honouring the legendary band's monumental legacy and has garnered widespread acclaim across the country since their inception in 2009.

Since embarking on national tours in 2014, their lovingly-crafted performances have captivated audiences nationwide.

title: Hottest Hot August Night - The Hits of Diamond and Newton-John
description:
One of the biggest concert events and albums in music history becomes one of the biggest tributes as they honour Neil Diamond and the memory of darling Olivia Newton-John. 

Such an event requires two very special performers. Michael Zammit is a craftsman musician who plays Diamond as if he were standing on stage at the Greek Theatre in Los Angeles that Hot August Night. He toured the US in the 90's with Pseudo Echo and remained. He now fronts his own band the Tequila Brothers and has built a huge following.

Audiences have been blown away by Jenn Allas' renditions of Olivia's classic hits, commenting that the quality of her voice is as close as anyone has ever come to emulating the beautiful melodious sound that was Olivia's trademark. 

Who better to bring the magic of Neil Diamond and Olivia Newton John to the stage in this 'Hottest' of new productions that features classic hits including from 'Hot August Night' - Sweet Caroline, Crunchy Granola, Cherry Cherry, Cracklin Rosie, I Am I Said and Olivia's Physical, I Honestly Love You and the hits from Grease and Xanadu.
A night of pure magic that will have audiences singing and dancing from start to finish - dont miss out!

title: The Play That Goes Wrong - Port Macquarie
description:
The longest-running comedy in London, the smash-hit Olivier and Tony-Award-winning, The Play That Goes Wrong, returns to Australia!

A hilarious hybrid of Monty Python and Sherlock Holmes, things go from bad to utterly disastrous when the Cornley Polytechnic Drama Society performs a classic murder mystery. Complete with an unconscious leading lady, a corpse that can't play dead, and actors who trip over everything (including their lines).

Celebrating its 10th Anniversary, experience total mayhem and comic hijinks at The Play That Goes Wrong, guaranteed to leave you aching with laughter.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Port Macquarie
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: Landescape Exhibition
description:
Inspired by the water and the natural environment: Water and the natural landscape are close to our hearts in the Port Macquarie-Hastings region. Glimpses of water, the sound of crashing waves, the dappled bush light and the raw beauty of the lush hinterland are the undercurrent of everyday life. Escape into the landscapes of the Port Macquarie-Hastings Council Art Collection.

The Port Macquarie-Hastings Council Art Collection comprises over 200 donated and acquired artworks reflecting its major themes: Abstraction and Landscape.

The Port Macquarie-Hastings Council Art Collection is housed in Council buildings around the Hastings. Many of the works can be seen in the foyer areas of the main Council Building and the Library. The Council first started acquiring the early works from an art competition held annually in Port Macquarie.

title: New Exuberance Exhibition
description:
JamFactory is excited to launch a new touring exhibition project bringing together contemporary design, art, and fashion through textiles.

Textile design today is a vibrant boundary-blurring creative field. By its very nature, it cross-pollinates. Moving through disciplines – graphic, furniture and product design, fashion and the visual arts – it manifests as surface patterning, material experimentation and transfiguration, storytelling and conceptual ideas.

Despite the hardships of recent years, Australian textile-based practices are flourishing. Makers are finding renewed confidence in community-driven interest, co-creation, and inclusivity. Collaborations in the fashion industry are on the increase, forged by creatives such as Romance Was Born, Iordanes Spyridon Gogos, Grace Lillian Lee and initiatives such as First Nations Fashion + Design. 

The skyrocketing visibility within First Nations practices is partly due to the passionate vision of new enterprises and reinforced by the meaningful and covetable textile designs being produced by artists in the Top End and remote art centres and collectives. In line with these developments, and urgent sustainability concerns, the artisanal ethos is gaining agency.

New Exuberance celebrates the work of more than 30 textile creatives and includes 10 commissioned furniture pieces produced by designers associated with JamFactory to acknowledge the rich diversity of textile-based practices in contemporary art, design and fashion in this country now.

title: Residue + Response: Tamworth Textile Triennial Exhibition
description:
Residue + Response: Tamworth Textile Triennial builds on the tradition of the Tamworth Fibre Textile collection which first began in 1973, showcasing 50 years of contemporary textile artists.

As we unfold from the recent global events, we reflect on our connection with others, our shared history and possible futures. The 2023 Textile Triennial is a celebration of 50 years of the National Textile Collection promoting and sustaining the unique cultural heritage associated with both the history and technology of textile practice.

title: Looking Back Moving Forward... bringing the past with us Exhibition
description:
Looking Back Moving Forward... bringing the past with us is an exhibition by the NSW Mid North Coast FIBRE ARTISTS NETWORK (FAN), exploring traditional to contemporary textile methods using domestic garments, native plant eco dyeing, references to climate change, applique and printing, basket work from materials collected locally plus the incorporation of found objects.

This exhibition will invite visitors to touch the threads of history and embrace the journey while collectively moving forward, carrying the essence of our heritage into the vibrant tapestry of the future.

title: Buttons, Bricks and Other Bits
description:
This exhibition showcases and highlights artefacts discovered and uncovered during archaeological excavations in the Port Macquarie CBD, with a particular focus on the Clarence Street area. Each piece tells a story about the daily lives of local people. Unlike today, there was no weekly garbage collection. Domestic rubbish was thrown on site into pits or used as compost.

Explore the layers of time that once rested beneath your feet and the forgotten gems from the past.

title: Fibre Flair!
description:
Fibre Flair! is a temporary exhibition featuring works by Port Macquarie U3A Textile and Fibre artists inspired by some remarkable objects from the Port Macquarie Museum's collection. 

The featured artworks explore fibre art techniques, form and materials to reimagine historical objects. 

Developed for the 2025 NSW Seniors Festival, the Fibre Flair! exhibition opens on 3 March. This year's festival theme is 'Time to Shine' and the exhibition shines a light on the Textile and Fibre artists work and the collection items that inspired them.  

Seniors will receive free entry to the exhibition and other exhibits during the NSW Seniors Festival.

title: Conflicts and Creativity
description:
Featuring the creativity and patriotism of service personnel, their friends and families, prisoners of war, civilians and communities during wars and conflicts. This exhibition showcases the ingenuity of people during times of conflicts to keep their hands and minds occupied and their hopes for the future alive. 

Supported by a Saluting Their Service Commemorative Grant through the Australian Government's Department of Veterans' Affairs.

title: Barayal Bila (River Song)
description:
Barayal Bila (River Song)  is an exhibition that shares a story of Dungang 'Hastings River', through a poem and other visual forms, acknowledging the beautiful water ways from the mountains to the sea.  

The exhibition explores Birrbay people living in balance with Ngaya Barray 'Mother Earth' and who freely occupied the river system to obtain water, food, medicines, shelter materials, utensils and transport, then contemporary uses of the river for commercial and recreational fishing.  The  final theme of the exhibition highlights the need to care for Gurrwa 'Sea' and Barray 'Country', protecting and conserving our environment for our young ones; our grandchildren, grandchildren's children and all future generations.                                                      
 
Produced with the support of Powerhouse as part of the Extending Storyplace project with Museums and Galleries of NSW.

title: Mono Couture Exhibition
description:
Now showing 'Mono Couture' an exhibition exploring fashion and design through custom-made historic and contemporary clothing from the Port Macquarie Museum collection within a black and white theme. 

The exhibition is a tribute to dressmakers, tailors, needleworkers, patternmakers and milliners.

title: Joey's Underwater Galaxy Exhibition
description:
The talented students from St Joseph's Primary School Port Macquarie (Joey's ) are taking over parts of the Port Macquarie Museum for an Underwater Galaxy Adventure exhibition, during Port Macquarie Artwalk 2025.  

For one night only, the Museum will be transformed and reimagined into something 'out of this world'! Be surprised, be amazed, be impressed!

title: Regional Creative Showcase Exhibition
description:
The Regional Creative Showcase 2025 celebrates the diversity and vibrancy of local talent across our art, design, and creative industries, featuring exceptional work from senior high school and TAFE Creative Industry students.

This wonderful exhibition will include a broad range of approaches and expressive forms inclusive of the Cultural Arts, Design, Digital, Fashion, Textiles and Visual Arts.

The Glasshouse Regional Gallery proudly supports regional arts in our community.

title: Sydney Dance Company Sneak Peek
description:
Join Sydney Dance Company for an insightful Sneak Peek before the evening main stage performance of Rafael Bonachela's momenta. During this engaging ‘fly on the wall’ experience, you will have exclusive behind the scenes access to a Sydney Dance Company rehearsal.

View the last 15 minutes of a company warm-up class.

Engage in a 15-minute talk and Q&A with Sydney Dance Company’s Rehearsal Director who will share contextual information about the creative processes explored to create the work

View 30 minutes of a professional dance rehearsal.

title: Exhibition Opening: Looking Back Moving Forward... bringing the past with us
description:
Join a celebratory morning tea and meet the artists exhibiting in Looking Back Moving Forward… bringing the past with us - an exhibition by the NSW Mid North Coast Fibre Artists Network.

This event is free, however, bookings are essential.

title: MZAZA Vocal and Instrumental Workshop
description:
World music sensation MZAZA is offering free vocal and instrumental workshops alongside their spectacular show, The Birth and Death of Stars. These workshops are free, however participants must hold a ticket to the 3pm main performance to participate in the workshops.

Vocal Workshop - Glasshouse Studio. Join award-winning French-Australian singer Pauline Maudy for an uplifting vocal workshop, open to both beginners and experienced singers.

Pauline teaches French, Bulgarian, Spanish and Ladino songs, helping singers of all levels harmonise with ease.

In this special session, you'll learn a classic French song from the 1960s, accompanied by instrumentalists.

And if you’re feeling inspired, you’ll even have the chance to perform as part of the 3pm show - but only if you’d like to!


Instrumental Workshop - Level 2 Mezzanine Foyer. Explore the vibrant sounds of Macedonian, Bulgarian, Greek and Turkish music with MZAZA.

In this hands-on workshop you will get a feel for some of the unusual rhythms, ornaments and pitches of modal music.

Bring your fiddle, guitar, ukulele, accordion, harmonica, hand percussion or any other instrument! Sheet music will be provided, but musicians who prefer to learn by ear are also welcome.

This workshop is open to all levels. Don’t miss this incredible opportunity to learn from world-class!

title: Sprouts Holiday Fun
description:
