Grow your child's creativity at one of our Glasshouse Sprouts art sessions!

Designed to inspire and delight young artists, these sessions offer a fun and engaging way for kids to explore their artistic side.

Join us during the school holidays for a creative experience led by local artists Lucy Pascale and Claire Johnson.

With limited spaces available, be sure to book early to secure your spot and avoid disappointment.

For ages 4-9. Parents/carers to attend free of charge.

title: Yarning With Yarn
description:
Come along to the Gallery for a hands-on community knitting workshop as part of Residue + Response: Tamworth Textile Triennial. Inspired by art piece Conversation Piece by exhibiting artist Kate Just, this drop-in activity invites you to sit, stitch and connect.

On Saturday and Sunday, come along and create your own knitted square with local knitter Renate (Rene) Wilson. Each square (or creation) will be joined to Conversation Piece and continue its journey with the exhibition to the next venue on tour. All ages and skill levels welcome – no experience necessary!

title: Bikers For  Kids Newcastle Toy Run and Family Day
description:
Bikers For Kids Newcastle Toy Run represents all that is merry and will be riding into Connolly Park Carrington  to provide local kids and families hope for a brighter future.  

Australians even more than ever are facing hardship or struggling to put food on the table. That's why it's so important that pull together as a community to donate gifts and raise funds for The Salvation Army Christmas Appeal than ever! Every gift donated ends up under the Christmas tree of a child or teenager in need who would otherwise go without on Christmas morning.

Bring joy and hope to families in need this Christmas by being a part of this fantastic community event. Now in its 47th year, this event is determined to continue to build upon the legacy of the Bikers For Kids Newcastle Toy Run. 

10,000 motorbikes of all shapes and sizes will hit the road from Stockton lead by Santa's Sleigh. Don't miss the incredible display of costumes and generosity as they make their way to Connolly Park loaded with toys and Christmas cheer!

Join in to welcome the riders and enjoy an exciting family day. There's so much to do, see and get involved with, from free face painting and kids rides to market stalls, food trucks and live music.

title: Saltwater Wine Mid North Coast Board Club Battle
description:
The Saltwater Wine Board Club Battle is the Mid North Coast's premier surf competition. Boardriders clubs from across the region go head-to-head in a high stakes tag team showdown to determine bragging rights of the best Board Club in our area.

This invite only event brings together the best surfers from eight local clubs - Boomerang, Forster-Tuncurry, Saltwater, North Haven, Port Macquarie, Sawtell, Coffs Harbour, and Woolgoolga to compete for bragging rights, cash and prizes.

Held in the lead up to the Australian Boardriders Battle qualifiers, the event helps clubs build momentum, test combinations, and foster club spirit before stepping onto the national stage.

Day 1 - Opens Division 
Day 2 - Juniors Division

Each team (as per ABB rules) consists of two Open surfers, one Female, one Senior (35+), and one Junior (U18), with each team nominating a Power Surfer who surfs twice. The comp runs in one-hour tag-team heats, and the team with the highest combined final score will be crowned champion.

title: 40 Years... & Evolving
description: The Central Coast Watercolour Society is proud to announce its 40th Anniversary Exhibition, celebrating four decades of artistic excelence, community connection and the captivating beauty of watercolours.

title: IRONMAN 70.3 Port Macquarie
description: The superb race offers a unique challenge set along the Port Macquarie region's spectacular coastline. This is the home of the Oceania TriClub championship and will see you and your mates swim in the calm waters of Hastings river, ride along the Pacific Ocean, and run in the heart of Port Macquarie with the crowds cheering your name.

title: IRONMAN Australia
description: Join the pilgrimage to the heart and soul of IRONMAN racing in Australia. At the home of the Oceania TriClub Championship, you’ll experience a truly unique swim in the calm water of Hastings River, a spectacular ride alongside the Pacific Ocean and a high-energy run in the heart of Port Macquarie, with crowds cheering you all the way to the line.

title: Australian Rugby Shield
description:
The Australian Rugby Shield is the pinnacle national XV-a-side community rugby representative tournament, with the best of the best community rugby players from around the country converging for a week-long tournament.  

Senior men's and women's teams from QLD Country, NSW Country, QLD Suburban, NSW Suburban, ACT and Southern NSW, Tasmania, South Australia and Defence Forces compete and have the opportunity for talent identification to higher honours.

title: Dark v Dark
description:
The Dark v Dark event by Modus Brewing is a bold and immersive craft beer experience celebrating the deep, rich flavors of dark beers from Newcastle's thriving brewing scene. 

This event brings together breweries and beer lovers for a night of indulgence, featuring exclusive brews, sensory experiences, and a lively atmosphere.

title: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic
description:
The Bobbin Head Cycle Classic is a community cycling event organised by five Rotary Clubs, raising funds for Lifeline and other charities. The event appeals to cyclists of all abilities with four optional distances: 27, 58, 80 and 104 kilometres. It is very well organised and managed with safety a high priority for riders, volunteers and supporters. 

Visit the website to learn more.

title: Back From Tucson Jewellery, Gem And Mineral Expo
description:
Kristallen and Quality Gem Rough Supplies will bring you the very latest crystals, minerals, gemstones and decorative polished stone from the largest mineral expo in the world, the Tucson Gem and Mineral Show.

Meet Rachelle Soloman of Rachelle Juter Jewellers. She has amazing, beautiful, hand made jewellery, all her own designs! You may even purchase a lovely cut stone or natural mineral and have her design something just for you.

title: Daniel Muggleton -  Newcastle
description:
Daniel Muggleton is an Australian comedian in a tracksuit.
 
His live shows frequently sell-out at comedy festivals around the world, have earned him numerous five-star reviews and a couple of industry awards. Daniel’s comedy specials ‘White and Wrong’ and ‘Let’s Never Hang Out’ have aired on Channel 7, Amazon Prime and The ABC. 

He's also been hand-picked to support Steve Hofstetter, Ismo and Jim Jefferies on tour, and was invited to perform at Just For Laughs in 2023. Through a combination of red hot word-of-mouth and viral stand-up clips, Daniel has become one of the most in-demand live acts in Australia. 

Daniel is also one of the hosts of Flog Cabin which is a comedy podcast you should start listening to if you don’t already.

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Newcastle Comedy Festival
description:
In 2021, Andrew Hamilton spent four months in two of Sydney’s maximum-security prisons for the commercial supply of psychedelic drugs. While incarcerated, Andrew began noticing the transformative power of laughter. After all, if a joke can make you forget you’re in prison, what else can it do? 

Upon his release, Andrew took up stand-up comedy, initially under strict bail conditions where his parents had to come with him to shows, and he had to be home in time for curfew. 

A year later, Andrew performed his debut solo show ‘Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison’, at the 2023 Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Andrew’s show garnered him critical acclaim, along with a nomination for Best Newcomer.

title: The Play That Goes Wrong - Newcastle
description:
GMG Productions and Stoddart Entertainment Group present a Mischief production
The longest-running comedy in London, the smash hit Olivier and Tony Award-winning, The Play That Goes Wrong, is coming to Newcastle.

A hilarious hybrid of Monty Python and Sherlock Holmes, things go from bad to utterly disastrous when The Cornley Drama Society performs a classic murder mystery. Complete with an unconscious leading lady, a corpse that can't play dead, and actors who trip over everything.
 
Celebrating its 10th Anniversary Tour, experience total mayhem and comic hijinks at The Play That Goes Wrong, guaranteed to leave you aching with laughter. 
 
The performance contains haze, strobe effects, smoke, pyrotechnics, adult themes, violence and loud noises. Recommended for ages 8 and above.

Running time si two hours including an interval. Times are approximate and subject to change without notice.

title: The Simon & Garfunkel Story - Newcastle
description:
Performing to great acclaim and sell-out shows in over 50 countries around the world, The Simon & Garfunkel Story is a critically acclaimed concert experience about two young boys from Queens who went on to become the world's most successful music duo.

Featuring all their classic hits, including The Sound of Silence, Mrs Robinson, Bridge Over Troubled Water and Cecilia, The Simon & Garfunkel Story charts their rise to fame and success during an intense six-decade-long friendship.

The story is woven between the songs, with evocative video projections and images conjuring up the atmosphere of the turbulent times and brings to life the lyrics and melodies that helped to shape a generation and propel the duo to fame.

Moving and powerful, The Simon and Garfunkel Story is a must see and captivating show told with warmth and feeling.

title: Disney's Frozen JR. presented by Hunter Drama
description:
Hunter Drama is proud to present Disney's Frozen JR. at the Playhouse, Civic Theatre Newcastle —a heartwarming stage adaptation of the beloved animated film, brought to life by some of the region's most talented young performers.

The story of Disney's Frozen JR. follows fearless Princess Anna as she sets off on a journey to find her estranged sister Elsa, whose icy powers have accidentally trapped their kingdom in eternal winter. Packed with all the hit songs you know and love—"Let It Go" "Do You Want to Build a Snowman?" and more—the production promises a dazzling experience for audiences young and old.

Audiences can expect all the charm of the original story plus special theatrical touches that make this staging unique. Tickets are expected to sell quickly. Don't miss this spellbinding journey through snow, song, and sisterhood.

Suitable for ages 3+

title: Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Newcastle
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  

Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   

It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Sam Campbell - Window Sucker - Newcastle
description:
Odd comedian Sam Campbell is en route to shed new light on all of the funniest topics before your very (beautiful) eyes. This guy is the full package but not the full dollar. Beneath every seat, they will place a loaded syringe, just in case he gets too carried away. Try to inject him near his spinal column if you dare or indeed can catch him.

Green Faces Finalist and Mo Award Nominee.

title: Calvin Berger - A Musical Comedy
description:
Presented by UpStage at the Playhouse
Produced by Hyde Entertainment
Boy meets girl, boy feels awkward about size of nose, boy gets other boy with reasonable sized nose to woo girl using awkward boy's words… 

Remember that one?  

In this upbeat, heartfelt musical by new writer Barry Wyner, the classic tale of Cyrano de Bergerac is given a modern, musical-comedy retelling. Set in contemporary America, four teenagers struggle with their insecurities as they make their way through the never-ending Judgement Day that is high school. 

Don't miss this Newcastle Premiere of Calvin Berger - winner of the Jerry Bock Award, Richard Rodgers Award, Kleban Prize, and Noel Coward Prize.

title: Mamma Mia! Newcastle
description:
Mamma Mia! is celebrating 25 dazzling years of musical magic! As the world’s favourite feel-good musical, it has captivated audiences across the globe since its debut in London’s West End. With over 70 million people having experienced its joyous energy, Mamma Mia! has become a global phenomenon, delighting fans with its heartwarming story and infectious ABBA hits.

Set on a stunning Greek island, the story follows a mother, her daughter, and three potential dads, all brought to life through ABBA’s unforgettable pop masterpieces. With hits like Dancing Queen, SOS, and Mamma Mia, the show promises an unforgettable night of live music and laughter.

Don’t miss your chance to experience the sheer joy and nostalgia of Mamma Mia! live on stage. Sing along to 22 of ABBA’s greatest hits and be swept away by this heartwarming and funny tale. Secure your spot and join the celebration of 25 super trouper years!

Music & Lyrics by Benny Andersson and Björn Ulvaeus, and some songs with Stig Anderson. Presented by The Very Popular Theatre Company
Book by Catherine Johnson 
Originally conceived by Judy Craymer

title: The Lightning Thief: The Percy Jackson Musical
description:
A high-voltage production — The Lightning Thief: The Percy Jackson Musical — is landing at The Playhouse, Newcastle. Based on the bestselling novel by Rick Riordan, this electrifying musical adaptation makes its Newcastle premiere with an all-star creative team and a cast packed with young local talent.

Directed by award-winning theatre maker Lauren Harvey, and musically directed by renowned performer and vocal coach Marty Worrall, this production promises a theatrical experience like no other — where Greek mythology crashes headfirst into modern-day mayhem, and the gods of Olympus aren't the only ones causing trouble.

When Percy Jackson discovers he's a demigod — the half-blood son of Poseidon — his world turns upside down. Banished from school (again), he's sent on an epic quest to find Zeus' missing lightning bolt and prevent a war among the gods. Packed with monsters, mayhem, and a killer rock score, The Lightning Thief is a fast-paced adventure that captures the imagination of audiences of all ages.

Audiences can expect to see themes of neurodiversity and diversity shine through in a story that speaks to young people with courage, humour, and empathy. Whether you're a die-hard Percy Jackson fan or new to the world of gods and demigods, this is a show that promises laughter, thrills, unforgettable music — and a theatre experience like no other.

title: Josephine Wants to Dance - Newcastle
description:
Josephine is a kangaroo who loves to dance. Her little brother, Joey, tells her kangaroos don't dance, they hop - but Josephine continues to point her toes and leap through the air. When a ballet troupe comes to the sleepy town of Shaggy Gully, Josephine desperately wants to dance like the ballerinas in pink tutus and silk ballet shoes.

On the day of the first performance the Ballet Company is in trouble. The prima ballerina twists her ankle and the understudy has a splinter in her toe. Who can dance the lead role? Josephine's talents are called upon to help save the day. Can she do it, and more importantly, does it matter that she's a kangaroo?

Recommended for ages 4–9 and their families. 

Running time 50 minutes, no interval. Times are approximate and subject to change without notice.

title: Return to Middle Earth | Fernleigh Wind Ensemble |  Newcastle Music Festival
description:
In their first festival performance, the newly formed Fernleigh Wind Ensemble will bring Johan de Meij's new symphony to Newcastle. 

After 30 years, composer Johan de Meij revisits Middle-Earth, the enchanting mythological world of J.R.R. Tolkien, with his Symphony No. 5 Return to Middle Earth. Although there are some thematic reminiscences of his monumental first symphony, The Lord of the Rings from 1988, De Meij puts a completely different musical vibe into this new symphony. 

There is an important role for a solo soprano and a mixed choir: they sing in Ilkorin, one of the Elvish languages of Middle-Earth. The ensemble welcomes Sara Carvalho as soloist in this great new work.

Program:
Johann de Meij
Symphony No 5 'Return to Middle Earth' for Wind Orchestra, Soprano Soloist and Choir

Images: 
Fernleigh Ensemble - Lauren Moulton/Dru Maher-Brooks | J.R.R. Tolkein, courtesy of the Tolkein Gateway

title: TEDx Cooks Hill
description:
TEDxCooksHill is Newcastle's premier stage for bold ideas and inspiring stories. Held at the vibrant Newcastle Conservatorium of Music, this event brings together trailblazers, creatives, and visionaries to spark change through talks that challenge perspectives.

More than just a platform, TEDxCooksHill acts as a catalyst and conduit for the global spread of good ideas, innovation, and creativity. It fosters a space where local and global communities can come together to share knowledge and inspire action. The event promotes discussions on cultural, political, economic, moral, and philosophical concepts, driving innovation and meaningful debate.

As Newcastle's only TEDx event, it captures the city's entrepreneurial spirit and creative energy. TEDxCooksHill builds a global network of thinkers, igniting connections and fueling cultural growth. With limited tickets, this unforgettable experience immerses audiences in a world of ideas that extend far beyond the stage.

title: The Olive Tree Market
description:
The Olive Tree Market features a curated line-up of over 130 of the best emerging and established artists, designers, makers, gourmet artisan food producers, and delicious street food purveyors each month. 

Join them on the first Saturday of every month to support local creators & enjoy some of the tastiest food and drinks Newcastle has to offer!

title: Dan Rath: Tropical Depression - Newcastle
description:
He can't focus. He doesn't know if it's microplastics, long covid or because he pays $500 a week to live in a mold experiment.
This year, he went to a rally dressed as Boba Fett and was bashed by both police and protestors.
He formed a parasocial relationship with a doordash chatbot and he lost all his crpyto trying to buy a mermaid skeleton.

title: Darby Street Festival
description:
Get ready for the Darby Street Festival — a vibrant celebration that brings together local businesses and residents in a lively, fun-filled atmosphere! 

The event will transform Darby Street into a dynamic hub featuring live music, performers, and family-friendly activities. Local businesses will extend their trading hours, offering unique experiences and showcasing everything Darby Street has to offer. 

The festival is set to attract a diverse crowd, increase foot traffic, and elevate business visibility, all while solidifying Darby Street as a creative hotspot in Newcastle's growing, thriving community. 

Don't miss out on this unforgettable celebration of local talent and community spirit!
host: Canvas Events PR Marketing Co Pty Ltd

title: Shaw and Partners World Ocean Series World Youth  Challenge
description:
Following the success of the inaugural Shaw and Partners World Youth Challenge, the event will make its return and will be better than ever, offering athletes aged U11- U14 the largest racing platform in surf sports history. 

The World Ocean Series has been dedicated to running the world's best surf sport events for the past decade.

The event will offer racing in the famed World Ocean Series Central Arena and offer an event broadcast, incredible prizes, athlete ambassadors and world class social content. All athletes to receive a free competitor pack too!

With the Shaw and Partners World Ocean Series Opens racing taking centre stage the Friday and Saturday, this offers a full weekend of family fun at the beautiful Port Macquarie.

title: Feast Over Fire
Bollywood Cruise Party – Newcastle Harbour!
description:
Multiple Live DJ's -  spinning the hottest Bollywood, Kollywood, and Punjabi hits, and more! With open format across the multiple decks for the DJ's to cater for everyone and pump all your favourites to sing and dance along to!

Dance Floor Vibes – Let loose under the stars!
Licensed Bar – Sip on all your favourite and delicious drinks as you cruise around the majestic Newcastle Harbour, from bars on each internal deck!
Mouthwatering Snacks available for purchase from the bar to keep the energy high! Look out for Indian cuisine styled specials!
Instagram-Worthy Views of Newcastle's stunning waterfront from the Sky deck and wrap around balconies.
Dress to Impress – Bollywood glam encouraged!

title: Island Triathlon Festival
description:
The Island Triathlon Festival event is staged over three days from Friday to Sunday and includes an evening fun run on Friday, an Aquathlon on Saturday and Sprint, Olympic and Short-distance triathlons on Sunday. 

The event is open to all standards of athletes and encourages participants to push their fitness to a new level.

title: Clay and Sip Class
description:
Sink your hands into clay and make unique ceramics with The Art Department in Newcastle!

Get your hands dirty and unleash your inner artist. The hand-building class is the perfect combination of art and socialising. Led by professional pottery teachers, you'll learn fun and unique techniques while having the opportunity to relax, get messy, and connect with others in an open and friendly environment. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned artist, the only thing you need to bring is your imagination and creative spirit.‍

And here's a twist, while they encourage you to bring your favourite drink and snack.

Mezze boards are available as an add-on at the checkout screen.

They promise you'll leave with your hands covered in clay, so there's no need to bring clay. Just bring your wonderful self and get ready to get your hands dirty!

All tools and an apron are provided, including a cool playlist of music!

Bring in your fave drink and snacks too!

title: Newcastle Jazz Festival
description:
Newcastle Jazz Festival has earned an enviable reputation among music fans as a regular annual event and as such attracts people from all states in Australia as well as New Zealand.  

The 36th Newcastle Jazz Festival will showcase a variety of bands playing a wide range of styles to cater for every taste.  They will be collaborating with NIMA to involve and encourage younger musicians to perform

Please see the website for full details.

title: Wine N' Dine Newcastle
description:
Wine N' Dine is making its highly anticipated appearance in Newcastle this Winter, and trust us—you won't want to miss it!

This isn't your average lunch, folks. Get ready for a self-guided Progressive Long Lunch that takes you on a mouthwatering tour of Melbourne's hottest venues—all on one glorious afternoon.

Simply choose your venue to kick off at, then take the reins and wander freely from venue to venue. With each stop, you'll feast on curated plates and sip on the finest wines. Want to linger a little longer at that cozy spot? Go ahead! Craving something new and exciting? The choice is all yours.

title: Festival of Sweets and Treats
description:
Explore your taste buds with another Festival of Sweets and Treats at The Station in Newcastle. There will be decadent and indulgent treats from mouth-watering cakes, chocolates, pastries, lollies, and more!

Improve your skills by attending the demonstrations and masterclasses that cover a range of beneficial topics to help you in the kitchen.

Chocolates and lollies, cakes, slices and cookies, live music, demos and masterclasses, food trucks, market stalls, dietary-friendly treats including gluten and sugar-free, kids zone, and entertainment and much more to be announced!

Bring your friends and family along to taste, smell, and see all of these delicious sweets and treats, and maybe take some home to enjoy later.

Please note this lineup is subject to change due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Newcastle Music Festival
description:
Newcastle Music Festival is an annual music festival held in Newcastle. Brilliant locals and inspiring guests from around the world feature in classical, jazz and world music concerts.

In 2025 the Festival welcomes special guests Bronwyn Douglass, Hourglass Ensemble, Madeleine Easton, Clemens Leske and the return of Orava Quartet. All your favourite concerts are back - Opera Cocktails, Dungeon Big Band, Festival Choir and Rising Stars. 

Check the website for details.

Image credits: Orava Quartet - Dylan Jones Photography – courtesy of Universal Music | Bronwyn Douglass - Sasha Dobies at Sherbet Birdie Photography | Hourglass Ensemble – David Collins | Sue Carson – Edwina Richards | Erin Sweetman – Kurt Sneddon

title: Collect
description:
The Lock-Up Contemporary Art Space's annual fundraiser, Collect is back. Get ready to connect with the local art scene, support artists and invest in art by some of the best in the Hunter and beyond. 

Free event, bookings are essential.

Over 100 artists from Newcastle, the Hunter and beyond will feature in this highly anticipated annual fundraiser exhibition. Celebrating its eighth year, Collect proudly presents works from local early career and established artists alongside The Lock-Up's renowned artistic community, including the likes of Michael Bell, Lottie Consalvo, James Drinkwater, Deborah Kelly, Mel O'Callaghan, Izabela Pluta, Alex Seton and Khaled Sabsabi. 

Each exhibiting artist will contribute a work to be exhibited and sold, raising funds for the not-for-profit, independent art space. Works will be available for purchase in the gallery and via The Lock-Up's online shop from opening night.

title: Brazilian Samba Dance Class to Live Percussion
description:
Brazilian Samba Dance Class to Live Percussion by SambaFrog. The only one in Newcastle.

Attendees will be led through a series of high energy Samba and other Brazilian Dances (Samba-Reggae, Afro-Brazilian, Frevo etc) with a wide range of steps and moves ranging from easy to complex. 

Bring water and a small towel. You will sweat.

title: Youth Surfing National Battle
description:
The Youth Surfing National Battle is a four day Junior Surfing event for the age divisions U12s , U14s, U16s and U18s in both Girls and Boys. 

This is a 6500 star-rated event on the surfing calendar. 

With a unique team challenge event that brings team comrades together for team building and working together in a team environment.

title: Caves Beach Markets
description:
The last Saturday of every month is Caves Beach Markets. 

Come along to this free event for the community and meet local makers and small businesses.

Situated in the shopping complex of the IGA Caves Beach, and organised by Cave Woman, Caves Beach Gelato and Mawsons Restaurant.  An all-weather market.

Looking for the perfect gift, or a special keepsake from Caves Beach?  memories of this stunning destination.

The last Saturday of every month is Caves Beach Markets. Come along to this free event for the community and meet local makers and small businesses.

title: Let's Surf Lake Mac
description:
Let's Surf Lake Mac will feature two consecutive weekend's of surfing action, including the final WSL Pro Junior of the rankings season, and a three-day six division 6,500 point Cadet Cup, with athletes across boys and girls under 16 years, under 14 years, and under 12 years. 

The event will take place at Redhead Beach, with a back-up location of Catherine Hill Bay should conditions require.

title: Sydney Disability & WorkAbility Expo
description:
The Sydney Disability & WorkAbility Expo brings together disability-specific products and services, as well as providing employment options to people in the disability community – all under one roof as an integrated Expo.

The Sydney Disability Expo brings together a wide range of product and service providers to help people live their best life, and also features a range of informative and interactive presentations delivered by industry experts and advocates and all-ability entertainment.

The Sydney WorkAbility Expo is designed to connect you with employers and support services, provide practical workshops to get you workplace-ready, and offer valuable resources to support your journey to employment.

Expo accessible features: live captioning at our stage, Auslan interpreters, quiet time Saturday 9th August 9am-10am, Marveloo, service animal friendly with the watering station, accessible venue facilities, drop off zone and accessible parking.

Jump the entry queues by registering your attendance. Get organised with the Expo Guide that will give you the lowdown on parking, exhibitors, floor plan, and the stage and entertainment schedule – launching closer to the event in 2025.

title: Cat Lovers Festival, Sydney
description:
Join an unforgettable celebration of your feline friends. Whether you’re a devoted cat parent, a passionate cat enthusiast, or simply enchanted by whiskered wonders, this is the event of the year for you!

Happening at The Sydney Showground, this is an event for all ages. Meet adorable cats across dozens of breeds, enjoy jaw-dropping performances by fabulous feline stars, and learn from Australia’s top cat experts through insightful talks and demonstrations.

Looking to expand your furr-mily? Visit the Adoption Zone to meet rescue cats in need of loving forever homes or explore hundreds of brands showcasing the latest in cat care, toys, treats, and accessories.

Experience the Pat-A-Cat sessions with friendly felines and enjoy creative activities to celebrate your love of all things kitty. Foodies can indulge in delicious eats from some of Sydney’s top food vendors to stay energised for all the fun.

Don’t miss this purr-fect opportunity to celebrate the unique magic of cats while creating unforgettable memories with fellow cat lovers.

Tickets are limited, book now to secure your spot at the ultimate festival for cat lovers!

The added bonus? Every Cat Lovers Festival ticket holder also gets Free Entry to the Dog Lovers Festival happening on the same weekend - that’s two great Festivals for the price of one!

title: Oz Comic-Con Sydney
description:
Step into the extraordinary world of Oz Comic-Con, where creativity thrives and passion unites fans of every generation! Embark on a thrilling journey across two action-packed days filled with adventure, laughter, and all things pop culture.

Whether you’re a seasoned convention-goer or attending for the first time, Oz Comic-Con promises an immersive and enjoyable experience for all. Come and ignite the spark of excitement and celebrate the diverse tapestry of pop culture that unites everyone. At Oz Comic-Con, the adventure begins the moment you walk through the doors – don’t miss out on the fun!

title: Sparke Helmore Newcastle City Triathlon
description:
The 32nd annual Sparke Helmore Newcastle City Triathlon will be staged from the Camp Shortland near Nobbys Beach on Newcastle Harbour and is one of the most picturesque courses in Australia. 

Offering Sprint and Corporate/Enticer distance triathlons and School Age Triathlons, the event has a course to suit all levels of fitness, from novice to elite. They look forward to seeing you in Newcastle.

title: Newcastle Beach 5s Australia Day Weekend Festival
description:
Beach 5s Australia is delighted to partner with the City of Newcastle for the annual Beach 5s Australia Day Weekend Festival – now in their 6th year.

They acknowledge the support of the City of Newcastle as they partner and focus on the local community and business engagement - events with added experiences and live entertainment - free to the public. 

Celebrating togetherness, harmony and inclusivity on Nobbys Beach, with its stunning views and vibrant community, is the perfect backdrop for Australia Day. 

The festival offers a unique blend of sports, culture, and entertainment that you won't find anywhere else. 

Every year, the tournament grows in size. The passion of Novacastrians and the lively footy fans always create a fantastic atmosphere for our Beach 5s participants.

title: Cirque du Soleil’s Corteo (Sydney)
description:
Corteo, one of the most beloved productions from Cirque du Soleil is heading to Sydney, and is set to charm Australian audiences for the very first time. 

This exceptional show, directed by Daniele Finzi Pasca (who also directed LUZIA), first premiered in Montreal under the Big Top in April 2005 and features a double-sided stage where audiences face each other. 

Corteo, which means cortege in Italian, is a joyous procession, a festive parade imagined by a clown. The show brings together the passion of the actor, with the grace and power of the acrobat, to plunge the audience into a theatrical world of fun, comedy and spontaneity, situated in a mysterious space between heaven and earth.

title: Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero - Sydney Olympic Park
description:
Discover the hero inside us all when Disney On Ice returns with the magical adventures of favorite Disney stars brought to life like never before.

Step inside the music and magic of Encanto with Mirabel and her family as they learn that everyone has a special gift. Sail away with Moana and Maui on their brave journey across the ocean to return the heart of Te Fiti. Join Anna and Elsa on their quest to protect their kingdom.

Be inspired by the Disney Princesses with stories of courage, determination and kindness as you swim under the sea with Ariel, explore an enchanted castle with Belle, and belt out your dreams with Rapunzel.

Hosted by Mickey and Minnie, experience world-class ice skating, iconic music, and stunning costumes that will make Disney On Ice presents Find Your Hero an experience the whole family will treasure forever.

title: Wentworth Point Twilight Market
description:
Held at Wentworth Point, this market will take place at Marina Square, on Wentworth Place, Wentworth Point, just across the water from their monthly Ryde Wharf Market. 

The Wentworth Point market will host more than 80 stalls offering delicious food, desserts, artisan goods, plants, homewares, jewellery, and fashion.

This exciting market is held on the fourth Saturday of each month for residents to enjoy the summertime.

title: Dog Lovers Festival, Sydney
description:
Join an unforgettable celebration of your canine friends. Whether you're a proud pooch parent, a passionate dog enthusiast, or just love being around happy, wagging tails, this is the event of the year for you!

Happening at the Sydney Showground, this paw-some festival promises a tail-wagging good time for all ages. Meet hundreds of beautiful dogs across dozens of breeds, watch jaw-dropping performances by talented canine stars, and learn from Australia's leading dog experts with educational talks and demonstrations.

Looking to grow your pack? Visit the Adoption Zone to meet dogs in need of loving forever homes or browse hundreds of brands offering the latest in doggy care, training, treats, toys, and more.

Enjoy the Pat-A-Pooch sessions with adorable pups, and creative activities to spark your love of canines. And for the foodies, there'll be delicious eats from some of Sydney's best food trucks to keep you fueled for the fun.

Don't miss your chance to celebrate the unconditional love of dogs while making memories with your friends and family. 

And the added bonus? Every Dog Lovers Festival ticket holder also gets free entry to the Cat Lovers Festival happening on the same weekend - that's two great Festivals for the price of one!f

title: The British and Irish Lions vs Wallabies - Sydney
description:
The British and Irish Lions will return to Australia in 2025 vs. Wallabies at Accor Stadium, Sydney.

This highly anticipated and in-demand festival of Rugby will see the Lions play nine matches in Australia, with three Tests against the Wallabies and six tour games around the country. The travelling festival is expected to fill stadiums whilst also attract over 40,000 international visitors to Australia!

The British and Irish Lions combine the best players from England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland, touring either Australia, New Zealand or South Africa every four years – meaning the Lions only visit Australia every 12 years.

Australia shares a long history with the Lions, with Australia’s first ever Rugby Test match taking place against a British Isles team at the Sydney Cricket Ground in 1899 on the Lions’ first tour to Australia.

Guarantee access to buy tickets right now to each fixture with a Wallabies First Lions Edition membership via the website.

title: Final of the AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: 2025 Ampol State of Origin Game III - Sydney
description:
Experience the all-consuming power of Australia's greatest sporting rivalry as Origin Game III kicks off on Wednesday, 9 July at Accor Stadium, Sydney.

Will the Queensland Maroons head south and claim victory on enemy territory, or will New South Wales defend their home turf?

Ampol State of Origin. Nothing Like It.

title: Group A match (Australia v A2) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Quarter Final (1A v 3BC) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Semi Final 2 (W20 v W22) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Quarter Final (1C v 3AB) - AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026
description:
The AFC Women's Asian Cup Australia 2026 brings together the top 12 teams in Asia. Football powerhouses China, Japan, Korea Republic and hosts Australia will be joined by 8 qualifiers (confirmed July 2025).
Hosted across 5 world class stadiums in Perth, Gold Coast and Sydney.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Budgewoi
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: goodnessgravel Bulahdelah
description:
Join goodnessgravel Bulahdelah with two options to pick from 125 kilometres with plus 2,000 metres of ascent or 80 kilometres with plus 1,200 metres of ascent. 

The beautiful region of Bulahdelah has oh-so-much to offer cyclists, where else could you hire a house boat to accomodate you for the weekend and then roll to the start at the Bulahdelah Showgrounds before pedalling through some sensational countryside, lovely farm lands, over a pass (twice) and through some quintessential Australian bush. They cannot wait to share this area with you.

It is time to head North for the winter, unless you're already North and then come South to explore the area of the Mid Coast with Bulahdelah being the hub.

They cannot wait to share even more goodnessgravel with you and looking forward to seeing you in 2025 to welcome in their newest event to their yearly calendar.

For more details visit the goodnessgravel website.

title: Nature Play
description:
Welcoming special guest Susan Moylan-Coombs joining in for Nature Play.

Come along to Aunty Time where you will sing some songs, listen to some stories and make something to take home.

title: Sydney's Annual Wedding Expo 2025 - Sydney Showgrounds
description:
The Sydney Annual Wedding Expo is the largest wedding expo in Australia. Located at the well-known Sydney Olympic Park just a quick drive from Sydney CBD and Parramatta CBD making it the perfect location for all couples getting married in Sydney. 

With over 150 vendors, from the greater Sydney region. They love the local, creative and trendy vibe that the Sydney Bridal Expo brings. Full of colour, inspiration, fun and great live entertainment – the Sydney Annual Wedding Expo is an event not to be missed. 

The hand-picked creative vendors include an array of florist, bridal gowns, photography, invitations, wedding cars, hens parties, makeup, fitness, men’s suits, shoes, videography, reception venues, honeymoon, bridal favours, candy buffets, wedding cakes, bridal jewellery, wedding planners, marriage celebrants and wedding stylist. Sydney Showground has been named ‘Best Event Venue – capacity more than 1,000’ for 2022.

title: Horizon of Khufu - Journey in Ancient Egypt
description:
Become immersed in a meticulously researched and otherworldly free-roaming VR experience of ancient Egypt with 'Horizon of Khufu'.

The experience offers Sydneysiders the chance to take a spectacular trip through time and space, back 4,500 years to the most iconic and historically significant Great Pyramids of Egypt - all without leaving the city. 

First launched in Paris in June 2022 and currently active in the U.K., the U.S., and Canada, 'Horizon of Khufu' has now delighted more than one million visitors across the globe, with an average rating of 4.8 out of 5 stars.  

Led by a virtual guide, the immersive expedition takes guests over the Giza Necropolis, burial chambers of late Queen's and Kings, as well as a nighttime wander of the majestic Pyramids of Giza. 

'Horizon of Khufu' is suitable for guests aged eight years and older, making it an educational and entertaining journey that bridges history with modern innovation for all audiences!

title: 2025 Sydney Boat Show
description:
Get ready for the next wave of boating adventure at the Sydney Boat Show!

Come along to the Sydney Showground, Sydney Olympic Park for a brand-new indoor boating and lifestyle showcase. Explore the latest boats, marine tech, fishing gear, water sports, and family fun — all under one roof!

Whether you're upgrading your ride, discovering new innovations, or planning your first adventure, there's something for everyone. Enjoy live entertainment, kids' activities, expert clinics, and exclusive show deals.

title: Go Diving Show
description:
The annual Go Diving Show is the only Scuba trade and consumer show in Australia. 

There will be demos, workshops, seminars, a VR area, a try dive pool, a demo tank and a photo competition. 
The whole ethos of the Go Diving Show is to create an educational, inspirational and interactive event suitable for everyone, from those interested in diving through relative novices and the next generation to more advanced divers and technical explorers, as well as snorkelers and freedivers.

Attendees can look forward to a series of interactive experiences, expert-led workshops, and networking opportunities that foster a sense of unity and growth within the global diving community

title: Life Chronicles
description:
Dive into the history of life itself with Life Chronicles, an immersive expedition covering 3.5 billion years of the Earth’s history and living organisms. 

Equipped with a virtual reality headset, you will be transported back in time to the Earth’s origins, before embarking on an epic adventure through the planet’s major evolutionary phases. Admire picturesque paleo-landscapes of major geological periods, and meet all kinds of spectacular species along the way… including dinosaurs and marine reptiles! 

Co-produced by Excurio and the Muséum national d’Histoire naturelle (France) and presented by Fever, Life Chronicles promises to be an entertaining and educational exploration into the heart of the living world.

title: Ramsay Health Care Triathlon Pink - Sydney
description:
Ramsay Health Care Triathlon Pink is not your average triathlon, it is all about the ladies and is all about fun.   Featuring a pool swim, closed roads and more pink than you’ll see in an under 5’s ballet class, they are confident once you’ve had a taste, you will be hooked.  All adult triathlon distances can be done in a relay team or as an individual, it’s totally up to you.

Whilst the Triathlon Pink events are only open to women plus girls / boys aged 7-13 years, the fun run distances are available to all ages and genders.

title: Cars and Culture Sydney
description:
Cars and Culture Sydney is returning to Sydney Olympic Boulevard!

At Motor Culture Australia, they take pride in being Australia's most diverse and rewarding automotive community, with their Cars and Culture meets reflecting this.

The events are family-friendly focused and full of fun and interaction, providing like-minded people from across the region with a chance to connect with others who share the same passion for vehicles. 

Expect a fun-filled day packed with unique builds and excitement! The last event boasted over $100 million worth of cars and hundreds of dollars in giveaway prizes.

Registering for the event registers your attendance only, and does not guarantee you a car park. They recommend arriving early to secure the best spot.

Want a VIP parking spot? Send them a message with the make, model, colour and rego so they can add you to the list!

Members can redeem their free food and drink vouchers at the Motor Culture tent on the day.

See you there!

title: Reflections Cadet Cup Bonny Hills - Powered by Surfest
description:
Get ready for an action-packed weekend at the Reflections Holiday Parks Cadet Cup powered by Surfest, at Rainbow Beach, Bonny Hills. This exciting event will showcase the best teen surfing talent in girls and boys categories, Under 14s, and 16s.

Reflections CEO Nick Baker emphasises the event's alignment with their motto "Life's Better Outside." The competition not only supports youth through thrilling surf action but also invites spectators to enjoy the coastal ambience. Saturday night, there will be 'Eats and Beats' zone at Reflections Bonny Hills Park—featuring food trucks, live music, and epic views. This adds a laid-back vibe to the overall excitement, ensuring an unforgettable experience.

This competition holds significance in the Surfing Australia ranking system, offering a fair format where no competitors face elimination in the first round. Come along to Rainbow Beach for a weekend of surf, sun, and surfside fun at the Reflections Cadet Cup powered by Surfest!

title: NAIDOC Week Children's Weaving Intro with Freshwater Education
description:
Join them in NAIDOC Week to learn about the traditional uses of lomandra for weaving. Participants have the opportunity to create their own woven bracelet using Aboriginal weaving methods.

They are a small Aboriginal family business that creates authentic Aboriginal education resources. They have cultural connections to Bundjalung, Worimi and Yaegl Nations.

Sustainable, authentic Aboriginal education resources and consultancy service.

title: St Ives Showground Market
description:
Experience the charm of the St Ives Organic Food Market, held every weekend at the St Ives Showground by Organic Food Markets. Surrounded by tall gums and open spaces, this relaxed boutique market features a curated mix of stalls offering fresh organic produce, artisan bread, gourmet treats, handmade soaps, and more.

Whether you're shopping for groceries or exploring unique finds, the passionate stallholders are always happy to help. Enjoy a locally roasted coffee and tasty bite as you wander.

With free parking, room for kids to play, and a welcoming community vibe, it's the perfect weekend outing. Support local and discover the joy of fresh, sustainable shopping.

title: NAIDOC Week children's cultural dance workshop
description:
First Nations People have been performing cultural dance for hundreds of thousands of years. Dance is used to tell the stories of creation beliefs, connections to totems, to tell stories of ancestral heroes and to educate about country, kinship and cultural responsibilities. In this workshop participants will learn all about cultural dance and meaning behind the dances they are learning. Participants will have the opportunity to learn cultural dance and song in a fun interactive session.

Gawura Cultural Immersions is a company dedicated to delivering high-level cultural education grounded in the ancient knowledge of First Nations peoples. Drawing on wisdom passed down through countless generations, the organisation facilitates immersive learning experiences that go far beyond traditional dance performances or surface-level cultural encounters.

Gawura offers a deeply enriching journey into cultural heritage through structured cultural frameworks and a variety of mediums. These include song, dance, cultural humility training, professional development for staff, cultural supervision, and the facilitation of emotional, spiritual, and physical wellbeing. Through these offerings, Gawura Cultural Immersions provides transformative education that fosters genuine understanding, respect, and connection.

title: Ryde Wharf Market
description:
This waterfront Ryde Wharf Market is held twice monthly on the second and fourth Sunday of each month.

This excellent market features 70 stalls offering fresh produce, hot food, homewares and a range of gifts. You can support local businesses and sample some of the best food and fashion Sydney has to offer. 

Pick up fresh, local fruit, vegetables and olive oil, or a new addition to your wardrobe at the market's range of fashion and jewellery stalls.

title: Laurieton Vintage Motor Club Show and Shine
description:
The event will have static displays of approximately 100 classic cars and motorcycles representing several car clubs and the community from the surrounding area, with trophies for eight categories. Beneficiaries of the 2025 event are the Community at 3 and Can-Survive.

A barbecue will be managed by members of "Can-Survive", a local Charity group, and the Laurieton United Services Club has drinks and a café with good coffee, light meals and cakes, plus the Bistro with great quality lunches.

All spectator's free entry. They will be offering ballot papers "LVMC People's Choice" for a gold coin donation. Those voting will be in for a chance of prizes.

Laurieton Vintage Motor Club Inc.  are supported with this year's event from the following:
Laurieton United Services Club, Port Macquarie Hastings Council, Doherty Auto & Mechanical, Camden Haven Tyres & Service Centre, Camden Haven Auto Parts, Red Point, Camden Haven Chamber of Commerce, Kennards.

Great Family Day Out in a beautiful location, come make a weekend out of it.

The Laurieton Vintage Motor Club (LVMC), a not-for-profit organisation, was founded in 2016 by a group of enthusiasts whose aim is to promote the restoration and preservation of vintage motor vehicles of all types in a friendly and social atmosphere.

title: Orchids Central
description:
Orchids Central Show is Sydney's premier and most centrally located Spring Orchid Show and one of the largest orchid display and sales annual events in NSW.

Held in Club Condell Park the show is organised by the Bankstown Orchid Society, Fairfield Orchid Society, Five Dock RSL Orchid Society, Eastern Suburbs Orchid Society, and Orchid Society of New South Wales.

Along with large displays of rare, native and exotic orchids there are many leading orchid nurseries coming from all over Australia to this event. The location in Club Condell Park, provides great parking, multiple dining options as well as other amenities.

title: Braidwood and District Heavy Horse Show
description: This Show brings together heavy horses in the District and beyond for a full day of led, ridden, harness and long-reining. Come see the gentle giants up close, and all ages are catered for in the classes.
host: Braidwood and District Heavy Horse Association

title: Bankstown Bites
description:
Bankstown Bites is celebrating a major milestone—and it's going to be the tastiest celebration yet!

Held at Griffith Park, this full-day event promises flavour-packed fun for everyone. Visitors can enjoy food tours, celebrity chef appearances, over 50 food stalls, live music, kids' workshops, BBQ demonstrations, and much more.

Culinary stars Karima Hazim (of Sunday Kitchen) and Big Sam Young will take the stage at the Bankstown Bites Celebrity Chef Demos and Masterclass, showcasing their signature flavours and culinary flair.

For those eager to get a head start on the festivities, a special Sneak Peek Pre-Event will be hosted at Bankstown Arts Centre. This evening event features drop-in art activities, delicious bites, and a high-energy DJ set presented by Red Bull.

Food lovers, families, and fun-seekers alike—this event is not to be missed. Come hungry, leave happy!

title: The Lakes Festival
description:
The annual Lakes Festival is back in its 10th year and will be even better than ever. The festival will include more than 20 free events, making a splash across the entire Central Coast.

The popular 10-day Festival presented by Central Coast Council, will feature a program of sporting, family, cultural, educational, art and live music events on and surrounding the waterways.

Make sure to follow The Lakes Festival on Facebook to stay up to date.

title: Singing Up Country
description:
The Northern Beaches Unique Festival is a vibrant celebration of Aboriginal music, culture, and community spirit, led by Yaegl man Michael Birk. This special event showcases the talents of renowned Aboriginal musicians, including Stiff Gins, Michael Birk and The Recognisers, Aunty Cyndy Drummond, Black Turtles, Nadeena Dixon, and Magpie.

Held in the lead-up to NAIDOC Week, the festival offers a meaningful and joyful way to honour and engage with First Nations culture. Before the music begins, attendees are invited to join a free storytelling session and guided walk through the regenerating bushland, followed by a warming soup supper to share in community and connection.

This event brings together diverse communities in a spirit of collaboration and respect. It is presented in partnership with the Frenchs Forest Catholic Parish Social Justice Group and the Kierans Creek Landcare Group, with support from Mona Vale Music.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Revesby
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of life’s biggest questions: 'Why are we here? Are we alone in the universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You’ll laugh and you’ll learn, but you’ll never look at anything the same, once you enter… The Mind Field.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Revesby
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Girrakool Blues
description:
The 2026 event will be a free music event at Memorial Park, The Entrance, with international, national and local Blues acts, starting with guitar Friday, music all day Saturday and the Sunday Family Fun day with kids circus activities, face painting and more.

There will be Girrakool Café, a licensed bar, specialty market and food stalls, and a roaming festival band during the breaks… All in a family-friendly, relaxed atmosphere

Aboriginal culture will feature heavily throughout the event, including Welcome to Country, Aboriginal Musicians,  and Women's cultural activities on Sunday.

title: The Entrance Market
description:
Discover the best of the Central Coast with a variety of local products, from fresh produce to handcrafted treasures.

The Entrance Market is held on the thrid Saturday of the month.

title: ChromeFest
description:
Come and enjoy cars, chrome and tunes, from the good ol' days.

ChromeFest is a buzz of excitement with show cars on display, live entertainment on five outdoor stages, a street cruise, retro market stalls, trade stands, vintage glamour fashion parade, dance demonstrations, the Australian Pin Up Pageant grand final, roving entertainment plus more!

For all details visit the ChromeFest website.

ChromeFest is proudly brought to you by Central Coast Council.

title: Braidwood Summer Music Jam
description:
The Braidwood Hotel is hosting the Braidwood Summer Music Jam featuring local and regional acts.

There will be food and drink on offer as well as plenty of seating or standing areas should you wish to dance.

title: Braidwood Book Fair
description:
The ever-popular Braidwood Book Fair will be held over the King's Birthday long weekend at the National Theatre in Braidwood. 

The event offers thousands of books for readers of all ages, all in categories for easy browsing. The Book Fair also includes a fantastic children's book section, a wide range of DVDs and CDs, puzzles, records and other treasures. 

If you'd like to donate, please contact direct to arrange delivery before the event as donations are not accepted during the fair.

title: CMR Artisan Markets
description:
The Cooma Railway Artisan Markets are open on the second Sunday of every month.

Stall holders include Fresh Bread, local Smoked Trout, Honey, Fruit and Vegetables, Plants and other seasonal produce.

Other food vans provide Coffee and Take Away food for eating while you browse.

The recently restored Railway Buildings are worth looking at – there is a small but very informative museum in one of the Waiting Rooms and you can do a wander around the outside  precinct. What you see will satisfy any railway buff.

Go online to the very informative website: cmrailway.org.au. Become a volunteer member or donate and contribute to one of the CMR’s ongoing projects.

title: Old Bar Beach Festival
description: Polish your Kombi because the Old Bar Beach Festival returns on the October long weekend! Featuring the world famous Kombi parade plus classic car displays, markets, carnival rides, street food and bar, all-day live music, fireworks and all-around good vibes.

title: Terrigal Wamberal Lions Car Boot Market
description:
Join them on the first Sunday of every month (except January) for the Terrigal Wamberal Lions Car Boot Market, a vibrant community event at Terrigal Lagoon Reserve, corner of Terrigal Drive and Willoughby Road, across from the Scout Hall.

Explore a wide variety of goods including plants, books, clothing, jewellery, tools, homewares, and more. Whether you’re seeking new or pre-loved items, there’s something for everyone. 

Clear out your garage or showcase your handmade creations without the hassle of a garage sale. For just AUD30, you can set up shop and sell your items to eager shoppers. Vendor check-in opens at 5:30 am—no booking required, first come, first served. More details for vendors are available here: Vendor Information

Proceeds from vendor fees and their barbeque directly support Lions Club projects and initiatives. Your participation makes a positive impact.

Treat yourself to sausage sandwiches and bacon and egg rolls from the Lions barbeque, and grab a coffee from the on-site coffee truck to keep you energised.

The market may be cancelled due to poor weather. they will update our Facebook page by 5:00 am if it’s not going ahead. Please check for updates if the weather looks uncertain.

title: Old Bar Markets
description: Old Bar Markets are a popular market held in the village of Old Bar and has a wide variety of unique market stalls. Old Bar Markets offer a laid back atmosphere, fresh produce, bric-a-brac, plants, jewelry, homemade products, home wares and lots more.

title: Burwood Winter Market
description:
Come along to Burwood for the Burwood Winter Market. 

Burwood Park will come alive with the sights, sounds, and flavours of Winter at this bustling Inner West market. Perfect for families and locals, the Burwood Winter Markets are a celebration of great food, boutique shopping, and the welcoming community spirit the area is known for. Discover handmade treasures, gourmet delights, and vibrant winter vibes.

title: The Australian Bee Gees Show - Frenchs Forest
description:
After a decade-long residency headlining the Las Vegas strip with over 3000 unforgettable performances, the Australian Bee Gees Show is poised to bring their sensational brand-new show back to Australia!

Currently dazzling crowds at The Excalibur Hotel and Casino where they have been re-engaged for a further five-year contract, their unparalleled success has earned them accolades such as the title of Best Tribute Show in Las Vegas by the esteemed Las Vegas Review Journal, along with a top 10 ranking in the ‘Overall Best Show’ category.

The Australian Bee Gees Show holds the distinction of being the first Australian band to headline 1000 shows on the famed Las Vegas Strip. With over 3000 performances in Las Vegas alone, their journey has been nothing short of extraordinary, solidifying their status as the premier Bee Gees tribute act worldwide.

Marking 25 years on the global stage with over 8,000 performances spanning 60 countries, the Australian Bee Gees Show has transformed into the ultimate live celebration of the timeless music of the Brothers Gibb. From their inaugural performances in 1996 to their current status as the world’s leading Bee Gees tribute act, the group’s exceptional talent and infectious energy have captivated audiences worldwide.

title: Oyster and Shucking Master Class
description:
Join Buckley's Oyster Bar at Pocket Bar Terrigal for a hands-on class where you'll learn how to expertly shuck oysters — and enjoy them fresh on the spot.

Whether you're a seafood fan or looking for a unique experience on the coast, this is one not to miss.

title: Avoca Beachside Markets
description:
Avoca Beachside Markets is a multiple award-winning boutique event held on the fourth Sunday of each month at Heazlett Park Foreshore and the picturesque backdrop of Avoca Beach. 

This free monthly event has become the premier artist, food and musician's community market on the Central Coast for over twelve years and a must-visit for out-of-town travellers and day-trippers.

Shop at the 90-plus stalls in a relaxing and creative environment with products ranging from local art, eco, recycled and up-cycled goods, skincare, jewellery, homewares and international food to name a few, whilst listening to beautiful free live music from local musicians provided by Fairplay Entertainment on the Central Coast Music and Arts live stage.

The waterfront produce section allows you to purchase fresh local fruits, vegetables, herbs, cheeses, breads, spices and more in a relaxed vibe.

With a beachfront location, bursts of colour, high-quality stalls and conscious ethos, this unique boutique market showcases creative souls locally sustainably. 

Carpooling, grabbing the local bus, walking or riding is the best way to avoid busy traffic each month in the area.

All event information is available on the website.
host: Fixx Events and Marketing Pty Ltd

title: Celtic Cuisine and Whisky | Meribella x Amber Lane
description:
This winter, Meribella invites you to an evening of bold flavour and warm spirit, celebrating the rich culinary heritage of the Celtic Isles. In partnership with award-winning Central Coast distillers Amber Lane, this exciting event pairs a five-course degustation menu with hand-selected single malt whiskies, curated to complement each dish.

Executive Chef Gavin Forman brings his own Celtic roots to the table, honouring timeworn traditions from his homeland with contemporary technique and a deep respect for provenance. From Irish boxty topped with smoked salmon and mustard crème fraîche, to Gaelic venison steak in a mushroom whisky cream, each course is a journey – enhanced by the complex, cask-matured expressions of Amber Lane whisky.

title: Black Head Bazaar
description:
The Black Head Bazaar is a market operating on the first Sunday of the month.

The Bazaar attracts a good mix of stalls selling arts and crafts, flowers, bric-a-brac, clothes, fruit and veg, home-cooked preserves, jams, pickles, cakes, biscuits, chocolates and gingerbread. It is especially renowned for its large number of plant stalls ranging from specialized palm sales to tube stock and local native plants. The barbecue breakfast runs all morning.

The Black Head Bazaar Winter Market is a small-scale market, mostly stalls with fresh/prepared produce, food and homemade crafts.

title: NAIDOC Week stone art workshop with Aunty Jude Jarrett
description:
Learn about how and why Aboriginal Art was traditionally created and used and take home your own stone art-work (or hide it for someone else to find)

Aunty Jude Jarrett is a proud Gumbayngiir woman and a qualified childcare worker with over 20 years of experience working in preschools and primary schools.

Jude holds a Certificate II, III and IV in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultural arts.

She has run art workshops for children and adults in schools, afterschool care and has done two large murals in office buildings in the CBD and has a painting in the City of Sydney people's art collection.

Her artwork has been used to illustrate a children's book, flyers, and used with official presentations.

title: Cultural awareness and painting workshop
description:
"Your story is part of a bigger picture."

This year Ku-ring-gai Art Centre is celebrating NAIDOC week with a collaborative, group workshop with the talented Peta-Joy Williams.

Peta-Joy will share her culture, her language, and the history of her practice while you reflect on your own roots and stories.

Everyone will work on their own mini canvases to tell their individual personal stories using Aboriginal Symbols. Then each canvas will come together, to tell a bigger story showing all our stories are part of a bigger picture.

title: Bloom sings Eva Cassidy Songbook - Avoca Beach
description:
With sold-out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Bloom is highly applauded as “one of Australia’s finest vocalists”, some even placing her in the same company, vocally, of those very artists she pays tribute to in her stage productions ‘Adele & Amy Winehouse Songbook’ and the ‘Stevie Nicks, Carole King & Linda Ronstadt Songbook’. Bloom now extends her focus toward another soulful musical powerhouse – Eva Cassidy.

Eva’s soul-stirring voice came to prominence in 1998 after her renditions of “Fields of Gold” and “Over the Rainbow” were released… two years after her passing.

Sadly, her inability to be signed by a record label, unsure of how to market her eclectic repertoire, meant Eva only released one solo album in her lifetime – Live at Blues Alley – an album she recorded and self-released in 1996. It wasn’t until 1998 that her posthumously released recordings would pique the interest of the small West Coast folk music label Blix Street Records. Her first posthumously released album “Songbird”, became a major international hit and earned the songstress subsequent number one albums across the globe, selling in excess of 12 million sales worldwide.

Bloom will once again enthral audiences across the country in this intimate and acoustic performance featuring all of Eva’s hits including “Songbird” “Time After Time” “Fields of Gold” “Over The Rainbow” and many more.

title: The Australian Beach Boys Show
description:
Flipside Entertainment presents; The Australian Beach Boys Show! 

Australia's original, and number one award winning Tribute Show to the iconic Beach Boys.

Returning to Avoca Beach Theatre, The Australian Beach Boys Show, with its unique replica 'Wall of Sound' and Audio-Visual production will leave you in awe. 

Awarded Best Vocal Group for 2024 at the Australian Club Entertainment Awards (ACE Awards), along with nominations for Best Tribute Show for 2023 and 2024 and including Club Performer of The Year. The Australian Beach Boys Show truly is, in a class of its own. 

Performing classics such as, Good Vibrations, Help Me Rhonda, Barbara-Ann, Little Deuce Coupe, Wouldn't It Be Nice and many more.

The Australian Beach Boys Show national 2026 Good Vibrations Tour, a Show not to be missed!

title: Ash Morse - Piano Stories
description:
An intimate evening of original music sung and performed by Ash Morse live on Avoca Beach Theatre's grand piano, accompanied by live studio recordings featuring his signature multi-layered vocal harmonies, strings, brass and percussion.

Ash Morse's music ranges from delicate and intricate piano vocal to grand and orchestral. Each song tells stories of his life and internal world through sweeping melodies and poetic lyrics.

The performance will include selection from Ash Morse's most recent albums: Cinematic/orchestral "To Go Home", nostalgic, heartfelt piano/vocal "Family Ties" and more joyful EP "Sunny Haven Avenue".

Ash will also perform his unique composition "Dream Machine", which was partly released as a radio edit in 2023 (now available only on YouTube), reached the top 40 in the prestigious Vanda and Young international competition, and claimed the grand prize for the IYMC International Composer's competition. In the words of Brian Henderson Ward, in his ASA review "Dream Machine" is "an incredible mix of melodies featuring so many key, time and mood changes. It is more complex than Bohemian Rhapsody and feels like a huge theatre production. An outstanding vocal performance along with fabulous harmonies. The musicianship was genius."

"Dream Machine" is part of Ash Morse's forthcoming 2025 album "Nowhere Land", his biggest, and most ambitious project yet.

title: Australian Trilogy Show
description:
'Australian Trilogy' Tribute Show performs Hit after Hit from three of the biggest names in Australian Music. A 2.5-hour non-stop party featuring all your favourite songs delivered by pro musos that love what they do, and boy, it shows. 

Australian Trilogy has been sweeping Sydney, NSW and beyond for the past couple of years and has built a strong following from all over. Paying homage to three of Australia's best-loved recording acts in Crowded House-Hoodoo Gurus- Midnight Oil. Songs like 'Something So Strong' 'Distant Sun' It's Only Natural' 'What's my Scene' 'Like Wow Wipe Out' 'Miss Free Love' and from The Oils the likes of 'US Forces' 'Blue Sky Mine' 'Power and The Passion' and so much more!

This show will have you feeling like a teenager again, reliving the amazing 80s and 90s in Australia.

What are they saying about the Australian Trilogy Show?

"OMG what power, what an incredible delivery of these iconic songs.. far out these guys kick these songs out of the park.. and the lead singer is so amazing and one of the best front men I have ever seen!

title: Joe Camilleri andThe Black Sorrows
description:
Joe Camilleri has been at the forefront of the Australian music scene for decades as the leader of Jo Jo Zep and The Falcons and The Black Sorrows, and as writer of radio anthems Hit & Run, Shape I'm In, Chained To The Wheel, Harley & Rose and Never Let Me Go. He is the consummate entertainer constantly honing his craft, an ARIA Hall of Famer and a rock'n'roll lifer. Joe's band, The Black Sorrows, are one of Australia's most prolific and enduringly popular bands, renowned for their high-energy live shows, musicianship and infectious, roots-soaked blues rock. They've sold more than two million albums to date and won an ARIA Award for Best Group.

The joy of live music, the excitement of watching great performers and the thrill of that old The Black Sorrows' magic is what these gigs are all about! Do not miss your chance to see The Black Sorrows.

Supported by Blue Mallee
Blue Mallee are an inspiring duo that fuse multi-folk genres of indie rock, ambient dreams, and trad folk influences into their sound. This original act, comprising of Evan and Niev, are pushing the boundaries of contemporary folk music with injections of primal rhythms, storytelling and great banter in their live shows.

title: John Schumann and The Vagabond Crew - The Redgum Years "Corrugated Highway" Tour
description:
Back in March 1983, Redgum recorded one of its most successful albums, live at Rose, Shamrock and Thistle in Rozelle, Sydney. "Caught in the Act" became a benchmark for live albums and highlighted John Schumann as one of the best frontmen in the country.

To be recorded over two nights in Melbourne in August, John and the boys are setting out on "The Corrugated Highway Tour" in October to feature the live album of the same name.

Updated lyrics reflect a comprehensively mad world and a few new/old Redgum favourites will be added to the set list. There's superb musicianship and vocal harmonies.  And John Schumann, the dry-humoured artist/intellectual with an acerbic tongue, an unerring popular touch and a campfire voice.

title: Grease vs Rocky Horror - The Ultimate Music Mashup
description:
Come along for a wild ride through the nostalgic world of Rydell High, where the iconic Pink Ladies and T-Birds collide with the outrageous charm of Dr. Frank-N-Furter and his Transylvanians!

Get ready for a night of electrifying dance numbers, unforgettable songs, and audience participation. Come dressed as your favourite character and win prizes. 

Anita Spring, Jonny Gardiner and their amazing band will have audiences up and dancing all night with classic songs like Summer Nights and the Time Warp. The band will be in full costume conducting a musical party that will blow audiences away, this is the showdown you didn't know you needed!

It doesn't matter if you prefer the 50s nostalgia of Rydell High or the Sweet Transvestite fun of Frank-N-Furter and friends, Grease vs Rocky Horror will be a night filled with nostalgia, music and fun!

title: Electric Light Orchestra Tribute
description:
Get ready to get swept up in the spaceship of music that is Electric Light Orchestra!

The boys and girl in the band will come down from the Blue Sky and Shine a Little Love over the audience with their Strange Magic. Dion's voice will have you believing it's Jeff Lynne up on stage. 

Replicating the big sound of Electric Light Orchestra are six performers with a wealth of experience in successful shows. Are you ready to Rockaria? The Electric Light Orchestra Tribute will be supported by Sound of the 70s, bringing a quality string of other hits from the Electric Light Orchestra era.

For a full night of entertainment don't miss the amazing musicianship, the incredible harmonies and of course the unforgettable music.

Electric Light Orchestra Tribute supported by Sounds Of The 70's is a show that will impress!

title: For The Love Of Purple - A Tribute To Deep Purple
description:
This is a concert for every rocker with music that elates! Deep Purple are among the pioneers of hard rock, together with Led Zepplin and Black Sabbath.
Fro The Love Of Purple brings to life on the stage the incredible music of Deep Purple, capturing the raw energy of one of their live shows in every detail with first rate musicianship from some of Australia's finest musicians featuring former members of The Radiators, Mental As Anything, Richard Clapton Band, Dee Minor & The Dischords.

The contribution of Deep Purple to rock music cannot be underestimated. Having sold over 100 million albums while filling global arenas for over 40 years, Deep Purple are true "Rock Royalty" and have created a legacy that will live long, with songs such as 'Smoke on the Water.' 'Black Night,' 'Highway Star,' 'Lazy' and 'Women from Tokyo.'

For The Love Of Purple will bring these songs and many more core Deep Purple songs which have influenced a generation of bands, artists and fans for a night to remember!

title: The Robertson Brothers - 1960's Variety TV Show
description:
Following their sold-out National Tour in 2024, Australia's new 'Kings of Variety Television' are back in 2025 with a brand-new show! The Robertson Brothers are thrilled to be returning with their new heart-warming and uplifting 1960's Variety TV Show!

Geoff and Ben Robertson are back as your charming and cheeky hosts for this nostalgic night of entertainment as they pay tribute to the musical giants of the 1960's – The Beatles, Petula Clark, Del Shannon, Beach Boys, The Hollies, Bee Gees and the Everly Brothers.

Variety TV Show fans will be excited to know the multi-talented Simon Brook McLachlan (from the Original Australian cast of Jersey Boys) will return in 2025 to thrill us with his very special tribute to Del Shannon.

Also joining the Variety show this year is the amazing Cosima De Vito with her incredible tribute to Petula Clark.

Cosima De Vito rose to fame on the first season of 'Australian Idol' reaching the top 3 in a monumental and groundbreaking season of Aussie TV. Her first single also debut at number 1 on the Aria Charts! Cosima is a true vocal force!

title: Tim Freedman's Moonlit Deck
description:
After the sold out success of the Love This City 25 Years tour in 2024, Tim Freedman is ready to strip things back, have a chat, and get his cabaret on.

Tim will take you on a journey through his repertoire, recount some new tales from his adventures in showbiz, and reveal untold stories about the genesis of the best known Whitlams songs.
