His steady hand will guide you through the highlights of his nine album catalogue with songs such as "Blow Up the Pokies" and "No Aphrodisiac", and into some lesser known detours including the recent country outing, The Whitlams Black Stump album "Kookaburra".

title: Avoca Beach Comedy Club "Musical Special"
description:
Get ready for an unmissable night of hilarity and harmony as Avoca Beach Comedy Club presents a musical comedy special like no other!

Cameron James (Spicks & Specks, ABC) is the "rockstar without a band" whose comedy songs and painfully honest stories have gone viral and wowed critics nationwide. Winner of Sydney Comedy Fest's Director's Choice Award, Cam's blend of music and mischief is unmissable.

Aidan Jones (Edinburgh Fringe, MICF) is a razor-sharp comic and classically trained pianist, known for his bold storytelling, quick wit, and sold-out shows across the globe. He's been nominated for Best Show at Edinburgh and is fast becoming a festival favourite.

Hosted by Marty Bright – a high-energy, globe-trotting comic who's brought his unique blend of physical and observational humour to stages from Sydney to New York, LA and Montreal.

title: Rebecca O'Connor "Simply The Best" As Tina Turner
description:
Get Ready for the ultimate Tina Turner experience!

This year, Rebecca O'Connor will ignite stages worldwide with a high-octane tribute to the Queen of Rock 'n' Roll.

"You want some action? I'll give you some action!" Tina once declared, and Rebecca embodies that spirit like no other.

Following Rebecca's sold-out World Tour in 2024, she's crafting an electrifying new performance that promises to leave audiences breathless.

With her powerhouse vocals, magnetic stage presence, and a tribute that blends nostalgia with fresh energy, this is more than just a show—it's a celebration of the indomitable spirit of Tina Turner.

The words of Tina Turner herself says it all. "Rebecca is so good, it's scary".

Don't miss your chance to experience the thrill and passion of Rebecca O'Connor's Simply The Best World Tour. Get ready to sing, dance, and feel the power!

title: Remembering The Carpenters with Lisa Budin-Price
description:
Immerse yourself in the enchanting world of The Carpenters with Lisa Budin-Price's extraordinary show! This two-hour musical journey goes beyond performance, delving into the heart of The Carpenters' legacy with Lisa's dedication and meticulous curation of timeless hits.

What sets this showcase apart is Lisa's unique blend of storytelling, personal anecdotes, and interactive engagement, creating an intimate atmosphere that has graced iconic venues worldwide, including The Sydney Opera House.

Don't miss the magic that Lisa brings to the stage, making each performance a captivating celebration of The Carpenters' life and music.

title: Rick Price - Tamborine Mountain 30th Anniversary Album tour
description:
Back in April 1995, Rick Price released "River Of Love" the first single from the album Tamborine Mountain which was also released in July of that same year. The single as well as the album scored high on the ARIA Charts. Produced by Rick and acclaimed New York Producer Ben Wisch featuring special guest appearances by Tommy Emmanuel on "Foolish Heart" and Tina Arena who joined Rick for the duet "Trust Me This Is Love". The album title refers to a picturesque rain forest area located in the Gold Coast Hinterland near Beaudesert where Rick grew up.

After the success of the first single "River Of Love" a second single "Bridge Building Man" was released. This song was written as an affectionate salute to his father and grandfather. These songs remain in Rick's set list to this day alongside his mega hits "Heaven Knows" "Not A Day Goes By" and "Walk Away Renee"

Come and celebrate with Rick and hear some of the great hits from this milestone album which include:

"To Be with You" "River of Love" "I Wanna Mean Something to You" "You're Never Alone" "Bridge Building Man" "Strangers" "Since I Met You" "Foolish Heart" "Trust Me This Is Love" (with Tina Arena) "Sure Close to Lonely Tonight" "Love Never Dies" "You're Never Alone" (single version) "Nothing Can Stop Us Now"

title: Simone Waddell Presents: Great Ladies Of Jazz
description:
As one of Australia's most seasoned jazz performers, Simone presents her latest show, featuring an exquisite repertoire of iconic songs made famous by some of the greatest female jazz vocalists in history. The setlist pays homage to legends including Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Nina Simone, Sarah Vaughan, Dinah Washington, Etta James, Norah Jones, Diana Krall, and more.

Simone's international-grade vocal prowess ensures an afternoon of pure entertainment, including unforgettable renditions of classics such as Ella Fitzgerald's How High The Moon, Billie Holiday's God Bless The Child, Nina Simone's Feeling Good, Sarah Vaughan's Lover Man, Dinah Washington's You Don't Know What Love Is, Norah Jones's Don't Know Why, Diana Krall's Fly Me To The Moon, Etta James's You've Changed, Carmen McRae's My Funny Valentine, Nancy Wilson's Save Your Love For Me, Dianne Reeves's Dreams, Aretha Franklin's Nobody Like You, and a myriad of other timeless favourites.

title: Fade Into You - Acoustic Women Of The 80's and 90's - The Album Show
description:
Get ready for a night of pure magic as three of Australia's most captivating singer-songwriters — Sophie Jones, Amy Vee, and Anna Weatherup — join forces to celebrate the indelible sounds of some of the '80s and '90s most loved indie, folk, and acoustic femme artists.

From the raw honesty of Ani DiFranco and the beguiling storytelling of Suzanne Vega to the heartfelt anthems of Alanis Morissette and Jewel, this show pays tribute to the women whose songs defined a generation and inspired countless musicians.

Album Show favourite Sophie Jones, known for her soaring and soulful vocals, brings her effervescent energy to the stage, while Anna Weatherup, whose voice first won hearts on The Voice Australia, offers ethereal warmth and emotional depth. Amy Vee, acclaimed for her spellbinding live performances and multi-instrumentation, rounds out the trio with grace and intensity. Together, they weave harmonies, stories, and memories into a magical evening of nostalgia and reinvention.

Whether you grew up with these songs or are discovering them anew, this show promises to stir your heart and lift your spirit. Don't miss this unforgettable tribute to the women who shaped the soundtrack of the '80s and '90s — and the artists keeping their spirit alive today.

title: Karise Eden and Greg Gould - Lady and The Tramp
description:
Two time ARIA winner and the voice that moves the nation Karise Eden and Australia's Got Talent powerhouse Greg Gould are a knockout in this hugely entertaining, vocally mind blowing show that celebrates the greatest Jazz, Blues and Soul artists of all time! 

Two of Australia's most powerful voices join forces to pay homage to groundbreaking artists like Amy Winehouse, Aretha Franklin, Nina Simone, James Brown, Janis Joplin, Prince, Tina Turner and the Queen of Jazz - Ella Fitzgerald! 

Join Karise and Greg as they put their own unique, tasty spins on these unforgettable timeless classics. It's the mixed lolly bag of soulful treats you never knew you needed!

That's why the Lady is a Tramp! 

Backed by Australia's finest musicians, this is one show not-to-be-missed!

title: 60 Years Of 1965 - The Album Show
description:
The Album Show returns with a new series of ever evolving shows. The shows celebrate iconic anniversaries of significant years of music, therefore changing every year!

The first in this series is "60 Years of 1965". This show focuses on the music released or recorded in 1965 from all around the world. Music from a key year of social evolution, and musical styles and popular culture growing, combining and breeding new sounds and styles… characteristics that resonate, now 60 years later.

1965 was a critical year in music history. The first wave of the British invasion had well and truly crashed all around the world, and American rock responded. We see a move away from simple beat music to pop music incorporating soul, blues and the first stages of the new rock music. With artists like The Beatles, the Beach Boys, The Who, The Byrds, Smokie Robinson, Tom Jones, The Kinks, The Four Tops, Bob Dylan and many many more, it proved to be a pivotal year in the move towards the psychadelia, hard rock and beyond of the late 60's.

With a 5 piece band, striking visuals and a little bit of a history lesson, The Album Show will present a showcase of as many of these iconic tracks as possible in a two set, two hour show!

title: Abby Dobson - The Beautiful Voice Of Leonardo's Bride
description: Abby will perform an intimate show of her original songs spanning her career in Leonardo's Bride, as a lauded solo artist and also her work in the faux-french band, Baby et Lulu.

title: Aussie Classics Show
description:
Presented by 'Out of the Box Productions', 'Aussie Classics-The Show' is a dynamic, entertaining and fun experience you'll never forget. Join them for a great night of Aussie Music.

Over the years Australia has produced numerous legendary acts that have left their mark on the Australian music scene as well as on the world stage. Covering numerous genres and artists, this show is a collection of Australia's most iconic hits and anthems that have stood the test of time.

Performers like The Easybeats, John Farnham, Little River Band, Olivia, INXS and The Divinyls are to name just a few covered in this show.

This Show comprises of two powerhouse vocalists and some of Sydney's finest musicians.
One of the amazing vocalists involved is Jay Parrino. Jay came to public attention in 2009 as a finalist on 'Australia's Got Talent." His version of Men at Work's "Down Under" reached 6 million views on youtube, making it the No. 1 most viewed cover of the Aussie anthem. Over the years Jay has worked alongside Ronan Keating and many other industry veterans as well as appearing on The Voice and The Morning Show.

title: Kevin Borich Express
description:
Australian music legend Kevin Borich is back on the road with a freshly announced tour, delivering his infectious brand of Funkin Rockin' blues to audiences across our great southern land.

Honed by 57 years of experience playing local and international tours, having the honour of jamming onstage with Santana, Bo Diddley, Richie Blackmore (Deep Purple), Ron Wood (Rolling Stones), John Mayall, Taj Mahal, Living Colour, Joe Walsh (Eagles), Canned Heat, and performing support shows for Elton John, Status Quo, Jeff Beck and Buddy Guy, Peter Frampton, Guess Who and AC/DC.

Kevin Borich is a true force of musical nature and one of Australia's greatest and most acclaimed guitarists, winning most popular guitarist in 1977 and 78 and since always mentioned. He will be joined by two incredibly talented Aussie rock mainstays, Jon Carson on drums and Chris Gilbert on bass, his A team who generate the joyful grooves for all who witness.

The tour comes following the release of Kevin's latest album 'Duets', which was met with rave reviews and shot swiftly to number one on the Aria Rock, Blues and Jazz Charts. Bringing together 10 Australian music greats, 'and two international stars. Duets' is practically oozing with a diverse mix of genres and style, combining professional brilliance in songwriting and stellar studio performances all distilled into one powerful album CD.

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Avoca Beach
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Simone Waddell Presents: Great Ladies Of Jazz - Avoca Beach
description:
As one of Australia's most seasoned jazz performers, Simone presents her latest show, featuring an exquisite repertoire of iconic songs made famous by some of the greatest female jazz vocalists in history. The setlist pays homage to legends including Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Nina Simone, Sarah Vaughan, Dinah Washington, Etta James, Norah Jones, Diana Krall, and more.

Simone's international-grade vocal prowess ensures an afternoon of pure entertainment, including unforgettable renditions of classics such as Ella Fitzgerald's How High The Moon, Billie Holiday's God Bless The Child, Nina Simone's Feeling Good, Sarah Vaughan's Lover Man, Dinah Washington's You Don't Know What Love Is, Norah Jones's Don't Know Why, Diana Krall's Fly Me To The Moon, Etta James's You've Changed, Carmen McRae's My Funny Valentine, Nancy Wilson's Save Your Love For Me, Dianne Reeves's Dreams, Aretha Franklin's Nobody Like You, and a myriad of other timeless favourites.

Simone will perform with her exceptional jazz trio who are the perfect match for this Australian songstress:
Drums: Mitch Farmer
Bass: Ralph Marshall
Keys: Sam McNally

Simone is a gorgeous singer, her talent of Kate Ceberano proportions. – Eric Myers – The Australian Newspaper

One of the most treasured, brilliant, talented voices on the planet today! Her concerts are a must see! – Dr Jeanine Staples – Professor, Scholar, Educator and Coach – USA

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Avoca Beach
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Rolling Stones Only The Hits - The Album Show
description:
What do you feel when Mick Jagger calls out longingly "Angie, Angie - they can't say we never tried?" Or Mick belts out "I can't get no satisfaction?" Or "You can't always get what you want?"

You feel pumped, energised, excited to be a part of a concert of some of the most significant music in the history of rock and roll! The Rolling Stones hold a unique and treasured place and their music lives on!

With over 6 decades to fill a huge catalogue with their enduring body of work, their resilience in an ever evolving social and musical landscape makes them not only an important musical entity, but a critical social barometer.

The much-loved 6 piece Album Show Band returns with this concert - Rolling Stones Only The Hits, playing two sets overflowing with strictly hits and classics from the Stones' catalogue!

You know what Mick Jagger would sing….Its only Rock and roll, but I like it, like it; yes I do! Be sure to be there!

title: Gina Jeffreys - An afternoon of Country Magic
description:
Multi award winning Country Music Queen Gina Jeffreys paved the way for the future of women in Australian Country Music in the 90's, being the first female in the history of Aussie Country to achieve platinum record sales and sell out shows across the nation.

After bursting on to the scene in 1991, when she won the iconic Starmaker (previous winners –Keith Urban, Lee Kernaghan, James Blundell) Gina quickly became the face of Australian country music.

In 1994, she opened for Johnny Cash on a National tour winning the hearts of Australia. From this moment on, things really changed for Gina. She went from singing to three or four people in a dimly lit Sydney wine bar to standing in front of 15,000 people a night before Johnny came out. 

Touring with Johnny at such a young age taught Gina so much. Just to stand on the side of the stage every night and watch how he touched people's hearts changed her.

Hit songs like Girls Night Out became the anthem for country girls all over Australia, and Gina had countless number one songs over her career.

title: James Morrison & Big Band Liechtenstein Matinee Encore
description:
Imagine a Big Band from one of Europe's smallest countries making its way to Australia – at the invitation of one of the nation's most renowned jazz musicians, James Morrison. Sound extraordinary? It certainly is! The Big Band Liechtenstein, founded over 40 years ago as an ensemble of the Liechtenstein Music School, has steadily evolved into a solid musical force with tremendous potential. In the meantime, it has become Liechtenstein's flagship jazz ensemble.

While performing in Europe, the band members met James Morrison, sparking a long-standing friendship. Together, they've electrified concert halls from Liechtenstein through Austria and Germany all the way to Switzerland. And it doesn't stop there: other jazz luminaries such as Peter Herbolzheimer, Bob Mintzer, Willie Murillo, and the Australian vocalist Olivia Chindamo have also performed with the Big Band Liechtenstein.

Now, get ready for an evening brimming with musical surprises as this high-energy group takes Australia by storm for the very first time. Experience a thrilling blend of Alpine warmth and world-class jazz, crowned by James Morrison's virtuoso performance. Be part of this special moment when tiny Liechtenstein and vast Australia come together in perfect musical harmony!

title: The Album Show - Top of the Pops - British hits of the 60's
description:
The Album Show and Ben Maiorana Entertainment present: "Top Of the Pops – British Hits of the 60's".

This two set, two hour plus show takes you on a chronological trip back into arguable the most important chapter in the History of Contemporary Music. Starting with the naïve innocence of the post skiffle, poor man's 'rock and roll' of the early 60's, through the world changing social tsunami of the British Invasion, into the development of British Soul, through Psychadelia, reinventing the Blues and finishing the decade with first stages of Hard Rock, this show is a journey of hits of all shapes and sizes, performed by some of the countries greatest musical exponents of the genre.

The show, performed by long time Album Show personnel John Kater, Maddy Breen, Russell Crawford, Rod Auld and Album Show boss Michael Carpenter showcases astounding vocal prowess with all 5 members taking on lead vocals, as well as providing the necessary showcase of the vocal harmonies of the era. Combined with first class musicianship from a band of true multi-instrumentalists, the showmanship of an ensemble revelling in the material and a striking, accompanying set of visuals, the 'Top Of The Pops' show touches on material by The Beatles, The Hollies, Gerry and the Pacemakers, The Searchers, The Who, the Rolling Stones, Dusty Springfield, Tom Jones, Lulu many more.

title: Bloom Sings The Eva Cassidy Songbook
description:
With sold out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Bloom is highly applauded as "one of Australia's finest vocalists", some even placing her in the same company, vocally, of those very artists she pays tribute to in her stage productions 'Adele & Amy Winehouse Songbook' and the 'Stevie Nicks, Carole King & Linda Ronstadt Songbook'. 

Bloom, also a recording artist in her own right, now extends her focus toward another soulful musical powerhouse – Eva Cassidy.

Eva's soul-stirring voice came to prominence in 1998 after her renditions of "Fields of Gold" and "Over the Rainbow" were released… two years after her passing, succumbing to Melanoma at age 33.

Sadly, her inability to be signed by a record label, unsure of how to market her eclectic repertoire, meant Eva only released one solo album in her lifetime – Live at Blues Alley – an album she recorded and self-released in 1996.  It wasn't until 1998 that her posthumously released recordings would pique the interest of the small West Coast folk music label Blix Street Records.  Her first posthumously released album "Songbird", became a major international hit and earnt the songstress subsequent  number one albums across the globe, selling in excess of 12 million sales worldwide.

Bloom will once again enthral audiences across the country in this intimate and acoustic performance featuring all of Eva's hits.

title: 50 Years Of 1975 - The Album Show
description:
The Album Show returns with a new series of ever evolving shows. The shows celebrate iconic anniversaries of significant years of music, therefore changing every year!

The next in this series is "50 Years of 1975". This show focuses on the music released or recorded in 1975 from all around the world. Music from a key year of social evolution, and musical styles and popular culture growing, combining and breeding new sounds and styles… characteristics that resonate, now 50 years later.

1975 was a critical year in music history. The smooth sounds of West Coast country rock, the high point of 70's pure pop, the dying echoes of glam, the growing wave of disco and even the stirrings of punk all were characteristics of this important year.  With artists like Captain and Tenielle, Elton John, Bee Gees, Hot Chocolate, America, Fleetwood Mac, ABBA, Eagles, The Bay City Rollers and many many more, it proved to be a pivotal year in the crystallisation of pop music.

With a 5 piece band, striking visuals and a little bit of a history lesson, The Album Show will present a showcase of as many of these iconic tracks as possible in a two set, two hour plus show!

title: A Tribute To Roy Orbison Starring Ron Man
description:
Talent OZ Entertainment Presents, Roy Orbison - Ron Man

Close your eyes and you're listening to Roy Orbison, open your eyes and you're looking at Roy Orbison.

Internationally acclaimed as one of the best vocal replicas to Roy Orbison, Ron Man has enjoyed many standing ovations from sell-out crowds both nationally and internationally.  Successfully touring Australia twice, Ron Man has also been a featured artist at The Parkes Elvis Festival for many years, made an appearance on Studio 10, and has been a featured artist on several Royal Caribbean cruises .

title: Unlocking The Doors - A Tribute To The Doors
description:
Unlocking The Doors are devotees of 'The Doors' music poetry and madness, driven by a fundamental authenticity to emulate the true experience of a Doors concert.

Rich delivers the baritone vocals, poetry and primal screams that Jim Morrison entranced his audiences with.

Sandy captures Ray Manzarek's jazz inspired solos, psychedelic carnival sounds, all while mastering the rhythmic backbone on bass keys.

Mick's classical training is crucial in harnessing the finger-picked flamenco style that Robby Krieger intertwined into his guitar playing.

Lee combines jazz, rock and Latin beats into a style that John Densmore is still praised for to this day.

Just remember "the future's uncertain and the end is always near".

title: Tribute Concert - Paul Kelly vs Neil Finn / Crowded House
description:
Paul Kelly versus Neil Finn / Crowded House, which one has produced the more memorable music ?
Both artists boast a songbook of classics which have stood the test of time and are interwoven through the fabric of our lives.

Neil Finn with Crowded House offerings like Better Be Home Soon, Don't Dream It's Over, Weather With You, Distant Sun, Something So Strong & Mean To Me. Paul Kelly with Before Too Long, Darlin' It Hurts, To Her Door, How To Make Gravy, Dumb Things and From Little Things Big Things Grow. The list goes on! 

It's the perfect show for the Australia Day and other themes days in the year. Come and celebrate with a band featuring some of Sydney's best musicians.

Don't Dream It's Over, just dream about being there to enjoy the music!

title: Mark Wilkinson - Wild and Hunted Things Tour
description:
Singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Mark Wilkinson, celebrates the release of his forthcoming album "Wild and Hunted Things" with a string of dates across the country this August and September. 

With a career that spans over a decade, Wilkinson has cemented himself as one of Australia's premiere acts with his soul stirring live performances and evocative songwriting. After building a global fanbase on the back of his busking roots in Sydney's streets, the troubadour has amassed over 150 million streams on Spotify, sold in excess of 80,000 physical albums and packed out headline shows across the world. As a support act he's shared stages with Brian Wilson, Rodriguez, Xavier Rudd, The Whitlams and Seal to name just a few. 

His new album "Wild & Hunted Things" is a hybrid of eloquent folk, evocative indie and enigmatic pop brought to life at the fabled Svenska Grammofonstudion in Gothenburg Sweden.

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Avoca Beach Picture Theatre
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. Album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

Alongside her music, Tender includes visual art that complements the album's themes. Melinda's unique painting process, which involves applying acrylics to plywood with brushes, twigs, and sponges, reflects the layered rhythms of songwriting and life itself.

title: Paco Lara Duende Flamenco Show - Avoca Beach
description:
Passionate Spanish flamenco guitarist, Paco Lara with a distinguished career in Europe and Australia of more than 30 years touring internationally alongside some of the greatest artists and maestro legends of flamenco in Spain, presents a very special and intimate afternoon of authentic flamenco at Avoca Beach Theatre. A show featuring a fusion of music, song and flamenco dance performed by Lara and his talented ensemble.

Interpretations of themes from his latest album Duende and his highly successful album, the Andalusian Guitar, including some of the greatest guitar classics of all time will be performed by Lara with the characteristic and unmistakable sound ("toque") of Jerez (Spain).

Paco Lara is considered one of the best flamenco guitarists from his generation. In 2017 he migrated to NSW from Jerez, the heartland of flamenco in Spain, and now his style, halfway between traditional and contemporary flamenco, is contributing to an increased popularity and understanding of the genre in Australia.

With his recent successes at the Sydney Opera House and at Adelaide Guitar Festival (2021 and 2023) and his national album tours in 2022 and 2023, he has proved his flamenco guitar mastery.

Recognised as the most prominent flamenco guitarist living in Australia, Paco Lara and his troupe is a world class musical and cultural experience not to be missed!

title: Richard Clapton - Live At Avoca Beach Again
description:
Richard Clapton as one of Australia's foremost singer/songwriters, paved the way for subsequent generations of songwriters to write about the experience of being Australian.

He grew up in Sydney in the 1960s before hopping a plane for London, and then later to Germany, where he wrote a first album, Prussian Blue (1973) which was one of the first major Australian "singer-songwriter" albums.

One of the most popular songs from Prussian Blue was I Wanna Be A Survivor. I doubt he imagined then, how true that message would turn out to be. His songs are still omnipresent on the radio to this day; his records charting the political landscape of the nation and the turbulent lives of two generations.                                                               

Like Americans Jackson Browne and Bruce Springsteen, Richard Clapton developed a sound based on melodic rock while his lyrics were poetic musings on his state of mind or the state of the nation.

By 1975, when he released his highly acclaimed, No.1 hit Girls On The Avenue, Clapton had set the themes he was to explore for the coming decades.

Over the following years there were a string of hits including the perennial favourites: Capricorn Dancer, Deep Water, I Am An Island, and more.

Richard mastered that most difficult of show business acts – the highwire that requires the balance of radio-friendly tunes and candid, from-the-heart, lyrics.

title: Rocketman - On Reflection Tour
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton's greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and his reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg's uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has transformed him in to becoming one of the single most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute, to perform on the world's biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews' performance as "fantastic" "brilliant" "the real deal" and as being "a real showman".

Greg Andrew and his 7 piece band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – Rocketman.

title: Eric Clapton's Unplugged and Hits - Matt Arthur and The Lazybones
description:
Experience the brilliance of Matt Arthur and The Lazybones as they pay tribute to Eric Clapton's iconic "Unplugged" album, alongside some of his greatest hits. Matt and his band capture the essence and emotion of Clapton's timeless classics like "Tears In Heaven" and "Layla"

Matt Arthur, an expressive vocalist and blues guitarist from Central West NSW, leads The Lazybones—a six-piece group drawing on decades of musical experience. Following the 2024 release of Then & Now, they toured NSW, Melbourne, and Brisbane, receiving positive reviews for their engaging performances.

Keyboardist Sam McNally, a founding member of Melbourne's 80s band Stylus, has toured with Air Supply, John Farnham, Tommy Emmanuel, and Tim Finn.

Bassist Michael Vidale, currently tours with the Don Walker Band and an original member from Jimmy & The Boys. He was Slim Dusty's primary bass player for many years.

Drummer Dave Egan has worked with Matt Arthur for over two decades, previously serving as the go-to drummer for major theatre shows and holding a long-running position in Sydney's The Enormous Horns.

Vocalist Chris E Thomas, has sung with Vanessa Amorosi, Brian Cadd, Tina Arena, Richard Clapton, Wendy Matthews, and also with Gene Simmons.

Together, these musicians combine their varied backgrounds to create a distinctive live sound.

title: John Waters - Radio Luxembourg - Avoca Beach
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six-piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: The Sicarios Pay Tribute To Creedence, Neil Young and Tom Petty
description:
Creedence, Neil Young and Tom Petty are Icons of Rock, whose music has been around for well over 50 years. They continue to remain popular and influential to generations throughout each decade. Music from a time when "gigs" had nothing to do with computers and everything to do with the crack of snare, twang of a Fender, the sweet liquor of vocal harmony and boot heels bouncing on a packed dance floor.

Led by the irrepressible and impassioned Lloyd G on drums and vocals, whose credits include LIonel Richie, The Atlantics, Died Pretty, Christine Anu, Dave Warner, The Flood, Jenny Morris, Perry Keyes and many more. His love and respect of these artists is evident in his captivating storytelling and intense, energetic performance throughout the night. Hooked by Lloyd's warm and witty stage presence, the audience really feels a part of the show.

The Sicarios are not just another tribute show! A band of the highest pedigree, featuring some of the country's finest musicians. This band will have you captivated from a fierce start with Born on the Bayou, to an explosive finale with Rocking in the Free World ... you truly won't want the show to end!

title: Every Breath You Take - A Tribute To The Police and Sting
description:
Australia's premiere tribute to the music of The Police and Sting in a two hour show drawing from their five studio albums featuring iconic songs such as Message In A Bottle, Roxanne, Walking On The Moon and Every Breath You Take as well as hits from Sting's solo career.

The band use the signature instruments of Sting, Andy Summers and Stewart Copeland and balance the studio versions of the hits with The Police's amazing live musicianship from shows right throughout their career, including their early punk inspired days to their stadium reunion tour.

Join them to experience the magic of The Police and Sting at Avoca Beach Theatre.

title: Hat Fitz and Cara
description:
Fitz and Cara, two of Australia's most captivating roots music artists, have spent over 15 years crafting their sound, captivating audiences across the globe, and leaving a trail of soulful melodies wherever they go. From festival stages to intimate venues, this husband-and-wife duo has released five critically acclaimed albums—and now, they're back with something truly special.

Their sixth album "The Couch Sessions Live" invites listeners into the heart of their creative world. Recorded in the cozy confines of their stunning hinterland home in South East Queensland's Sunshine Coast, this project captures the warmth, raw energy, and unfiltered authenticity that define their live performances.

Joined by the extraordinary Andrew Szumowski, affectionately known as "The Mouse" and guided by the expert engineering of Paulie B and Steve from Yama Nui Studios, the album unfolds like a heartfelt conversation between friends. Filmed by Justin Brown of Brown Dog Productions, the visuals bring you even closer to the duo's world, offering a glimpse of their artistry in its purest form.

"The Couch Sessions Live" isn't just an album—it's an experience. Each note carries the warmth of their home, the passion of their performances, and the deep connection they share with their audience. This is roots music at its most honest, raw, and utterly enchanting.

title: The Music Of Lennon and McCartney - The Album Show
description:
Lennon and McCartney. Arguably two of the most recognisable names in contemporary history. Their music and legacy will be celebrated eternally, as their music, creativity and cultural impact continues to resonate even in our modern world.

The Album Show presents 'The Music of Lennon and McCartney'. This show is more than just another Beatles related tribute show. This show focuses on the songs they wrote – together and alone. For The Beatles, for their solo careers and for other people.

The 5 piece band of experienced 'Beatle performers' will tell the story of these iconic songwriters in a unique way. Separating their contributions into 'chapters', and comparing and contrasting their approaches across ballads, rockers, solo songs, Beatles tunes and more, we get to see and hear how similar, yet how unique these two men were, while also speaking to how close they were, and how distant they became.

With scintillating performances, evocative visuals and a compelling narative, this show promises to show yet another side of the enduring legacy of Lennon and McCartney.

title: Meg Washington - Live At Avoca
description:
Meg Washington is a platinum-selling, award-winning, and genre-defying singer-songwriter who fluently weaves the worlds of jazz, pop, folk and musical theatre together. 

Solo, Meg's shows are an intimate, captivating spell. Alone at the piano, the soaring melodies and lyrical poetry of her songwriting are laid bare, as Meg makes her way through a selection of songs from her impressive five-album catalogue. Each night is truly unique, with a setlist often chosen according to the special, connected moment that is shared between artist and audience.

A rare opportunity to hear Meg's electrifying voice up close and to experience one of Australia's best musicians in a never-to-be repeated live performance.

title: Prinnie Stevens - Lady Sings Soul
description:
Get ready to lose yourself in the soul-stirring magic of Prinnie Stevens!

After the huge success of Lady Sings The Blues, Prinnie is back! This is no ordinary cabaret! It's where powerhouse vocals meet raw emotion, where musical theatre meets the raw energy of Soul, RnB, Pop, and Gospel.

For over 25 years, Prinnie has captivated audiences with her unique blend of talent, from the dazzling stage of musical theatre to the electrifying arena of "The Voice." Now, she's ready to unleash her true essence with "Lady Sings Soul" a journey of self-discovery through the timeless sounds of soul music.

Prepare to be transported by the soulful voices of legends like Aretha Franklin, Whitney Houston, Anita Baker, Chaka Khan, Sade, Toni Braxton, Beyoncé, and more. Prinnie's raw talent and undeniable charisma will ignite your soul and leave you breathless.

Don't miss this unforgettable night of soul-baring music and electrifying performances.

Get your tickets now and experience the magic of "Lady Sings Soul"!

title: Celebrating The Music Of Countdown
description:
Celebrating countdown live - Relive great hits of the 70's & 80's

Hosted by Paul Field

Singing hits from the Cockroaches, Dragon, the Sports and more.

With Bronwyn Mulcahy with tributes to the Divinyls, Suzi Quatro, Blondie & the disco era.
With Dave Wilkins bringing to life Aussie greats Sherbet, Stevie Wright, John Paul Young, and more.

And even more classic countdown hits by Skyhooks, AC/DC, Abba, Cheap Trick, Loverboy and more.

Featuring the music & ex-members of Mental As Anything, Richard Clapton, The Radiators.

Do yourselves a favour and get your tickets for a fun night of retro entertainment.

title: Songs of Love and Loss and Hope - Metin Yilmaz and Larysa Kovalchuk
description:
This unique musical collaboration, which combines Kurdish and Ukrainian national instruments, will present the joys and cries of two cultures, as well as modern compositions with highly virtuousic improvisations.

As one of the contestants recently on The Voice of Australia, Larysa's enchanting voice captured and mesmerised audiences.

Larysa Kovalchuk's exceptional soprano voice, combined with the gentle sounds of the bandura,has thrilled audiences as geographically distant asher native Ukraine, Western Europe and around

Australia. Larysa studied voice, bandura and conducting at Kiev Conservatorium of Music and soon became one of the nation's leading players. She performed in numerous festivals in the Ukraine and Western Europe, including Latvia, Estonia Germany and France. Larissa was a laureate of the 1993 all-Ukrainian Bandura Festival and won international renown when she performed at the 1994 "All the World's Violins" Festival in France.

Since moving to Australia, Larysa has made recordings with SBS and ABC Radio and Television Companies, has appeared in Opera House, numerous Multicultural and Folk Festivals, Musica Viva Concerts and many invited performances. These include the 2014 "Noel! Noel!" concert series with the Australian Brandenburg Orchestra, the 2015 Woodford Folk Festival and the 2023 National Folk Festival . Larysa holds her Masters Degree in Education from the University of Sydney and currently is the Leading Vocal Teacher at the Riverina Conservatorium of Music.

title: Ted Mulry Gang
description:
Ted Mulry first came to the attention of the music industry when he sent a demo of some of his own compositions to Albert Productions in Sydney. The company persuaded him to become a recording artist and he soon rose to fame as a solo singer/songwriter with his own composition, the pop ballad "Julia", which made the Australian charts in 1970. He followed that with "Falling in Love Again", a song by The Easybeats songwriting team Harry Vanda & George Young, which was a major hit in 1971. Mulry was a prolific songwriter, and a number of bands and artists, including John Farnham and Alison MacCallum, recorded his songs. Most notably, rock band Sherbet had a hit with his song "You're All Woman".

After getting tired of being backed by different backing bands, in 1972 he switched from acoustic guitar to bass and formed his own band, Ted Mulry Gang, with guitarist Les Hall and drummer Herman Kovac. The band released their first album Here We Are. When that album didn't do as well as expected, the record company wanted Mulry to go back to singing solo. Ronnie Clayton told them to stick to it and brought in second guitarist Gary Dixon to complete the foursome. With his own band behind him he adopted a more hard rocking style.

title: The Album Show - West Coast 70's
description:
Sydney based collective The Album Show presents "The West Coast 70's".

This show consists of a 6-piece show band of experienced and accomplished musicians/singers, playing a setlist of bonafide hits from one of the most significant periods in the development of contemporary pop music, the 'California' scene from the 70's. This period was the perfect melting pot of rock and roll, pop and country music at a time that showed the emergence of the singer-songwriter.

Showcasing the biggest hits of The Eagles, James Taylor, Fleetwood Mac, Linda Ronstadt, The Doobie Brothers and many many more, this two hour plus show, featuring a whole band of vocalists (including Sophie Jones and Michael Carpenter) and first rate musicians, the show will take you on a journey where you'll see how interwoven the paths of these artists were, and hear a timeless catalogue of material.

With striking visuals, a super tight band, soaring harmonies, engaging banter and more denim than should be allowed on one stage, The West Coast 70's are ready to take you back in time with a night you're bound to never forget!!

title: Kingswood - You Wreck Me Tour
description:
Multi Platinum and Gold ARIA certified, ARIA nominated, four times Golden Guitar nominees Kingswood have returned. 

Refined, electrifying, and unapologetically raw, Kingswood stands at the crossroads of vintage rock and modern country. With a sound that feels like a shot of whiskey in a velvet glass—smooth yet burning with intensity—this Australian powerhouse has carved out a space where heartland rock meets the sounds of American nostalgia.

From roaring festival stages to stripped-back honky-tonk sets, Kingswood delivers a brand of storytelling that's equal parts elegance and edge. Their music pulses with the spirit of classic America —Springsteen's fire, Petty's soul and Alan Jackson's cheek—while weaving in their own signature of soulful harmonies, driving guitars, and a relentless pursuit of sonic authenticity.

With their latest release, a searing rendition of Tom Petty's 'You Wreck Me,' Kingswood brings new life to a timeless anthem. Fuelled by the reckless energy of love and destruction, the track is a testament to the band's ability to honor rock's greats while making every note undeniably their own.

title: The Oils - The Midnight Oil Tribute Show
description:
The Oils pay tribute to one of Australia's greatest ever rock bands Midnight Oil. In an explosive energetic two hour live concert style show, the inclusive songbook takes you on a ride of pure oz rock nostalgia.

The Oils perform the most iconic songs including Beds Are Burning, Power & The passion, Run By Night, The Dead Heart, Cold Cold Change, Blue Sky Mine and many more long-time fan favourites.

Above all The Oils Tribute is well known by passionate Midnight Oil fans to deliver a respectful tribute show to one of Australia's biggest live bands.

In the spirit of Midnight Oil. Let's rock!

title: Killer Queen Experience
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia's most sought-after Tribute Act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Persistence has paid off for lead singer John Blunt, original member and Freddie Mercury Impersonator for over 15 years, cementing John as the most recognised Freddie around the globe.

Originally known as "The King and Queen Show"(a tribute to Elvis & Queen), John found his talents entertaining guests at Warner Bros Movie World imitating characters such as Roy Orbison, Austin Powers, Elvis Presley and Freddie. Forgetting his costume fronting a cover band for a Halloween gig, John somehow accidentally dressed as Freddie and the rest is history!

Move forward a decade and John was chosen by ITV Channel 5 UK for the docu/drama "The Freddie Mercury Story–Who Wants to Live Forever" a detailed look into the personal life and death (45 years old in1991) of Queens Frontman, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

title: Lonnie Lee - 1959 When Rock Broke The Sound Barrier
description:
Lonnie Lee, The 'Last Man Standing' from his era with his audio visual event '1959' his story as 'rock breaks the sound barrier'

In 1956 at the very start of Rock'n'Roll, a young country boy stood on stage alone with his guitar, no band, just him, introducing Rockabilly to Australian audiences. Now 68 years later, his iconic career has come full circle. As the last record superstar from his era still on stage, he once again is alone. The Leemen whilst not seen, are heard on his own amazing tracks.

After all these years, Lonnie has taken a new exciting direction for his career which focuses on that magic year of 1959, when Rock'n'Roll exploded across the world. With amazing audio visual highlights from his entire career to accompany him singing his own Gold hits as well as legendary hits of his friends, the same excitement will emanate from the stage as it always has from a Lonnie Lee show. The tracks he sings to bring back the same excitement they did back in the day.

One of the features in the show is when he talks about and sings an amazing song he wrote for Roy Orbison called 'Rain', which in the 1970's, Roy told him it would be his next #1 single.

title: Craig McLachlan Live and Intimate - Six String Stories
description:
Get ready Australia for a Night To Remember as Australian heartthob Craig McLachlan brings his unique and exciting Live and Intimate stage show to theatre's and venues across Australia.

Craig McLachlan is an actor, singer, musician and songwriter from TV's Ramsay Street to 1950's Ballarat & across stages of the world, Craig as Henry, Doctor Blake, Frank n Furter, Doctor Zuko, Ed, Grant or simply as himself has entertained millions of people for over three decades.

His successes include The Doctor Blake Mysteries, The Rocky Horror Show, CSI Los Angles, Packed To The Rafters, McLeod's Daughters, Grease, Bugs, Catherine The Great, Superfire, Hating Alison Ashley, Chittty Chitty Bang Bang, City Homicide, The Cut, Special Ops, Redfern Now, Deep Water, Restoration, Home and Away, Neighbour's – the list goes on and continuous to grow.

Craig is a Gold Logie, Aria Winner, three time Silver Logie and Helpmann Award Winner and has several Australian and UK Hit Singles to his name along with some very shiny Gold & Platinum records he has yodeled with the Bee Gees while waiting to sing for The Queen! Yes, That Queen.!

So join Craig and his snare smackin' mate Dave, as he takes you on a strange musical journey! playing, singin', riffin' & chatting his way through the stories behind the stories!

title: Daniel Muggleton - You May Be White, I May Be Crazy
description:
Daniel Muggleton is an Australian comedian in a tracksuit.

His live shows frequently sell-out at comedy festivals around the world, have earned him numerous five-star reviews and a couple of industry awards. Daniel's comedy specials White & Wrong and Let's Never Hang Out have aired on Channel 7, Amazon Prime and ABC TV. He's also been hand-picked to support Steve Hofstetter, Jim Jefferies and Ismo on tour, and was invited to perform at Just For Laughs in 2023. Through a combination of red hot word-of-mouth and viral stand-up clips, Daniel has become one of the most in-demand live acts in Australia.

Daniel is also one of the hosts of 'Flog Cabin' which is a comedy podcast you should start listening to immediately.

title: Dave Graney and The Coral Snakes - The Soft and Sexy Sound Tour
description:
Gather up folks for one of the best tours coming your way this year. Dave Graney 'n' The Coral Snakes are hitting the road this October/November for a national tour to mark 30 years since the release of their iconic, 1995 Gold-selling album, The Soft 'n' Sexy Sound.

 This anniversary tour is a major moment for the band, who are long celebrated for their stylish mix of art rock, pop, and lounge-inspired grooves. Originally recorded at Metropolis Audio in Melbourne and produced by Victor Van Vugt (Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds, P.J. Harvey, Sarah Blasko...), The Soft 'n' Sexy Sound highlights Graney's sharp lyrical flair and genre-blending sound, which resulted in him picking up ARIA Award for Best Male Artist back in '96.

 Fast track 30 years, the upcoming Anniversary shows promise to bring the cool and collective sounds of  Dave Graney 'n' The Coral Snakes acclaimed album to life in full on the stage. The setlist will dive deep into The Soft 'n' Sexy Sound, with standout tracks such as "Rock'n'Roll is Where I Hide" "I'm Not Afraid to Be Heavy", and "I'm Gonna Live in My Own Big World", along with a second set of classics and fan favourites.

title: Bongo Starkie's Skyhooks Show
description:
Bob Bongo Starkie, guitarist with the legendary Skyhooks performs the classic songs and a few more that need to be heard, in a personal celebration of one of Australia's most beloved bands. 

In between songs Bob shares humorous anecdotes and insights into the inner workings of the Skyhooks. Bob Bongo Starkie's Skyhooks Show - Razor Sharp Riffs and a Lotta Laughs! 

Featuring the powerful voice of Sasha Theunissen on lead vocals. Skyhooks helped change the face of rock n roll in the 1970s with number one and Top 10 singles to their credit, as well as two of the country's biggest selling albums, Living in the 70s and Ego is Not A Dirty Word. ( Both produced by Ross Wilson) Skyhooks smashed onto the scene in their colourful costumes and wearing elaborate make-up well before other bands tried it! 

Killer singles such as Living in The Seventies, Horror Movie, Ego (Is Not A Dirty Word), Women In Uniform and Jukebox in Siberia have been permanently on rotation on radio stations around the country for decades.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Five Dock
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: Acrylic Aviary Art Exhibition
description:
Step into the Acrylic Aviary, a solo exhibition by local Hallidays Point artist Shelley Kurtz. Featuring bold, earthy acrylic paintings, this collection celebrates the beauty of Australian native birds through Shelley's largest and most intricate works to date.

Artworks are available for purchase.
Australian Beaks books also available.
Free admission.

title: Echoes of Light: Our Connection Through Waterways
description:
A First Nations exhibition focusing on the deep connections between culture, Country and water.

Echoes of Light: Our Connection Through Waterways is an exhibition by friends and collaborators Emma Hicks and Merindah Funnell, presenting a series of mixed media works that highlight interwoven stories shaped by water and time immemorial and are deeply connected to Country.

The exhibition features new, site-specific works that bring together the cultural practices and knowledge connected to Cammeraygal Country. The artworks share relationships to Country and invite viewers to reflect on their own connections and experiences to place.

As part of the exhibition, Emma and Merindah consulted with Barada Bana, Yuin, and Cammeraygal Elder Auntie Jeanie Moran.

Emma and Merindah are also bringing together First Nations Aunties in Sydney's north, hosting a one-day eco-dyeing and weaving workshop led by Noongar artist Jodie Dowd as part of a community-led collaborative artwork.

title: Obsolete Redux
description:
'Obsolete Redux' explores the enduring resonance of analogue experiences within the rapidly digitalising contemporary society.

The exhibition juxtaposes the tactile warmth of analogue photography with the immediacy of digital photography and installation works, highlighting the ephemeral and intangible nature of modern life. Participating artists from Australia and Korea delve into themes of memory, intimacy, and authenticity through this contrast, reinterpreting analogue media not as mere relics of the past but as powerful mediums for connection and introspection today.

Each artwork reflects a universal human longing for the tactile, the imperfect, and the material, offering audiences a moment to pause and reflect within a fast-paced, screen-saturated era. 'Obsolete Redux' reminds us that within what is often dismissed as 'obsolete,' there remains profound emotional depth, introspection, and the enduring touch of humanity.

Artists: Carolyn Craig, Damian Dillon, Han Heejoon, Hong Insook, Cecilia Kim, Julia Kim, Haejung Lee, Roy Lee, David Manley, Sangwook Moon

title: Ukrainian DNA
description:
'Ukrainian DNA' is an exhibition of work by Maru Jarockyj that highlights the infusion of her Ukrainian heritage with linear blocks and coloured cubic assemblies, which are defined by symbolic Ukrainian themes. The essence of this art lies in the purity of its lines and cutting blocks of colour. Together, these form a unique painting style that is inspired by both modernism and cubism, at the same time embracing Ukrainian heritage and bold architectural influences at the same time. 

As a practising architect, Maru's fascination with abstraction, geometry and fragmented forms has been an enduring constant of her work which spills onto the canvas in a symphony of eclectic lines. These lines, which reflect strands of strong Ukrainian DNA, symbolically represent the cultural links tied to a deep sense of self: a mystic multicultural identity that Australian Ukrainians draw upon while living in the diaspora.

Sharing art and culture makes communities stronger, more resilient, and the work featured in Ukrainian DNA will reinforce the idea (in these horrific times for Ukraine) that Art gives us a voice, gives us optimism and hope. The significant Ukrainian-Australian community living in Sydney is fiercely proud of its heritage and will always harness its creative Ukrainian DNA for the triumph of truth.

title: CASA / HOUSE: Interior of Abstract Memories
description:
A solo exhibition by Gaia Starace, 'CASA / HOUSE:' is an immersive body of abstract work that invites the viewer into a space of memory, emotion, and interiority. Rooted in the idea of home as both a physical and psychological sanctuary, the exhibition unfolds like a domestic dream — soft, unstable, and deeply personal.

The word 'casa' — house — becomes a lens to examine the layered interplay between past and present, memory and space, fragility and strength. Within this imagined interior, a soft baby doll pink permeates the environment, acting as both a visual and emotional cue. Scattered prompts — like a cardboard, old-fashioned telephone recalling long conversations filled with laughter and confidences shared with a childhood friend, or a delicate coffee table resembling dollhouse furniture — evoke a sense of playful nostalgia. These elements gently remind us of the impermanence of material things and the intimacy of remembered moments. Within this space, the abstract paintings serve as emotional anchors. Created through an intuitive, process-based approach, each piece reflects not an object or a scene, but a felt experience — a gesture toward a moment, a colour that lingers like a memory. These compositions act like rooms within a house of feeling: layered, quiet, and open to interpretation.

Image: Gaia Starace, 'Casa-House', 2025, mix media and digital design

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Belmore
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.'

title: Mik Maks Live - Menai
description:
YouTube sensations and beloved family band The Mik Maks are heading to Gippsland for the very first time!

With over 8.5 million subscribers and fans around the world, The Mik Maks have become a household name for families — but nothing beats seeing them live on stage!

Join brothers Al and Joel, Joel's daughter Ava, and their cheeky friend Drums the Panda for a morning of music, laughter, and dance-along fun. Whether your little one loves to wiggle, giggle, or sing at the top of their lungs — this show is for them!

It's music that moves kids — physically, emotionally, and educationally.

Don't miss the magic — book your tickets now.

title: 40th Pittwater to Coffs Harbour Yacht Race
description:
The East Coast Classic Royal Prince Alfred Yacht Club (RPAYC) invite competitors to participate in the Pittwater to Coffs Harbour Yacht Race.

The 40th running of the East Coast Classic race is held before Easter each year. Starting off Barrenjoey Headlands in Broken Bay, racing 226 nautical miles (nm) to Coffs Harbour.

Racing is open to offshore Cat3+ yachts, Monohulls and Multihulls with IRC - ORC - OMR - and Short-Handed Classes.

The race generally takes two days to complete and takes in some outstanding coastal scenery as you head north to beautiful Coffs Harbour.

On arrival in Coffs Harbour, the Coffs Harbour Yacht Club celebrates the weekend race, concluding with the presentation on Sunday afternoon.

The offshore yacht race is ideal for novice and experienced sailors. Sail into Coffs Harbour and be welcomed by the volunteer team from the Coffs Harbour Yacht Club and berth at the newly built Coffs Harbour International Marina.
host: The Royal Prince Alfred Yacht Club

title: Sydney to Auckland Ocean Yacht Race
description:
The race of a lifetime. Royal Prince Alfred Yacht Club together with the Royal Akarana Yacht Club invite competitors to participate in the Sydney to Auckland Ocean Yacht Race 2025.

The race will start in Sydney Harbour on 11 October 2025 and finish in Auckland Harbour. This challenging 1,250nm Category 1 race is open to offshore cruising and racing yachts, superyachts and ocean-racing multihulls. New for 2025 - Rally! Cruise your way to Auckland.

Join the race or watch the fleet sail out of Sydney Harbour as they cross the ditch to New Zealand.
host: The Royal Prince Alfred Yacht Club

title: Mona Vale Market
description:
Every Sunday, the market bursts to life with a vibrant mix of sights, sounds, and aromas. Featuring a wide variety of traders, it offers something for everyone from handcrafted goods to freshly prepared hot food. Stalls showcase an eclectic range of non-food items including home ware, vintage treasures, clothing, and artisan products. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, with local makers and independent sellers creating a lively, community-focused experience.

In addition to unique shopping opportunities, the market serves up a delicious array of hot food. Visitors can enjoy international street food and familiar favourites, all cooked fresh and ready to eat. Whether grabbing a quick bite or spending the afternoon browsing, the market invites exploration and connection.

More than just a shopping destination, this weekly event is a celebration of local enterprise and creativity. It brings people together in a dynamic open-air setting, making each Sunday a chance to discover something new.

title: Dried Flower Frame Art Workshop
description: Create stunning dried flower frame art at a class in Drummoyne. Unleash your creativity and take home a beautiful masterpiece. Come and enjoy a special and memorable experience. ClassBento donates one dollar from every booking to Dementia Australia.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Soldiers Point
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head'

title: Melinda Schneider: The Tender Tour - Soldiers Point
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Diesel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Lakeside Festival
description:
A boutique weekend festival for all ages at beautiful Forster-Tuncurry, kicking off with Lakeside Laughs comedy night on Friday night. 

The festival begins with Lakeside Laughs (Comedy Night) on Friday evening. The Lakeside Music Festival takes place on the following day and features brilliant live music with a gorgeous backdrop of the crystal blue waters of Wallis Lake. Great views, shady lawns and a single intimate stage create your perfect zone to chill out or dance till you drop.

Delicious food, including legendary Wallis Lake Seafood,  local wines, boutique beers and a safe kids' fun zone make Lakeside your perfect festival.

High-quality local products available at the on-site markets, offering a wide variety of items to suit every need, and at reasonable prices.

Sunday brings more live music and treats for your tastebuds with the Lakeside Long Lunch at many lake-view venues in Forster and Tuncurry. 

Come and make a weekend of it with many available accommodation options and much to see and do.

Tickets will be limited and will sell out.   

Lakeside Festival is 100 per cent not for profit and run by local volunteers simply for the love of music and our region.

title: Orange Grove Market
description:
Orange Grove Market is open every Saturday, rain or shine. This much-loved market has been operating for over 20 years at Orange Grove Public School in Leichhardt. Come and enjoy the best bacon and egg rolls in Sydney. Parking is available on-site or in surrounding streets. Organic Food Markets create open-air markets that offer a rich variety of food and non-food stalls. Visitors can do their weekly food shopping with access to both certified organic and conventionally grown fresh fruit and vegetables, freshly baked bread and patisserie, artisan gourmet produce (including delicacies like Aussie truffles), seasonal produce straight from the farmer, deli products, local and French cheese, fish, meat, and more. Hungry shoppers can get their caffeine fix and enjoy some of Sydney's best hot food.

The markets also feature a range of non-food stalls, including vintage items, fashion, jewelry, homewares, plants, and, of course, eco-friendly, sustainable, fair-trade, and healthy products. Each market has its own distinct character and offerings.

title: Gawura dance workshop and bushwalk
description:
Celebrate NAIDOC week's 50th year with cultural dance these school holidays.

Have fun, move and learn with the performers from Gawura Cultural Immersions. Participate in storytelling that has been alive for hundreds of thousands of years. Dance together and go on a guided bush tucker walk. Suitable for children 5 years old and up. Bring a snack, drink and shoes suitable for bushwalking and a hat.

title: The Beaches Farmers Market
description:
Every Friday, the vibrant Organic Food Markets host a lively community market featuring a diverse mix of stalls and local producers. Held in an open-air setting, this weekly event is a go-to destination for fresh organic produce, gourmet treats, and unique handmade goods.

From the early hours, the market fills with the delicious aroma of hot food from around the world ranging from sizzling street food to hearty vegetarian and vegan dishes. It's the perfect place to grab breakfast or lunch, with plenty of choices to suit every palate.

Beyond food, the market also showcases a variety of non-food stalls offering handmade crafts, eco-friendly home wares, clothing, plants, skincare products, and more. Many of the stallholders are small businesses and passionate artisans, giving visitors the chance to shop local and support sustainable, ethical practices.

Whether you're picking up fresh groceries, enjoying a tasty meal, or browsing for something special, the Friday market by Organic Food Markets is more than a shopping trip it's a weekly tradition that brings the community together. With a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere and a focus on quality, creativity, and sustainability, this market offers something for everyone.

title: Bon But Not Forgotten Celebrate AC/DC - Sydney
description:
Get ready to crank up the volume! Bon But Not Forgotten, the world-renowned AC/DC tribute band, is hitting the road for an epic Australian tour to mark five decades of legendary and electrifying rock ‘n’ roll. This high-voltage tour will celebrate AC/DC's iconic legacy, performing timeless hits that have shaped the sound of rock music across generations.

The Australian rock titans have delivered decades of anthems like “Highway to Hell” “T.N.T.” and “Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap” and Bon But Not Forgotten is set to pay homage to these classics.

The tour will feature an extraordinary lineup of musicians, including Cynthia Gallie, one of Australia’s most versatile rock vocalists. She’ll be joined by James Morley of The Angels on guitar, Bobby Poulton of Wolfmother on bass, Eddy Santacreu of Queen Orchestrated on guitar, and renowned drummer Dave Kirby. Together, they will recreate the raw power and energy of AC/DC’s Bon Scott and Brian Johnson eras, delivering a performance that fans won’t soon forget.

Described by The Rock Pit as “the closest you’ll get to the raw power and legendary sound of the original line-up” Bon But Not Forgotten has earned a reputation for their dynamic stage presence and precise musicianship. 

This year’s tour will feature special guests, Poundcake: The Van Halen Show, amplifying the celebration of 70’s rock n’ roll.

title: Rozelle Collectors Markets
description:
The Rozelle Collectors Market is one of Sydney's favourite outdoor second hand, bric-a-brac and antique markets. Stallholders have been selling their pre-loved wares to an ever expanding audience in the grounds of the Rozelle Public School for over 20 years, and the market community had developed a reputation as brilliant spot for a poke about, catch up with friends, and to bag some unique finds. 

This convenient inner-west open air market operates year round and offers a beautiful outdoor setting alongside the historical buildings of the Rozelle Public School that was established in 1877.

Browse a huge range of pre-loved antiques, collectibles, fashion, jewellery, art and music, all while being entertained by top notch local performers. And when you're in need of a break, local artisinal providores and international food stalls offer a delicious range of great value food.

title: Melinda Schneider - Tuncurry
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: The Viking Challenge
description:
A six-a-side Soccer tournament is held in the first weekend of March each year at Nth Tuncurry Sporting Complex. 

The event caters for Men and Women from A grade levels up to over 30 for ladies and 35 for men. Registrations open in December each year.

Up to 180 sides participate. And provides the opportunity for players and spectators to stay and enjoy the wonderful Great Lakes Area.

title: Rotary Club of Lower Midcoast Book Fair
description:
The twice-yearly Rotary Club of Lower Midcoast Book Fair is an opportunity for the public to come and buy donated second-hand books to support the Rotary Club of Lower Midcoast to raise money.

Money raised from this event goes back into the local community through the club's various programs.

Children's books section is 50 cents each, and other books are only AUD3.00 each (a few Antiquarian/Rare books may be pre-priced differently). Magazines are 50 cents each. An eclectic range of books, including an expanded Craft and Hobbies Section.

Free Entry and books may be paid for by Eftpos or Cash.

There will be two rooms of books. Room One is fiction books by authors' surname A-Z and an extensive children's Section. Room Two is non-fiction books by topic (over 15 topics).
host: Rotary Club of Lower Mid Coast

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Cammeray
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Cammeray
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head

title: Roger Knox  - Petersham
description:
Legendary Aboriginal Elder, entertainer and songwriter Uncle Roger Knox will perform in a stripped back acoustic mode for this uplifting storytelling and musical event. Riding on the success of his recent album release - Buluunarbi and the Old North Star - he will be joined by Toby Martin on this special Sunday afternoon.

Uncle Roger and Toby will play the entirety of the new album as well as a few old favourites. Buluunarbi and the Old North Star represents a cultural milestone for Uncle Roger as his first album of original material. Each song generously shares moments in his life and his travels as a Gomeroi songman, singing across his and our Country.

title: Engadine Street Festival
description: After a short hiatus, The Engadine Street Festival returns bigger and better than ever, promising an unforgettable day out for the whole community. With more than 200 stalls, thrilling rides, live music all day, children's entertainment, community performances, and incredible food, this event is one of the highlights of the Shire calendar, drawing huge crowds every year. Expect a vibrant, buzzing atmosphere filled with shopping, entertainment and local flavour.

title: There is a Platform Called Archibald
description:
Every year, one of the most anticipated events in the Australian art calendar is the Archibald Prize — a century-old portraiture award that both celebrates and challenges our understanding of who gets seen. Who is selected? Who is overlooked? Are the judging criteria truly inclusive? 

This exhibition brings those voices to the forefront. Curated by the influential artist and curator Shen Jiawei, There is a Platform Called Archibald features works by prominent Chinese-Australian artists who have either been finalists in the Archibald or have created works that respond to its legacy. These portraits — some celebrated, others overlooked — offer an invitation to rethink how we define value in portraiture. After all, art is not governed by a single standard.

The works on display explore themes such as the deconstruction of identity, reimagining cultural hybridity, and subtle critiques of systemic bias. These portraits offer rich, complex, and deeply human narratives, encouraging viewers to reconsider the traditional definitions of portraiture and reflect on the diverse stories that make up Australian identity.

title: Truffle Season - Long Table Degustation Lunch
description:
Robertson Truffles 2025 black Périgord truffle season is back for 2025.

The hunt and tasting menu, and cooking demonstrations are now fully booked out, but the Long Table degustation lunch is not to be missed.

title: The Sydney International Cup
description:
Australia's number one invitation-only end-of-season soccer tournament for girls and boys. 

Competition categories for boys/mixed teams for players aged 8 to 12 and all-girls teams for players aged 9 to 12.

The tournament format provides players with a unique opportunity to showcase their ability and passion for the game within the fantastic venue of Cromer Park Sports Complex on Sydney's beautiful Northern Beaches.

This year is the eleventh edition, the four-day tournament takes place annually over the October long weekend attracting international, interstate and local teams. 

Who will be crowned the 2024 Sydney International Cup Champions?
host: CNK Group Trustee for CNK Group t/as Sydney International Cup
