title: Focus: Australian government photographers
description:
Focus: Australian government photographers brings Australia's government photographers out of the darkroom and into the spotlight.

Between 1939 and 1996, dozens of photographers were employed by government agencies to capture Australian life. This fascinating exhibition delves deep into the lives and work of these talented individuals who helped to preserve their rich visual heritage, including Harry Frauca, Jocelyn Burt, Mervyn Bishop and many more.

Focus invites visitors on a journey spanning six decades of Australian life.

Explore a diverse selection of work that includes intimate nature photography, striking architectural shots and images that capture everyday memories from Australia's past. 

Step into the virtual darkroom and experience the magic of photography by watching pictures develop before your eyes.

Experience the power of photography to shape perceptions, ignite conversation and preserve memories.

This exhibition is supported by the National Collecting Institutions Touring and Outreach Program.

title: Northside Produce Market
description:
Northside Produce Market operates rain or shine on the 1st and 3rd Saturday of each month from 8am till midday, except for January when the market is closed on the 1st Saturday of that month.

Providing the best fresh produce, exceptional artisan food goods, breakfast, brunch and lunch. 

Northside Produce Market is a great asset to the Sydney community supporting the local and state wide food producers and connecting customers straight to the source. 

Keep up to date with the market on their Facebook and Instagram.

title: TCS Sydney Marathon  presented by ASICS
Melinda Schneider: The Tender Tour - Robertson
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Thread, Paper, Scissors - Paper Textile Possibilities
description:
Renowned creative Anzara Clark is running a special 4.5-day workshop exploring the fascinating potential of paper as a textile. 

In this hands-on workshop, you'll discover how to transform paper into cloth using traditional techniques, learning to manipulate and enhance it with texture, dimension, and colour. 

Explore the versatility of paper cloth—perfect for 2D artworks, soft sculptural forms, functional accessories, and even simple garments. Anzara will guide you through traditional Japanese paper thread-making methods and share ways to mark and dye your paper fabric. 

You'll then use your custom-made paper cloth to design and construct a functional accessory or artwork, using techniques specially adapted for paper textiles.

This workshop is open to all levels—whether you're new to working with textiles or an experienced maker curious about a new medium.

title: Hidden Stories. Faces of our Community (Multicultural Photography Exhibition)
description:
House to Grow, in collaboration with creative visual photographer and storyteller Pilar Lopez, is dedicated to illuminating and giving voice to the untold stories of multicultural community through the Multicultural Photography Exhibition "Hidden Stories: Faces of Our Community." Hosted at the historic Harold Park Community Hall (TramSheds), this exhibition will showcase a collection of creative photographs capturing the rich diversity and inspiring narratives of Australia. 

The event will feature performances from artists of various backgrounds, engaging speakers, and children's activities, aiming to celebrate diversity and amplify the unique experiences that shape our vibrant society.

Pilar Lopez is not only a creative photographer and founder of Shooting For a Reason but also a storyteller, migrant, and CEO of House to Grow charity. With a passion for people, photography, and community empowerment, Pilar has combined these three passions into a career over the past 25 years. She is a dedicated advocate for inclusion, diversity, and equality, and has received multiple awards.

Please note that attendance is only permitted by confirmed registration.

title: Tramsheds Gem and Crystal Expo
description:
Experience the epitome of elegance at this boutique, where you'll discover a captivating world of exquisite gemstones, jewellery, minerals, decorative pieces, and fossils.

For discerning jewellers seeking the finest gemstones and lapidary rough, the quest ends here. The collection boasts a stunning array of gemstones that will inspire your craft and elevate your creations.

Are you in search of that one-of-a-kind piece of jewellery that sets you apart from the crowd? Look no further; they specialize in unique, standout pieces that reflect your individuality.

If your desire is to adorn your home or office with a striking, bold statement, then consider their fine fossils and decorative minerals. These pieces not only add elegance but also convey your distinctive style.

Indulge in a boutique experience like no other, where beauty, rarity, and sophistication converge.

title: Conscience by Joe DiPietro
description:
The Australian Premiere of Tony Award-winning playwright Joe DiPietro's Conscience, directed by Madeleine Stedman, brings this pivotal moment to the stage. 

The play delves into the intense political and personal dynamics between Smith and McCarthy, portraying Smith as a dry-witted hero with the rare courage to take on a lying bully sowing chaos and threatening the nation's fabric. As McCarthy's influence unravels, the narrative underscores the enduring relevance of standing up against tyranny.

A timely run production  by Joining the Dots Theatre. This production invites audiences to reflect on the power of individual conviction in the face of widespread fear and the importance of remembering those who dared to speak out when others remained silent.

title: Zepplin: The Life and Times of Led Zeppelin - Sutherland
description:
Zepplin brings to life the electrifying music and legendary stories of one of rock’s greatest bands. In a two-hour concert production, Zepplin delivers over 26 iconic songs, narrated stories, and rare archival footage, creating an immersive journey through Led Zeppelin’s rise to fame.

With a lineup of internationally acclaimed musicians, Zepplin captures the raw energy, intensity, and passion of the original band. Jesse Attard channels Robert Plant with powerful, controlled vocals, while Dean Blackborough stuns audiences with blistering Jimmy Page solos. On bass, Ian Graham flawlessly delivers John Paul Jones' intricate riffs, and Michael Bianco embodies John Bonham’s thunderous drumming, delivering a solo that must be seen to be believed. Lionel Caesar completes the lineup, recreating the epic soundscapes that defined Led Zeppelin’s legendary catalogue.

With rave reviews from fans and critics alike, audiences call it "as close to the real Led Zeppelin as you're gonna see" and "an absolute must-see for any Zepp fan." Don’t miss your chance to experience Zepplin—the Led Zeppelin Rockumentary

title: Sydney Harbour New Year’s Eve Fireworks Cruise!
description:
The ultimate New Year's Eve cruise fireworks spectacular experience! 

This vessel hosts a rocking New Year’s Eve party providing the best views of all the must-see NYE events on Sydney Harbour!

The Harbour Spirit New Year’s Eve Cruise Sydney package includes a 5.5-hour cruise, a roving service of appetizers, a selection of Australian beers, wines, sparkling wine, soft drinks, and a more substantial gourmet grazing station to see you through the night. 

As the sun goes down on Sydney Harbour, the Harbour Spirit gives guests spectacular views of all the action on Sydney Harbour, including the Harbour of Light Parade and the grand finale, the spectacular midnight fireworks display.

title: Daniel Pata: High Country | Solo Exhibition
description:
Daniel Pata's latest solo exhibition "High Country" is dominated by works depicting Katoomba and the Jamison Valley, which he understands to be one of the largest canyons in the world. The exhibition showcases spectacular precipitous cliffs, clouded valleys, and vast distances—an extraordinary opportunity to explore the equally vast range of colours, tones, and rich textures on display, as well as the fascinating interplay of space. For Daniel, these qualities continue to reveal themselves more deeply with each return visit.

In this exhibition, Pata continues to explore material produced en plein air from the Snowy Mountains and his ongoing work in the Blue Mountains, a place that he considers one of the great places on earth, where the pictorial impact remains as exhilarating as ever.

For Daniel Pata, the high country holds a special spiritual presence. Reflecting on his first show and Lloyd Reese's encouraging comment that he should continue working in the "high country", he now sees that advice as having truly come to pass.

Daniel Pata is represented in major Public Collections in Australia and internationally, including the Gosford Regional Gallery Collection, NSW; Sturt University, NSW; National Gallery of Australia, Canberra, ACT; St Peter's College, Oxford University, UK, and numerous Corporate and Private collections in Australia, Europe, USA.

title: The Ester Spirits Negroni Masterclass
description:
The Ester Spirits Negroni Masterclass is an immersive experience for cocktail lovers, offering a hands-on journey through the art of Negroni-making.

Discover three unique takes on the beloved ruby-hued classic, from timeless recipes to bold, experimental riffs. Taste the latest aperitivo release alongside exclusive, unreleased products from the Ester Spirits range.

Savour curated Italian cheese and charcuterie pairings, designed to complement your suite of Negronis. Guests also receive a special discount on the day, making it easy to continue perfecting their craft at home.

title: Naturism
description:
No internet. No intruders. No clothes.

Far from the trappings of civilisation, a group of nudist baby boomers have created their very own off-grid bush eco-paradise. An unseasonably hot summer approaches, but no worries! They've got enough preserves, pickles, and Fleetwood Mac to get them through it… probably.

Enter Evangeline—a Gen Z eco-influencer, on the run from something terrible. She's loud. She's over-sensitive. And she wants to stay.

Set in a time of unforgiving drought, with hot winds foretelling worse times ahead, an all-nude, all-legendary cast takes you on an hilarious journey of hope and delusion in the face of disaster.

Playwright Ang Collins (Blueberry Play, Spewy) makes her mainstage debut with a work of glittering comic absurdity. Teaming up with Artistic Director Declan Greene (The Lewis Trilogy, Sex Magick), Naturism takes an irreverent and deeply messy look at just how much heat our squishy, naked little bodies can take.

title: Illawarra Beekeepers Open Day
description:
After a highly successful Open Day in 2024, the Illawarra Beekeepers, at Sutherland, have another Open Day for 2025.

Members of the public are invited to come and see the Bees at their Bee Garden and Clubhouse.

There will be information sessions, kids corner, honey tasting and sales, a sausage sizzle and opportunities to suit up and get close to the bees.

title: Choirboys - Run To Paradise - Sydney
description:
As young twenty-something-year-olds, Choirboys formed in 1978, growing up on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The wild, hedonistic lifestyle the band witnessed of the youth in the 70s is ultimately what gave birth to their seminal rock anthem, Run To Paradise. It’s all about the stories that sound all too familiar within the culture widely assumed of the music industry - “sex, drugs, and rock ‘n’ roll” and they tell it all.

Run To Paradise is a “spilling of the beans” of sorts. It’s part story, part song that chronicles through some of the wildest, most risqué, outrageous, and downright hilarious stories of Australian Rock. All, as these Oz pub-rock icons recall it.

Behind the narrative are the classic songs that define the musical landscape of rock music in the ’70s and '80s, including Deep Purple’s “Smoke On The Water”, Chuck Berry’s ‘Never Can Tell’, TMG’s ‘Jump In My Car’, Dragon’s ‘Are You Old Enough’, AC/DC’s ‘Long Way To The Top’ and of course, the Choirboys hits ‘Boys Will Be Boys’ ‘Never Gonna Die’ ‘Struggletown’ and the pub-rock anthem ‘Run to Paradise’, to name a few.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Dee Why
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of life’s biggest questions: 'Why are we here? Are we alone in the universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You’ll laugh and you’ll learn, but you’ll never look at anything the same, once you enter… The Mind Field.

title: Back to the Future The Musical - Sydney
description:
Take an electrifying ride back in time with London’s Olivier Award winning best new musical.

Back to the Future: The Musical is coming to the Sydney Lyric Theatre in 2025 for its Australian Premiere.

Welcome to Hill Valley! When Marty McFly finds himself transported back to 1955 in a time machine built by the eccentric scientist Doc Brown, he accidentally changes the course of history. Now he’s in a race against time to fix the present, escape the past and send himself… back to the future.

Set your destination time, Sydney and get ready to make musical theatre history.

title: MJ the Musical
description:
He is one of the greatest entertainers of all time. Now, Michael Jackson's unique and unparalleled artistry is thrilling audiences in Sydney in the multiple Tony Award®-winning musical MJ. 

Centred around the making of his 1992 Dangerous World Tour, MJ goes beyond the singular moves and signature sound of the star, offering a rare look at the creative mind and collaborative spirit that catapulted Jackson into legendary status. 

Created by Tony Award®-winning Director / Choreographer Christopher Wheeldon and two-time Pulitzer Prize winner Lynn Nottage.

Now playing at Sydney Lyric Theatre.

title: Kirribilli Markets
description:
The Kirribilli Market is one of Sydney’s most iconic and internationally renowned markets and has been a favourite with both locals and visitors for over 49 years.

The Kirribilli Markets is one of Sydney’s most popular markets, held on the first and second Sunday and fourth Saturday of every month. Featuring stalls selling new and vintage fashion, accessories, emerging local fashion designers, home and gift wares, arts and crafts, jewellery, plants, gourmet foods and a whole lot more.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Cremorne
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: On Time
description:
Set against Sydney Observatory's timeless backdrop, On Time is a four-part talk series exploring the philosophy of time. 

Join journalist Rachel Hocking with leading thinkers including Professor Dean Rickles and Professor Kristie Miller to examine how time governs our world by measuring moments, defining cycles and shaping our deepest sense of self.

title: Secret Strike – War on our Shores
description:
Step into history and uncover the covert mission that shook Sydney in a new exhibition focused on the dramatic events of the Japanese midget submarine attack on Sydney Harbour.

The year 2025 marks 80 years since the end of World War II, a pivotal moment in global history. To commemorate this significant anniversary, the museum presents Secret Strike – War on the Shores, focusing on the dramatic events of the Japanese midget submarine attack on Sydney Harbour.

This exhibition offers a unique view of this wartime event, featuring the stern section of the midget submarine M22 and voice pipes from the ill-fated HMAS Kuttabul. Explore the story of the raid, view historic images depicting the aftermath of the attack, and hear firsthand accounts of how this event impacted the lives of everyday Australians.

title: Nocturne at Pier Pavilion
description:
Experience the magic of music at Nocturne, a free four-week concert series in the stunning new Pier Pavilion.
Escape the ordinary this winter with Nocturne, a mesmerising four-week series of free concerts in Barangaroo's breathtaking new Pier Pavilion.

Immerse yourself in captivating musical soundscapes curated by Musica Viva Australia and performed by talented Sydney musicians. Each Thursday, Friday, and Saturday evening, visitors can enjoy a program of contemporary chamber music and classical interpretations of modern tunes.

Discover the acoustic brilliance of the Pier Pavilion, as it transforms into an intimate setting for unforgettable sonic journeys. 

No tickets required, just gather your loved ones and embrace this unique opportunity to enjoy world-class music under the stars in a spectacular waterfront location completely free!

title: Blak Markets In The Rocks
description:
Blak Markets is making its return to Tallawoladah Lawn in The Rocks, overlooking the iconic Sydney Harbour. Created by Indigenous charity First Hand Solutions, Blak Markets gives the chance to shop and support a good cause, with 100 percent of all profits going back into enriching First Nations communities. 

Blak Markets will feature 20 plus unique Indigenous Australian stalls selling a range of authentic and handmade artworks, jewellery and homewares. It’s the perfect opportunity to grab a meaningful gift for yourself and loved ones while celebrating First Nations makers, artists and small business owners.

title: Sam Campbell - Window Sucker - Newtown
description:
Odd comedian Sam Campbell is en route to shed new light on all of the funniest topics before your very (beautiful) eyes. This guy is the full package but not the full dollar. Beneath every seat, they will place a loaded syringe, just in case he gets too carried away. Try to inject him near his spinal column if you dare or indeed can catch him.

Green Faces Finalist and Mo Award Nominee.

title: The Morning Shift Australia & New Zealand Tour - Sydney
description:
After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa's favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they'll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever Live tour.

Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.

title: HOKA Runaway Sydney Half Marathon
description:
For a few amazing hours in perfect Autumn running conditions, the best of Sydney's city streets are yours to enjoy. None of the big city hustle and bustle, just wide-open city streets, stunning views and the buzz of Australia's biggest half-marathon all around you.

More than 20,000 runners participated in 2025 on a  spectacular 21.1 or 10 kilometre course taking in the best of Sydney's iconic landscape, including views of the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, The Rocks and Pyrmont Peninsula. 

The most impressive race of its kind in Australia, the course attracts a mix of local, interstate and overseas runners, coming together to challenge themselves and achieve a personal best.

title: Wildlife Photographer of the Year
description:
See the world through a new lens and experience the breathtaking beauty and raw power of nature in Wildlife Photographer of the Year.

Returning for its 60th year, direct from the Natural History Museum in London, this extraordinary showcase invites you to witness the awe-inspiring diversity of life on Earth and the urgent need for its protection.

This year's competition attracted an astounding 59,228 entries from 117 countries, celebrating the very best in nature photography. From mesmerising animal behaviour to breathtaking landscapes and powerful photojournalism, each image is a testament to the artistry, patience, and dedication of photographers from around the world.

Featuring 100 stunning images across multiple categories, including Animals in Their Environment, Underwater, and Photojournalism, this exhibition will take you on a journey through Earth's most extraordinary moments.

title: NAIDOC Week Open Day
description:
The Australian National Maritime Museum kicks off NAIDOC week with a FREE Family Fun Day, honouring the theme for 2025 The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy. 

Celebrate the oldest, continuous living cultures on earth, exploring stories and knowledge of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

The day will begin with a Smoking Ceremony led by Elder Uncle Les, providing a foundation of respect and tradition. 

From there, the celebrations continue with a range of engaging and educational activities including dance workshops with the incredible Bangarra Dance Company, sharing movement and story through culture. Indulge in bush drinks and native plant workshops with Koori Kulcha, where you'll taste delicious beverages. 

The kids can enjoy face painting and an array of art-making activities including a drop in mural making workshop with Nioka Lowe-Brennan.

There will also be live music performances throughout the day, bringing rhythm and energy to every corner of the celebration.

title: Wentworth Park Antique and Collectors Fair
description: The Wentworth Park Antique and Collectors Fair is a long-running bi-monthly Antique and Collectors Fair in Glebe. The event features over 140 stalls of everything antique and collectable.

title: NSW Wine Cellar Door at Rocks Markets
description:
Discover the best of NSW's wines at the Cellar Door experience.

Step into the enchanting world of NSW's vineyards without leaving Sydney! The Rocks Markets brings the NSW Wine Cellar Door to your doorstep. Celebrate the diverse and exquisite wines that NSW has to offer.

Purchase tastings, glasses and bottles to take home for your dinner party.

Plus, you get to meet the passionate people behind the bottles and discover your new favourite drop, all in a stunning spot under the Harbour Bridge.

title: Fire Pit Cinema Under The Stars
description:
Christmas flicks by the fire with marshmallows and mulled wine equals the Winter's Perfect Combo. 

This winter, Sydney is getting a cinematic experience like no other and it involves crackling fire pits, classic Christmas movies, marshmallows roasting, and mulled wine under the stars.

As part of the beloved Christmas in July Festival in the Rocks, the city will welcome the first-ever Fire Pit Cinema in Australia, taking place for ten nights only. Set against the historic backdrop of Cadmans Cottage in The Rocks, this pop-up experience offers the coziest winter night out.

Guests will be able to book their own private fire pit for two to six people, settle in under a blanket, sip on steaming hot chocolate or mulled wine, and enjoy timeless Christmas flicks like Home Alone, Elf, Love Actually, The Holiday and Last Christmas; all while toasting marshmallows over the fire. It's romantic, nostalgic and wonderfully festive.

Each booking includes a reserved fire pit, cosy blankets, marshmallows to roast, and outdoor cinema access. Whether you're planning a date night, a winter catch-up with friends, or a magical family outing, the Fire Pit Cinema is a movie night reimagined, warm, atmospheric and totally unforgettable.

title: Australia Day Dinner Cruise - Harbourside Cruises
description:
Join in on Sydney Harbour and celebrate a magnificent Australia Day.

This is a great opportunity to celebrate Australia Day in style with your friends and family while cruising Sydney Harbour. Enjoy a relaxing Sydney Harbour cruise and view the spectacular Australia Day fireworks onboard Harbour Spirit.

Celebrate Australia Day on a 4-hour Sydney Harbour Australia Day dinner cruise onboard the fully air-conditioned luxurious Harbour Spirit

Shared cruises with other groups on-board. Harbourside Cruises outdoor decks have spectacular Australia Day Fireworks and Sydney Harbour views.

title: Melinda Schneider - The 'Tender' Tour - Marrickville
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Bloom sings Eva Cassidy Songbook | Marrickville
description:
With sold out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Bloom is highly applauded as “one of Australia’s finest vocalists”, some even placing her in the same company, vocally, of those very artists she pays tribute to in her stage productions ‘Adele & Amy Winehouse Songbook’ and the ‘Stevie Nicks, Carole King & Linda Ronstadt Songbook’. Bloom now extends her focus toward another soulful musical powerhouse – Eva Cassidy.

Eva’s soul-stirring voice came to prominence in 1998 after her renditions of “Fields of Gold” and “Over the Rainbow” were released… two years after her passing.

Sadly, her inability to be signed by a record label, unsure of how to market her eclectic repertoire, meant Eva only released one solo album in her lifetime – Live at Blues Alley – an album she recorded and self-released in 1996. It wasn’t until 1998 that her posthumously released recordings would pique the interest of the small West Coast folk music label Blix Street Records. Her first posthumously released album “Songbird”, became a major international hit and earned the songstress subsequent number one albums across the globe, selling in excess of 12 million sales worldwide.

Bloom will once again enthral audiences across the country in this intimate and acoustic performance featuring all of Eva’s hits including “Songbird” “Time After Time” “Fields of Gold” “Over The Rainbow” and many more.

title: National Indigenous Art Fair
description:
Celebrate contemporary Indigenous Australian art, design, food and culture at the annual National Indigenous Art Fair Overseas Passenger Terminal, at Gadigal Country, The Rocks, Sydney.

This iconic annual event held on Sydney Harbour’s stunning foreshore showcases the latest award-winning ideas and innovations from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists, designers, and makers from around the country.

The National Indigenous Art Fair also represents an incredible gathering of indigenous creatives, with many travelling from the far corners of Australia – places like Ramingining, the Tiwi Islands and Yuendumu in the Northern Territory. 

There will also be a colourful festival atmosphere with bush tucker cooking demonstrations, weaving and cultural workshops, live music, children’s activities and Aboriginal dance performances. 

With a full schedule of live experiences including talks, demonstrations, tastings, master workshops, and daily performances, it’s a great day out for all the family. Everyone’s welcome to look, listen, learn, and join in!

title: Sydney Spirits Festival
description:
Get ready for the ultimate celebration of flavour and craftsmanship at Australia’s largest and most diverse spirits festival! Over three unforgettable days, indulge in an incredible mix of Australian and international brands showcasing their finest creations.

Discover 100s of exceptional spirits, including whisk(e)y, gin, soju, schnapps, rum, vodka, vermouth, grappa, tequila, liqueurs, fortified wines, and more. This is your chance to savour rare and iconic tastes, meet the makers, and immerse yourself in the vibrant world of spirits like never before.

Don’t miss the event that has spirit enthusiasts buzzing—mark your calendar and join the party!

title: Bastille Festival Sydney
description:
Celebrate the Bastille French festival, bringing the best food, wine, and art since 2013.

So, dig your beret out of the cupboard and get ready to join the 4-day French food, wine and art revolution, the likes of which Sydney has never seen before!

The ​Bastille Festival Sydney​ is a free entry, French cultural celebration of food, wine and art, held annually in Sydney's Circular Quay and The Rocks.

title: The Intelligence of Painting
description:
The Intelligence of Painting throws a spotlight on the energy of contemporary painting in Australia today through the work of 14 Australian women artists.

The exhibition includes recent MCA Collection acquisitions, as well as new and recent paintings by Karen Black, Angela Brennan, Eleanor Louise Butt, Prudence Flint, Maria Madeira, Thea Anamara Perkins, Kerrie Poliness, Jude Rae, Jessica Rankin, Julie Nangala Robertson, Gemma Smith, Jelena Telecki, Jenny Watson and Nyapanyapa Yunupingu.

title: Cerith Wyn Evans
description:
Experience epic contemporary environments of light and sound created by UK-based artist Cerith Wyn Evans in the MCA Australia's major winter exhibition.

Conceived as if the audience were strolling through a garden, the exhibition invites you to meditate and contemplate a passage through space and time. 

Monumental light sculptures will occupy the MCA's double-height exhibition galleries, including F=O=U=N=T=A=I=N (2020), an architectural wall of white neon three metres tall and ten metres wide, which audiences are welcome to walk around and through.​

The exhibition includes a significant selection of major works, most of which have never been seen before in Australia.

Tours, talks, film screenings and family programs are on offer throughout the exhibition.

title: Improv Comedy Cagefight
description:
Sydney's best-rated, longest and wildest comedy battle show! Every Monday comedians compete for comedy glory.

Join the Cagefight for a wild, unpredictable and hilarious comedy show! This is where Sydney comedians are pitted against each other and they use their wits and improv skills to generate nonstop laughs.

The audience picks on the comedians, not the other way around! Audiences vote on their favourite comedians - the winners perform again. Think of a mishmash between 'Whose Line Is It Anyway' and 'Thank God You're Here'.

This show is awesome for those who love improv, stand-up comedy and unpredictable shows that are jam-packed full of jokes.

title: The Welcome Choir Sydney
description:
There is no audition, reading music or ongoing commitment for this choir, all you have to do is turn up on the day and sing. Run by soul, funk, and RnB musician Bek Jensen, the choir preaches an all-welcome philosophy, not just singing ability but all ages, gender and culture too. Each session is a two-hour affair featuring a different song each time, with Jensen taking you through some vocal warm-ups before leading the group to sing in harmony.

The pop-in choir runs monthly on the Central Coast and once every three months in Sydney. Check the socials for details for event dates or to know what song is coming up in the next session.

title: Newtown Record Fair
description:
Newtown Record Fair is your friendly record fair in the heart of Newtown.

Every couple of months the vinyl community meets up to cratedig over 20,000 new, secondhand and collectable vinyl for sale with expert local inner-west record sellers. 

Also vinyl deejays, full craft beer bar, yummy restaurant and dog/kid-friendly surrounds. What's not to love? Oh and its always free entry.

title: Signature Dining at SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium
description:
Signature Dining is Back for 2025. 

Get ready to elevate your evening with Signature Dining at SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium! This restaurant-style, fine dining experience combines a decadent three-course meal and a two-hour drinks package with the magic of dining surrounded by hundreds of marine creatures. 

2025 brings even more excitement with exclusive, private tables set in intimate, breathtaking locations across the aquarium. Perfect for date nights, special celebrations, or an unforgettable night out!

Please Note: This is an 18+ only event, ensuring a serene, exclusive, and romantic atmosphere for your evening.

Book now to secure your spot for this extraordinary date night experience and create memories as unique as the stunning marine world surrounding you.

title: Glebe Markets
description:
The Glebe Markets is one of Sydney's most popular and iconic markets that has been running for over 30 years.  A must-visit, the Glebe Markets has  200 stalls to shop and browse from and is a located in the heart of Glebe at the Glebe Public School.  Renown for its wonderful diverse and eclectic mix of stalls with everything from local Australian fashion designers, hand-made jewellery, homewares & crafts by local artisans, original art and an extensive line up of vintage and pre-loved fashion along with amazing fresh food from around the globe. 

You'll find people hanging-out with friends for the great vibes, great finds and live entertainment.

title: Dirty Dancing in Concert – Sydney
description:
Enjoy the digitally remastered hit film like never before on a full-sized cinema screen with a live band and singers performing the iconic songs. With a soundtrack that marked a generation, Dirty Dancing in Concert promises to bring an enchanting and unique experience to the classic 80s film.

Directly following the film, the band and singers will throw an encore party that will surely take you back to the time of your life as you sing and dance to your favourite songs featured in Dirty Dancing.

Set in the summer of 1963, Baby Houseman (Jennifer Grey) and her family vacation to the beautiful Catskills resort, Kellerman's Mountain House. Intrigued by the staff's dance instructor, Johnny Castle (Patrick Swayze), and the vastly different lifestyle of others, Baby finds herself learning to dance while having the time of her life and falling in love. It becomes a summer she never forgets.

Immerse yourself in the timeless romance of Baby and Johnny and experience one of the most memorable movies of the past 30-plus years like never before.

title: Sydney MindBodySpirit Festival
description: Learn from over 160 exhibitors, catch free seminars and performances, book yourself a psychic reading, find just the right gift, attend a workshop and taste some delicious health foods!

title: International Mining and Resources Conference
description:
As Australia's largest and most influential mining event, the International Mining and Resources Conference creates a global conversation, mobilises the industry for collaboration in the mining, investment, and technology industries for three days of learning, delivering ideas and unparalleled networking. 

International Mining and Resources Conference brings together mining leaders, investors, government representatives, technology innovators, and industry experts from over 120 countries.

title: Fireworks at Darling Harbour
description:
See the night sky light up with spectacular fireworks at Darling Harbour.

Grab yourself a ringside seat around Cockle Bay, or a bite to eat in one of the many harbourside restaurants, and enjoy an amazing fireworks display each Saturday night during January at Darling Harbour.

See the website for dates and where to get the best views.

Brought to you by Placemaking NSW, Cockle Bay Wharf, King Street Wharf, Darling Quarter, New Sydney Waterfront and Novotel Darling Harbour.

title: Free Spanish Classes Sydney
description:
Were you thinking of learning Spanish in Sydney but you are not sure if Spanish is for you? 

Try one of the group classes for free before committing to any of the  Spanish courses.

Spanish Blackboard Academy has some of the best native Spanish teachers in Sydney. All of the teachers in the team are university-qualified with a Master’s Degree in teaching Spanish as a second language. In addition, they are official examiners of DELE (Diplomas de Español como Lengua Extranjera), the internationally recognised Spanish certificate.

If you want to learn Spanish in Sydney, please do not hesitate to contact them. They are looking forward to seeing you in one of our Free Spanish Lessons Sydney or their Spanish Courses Sydney!

Online Spanish classes are also available.

title: New Year’s Eve in Sydney
description:
As the clock winds down on 2025, the atmosphere in Sydney becomes electric. 

The city is getting ready for the biggest party of the year, where more than one million people gather around Sydney Harbour to watch the world-famous fireworks display. 

It's a time for locals and visitors to come together and celebrate, to feel nostalgia for the year that was and hope for the year to come. 

You'll feel that shared sense of belonging whether you're sitting in a park by the water or in a ritzy rooftop bar.

title: Sydney Fringe Festival
description:
Prepare for an unexpected and exhilarating month filled with over 450 jaw-dropping events presented in over 70 venues across Greater Sydney.

From the pulsating heart of the city to its hidden historical gems, Sydney Fringe Festival is bringing you bespoke experiences that celebrate local stories and strengthen the bond between festival-goers and the city's rich tapestry of communities. Secure your tickets and dive into a kaleidoscope of creativity as Sydney is transformed into a riot of colour and culture this September!

title: Sydney Home Show
description:
Looking for the latest trends and innovations for your home improvement project? 

Look no further than the Sydney Home Show! Held twice a year, the Sydney Home Show is NSW’s largest consumer exhibition dedicated to all things home. With everything you need under one roof, you can compare products, get expert advice and find inspiration for your dream home.

Expect to find everything from major appliances and décor items to building products and services. It’s a great way to see, test and compare the latest offerings from all your favourite home improvement companies. 

Enjoy Show specials, free seminars, and early access to new products and sales.

title: Care Expo Sydney
description:
No matter what level of assistance you or your loved ones need, Care Expo will connect you to the right people.

They are proud to showcase the latest in products and services for in-home care, aged care, healthcare support, disability care, mental health and general wellness.

A spirited speakers program will entertain you and present new thinking on what is available to assist you or your loved ones.

This event will help you to be better informed and confident and will empower you to lead your best life.

title: NAIDOC Week in Darling Harbour
description:
NAIDOC Week presents an opportunity for all Australians to learn about First Nations cultures and histories, and to participate in celebrations of the oldest, continuous living culture on earth.

The 2025 theme "The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy" celebrates not only the achievements of the past but the bright future ahead, empowered by the strength of our young leaders, the vision of our communities, and the legacy of our ancestors. 

Celebrate in Darling Harbour with:

Welcome to Country and Smoking Ceremony. Fire up NAIDOC Week as First Nations elders take you through a Welcome to Country, Smoking Ceremony and special cultural dance performances at Cockle Bay Green.

Fireworks on select nights. To celebrate in Darling Harbour enjoy a spectacular NAIDOC-themed fireworks show.

Visit the website for full schedule and information. 

Brought to you by Placemaking NSW.

title: Badu Gili: Healing Spirit
description:
Badu Gili - meaning 'water light' in the language of the traditional owners of Bennelong Point, the Gadigal - is a free daily experience that explores First Nations stories in a spectacular six-minute projection on the Opera House's eastern Bennelong sails.

Badu Gili: Healing Spirit illuminates the eastern Bennelong sails with a dynamic projection displaying the works of celebrated First Nations artists, the late Bidjigal elder Esme Timbery and her children Marilyn Russell and Steven Russell, and artist Joseca Mokahesi Yanomami of the Yanomami people in the Amazon. 

The lighting of the sails takes place each day at the top of the Monumental Steps from sunset.

*Times are subject to change with the seasons and Forecourt events. Check the website for screening times.

title: Juan Diego Flórez in Recital - Sydney
description:
With a career that includes performances on the world's leading stages, Juan Diego Flórez has established himself as one of opera's greatest talents. Adored by fans and critics worldwide, Flórez's stunningly expressive and agile voice has garnered international acclaim—most notably for his performances of the bel canto style and French Romantic repertoire.

As an international recording artist, Flórez has released numerous solo albums and operas securing his place among the greatest performers of all time. Hailing from Lima, Peru, Flórez's generosity, charisma and passion inspire his many philanthropic endeavours, including Sinfonía por el Perú—a social project that uses the power of music to help vulnerable children and adolescents. His numerous accolades include Peru's highest distinction, the Gran Cruz de la Orden El Sol, and being recognised as a Kammersänger by the Austrian government in 2012.

title: Marcia Sings Summer
description:
Donna Summer sold over 100 million albums, won five Grammy Awards and had 32 chart singles in the Billboard Top 100, including 14 top ten and four number-one singles. 

Join Marcia Hines and special guest Casey Donovan for an evening of putting the Concert Hall acoustics to good use as they bust out the classics; Hot Stuff, Bad Girls, I Feel Love, Love to Love You Baby, She Works Hard for the Money, This Time I know it's for Real and many more. Accompanying them, a nine-piece band on stage led by musical director and drummer, Joe Accaria.

This will be a celebration of the life and music of one of the world's best-selling music artists of all time and the undisputed Queen of Disco.

title: Ray Chen in Recital - Sydney
description:
Renowned violin virtuoso Ray Chen returns to Hamer Hall for a breathtaking recital that promises to captivate and inspire.

Known for his virtuosity, expressive style and compelling stage presence, Ray Chen will perform a diverse program demonstrating why he is one of the most sought-after violinists worldwide.

With his Dolphin Stradivarius violin and charismatic interpretations, this event promises to be an unforgettable experience for classical music enthusiasts.

title: Moss Piglet
description:
Playful and thrilling, Moss Piglet is an epic new work for families about how even the tiniest of things can be the strongest. 

Prepare to embark on an extraordinary journey through the microscopic world of the tardigrade… perhaps you’ve heard of them?

title: The Twits
description:
Roald Dahl's gruesome twosome The Twits return to stage to delight and disgust in equal measure. Unmissable fun for all the family packed with Dahlicious mischief, hilarious mayhem, and big belly laughs!

Mr and Mrs Twit are the nastiest couple you could ever hope (not) to meet – both on a quest to be meaner than the other – but who will outwit the Twits? Full of trickery and wickedly-funny pranks, this infamous pair ultimately highlight the need to treat others with love and care and shows that spreading positivity is far more enjoyable.

Packed with Dahlicious mischief, hilarious mayhem and humongous belly laughs, The Twits is unmissable theatre for all ages, from the team that brought us the sold-out season of Fantastic Mr Fox, George's Marvelous Medicine and Revolting Rhymes & Dirty Beasts.

You've read the book – now get to the theatre and experience this family classic from the wacky mind of the world's No. 1 Storyteller live on stage.

title: Murmur
description:
For the first time in Australia, join Murmur's visual circus and a multi-sensory acrobatic sound composition! This is an imaginative performance for everyone who sometimes longs to be more than just human.

Camiel is building a world full of sounds. A purring cat comes from a pocket, a swarm of bees flies through the air, two arms create the sound of cars. Far away you hear a finger squeaking on a window. Sea becomes wind becomes breath. 

Surrounded by the audience, Camiel jumps, falls, rolls and flies in his attempt to compose the world. Suddenly the audience's backpacks start to buzz and everything and everyone becomes part of a swirl of sounds in a loudspeaker landscape.

title: Garden of Earthly Delights - Sydney
Where is the Green Sheep?
description:
For the first time on the stage, Monkey Baa Theatre Company brings the theatrical adaption of beloved Australian classic to life; Mem Fox’s and Judy Horacek’s Where is the Green Sheep?

Where is the Green Sheep? is an immersive visual theatre experience based on the beloved children’s book by Mem Fox and Judy Horacek. We meet Blue Sheep who loves his blue flowers and Red Sheep who loves to cartwheel in the fields, Bath Sheep who loves bubbles and Bed Sheep who loves to bounce ... But where IS that Green Sheep?

Blending puppetry and animation, this beautiful production invites young audiences to join our three farmers on their quest to find the elusive green sheep. Co-created with students from Bankstown West Public School, this delightful production integrates their voices as narrators, ensuring the work resonates deeply with young audiences.

title: The Music of John Lennon - Give Peace a Chance - Sydney
description:
An extraordinary line up of Australian singers & musicians perform 32 John Lennon classics — touring Australia this July!

Get ready to experience the raw energy of Come Together, the heartfelt vulnerability of Jealous Guy, the timeless hope of Imagine and the pure rock 'n' roll spirit of Help—alongside beloved classics like In My Life, Strawberry Fields Forever, All You Need Is Love and Give Peace a Chance.  

Backed by an all-star band, five of Australia's most electrifying singer-songwriters are joining forces to unleash the extraordinary musical world of John Lennon. Adalita (Magic Dirt), Diesel, Steve Kilbey (The Church), Isabella Manfredi (The Preatures), and Kevin Mitchell (aka Bob Evans/Jebediah) will dive deep into Lennon's musical journey—from the Beatles' revolutionary anthems to his most intimate solo masterpieces. 

Set in the Sydney Opera House, this is more than a tribute. It's a celebration of Lennon the songwriter, the radical, the dreamer.

title: A Very Old Man with Enormous Wings
description:
A magic-realist gem of theatre and storytelling for all ages from Ireland, using a combination of music, puppetry and live video projection. 

Inspired by the story by Gabriel Garcia Marquez.

title: Mario the Maker Magician
description:
Contagiously upbeat and full of heart, the ever-innovative Mario the Maker Magician leads you through an explosion of handmade art and robot magic for all ages. 

He's "magic's punk rock Peter Pan philosopher!" Do what you love, use what you have and have fun!

title: Mahlerfest
description:
Prepare to be part of history! This once-in-a-lifetime concert pairs Mahler's Fourth and Fifth symphonies in a single, breathtaking evening – a feat rarely attempted worldwide, and one that promises to transcend the boundaries of musical storytelling.

Watch as Alexander Briger leads the Australian World Orchestra in this epic journey from the celestial beauty of Mahler's Fourth to the searing emotional intensity of his Fifth.

title: Calamity Jane
description: Virginia Gay returns as the legendary frontierswoman in this stripped-back, rough-and-ready reimagining of the classic musical. Grab a drink and prepare to be immersed in the world of the Golden Garter Saloon.

title: Duck Pond
description:
When Swan Lake meets The Ugly Duckling, feathers will fly.

Circa, Australia's trailblazing contemporary circus company, takes ballet's most beloved classic and flips it on its head. With soaring aerials, a sequinned duck army, burlesque black swans and a cheeky twist on the fairytale you thought you knew, Duck Pond is a high-octane fusion of beauty, comedy and jaw-dropping skill.

Quirky, beautiful and delightfully irreverent. This is Swan Lake, but not as you know it.

title: New Year's Eve at the Sydney Opera House
description:
Kick off 2026 in operatic style with one of two spectacular performances at the Sydney Opera House.

No other city celebrates New Year's Eve like Sydney, and there's no better place to join in the celebrations than at the Sydney Opera House with Opera Australia.

Choose between The Opera Gala in the Concert Hall, featuring opera's most beautiful music, or a staged opera performance, in the splendour of the Joan Sutherland Theatre.

Join the waitlist to get pre-sale access before the general public.

title: Latin Nights by the Bay
description:
Sydney’s favourite outdoor Latin dance event returns, bringing together the city’s best Latin dance schools, top DJs, live music, and an incredible community!

Every Friday night, Palm Grove will become the destination for Sydney's Latin Dance lovers to unite and dance the night away as the sun goes down.

Free for everyone to enjoy, the DJ will spin those Latin beats to get everyone moving, from salsa, bachata to mambo and every style in between. ​Live music and bands will bring the energy each week.

Every week is fresh, exciting, and unique! Expect new performers, different dance schools, and a brand-new atmosphere every time. Everyone is welcome, whether you're a seasoned dancer, a student, or stepping onto the dance floor for the first time. The focus is social fun, no heels or sequins required! ​

Whether its date night or catchups with friends, Darling Harbour provides all the ingredients for a great night out.

title: 2025 Sydney International On-Water Boat Show
description:
Step aboard for the ultimate on-water boating experience at the Sydney International On-Water Boat Show!

Set against the stunning backdrop of Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour, this premium marine showcase brings you closer to the action. Discover a spectacular on-water display of luxury vessels, high-performance boats, and the latest innovations in marine technology.

From serious boat buyers to lifestyle seekers, there's something for everyone — with vibrant foreshore activations, expert talks, family fun, and a true taste of the boating lifestyle.

title: Australian International Music Festival
description:
The Australian International Music Festival is one of their most popular and best attended events. With an average of 900 to 1300 participants each year they regularly have groups from Australia, China, New Zealand, Japan, Singapore and the USA providing a fantastic musical and cultural experience.

This Music Festival is open to groups of all types but in particular Wind Bands, Orchestra, Choirs and Jazz Bands. As well as performing at the Sydney Opera House, participants will also perform at venues such as the City Recital Hall [affectionately known as Angel Place] and Darling Harbour. 

World Projects South Pacific aim to expand your mind with workshops from world class clinicians flown in from around the world and cultural exchanges with other bands most of whom share your passion but speak another language, an experience not to be missed.

title: Shark Arm Case
description:
An immersive murder mystery, live in the Justice & Police Museum! 

Sydney's bizarre and infamous true crime is brought to life in 'Shark Arm Case', an immersive murder mystery at the historic, 170-year-old Justice & Police Museum near Circular Quay.

Written by Kyla Lee Ward, this gripping theatrical event revisits the real events of 1935, when a tiger shark in Coogee Aquarium famously regurgitated a human arm bearing a distinctive tattoo. 

Audiences will step into the murky underworld of 1930s Sydney, where smuggling, insurance fraud and cold-blooded murder intertwine.

As the case unravels, meet a cast of compelling characters including Detective Sergeant Frank Matthews, underworld figures, and the wives of key suspects.  

Blending immersive storytelling with live theatre, 'Shark Arm Case' invites participants to explore the Museum's spaces while uncovering clues in a thrilling recreation of one of Australia's most perplexing unsolved crimes.

title: Bastille Festival
description:
For 12 years, Bastille Festival has brought joie de vivre to Sydney, drawing Francophiles, foodies, wine lovers, and good-vibe seekers. This much-loved winter event returns, lighting up the Harbour with all things French – from raclette and rosé to cinema and cabaret.

"This 12th edition is all about going bigger, bolder, and more immersive" says Vincent Hernandez, Founder and Festival Director. "A true 'Tour de France' of flavours, sights, and sounds."

With over 120 exhibitors and over 80 dishes, festival-goers can enjoy French favourites like escargots, crêpes, macarons, plus new chef collabs and creative fusions. Eight wine regions will be featured – Bordeaux to Burgundy, Provence to the Rhône – plus champagne bars, mulled wine, cocktails, and more.

"Each glass is a journey through a region, its traditions, and its people" says Hernandez.

The fun doesn't stop at food and wine – enjoy more than 100 free shows including concerts, street theatre, fire performances, and the return of French Cabaret Night and the French DJ Party.

Find your beret, grab your friends, and celebrate winter the French way.

title: Darling Harbour Run Club
description:
Chase your running goals while exploring Darling Harbour, totally free!

Be part of The Run Club in Darling Harbour, a free and active vibrant community for runners of all skill levels. Whether you’re taking your first steps in the world of running or a seasoned marathoner in seek of a new routine, come and get your heart rate up at The Run Club. 

Every Monday morning,  dive into an incredible workout, socialise and find out exactly what a runner’s high really is!

Each session will be led by a friendly and experienced trainer, starting with a warm up jog. The trainer will take you through drills to improve your runner technique, then follow up with some faster and short run ranging from 200 – 600 metres.

You'll have a dedicated running coach who will program a fresh workout every time. The coach will also help you with a specialised running technique and mindset advice to help you improve your performance. 

Grab your running gear and join them at Village Green South in Darling Quarter every Monday.

Looking for more places to get your fitness up? Join The Run Club at The Rocks every Tuesday and Barangaroo every Friday.

title: Seeing Sydney, Knowing Country at the Museum of Sydney
description:
Sydney is known for its iconic harbour, scenic foreshores, bushland reserves, and ever-growing urban and suburban areas. But how were its landscapes experienced and understood in the past?

Seeing Sydney, Knowing Country on at the Museum of Sydney, explores the development of the NSW colony through a selection of significant historical maps, plans, sketches, artworks and objects from the Museums of History NSW and other institutional collections, alongside picturesque colonial landscape prints from the collection of Beat Knoblauch. 

Inscribed over this colonial perspective is an innovative artistic intervention, led by Dharawal and Yuin artist and designer Alison Page, in collaboration with the Sydney Coastal Aboriginal Women's Group, that layers First Nations understandings of Country. Traditional owners' knowledge of Country, developed over 60,000 years, offers a way to gain a deep appreciation of the landscapes we encounter in Sydney today.

title: 'Truth-Telling Through Fiction’: Anita Heiss in Conversation
description:
Join award-winning writer Dr Anita Heiss in conversation with journalist Nicole Abadee to explore truth-telling in First Nations fiction at the Museum of Sydney.

A proud member of the Wiradyuri Nation of central NSW, Anita's historical fiction novels Barbed Wire and Cherry Blossoms, Bila Yarrudhanggalangdhuray and Dirrayawadha (Rise Up) tell epic stories steeped in language, culture and Country. This wide-ranging discussion will consider how fiction gives powerful insights into the reality of First Nations lives and helps build understanding between white and black Australia.

On the night, you will also learn about Towards Truth, a groundbreaking truth-telling project developed in response to the Uluru Statement from the Heart. A partnership between the Justice and Equity Centre and the UNSW Indigenous Law Centre, Towards Truth shows how laws and government decisions have impacted First Nations people since colonisation began. Bold in scope and forensic in execution, Towards Truth is changing how we understand our history and the Australian colonial project.

Before the talk, attendees are invited to a private viewing of the Seeing Sydney, Knowing Country exhibition between 5pm and 5.45pm. The presentation will be followed by a book signing with Anita Heiss and an opportunity to meet the Towards Truth team.

title: Let’s party like it’s 1815 by Joan Ross
description:
Let's party like it's 1815 by Joan Ross is an eight-minute digital artwork on display at the Museum of Sydney that colourfully critiques the legacy of the colonisation of Australia.

"Advertisements pervade our lives and our disconnection from nature is like a ravine: narrow and eroded. " – Joan Ross

Artist Joan Ross assembles what she calls 'a tableau of greed', in which colonists display their disregard for nature and self-assumed superiority by partying on land that they have claimed. A fantastical colonial world flecked with Ross's trademark fluorescent yellow explodes with...

"fake advertisements for leaf blowers and perfume; mansions, silverware, festivities toasting over 'their land'; blowflies, bees, celebratory fireworks over a bleak horizon; balloons, lavish curtains, native–non-native plants pollinating with each other, flowers with the heads of colonists; security cameras, butterflies, willy-willies spitting out leather lounges, TVs, lightbulbs, happy couple figurines, pianos, vases, paintings and roast chicken dinners!"

Ross presents an insatiable culture of overconsumption, depicting Australian colonisation as 'a car crash':

"In slow motion we watch the insensitivity and lack of regard – the long-drawn-out slide towards an inevitable crumpled heap. We saw it happening, but we couldn't stop it; now it's left for us to clean up."

title: Eora by Michael Riley
description:
Eora, by the late Wiradjuri/Kamilaroi filmmaker and photographer Michael Riley (1960–2004), is a 20-minute digital film on display at the Museum of Sydney that tells the story of Sydney’s First Nations people – before and after colonisation.

With scenes juxtaposed on three large screens, the work combines archival colonial imagery, natural landscapes and cityscapes, and artworks by many of Riley’s contemporaries with an evocative soundscape that includes whispered words of local First Nations people.

The film, which has recently been digitised, was commissioned for the opening of the Museum of Sydney in 1995. The restaging of the work honours Riley’s intent to celebrate First Nations beauty, cultures and survival despite the ongoing effects of colonisation.

title: Collage workshops for kids at Museum of Sydney
description:
Join the Sydney Collage Society for a hands-on workshop inspired by Joan Ross's immersive digital artwork Let's party like it's 1815, currently on display at the Museum of Sydney.

Using found imagery, bold colour and texture, kids will create their own collage artwork that responds to the impact of colonisation on Australia's environment by layering landscape and other natural imagery against objects not necessarily found in nature.

The Sydney Collage Society will expertly guide participants step by step through an art-making process that will see kids learn new techniques and explore their creative potential.

No experience is necessary; all materials are provided
Suitable for ages 8 years and over.
Parents and carers must remain with participants for the duration of the workshop, but don't require a ticket.

title: Draggieoke at Kasippu
description:
Your new obsession is here! Draggieoke is where fierce drag, wild karaoke, and killer cocktails collide. 

Sing your heart out, slay the stage, or just soak up the chaos. Free entry. Fabulous vibes.

title: River Fest - Tea Gardens
description:
Head to the beautiful riverside town of Tea Gardens for the fabulous  River Fest.

The day-long festival is free and has something for everyone, and all ages, from ferry joy rides, duck races and a prawn-eating competition. 

The day kicks off with a dog show - great prizes for your precious pooches who have the waggiest tails and the biggest smiles.

There will be dozens of stalls along the waterfront offering a range of delicious culinary delights as well as clothes stalls, unique art and creative works and locally grown organic products. 

Fire trucks will give the kids and big kids a chance to hose down.  You can also add face painting, live music and a petting zoo.

The festival is environmentally friendly and suitable for persons with disability. 

A full program of events at River Fest is available online at the Myall Times website/Facebook page, and Myall Times Myall River Fair Facebook page.

title: Here You Come Again
description:
Here You Come Again is a rollicking, joyous new musical comedy featuring all of Dolly Parton's biggest hits! Packed with iconic songs like Jolene, 9 to 5, Islands in the Stream, I Will Always Love You, Here You Come Again, and many more, this colourful and heartfelt musical tells the story of a diehard fan whose fantasy version of international icon Dolly Parton helps him navigate life's toughest challenges.

With her wit, humour, and charm, Dolly teaches him invaluable lessons about life, love, and how to pull yourself up by your bootstraps - whether or not those bootstraps have rhinestones!

Following sold-out seasons across the U.S. and U.K., Here You Come Again is coming to Sydney with co-creator Tricia Paoluccio in the role of Dolly, next to Australia's own Dash Kruck (Little Shop of Horrors, Jesus Christ Superstar) and an Australian ensemble and live band.

Here You Come Again is co-created and written by two-time Emmy Award-winning Bruce Vilanch, Gabriel Barre and Tricia Paoluccio, and adapted for Australia by Fiona Harris and Mike McLeish. This is the 2025 musical you won't want to miss!

title: Midday Salute
description:
The Midday Salute held at noon on Australia Day is a unique combination of meaningful events that weaves together cultural traditions and military displays in a tribute to our nation.

Be awe-inspired by a ceremonial showcase from the Australian Defence Force, including a thunderous 21-Gun Salute resonating from North Sydney, followed by an aerial flypast courtesy of the Roulettes, the Royal Australian Air Force's elite aerobatic team.

Keep your eyes peeled for the Australian Navy’s Seahawk Helicopter soaring along the harbour, proudly displaying the Australian flag.

The Wirawi, part of the Tribal Warrior Aboriginal Corporation fleet, will conduct an on-water smoking ceremony, cleansing all who gather.

To conclude the Midday Salute, everyone is encouraged to join in singing the National Anthem around Circular Quay. The anthem will resonate in both English and Eora, with lyrics available on event screens

title: ANZAC Day
description:
ANZAC Day is a national day of memorial in Australia, commemorating those who lost their lives in the First World War, and there are few better places to remember these brave soldiers than New South Wales (NSW).
 
Several ANZAC Day Dawn Services will be held on 25th April and if you choose to attend the ANZAC Day Dawn Service at The Cenotaph, Martin Place, you may wish to view the traditional ANZAC Day Parade which will commence at 9am in the Sydney CBD.

To conclude the ANZAC Day Parade, at approximately 12:30pm, a Commemoration Service will be held at the War Memorial in Hyde Park (South). All are welcome to attend the ceremony.

title: Navy Helicopter flag display
description:
Look up to see one of the Royal Australian Navy’s impressive Seahawk Helicopters take to the Sydney sky on our national day. The chopper will paint the sky with a giant Australian flag to mark Australia Day.

The helicopter will parade from the Northern Beaches, up through Sydney Harbour and past the Opera House.

title: BullyBully
description:
What does a toddler and your average world leader have in common? Turns out quite a lot. 

In BullyBully, two world leaders meet in no mans land. What follows is an encounter between two childish but powerful adults. The two world leaders battle it out for the top spot using laughter, dance and movement contests. With humour and theatrics, BullyBully invites you to think about conflict and resolution.  

Don't miss these ego-driven, grown-up world leaders elicit belly laughing with their slapstick comedic dance battles and childish quarrels.

title: Bjorn Again - The World's Number One ABBA Show 2025 Tour | Sydney
description: Mamma Mia, Björn Again are back! The world's no.1 ABBA show, Björn Again, is taking Australia by storm with their dazzling world-class show. Bringing the sparkle and joy of ABBA's timeless music to the stage once more, this Super Trouper event promises a singalong, dance-along extravaganza. With hits like Dancing Queen, Mamma Mia, and SOS, and ballads like Winner Takes It All, Björn Again will make your Mamma Mia dreams a reality. Suitable for all ages, this unforgettable show connects generations. Don't miss out when Björn Again comes to a city near you.

title: The Simon & Garfunkel Story - Sydney
description:
Performing to great acclaim and sell-out shows in over 50 countries around the world, The Simon & Garfunkel Story is a critically acclaimed concert experience about two young boys from Queens who went on to become the world's most successful music duo.

Featuring all their classic hits, including The Sound of Silence, Mrs Robinson, Bridge Over Troubled Water and Cecilia, The Simon & Garfunkel Story charts their rise to fame and success during an intense six-decade-long friendship.

The story is woven between the songs, with evocative video projections and images conjuring up the atmosphere of the turbulent times and brings to life the lyrics and melodies that helped to shape a generation and propel the duo to fame.

Moving and powerful, The Simon and Garfunkel Story is a must see and captivating show told with warmth and feeling.

title: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May -  Live on Stage: Sydney
description:
James May will premiere a landmark live theatre show in Australia, bringing to life the stories of the extraordinary explorers who traversed the deserts, scaled the mountains, and sailed into the unknown. The live show combines theatrical techniques and James' charismatic storytelling to create an evening of compelling intellectual entertainment.

From Ice Age migrations to space travel, the stories of famous, infamous and unknown explorers will come to life in a theatric style, presented by British television presenter and award-winning journalist James May. James is best known as a co-presenter of Top Gear and The Grand Tour and as the host of the Our Man in… TV series.

Few endeavours have captured the imagination and spirit of humanity as profoundly as exploration. Audiences will embark on an awe-inspiring journey through time and space. They will discover the stories of those who risked (and sometimes gave) everything, driven by insatiable curiosity and an unquenchable thirst for discovery, pushing back the boundaries of the unexplored regions of the world, and now, the universe.

James May will unravel the breathtaking tales of humankind from the earliest wanderings of ancient hunter-gatherers to the intrepid, often obsessive explorers, among them Lief Ericson, John Cabot, James Cook's navigator Tupaia, Stanley and Livingstone, Gertrude Bell, through to the moon walkers, space exploration and the seemingly impossible challenges of interplanetary and intergalactic travel.

title: Elizabeth Gilber Weekend Workshop
description:
Enjoy a weekend of big magic with the worldwide bestselling author of Eat Pray Love and be inspired to live the vibrant, fulfilling life you’ve dreamed of.

Readers of all ages and walks of life have drawn inspiration and empowerment from Elizabeth Gilbert’s books for years. Now this beloved author digs deep into her own generative process to share her wisdom and unique perspective about creativity. 

With profound empathy and radiant generosity, she offers potent insights into the mysterious nature of inspiration. Elizabeth asks to embrace curiosity and let go of needless suffering. She shows how to tackle what we most love, and how to face down what we most fear. She discusses the attitudes, approaches, and habits needed to live a most creative lives. Balancing between soulful spirituality and cheerful pragmatism, Gilbert encourages all to uncover the “strange jewels” that are hidden within.

Whether looking to write a book, make art, find new ways to address challenges in work, embark on a dream long deferred, or simply infuse everyday lives with more mindfulness and passion, this weekend of cracks open a world of wonder and joy.

title: Movement and Meditation Classes
description:
Every Tuesday, over your lunch break, take time out for yourself and escape the office. Meet in the centre of the Chinese Garden of Friendship and enjoy a gentle movement and meditation practice with beautiful teacher Carol.

Carol will share a blend of qi gong, tai chi and yoga movements to help relieve stress, shift energy and find focus, ending with a meditation to hold calm and stabilize the mind. Wander the tranquil garden as you leave, and re-enter the world with a sense of renewal. 

Carol is passionate about working with people's energy through intuitively guiding and empowering each individual to connect with the deeper messages of their bodies. To create change and healing for their physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health so that they can return to wellness.

Carol has been teaching yoga for over a decade and is trained in Vinyasa, Hatha, Yin, Myofascial Release, Qigong, Acupressure, and Medical Intuition. She is most interested in bridging ancient teachings and modern science to help people connect with themselves on a deeper level of wisdom from within for self-care and self-healing.

Maximum group size of 15 people, booking essential.

title: NRL St George Illawarra Dragons v Cronulla Sharks (Round 23)
description:
Get ready for Round 23 action as the St George Illawarra Dragons take on the Cronulla Sharks.
 
Bring your friends, family, and fellow fans for an unforgettable afternoon of rugby league. 

Don't miss out – secure your tickets now and be part of the action!

title: NRL St George Illawarra Dragons v Manly Sea Eagles (Round 26)
description:
Get ready for Round 26 action as the St George Illawarra Dragons take on the Manly Sea Eagles.
 
Bring your friends, family, and fellow fans for an unforgettable afternoon of rugby league. 

Don't miss out – secure your tickets now and be part of the action!

title: Paintings from the Collection
description:
More than 300 original artworks of landscape and portrait paintings on permanent public display at the State Library of NSW. 

The exhibition features portraits of the extraordinary and the everyday, rare and recent views of Sydney and the harbour, suburban streetscapes and burgeoning rural townscapes, from the 1790s to today. 

Discover the stories behind the paintings on your own device by listening along to the audio guides, available on the Library's website.

title: Garrima: The Country Cries for Truth live
description:
A night of performances from Bundjalung artists at the State Library of NSW. 

Kicking off NAIDOC Week 2025, enjoy a special night of performances inspired by Dr Bronwyn Bancroft's exhibition The Country Cries for Truth.
 
Hosted by Gardening Australia's Clarence Slockee, with music, art and readings from Djanaba, Kyra Kum-Sing, Melissa Jackson, Mr Rhodes and Rubyrose Bancroft.
 
A pop-up bar in the Paintings Galleries will be open from 5 pm, with sounds from DJ NAIAN. A Welcome to Country will kick-off official proceedings at 6 pm, with other performances to follow.

title: The Objects Gallery
description:
The Objects Gallery is a free display featuring nearly 1000 objects from the State Library of NSW’s realia collection acquired over the past century.

Many of these objects came with manuscript collections of writers, artists, surveyors, politicians, community organisations and businesses. Others came from Sir William Dixson (1870–1952), who gave his extensive collection to the Library, both during his lifetime and as a bequest in 1952.

The objects on display are mostly inorganic — made of metal, stone, glass or clay-based materials — and will not be damaged by exposure to light. The rest of the collection, which includes 8000 other objects, remains below ground in the Library’s multi-level storage areas or ‘stacks’.

title: World Press Photo Exhibition
description:
The World Press Photo Exhibition is a free exhibition on display at the State Library of NSW. 

This popular, internationally touring exhibition showcases the best and most important photojournalism and documentary photography of the last year. 

See the photographs that won this year's annual World Press Photo Contest, chosen from 59,320 entries received from 3,778 photographers from 141 countries. 

This year with more winning projects and photographers than ever before.

title: The Country Cries for Truth
description:
A powerful and personal exhibition by distinguished Bundjalung artist Dr Bronwyn Bancroft AM is now on display at the State Library of NSW.

Dr Bronwyn Bancroft AM – artist, book author/illustrator, mother and truth-telling warrior from the Northern Rivers of NSW – has a masterly approach to her works, and this exhibition will lead you through a passage of curiosity and reflection.

Allow yourself to be gifted a new lens into our shared history through Dr Bancroft’s artistic practices — where Country was once captured being decimated, Bronwyn warmly invites you to see it being brought back to life through her use of colour, defining lines and added imagery.

title: Trivia in the Library Bar
The Australian Dream?
description:
Architecture and design enthusiast Tim Ross casts his unique eye across the State Library of NSW's archive to explore ideas of home and the Australian dream of home ownership.

From the suburbs to the bush and the inner city, Australians have been obsessed with the idea of home and the dream of home ownership.

In this exhibition, comedian, television presenter, and architecture and design enthusiast Tim Ross casts his unique eye across the State Library’s archives and images. Uncovering stories from across the decades of how we have been sold and realised ideas of home, Tim looks at why Australians have chased home ownership and explores some of the unique and special ways we have built in this place.  

We are a nation that is undeniably fixated on property, but increasingly, the headlines are about housing scarcity, affordability and mortgage pain. For many Australians, owning a home now seems like an unattainable dream. So, what can we learn from our past to help solve the problems of the future, and how can we reimagine the Australian Dream?

title: Paddy's Markets
description:
Discover photographs of Paddy's Markets, one of Sydney's oldest markets, on display at the State Library of NSW. 

Paddy's Markets Haymarket has long been an icon of Sydney's Chinatown. State Library photographers Bruce York and Joy Mei En Lai captured Paddy's and its stallholders in August 2024, during the recent redevelopment. 

Alongside historic images from the Library's collection, these contemporary photos are a reminder that Paddy's has a way of enduring. 

Displayed across the Circulation Gallery on Level 1 of the Mitchell Building, see how one of Sydney's oldest markets has been documented in the Library's photographic collections over more than 85 years.

title: PIX: The magazine that changed everything
description:
