Discover the scandals, daring exploits, and bold photography from the magazine's 30-year history at the State Library of NSW. 

With its eye-catching, lipstick-red logo, PIX delivered a new style of journalism, using photographs to tell sensational stories of modern life. 

This exhibition explores the PIX story — through the people and pictures that made the magazine — for the first time.

title: NRL St George Illawarra Dragons v Sydney Roosters (Round 19)
description:
Get ready for Round 19 action as the St George Illawarra Dragons take on the Sydney Roosters.
 
Bring your friends, family, and fellow fans for an unforgettable afternoon of rugby league. 

Don't miss out – secure your tickets now and be part of the action!

title: Lunchtime Concerts at NSW Parliament
description:
Experience the splendour of live music at free lunchtime concerts in NSW Parliament's Fountain Court.

At each concert, musicians from the Sydney Youth Orchestras, Sydney Conservatorium of Music and other talented organisations and groups will play a selection of pieces ranging from classical through to contemporary movements.

You are invited to join us at the Fountain Court of NSW Parliament House to watch, listen and be inspired by outstanding music against the backdrop of Australia’s oldest parliament.

Book your place online. Walk-ins are also welcome.

title: Lecture: Transformation and Innovation, Chinese watercolour painting
description:
Transformation and Innovation — Exploring the Century-Long Development of Chinese Watercolour Painting.

The lecture will trace the development of Chinese watercolour painting over the past century. Since the late 19th century, watercolour painting has been introduced to China through Western art education. By the 21st century, Chinese watercolour art has embraced new trends such as cross-media experimentation, material innovation, and the integration of digital technologies.

In the ongoing interplay between tradition and modernity, and between local and global perspectives, Chinese watercolour has undergone continuous transformation, achieving constant renewal and breakthroughs. Rooted in the rich soil of Chinese cultural heritage, it also actively absorbs and integrates international artistic languages, preserving an Eastern aesthetic while expressing a diverse and open contemporary sensibility.

This lecture will guide the audience through the historical evolution and contemporary expressions of Chinese watercolour art. It also aims to serve as a platform for artistic dialogue and exchange between China and Australia, fostering encounters and resonance between Eastern and Western cultures through the medium of watercolour.

The Lecturer-Liu Baoxun

Mr Li Baoxuan, born in 1983 in Fuxin, Liaoning Provinceof China, currently holds the position of Associate Professor and Master's Supervisor at the Lu Xun Academy of Fine Arts, where he serves as Deputy Director of the Department of Watercolour Painting with the School of Painting Arts.
host: CHINA CULTURAL CENTRE IN SYDNEY LIMITED

title: High Tea at Parliament House, Sydney
description:
Experience Traditional High Tea and a Tour at Parliament House, Sydney.

Strangers’ Restaurant overlooking the beautiful Domain, provides a rare opportunity for the public to experience fine dining at New South Wales Parliament House.

Executive Chef, Vanessa Harcourt and her passionate culinary team design seasonal menus that showcase the wonderful delicacies and unique regions of New South Wales.

Every Friday the Parliament Host a traditional High Tea in the Strangers' restaurant.

For the High Tea dining experience allow 90 minutes.

title: Monday Lunch Special and Free Tour
description:
Strangers’ Restaurant Monday Lunch Special provides a rare opportunity for the public to experience fine dining at New South Wales Parliament House. 

Dining in Strangers Restaurant, followed by the free public tour which departs from the front desk.

The free guided tour is conducted in English and is suitable for visitors of all ages. Available every Monday. Explore the historical chambers and meeting rooms, allow 60 minutes for the tour.

Includes your selection of one main and dessert from the a la carte menu, followed by tea and coffee at a set price of AUD65 per person.

title: Free Tour of NSW Parliament
description:
Take a tour of NSW Parliament House! 

A range of programs and events are scheduled throughout the year for the public to engage with the workings of the parliament. These events are designed for families and adults, and can offer the opportunity to view the chambers in session, meet with Members, and on non-sitting days​ to sit in the chambers. 
 
Whether you come with family, friends, or on your own, a free tour of NSW Parliament House will always surprise you. Join them every Monday and Friday at 1:30pm (more often during school holidays) for a free guided tour and step back in time into one of Sydney's oldest buildings. While walk-ins are always welcome, we recommend that you book in advance to obtain your preferred date and time slot.
 
Tours take approximately one hour.

For further information contact the Tours Officer.

title: Chinatown Night Market
description:
Chinatown’s famous Friday Night Markets are one of Sydney’s most popular late-night shopping hotspots, showcasing local designers, delicious Asian street food and unique products to locals and tourists.

The Markets reflect the culture, creativity and energy of Sydney’s thriving Chinatown precinct.

The Chinatown Markets offer its visitors the opportunity to taste their way through Asia without leaving the city. The Market includes its own Little Eat Street with more than a dozen stalls offering cuisines from Hong Kong to Hanoi with favourites including yum cha, teppanyaki, sushi and pho.

As well as a great range of street food, the Markets have more than 50 stalls operated by students, young designers and local artists with Asian heritage or whose designs refer to Asian cultures.

title: Baby Massage Demonstration for Parents
description:
The Infant Massage Information Service will be holding free demonstration sessions on infant massage for parents throughout Australia in 2025. 

The sessions will cover a massage demonstration as well as discussions on appropriate oils to use for massage time, when and how long to massage for, and the benefits of massage for infants.

Baby massage can decrease crying and improve sleep. International research has also shown that massage strengthens the immune system in addition to providing a wide range of additional physical and psychological benefits.

Infants are invited to attend the session with their parent/s and expected parents are also welcome to join in.

Limited spaces are available, and parents must reserve a position to attend. 

To book, contact the Infant Massage Information Service via phone or email.

title: Drag Bingo at Southern Cross Hotel
description:
Join us every week for Drag Bingo hosted by Drag Race Down Under star, Minnie Cooper!

Free entry, drink specials, awesome prizes, and a night full of fun.

title: Paddys Markets at Haymarket
description:
Paddy's has held a central place in Sydney's history for over 150 years. Paddy's Markets, Sydney's biggest markets, have a wide variety of stalls; food, fashion, gifts and gadgets in a true market atmosphere.  

A bustling market in the heart of the City and right beside Chinatown offers a variety of lunchtime takeaway or eat-in food options that are sure to have you coming back for more. 

Paddy’s Haymarket is for the curious of mind and also for those who are budget-conscious. It operates like a traditional market and offers imported and local women’s fashion, kids' clothes, hair accessories, and jewellery as well as gifts, souvenirs, gadgets, and lots more.

For food lovers, Paddy’s Haymarket is the place to be for fresh fruit and vegetables. The markets at Haymarket have been the home for growers and producers for over a century. Come and try it for yourself!

For seafood lovers, there is plenty of fresh fish, prawns and the best catch of the day. 

Paddy’s is a market that has something for everyone and even a library of music, art and books to enjoy. 

Paddy’s Haymarket is a must for tourists who are looking for Australian souvenirs and cheap gifts that are fair dinkum Australian.

title: Creative Studio: Media Arts
description:
Step into the world of film, storytelling and digital media in this immersive three-day workshop led by Powerhouse Residents Co-Curious, Kopi Su and The Film Collective. Designed for senior high school students with ambitions of being filmmakers, digital designers or creatives, this hands-on workshop dives into the core of media arts, blending screenwriting, character design, AI innovation and visual storytelling.

Create with Co-Curious to discover the art of screenwriting and explore real-world career pathways into the screen industry. Innovate with Kopi Su using AI-powered tools and human-centred design to unlock fresh ideas and think like a next-gen creative. Meet filmmakers from The Film Collective and learn to design bold main characters, build visual assets and pitch your ideas.

Presented in partnership with University of Technology Sydney.

title: Sydney City Night Market
description:
Springtime arrives and so does this wonderful collection of food, fashion and accessories, unique handmade pieces, gourmet produce and quirky pop-up wine bars.

Set in amongst the fairy-lit trees and city-vibing sounds of Belmore Park.

Take a wonder through, enjoy a bite to eat and relax to end the working week.

title: City2Surf
description:
The World's Largest Fun Run - City2Surf, will be back in Sydney!

Bringing 90,000 people together from all walks of life to run, jog, walk or stroll the iconic 14km course from Sydney central business district to Bondi Beach.

Save the date for another spectacular year as they celebrate Sydney with live entertainment, food, training runs, fundraising and much more.

See you on the start line!

title: Art After Hours
description:
Every Wednesday night, wander through the Art Gallery after hours and discover new art and old favourites in the latest exhibitions and collection displays. 

Join a guided tour, and enjoy a drink or a bite to eat in the cafe.

A courtesy bus runs every 20 minutes from 6 pm until closing from the Art Gallery to various locations in the city close to public transport.
host: Art Gallery Of New South Wales

title: Artisans in the Gardens Exhibition
description:
A sophisticated showcase

Experience Australia's finest established and emerging artists and craftspeople, with over 3,000 works on display, including sculpture, ceramics, hand-blown glass, jewellery, and textiles. 

Since its inception in 2000 with just four exhibitors in a small room, this prestigious exhibition has grown into a sophisticated event, now showcasing a diverse range of over 3,000 pieces across multiple mediums. For the first time, Artisans in the Gardens will span across two venues, Lion Gate Lodge and Victoria Lodge in the Royal Botanic Gardens. 

The Food with Friends Cafe, run by volunteers from the Foundation & Friends, will be open daily from 10am to 3pm throughout the exhibition.

Artisans in the Gardens is dedicated to supporting talented artists while raising essential funds for the Foundation & Friends of the Botanic Gardens.

The Foundation proudly gives 20% of the income that Foundation & Friends make from Artisans in the Gardens towards supporting the Education Access Program run by Botanic Gardens of Sydney. This program gives eligible schools the opportunity to participate in educational.
host: Foundation and Friends of the Botanic Gardens

title: Alchemy of a Rainforest
description:
Explore a vibrant tapestry of life! Step inside this immersive, sensory exhibition featuring spectacular rare and unusual tropical and subtropical rainforest plants.

Here, amidst a lush, layered canopy, you'll experience the intricate beauty and complexity of the rainforest like never before.

Alchemy of a Rainforest is more than an exhibition; it's an immersive journey that envelops you in the vibrant, living essence of one of the Earth's most valuable ecosystems. 

Throughout the space, garden sculptures by environmental artist Jane Gillings add vibrant pops of colour and texture. Crafted from repurposed plastic waste, these intricate pieces depict seeds, flowers, branches, fungi, and butterflies, highlighting the rainforest’s role as an ecological powerhouse that sustains diverse life forms.

A highlight of the exhibition is the oversized Satin Bowerbird’s bower, crafted from upcycled materials. This stunning installation invites you to walk through, sit, and be surrounded by the hum of rainforest sound art, transporting you to a tropical forest teeming with life.

Curated by the horticultural team at the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney, Alchemy of a Rainforest has over 18,000 plants on display and one of the largest living green walls in the Southern Hemisphere.

Join us in this immersive journey, where art, nature, and innovation come together to create an experience that is both spectacular and profoundly meaningful.

title: Crafting with Nature: Secret Sculptures Workshop at Sydney
description:
This program invites children to stop, listen, and expand their imaginations in nature.

The experienced Guides will get the children looking down and around at the tiny, magical worlds hidden deep within the Garden. What can they see? See mushrooms that look like fairy homes, little bugs in the leaf litter, shapes and patterns in the soil. What can they imagine? Let's imagine together!

After exploring together, craft a tiny sculpture from earthenware clay and collect nature treasures. These miniature sculptures are designed to be taken and hidden in some secret place in nature. A special secret only you know about - which you can go back and visit again and again!

title: NAIDOC - Aboriginal Harbour Heritage Tour (free)
description:
Held each year in July, NAIDOC Week celebrates Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures.

NAIDOC Week 2025 marks a powerful milestone: 50 years of honouring and elevating Indigenous voices, culture and resilience. 

The 2025 theme "The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy" celebrates not only the achievements of the past but the bright future ahead, empowered by the strength of young leaders, the vision of communities, and the legacy of ancestors. 

To celebrate NAIDOC Week 2025, come along to the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney on one of the tours.

Join your First Nations guide and admire the beauty and history of Sydney Harbour through the lens of the local Gadigal people. 

On your one-hour tour, you'll stroll along the stunning Sydney Harbour foreshore while listening to stories of Gadigal lifestyle, traditions, history and connection to country and community.

And if you have a little more time, please enjoy a browse through their lovely book collection in the Garden Shop, located in the middle of the gardens.

All tours will be free, but you must register.

title: Tree Musketeers Outdoor Theatre
description:
Join the adventurous journey of the Tree Musketeers in this seriously silly outdoor theatre in the Gardens.

The Tree Musketeers embark on a mission to uncover the mysteries behind the rapidly disappearing rainforests around the world. In this thrilling and educational performance, three heroic friends face challenges, solve puzzles, and seek the truth behind deforestation and its impact on the planet.

As they delve deeper into the heart of the rainforest, they discover the importance of preserving nature and the powerful role each individual plays in conservation. This captivating play is not only an adventure but also a call to action, inspiring audiences to protect and cherish the world's precious rainforests.

Come along and be a part of this incredible quest to save the world's lungs!

Recommended for children aged 2 – 8 years and their caregivers.

title: Speakers' Corner - Sydney
description:
Every Sunday people gather opposite the NSW Art Gallery to discuss all matters. It's a safe place for anyone who wants to engage in real debate, about any topic. 

The ones standing on ladders are the speakers, and they believe it is their job to educate their 'grasshoppers' or 'groundlings’.  The ones in chairs believe it’s their job to point out why the speaker is wrong and to heckle. Both parties are kept busy.

And, if a passer-by has something to say, they might well be given five minutes to say it, up on The Ladder of Knowledge.

 So, come along and argue with the ratbags. Or get on a ladder and be one!

If you decide you have had enough, they generously provide a large art gallery across the road.

title: Burra
description:
Be transported on an immersive journey through the eyes of burra (eel) in the Australian Museum's learning and play space.

A truly unique experience  where you can explore at your own pace or join a free pop-up event. Children and adults are invited to touch, listen and see while exploring the giant burra, sensory walls and interactive play zones. 

General entry to the Australian Museum and Burra is free!

title: Tails from the Coasts
description:
Created in collaboration with the National Museum of Singapore, Tails from the Coasts: Nature Stories of Singapore debuts at the Australian Museum, sharing a glimpse of this precious and prestigious national collection which showcases natural history, biodiversity and conservation from the Malay Peninsula and Australia.

This exhibition explores the common bonds of biodiversity between Australia and Singapore through 36 exquisite watercolour drawings from the renowned William Farquhar Collection of Natural History Drawings.

title: The Birds of Australia: John and Elizabeth Gould
description:
Discover the amazing world of Australia's birdlife in a new immersive and interactive exhibition. Featuring STORYBOX, an interactive storytelling cube, The Birds of Australia brings to life the iconic illustrations of John and Elizabeth Gould, along with First Nations storytelling and knowledges. After touring New South Wales, the popular installation is landing at the Museum in an expanded exhibition, with a range of art, specimens and objects related to our feathered friends.

Learn about current habitat pressures facing many of the birds featured in Gould's collection and what you can do to help in your local area. Use your mobile to scan the QR code and unlock First Nations stories, bird calls, in-depth profiles, interactive activities and more.

title: Cookbook Club Sydney
description: Imagine the typical book club but instead of meeting to talk about a novel's characters, plot and meaning, you're meeting to eat all the recipes of a cookbook. Each month, a new cookbook is chosen by the host, you make something from the book, bring it along and add it to a feast made from other recipes in the cookbook. Whether you're a solo traveller or a club regular, the event promises a "no pressure", relaxed environment with host (Mika Nakamura) helping guests meet each other. Events can be at different locations each month so check the Instagram page for month-by-month details.

title: Treasures of the Anzac Memorial  Exhibition
description:
Come and experience the new exhibition showcasing  Treasures that have been donated to the Anzac Memorial from its opening in 1934. 

For 90 years veterans and their families have donated objects to which they ascribe great value to the Anzac Memorial. Some of those objects are of unquestionable aesthetic and financial value. Some appear quite mundane, their significance requiring explanation and interpretation. All are treasures.

This exhibition comprises a selection of treasures of the Anzac Memorial collection. The choices were made by the curatorial and collection management staff. The selection is subjective and by no means definitive. New treasures are being donated all the time.

In 1934 Great War veteran, lawyer and author S Elliot Napier wrote of the Anzac Memorial that “as the men of 1914-1918… are gathered to the valley of the shadows” the rooms of the Memorial “will be transformed into reliquaries wherein may be placed such tributes and mementoes to the men of 1914-1918 as may be deemed appropriate. Thus will the Memorial gather to itself its full spiritual message for delivery to future generations of Australians.”

Thery hope that their choices have lived up to the ideals of those of Napier's generation and through their display provide examples of the courage, endurance and sacrifice of those whose lives have been touched by war from colonial times to the present day.

title: School Holiday Drop-in Activity: A Day in the Life of a Soldier
description:
Have you ever been curious about how a soldier lives in the field, or wondered what they eat or how they sleep?

Visit the Anzac Memorial these school holidays for a hands-on experience of a day in the life of a soldier.

Touch and wear real military equipment and uniforms with their sensory trolley and have a close-up look at a special tent soldiers use to keep themselves warm and dry at night, set up inside the Auditorium.  

The Anzac Memorial team are excited to share their knowledge and guide you through all these interesting objects and what they are used for.

This program is ideal for children aged 5+.  All children must be accompanied by a responsible adult. A complimentary copy of the Anzac Memorial Family Discovery Trail will be provided to each ticket holder. 

The activity will be held on the Lower Ground Level. Entry is via Liverpool Street.

Bookings are essential.

title: Art From Behind the Wire
description:
Art From Behind the Wire is a new exhibition featuring posters, magazines and other printed material created by Second World War prisoners of war, including Major John Champion de Crespigny.

John was among thousands of Australians made prisoners by the Japanese in the early months of 1942. Captivity at the hands of the Japanese is remembered for merciless brutality however the initial experience in some camps was not harsh. To maintain the morale of the inmates, Champion de Crespigny and others made posters and produced a magazine, Mark Time, during their time as POWs in Java.

This extraordinary collection offers a glimpse into the uncertainties of life as captives of a cruel and unpredictable enemy.

The exhibition also includes four sketches of the Japanese war crimes trials held on Morotai in December 1945, drawn by Signalman Alex King, a talented professional newspaper artist. King served with the Australian Corps of Signals and was able to observe some of the trials firsthand.

These unique original sketches capture the moment when Japanese soldiers attended makeshift courts sitting in the witness chair. They offer a rare insight into both the trial process and the individuals accused of war crimes. 

The exhibition is in the Memorial's Auditorium on Lower Ground level. The Memorial is open every day. 

Entry is free.

title: Silversmithing For Beginners
description:
Make your own sterling silver earrings from sheet metal.

Join this immersive silversmithing experience in this ultimate beginner class.

Working with a sterling silver sheet, you'll learn how to cut your shapes using a jeweller's saw. Refine your edges with precision using metal files and emery paper before delving into the world of texture, choosing from options like matte, shiny, hammered, or patterned finishes.

Each participant will receive a piece of sterling silver in sheet form, enough to make a pair of small-medium-sized earrings. Additional silver can be purchased to accommodate larger shapes if you like statement earrings.

For added dimension, you'll also have the option to dome your pieces.

Finally, you'll learn how to drill the metal to create holes for attaching ear hooks (please note, that studs are not an option in this basic intro class).

For the health and safety of all participants, they require closed shoes to be worn and long hair must be tied back. Alcohol is not permitted in this class but you are welcome to BYO non-alcholic beverages. This class is for participants over the age of 18 only.

title: Candle Making Class
description:
Welcome to Sydney Creative's Candle Making Class, nestled in the iconic pink studio in the heart of Redfern.

Perfect for beginners, their class invites you to craft a luxury double-wicked, extra large candle. Designed to illuminate your space with a burn time of approximately 50 hours and a fragrance that's uniquely yours.

In this two-hour session, they will guide you through:

Jar and Lid Selection: Mix and match your favourite colours.

Vessel Preparation: Learn to prepare your glass vessel for the wax.

Wick Mastery: Discover the importance of choosing and securing the correct wick size for an even, perfect burn.

Wax Selection: Discover why they love Cocosoy wax.

Scent Creation: Blend your own fragrance oils under expert guidance to create a signature scent that delights.

Understanding Throws: Gain insight into achieving the perfect cold and hot throw for maximum scent release.

Pouring Technique: Candle making is a science, learn how to prepare your jar for the wax, when to mix in the fragrance, and how to monitor the temperatures.

Troubleshooting Tips: Equip yourself with the know-how to navigate common candle-making challenges.

They provide all the materials you'll need, from the wax to the wick, the fragrance, and the finishing touches. A worksheet will be provided during the session, so you can take notes along the way.

title: Plant Pot Painting
description:
Introducing Sydney Creative's new Terracotta Plant Pot Painting Class, a fun and creative way to add some personality to your plants. 

In this class, you will have the opportunity to learn how to paint and decorate your own plant pot with your chosen colours. An experienced teacher will guide you through the process, providing tips and techniques on how to create a unique and fun pot for your plants.

This session is open-ended, once we've shown you the texture techniques, rather than following and copying the teacher, you'll be set free with your creativity to create your own unique pot. Your teacher will be on hand should you require assistance or advice with your masterpiece.  

The class is bring your own friendly, feel free to bring your favourite drink to enjoy while you create your masterpiece. All painting materials, including the plant pot, paints, brushes and palette knives will be provided. So, all you need to bring is yourself, your creativity and your drink!

At the end of the class, you'll take home your own one-of-a-kind painted plant pot, ready to be displayed with pride. Whether you're looking for a fun night out, a creative outlet, or a unique way to bond with friends, Sydney creative's Plant Pot Painting Class is the perfect choice. Book your spot today and get ready to unleash your creativity!

title: Reed Diffuser, Candle Making & Sip Class
description:
Welcome to Sydney Creative's Candle Making and Reed Diffuser Class, nestled in their iconic pink studio in the heart of Redfern. Perfect for beginners, their class invites you to craft a luxury double-wicked, extra-large candle with a burn time of approximately 50 hours, and a diffuser with a fragrance that's uniquely yours.

Sydney Creative will provide all the materials you'll need.

title: Intro To Garment Making - Shorts/Pants
description:
Advance your sewing skills by following a pattern to make your own shorts or pants.

Looking to advance your current sewing skills? Come along to Sydney Creative's sewing class to make your own elasticated shorts or pants.

The pattern they use comes in different lengths, choose to make short shorts, bermuda shorts, knee length, ankle length or full length

Their pattern sizing is from size six - 20, if you are on either end of this scale and would like to double-check our pattern will fit, you can measure your hips with a measuring tape, stand with heels apart and measure around the fullest part of the hip and bottom area all the way around. The minimum measurement for our pattern is a hip measurement of 88cm, or the largest is 128cm.

The pattern for the shorts is slightly more complex and a natural next step from our Sewing For Beginners class.

What they'll cover:

Reading a commercial pattern
Measuring yourself to determine the correct size
Cutting a commercial pattern to your size
Pre-treating fabric
Cutting your fabric to the pattern specifications
Attaching a waistband
Adding elastic to the waistband
Garment Construction
Learn our DIY overlocking method
Pressing seams open
Hemming

title: Cold Process Soap Class with Natural Clays and Botanicals
description:
Make your own soap in this fun class!

Join them for an engaging and hands-on Cold Process Soap Making Workshop where you will learn the traditional art of making soap bars from scratch. In this affordable class, you will get to make a 1kg soap loaf which can be cut into eight bars of soap.

What You'll Learn:

The basics of cold process soap making, including safety measures and techniques.
How to work safely with sodium hydroxide (lye), an essential ingredient, you can't make soap without it!
Understanding the saponification process and its importance in soap making.
The benefits of superfatting your soap and how to do it.
How to incorporate fragrance oils for custom scents.
Learn about the nourishing aspects of each oil and why we use them in our base recipe.
Learn about the unique properties and benefits of various clays, allowing you to customise your soap to suit your skin type.
Learn how to blend all of your ingredients together until you reach trace.
An introduction to natural exfoliants and decorative toppings like petals and seeds.
Techniques for insulating and curing your soap for the best results.
How to troubleshoot common soap making issues, such as separation and soda ash.

title: Painting Class - Student Special
description:
Paint, sip and relax with friends.

Join Sydney Creative for a fun and creative night. In this two-hour session, you'll paint your very own plant pot or canvas.

Bring your own drinks are welcome, so grab your favourite beverage and get ready to unleash your creativity. Sydney creative will provide aprons, however, it's recommended to wear clothes you won't mind getting a little paint on.

Please note, this is a student special price for students only. Student IDs will be checked upon entry. There is an age limit of 18+ for this class.

title: Textured Paint and Sip Class
description:
Introducing Sydney Creative's Textured Paint and Sip Class for adults.

Guided by an experienced instructor, you'll learn step-by-step techniques to create your own masterpiece while sipping on your favourite beverage. these classes are held in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, making it the perfect way to spend time with friends or a unique date night.

You'll be guided through the process from choosing your colours, painting your background and learning the palette knife technique to create textured petals.

This class is open-ended, once we've shown you the texture technique, rather than following and copying the teacher, you'll be set free with your creativity to create your own unique artwork, however, your teacher will be on hand should you require assistance or advice with your masterpiece.  

All materials are provided, including a 12" x 16" canvas, paints, brushes, palette knives and aprons, so all you need to bring is yourself and your favourite drink. At the end of the class, you'll take home your own one-of-a-kind textured painting, ready to be displayed with pride.

Whether you're looking for a fun activity, a creative outlet, or a unique way to bond with friends, our Textured Paint and Sip Class is the perfect choice. Book your spot today and get ready to unleash your creativity!

title: Manly Fresh Produce Markets
description:
Held at Sydney Road and Short Street Plaza every Sunday, at the Manly Fresh Produce Market you'll find some of the best fresh produce and gourmet delights directly from farmers, makers and food providores from across NSW. 

From paddock to plate, foodies can indulge in organic fruit and vegetables, quality cheeses, olive oils, fresh flowers and so much more.

title: Amongst the Clouds at Artspace
description:
Amongst the clouds (digital materialities in the 21st century) profiles Australian and international artists who explore the ways in which digital realms are determinedly tied to the physical world. As the distinction between the digital and the material world becomes increasingly blurred, how we think about art, society and technology is radically shifting and evolving. This exhibition features artists who are pioneering new ways that - art and technology - reshape our physical and digital worlds. 

Amongst the clouds includes recent work and some work not seen before in Australia from featured artists: Liu Chuang (China), Nina Davies (Canada/UK), Archana Hande (India), Lawrence Lek (UK), Sophie Penkethman-Young (Australia), and Liam Young (USA).

title: Whitefella Yella Tree - Sydney
description:
After a runaway premiere season at the SBW Stables Theatre in 2022, Whitefella Yella Tree is back to wow audiences in 2025—presented by Sydney Theatre Company, La Boite Theatre and University of Melbourne Arts and Culture (UMAC).

Once in a blue moon, in the middle of nowhere, two teenage boys meet under a lemon tree. After a rough start, a fragile friendship fruits into a heady romance.

If history would just unfurl a little differently, the boys might have a beautiful future ahead of them. But without knowing it, Ty and Neddy are poised on the brink of a world that is about to change forever.

Palawa playwright Dylan Van Den Berg has won most of Australia's major playwriting awards—including the Griffin Award, the David Williamson Prize and the NSW Premier's Literary Award for playwriting (twice!).

In Whitefella Yella Tree Dylan has penned a heart-warming and heart-breaking story about love, Country and Blak queerness through history. The extraordinary Joseph Althouse (Green Park) makes his return to Griffin, alongside the directing team of Griffin's Declan Greene and Wiradjuri/Worimi theatremaker Amy Sole.

title: Birdsong of Tomorrow
description:
The wandering albatross. The buff-breasted paradise kingfisher. The superb fairywren. Every day across this country, birds sing. Songs passed down through generations. Songs of a world that's gone and a world that's changing. Birds fill every part of the planet with melody and colour. They soar and swim and run. And a lot of them are chickens.

Nathan Harrison (Hottest 100 of Animals: A Countdown for the Anthropocene) is a professional theatre-maker and an amateur birdwatcher, who has seen roughly 150 varieties in the last year alone. Blending science, storytelling, music and video, Birdsong of Tomorrow is a playful and heartfelt look at the rapidly changing environment— and what birds might sing when we're gone.

title: Koreaboo
description:
Hannah had her trip all planned out. Travel to Korea. Visit her birth mother. Spend a golden summer creating precious memories. 

But when she arrives in Seoul, reality hits hard. Her Umma works in a convenience store day and night, barely taking a break. She seems more interested in stacking shelves and re-arranging the garden gnome display than connecting with a long-lost Australian daughter. 

Hannah is Korean, yet in Umma's mind, Hannah is a "Koreaboo"—a foreigner captivated by K-Pop, kimchi and hanboks. Armed with only Google Translate and unrelenting optimism, Hannah must try to find a place within Umma's world before the end of a sweltering summer. 

Taking inspiration from real events of Michelle Lim Davidson's life (The Feather in the Web, The Newsreader), this profound and heartfelt play marks the writing debut of one of Australia's most beloved performers. Michelle herself takes to the stage under the direction of Jessica Arthur (The Dictionary of Lost Words), in a reunion story that reaches across continents, cultures and Spotify® playlists.

title: Grief is the Thing with Feathers
description:
Belvoir presents acclaimed New Zealand-Australian theatre director Simon Phillips' new adaptation of Max Porter's bestselling novel, Grief is the Thing With Feathers. 

Co-adapted by Phillips, Nick Schlieper and Toby Schmitz, Grief is the Thing With Feathers is an imaginative and poetic take on how a family navigates loss, starring Schmitz (Netflix's Boy Swallows Universe, The Dance of Death), alongside Philip Lynch (Never Closer), and Fraser Morrison (Disney's The Last Days of the Space Age). 

Two young boys full of energy and curiosity, try to make sense of their mother's sudden death. Their father, with the soul of a poet, is struggling to find the words. Then Crow arrives—strange, loud, funny, and unsettling. Part babysitter, part nuisance, part unlikely guide. Crow, like a gothic Mary Poppins, brings chaos and comfort in equal measure. Is he real? Is he imagined? Did this odd bird come to a grieving family because they needed him? Or is he something they made? 

Profoundly beautiful and poignant, this fresh reimagining of Porter's exquisite prose poem is not to be missed.

title: Arj Barker - The Mind Field - Kingsford
description:
All of reality, as you can ever possibly know it, exists exclusively in your mind.

Armed with this knowledge, Arj sets out to answer some of Life's Biggest Questions:
'Why are we here? Are we alone in the Universe? Why does it hurt when we pee?'

You'll laugh and you'll learn, but you'll never look at anything the same, once you enter…
The Mind Field.
'It's all in your head.

title: Community Day: The Neighbour at the Gate Opening Weekend
description:
Join a fun-filled day of family-friendly, free creative activities.

See the exhibition, participate in artmaking and mindfulness sessions led by Madina Yoga, and enjoy drop-in workshops facilitated by art educators, inspired by the artworks in the exhibition. Explore a range of mediums including ceramics, textiles and printmaking inspired by the work of exhibiting artists Jacky Cheng, Dennis Golding, James Nguyen and Jason Phu. Visitors can contribute a clay piece to the exhibition and take away their own textile tassel or hand-printed tote bag at the end of the day.

Hear directly from the exhibiting artists and curators in a free panel talk, unpacking the themes of the exhibition.

After a day of artmaking and artist talks, join an evening of free DJ sets outdoors, with DJ Rocky Stallone, Sveta and Mason Kimber and food and beverages. Closing out the Opening Weekend celebrations is the major program event, the Shared Skies Music Concert in the historic Cell Block Theatre, with live performances from BARKAA, Rainbow Chan and DJ Rocky Stallone (ticketed event, bookings essential).

Alongside their special celebrations and activities, the NAS Gallery will be open for extended hours. Please visit the website for more information.

This is proudly supported by the NSW Government through the Blockbusters Funding Initiative.

title: Arts Industry Day: The Neighbour at the Gate Opening Weekend
description:
You are warmly invited to come along for an industry day, focused on artist talks and art making opportunities.

Hear directly from the guest curatorium and the featured artists in The Neighbour at the Gate exhibition, charts the entangled legacies of exclusion and resilience, drawing vital parallels between the past and present, memory and nationhood. 

Create a ceramic work to add to James Nguyen's participatory installation artwork 'Homeopathies_where new trees grow' (2025), or make a fabric tassel inspired by Jacky Cheng's work 'Imaginary Homelands' (2025). Learn more about the shared histories and stories behind this immersive exhibition.

Free admission, all welcome

This is proudly supported by the NSW Government through the Blockbusters Funding Initiative.

title: The Neighbour at the Gate
description:
The National Art School (NAS) presents a major new exhibition, The Neighbour at the Gate, premiering at NAS Galleries.

Curated by a guest curatorium led by Clothilde Bullen (Wardandi Noongar and Badimaya Yamatji), with Micheal Do and Zali Morgan (Whadjuk Balladong and Wilman Noongar).

Bringing together newly commissioned works by leading Australian artists Jacky Cheng, Elham Eshraghian-Haakansson, Dennis Golding (Kamilaroi/Gamilaraay), Jenna Mayilema Lee (Gulumerridjin (Larrakia), Wardaman, KarraJarri), James Nguyen and James Tylor (Kaurna, Thura-Yura language region), the exhibition reckons with the echoes of immigration policies and the legacies of Colonialism in Australia, unravelling how these forces continue to shape First Nations and Asian Australian experiences and relationships.

Across various mediums and perspectives, The Neighbour at the Gate charts the entangled legacies of exclusion and resilience, drawing vital parallels between the past and present, memory and nationhood.

The Neighbour at the Gate is a commissioned exhibition project for the National Art School, proudly supported by the NSW Government through Blockbusters Funding initiative. The exhibition will be accompanied by a publication, learning and education framework and public program.

title: Burlesque: The (Parody) Dinner Show
description:
You've seen "Burlesque" and now you can see "Burlesque: the (parody) Dinner Show". From DVD to 3D, do not miss this immersive theatre (parody) adaptation of the cult movie classic.

 Be ready to plunge into a different world and be entertained from every angle. This is a 360-degree experience unlike anything else! You'll enjoy the theatrical whirlwind around you from the safety and comfort of your own cabaret table, all while lapping up the scrumptious dinner and drinks. 

Expect all your favourite characters reimagined, funnier and in the flesh. There may even be a little actual burlesque.

Standard tickets include a two-course meal. Options to include three courses or beverage packages are also available.

This show is recommended for audiences 16 years or older. Minors may attend with a responsible adult. This event is a 3-hour sitting.

title: Boards and Bottles - Wine and Games
description:
Looking for the perfect midweek escape? Come to The Art Syndicate for Boards and Bottles: Thursday Board Game Night! Gather your friends, roll the dice, and enjoy a selection of classic and modern board games while sipping on your favorite wines, beers and spirits from NSW.

There are a small selection of board games available, and they welcome you to bring your own favorites and use the cozy space to play. 

Whether you're a seasoned strategist or just looking for a fun night out, the more games, the merrier.

title: Mondays at The Art Syndicate: Celebrating NSW Beverages
description:
Unwind on your day off and discover the best of NSW’s local drinks scene!

From craft beers and ciders to wines and spirits, our weekly gathering is the perfect place to explore a rotating selection of beverages in a welcoming, laid-back atmosphere.

Whether you’re a hospitality worker looking for a place to relax or someone curious about NSW’s diverse drink offerings, Mondays at The Art Syndicate are your chance to sip, sample, and enjoy a great night out.

title: The F.O.C.K.: Festival of Canoe and Kayak
description:
The F.O.C.K.: Festival of Canoe and Kayak is a celebration of recreational paddling in Australia.

A family friendly event with a risqué title, the Festival of Canoe and Kayak. is an annual event that is the number one recreational paddling festival in Australia.

A showcase and celebration of paddling culture and community, it's also a lot of fun!

title: Darlo Night Market
description:
The Darlo Night Market offers an evening of fashion, food, and vibrant atmosphere, serving as a dynamic pop-up boutique market that showcases emerging designers, vintage treasures, and an array of delicious street food.

Located in the heart of Darlinghurst, just a short walk from Oxford Street and Surry Hills, the market provides a lively and accessible destination for those seeking a unique night out.

Visitors can explore a curated selection of vintage and pre-loved fashion, where they'll discover upcycled garments and one-of-a-kind wardrobe pieces that promote sustainable shopping in style.

A variety of hot food and sweet treats are available throughout the evening, ensuring that guests remain well-fed and energized as they browse the stalls and enjoy the festivities.

The atmosphere is further enhanced by live DJs and music, creating a soundtrack of upbeat tunes that complements the market's energetic and welcoming vibe.

The Darlo Night Market takes place on the third Saturday of each month.

This monthly event invites locals and visitors alike to mark their calendars, gather their friends, and immerse themselves in a night of community, creativity, and culture.

title: Maple Social Club
description:
Maple Social Club is all about facilitating fun, unique and low-pressure community experiences. Each week hundreds of people come together to connect over music, activities, food and drink in and around Sydney. 

Since starting in November 2024, the community has grown to thousands of people. The events have ranged from dinner parties in renovated churches, morning raves in cafes, to huge but casual tennis and racket sport tournaments. 

The events are free to attend, typically once a week, and hosted in the inner suburbs of Sydney. As the style and location of events can change, check the socials to keep up to date with upcoming events.

title: John Watson the "Minskys Piano Man" at Henry G's
description:
On the first Sunday of every month, Henry G's proudly welcomes John Watson.

Renowned for his captivating performances at Minskys Piano Lounge, Watson enchants audiences with a blend of timeless classics and delightful surprises, all complemented by fine wine and warm company.

Reservations are highly recommended.

title: Run Port Stephens
description:
Run Port Stephens is a fan favourite!

Starting at Nelson Bay Foreshore, runners will tackle rolling climbs and fast flat paths along the edge of the pristine coastline.

Racing through tree-covered paths, past coffee shops and the town centre, Run Port Stephens is undoubtedly one of the most pristine courses in the state!

With a race distance to suit everyone, this event has everything you need, including finisher medal, event merch available, AG podium medals, timing, photos, and more.

The perfect event for runners, spectators and families alike, with beaches and a kids' play area nearby, to entertain the family while their loved ones push themselves to the limit!

Come for The Run but stay for the weekend full of activities, with a festival atmosphere including an expo, food trucks, kids activities, and a Fisiocrem tent with Massage therapists. Partners PURE Sports Nutrition and Revvies will be supplying their goodies to competitors.

title: Green Square Monthly Market
description:
Cambridge Markets is excited to announce that Green Square Market will be returning on a monthly basis, held on the fourth Saturday of each month. They are thrilled to bring this outstanding event back to the community, creating a vibrant gathering place where locals and visitors can come together to enjoy a day filled with shopping, delicious food, and live entertainment.

With up to 50 stalls, this market is more than just a shopping destination—it's a place to connect, support small businesses, and celebrate the best of local creativity, culture, and fresh produce.

title: Sail Port Stephens
description:
Sail Port Stephens is an annual yachting regatta series held in the pristine waters of Port Stephens over April and May. 

The event offers great sailing for all classes of boats plus a vibrant social and entertainment program. It's family-friendly, affordable and fun!

You can drive to Port Stephens from Sydney in less than three hours. Alternatively, fly from Melbourne or Queensland direct to Newcastle Airport. There's a wide range of accommodation available to suit any budget.

title: Fisiocrem Triathlon Hawks Nest
description:
Triathlon returns to the stunning location of Hawks Nest, a haven for sports enthusiasts.

Featuring tranquil, crystal-clear waters for the swim, a rapid and level bike course, and an exhilarating run to finish, it's the perfect setting for this triathlon festival.

Dive into the excitement, with your choice of three captivating distances: the Standard, Sprint, Super Sprint, Classic and Aquabike. 

Experience the thrill of the race, surrounded by the natural beauty of Hawks Nest. Your ultimate triathlon adventure starts here!

title: Garden of Earthly Delights - Kangaroo Valley
Cricket Australia Men’s One Day International Series vs India
description:
India makes their way back to the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) for the third and final One Day International match of the series. 

The rivalry between these two nations is intensifying and you need to see it.

title: Cricket Australia Women’s T20I Series vs India | 1st T20I
description: This season Australia will face the growing force of India in the Women's T20I series. With Women's cricket returning to the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG), you won't want to miss it.

title: Wrexham Down Under Tour - Sydney
description:
The Red Dragons are roaring south. And they're not coming quietly.

After storming into the Championship thanks to historic back-to-back-to-back promotions, Wrexham AFC are unleashing their fire on Australia and New Zealand for the very first time — and they're coming for the best the A-League has to offer.

Three cities. Three massive matchups. One unforgettable tour.

Ticket purchasers should note that the final squad is subject to change for reasons including player availability and injury.

title: The British and Irish Lions vs New South Wales Waratahs - Sydney
description:
The British and Irish Lions will return to Australia in 2025 vs New South Wales Waratahs at Allianz Stadium, Sydney.

This highly anticipated and in-demand festival of Rugby will see the Lions play nine matches in Australia, with three Tests against the Wallabies and six tour games around the country. The travelling festival is expected to fill stadiums whilst also attract over 40,000 international visitors to Australia!

The British and Irish Lions combine the best players from England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland, touring either Australia, New Zealand or South Africa every four years – meaning the Lions only visit Australia every 12 years.

Australia shares a long history with the Lions, with Australia’s first ever Rugby Test match taking place against a British Isles team at the Sydney Cricket Ground in 1899 on the Lions’ first tour to Australia.

Guarantee access to buy tickets right now to each fixture with a Wallabies First Lions Edition membership via the website.

title: NRMA Insurance Men's Ashes - Pink Test
description: The most iconic series in world cricket is coming... The NRMA Insurance men's Ashes series heads to Sydney for the Pink Test. The Ashes remains one of the most historic and hotly contested events in world sport – and you will not want to miss this. Stay ahead of the game and register for priority access to tickets, the most up-to-date schedule information and special offers from Cricket Australia.

title: Urban Wine Walk Manly
description:
The streets and laneways of Manly will come alive this Winter as a line-up of the best venues transforms into an Urban Cellar Door for you to visit on a self-guided trail.

How does it work you ask? Simply decide which venue you'd like to start from and you're off. Choose your own adventure as you and your friends move from venue to venue tasting delicious wines thanks to the incredible line-up of Australian winemakers.

Guaranteed to sell out, the Urban Wine Walk promises a fun and unique self-guided wine-tasting experience that you and your friends won't want to miss.

title: Paddington Markets
description:
The mission of the Paddington Markets is to provide space for creativity and positive community transformation in the local community. It is a place, to connect, to create and learn, and provides a place of trade for artisans, entrepreneurs, and many small businesses.  

It is the perfect place for buying a unique gift that you can’t find anywhere else,  to find the best of fresh produce and is a really great place to  have a relaxed Saturday lunch.

Paddington Markets has been part of the mission and ministry of Paddington Uniting church for nearly 50 years.  The markets began in 1973 as the brainchild of the late Reverend Peter Holden Rev. Holden is considered by many to be a visionary young minister who had just returned to Sydney after helping to organise the legendary Woodstock music festival.  At that time, the church community saw the markets as a way to encourage the creativity Paddington had on offer as it developed a new bohemian new identity following the recent migration of artists to the area.

title: Daniel Muggleton - You May Be White, I May Be Crazy - Moore Park
description:
Daniel Muggleton is an Australian comedian in a red tracksuit. 

Daniel's stand-up shows frequently sell out at comedy festivals around the world, in addition to receiving numerous 5-star reviews and awards. 

He's been hand-picked to support Jim Jefferies, Steve Hofstetter and Russell Kane on tour and clips of his jokes frequently go viral on social media, having amassed over 25 million views.

title: Tropical Depression - Dan Rath (Moore Park)
description:
Dan can't seem to focus anymore. He wonders if it's the microplastics, the lingering effects of long COVID, or simply the fact that he's paying $500 a week to live in what feels like a slow-motion science experiment in mould growth.

This year has been a strange ride. He showed up to a rally dressed as Boba Fett, only to be caught in the chaos and beaten by both the police and the protestors. Somewhere along the way, he developed a strangely comforting, one-sided relationship with a DoorDash chatbot—his most consistent companion during late-night food orders. And in a final twist of digital misadventure, he lost all his cryptocurrency trying to buy what he believed was a genuine mermaid skeleton.

title: Jane Canfield: Elemental
description:
Jane Canfield paints primarily in oils and gouache, working off smaller studies produced en plein air and producing larger oil paintings in her studio. She is inspired by the landscape around her in the Central West of New South Wales.

With more than a dozen solo exhibitions to date, Jane Canfield has works in many private collections in Australia and Internationally. Her landscapes are simplified and reduced, creating an impression of the landscape, and using colour as a driving force for the composition.

In 2014 she was collected into the prestigious Kedumba Drawing Award, and has been a finalist in many art prizes including the Paddington, NSW Parliament and Calleen Art Award.

title: Chris Watts: Slow Burn
description:
Chris Watts is an accomplished artist whose award-winning career spans graphic design, music, illustration, and painting, with each medium enriching the depth and impact of his work. 

His musical career has seen him perform alongside international legends Elton John and Robbie Williams, with his visual talents leading him to design his own album covers and direct his music videos—each a distinctive blend of his artistic vision and creative prowess.

Inspired by the Pop Art movement and a deep admiration for Warhol, Chris's paintings deliver powerful, vibrant statements on the themes of fashion, confidence, style, and attitude. His pieces bring bold colour and dynamic energy to the canvas, capturing a fresh, contemporary perspective that commands attention and challenges the status quo in modern art.

title: Jakey Pedro Exhibition at Art2Muse Gallery
description:
Northern Beaches artist Jakey Pedro (Jacob Pedrana) is a rising star in the art world with recent exhibitions in Australia, L.A. and Costa Rica. His current body of work speaks to the wildness of the rodeo, induced by sub-tropical colouring.  

Fusing bold, pastel acrylic blocks with the soft edge of an oil stick, his unruly, neo-expressionist style is full of movement and metaphor, inspired by the wildness of the Western rodeo and surf culture.

title: Science in the Swamp
description:
Greater Sydney Parklands is bringing back the much-loved Science in the Swamp to Centennial Park on Sunday in celebration of National Science Week.

This action-packed family event invites everyone to embrace their inner scientist, offering more than 30 interactive stalls and live science shows. Visitors can look forward to coming face to face with a life-sized roving dinosaur, live science shows, hands−on experiments, native animals and many stalls to explore.

title: Night at the Barracks - North Head Manly
description:
This phenomenal concert series is perched above Sydney Harbour against the stunning backdrop of North Head Manly. Night at The Barracks comes alive once a year for a limited time. As the sun sets, the venue transforms, offering an unforgettable experience with your favourite artists under the stars.

But it's more than just the music. Come early, grab a drink, and savour the tasty flavours from the lineup of local food and beverage vendors. Find your spot, soak in the atmosphere, and settle in for an incredible night.

In line with their commitment to preserving the deep historical significance North Head Sanctuary holds, Night at The Barracks proudly champions sustainability, minimising their carbon footprint and promoting others to do the same. From recycling programs to sustainable transport options, eco-consciousness is the heart of every aspect of our event planning. For more information on the rich history of this iconic location, check out The Harbour Trust website.

They also take a moment to respectfully acknowledge the Traditional Custodians of the land upon which they gather. Their respect extends to their Elders, past, present, and emerging.

title: Truffle Dinner at Chiswick Woolahra
description: Chiswick will host an evening of 'all things truffle' as they welcome The Truffle Farm to Chiswick and treat guests to a four-course sharing menu. Featuring truffles married with Chiswick's winter harvest, the evening will be a warm and relaxed affair that's all about celebrating produce at its peak. For a true immersion in this incredible ingredient, guests can opt to add on a curated wine pairing from head sommelier Georgie Davidson-Brown.

title: History Kids – The Hunt for Clues at Vaucluse House
description:
These school holidays, step into the past and become a history detective at Vaucluse House!

Dress up and go undercover as you search for clues to solve a puzzle at the house. Along the way, you'll uncover fascinating stories about Vaucluse House, the lives of the Wentworth family, and the Birrabirragal and Gadigal people, the traditional custodians of this land.

Get hands-on with fun activities, explore the house in a whole new way, and complete your adventure with a refreshing drink and treat.

Are you ready to crack the case?

title: Shoal Bay Food and Wine Festival
description:
Get ready to indulge your senses at the inaugural Shoal Bay Food and Wine Festival, a mouthwatering celebration of some of the region's food, wine, craft beer, and spirits.

This exciting event will transform Shoal Bay Road and the stunning foreshore into a vibrant alfresco dining precinct, showcasing the region's food and beverage scene. Enjoy live music and activities for all ages as you soak up the relaxed atmosphere.

title: Tai-Chi in Centennial Park Sydney
description:
One hour of Tai-chi relaxes and regulates the central nervous system, promotes physical and mental well-being and releases emotional and physical stress accumulated through work or other anxieties. People of all ages can cultivate relaxation, balance, central equilibrium and physical coordination through these gentle and non-jarring exercises.

Tai-chi is also often referred to as a 'moving meditation' or 'moving in stillness' or promoting self-awareness and self-discipline which in turn generates a feeling of well-being, where inner tensions dissolve and the 'mind' starts to quieten. 

A focus on awareness, breathing and visualisation techniques help to promote a deeper sense of relaxation and focus.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Caringbah
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to seven million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Lexi Love and Sam Star Sydney
description:
They are fierce, fabulous, and fully prepared to steal your heart. Lexi Love and Sam Star are bringing their bold personalities and jaw-dropping performances to the stage, and trust them, you’re not ready.

Expect powerhouse performances, BTS stories, and so much more.

VIP Meet and Greet: Feeling extra? Snag a Meet and Greet Package for an exclusive photo op with the queens. (Warning: they are even more stunning up close!) Availability is seriously limited, so don't miss the presale or cry later.

Get ready to fall head over heels—Lexi Love and Sam Star are here to snatch wigs, turn heads, and leave you begging for more.

title: Woollahra Sailing Club - Sailing and Water Sports Adventure Camp
description:
Looking for some fun and adventure during your vacation, Woollahra Sailing Club is the perfect place for you. Their Sailing and Water Sports Adventure Camps during the school holidays are full of sand, sea, adventure, and fun! 

All programs are led by friendly instructors who are fully certified by Australian Sailing. They offer camps for sailors who want to improve their skills, as well as camps for teens and daily adventure camps for children six years or older with no experience.

For independent sailors who want to improve their sailing skills and have an introductory experience to fun racing, the Junior Sailing Holiday Camps are the perfect choice. Teens can also enjoy a fun-filled, social, and action-packed 4-day program with a varied experience of different water sports, sailing, and activities each day. 

If you're traveling with kids aged 6-12 years old, the Rose Bay Adventure Camp is a must-visit. With a varied experience of different water sports, activities, sailing, environmental science, games, and more, your kids will have a great time while you relax and enjoy the scenic views. Camps run rain, hail, or shine all year round with activities on both land and water to keep everyone occupied, active, and endlessly entertained.

title: GV Block Party
description:
Greenvalleys Mountain Bike Club presents the GV Block Party,  Australia’s boutique mountain bike event of the year.

Mountain Bike riders have seven timed stages with unlimited runs to set their best time with a variety of side events including the Airbag under lights session and the "Tales from the Trails" Film competition on a massive outdoor cinema.

title: The TAB Everest
description:
The TAB Everest is the world’s richest race on turf that sees twelve of the very best sprinters compete for over AUD20 million in prizemoney in the Group one race.

Sydney’s Royal Randwick hosts the race day as one of Australia’s most prestigious racing venues. The TAB Everest is a day of world class racing, hospitality, and entertainment that you won't want to miss.

title: Your Local Wedding Guide's Expo - Sydney
description:
Your Local Wedding Guide Sydney Expo brings together Sydney's leading wedding professionals and suppliers under one roof so you can find everything you need to plan your perfect wedding day. 

This highly anticipated, prestigious wedding show gives you the opportunity to meet face-to-face with wedding suppliers so you can find your dream wedding team, plus you'll see fabulous displays, get expert advice, view the latest trends, and immerse yourself in all of the unique and diverse wedding products the exhibitors have to offer. 

Whether you're dreaming of a country, beach, or city wedding - large or intimate, they've got something for everyone. Find gowns, suits, celebrants, reception venues, photographers, hair and makeup artists, bomboniere, cakes, florists, and much more! If you're getting married, their on-trend Sydney wedding expo is an event not to be missed. 

You'll find lots of ideas, inspiration and advice, exclusive expo specials, live music, plus incredible prize packages. Entry is free, plus you'll receive a complimentary copy of Your Local Wedding Guide magazine! Join them for a free, fun day out at Royal Randwick Racecourse!

title: Jimeoin - Pandemonium (Kingsford)
description:
Don't miss Jimeoin's hilarious new show Pandemonium!

A night spent with this comedy legend is not only funny but full of handy tips. Jimeoin will teach you how to make your bed with very little effort, how to prank your partner and get away with it and how to talk dirty in a nice way…. you'll come out the other side having laughed yourself stupid and maybe with a life hack or two.

Have you ever wondered what goes on inside Jimeoin's head? By the end of this show you'll know that it's absolute Pandemonium!

title: Kings of Country Rock - Kingsford
description:
A two-hour stage spectacular that captures the sounds and excitement of America's country rock icons.

The Kings of Country Rock concert features all the timeless rock and roll classics that defined the Eagles and Creedence Clearwater Revival as 1970s superstars.

Part one of the highly-acclaimed show takes the audience on a musical journey of the Eagles, the highest-selling American band in U.S. Audience members will hear faithfully reproduced masterpieces such as Take It Easy, Witchy Woman, Already Gone, One of These Nights, Lyin’ Eyes, Take It to the Limit, New Kid in Town, Desperado, Hotel California and Life in the Fast Lane.

Part two of the show kicks into overdrive, featuring the chart-topping sounds of San Francisco’s favourite sons, Creedence Clearwater Revival. With more than 26 million album sales in the U.S. alone, it was CCR’s take on Dale Hawkins’ rockabilly classic Suzie Q that set an irrepressible force in motion and made the band a platinum household name. CCR anthems such as Proud Mary, Bad Moon Rising, Up Around The Bend, Born On The Bayou, Have You Ever Seen The Rain, Travelin’ Band and Green River will surely get the audience singing a chorus of hits.

The Kings of Country Rock Tour is the ultimate rock experience! The cast of multi-talented and internationally respected musicians brings to life a stage show like no other.

title: South Coast Readers & Writers Festival
description:
The South Coast Readers & Writers Festival returns to Thirroul with a vibrant lineup of literary talent, from rising stars to international bestsellers. 

With headlining authors Charlotte McConaghy (Wild Dark Shore), Isobelle Carmody (Comes the Night), Pip Williams (The Bookbinder of Jericho), Kate Forsyth (Psykhe), Nikki Gemmell (Wing), Nardi Simpson (the belburd), Omar Sakr (The Nightmare Sequence), Jessie Tu (The Honeyeater), and Amy Remeikis (What's the Big Idea?), plus many more festival guests to be announced. 

Come along for gripping conversations on cautionary tales from the past and speculative futures, the reclamation of lost histories and endangered languages, climate grief and the turbulence of current affairs, new mythologies, explorations of womanhood, and the business of publishing.

From soul-stirring poetry readings, captivating literary fiction, historical recreation, and young adult adventures to thought-provoking non-fiction, intimate memoirs, gripping biographies, and cutting-edge politics, this year's South Coast Readers & Writers Festival promises an unforgettable program.

Dive into a celebration of writing, ideas, and voices that inspire, challenge, and connect, in the picturesque village of Thirroul on the NSW South Coast.

title: Summit Shoalhaven
description:
Trail runners rejoice - Summit Shoalhaven returns!

Established in 1966 by a small team of local running enthusiasts from the Nowra Athletics Club, this iconic event has seen thousands of runners make the journey up Mount Scanzi to finish in the Kangaroo Valley. In 2025, 59 years after the first King of the Mountain, we will again run this course as Summit Shoalhaven!

Which distance will you conquer? 54 kilometres, 36 kilometres, 21 kilometres or 11 kilometres. 

Summit Shoalhaven will begin and end at the new course held West of North Nowra (off Illaroo Road), and caters for the full spectrum of runners, from the elite to the weekend warrior.

title: Port Stephens Multisport Festival
description:
The spectacular coastlines, beaches and national parks of Port Stephens are set to play host to a weekend of off-road action.

Located on the NSW Mid North Coast, and just 2.5 hours' drive from Sydney, Port Stephens offers a winning combination of spectacular beaches, scenic national parklands and rugged rocky coastlines providing the perfect backdrop for a weekend of off-road action at the Port Stephens MultiSport Festival.

This weekend of not-to-be-missed action will host the TreX Cross Triathlon Series and Trail Run Australia with events for all comers from the littlest Dirt Kids right through to the hardcore off-road Dirt Masters.

So, whether you're a group of mates, a club, a family, a weekend warrior or someone who just loves being in the outdoors in spectacular destinations, it's time to discover your next adventure at the Port Stephens MultiSport Festival.

title: Kings of Country Rock: Eagles Vs Creedence Clearwater Revival - Thirroul
description:
A two-hour stage spectacular that captures the sounds and excitement of America's country rock icons.

The Kings of Country Rock concert features all the timeless rock and roll classics that defined the Eagles and Creedence Clearwater Revival as 1970s superstars.

Part one of the highly-acclaimed show takes the audience on a musical journey of the Eagles, the highest-selling American band in U.S. Audience members will hear faithfully reproduced masterpieces such as Take It Easy, Witchy Woman, Already Gone, One of These Nights, Lyin’ Eyes, Take It to the Limit, New Kid in Town, Desperado, Hotel California and Life in the Fast Lane.

Part two of the show kicks into overdrive, featuring the chart-topping sounds of San Francisco’s favourite sons, Creedence Clearwater Revival. With more than 26 million album sales in the U.S. alone, it was CCR’s take on Dale Hawkins’ rockabilly classic Suzie Q that set an irrepressible force in motion and made the band a platinum household name. CCR anthems such as Proud Mary, Bad Moon Rising, Up Around The Bend, Born On The Bayou, Have You Ever Seen The Rain, Travelin’ Band and Green River will surely get the audience singing a chorus of hits.

The Kings of Country Rock Tour is the ultimate rock experience! The cast of multi-talented and internationally respected musicians brings to life a stage show like no other.

title: Toni Childs - A Retrospective - Thirroul
description:
Join the legendary Toni Childs for a special two-hour solo performance as she celebrates her life's musical works in song and in story. Toni will be performing hits and fan favourites from Union, House of Hope, The Woman's Boat and Keep the Faith, and sharing stories of how Union came to life in the first hour of her show. The second hour will be an introduction to Toni's new music, from two very special albums, It's All a Beautiful Noise and Citizens of the Planet.
  
Emmy Winner and three-time Grammy-nominated recording artist, Toni is a celebrated singer-songwriter known for her powerful voice, inspiring independent spirit and crafted storytelling. With fans in over 50 countries around the world, Toni has produced a list of international hits such as: Don't Walk Away, Stop Your Fussin', Walk and Talk Like Angels, Zimbabwe, Where's the Ocean, Many Rivers to Cross, I've Got to Go Now and Because You're Beautiful, to name a few.  
           
Over Toni's illustrious career, she has opened for Bob Dylan and performed duets with greats such as Al Green and Peter Gabriel. She has toured the world over, gaining a much-loved fan base.  
  
The coming years will see the wider release of two very special albums of music: first, It's All A Beautiful Noise and the second Citizens Of The Planet.

title: Seventh Wonder performs Fleetwood Mac - Thirroul
description:
Hailed as one of the world's leading Fleetwood Mac shows, and managed by Former Fleetwood Mac manager Dennis Dunstan, this show has been applauded by critics and fans, including Mick Fleetwood himself: "On first hearing Seventh Wonder Orchestrated… it gave me goosebumps."

This world-class performance, led by the incredible Bloom, brings together a star-studded band and the exquisite strings of the Sydney Pops Orchestra to create an unparalleled tribute to Fleetwood Mac's music.

The evening will showcase the entire Rumours album, performed note-for-note, alongside the band's greatest hits. This masterful production promises to captivate fans of all ages and celebrate the legacy of one of the most beloved bands in music history.

Seventh Wonder Performs Fleetwood Mac rises above mere tribute—it's a celebration. Featuring meticulous, note-for-note recreations of Fleetwood Mac's greatest songs, the show has won acclaim for its authenticity, emotional resonance, and powerhouse performances, catapulting the band into being regarded as one of the World's Leading Fleetwood Mac shows.

Dennis Dunstan, who managed Fleetwood Mac for over a decade, adds his stamp of approval to this exceptional production: "Fleetwood Mac's music is timeless, and this show is the perfect celebration of their artistry. The addition of the Sydney Pops Orchestra's strings elevates it to a whole new level. It's a must-see for any music fan."

title: Echoes of Pink Floyd - 60 Years of Pink Floyd - Thirroul
description:
Iconic British rock band, Pink Floyd left an indelible mark on the world, inspiring generations with their ground-breaking soundscapes and thought-provoking lyrics. 2025 marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style in a brand new concert production by Adelaide’s own Echoes of Pink Floyd.

Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerizing journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.

Echoes of Pink Floyd stands as Australia’s foremost tribute dedicated to honouring the legendary band's monumental legacy and has garnered widespread acclaim across the country since their inception in 2009.

Since embarking on national tours in 2014, their lovingly-crafted performances have captivated audiences nationwide.

title: The Simon & Garfunkel Story - Wollongong
description:
Performing to great acclaim and sell-out shows in over 50 countries around the world, The Simon & Garfunkel Story is a critically acclaimed concert experience about two young boys from Queens who went on to become the world's most successful music duo.

Featuring all their classic hits, including The Sound of Silence, Mrs Robinson, Bridge Over Troubled Water and Cecilia, The Simon & Garfunkel Story charts their rise to fame and success during an intense six-decade-long friendship.

The story is woven between the songs, with evocative video projections and images conjuring up the atmosphere of the turbulent times and brings to life the lyrics and melodies that helped to shape a generation and propel the duo to fame.

Moving and powerful, The Simon and Garfunkel Story is a must see and captivating show told with warmth and feeling.

title: Holly 'Cookie' Baker - Where Do You Go In The Winter?
description:
After a five-year hiatus from touring, Australian singer-songwriter Holly 'Cookie' Baker is making a triumphant return to the stage with her 17-date Where Do You Go In The Winter? Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australian tour. The tour marks Cookie's debut performances in Aotearoa, bringing her heartfelt songs to new audiences for the first time.

Raised on a coastal farm in rural South Australia and now based on Kaurna land, Cookie has built a loyal following for her lyrically rich alt-country folk and dreamy pop sound. Known for her sparkling vocals, poetic grit, and dynamic storytelling, Cookie has toured with Mick Thomas, recorded with Tim Rogers, and shared the stage with icons like Neko Case, Kate Miller-Heidke, and Jen Cloher.

"This tour is really about reconnecting — with the music, with the audience, and with the kind of intimate, soul-nourishing shows that made me fall in love with performing in the first place" says Cookie. "New Zealand has been such a huge supporter of my music from afar, and this tour feels like a really special way to finally build that connection in person. In a time when so much feels fast and fleeting, I'm craving the slow magic of small rooms and real moments."

title: Illawarra Folk Festival
description:
The annual Illawarra Folk Festival has before been held over four days but for the 2026 festival, it may be eight venues with over 96 acts over three days.

The festival will include the sounds of folk, indie, world, roots, bluegrass, Balkan and Celtic music, as well as poetry, comedy and dance.

Set in the spectacular northern Illawarra Escarpment in Bulli Showground, the 2026 festival may have eight onsite venues and be a family-friendly village with action from early morning to late night.

With superb music from up to 96 international, national and local artists performing in over 228 concerts, workshops, sessions, and dances there will be also a colourful array of international food stalls, craft stalls and the festival bar.

You can also camp onsite or stay in top-quality accommodation nearby. There is plenty of onsite car parking and Bulli train station is a short walk away.

The festival commences on Friday afternoon, and concludes on Sunday evening with a finale with special guests.
