The festival does not have any major grants or funding and will be relying on the limited funds the Illawarra Folk Club has and ticket sales to survive.

title: Bulli Village School Holiday Market Day
description:
At the Bulli Village Market, you will find a face painter, sandpit area, henna tattoos and pony rides for the kids.

This location has an awesome new vibe with new stalls, extra parking as well as pony rides, Italian gelato, and lots of fun.

With over 90 bespoke stalls at this Iconic market location in the Northern suburbs of the Illawarra, it is a great place to meet family and friends, grab a coffee and delicious pastries or donuts. There are also gluten-free specialty stallholders at this market. You can sit and enjoy the new vibe of this lovely market day. You will find just about everything at this market from Dumplings, Vietnamese street foods, Colombian foods, South American Empanadas and paella.

Come and sample some wine, gin and salami tastings, plus some of the best Street foods you will find at any market, live music and great locals on any given day. You will find something for everyone at this all-weather market offering an indoor and outdoor seating area a play area for the kids to enjoy.

Plenty of parking is available. Disability parking areas.

Gold coin donation going to local charity.

Dog friendly.

title: Anzac Day at Wombarra Bowlo
description:
Anzac Day is Wombarra Bowlo's biggest day of the year.  It's one they like to commemorate and celebrate what Diggers have done for the country.

Festivities include brekky at 7 am (gold coin donation), DJ's from 12 pm and 2UP from 1 pm.

title: John Waters presents Radio Luxembourg - Randwick
description:
Iconic star of stage and screen John Waters, featuring Stewart D’Arrietta and the Chartbusters, celebrates the songs of the British Pop Invasion that changed the world of modern music forever.

From the evocative strains of Peter Saarstedt’s Where Do You Go to My Lovely, and the memory dredging Waterloo Sunset by the Kinks and To Love Somebody by the BeeGees, to the infectious grooves of Itchycoo Park by the Small Faces and the anthemic My Generation by The Who, Waters and his band reprise and reinvent the classic hits. With a six piece band and singers in brilliant voice, Waters recounts anecdotes and moving memories of the music of the era, taking the audience through the time continuum to songs that resound over decades, and remain as relevant as ever.

Born in London, Waters was in his teens and early twenties during the 1960s and considers himself one of the luckiest music lovers as a result. The reason why is in part due to Radio Luxembourg. At a time when commercial radio licences were not available in the UK, pop and rock music of the day was broadcast from continental Europe. This access was courtesy of the independent principality of Luxembourg - a clever move by the British record industry to circumnavigate the laws of the day.

title: Woodfest
description:
Every tree has a story, so take a trip to Bulli on the serene South Coast of NSW this October to see those stories come to life.

Enliven your senses and celebrate some of the world's most respected artisans with a love for wood who have honed their craft to share their skills and creations with you at this special event the whole family can be part of.

Come along to this one-of-a-kind festival in beautiful Bulli just minutes from one of the best beaches on the South Coast for an up close and personal experience with some of the world's best spoon carvers, traditional tool makers, wood turners, along with markets, sculpture, crafts and much more.

With a selection of tasty gourmet food, a barista cafe plus live music and entertainment including free activities for the kids, you'll be spoiled for choice at this annual exciting event that celebrates a global love for wood!
host: THE ILLAWARRA WOODWORK SCHOOL PTY LIMITED

title: Bulli Village Market
description:
The market boasts over 90 bespoke stalls at the iconic location in the Northern suburbs of the Illawarra. It is a great place to meet family and friends, grab a coffee and delicious pastry, and enjoy the market day vibe. With plenty of parking at this location, pony rides, a Facepainter and a sand pit for the kids. There are three seating areas, undercover and two outdoor seating areas, so you can laze in the sunshine on any market day.

There is something for everyone, with a lovely selection of hand-made crafts, Street food
coffee, pastries, and live music on every market day. There are also gluten-free breads, an amazing range of cheeses, olives, salamis gin, and wine sampling to enjoy.

This all-weather market has an ATM and occurs on the second Sunday of the month. The local men's shed manages the public car parking areas and appreciates a gold coin donation if you are able to donate.

title: Open Days at Illawarra Grevillea Park Botanic Garden
description:
The Illawarra Grevillea Park Botanic Garden houses a unique collection of native plants from all over Australia. 

Visitors can wander through the expansive display gardens, explore the rainforest and sensory walk or wander through the book display in the 100-year-old chapel.  There are acres of area to explore including a well-marked bushwalking track. Or utilise the BBQ and picnic facilities and enjoy the day with your family surrounded by colourful seasonal displays.

There are hundreds of plants for sale, including many grafted Grevilleas. Volunteers are on hand to answer questions and provide advice on growing native plants. 

The Illawarra Grevillea Park Botanic Garden hosts open days seasonally in Autumn, Winter and Spring.

Autumn - first two weekends in May 
Winter - first two weekends in July
Spring - first two weekends in September

Please always check their website or get in touch prior to travel to check opening dates and times. Their volunteers look forward to welcoming you.

title: Urban Cocktail Trail Bondi Beach
description:
To celebrate all the art, craftsmanship and fun a beautifully made cocktail has to offer, you're invited to Bondi Beach for the Urban Cocktail Trail!

How does it work you ask? Rally your friends together and start the afternoon with a bite to eat and of course, a cocktail at your starting location before making your way around the trail to redeem your cocktail vouchers, choosing your favourites from the Signature Cocktail List!

As a self-guided experience where you decide to stop and sip is completely up to you!

title: Andrew Hamilton - Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison - Bulli
description:
In 2021, Andrew Hamilton spent four months in two of Sydney’s maximum-security prisons for the commercial supply of psychedelic drugs. While incarcerated, Andrew began noticing the transformative power of laughter. After all, if a joke can make you forget you’re in prison, what else can it do? 

Upon his release, Andrew took up stand-up comedy, initially under strict bail conditions where his parents had to come with him to shows, and he had to be home in time for curfew. 

A year later, Andrew performed his debut solo show ‘Jokes About the Time I Went to Prison’, at the 2023 Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Andrew’s show garnered him critical acclaim, along with a nomination for Best Newcomer.

title: Bondi Farmers Market
description: The Bondi Farmers Market is held every Saturday at Bondi Beach Public School. The market brings you fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables, organically grown meat and poultry, just picked flowers, artisan breads, homemade jams, farmstead cheeses, seafood, olive oils, herbs, spices, good eats, coffee, matcha, fresh juices much more.

title: Bondi Aboriginal Experiences
description:
Walangari Karntawarra and Diramu Aboriginal Dance and Didgeridoo entertain and inform during this fun-filled, interactive cultural experience.

During the hour workshops the audience will be enthralled by the dynamic and authentic presentation of First Nations' dance and music. Learn dances, songs and words in a local Aboriginal language.

Attendees have the opportunity to feel and touch ancient artifacts, understand their uses, and identify bush foods and medicines still growing locally. 

Join in the yarning circle, or test your knowledge with the general knowledge quiz.
host: Walangari Karntawarra and Diramu Aboriginal Dance and Didgeridoo

title: Bondi Festival
description:
Waverley Council is back with its biggest-ever program for their annual Bondi Festival,  featuring a fresh line-up of world-class music, theatre, comedy, visual arts and interactive performances from the best in local talent.

The 17-day, all-inclusive festival makes its triumphant return to Bondi Pavilion and surrounds, with a smorgasbord of vibrant shows, free community events, and cutting-edge, night-time arts programming – alongside festival favourites, including Bondi's famous ice-skating rink and the beloved Bondi Vista Ferris Wheel. 

This year, there is also a new offering for the foodies-at-heart; the Festival's Blue Sky Markets make their debut at Bondi Park over three big Saturdays, bringing together delicious dishes from local businesses in Sydney's East.

title: Bondi Markets
description:
Established in 1993, the Bondi Markets are open every Sunday on the wonderful beachfront grounds of Bondi Beach Public School. 

Head to the markets and you'll find original designer clothing, exotic imports, handmade jewellery, arts, crafts, homewares, retro furniture, vintage clothes, and so much more.

Bondi Markets are the place to find the next big thing. Keep your eye out for up-and-coming designers. Mix it with the locals and shop to the sights and sounds of Australia's most famous beach.

See you down at the Bondi Markets this weekend.

Plus, on the first Sunday of every month, they host a special event - Vintage & Pre Loved pop-up alongside the regular market

title: Christmas Market - Open Day - Illawarra Lapidary Club Inc
description:
Club members will be selling jewellery, gemstones, cabochons, minerals, opals, findings, beads and fossils and lapidary equipment and items.

A great day for the whole family, come and find something special.

title: Christmas in July Market - Open Day
description:
Club members will be selling jewellery, gemstones, cabochons, minerals, opals, findings, beads and fossils and lapidary equipment and items and more.

A great day for the whole family, come and find something special.

title: Cronulla Winter Markets
description:
Cronulla will come alive for a weekend of shopping, eating and entertainment when Cambridge Markets returns to The Shire, with its amazing Cronulla Winter Market.

More than 150 micro-retailers will come together to offer everything from fashion to homewares, art, craft, plants, photography, pet goods, toys, gifts, candles and of course a smorgasbord of international gourmet food over the two-day event.

The Cronulla Winter Market will be held at Don Lucas Reserve, Wanda Beach, Cronulla. The alfresco market will be a beachside open-air event with something for the whole family.

title: Bloom sings Eva Cassidy Songbook | Cronulla
description:
With sold out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Bloom is highly applauded as “one of Australia’s finest vocalists”, some even placing her in the same company, vocally, of those very artists she pays tribute to in her stage productions ‘Adele & Amy Winehouse Songbook’ and the ‘Stevie Nicks, Carole King & Linda Ronstadt Songbook’. Bloom now extends her focus toward another soulful musical powerhouse – Eva Cassidy.

Eva’s soul-stirring voice came to prominence in 1998 after her renditions of “Fields of Gold” and “Over the Rainbow” were released… two years after her passing.

Sadly, her inability to be signed by a record label, unsure of how to market her eclectic repertoire, meant Eva only released one solo album in her lifetime – Live at Blues Alley – an album she recorded and self-released in 1996. It wasn’t until 1998 that her posthumously released recordings would pique the interest of the small West Coast folk music label Blix Street Records. Her first posthumously released album “Songbird”, became a major international hit and earnt the songstress subsequent number one albums across the globe, selling in excess of 12 million sales worldwide.

Bloom will once again enthral audiences across the country in this intimate and acoustic performance featuring all of Eva’s hits including “Songbird” “Time After Time” “Fields of Gold” “Over The Rainbow” and many more.

title: Bundeena and Maianbar Art Trail
description:
Come along on the first Sunday of each month for a peek inside some of Sydney's finest artist studios, nestled on the edge of the Royal National Park. 
 
You can walk or drive to open artist's studios in the villages of Bundeena and Maianbar. An interest in art and creativity is all you need for admission. All are welcome, the first time 'trailer' or the open day regular, the serious collector or the window shopper. 
 
Artworks on show and for sale include paintings, drawings, printmaking, woodcarving, decorative and functional pottery, glassware and jewellery. 
 
Take a scenic drive through the Royal National Park to get here or take a beautiful ferry ride from Cronulla.

title: Jewellery Gems and Minerals Festival
description:
The club will be featuring gemstone faceting, cabochon cutting, silver crafts, jewellery making and valuations, mineral group, club and fossicking information, refreshments, raffle and kid’s games.

There will be traders selling lapidary supplies, minerals, jewellery, crystals, findings, fossils, beads and opals.

Hoping you can make it. A great weekend for all ages.

title: Kids Care Cup
description:
Aboriginal Rugby League Carnival that raises awareness of Aboriginal kids in Out or Home Care system. 

Aboriginal teams from all around NSW come together to support the campaign.

title: MS Gong Ride
description:
Australia's most iconic recreational cycling event, held annually on the first Sunday in November. 

The MS Gong Ride supports Australians living with multiple sclerosis (MS) and is the most significant fundraising event for MS Plus. Cyclists depart Sydney and ride to the City of Wollongong. 

The event offers 3 distances; 82km starting at Tempe Recreation Reserve, and 58km starting at Engadine. Cyclists ride the Princes Highway through the closed roads of the Royal National Park, travelling along the coast to Thirroul, over the Sea Cliff Bridge through Woonona finishing at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadows. 

A short ride on the cycleway from Nicholson Park is offered to members of the Cycleability program from The Disability Trust.

title: Maroubra Beach Markets
description: This wonderful beach market is back this year. Expect shopping, food, fun and lots of great people at this fun monthly event. As usual, expect an eclectic mix of high-quality stalls across food, beverage, fashion, homewares, toys, art, craft, gifting, plants and plenty more. As well, this market will have a global hot food focus offering lots of wonderful dining for customers.

title: Monday Trivia at The Frat
description:
Join them at The Frat every Monday night for Trivia in the main lounge!

Free to play with $200 worth of prizes up for grabs.

Prizes include Frat Member Reward Points, Food & Drink vouchers.

Spread the word, get your teams together and see you at The Frat!
host: THE FRATERNITY BOWLING & RECREATION CLUB LTD

title: School Holiday Bambini Disco
description:
Come to the Fraternity Club for the next kids disco!

Your bambini's can dance the day away to all their favourite music while you enjoy a meal in the bistro or delicious wood-fired pizza.  All children must be accompanied by a responsible adult.  Adults are offered free tickets to attend but must 'purchase' a ticket so that we can keep a track on numbers. 

This is an alcohol free event.
host: THE FRATERNITY BOWLING & RECREATION CLUB LTD

title: Friday Night Raffles
description:
Friday nights just got tastier! Join The Frat for their legendary "Not just a meat" raffle!

Up for grabs are vouchers for delicious, top quality produce from Harley & Johns Seafood, Passion in Fruit, Illawarra Meat Co. plus, Leisure Coast Fruit & Deli.

A great way to end the week, enjoy a meal, and win yourself a weekend feast!
host: THE FRATERNITY BOWLING & RECREATION CLUB LTD

title: Pacific Palms Community Market
description:
Over 80 stalls to find that special thing you didn't know you needed until you saw it!

The Pacific Palms Community Centre comes alive with vibrant colours, textures and a really great vibe…come and experience it for yourself!

The Pacific Palms Market showcases quality handmade, homegrown and home-baked products from around the Barrington Coast region and beyond.

Sample some of our fabulous food from around the globe, including organic vegetarian curries, Asian noodles and Aussie-style barbecues! See the colourful stalls including eco and fair-trade products, jewellery, art, crafts, clothes, plants, fruit, vegetables and beautiful body products. A jumping castle and pony rides will keep the children entertained whilst you can enjoy an organic coffee and cake on the alfresco deck.

title: Australian Surf Championships - Australian Shortboard Titles
description:
Surfing Australia and Surfing NSW are pleased to announce the Australian surf championships, which incorporate the Australian shortboard titles.

The championships will run consecutively on the beautiful coastline of Wollongong, NSW this August.

title: HonkOz Festival
description:
The Honk Music Festival is a free, street-based event held in Wollongong during the height of summer, a time when the city is typically quiet. The festival injects vibrancy and energy into the area, attracting visitors from outside the region and encouraging engagement with local food outlets and venues.

The festival is known for its participatory music and parades, which bring together individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds. Community groups are actively encouraged to join the parading, fostering inclusivity and collaboration.

A wide range of art forms are celebrated, including music, performance, dance, circus, and visual arts. Families benefit from the Kids Honk! program, where children participate in music workshops and performances, as well as lantern-making workshops that culminate in a parade. The festival also empowers youth by providing opportunities to create and perform.

By emphasizing shared musical experiences, the Honk Music Festival helps to combat isolation and loneliness, creating a sense of connection and community among participants.

title: Down Under Championship
description:
The Down Under Championship returns with a bang! As Australia's premier CrossFit®️ Licensed Event, the DUC24 is set to be a thrilling spectacle, featuring over 400 athletes from Australia, New Zealand, and around the globe.

Steeped in the rich history of Oceanic CrossFit®️, the heart of the competition beats once again at the WIN Entertainment Centre. Join three days of intense competition, as they honour the sport's legacy and challenge the new generation of athletes with their extraordinary physical prowess. 

Don't miss out on this showcase of incredible talent and relentless determination!

title: Dan Rath: Tropical Depression - Wollongong
description:
He can't focus. He doesn't know if it's microplastics, long covid or because he pays $500 a week to live in a mold experiment. 
This year, he went to a rally dressed as Boba Fett and was bashed by both police and protestors. 
He formed a parasocial relationship with a doordash chatbot and he lost all my crpyto trying to buy a mermaid skeleton.

title: Basketball NSW State Cup
description:
The 2025 Junior State Cup will take place across two premier venues: the iconic Snakepit Basketball Stadium and the Illawarra Sports Stadium in Berkeley. 

The event will showcase the rising stars of NSW basketball, as teams from across the state come together to compete at the highest level in pursuit of state honours.

Boys and Girls aged under 12s, under 14s, under 16s and under 18s.

The 2025 fixture will be released at a later date once teams qualify for the event.

title: Melinda Schneider - The Tender Tour - Wollongong
description:
Acclaimed Golden Guitar-winning singer-songwriter Melinda Schneider is hitting the road this year to celebrate her highly anticipated album, Tender — her first original album in over a decade. Known for her heartfelt lyrics and soulful melodies, Schneider's new release marks a deeply personal and empowering return to her country music roots, embracing vulnerability, love, and resilience.

With Tender, Melinda Schneider continues to forge a powerful connection with her audience through authentic storytelling. The album includes a string of emotionally charged singles that showcase her evolution as both an artist and a woman. Fans will hear a rich exploration of emotional depth and raw honesty through tracks like '25 Hours', 'Words' and 'The Woman'. The new album's title track, a duet, also features Australian music icon, Deisel.

The Tender Tour will offer fans a chance to experience Melinda Schneider's extraordinary new music live, and also feature beloved hits from her iconic career, making it a must-see event for long-time fans and newcomers alike.

title: Eats and Beats - Albion Park
description:
The Streets Are Coming Alive!

Eats and Beats is a vibrant celebration of food, music, markets and family fun. 

Enjoy acoustic sets, DJ tunes and a silent disco under the stars, all set against a backdrop of magical lighting and art installations. 

Wander through creative market stalls supporting local makers and young talent, savour street food and sweet treats, and discover surprises at every turn — from interactive street performers and glowing light-up acts to face painting, a mini outdoor cinema and a light up dance floor

There's something for everyone, of all ages.

title: Albion Park Community Hub Market
description:
he Albion Park Community Hub Market is a vibrant, family-oriented event typically held on the first Sunday of each month at Centenary Hall in Albion Park.

As winter sets in, it's the perfect time to appreciate the warmth of indoor gatherings and the sense of community they bring. The next market offers an exciting experience with a wide variety of stallholders ready to delight visitors with unique shopping opportunities.

Guests can enjoy live music that sets a welcoming tone, along with delicious treats, including hearty winter soups and traditional damper to keep everyone warm and satisfied.

Children will be entertained with face painting, and the venue offers ample parking and disabled access to ensure everyone can join in the fun.

Entry is free for all, and the market is held rain or shine, making it a reliable destination for a great day out.

title: Ron Callaghan & Kyarna  -  Celebrating with Song: NAIDOC Week
description:
Join for Music and Tea at  Wollongong Art Gallery for a powerful morning of music and culture as you celebrate NAIDOC Week 2025 with an unforgettable concert featuring proud Yuin Nation artists Kyarna and Ron Callaghan.

In honour of this year's theme "The Next Generation: Strength, Vision & Legacy" this concert showcases the enduring strength of Aboriginal culture, the vision of artists, and the legacy carried forward through music and storytelling. Kyarna brings a fresh, soulful sound that speaks to identity, hope, and the future, while Ron Callaghan offers rich, heartfelt songs grounded in community, connection, and country.

Held on beautiful Dharawal Country, this free event invites all to come together, reflect, and celebrate the voices shaping tomorrow. Through powerful performance and cultural expression, we pay tribute to generations past and present, and lift up those who are leading us forward.

Come be part of a morning that celebrates legacy, honours resilience, and amplifies the voices of the next generation.

title: Garden of Earthly Delights - Wollongong
Lawrence Mooney - Dead Set Country - Wollongong
description:
Mooney's gone country. Deep country. Dead Set Country. He likes the word country because it's got a rude word in it if you EMPHasise it properly. 
 
Dead Set Country is Lawrence's brand new hit show that's all about a city boy gone bush. Roughed up by locals, mourning dead wombats, talking with horses and having an abiding affair with a tractor - in short Mooney is Dead Set Country.  
Following on from the acclaim for his past three shows Beauty, Embracing Your Limitations and Pigeonhole he's back with Dead Set Country. This time he's covered in dust, speaking slower and line dancing.   
It's Clarkson's Farm meets Lawrence Mooney's head on collision with country Australia. "You're not from round here are ya mister?"

title: Echoes of Pink Floyd - 60 Years of Pink Floyd - Wollongong
description:
Iconic British rock band, Pink Floyd left an indelible mark on the world, inspiring generations with their ground-breaking soundscapes and thought-provoking lyrics. 2025 marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style in a brand new concert production by Adelaide’s own Echoes of Pink Floyd.

Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerising journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.

Echoes of Pink Floyd stands as Australia’s foremost tribute dedicated to honouring the legendary band's monumental legacy and has garnered widespread acclaim across the country since their inception in 2009.

Since embarking on national tours in 2014, their lovingly-crafted performances have captivated audiences nationwide.

title: The Australian Eagles Show - 50 Years of Hotel California - Wollongong
description:
Fifty years on, Hotel California remains a cornerstone of classic rock — an iconic album that defined a generation and cemented the Eagles as rock legends.  The Australian Eagles Show, Australia's premier tribute to the Eagles' unforgettable sound, honours the milestone live in concert.   

The show's first set will see the band performing the Hotel California album in its entirety, followed by the second set of all the other Eagles classic hits.

Renowned for their pitch-perfect harmonies and masterful musicianship, The Australian Eagles Show is fronted by the supremely talented Michael Thompson and Shayne Browne. Backed by a powerhouse five-piece band, the show brings to life the legendary sounds that have captivated audiences for five decades.

Audiences can expect faithful recreations of timeless classics like "Desperado" "New Kid in Town" "Life in the Fast Lane" and, of course, the Grammy-winning epic "Hotel California." This tour also honours the solo hits of Don Henley, Joe Walsh, and the late Glenn Frey, offering a full-bodied tribute to the band's enduring legacy.

The Australian Eagles Show channels the spirit of the original band, delivering an authentic concert experience that continues to wow fans across Australia.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or discovering the Eagles for the first time, this 50th-anniversary celebration of Hotel California is an unforgettable night of music, and nostalgia.

title: Tramways Family Fun Day
description:
Take a trip back in time to the Tramways and revisit an era of Australia's Industrial Steam Tramways.

Travel behind a steam locomotive from those years in one of the historical passenger cars.

Inside the grounds of the museum awaits the railways of years from a by gone by era that make the experience of railways of yesteryear for all to enjoy.

The day includes train rides, food sales, picnic grounds, shelters, locomotive shed tours, exploring the museum and inside car parking.

Book ahead online or purchase tickets upon arrival.

title: Australian Darts Masters
description:
The Australian Darts Masters returns at Wollongong's WIN Entertainment Centre. Eight of the world’s top PDC players will compete against eight Oceanic talents as Sport’s Biggest Party arrives Down Under.

The 2025 event boasts a stellar lineup. Rising star Luke Littler will make his Australian return, while Michael van Gerwen and reigning World Champion Luke Humphries are set to go head-to-head.

Get ready for over-the-top celebrations, wild 180s, loud walk-ons and an atmosphere that’s unmatched in sport.

Please note that all players are expected to appear; however, participation is subject to PDC confirmation, and lineups may change due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny
description:
If you like fast-paced, edgy one-liners, then get ready to be happy. Jimmy Carr is going back on tour with his brand-new show 'Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny'.
 
"A comedy hero for our times" The Guardian
"Jimmy Carr is a world-class comedian" The Independent
 
Jimmy tells jokes, and jokes are like magnets. 
Jokes attract people, but they can also repel. 
Some people are repelled by Jimmy's dark brand of comedy. This show is not for them.
But if it's the kind of thing you like, then this is the kind of thing you'll like.
 
Hurry, this will definitely sell out!

title: Keith Urban - High and Alive Tour
description:
Five-time ARIA and four-time Grammy Award Winner Keith Urban has just announced his highly anticipated High and Alive World Tour.

The 9 arena shows for August 2025, featuring opener Chase Matthew, one of country music's boldest emerging voices, are Urban's first Australian concerts since December 2022.

The High and Alive World Tour will be heading to Wollongong's WIN Entertainment Centre and it will be the first opportunity for Australians to hear live versions of new songs from HIGH, including "Wildside" "Straight Line" "Go Home W U" with Lainey Wilson and "Messed Up As Me" as well as number one hits including "One Too Many" (with P!nk) "Wasted Time" "Somebody Like You" "Parallel Line" "The Fighter" (with Carrie Underwood) and "Long Hot Summer."

Urban is one of Australia's most coveted live acts and his concerts are once-in-a-lifetime events that critics have said are "not to be missed." Over the last ten years, he has sold over half a million concert tickets in Australia. His two-hour plus shows are power-packed with an energy and showmanship that make him one of the music industry's best live performers.

Tickets on sale now!

Proudly presented by TEG Live.

title: Nitro Circus
description:
Nitro Circus is coming to WIN Stadium for one night only!

Created by Travis Pastrana, the world leader in action sports entertainment, the electrifying show has already mesmerised audiences worldwide with adrenaline-pumping performances and jaw-dropping stunts in Costa Rica and Colombia.

Now the Nitro Circus “Off the Rails” World Tour kicks off in Australia from October. 

Debuting a 360 Stadium Show with a 15-metre Giganta ramp, cutting-edge FMX kickers, and immersive effects. Expect a thrilling ring of fire, explosions, insane contraptions plus a lighting, pyro and special effects spectacle, delivering nonstop action from every seat.
 
Athletes will push the limits with death-defying tricks, including BMX and Scooter star Ryan Williams (AUS) defying gravity and FMX sensation Jacko Strong (AUS) soaring upside down at incredible heights.

Non-stop action, explosive special effects this is the thrill of a lifetime! Where the Impossible Happens!

Head to the website for more information.

title: Live Music Nights at Steamers
description:
Join them every Thursday for live acoustic music by some of the gong's best artists.

There’s nothing better than grabbing a drink or a bite to eat with friends and listening to some great acoustic music. Showcasing a variety of talented local musicians every Thursday night from 6 pm, this is the ideal spot to enjoy some incredible acoustic music.

title: Nitro Circus: Off The Rails - Wollongong
description:
Nitro Circus is coming to Wollongong for one night only!

Created by Travis Pastrana, the world leader in action sports entertainment, the electrifying show has already mesmerized audiences worldwide with adrenaline-pumping performances and jaw-dropping stunts in Costa Rica and Colombia.

Now the Nitro Circus “Off the Rails” World Tour kicks off in Australia from October. 

Debuting a 360 Stadium Show with a 15-metre Giganta ramp, cutting-edge FMX kickers, and immersive effects. Expect a thrilling ring of fire, explosions, insane contraptions plus a lighting, pyro and special effects spectacle, delivering nonstop action from every seat.
 
Athletes will push the limits with death-defying tricks, including BMX and Scooter star Ryan Williams (AUS) defying gravity and FMX sensation Jacko Strong (AUS) soaring upside down at incredible heights.

Non-stop action, explosive special effects this is the thrill of a lifetime! Where the Impossible Happens!

title: World Triathlon Championship Finals Wollongong
description:
The event is a milestone in Wollongong’s proud sporting history, showcasing the region’s natural beauty and sporting prowess on the global stage.

The 2025 World Triathlon Championship Finals will feature 13 races over four days, including elite, under 23, junior, para triathlon and age groups events. In addition, the schedule will include a community triathlon, giving the expected 6,700 participants from over 43 countries the chance to experience the excitement of a world-class event.

title: Wollongong Schools Comp - Graduation Cup - Wollongong
description:
Come on ‘Gong Schools, Rocky Trail Academy is coming back to Cringila Hills MTB Park and its Graduation Cup Time!

Hosted by Rocky Trail Entertainment, this event is designed for high school-age riders to challenge themselves across three epic timed stages on some of the best trails in the region. Whether they’re looking to challenge themselves or just have fun with friends, the Rocky Trail Academy event is all about fostering growth and camaraderie. 

The event format includes three stages, designed to test a variety of skills, including endurance, speed, and technical ability. Everyone gets five possible runs on each track, with the fastest time per stage counting toward your final result. With no set track order and untimed liaisons, you can enjoy the beautiful outdoors at your own pace. Riders will also earn points for their school, with bonus points awarded for top finishers on each track.

Race categories are based on school year groups - students race against their peers and experience the thrill of friendly competition. Each track is designed to be rideable by anyone from beginners to experienced, ensuring there’s something for every skill level.

Their experienced team will be there to ensure everything runs smoothly, from registration to course marshalling and first aid services! For full event details, including trail maps, parking, and amenities, visit the official event page.

title: Bon But Not Forgotten Celebrate AC/DC - Albion Park Rail
description:
Get ready to crank up the volume! Bon But Not Forgotten, the world-renowned AC/DC tribute band, is hitting the road for an epic Australian tour to mark five decades of legendary and electrifying rock ‘n’ roll. This high-voltage tour will celebrate AC/DC's iconic legacy, performing timeless hits that have shaped the sound of rock music across generations.

The Australian rock titans have delivered decades of anthems like “Highway to Hell” “T.N.T.” and “Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap” and Bon But Not Forgotten is set to pay homage to these classics.

The tour will feature an extraordinary lineup of musicians, including Cynthia Gallie, one of Australia’s most versatile rock vocalists. She’ll be joined by James Morley of The Angels on guitar, Bobby Poulton of Wolfmother on bass, Eddy Santacreu of Queen Orchestrated on guitar, and renowned drummer Dave Kirby. Together, they will recreate the raw power and energy of AC/DC’s Bon Scott and Brian Johnson eras, delivering a performance that fans won’t soon forget.

Described by The Rock Pit as “the closest you’ll get to the raw power and legendary sound of the original line-up” Bon But Not Forgotten has earned a reputation for their dynamic stage presence and precise musicianship. 

This year’s tour will feature special guests, Poundcake: The Van Halen Show, amplifying the celebration of 70’s rock n’ roll.

title: Travelling Film Festival Warrawong
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Warrawong! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, and Sydney Film Festival at Gala Twin Cinemas.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Plus the powerful documentary about the Lismore floodings - Floodland, the A24 indie hit Sorry Baby, Cannes Best Director winner The Secret Agent and much more!

The festival weekend will screen nine acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: Jamberoo Action Park - Australia Day Celebrations
description:
Welcome to Australia Day at Jamberoo Action Park, New South Wales’s largest family-owned and operated water theme park…..Let’s celebrate Australia Day with a day of good old Aussie action!

Oz Music all day long, competitions and giveaways around Outback Bay, Meat Pies, Sausage Rolls, Burgers, Fish n Chips, Calamari, Pizzas and more.

And don’t forget to try out the latest Aussie favourite – the Scoop Ice Creamery – this is a must before you leave Jamberoo!

It's Australiana all day long with the new thrill ride precinct – Velocity Falls – featuring Octo Racer and the Stinger – they’re sure to get your heart racing.

How about the Trilogy of Tube rides? Take on the Taipan! The Funnel Web! The Perfect Storm! You must do all three!

Admission into the Park covers all rides and attractions and parking is free, so you can experience all that Jamberoo Action Park has to offer all day long.

Experience Australia Day at Jamberoo Action Park where you control the action!

title: Jamberoo Action Park - Canberra Day Long Weekend
description: Jamberoo Action Park is pleased to help provide a long weekend to anyone and everyone who is willing when they celebrate Canberra Day this season.

title: Coomaditchie Last Minute Gallery NAIDOC Exhibition - Official Opening
description:
Coomaditchie Last Minute Gallery NAIDOC Exhibition. One Exhibition, two Locations!

Join them in celebrating NAIDOC Week 2025 with a vibrant showcase of Coomaditchie's talented artists, featuring beautiful original artworks, quality prints, apparel and products available for purchase.

Official Opening at NASA Gallery will kick off with a Welcome to Country and Smoking Ceremony to honour and connect with Country.

Enjoy free food and bush tucker sweets, Mr. Booch ice cream, a weaving workshop, and DJ Melly Mel bringing the vibes!

This National NAIDOC Week activity is proudly funded by Aboriginal Affairs, National Indigenous Australians Agency, and Wollongong City Council.

title: Red Point Arts Makers' Markets and Open Day
description:
Red Point Arts has a monthly Makers' Market which is an arts and craft market by members of Red Point Arts on the second Saturday of each month. 

Located in the courtyard at The Wentworth. 

Come and enjoy the beautiful grassed courtyard filled with art and craft stalls. You can visit open studios to see artists at work and check out free exhibitions at the Red Point Gallery. There will be live music to enjoy, and don't forget to try the delicious food at Little Thai at Port restaurant. This event is kid-friendly, pet-friendly, and fun in any weather

Red Point Arts members can have a stall free of charge and external stallholders have a small fee of AUD20 (non-members must have own market insurance).

title: Port Kembla Fear Fest
description:
FearFest is the premier Halloween family event in the Illawarra, attracting an estimated crowd of 6,000 people annually. Held in Port Kembla's Wentworth Street, this vibrant festival transforms the area into a hub of spooky festivities, community engagement, and economic activity. 

Designed to celebrate the cultural and economic revitalization of Port Kembla, FearFest fosters tourism, supports local businesses, and strengthens community bonds. 

Daytime events will include markets, crafting activities, cupcake decorating, face painting, and photo opportunities with animals and characters. The festival will feature street entertainers, live music performances, and interactive shows. 

As night falls, adults can participate in themed events at local venues and in Military Lane including markets, live music from bands, DJs, street performers, haunted houses, and other thrilling activities. 

FearFest attracts visitors from across the region, increasing foot traffic and benefiting local businesses. This influx supports the local economy and showcases Port Kembla as a vibrant destination. 

After three years of running, the event now serves as a significant event that not only provides entertainment but also contributes positively to the social and economic fabric of Port Kembla and the broader Illawarra area.
host: PORT KEMBLA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND INDUSTRY INCORPORATED

title: Jamberoo Car Show
description:
The Jamberoo Car Show and Family Day raises funds for the Jamberoo Rural Fire Brigade and has been a very popular event since its small beginnings just a few years ago.

This year’s Show will be held at Kevin Walsh Oval in Jamberoo, with approximately 600 classic cars on display, modern and vintage fire trucks and stationary engine displays. 

The Show will have plenty to offer for children, including Matildas Farm Yard animal nursery, face painting.  And of course, there will be a range of food and drink vendors on-site catering to every taste.

The Show is a key part of what has been called the Jamberoo Big Weekend. The Jamberoo Village Markets will be held in conjunction with the Car show and local businesses will be gearing up to welcome visitors.

title: Jamberoo Village  Markets
description:
Jamberoo Village Markets runs on the last Sunday of each month.

Jamberoo Village Markets is a monthly market in South Coast Jamberoo in NSW incorporating craft stalls alongside fresh food, fruit, and vegetables, local crafts, flowers, and homewares as well as live entertainment. 

There are a variety of stalls including flowers, leatherwork, clothing, plants, organic vegetables, sweets, knitwear, orchids, bread, food, and seasonal specialties. 

Jamberoo Markets are a dog-friendly (on leash) destination. 

Please check their Instagram site for weather updates and monthly cancellations.

title: Nowra Showground Indoor Market
description:
Enjoy the beautiful location, plenty of trees and parking, great views, doggie playgrounds, walking trails, and of course, the many market stalls inside the Nowra Showground Pavilion.

The Nowra Showground Indoor Market boasts local stalls with plenty of handmade and homegrown items including plants, clothing, toys, pet accessories, knitting and crochet crafts, art, books, jewellery, cards and paper crafts, woodwork, jams and much more. 

Yo Mama Kitchen will be serving you delicious breakfast options while WTF Donuts will be there for your coffee and sweet treats. 
Shoalhaven Local Markets & Committee is delighted to be hosting this market on the fourth Saturday of each month with big thanks to Shoalhaven Council for the support.

title: Water Fest Shoalhaven
description:
Water Fest Shoalhaven is a new celebration of water event to be held during Summer throughout Shoalhaven. This new event will spread over weeks and unite communities and visitors by encouraging visitation to the region for days of action-packed water activities, great food and entertainment. 

This new water event will celebrate Summer in Shoalhaven, with a range of small community events including everything from a celebration of the local underwater and above-water worlds. There will be live entertainment, market and food stalls, amazing water experiences and educational workshops.  

Celebrating summer and water will be the focus of Water Fest by bringing a whole new appreciation of water and how we all benefit from water.

title: Reddall Reserve Parkrun
description:
Weekly 5K Parkrun – Free and fun for everyone. 

Join in every Saturday for a free, timed 5km run/walk on a very flat and scenic two-lap course along a fully sealed cycle path.  

All ages and abilities welcome. Dog-friendly (1 per person, on a short handheld, non-extendable lead). Bring your barcode (register once at parkrun). Arrive early for the first-timers briefing. Bring friends, family and your camera – and enjoy the views!

Whether you're chasing a PB or just out for a stroll, come be part of the parkrun community. Have fun, stay safe, and see you at the start line!

title: Rodgers and Hammerstein's Cinderella
description:
Join them for the enchantment and romance of one of the most beloved fairytales of all time as Cinderella comes to life on stage at the Shoalhaven Entertainment Centre.

Albatross Musical Theatre Company presents a breathtaking production filled with Rodgers and Hammerstein's most-beloved songs, including "In My Own Little Corner" "Impossible" and "Ten Minutes Ago".

This is an up-to-date, hilarious and romantic libretto giving you all the moments you know and love - the prince, the fairy godmother, the pumpkin, the glass slipper, the ball. You will be transported through a truly magical theatrical experience!

title: Resist the System - Karla Dickens
description:
Resist the System brings together two major artworks from Karla Dickens. Return to Sender is an installation that reworks a collection of found postcards picturing First Nations people from the turn of last century. Wiradjuri artist Karla Dickens confronts these racist greetings with messages of strength and survival. This celebrated work will be exhibited alongside Criminalised, a new commission created especially for Shoalhaven Regional Gallery, that challenges the criminalisation of young Black children. The artist has sewn and decorated black balaclavas, typically associated with concealing the identity of a criminals, to create a new photographic series with young First Nation children from her neighbourhood on Bundjalung Country, NSW.  

Karla Dickens is a Wiradjuri artist whose work spans sculpture, textiles, poetry, painting, photography, and found material collage. Drawing on her Indigenous heritage and experiences as a single mother, Dickens's work uncovers hidden aspects of Australia's past and ongoing relationship with its Indigenous peoples. Using a range of methods and materials, her work celebrates and critiques historical figures and practices, interprets histories of institutionalisation and dispossession, and communicates the ongoing discrimination, oppression, and socio-cultural repercussions of colonialism experienced by Australians of Indigenous descent. Karla's work has been included in the Biennale of Sydney, the Asia Pacific Triennial and numerous prestigious exhibitions in Australia and around the world.

title: Bagandha yanggamba-ngga - ‘Country sings in me’ -  Nicole Smede Exhibition
description:
Nicole Smede is the winner of the inaugural First Nations Exhibition with her project Bagandha yanggamba-ngga - 'Country sings in me'.  

Bagandha yanggamba-ngga - 'Country sings in me' is a video and sound installation that speaks to the origins of traditional languages and the reciprocal exchange between Country, human and non-human kin. In collaboration and consultation with community, this work will feature community Elders and custodians of the Mudingaal Yangamba choir and honour the deep ties between spirit, place, language and song.

title: Woven - Jaz Corr Exhibition
description:
Woven is a communal painting, commissioned by Shoalhaven City Council, as part of the Reconciliation Action Plan. 

The painting was created through community participation art workshops and conversations held in diverse locations such as Vincentia, Nowra, Ulladulla, and Bomaderry.

At the heart of the painting is a central meeting place that unifies the diverse journeys and beliefs of both Indigenous and non-Indigenous community members. The surrounding empty space represents a pathway toward an unknown future which like a stone thrown into the water ripples outwards through multiple understandings, perspectives and communities.

As the painting evolved, the form of a woven basket emerged, representing the interwoven histories of the community and the contribution made by collaborative art practice. Embedded into the fabric of the basket is representation of both the Aboriginal Flag and the Union Jack to illustrate the Aboriginal and Non-Aboriginal community that makes up the fabric of the Shoalhaven region.  

The missing elements of the painting are deliberate asking the audience to reflect on the unfinished process of reconciliation.

title: Single Channel - group exhibition
description:
Drawn from the national collection, Single Channel brings together moving image artworks from 2000 to 2019 by some of Australia's most nationally and internationally significant artists. The works explore notions of identity in powerful, unexpected and mesmerising ways. Focusing on works by First Nations and Australian artists, the exhibition includes work by Tony Albert, Destiny Deacon and Virginia Fraser collaboration, Silvana and Gabriella Mangano, Club Ate, Shaun Gladwell and Tracey Moffatt.

Single Channel brings together key moving image works from the National Gallery of Australia's collections made from 2000 to 2019. The selection traces the emergence of the moving image as one of the success stories of contemporary practice, its connection to portraiture, and exploration of self-identity and its promise of narrative possibility. Focusing on works by First Nations and Australian artists, the exhibition includes key work by Tony Albert, Destiny Deacon and Virginia Fraser collaboration, Gabriella and Silvana Mangano, Club Ate, Shaun Gladwell and Tracey Moffatt. Each work is produced as a single channel format by the artists and exclusively for the exhibition are shown consecutively as a single channel projection creating a unique and exciting viewing experience.

Curators Tina Baum, Curator of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art and Anne O'Hehir, Curator of Photography.

Single Channel is a National Gallery Touring Exhibition fully funded by The National Gallery of Australia

title: Shoalhaven Philatelic Society Stamp and Coin Day
description: Selling and Buying of stamps and coins.  Displays, lucky door prizes, boxes of 2 cent stamps to browse through and purchase. Come and join in the fun - free admission!

title: Berry Celtic Festival
description:
The Berry Celtic Festival promises a day full of medieval entertainment. The Grand Street Parade of Pipe Bands marching in their distinctive kilts, Celtic Clans, medieval knights, and Scottish Terrier dogs commences at 9.30 am, all heading to the Berry Showground.   

Jousting has been one of the real hits of the Celtic Festival and is full of excitement, and the heavily armoured noble knights will once again put on a great show. 

In the background, medieval mercenaries re-live battles in hand-to-hand combat, demonstrating their skilful swordplay.

You can also listen to the Celtic fiddlers and the enchanted singing, watch the competition games, or just browse the many Celtic merchandise stalls. There is always something to do.

Come see the marching of the massed bands, musical items, Celtic fiddlers, highland dancing, enchanted singing, and, of course, the battles of the medieval knights. 

The Berry Celtic Festival is a fundraising project of the Rotary Club of Berry. 

Check the website for full details and ticketing arrangements.

title: The Water Runners Play Wesley Hall Berry
description:
The Water Runners will play their style of Bluegrass Infused Folk. They are very happy to be playing not far from their hometown, Kiama, for the good people of Berry and its surroundings. This afternoon show will be a sweet way to spend a cosy Sunday afternoon together in Berry's beautiful and historical Wesley Hall.

The Water Runners are currently recording a 4th album with Syd Green (who performs with Kasey Chambers) and are keen to share their new songs and stories.

The Water Runners have received multiple awards for their songwriting and have been awarded Best Band in the National Busking Championships. They were also nominated for the People's Choice Award from the Australian Folk Alliance.

Come settle in and enjoy the warm and witty stage show. Afternoon tea is provided and included in ticket price.

More information about the band and their music can be found on their website.

title: Berry Farm and Lifestyle Field Days
description:
The Berry Farm and Lifestyle Field Days (formerly known as the Berry Small Farm Field Days) is the only event of its kind on the South Coast. 

The region has evolved, and so has the event. With an influx of tree-changers and lifestyle focused landowners, the new name reflects the broader appeal of rural living today - where
traditional farming sits comfortably alongside boutique accommodation, garden design, outdoor living, and food and wine ventures.

Exhibitors range from agricultural machinery suppliers to artisan producers, with something on offer for everyone, from seasoned small-scale farmers to newcomers embracing the rural lifestyle.

The Berry Farm and Lifestyle Field Days is a true family day out for all ages.  Explore the exciting new lifestyle area showcasing the latest in caravans, camping equipment and outdoor living solutions for the modern rural adventurer. Wander through the dedicated garden section, where plant enthusiasts can discover unique varieties and stunning garden ornaments to transform your outdoor space. Marvel at machinery ranging from impressive tractors to practical ride-on mowers suited for properties of all sizes.

Children will delight in the animal nursery, where they can interact with friendly farm animals.  And no one will want to miss Farmer Dave's renowned Dog Show. When hunger strikes, the food court presents a tempting array of refreshments to fuel your day of exploration.

title: The Berry Markets
description:
The Berry Markets is run on the first Sunday of every month except February. 

Visitors flock to Berry each month to experience fresh local produce and plants, unique hand crafted items, good food and a buzzing atmosphere. 

Come and see for yourself what everyone is talking about.

title: PBR Monster Energy Tour Nowra Invitational
description:
A sport like no other. A showdown of the greatest. Heart-stopping action. It’s man vs. beast, where every second matters. 
 
The biggest names in Australian bull riding go head-to-head in a new season of Professional Bull Riders, delivering a competition like no other. 

Join the unmatched entertainment experience at the PBR Monster Energy Nowra Invitational at Shoalhaven Rugby Football Grounds. 
 
Buckle up for the toughest 8 seconds in sports - its bull time.

title: Berry Village Market
description:
Berry Village Market is held on the fourth Sunday of every month at the Berry Bowling Club. With over 80 boutique stalls.

Visitors can also enjoy great coffee, delicious donuts, pastries and amazing market foods. With two outdoor live music areas and indoor and outdoor seating are available on the global green. Visitors can enjoy the music while they relax and enjoy the market atmosphere. Visitors are encouraged to bring their fur babies and a picnic blanket to enjoy the market atmosphere.

The market also provides full club facilities with an ATM machine, air conditioning, and Chinese cuisine.  This marketa lso have plants, garden sculptures, quality Bric a brac, re-purposed books, quality handmade items and lot's more! 

The stalls offer products ranging from health products, fresh flowers, farm fresh eggs, honey, and mead, jams to gourmet food, and everything in between. Visitors can also find something for their fur babies, including a variety of treats and toys. The market is a great place to explore and try new things.

In conclusion, Berry Village Market is a great place to spend a Sunday with friends or family. Visitors can enjoy a variety of food, drinks, and entertainment while exploring the many stalls.

title: Berry Farmers' Market
description:
The Berry Farmers' Market is a genuine farmers' market, held every Thursday afternoon in the delightful township of Berry, NSW. 

This is a true farmers’ market that cares about the origin of food and the protection of local growers, producers and makers.

Each week you will find a wonderful selection of seasonal produce, sold directly to you by the farmer or maker. Along with fruit and vegetables, you can expect to find seafood, oysters, local Wagyu beef, honey, eggs, milk straight from the dairy, gelato made from local milk, cider, wine, mushrooms, cakes and tarts, preserves, sourdough bread, street food, ready-made meals and more.

title: Markets at the Marina
description:
Browse the ever-evolving collaboration of artisan stalls, boutique retailers, local makers and emerging businesses at the region's newest market held on the last Sunday of each month.  

The stunning backdrop of the Shellharbour Marina, combined with the incredible restaurants at The Waterfront Dining Precinct, creates the perfect place to catch up with friends, enjoy a stroll and browse the stalls, soak up the sun and enjoy your Sunday!

title: Great Divide Folk Festival
description:
A grassroots folk festival over three days every fourth weekend in October featuring acoustic music, dance, yarns (storytelling and poetry) with simple workshops.  

Music focus covers bluegrass through traditional and modern folk with dance covering various cultural traditions.   No ticketing is charged, although there can be artist merchandise and tutoring fees (beyond the basic workshops).  

Set at 1,100 metres elevation in the historic Monaro village of Nimmitabel.

title: Steampunk @ Altitude
description:
Steampunk @ Altitude is an annual festival of all things Victoriana mixed with the age of technology and imagination.  

Think of Jules Verne novels to the HG Wells Time Machine to Tesla versus Edison, and even at a stretch, Harry Potter! Combine this with an overwhelming passion for fashion and you have a gala event where everyone dresses up and becomes another character larger than life!   Set in the south-eastern village of Nimmitabel, which at 1,100 metres above sea level, echoes the era perfectly.  

Featured recently on the ABC TV "Backroads" program in all its splendour - a unique event not to be missed every first weekend of May.

title: Intuitive Weaving Workshop
description:
This workshop is time and space for you. 

Join Sarah on this creative journey, where the art of weaving and the practice of deep listening converge, creating a sacred space for self-reflection, connection, and inner peace.                                                                                                                                                                                                                       In this immersive three-hour workshop, embark on a transformative journey that combines the art of weaving with the power of your intuition and your ancestral remembering's. Immerse yourself in the gentle whispers of nature's Bungalow Palm inflorescences, as you quieten your mind and call in the now.

You'll be using the very magical Bungalow Palm inflorescences. Sarah will walk you through the foraging and harvesting of the material, and then how to prepare it for weaving. Then explore basketry and random weave techniques so set you off on a journey of personal discovery. 

Through this practice, you will cultivate a profound sense of presence and deepen your connection to the present moment, the now and the timelessness of your soul. Through the rhythmic motion of your hands, you will not only create a beautiful sculptural form but also forge a deep connection with the world around you. Feel the peaceful echo of ancient wisdom reverberate within you, as you weave together mindfulness and craftsmanship.

All materials will be supplied, just bring you and your open heart.

title: Craft at Burnetts On Barney
description:
Join them for a fun-filled morning of creativity in the Glass House at Burnetts on Barney! 

Kids can get crafty painting their very own pebbles – all materials are supplied, just bring your imagination. While the little ones create their masterpieces, parents can relax with a coffee at the lovely Quarry Café.

title: Fairy and Animal Garden Craft
description:
Bring the magic of nature to life with this Fairy and Animal Garden craft event! 

Kids can create their own enchanting miniature garden scenes filled with fairies, woodland animals, and natural treasures – all materials are provided, just bring your imagination!

While the children get creative, parents can relax and enjoy a coffee or treat at The Quarry Café.
Let your child's creativity blossom in this fun, hands-on activity!

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Jackee B
description:
Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

Jackee B trio are three musicians, who share wonderful vocal harmonies, musical intellect and bring quirky arrangements to popular songs.

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Lucy and Hayley
description:
Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

Lucy and Hayley are an acoustic duo bringing pop and pub covers to the east coast of Australia. With sweet, weaving harmonies and driving guitar rhythms, the pair will get you singing along to their take on hits from a range of eras. From Creedence Clearwater Revival to Amy Winehouse, The Angels to Dolly Parton, Lucy and Hayley love using music to connect with audiences wherever they go.

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Day and Night
description:
Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

Local musicians Merryn-Lee Perez and Chris Cutting perform as a duo showcasing classic covers.

title: Macrame Craft at Burnetts On Barney
description:
Get creative these school holidays with a fun and hands-on Macrame Workshop just for kids aged 8 and up! Join them at the beautiful Burnetts On Barney for a 2.5-hour session led by the talented Karen from KB Macrame.

In this workshop, kids will learn the basics of macrame and create their very own colourful hanging piece to take home. With two colour options to choose from, each child can make something uniquely their own while exploring texture, knots, and creativity in a relaxed and supportive environment.

Come along and enjoy a fun-filled afternoon of crafting, creativity, and confidence-building!

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Alana-Lee
description:
Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

Alana-Lee's alluring and bewitching production sounds add another dimension to the traditional female piano singer-songwriter.

title: Kid's Craft - Mini Bird House
description:
Let the kids get creative in the Glass House at Burnetts on Barney with this hands-on craft activity! Each child will decorate their own mini wooden birdhouse to take home – all materials are provided. It's a fun and relaxing morning perfect for little makers.

While the kids paint, parents can unwind with a coffee at the Quarry Café.

A great way to spend the morning together!

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Doux Ame
description:
Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

Doux Ame is a professional piano vocal group based in the Illawarra, NSW Australia. The words Doux Ame is a close French translation of our original duet name –  Sweet Soul. Specialising in live jazz contemporary lounge music.

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Emma and Ron Davison
description: Call your friends, grab a coffee and lunch from The Quarry Cafe onsite, pull up a seat in the sunshine or protected from the elements under the pergola or glasshouse, then kick back, soak in the quarry wall surrounds, and tap your toes to some relaxing live music, performed every Saturday by one of the region's many local musical talents.

title: Live Music at Burnetts with Penny Hartgerink
description:
Join Burnetts on Barney every Tuesday evening for live music in the heart of the garden! Relax among the plants and enjoy an ever-changing lineup of local talent in the beautiful suroundings of Burnetts on Barney Garden Centre. Good vibes, great music, and a perfect midweek escape.

Celebrated and much-loved Kiama musician, Penny Hartgerink, is a talented songwriter and gifted singer and guitarist. Her voice and her smile bring our Quarry space to life when she performs her magic.

title: The Barstool Brothers Kiama Monthly Brunch
description:
Proudly sponsored by Kiama Leagues Club
There's nothing like good mates, a great feed, and real conversation.
Join them each month at Cedar Cutters Sports Bar for the Kiama Monthly Brunch—a relaxed get-together for local blokes to catch up, check in, and share a laugh.

Enjoy a free Bacon & Egg Roll and coffee on them.
No speeches, no pressure—just a casual way to stay connected.

Come for the roll, stay for the chat.
Because the best conversations happen around the table over brekky!

title: Kids Bingo
description:
Beat the school holiday boredom with free Kids Bingo at Kiama Leagues Club!
Come and join the fun with free prizes and games.

Children are to be under parental supervision.
No bookings required.

title: Kids Movie Night
description:
Free Kids Movie Night at Kiama Leagues Club! 

Bring the kids, grab a spot, and settle in for a cosy winter movie night these school holidays!

Free entry, no bookings are required. Popcorn and Poppa Packs are available on the night.

Bring a rug, beanbag or cushions and get comfy. Perfect for the whole family — no bookings needed, just come along and enjoy the show!

Movie details to be confirmed closer to the event.

Children must be supervised at all times.

title: Sea and Spirit Psychic & Healers Hub Expo
description:
The Sea & Spirit Psychic and Healers Hub Expo returns to Kiama this July.
Psychic readers, Healers and services, candles and gifts, oracle cards, crystals, hand crafted products, oils and organic products, clothing and equipment plus more!

title: Kids Disco
description:
Let the kids burn some energy these school holidays and get ready to boogie at this free Kids Disco!

Free entry! No bookings required.

Beat the school holiday boredom, and come and party with us!
Children are to be under adult supervision.

title: Winter Festival Diggies Kiama
description:
Mulled wine and canapés on arrival by the open fire in the courtyard, with live music. Following is a delicious winter feast prepared by chef Tyler and his team. 

You won't want to miss our celebration of winter food and wine!

title: Kiama Vintage Fair
description:
Kiama Vintage Fair is a fun one-day Vintage Fair held indoors at the historic Kiama Masonic Hall. Filled with all things preloved, vintage, retro, mid-century, antique, collectable, quirky, curated and curious.

Browse a wide range of stylish and unique items, from vintage fashion and mid-century decor to bric-a-brac, vinyl, cameras and more. It's a fun and friendly community event with something for everyone who loves a good rummage or a timeless treasure.

Adding to the atmosphere is an old-school trio playing live rock'n'roll music from the 50s, 60s and 70s. 

Free entry and everyone is welcome.

title: Rekindled Fashion Pre-loved Market
description:
Discover the charm of quality pre-loved fashion market where true designer label and vintage items can be found.

Be delighted by a hall full of stalls offering fabulous pieces at fabulous prices.

title: Sunday Sessions at Yves
description: Enjoy live music every Sunday at Yves from their pick of local musicians! Soak in stunning waterviews, savor delicious food, and sip on expertly crafted cocktails—the perfect Sunday vibe!

title: Kiama Winter Street Festival
description:
Step into a Winter Wonderland this July at the Kiama Winter Street Festival!

This winter school holidays, the town will come alive with a vibrant program filled with art, music, dance, captivating new performances, wellness and workshops. Join the celebration in the heart of Kiama!

Presented by Destination Kiama, this free family-friendly event transforms Terralong Street into a buzzing hub of entertainment.

Pedestrians and party-goers are welcome to revel in the festival atmosphere, enjoying open street dining from local cafes and restaurants. Festival highlights including engaging street performances, free interactive workshops, diverse dance performances, live music, fun kid's activities, on-street dining experiences and late-night shopping.

Public transport is strongly encouraged. If driving, you're welcome to park at the Kiama Leisure Centre (until full) and catch the free Special Event shuttle bus running throughout the evening. Parking will be managed by Jamberoo Rural Fire Service volunteers, and a $5 donation upon entry is kindly requested.

Please note there will be road closures on Terralong Street between Collins and Shoalhaven Streets.

Don't miss this magical event that promises something for everyone!

title: Kiama Woodcraft Group - Exhibition and Sales
description:
The Kiama Woodcraft Group are having an exhibition and sale of members' work. 

If you are looking for a special gift or just love the art of woodcraft, then come along and see the wonderful variety of work on display.

There will also be a selection of traditional tools for sale.

If you are thinking of joining a woodcraft group then why not come along and talk to the Club members who are always happy to share their knowledge and answer questions.

title: Kiama Seaside Markets
description:
Discover the charm of the Kiama Seaside Markets, a must-visit experience for tourists exploring the stunning NSW South Coast. Held on the third Sunday of each month at beautiful Black Beach Reserve, these vibrant open-air markets are set against sweeping ocean views and the iconic Kiama Lighthouse.

Stroll through over 150 stalls brimming with locally made crafts, boutique fashion, art, jewellery, homewares, and gourmet treats. Meet the makers, sample delicious food, and soak in the relaxed coastal atmosphere. Whether you're looking for unique souvenirs, handmade gifts, or just a great coffee by the sea, the markets offer something for everyone.

Located just minutes from Kiama's cafes, beaches, and the famous Blowhole, it's the perfect day out for couples, families, and weekend wanderers. Come and enjoy live music, fresh sea breezes, and the friendly community vibe that makes the Kiama Seaside Markets a true highlight of the region.
host: Kiama Business Network ( KIAMA & DISTRICT BUSINESS CHAMBER INCORPORATED)

title: Sundays at The Grand
description:
Celebrate Sundays in Summer with happiest hours of refreshing cocktails, prawn buckets and live local DJs. 

Plus their brand new menu celebrating flavours and local ingredients to the table, the best of a classic pub feed with a modern flare.

Stay up to date on social media.

title: Kiama Jazz and Blues Festival (KJBF)
description:
Kiama Jazz and Blues Festival is a three-day South Coast signature event packed with all sorts of live jazz & blues music.

It is set in the streets, outdoor hubs, parks, churches, cafes, bars, breweries and clubs across the breathtaking Kiama region.

Expect to be amazed by the exceptional performances of ever-evolving interpretations of the genres of music called Jazz and Blues.  

This year sees more events in festival Hubs, street activities and outdoor environments. Although largely free to attend, there are some exceptional ticketed performances and weekend passes that require booking to avoid disappointment.

title: Kiama Farmers' Market
description:
Set against a stunning coastal backdrop, the Kiama Farmers’ Market is a weekly must-visit. The market is started each week by the ringing of the bell - no market trading takes place until the bell has been rung.

This is a true farmers’ market, dedicated to supporting local growers, producers, and makers. While you browse, kids can play on the beach or in the park, or you can relax on the grass with an afternoon snack or early dinner.

Each week, a wonderful selection of seasonal produce is sold fresh and direct to you from the local market gardens. Along with fruit and vegetables, you can expect to find a variety of other produce, such as seafood, oysters, local Wagyu beef, honey, eggs, milk straight from the dairy, gelato made from local milk, cider, wine, mushrooms, cakes, and tarts, preserves, sourdough bread, street food, ready-made meals… and so much more!

title: Changing Tides Festival
description:
Changing Tides Festival is an energetic celebration of music, local culture, and community. 

With two unique experiences, the festival invites everyone to immerse themselves in the best of the South Coast—featuring thrilling live performances by both local and international artists, along with a variety of delicious, locally sourced food. 

Set against breath-taking coastal scenery, the festival unites artists, people of all abilities, and local businesses in a vibrant, inclusive event!

Please stay tuned for the full Changing Tides Festival program!

title: Land of Milk & Honey 2.0
description:
Land of Milk & Honey 2.0 returns to The Pavilion, Kiama, following last year's buzzing debut with The Terrys and Ross Wilson.

This year, they're thrilled to (tentatively) welcome Aussie rock legends Jebediah and Killing Heidi as headliners—bringing even more energy to the stunning South Coast.

Alongside the major acts, they're shining a light on the finest local talent, including:

Nic Lee
Gaby Bonello
Jase Invo
Annaliese Szota
Grace Mae
Aodhan

Celebrate community, creativity, and coast culture in one epic weekend of live music.

Lineup and announcement date will be advised soon. Keep checking the website for updates.

title: Frenzal Rhomb - A Man’s (Still) Not a Camel - 25th-ish Anniversary Tour
description:
For too long, regional Australia has been deprived of sweet guitar riffs, 90s slap bass, sick drum beats, and harmonised rhymes about beer. Frenzal Rhomb is here to fix that.

To celebrate 25-ish years of A Man's Not A Camel, the Frenzal Rhomb Political Party (FRPP) is hitting the road to bring their majestic, iconic, exalted album back to the stages where it belongs. Expect loud, fast, beer-soaked punk rock, played by a band 25 years older but just as reckless.

With classics like "Never Had So Much Fun" "We're Going Out Tonight" and "You Are Not My Friend", this is not just another gig-it's a civic duty.

title: The Creative Business Summit
description:
Creatives have the opportunity to connect, learn, and evolve, elevating both their artistic pursuits and business endeavors.

Artists, designers, photographers, writers, performers, makers, and creators often face the challenge of balancing their passion with the practicalities of running a business. While the focus remains on creating, making, designing, and performing, business skills are equally essential.

The Creative Business Summit offers a solution—a one-day event designed specifically for creative professionals. Attendees will gain practical and inspiring insights on building a thriving and fulfilling creative business while shaping their ideal artistic journey.

This gathering provides an invaluable chance to meet like-minded individuals and experience the magic of conversation and connection.

title: Kiama Comedy Festival
description:
The Kiama Comedy Festival, hosted by Comedy for a Cause, will bring world-class comedians from the Sydney, Brisbane, and Melbourne International Comedy Festivals, alongside talented local performers. With over 10 solo shows and two Gala events, the festival will take place at premier venues such as Kiama Pavilion, Kiama SLSC, Kiama Leagues Club, and Fillmores.

Held in October, the festival strategically aligns with a quieter tourism season, ensuring a greater selection of comedy talent while drawing visitors to support the local economy. Audiences can expect performances from renowned comedians like Arj Barker, Jimeoin, Rhys Nicholson, Luke Heggie, and Becky Lucas (subject to availability). A standout feature of the festival is a performance by Mark McConville, a comedian and suicidologist, emphasizing the connection between laughter and mental health. In support of Mental Health Month, information services will be available to promote well-being and community support.

The festival is designed to engage all audiences, with kids' comedy workshops and children's activities making it a truly inclusive event. It aims to attract comedy enthusiasts, cultural event seekers, tourists, and families from Wollongong, Shellharbour, Shoalhaven, and the Southern Highlands.

With strong marketing efforts, including social media campaigns, collaborations with businesses, and community partnerships, the festival will showcase Kiama's cultural vibrancy while promoting mental health awareness.
host: Comedy For A Cause PTY LTD

title: Where Thought Settles by Chick Butcher - Exhibition at Sevenmarks Gallery
description:
Chick Butcher returns to Sevenmarks  with a Sculptural Reckoning on Loss and Presence.

Sevenmarks  Gallery is proud to present Where Thought Settles, a potent new solo exhibition by contemporary artist, Chick Butcher. 

Opening 12 July, 2025 in Kiama, this marks Butcher's second major presentation within the gallery he co-founded—and it lands with presence.

Working with timber, glass and Corten steel, Butcher builds a sculptural language of weight and restraint.
