The materials carry a visceral presence—darkened wood holds the scent of fire and time, while glass surfaces reflect with veiled precision. Each work is pared back, exacting and quiet, inviting close attention rather than spectacle.

In Where Thought Settles, Butcher gives form to what lingers —where mass meets memory and absence becomes its own kind of monument. These objects don't speak loudly, they resonate. Still, grounded and contemplative, they hold space as much as they occupy it.

At a time when contemporary art often mirrors the relentless pace of the world, Where Thought Settles compels us to slow and pause. It is not simply an exhibition—it is an invitation to listen to what is felt but not said, to engage with the weight of what remains.

In resisting noise, these works speak with clarity. In their stillness they become monuments to presence, memory and the quiet truths that define our time.

title: Jason Invernon at Crooked River Estate
description:
Join them on the hill for an unforgettable afternoon with live music by Jason Invernon.

This free outdoor event invites you to kick back and soak in the stunning views of their estate. Bring your picnic rugs and settle in on the hill overlooking the vineyard—seating is limited, so come early to snag the best spot. They're family-friendly and welcome dogs too, just keep them on a leash.

See you on the hill for a day of music, relaxation, and spectacular views!

Note: Outdoor live music is weather-dependent.

title: Live Music Sundays at Mountain Ridge Wines
description:
At Mountain Ridge, they love a reason to gather, so come sip, savour and share with them while being entertained by a variety of local musicians on the first Sunday of every month. While you relax and unwind taking in the views over Coolangatta, Saddleback and Cambewarra.
Check out the Mountain Ridge Wines website, Instagram and Facebook pages to view upcoming music dates and artists.

title: South Coast Ceramics Market
description: The inaugural South Coast Ceramics Market celebrates the artistry, heritage and beauty of handmade ceramics on the South Coast. They're connecting over 30 local potters, sculptors and passionate makers in a beautifully curated heritage space, The Co-Op Gerringong. Visitors can discover, connect and take home meaningful handmade ceramics. From wheel thrown ceramics, hand built forms to sculptural vessels, every piece tells a story shaped by the earth and the creative hands behind it. The Co-Op Gerringong, once the hub of the local dairying industry, this beautifully restored industrial building will once again bring the community together for this South Coast Ceramics Market.

title: Creative Beading Workshops
description:
Unleash your inner artist at Bead Shack – your destination for creativity and craftsmanship!

Join the one-hour workshop which includes all the materials you need. 

During your workshop, you'll have the choice between a bowl of glitzy beads or a bowl of wooden beads, according to the project.  There will always be a choice of colours to delight the maker. With guidance from experienced instructors, you'll bring your unique creation to life. 

The workshops are designed to encourage makers to explore their creativity, and that's why a variety of bead options is available. The fundamentals of design, colour theory, and shape utilisation are taught to help craft something truly special.

The class fee covers the use of provided beads. If you desire extra beads, pendants, or special additions for your project, they are available for purchase at an additional cost.

Creative Kids Vouchers are welcome.

At Bead Shack, they live to inspire your creativity and guide you on your crafting journey. Join a workshop and let your imagination run wild!

title: Beachy Hanging Decoration Workshop
description:
Design, create and make your very own items and have a bit of fun making a summer decoration to hang anywhere in the home or holiday van.

The workshop includes basic stringing materials and tuition, a few pieces of stone and wood, and up to three wooden decorations, shells and beads. Attendees can purchase extra materials on the day.

Decorations include a fish, a turtle, a seahorse, a boat or a few beachy items on some lovely handmade natural seagrass string for a perfect beachy look.

This workshop is flexible in the way that attendees can take fifteen minutes or an hour (one-hour maximum) to complete the workshop.

title: Beading Workshop
description:
Unleash your inner artist at Bead Shack – your destination for creativity and craftsmanship!

Join the one hour workshop which includes all the materials you need. At Bead Shack, a diverse range of projects awaits your creative touch. Craft beautiful jewellery, colourful sun catchers, charming lace-up animals, intricate Kumihimo Japanese weavings, delightful hanging decorations, and more.

During your workshop, you'll have the choice between a bowl of glitzy beads or a bowl of wooden beads. With guidance from experienced instructors, you'll bring your unique creation to life. The workshops are designed to encourage kids to explore their creativity, and that's why a variety of bead options is available. The fundamentals of design, color theory, and shape utilization are taught to help craft something truly special.

The class fee covers the use of provided beads. If you desire extra beads, pendants, or special additions for your project, they are available for purchase at an additional cost.

At Bead Shack, they’re here to inspire your creativity and guide you on your crafting journey. Join a workshop and let your imagination run wild!

title: Alma Moodie Quartet
description: Anna da Silva Chen returns to Gerringong with the acclaimed Alma Moodie Quartet. Immerse yourself in the passion of musical Romanticism with a program that spans from Beethoven to Zemlinksy.

title: SONIDO
description: From Sydney to Latin America, SONIDO mixes cultures and sounds to create music full of heart. This fun and lively concert is for children of all ages to enjoy.

title: Tomerong Markets
description: Sweet little village market with local handmade products at the quaint Tomerong Hall. Held every third Saturday of each month. Great community, and gorgeous village life.

title: Culburra Beach Festival
Milton Village Showground Market
description:
This beautiful market is held in the grounds of Milton Showgrounds the first Saturday of the month.

This market offers over 100 stalls, with quality handmade crafts, ladies, babies and men's fashion. Find delicious street foods, pastries, olives, cheeses, local honey and sourdough bread as well as local produce, farm eggs and meats.

Clyde River Berry Farm sells organic ice cream, and Milton Lions also operate a barbeque at each market day. There are also quality collectables, vintage, retro and memorabilia. On some market days, you will find anything from restored furniture, surfboards, quality collectables plants, vintage & vinyls, re-purposed books and specialty handmade. You will also find yummy donuts, Thai and Columbian foods.

title: Huskisson Market
description:
The Huskisson Market is a monthly market with something for everyone, right in the heart of the seaside town. 

The market is held on the sporting ground adjacent to the Huskisson Bowling Club, on the second Sunday of each month.

You'll find live plants, unique arts and crafts, fresh produce, bric-a-brac and much more.

Be sure to explore this thriving community at the heart of Jervis Bay if the Huskisson Markets are on while you're in the area.

title: Kangaroo Unbound
description:
Kangaroo Unbound is a poetry-art exhibition, featuring more than 20 paintings, etchings and collagraphs from Garry's Shead's iconic D.H. Lawrence series, as well as poems written in response to those works by Wollongong writer and academic Luke Johnson.

Travelling exhibition from the University of Wollongong and Wollongong Art Gallery.

title: Red Heart of Australia
description:
'Red Heart of Australia' is an exhibition of eight paintings, created by Aboriginal artists from across central Australia. The paintings were selected from the National Museum of Australia's vast collection.

Red is the colour of Australia's centre, and the colour that unites these desert artworks. Family, spirituality and Country are expressed by the artists through the vibrancy of red, the colour of the earth beneath their feet.

'Red Heart of Australia' is developed by the National Museum of Australia with support from the National Collecting Institutions Touring and Outreach Program.

title: In Conversation: Luke Johnson on 'Kangaroo Unbound'
description:
Join poet Luke Johnson in conversation with Mara Davis Johnson as they discuss his new book, 'Kangaroo Unbound' at the Jervis Bay Maritime Museum & Gallery.

'Kangaroo Unbound' is a collection of 50 poems by Johnson that take their titles and inspiration from legendary Australian artist Garry Shead's iconic 'D.H. Lawrence series' of paintings and etchings which he produced in the early 90s in response to Lawrence's 1923 novel Kangaroo.

This special event will take place among some of Shead's paintings and etchings that inspired the poems in the Kangaroo Unbound exhibition, now on show at the Jervis Bay Maritime Museum and Gallery.

The event is free for the general public with a museum entry to be purchased on arrival. This also includes light refreshments. Museum Members and Annual Pass holders are free.

title: Jervis Bay Maritime Museum Markets
description:
First Saturday of every month! 

The Museum's monthly markets take place on the first Saturday of the month and profile a variety of local arts and crafts, home wares and produce. Relax by the pond with live music and refreshments.

Check out the Museum shop and Mangrove Boardwalk while you are there.

title: Travelling Film Festival Huskisson
description:
The Travelling Film Festival is coming back to Huskisson! Catch the year's most acclaimed films from around the world, including prize winners of the Cannes, Sundance, Berlin and Sydney Film Festival at Event Cinemas Kotara.

Don't miss the Opening Night screening of the heartwarming DJ Ahmet, or the most acclaimed film of 2025 so far, the Palme d'Or winning It Was Just an Accident, plus see Carey Mulligan in the charming and funny The Ballad of Wallis Island.

Plus the joyous documentary about the world porridge championships The Golden Spurtle, Berlinale Silver Bear winner The Blue Trail, Cannes Grand Jury winner Sentimental Value and much more!

The festival weekend will also screen six more acclaimed and awarded films from around the world at exclusive screenings, plus three award winning short films you need to see!

title: Culburra Beach Market
description:
Culburra Beach Markets is a thriving, all-local monthly market at the tranquil location of Culburra Beach Community Centre and tree-lined reserve. 

They have dozens of stalls many of which are handmade and homegrown makers including cards and paper craft, tie-dye, crystals and gems, clothing, kids items and toys, plants, soaps and candles, decor and home furnishings, jams and preserves, woodcraft and much more! 

Hungry? Yo Mama Kitchen has you covered with Bacon and Egg Rolls and scones, while Wicked Tasty Food has the best doughnuts, coffee and cold drinks. 

They look forward to seeing you every first Sunday of the month.

title: IGA Callala Triathlon Festival
description:
The IGA Callala Triathlon Festival is much loved by those who know this as the "Boutique Triathlon". 

Set on the northern shores of Jervis Bay, Callala Beach is a pristine location with that much-loved white sand, clear water and a laid-back feel.

The festival features the popular distances Standard, Sprint, Super Sprint, Aquabike (Swim, Bike only – Standard Distance) and TriKidz, ensuring there is something for all ages and abilities!

Secure your spot and join Elite Energy this December for an endorphin rush before the Santa season kicks in.

title: Shoalhaven 6 hour Adventure Race
description:
Take on the challenge of an epic 6 hour adventure race in Shoalhaven! Run, kayak, mountain bike and navigate your way over a 15km or 30km un-marked, off road course with 6 hours to collect all the check points and get back to the finish line. 

This team-based event is possibly the funnest day out on the trails you can have. It’s a 2-person team based challenge to work together and navigate using a map and compass around a 15 or 30km linear course, collecting check points along the way and get to the finish before the 6 hours cutoff. The winner is the first team over the line that completes the course.

title: Callala Beach Makers Market
description:
This is it! Shoalhaven Local Markets & Committee presents, after many years, an all makers market, including supplies to be your own maker! 

Following the Shoalhaven City Councils moniker of "Make It, Bake It, Sew It, Grow It" they offer only local items made, produced and grown in the Shoalhaven! Highlighting amateurs and pros alike, it's always a fantastic market community at one of the markets. 

And the location! The stunning Callala Beach Hall right on Callala Beach, Jervis Bay with fantastic indoor space, outdoor kids recreation, adjacent to other local small business. 

Yo Mama Kitchen will be cooking up your breakfast needs with Bacon & Eggs Rolls, BLATS, Devonshire Tea and more! 

So please come along and help celebrate the very first Callala Beach Makers Market and support your community!

title: Run Husky
description:
Get ready for the annual Run Husky Festival  featuring the ever-popular Husky Half Marathon and a newly added Marathon. It is sure to be another crowd-pleaser – a flat, fast course on the scenic shores of Jervis Bay.

The view is nothing short of perfection! Participants have always wished the race was longer...so now it is! Choose your distance: Marathon, Half Marathon, 10 kilometre, 5 kilometre, 2 kilometre.

There's a distance for everyone and fun for everyone. Pack the family up, soak in the scenery and make a weekend of it!

title: AustBanners Triathlon Huskisson
description:
Come and immerse yourself in a multisport festival in the idyllic coastal location of Huskisson, Jervis Bay!

Huskisson is famous for hosting one of the southern hemisphere's largest triathlon festivals in February each year, closely followed by its November sister-event, AustBanners Triathlon Huskisson.

This year's version promises a full program of racing, with Standard, Sprint and Super Sprint triathlons, as well as ocean swims and Tri Kids events.

Why not make a weekend of it in the stunning coastal town of Huskisson? Take part in Run Huskisson with a distance for the whole family!

title: The Bay Games
description:
The Bay Games is about creating connection and community through competition. It is a Functional Fitness event focused towards the 'Everyday Athlete'. 

These are people who work full-time but still make a big effort to take care of their health and fitness. 

The Bay Games works to provide these everyday athletes with a professional sports experience in and amongst the beautiful Jervis Bay.

title: Ramen Nights - Blue Nami Japanese
description:
Authentic Ramen: Slip, Slurp, Repeat! Every Wednesday and Thursday, immerse yourself in the art of authentic Japanese ramen at Holiday Haven Huskisson Beach Caravan Park. Envision a setting where the rich, savoury broth, handmade noodles, and perfectly balanced toppings come together to create a culinary experience that transcends a simple meal—it's a journey. Whether you're a devoted foodie or just in need of a delicious midweek pick-me-up, this event invites you to relax by the beach, share smiles with fellow enthusiasts, and celebrate every slurp as a moment of pure joy.

A sense of community and culture set against the backdrop of Huskisson's beautiful coastline, the event transforms an ordinary week into a mini festival of flavours. The playful tagline "Slip, slurp, repeat" isn't just fun—it's a promise of comfort, authenticity, and repeated indulgence. Imagine the sizzle of fresh ingredients meeting the warmth of a simmering broth; it's an invitation to experience food with both your taste buds and your heart. This is your sign to gather, share stories, and capture those vibrant moments that make each visit unforgettable. 

It's an opportunity for locals and travellers alike to experience a slice of Japanese tradition, amplified by the relaxed vibe of a scenic caravan park. 

This event is proudly supported by the Shoalhaven Food Network.

title: Huskisson parkrun
description:
Huskisson parkrun is a free, weekly, timed five-kilometre running and walking event held at Moona Moona Creek at Huskisson, NSW. 

It's open to everyone, regardless of age or ability, and is organised by volunteers. Participants can choose to walk, jog, run, volunteer, or spectate. 

It's not a race; parkrun events are timed, and participants receive a personal time. They are all about community and inclusivity, and they are organised and run by volunteers. Dogs are welcome on a short, hand-held lead. 

Everyone is welcome-  all ages and abilities, including walkers, joggers, and runners.

title: Family Friday
description:
Enjoy Family Fridays at Cupitt's Estate, the perfect way to relax and reconnect at the end of the week.

Delight in the Family Meal Deal, which includes two delicious pizzas, a fresh salad, a jug of soft drink, and your choice of two glasses of house wine or beer.

Fun activities will entertain the kids each week, leaving you free to unwind and enjoy. Book your table and make Friday night a family tradition at Cupitt's Estate.

title: Cupitt's Estate Sunday Sessions
description:
This Summer, catch Sunday Sessions and finish off your weekend in style at Cupitt's Estate.  With Live Music from 12:30pm, it's the place to be on a Sunday in the Shoalhaven.

Enjoy the Estate wine, craft beer, and delicious food while singing along to their fabulous local talent who play with a backdrop of the green rolling hills of Milton, the Budawang ranges and Burrill Lake.

Bookings for the Terrace tables are recommended, and dogs on leads are welcome in the lawn area.

Cupitt's Estate operates as a winery, brewery, restaurant, and luxury accommodation.

title: Christmas in July
description:
Come along to this free community event, in the centre of Sussex Inlet. 

Activities include Circus Activities, Santa (in the snowfield, with his reindeer!), hair braiding and face painting, mural painting for kids, live music, carousel and jumping castle.

All cafes will be open for dinner with a great choice of food.

title: Jervis Bay Arts Trail
description:
Step inside the artists' studios of the Jervis Bay Arts Trail on the last Saturday of each month. Meet the artists, learn about their unique processes and buy direct. 

The artists work across many styles and mediums – oils and watercolour, photography and textiles, collage and drawings, landscapes, abstracts, sculpture – there's something for every taste along the Trail. Check the website to see who is open and where to find them, plus details of group exhibitions, pop-up art shops and special events. 

The Jervis Bay Arts Trail presents a perfect opportunity to connect with over a dozen artists in the region, as they open their working studios to offer visitors insight into their creativity, materials, inspiration and works-in-progress.

title: Sunday Sessions at The Rooftop Bar and Grill
description:
Join in on a Sunday Session at The Rooftop East each Sunday afternoon for live music and good vibes.

No bookings necessary. 

Visit the website for details on upcoming acts.

title: Sculpture for Clyde
description:
A ten-day free event held on the Batemans Bay Foreshore highlighting original Sculptures from Australia and overseas.

The event includes an outdoor sculpture exhibition, indoor sculpture exhibition and a student sculpture exhibition, with regional high schools partaking in this part of the event. 

All sculptures are unique with no editions, representing opportunities for the public to enjoy or purchase original art. 

The sculpture winning the acquisitive award will be permanently positioned in the Batemans Bay Sculpture Walk along the Clyde River foreshore.

title: Batemans Bay Rotary Sunday Market
description:
Batemans Bay Sunday Market is held on the first and third Sunday of every month beside the beautiful Clyde River on the waterfront foreshore precinct in Batemans Bay CBD. 

No weekend on the coast is complete without a visit to these markets on a Sunday morning. With fantastic stalls, great music, plenty of parking in Batemans Bay CBD and a beautiful location on the foreshore precinct, the Sunday Market has something for everyone!

Organized by Rotary Batemans Bay, the market regularly has up to 60 stalls selling clothes, food, collectables, plants, hobbies, gifts, antiques, wood products, bric-a-brac and more. 

Visitors can enjoy live music from local artists, great coffee and good bargains all in a pleasant location beside the river. On occasion, they hold an extra market on a Sunday in addition to the regular markets. 

For more information and for stall bookings, please visit the Batemans Bay Sunday Market website.
host: ROTARY CLUB OF BATEMANS BAY INC

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Batemans Bay
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton's greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg's uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world's biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews' performance as fantastic, brilliant, the real deal and a real showman. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – Rocketman.

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg's Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you've not seen the real Elton.

title: Elton John Experience - Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Batemans Bay
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John, quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton’s greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg’s uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world’s biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews’ performance as “fantastic” “brilliant” “the real deal” and “a real showman”. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – "Rocketman".

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg’s Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you’ve not seen the real Elton.

title: Fungi - The Web of Life Movie  - Batemans Bay
description:
All life on Earth is connected by a great mystery we are only just beginning to unravel. Hidden between the world of plants and animals, another world exists: ''Fungi: Web of Life. We'll begin in the mysterious world of the forest floor, where fungi are the central players in nature's story of birth, death, and rebirth to discover that life as we know it simply would not exist without them.   

Join acclaimed British biologist, Dr. Merlin Sheldrake, on a quest to find an incredibly precious blue mushroom, against the backdrop of Tasmania's ancient Tarkine rainforest. Merlin will show us some the grandest and strangest organisms ever discovered, showcased through jaw-dropping time-lapse cinematography, in a landscape largely unchanged from the time of the dinosaurs. 

Fungi have important lessons to teach humanity about survival through cooperation. Indeed, these incredible lifeforms may hold the key to solving some of humanity's most urgent problems. With millions more species to discover, our journey into the secret world of fungi has only just begun.

For all who enjoyed our film in 2024 - this is more of Stephen Axford's work - it will be another awe inspiring film. Have a look at the trailer and Stephen's photos.

title: Ulladulla Wharf Markets
description:
Ulladulla Wharf Markets is held on the second Sunday of each month at the Ulladulla Harbour.

This is a great market to visit with stallholders selling locally produced items, vintage wares and always great coffee to be enjoyed as you stroll the beautiful harbour.
host: Volunteer Marine Rescue NSW- Ulladulla Unit

title: Fox Superflow Mogo Mania | Mogo NSW
description:
The “Mogo Mania Stage Race” weekend takes the Fox Superflow® format to the next level and expands it into a multi-day gravity adventure! Race the way you Ride all weekend with SIX stages on Mogo’s epic trails.

Tailor your Mogo Mania experience to your style and schedule -  six stages on offer for the “Mogo Maniac” Titles, three stages each day. Do all, or you pick one day.

Whether you’re chasing podiums or are just out for a fun day of riding, this event is all about enjoying the ride with friends. 

With no set track order and untimed liaisons, you’re free to enjoy the day (or days!) at your own pace. You get up to five runs on each of the tracks, with your fastest run on each stage combined for your final result. 

The event is open to all ages, with categories based on age groups, so you can race against your peers. Whether you're a young rider or a seasoned veteran “race the way you ride” and make new friends along the way! The race village will be buzzing with activity, featuring live timing, mountain bike equipment exhibits, music, and plenty of food and drink options to keep you fuelled for the day. For full event details, including trail maps, parking, and amenities, visit the Fox Superflow® website.

title: Sea Otter Australia Schools Championships | Mogo NSW
description:
Get ready for an epic day of mountain biking with the Sea Otter Australia Schools Championships at Mogo MTB Park! Hosted by Rocky Trail Entertainment, this event is designed for high school-age riders to challenge themselves across three epic-timed stages on some of the best trails in the region. Whether they’re looking to challenge themselves or just have fun with friends, the Rocky Trail Academy event is all about fostering growth and camaraderie. 

The event format includes three stages, designed to test a variety of skills, including endurance, speed, and technical ability. Everyone gets five possible runs on each track, with the fastest time per stage counting toward your final result. With no set track order and untimed liaisons, you can enjoy the beautiful outdoors at your own pace. Riders will also earn points for their school, with bonus points awarded to top finishers on each track.

Race categories are based on school year groups - students race against their peers and experience the thrill of friendly competition. Each track is designed to be rideable by anyone from beginners to experienced, ensuring there’s something for every skill level.

Their experienced team will be there to ensure everything runs smoothly, from registration to course marshalling and first aid services! For full event details, including trail maps, parking, and amenities, visit the official event page.

title: Dressage at Willinga
description:
Dressage at Willinga returns to the South Coast - set within the spectacular surrounds of Willinga Park. 

More than a venue, Willinga Park is a destination. With its award-winning architecture, botanic gardens, sculpture walk and world-class arenas, it offers an experience that goes far beyond competition.

Across two full days, you'll see riders from across the country compete from Preliminary to Grand Prix Freestyle. Whether you're passionate about the sport or simply curious, this is your chance to witness the power and beautiful precision of dressage in an unforgettable setting.

Free entry for spectators, everyone is welcome. Elite Dressage performances across three purpose-built arenas. 

Explore the grounds and walk through expansive gardens and large-scale sculpture installations. 

Relax at the Bunker Café open daily for coffee, breakfast and lunch. 

Willinga Park is family and dog friendly, on-lead dogs welcome. 

They look forward to welcoming you to Willinga Park!

title: The Jackson Ranch Pop-Up Restaurant
description: The Jackson Ranch Pop-Up Restaurant is returning soon! Enjoy a scenic drive to Bawley Point and revel in a seasonal, mouth-watering menu. The pop-up will be open each weekend for delicious dining.

title: Sea Otter Australia Festival
description:
Experience the rush of two-wheeled (and beyond!) action at Sea Otter Australia! This new Australian Cycling Festival explodes onto the scene with 30 years of Sea Otter Californian history as the biggest Bike Festival brand in the world, bringing you a non-stop, three-day cycling extravaganza with a huge line-up of satellite events and experiences in the region in the festival week!

This isn't just racing; it's the ultimate bike festival experience! Imagine: eight official events, from hardcore Gravity Enduro and thrilling Superflow® to epic marathons, junior champs, and fun kids races. Plus, experience the adrenaline of E-bike Four Cross, Cyclo-Cross beach battles, and jaw-dropping Freestyle jams! 

The Event Hub is the beating heart of it all – a rider's paradise with over 200 brands showcasing the latest gear, demo rides, exclusive deals, and chances to meet your cycling heroes. Picture this: meet the gang at the hub in the morning, ride, race and demo on Mogo Trails, then roll back into the hub, grab a cold drink, and swap stories with fellow riders, soaking up the festival vibes. Then, you're checking out cutting-edge bikes, scoring sweet deals, and maybe even snagging an autograph from your cycling hero. It's the ultimate rider's playground!

Get ready for a long weekend of adventure, bikes, good times, and everything cycling!

title: Christmas Fair at Long Beach
description:
Come and join in for the Long Beach Christmas Fair. 

Stalls offer everything from handmade goodies to wooden gifts, plants to ice cream and everything in between.

The event features food and coffee vans, kids activities such as a jumping castle, market stalls,  great selection of food including RFS sausage sizzle - there will be something for everyone, young and old.

Santa is visiting at noon with surprises and sample bags to take home.

Pack a picnic rug and come enjoy music and the nearby beach.

title: Garden of Earthly Delights - Batehaven
description:
A garden teeming with temptation and desire, grotesque creatures and improbable scenes of surrender: the uninhibited world of Hieronymus Bosch's 500-year-old triptych "De tuin der lusten". Baffling his Dutch contemporaries and the casual tourists in Madrid's Prado in equal measure (not to mention generations of art critics) Bosch's Garden of Earthly Delights is ever-enigmatic. 

Whether it is interpreted as a surreal feast for the senses or as a stark warning about the moral decay during a time of rapid change, this art exudes dread and seduction in equal measure. 

Trust Luminescence Chamber Singers to turn this surreal feast of the senses into an aural tapestry as pleasurable and perilous as Bosch's vision. Drawn from the vaults of Renaissance raunch, Medieval monasterian excess and daring modern transgressions, Garden of Earthly Delights offers a vocal cornucopia of surprise and surreptitiously cheeky delight, probing the pleasures and perils of excess.

Program to include music by Josquin, Banchieri, Gallus and new works by Nicole Murphy and Archie Tulk.

title: Fungi - The Web of Life Movie - Moruya
description:
All life on Earth is connected by a great mystery we are only just beginning to unravel. Hidden between the world of plants and animals, another world exists: ''Fungi: Web of Life. We'll begin in the mysterious world of the forest floor, where fungi are the central players in nature's story of birth, death, and rebirth to discover that life as we know it simply would not exist without them.   

Join acclaimed British biologist, Dr. Merlin Sheldrake, on a quest to find an incredibly precious blue mushroom, against the backdrop of Tasmania's ancient Tarkine rainforest. Merlin will show us some the grandest and strangest organisms ever discovered, showcased through jaw-dropping time-lapse cinematography, in a landscape largely unchanged from the time of the dinosaurs. 

Fungi have important lessons to teach humanity about survival through cooperation. Indeed, these incredible lifeforms may hold the key to solving some of humanity's most urgent problems. With millions more species to discover, our journey into the secret world of fungi has only just begun.

For all who enjoyed our film in 2024 - this is more of Stephen Axford's work - it will be another awe inspiring film. Have a look at the trailer and Stephen's photos.

title: Fungi Feastival - Horror Movie, Gaia
description:
Gaia is a 2021 South African ecological horror film produced and directed by Jaco Bouwer from a screenplay by Tertius Kapp. It stars Monique Rockman, Carel Nel, Alex van Dyk, and Anthony Oseyemi. 

In addition to the movie screening there will be fungi-inspired beverages and truffle popcorn plus prizes for fungi-themed dress-ups and for fungi nerds. The audience will be encouraged to participate in the screening of the film. There will be warnings so those who are squeamish can avoid the really scary bits.   

An injured forest ranger on a routine mission is saved by two off-the-grid survivalists. What is initially a welcome rescue grows more suspicious as the son and his father reveal a cultish devotion to the forest where a fungi of monumental proportions proliferates at night, gathering strength, threatening to take over the earth. 

Gaia has a lot to say about humanity's destruction of the environment and the tipping point we have collectively reached in the Anthropocene, but the film says it with creativity, flights of imagination and even humour. It's a thought-provoking and disturbing film.

title: Moruya Country Market
description:
The Moruya Country Market is a vibrant market held every Saturday morning on the banks of the stunning Moruya River. 

There is something for everyone with stallholders selling everything from locally grown fresh produce, delicious homemade preserves and baked treats, handmade arts and crafts, pre-loved books, clothing, bric-a-brac, and refreshments.

Make a day of it - wander the market, pick up your fresh produce, look for a bargain, grab a freshly brewed coffee and a tasty treat, and soak up the atmosphere.

title: SAGE Farmers Market Moruya
description:
Held every Tuesday afternoon at Riverside Park, The SAGE Farmers Market was born out of a community demand for quality, local food. They are proud to be able to provide a marketplace for consumers to access locally grown or harvested food directly from the producers, under safe and controlled conditions.

The market has quickly established an excellent reputation in the surrounding districts as an authentic farmers market and they have made it their highest priority to maintain that authenticity, so that consumers can be sure that what they purchase from any SFM stall holder adheres to the SFM philosophy and ethos (see the website for more information).

The secondary purpose is to educate consumers about the multiple benefits of eating local produce and products and to raise awareness of the seasonality of local food.

title: Fun with Fungi Rock and Clay Art - Fungi Feastival
description:
In these two hour sessions participants will be provided with materials to paint their own unique fungi design on rocks which they can either keep or share by leaving them somewhere for others to find. 

They can also paint a mushroom mould to take home or give away as a present. There will be a number of fun mushroom moulds to choose from. If there is still time they can have a go at making paper mushrooms.

These events are specifically designed for children.

title: Currarong Art Trail
description:
Currarong is a picturesque seaside village, within the pristine Jervis Bay Marine Park, on the south coast of New South Wales. The tiny village is home to many talented, active artists.

Currarong's monthly walking Art Trail provides a fabulous opportunity to explore the village while meeting their local participating artists and enjoying their creations.

The artists are looking forward to welcoming you into their homes, studios and workspaces on the first Saturday of every month at selected times.

Before you head out on the Art Trail, they invite you to take a look at the artists profiled on the website. Please check that the artists you would like to visit will have their studios open during your visit. 

Then, when you're ready, wander the village, meet the artists, chat with them about their art, and, if you fall in love with a piece, feel free to make a purchase directly from their studio.

The Art Trail is an easy walk and a lovely way to enjoy the village.

title: Fungi Feastival Photograph Exhibition
description: This exhibition displays photos of fungi captured between Batemans Bay and Eden. It includes show the winners and finalists of the Fungi Feastival photography competition. The photos are amazing.

title: Fungi Feastival Photograph Exhibition Launch
description:
Join the informal opening of the Fungi Feastival photography exhibition. Meet the prize winners as they receive their awards. 

The display will show the winners and finalists of the Fungi Feastival photography competition. The photos are amazing.

title: Moruya Jockey Club Thoroughbred Racing
description:
The next event at the Moruya Jockey Club will include some great racing action as well as on-site facilities inclusive bookies, a bar, hot food, a coffee van and a TAB in operation. 

Marquees are available on the day, please contact the club should you wish to book a marquee.

title: River of Art Festival
description:
Celebrating 21 years of creativity on the coast! This Spring, immerse yourself in the vibrant arts and culture of Eurobodalla, the heart of the South Coast.

As whales glide along our shores and chefs showcase the region's freshest local produce, the River of Art Festival invites you to explore over 100 inspiring events across 11 days and 100 kilometres of stunning coastline.

Celebrate creativity with local artists, makers, and growers. Escape to tranquil coastal havens or countryside retreats where nature, comfort, and community blend. From Open Studios and Exhibitions to live performances and workshops, every moment is designed to inspire, excite and connect.

Plan your visit, explore the art, and take something extraordinary home.

title: Tuross Community Markets
description: The Tuross Community Market is held on the second and fourth Sunday of each month. Located along Evans Road at Tuross Head, the market features fresh produce, homewares, clothing and more.

title: Fungi Feastival - Cobargo
description:
The Fungi Feastival is a month-long celebration of all things fungi from Eden to Batemans Bay!

There is so much to learn from Fungi, and a range of fun activities will be available throughout the festival.

The science of fungi. There is so much to choose from: the south coast launch of "Follow the Rain" world-famous fungi hunters and photographers Stephen Axford and Catherine Marciniak present a series of fungi and photography workshops, and workshops on growing gourmet mushrooms and truffles.

Cooking and eating with fungi. Join a lesson on how to cook mushrooms and truffles or a truffle hunt; try a mushroom or truffle dish at participating cafes and restaurants; experience an amazing mushroom or truffle dinner at a restaurant; or purchase gourmet mushrooms and truffles to cook your meal.

The art of fungi. Fungi photography, movies, pottery, so many options.

Children's activities during the holidays.

title: Cobargo Folk Festival
description:
The 2026 Cobargo Folk Festival is a welcoming, family-friendly event featuring three days of folk and roots music in the NSW village of Cobargo in the beautiful Bega Valley. 

Established in 1996, the Festival has grown to become one of Australia's best-loved village festivals because of its intimate size, fun and friendly vibe, and high-quality artistic program. 

The Cobargo Folk Festival is a place to reconnect, relax and get creative with family and friends.  The Festival offers a warm and authentic experience on the NSW Sapphire Coast, featuring the best of live folk and roots music from Australia and overseas.

The family-friendly vibe continues with KidBARGO! The special kids' program and The Crossing Youth Performers' stage. 

Come and try the best of Sapphire Coast produce at the festival food village and enjoy local art and craft offerings at the festival market.

title: Art exhibition: Lazy Lizard Cobargo
description: ​View a small and diverse exhibition of fungi-inspired art at the Lazy Lizard Gallery. This innovative gallery is run by a group of creative artists who live within a radius of 20 kilometres of Cobargo.

title: Weekend Workshop Bandicoot Pottery Studio
description:
Join this pottery class workshop and learn hand-building and wheelwork in a positive environment filled with imagination, creativity and fun.

If you're interested in learning how to hand-build or how to use the wheel, this is the perfect place to start. You will learn the fundamentals of hand-building, including pinching, coiling, and slab construction. On the wheel is wedging and throwing strong forms, including bowls and cups.

title: Horizon Apartments Narooma Forest Rally
description:
The Horizon Apartments Narooma Forest Rally is a competitive motorsport event conducted on closed gravel roads within the New South Wales forests surrounding Narooma and Bodalla on the New South Wales south coast. The event has developed in stature to be recognised by the New South Wales Rally Panel as the best event in New South Wales in 2016 and 2019. 

Experienced competitors will compete against the clock in highly modified vehicles, providing a fantastic attraction for spectators of all ages. Crews will service their vehicles in Narooma and compete in the nearby forests. Spectating is free. The event is family and community orientated and is well received by the local shire council and community.

title: Tilba Market
description:
When you visit the charming historic township of Central Tilba on a Saturday morning you can't go past the Tilba Market held in the Big Hall every week.

There is a variety of stalls selling a range of products including fresh fruit and vegetables, free-range eggs, local honey, jams and preserves, delicious baked treats, plus much more.

title: Candelo Markets
description:
The village of Candelo is home to one of the best markets in Australia, the monthly Candelo Market.  

The atmosphere is always one of a village fair. 

There is great food and coffee, roaming musicians and entertainers, and a variety of stalls including everything from livestock and plants to bric-a-brac, books, new and recycled clothing, health food and treatments, jewellery, skincare, and of course great local produce. 

The streets come alive and the Town Hall and local cafes are also part of the action. 

Come for the market and stay for the day in a wonderful Australian country village.

Candelo Markets are held on the first Sunday of every month.

title: Fungi Feastival - Tilba
description:
The Fungi Feastival is a month-long celebration of all things fungi from Eden to Batemans Bay! 

There is so much to learn from Fungi, and a range of fun activities will be available throughout the festival.

The science of fungi. There is so much to choose from: the south coast launch of "Follow the Rain" world-famous fungi hunters and photographers Stephen Axford and Catherine Marciniak present a series of fungi and photography workshops, and workshops on growing gourmet mushrooms and truffles. 

Cooking and eating with fungi. Join a lesson on how to cook mushrooms and truffles or a truffle hunt; try a mushroom or truffle dish at participating cafes and restaurants; experience an amazing mushroom or truffle dinner at a restaurant; or purchase gourmet mushrooms and truffles to cook your meal. 

The art of fungi. Fungi photography, movies, pottery, so many options.

Children's activities during the holidays.

title: Plethora of Postcards
description:
Experience a Plethora of Postcards at the Annual Postcard Exhibition.
Come along and enjoy the incredible variety of postcards created by a diverse range of artists, both young and young at heart, reflecting this year's theme of 'home' or expressing their individuality.
View the prize winners and perhaps purchase a card or two for your own collection.        
             
You are invited to creat A6-sized artworks and enter them in the 14th annual Plethora of Postcards Exhibition.  Don't miss out on your opportunity to be part of this very popular show and amaze yourself, your friends and family—great prizes to be won in several categories.

Entry forms will be available on the Spiral Gallery website
​

title: Spiral Gallery Members Gallery and Shop
description:
Spiral Gallery's Artist Members showcase their works in Gallery and Shop. 

It has a smorgasbord of original artworks, including ceramics, jewellery, clothing, textiles, prints, paintings, handcrafted wood and knives, baskets and more.

title: Fish and The Sleeping Whales
description:
Fish and the sleeping whales showcases drawings, etchings and lino cuts by  David Whitfield and Kate Wall. 
 
Longing for the ocean views, the deep blues slashed with white foam. Deepening in the distance until it meets the pale blue of the sky.  But this exhibition is about what is under that blue blanket. The fish: many are now endangered through loss of habitat, overfishing, and polluted waters. Fish are the subject of the drawings and prints, added to that is an explosion of scale with the sleeping sperm whale part of the drawn background.

title: Sapphire Coast Orchid Club Spring Show
description:
This is an annual event in which Orchid Club members display their plants in a competitive display. 

The event is open to the public who also have the chance to purchase plants from the members sales bench.

title: Fungi Feastival - Bega
description:
The Fungi Feastival is a month-long celebration of all things fungi from Eden to Batemans Bay!

There is so much to learn from Fungi, and a range of fun activities will be available throughout the festival.

The science of fungi. There is so much to choose from: the south coast launch of "Follow the Rain" world-famous fungi hunters and photographers Stephen Axford and Catherine Marciniak present a series of fungi and photography workshops, and workshops on growing gourmet mushrooms and truffles.

Cooking and eating with fungi. Join a lesson on how to cook mushrooms and truffles or a truffle hunt; try a mushroom or truffle dish at participating cafes and restaurants; experience an amazing mushroom or truffle dinner at a restaurant; or purchase gourmet mushrooms and truffles to cook your meal.

The art of fungi. Fungi photography, movies, pottery, so many options.

Children's activities during the holidays.

title: ReBoot in Bermagui
description:
Enjoy two days of active participation in a variety of activities in Bermagui's beautiful coastal environment.

The ReActivate Program includes adult and kids fun runs, teams tug-o-war, ocean swims, a social road bike ride and a healthy Bermagui breakfast. To participate in the ReActivate program, register online through the website.

The ReEnergise Program offers something for everyone with yoga, Tai Chi, pilates, stand-up paddle boarding, golf, barefoot bowls, badminton, pickleball, kids entertainment and lots more.

Visit the website for further information. Online registration for activities will commence approximately eight weeks before the event.

title: Wyndham Village Market
description:
The Wyndham Village Market is held in Wyndham Village on the fourth Sunday of every month. Find handmade treasures, yummy homemade treats and local produce at their friendly all-weather market.

Enjoy great food and Wyndham's own specialty coffee while listening to the local 'music maker of the month'.

After the market, you can take the self-guided heritage walk around town (ask for details at the market).

title: Bermagui Growers and Makers Market
description:
Discover the taste of Bermagui! Come and meet friendly local growers and makers at the weekly market. There is lots of farm-fresh produce, ready-to-heat and ready-to-eat meals, baked goods, drinks, handmade gifts and unique arts and crafts.

The market runs every Thursday from October/November to April at the Bermagui Country Club. Check out the calendar to see when the market is on. 

Visit the Facebook page to receive market updates, food tips and special deals.
host: Bermagui Growers and Makers Market Inc

title: Fungi Feastival - Bermagui
description:
The Fungi Feastival is a month-long celebration of all things fungi from Eden to Batemans Bay!

There is so much to learn from Fungi, and a range of fun activities will be available throughout the festival.

The science of fungi. There is so much to choose from: the south coast launch of "Follow the Rain" world-famous fungi hunters and photographers Stephen Axford and Catherine Marciniak present a series of fungi and photography workshops, and workshops on growing gourmet mushrooms and truffles.

Cooking and eating with fungi. Join a lesson on how to cook mushrooms and truffles or a truffle hunt; try a mushroom or truffle dish at participating cafes and restaurants; experience an amazing mushroom or truffle dinner at a restaurant; or purchase gourmet mushrooms and truffles to cook your meal.

The art of fungi. Fungi photography, movies, pottery, so many options.

Children's activities during the holidays.

title: Boneless Vegetarian Mushroom Ramen Night - Fungi Feastival
description:
Boneless Cafe presents Vegetarian Mushroom Ramen Night Join them for a cosy evening celebrating local produce, comforting bowls of mushroom-rich ramen, and the best of the region's vegetarian flavours. 

Expect a delicious three-course set menu, with local wines, cocktails  and good vibes all around.  

Two sittings are available.

title: Ceramic Fungi Sculpture by Tika Robinson - Fungi Feastival
description:
Tika Robinson's unique ceramic fungus sculptural works capture the links between decay and regeneration that fungi produce. They explore the effect that different clay, glaze and inks create in the works.

Tika Robinson grew up on a cattle and truffle farm in rural NSW. She attended UNSW Art and Design, completing a Fine Arts degree with Honours. She is currently exploring ceramic fungus sculptural works with an ink element. 

Tika explores the contrast that can be created and discovered with diametrically opposing ideas. Through her work she studies ideas such as life and death, and decay and growth, exploring the decay to regenerative process that fungi produce.  TIka looks at the contrast of humans and nature delving into the depths of the natural ecosystems. She studies the ecosystems of mycelia networks that connect multiple organisms and fungi underground. These networks highlight the connection and distribution of the world's regeneration. 

The event is open during library hours in Bermagui.

title: Sculpture Bermagui
description:
Held annually in March in Bermagui on the far south coast, Sculpture Bermagui includes an Outdoor exhibition in the magnificent setting of Dickinson Point Headland and the foreshore of Dickinson Park, as well as an exhibition of Indoor sculptures in the Bermagui Surf Club, overlooking Horseshoe Bay.

Visit the Sculpture Bermagui website for details of all exhibitions.

title: Barragga Yangga
description:
The Barragga Yangga Many Songs Festival is the culmination of a series of residencies held at Four Winds in 2024, bringing community members and artists together to explore storytelling, song learning, and orchestration. Showcasing newly created material performed by Djinama Yilaga and special guests  – Barragga Yangga is a musical and cultural event not to be missed.

Under the guidance of Four Winds First Nations Creative Director Cheryl Davison, the project aims to strengthen the local Community's connection to their cultural heritage by integrating First Nations stories and traditions into new works. Long term, Barragga Yangga's mission is to foster cultural exchange, promote understanding across generations, and create a lasting legacy of unity and respect.

The project brings together an impressive group of multi-disciplinary artists to take a deep dive into Dhurga language and culture.  Visiting performers and choirs from across the NSW south coast and beyond are invited to immerse themselves in three days of storytelling, language and song workshops, culminating in a dynamic participatory showcase of newly created material on the Four Winds outdoor amphitheatre featuring Djinama Yilaga Choir, Butchulla songman Fred Leone, Yuin rap artist Gabadu, Sydney Conservatorium of Music Students, Affinity Quartet and Stonewave Taiko with arrangements by conductor and mentor Roland Peelman AM and musician Heath Cullen featuring orchestration by Stuart Hunter.

title: Fungi - The Web of Life Movie - Four Winds Bermagui
description:
All life on Earth is connected by a great mystery we are only just beginning to unravel. Hidden between the world of plants and animals, another world exists: ''Fungi: Web of Life. We'll begin in the mysterious world of the forest floor, where fungi are the central players in nature's story of birth, death, and rebirth to discover that life as we know it simply would not exist without them.   

Join acclaimed British biologist, Dr. Merlin Sheldrake, on a quest to find an incredibly precious blue mushroom, against the backdrop of Tasmania's ancient Tarkine rainforest. Merlin will show us some the grandest and strangest organisms ever discovered, showcased through jaw-dropping time-lapse cinematography, in a landscape largely unchanged from the time of the dinosaurs. 

Fungi have important lessons to teach humanity about survival through cooperation. Indeed, these incredible lifeforms may hold the key to solving some of humanity's most urgent problems. With millions more species to discover, our journey into the secret world of fungi has only just begun.

For all who enjoyed our film in 2024 - this is more of Stephen Axford's work - it will be another awe inspiring film. Have a look at the trailer and Stephen's photos.

title: Truffle lunch at Mimosa Wines - Fungi Feastival
description:
Save the date - an amazing four course truffle lunch will be served by Mimosa Wines.  Local truffles, local produce.  Meet the producer while you enjoy some of the best truffle dishes you are likely to taste. Last year, this quickly sold out as places are limited. 

The view is amazing, across the vineyard and back to towards the trufferie from where your truffles are harvested.  If truffles are your passion, book a truffle hunt at Gulaga Gold preceding this lunch. Then enjoy the truffles harvested during your lunch.

title: Tanja Hall Market
description:
The Tanja Hall Market is a vibrant, spring/summer  monthly community market offering a wealth of local culinary delights, fresh and preserved produce from local gardens, local arts and crafts as well as desired second-hand treasures of clothing, books and Retro goods. 

It operates every second Sunday of the month (Sept-April) 9am- 1pm in the beautiful old Tanja Hall in the small community of Tanja between Tathra and Bermagui.  

Come along,  join in the fun and soak up the atmosphere. 

Please note, due to poor mobile reception cash is preferable to the store holders.

title: Tanja Public School Winter Fair
description:
Tanja Public School Winter Fair – Fundraising Event

Tanja Public School P&C will host its annual Winter Fair — a cherished community fundraising event that brings together families, neighbours, and visitors for a day of seasonal celebration.

The program will feature live music, interactive workshops, children's activities, and a diverse range of local stalls offering handmade, homegrown, and sustainably sourced goods. The event reflects the school's commitment to the ethos of "Home Made – Home Grown – Local – Sustainable."

The Winter Fair is open to all, and the wider community is warmly invited to attend and take part in this much-loved tradition.

 Stallholder enquiries welcome

title: Big Dance / Melbourne Cup Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great day out, celebrating the Melbourne Cup/Big Dance Race Meet at the Sapphire Coast Turf Club. There will be Fashions on the Field, food trucks, bars & a kiosk

Free buses to and from the track will be operating.

title: Bermagui Cup Race Day
description:
Enjoy a thrilling seven-race TAB meeting at the Sapphire Coast Turf Club

This event offers a range of amenities, including TAB facilities, bars, a kiosk, bookmakers, and the added convenience of free buses to and from the track. For specific timings and pickup locations, please visit the website. Join them for a day of exciting races and great entertainment!

title: Tathra Multisport Festival
description:
The stunning coastal town of Tathra transforms into an adventure haven with the launch of the Tathra MultiSport Festival!  

This weekend celebration brings heart-pounding off-road action, featuring the Tathra Wharf 2 Waves Ocean Swim and Trail Run Australia Tathra.

No matter if you're a seasoned athlete, weekend warrior, beginner, fun-loving family, or one of the littlest Dirt Kids, Tathra has the perfect event and course!

Explore world-class trails, soak in breathtaking coastal landscapes, and be immersed in a vibrant festival atmosphere. It's the ultimate weekend to experience the thrill, camaraderie, and magic of Tathra's unique coastal charm.

Don't miss the action this March in Tathra!

title: Tura Nursery Biodiversity Education Workshops
description:
Series of community education events profiling flora from the local environment.  Expert specialist horticultural teachers deliver free workshops on topics such as bonsai techniques, native orchid growing, weed identification and management, and promotion of Food Organics and Garden Organics use on behalf of Bega Valley Shire Council.

Regular notable media-personality presenters include Costa Georgiadis, Paul West, and Bruce Pascoe. ABC South East NSW live broadcasts the events.

Brent Whiter, national award-winning horticulturalist, and owner of Tura Nursery, provides individual advice on all matters gardening.  Brent is also known as the voice of Gardening Talkback on local ABC Radio.

title: Slow Rise Retreat
description:
A weekend to reset. 
To reconnect. 
To rise — slowly. 

Slow Rise a carefully curated 2-night/3-day wellness retreat on the Sapphire Coast.

It's an invitation to shift rhythm and perspective. To soften into a slower pace and reconnect.

This weekend is not a detox. Not a performance camp.

It's a full exhale — a spacious, thoughtful, and elevated experience. Designed for those who seek more than a break — those craving community, real conversations, growth towards visions and space to reset.

Together you step away from the city's hum and into the rhythm of the coast.

Besides calming free time, you will dive into meditative sunrise rituals, invigorating movement in nature, inspiring talks, exploration of local produce, restorative stretch sessions and wind down with sauna, ice bath and fireside evenings.

The intention to change thoughts and habits around wellbeing and health through exploration, experience and education weaves throughout the SLOW RISE retreat. Go on a journey together that opens horizons and shifts perspectives to enhance self-care and sustainability within the rapid dance of your lives.

This retreat is curated and co-hosted by citta collective and The Foundation. In collaboration with Hillcrest Merimbula and Safir House.

title: Rocketman In Concert - On Reflection Tour - Merimbula
description:
No one quite embodies the charm, the versatility, the dynamic charisma, and be able to recreate the flamboyant stage show of Sir Elton John quite like Greg Andrew.

With blindingly accurate and faithful recreations of Elton's greatest hits, combined with his effortless melodic skills and reputation as a virtuosic pianist, Greg's uncanny likeness to the Rocketman himself has made him one of the most recognised Elton John performers in the world.

In 2017, Greg was hand-picked with a personal invitation as the only global Elton John tribute to perform on the world's biggest tribute music festival stage in the UK, TRIBFEST. This set the wheels in motion for what has become a very rich and enduring touring history with over twelve years on the world stage, performing to well over half a million enthusiastic patrons in over thirty countries, who have aptly described Andrews' performance as fantastic, brilliant, the real deal and a real showman. Greg Andrew and his band pay homage to Elton John in his two-hour concert production, which takes its name from one of the British singer-songwriter's most-loved tracks – Rocketman.

Rocketman in Concert - On Reflection Tour celebrates the Greatest Hits from the Elton John and Bernie Taupin collection! Greg's Elton John Experience will have you second guessing yourself that you've not seen the real Elton.

title: Far South Film Festival
description:
The Far South Film Festival (FSFF) is held annually in August and showcases stories told by regional filmmakers from all over Australia. 

The festival is produced by Far South Film Inc, a not-for-profit incorporated association of professional and emerging filmmakers and digital creatives living in South East regional NSW.

They invite their fellow filmmakers from regional and remote areas of Australia to submit short films under 40 minutes in length  or features under 90 minutes in length.

In 2025, film screenings, Q&A sessions and awards will be held in-person in Merimbula NSW .

Come and join us in Merimbula to watch the unique, the beautiful, the scary and the moving stories from filmmakers living outside the metropolitan areas of the island continent.

The major prize for Best Film is AUD1000 with prizes in other categories.

title: Sapphire Coast Orchid Club Summer Orchid Show
description:
The South Coast Orchid Club presents an orchid show principally for Australian Native Sarcanthinae Orchids - although other orchids in flower at the time will also be on show. 

Sarcanthinae are principally Australian native orchids from the rainforests and rocky ravines. This show is dedicated to these dainty orchids which are rarely seen at the Club's regular orchid shows. Their flowers may be small but are carried in profusion, and displayed en masse, with their ever-increasing colour range, they make quite a show. 

Complimented by a variety of exotic orchids and other native species the show has a particularly good showing of Masdevallias and some eye-catching pendulous Cymbidiums along with Softcane Dendrobiums, all in all the Show is building to a very impressive spectacle.

Sales of orchids will be available, but be early. For more details please go to the website.

title: Sapphire Coast Orchid Club Winter Orchid Show
description:
The Sapphire Coast Orchid Club's Winter Show is a most spectacular orchid show and will be held at Twyford Hall Merimbula on the NSW far South Coast. This annual event attracts growers from all over the far south coast vying for the coveted awards.

Cymbidium orchids are at their best at this time of the year, and visitors can see the state of the art blooms on show.  Along with the rapidly expanding Australian native orchid section, there are many other exotic varieties of orchids on show. Potting demonstrations and tips on orchid culture will be given by some of the South Coast's top orchid growers.

There is a sales table where members sell excess plants, this provides an opportunity for both the enthusiast as well as the public to purchase quality plants at very reasonable prices. Entry is free. For more information go to the web site.

title: Pambula Rotary Market
description:
Visit this sun-filled market on the broad sports grounds of Pambula every month. 

A huge variety of stalls include everything from hand-made preserves, pickles, olive oil, cakes and sausage sizzles, to jewellery, all kinds of clothing, bric-a-brac, and more.

title: Eat Festival
description:
The Eat Merimbula Festival is the premium food festival of the Sapphire Coast NSW.  Each year, the region comes together on the foreshore of Merimbula Lake to celebrate the local chefs, cooks and produce of the region.

The super-popular day celebrates local heroes with award-winning oysters and seafood, prime cuts from rich paddocks and sweet delights. Guests are encouraged to settle in by the water and savour something delicious from our stable of restaurants, bars and cafes.

In 2026, Sunday's popular large gathering on Merimbula's Fishpen will return, along with a host of satellite events featuring their towns and villages, too. 

Partner events will run over the entire weekend and provide a richer and more delicious experience for visitors and locals alike.  Keep checking in with the website as they head toward the big day.

title: Sapphire Coast Week of Golf
description:
Now in its 40th plus year, the annual Sapphire Coast Week of Golf is the high point of the golfing calendar for the Pambula Merimbula Golf Club and for the Far South Coast region at large. 

Described by the influential Inside Golf magazine as 'the finest tournament of its type in Australia', the competition annually attracts around 300-450 entrants from every state and territory as well as numerous overseas visitors from such places as the United Kingdom, Canada, Singapore and New Zealand. 

Highly regarded for its friendly atmosphere and professional organisation the tournament has encouraged many return visits from golfers, some having participated for more than 30 years. 

The 2025 Week of Golf comprises multiple days of women’s, men’s and mixed competitions. The week concludes with the Pambula Merimbula  Men’s Open Championship on the final Saturday and Sunday.

title: Wanderer Festival
description:
Wanderer Festival is a celebration of music and arts crafted for all generations of festival goers, taking place at a beautiful coastal location in Pambula Beach. Located halfway between Sydney and Melbourne and just a three-hour drive from Canberra, the Sapphire Coast remains one of Australia's truly pristine yet accessible landscapes. 

Wanderer Festival features a music lineup that transcends genre and demographic and a diverse arts program traversing theatre, comedy, circus and workshops. Wanderer's different stages, spaces and campgrounds are dedicated and created purposefully for the young, old and everyone in between.

The Sapphire Coast offers many excellent off-site accommodation options for those preferring to stay beach front, hinterland or in town. The region is also home to a truly vibrant creative community: the spirit upon which the festival is founded.

The festival pays its deep respects to the Thaua people of the Yuin Nation upon whose land it gathers.

title: Eden Whale Festival
description:
The Eden Whale Festival is an annual event, highlighting the southern migration of the humpback and other whales. If you want to get up close and personal with these magnificent animals, there is no better place to be in Australia than Eden on the NSW South Coast.

The whales can be seen in large numbers in the town's stunning Twofold Bay, whether you are in a boat or, indeed, just from the shore.

For one weekend each year, the rich maritime and whaling history of this port on Australia's Coastal Wilderness becomes the centrepiece for a weekend that somehow seamlessly links all things whale. 

There are food events, art exhibitions, vibrant markets showcasing and selling the work of local artisans, great local food and wine, educational marine displays and presentations, quality children's entertainment, live music, and - of course - the best whale-watching experience in Australia.

title: Fungi Feastival - Eden
description:
The Fungi Feastival is a month-long celebration of all things fungi from Eden to Batemans Bay!

There is so much to learn from Fungi, and a range of fun activities will be available throughout the festival.

The science of fungi. There is so much to choose from: the south coast launch of "Follow the Rain" world-famous fungi hunters and photographers Stephen Axford and Catherine Marciniak present a series of fungi and photography workshops, and workshops on growing gourmet mushrooms and truffles.

Cooking and eating with fungi. Join a lesson on how to cook mushrooms and truffles or a truffle hunt; try a mushroom or truffle dish at participating cafes and restaurants; experience an amazing mushroom or truffle dinner at a restaurant; or purchase gourmet mushrooms and truffles to cook your meal.

The art of fungi. Fungi photography, movies, pottery, so many options.

Children's activities during the holidays.

title: Eden Community Market
description:
Eden Community Market - The Friendly Market.

Eden Community Market exemplifies a local Country Market. There are stalls from amazing crafts people, local cottage industries and sustainable initiatives alongside the classic fare of bric-a-brac, garden produce, local concerns and ‘craft for kids’. It is a window into our town, and surrounds, and an experience where bargains are found.
A feature of Eden Community Market is its live music and ‘home-cooked’ delights. Its beautiful location at the ‘top of the hill’, at the end of the main street, allows visitors to enjoy a ‘one stop’ experience where a stroll along the shops or a coffee at one of Eden’s cafes can be combined with a truely local community market. 
It may not be the biggest market on the Far South Coast of NSW but it has a reputation of being one of the friendliest. Visitors will see a community bent on enjoying itself and find themselves being welcomed into the fun.
The Market is from 9am till 1pm on the third Saturday of each month on the grounds of Eden Uniting Church at 18-20 Chandos Street, Eden.

title: Lord Howe Island Discovery Day Celebrations
description:
Lord Howe Island was discovered on 17th February 1788 by Lieutenant Henry Lidgbird Ball, Commander of the armed tender of the First Fleet, HMS Supply.

In previous years tourists are welcomed to join the local community in celebrating the discovery of the Island each year with track and field events for all ages.

Don't miss the slow bike ride, three-legged race and various relay races.

The P & C runs a food stall on the night for those who wish to dine otherwise bring a picnic and a rug.
host: Lord Howe Island Visitor Information Centre

title: Dark Sky Festival - Lord Howe Island
description:
Visitors are invited to experience the magic of pristine night skies at the Dark Sky Festival on Lord Howe Island.

Set against the backdrop of one of Australia's clearest and most unspoiled night skies, this immersive festival celebrates the island's exceptional nocturnal environment through a diverse range of unique experiences.

Attendees can take part in expert-led stargazing sessions or explore the art of capturing the cosmos in astrophotography workshops guided by professionals.

The program also includes a stargazing and yoga experience, as well as nocturnal walks with naturalist Ian Hutton, offering insights into the island's distinctive wildlife and volcanic terrain after dark.

Science talks will feature renowned experts such as Fred Watson and Marnie Ogg, who will delve into topics ranging from dark sky preservation to the mysteries of the universe.

Live music events will bring the community together in celebration under the stars.

title: Nathaniel and Olivia Lucas Norfolk Island Family Muster
description:
Nathaniel Lucas and Olivia Gascoigne/Gaskin arrived on Norfolk Island on 6 March 1788 per HMAT Supply. The March 2026 Family Muster will showcase Nathaniel Lucas's life on Norfolk Island as well as associated families such as Hodgetts, Murray, Rowley, Brooks, Cox, White, Sydes/Sides, Saltmarsh and Stevens.

Discover - Explore - Enjoy - Experience the Heritage and History of the Lucas family from colonial Norfolk Island.  Includes the new Nathaniel and Oliva Journey in Time Tour (exclusive to Family Muster).

title: Auburn Frenchfest - Louise Blackwell and The French Set
description:
After playing legendary French chanteuse Juliette Gréco in her award-winning cabaret show Love On The Left Bank, Lou Blackwell and the French Set are returning to the Auburn French Festival.

Singer Lou Blackwell brings together some of Adelaide’s finest jazz musicians including Mark Simeon Ferguson on keys, Julian Ferraretto on violin, and John Aué on double bass to perform songs from the great ‘variété française’ French popular song tradition. C’est formidable.

title: Wentworth  Twilight Christmas Markets
description:
Enjoy a festive night at the Wentworth Twilight Christmas Markets. 

Enjoy unique market stalls and late-night shopping at local shops. Savor delicious food from food vans and local pubs and cafes. Experience live music and fun kids' activities for all ages. 

Don’t miss the new Wentworth Visitor Information Centre and Library, open during the event.

Capture the magic with Santa photos in the library.

title: Quirky Creative Supplies Snowflake Ornament Workshop
description:
Come along and learn how to make a crocheted Christmas snowflake ornament! Use one to hang on a tree or create several to string together in a garland.  

Skills needed are basic (chaining, slip-stitch, UK double/treble/double treble stitches). Refresher on terms will be included.  

Yarn and pattern provided, please bring own 4.5mm hook.

title: Pooncarie Desert Dash Rally
description:
Off Road cars are some of the most impressively engineered in Australian motor sport and most incorporate complex, long travel suspension systems and powerful engines to enable them to negotiate the rugged, dusty or sometimes muddy terrain they encounter, as fast as possible. There are a number of different classes of competition with vehicles ranging from purpose built space framed open wheelers with engines up to 6000cc to modified 4WD vehicles. Except for the single seaters, all vehicles consist of a driver/navigator team. The endurance aspect of the racing makes each course a test of driver and navigator skill and mechanical preparation. 

Each of these forms a championship in its own right. Off Roading is an exciting and adrenaline filled discipline of motor sport and is growing in stature with an increasing number of competitors looking to take up the challenge. Competitors attend these rounds from every state with most events incorporating a round of their State Championship which attracts local competitors, sponsors and spectators.

title: Pirates of the Carramar
description:
Back by popular demand this Christmas Season - Ratbagz Comedy Theatre present Pirates of the Carramar!

Held in the Coomealla Club Auditorium and includes a 2 course Meal (alternate service)- please notify your dietary requirements.

Be prepared for Nauti humor, cutthroat banter and a sword fight or two as Pirates of the Carramar commences after Main service. 

After a short break - Ratbagz Unplugged will be live to entertain you!

Perfect for end of year staff parties and family get togethers!

title: Let's Talk North-West - Bourke
description:
An exciting outreach initiative is coming to Western NSW and we’re inviting everyone to join in!  

NSW Fair Trading and the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) are collaborating to support Aboriginal communities by promoting consumer education.   

The project focuses on addressing issues that affect vulnerable and disadvantaged consumers, with a strong emphasis on empowering First Nations Australians. By offering tailored, culturally appropriate education, we aim to create safer, more informed communities.  

These events are an opportunity to learn about vital consumer rights, recognise scams and protect yourself and your loved ones from unfair practices. Events and activities are designed to be interactive, engaging, and relevant to everyday challenges. Whether it’s buying a used car, understanding tenancy laws, or shopping rights, our sessions are here to help you feel confident and informed.

Find out more information and register at the event website.

title: Let's Talk North-West - Brewarrina
description:
An exciting outreach initiative is coming to Western NSW and we’re inviting everyone to join in!  

NSW Fair Trading and the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) are collaborating to support Aboriginal communities by promoting consumer education.   

The project focuses on addressing issues that affect vulnerable and disadvantaged consumers, with a strong emphasis on empowering First Nations Australians. By offering tailored, culturally appropriate education, we aim to create safer, more informed communities.  

These events are an opportunity to learn about vital consumer rights, recognise scams and protect yourself and your loved ones from unfair practices. Events and activities are designed to be interactive, engaging, and relevant to everyday challenges. Whether it’s buying a used car, understanding tenancy laws, or shopping rights, our sessions are here to help you feel confident and informed.

Find out more information and register at the event website.

title: Let's Talk North-West - Walgett
description:
An exciting outreach initiative is coming to Western NSW and we’re inviting everyone to join in!  

NSW Fair Trading and the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) are collaborating to support Aboriginal communities by promoting consumer education.
