The project focuses on addressing issues that affect vulnerable and disadvantaged consumers, with a strong emphasis on empowering First Nations Australians. By offering tailored, culturally appropriate education, we aim to create safer, more informed communities.  

These events are an opportunity to learn about vital consumer rights, recognise scams and protect yourself and your loved ones from unfair practices. Events and activities are designed to be interactive, engaging, and relevant to everyday challenges. Whether it’s buying a used car, understanding tenancy laws, or shopping rights, our sessions are here to help you feel confident and informed.

Find out more information and register at the event website.

title: Heartland Raceway- Super Sedans, V8 Dirt Modifieds & Street Stocks
description:
Come for an exhilarating day of racing at Heartland Raceway in Moama, where the roar of engines and the thrill of competition come alive with Super Sedans, V8 Dirt Modifieds, and Street Stocks. This event promises high-speed action and edge-of-your-seat excitement for all motorsport fans.

Super Sedans: Watch as powerful Super Sedans take to the track, featuring some of the most skilled drivers battling it out for supremacy. These high-performance machines are engineered for speed and agility, providing a spectacular show with intense racing and breathtaking maneuvers on the dirt surface.

V8 Dirt Modifieds: Feel the ground shake as V8 Dirt Modifieds hit the track, delivering raw power and thrilling competition. With their unique design and powerful V8 engines, these cars are built for maximum performance and will leave spectators in awe as they navigate the challenging turns and straightaways with precision.

Street Stocks: Experience grassroots racing at its finest with the Street Stocks category. These vehicles, resembling everyday street cars, offer close-quarters racing and plenty of action as drivers push their limits and showcase their skills. This category is always a crowd favorite, providing an exciting and relatable racing experience.

title: The Country Makers Markets @ Whitton Malt House
description:
Come wander the stunning Whitton Malt House grounds and explore the treasure trove that is The Country Makers Markets.

Enjoy a vibrant atmosphere with delicious food and entertainment. It's more than just a market; it’s an experience for the whole family.

By shopping at their Makers Market, you’re supporting local artists and small businesses. Each purchase directly contributes to the dreams and passions of talented makers in the community.

title: Let's Talk Dubbo
description:
NSW Fair Trading is hitting the road again this year, hosting a series of regional community engagement events throughout NSW. 

These events aim to inform consumer groups, small businesses, and traders on their rights and responsibilities, as well as the services offered by NSW Fair Trading. 

In collaboration with local organisations, we will deliver a program covering a wide range of topics, such as the cost of living, tenancy issues, consumer rights, scams, and more.

Consumer rights roundtable for community service workers

Join us to hear about resources which help clients navigate consumer rights, renting, support for financial hardship and disability services. 

Engage with experts, network with peers from your local area, and participate in a roundtable discussion to address the challenges faced by your clients.

Find out more information and register at the event website.

title: Helen Pynor Exhibition
description:
93% Human is an exhibition exploring the multispecies nature of being ‘human’ and the ‘promiscuous’ exchanges of DNA with others. Through an investigation of DNA exhaling in our breath and inhale from others, the work highlights the intimacy of unnoticed exchanges with human and non-human others, and ‘contamination’ as a necessary condition of being.

A performance video depicts artist Helen Pynor and bioinformatician Jimmy Breen collecting a shared breath sample. DNA extracted from this breath was found to comprise 93% human DNA, with the remaining 7% belonging to around 6,700 microbial species. Based on a sound score by composer Amanda Cole, classically trained singers sing and whisper the Latin names of hundreds of these species, brought into the gallery as an 8-channel sound work.

title: Wynne Prize 2024
description:
The annual Wynne Prize was first awarded in 1897 in honour of the official opening of the Art Gallery of New South Wales at its present site.

Judged by the trustees of the Art Gallery, the prize is awarded to the best landscape painting of Australian scenery or for the best example of figure sculpture by an Australian artist.

The Wynne Prize reflects the diversity of figurative sculptural practice, while the paintings are a dynamic reflection of Australian artists’ response to the land, reflecting contemporary aesthetics, environmental and stewardship concerns, and conceptions of Country.

This touring exhibition is an opportunity to see the finalists in the Wynne Prize 2024.

title: Tunes On The Turf  Music Festival
description:
10 years in the making....Tunes On The Turf is a music festival supporting and featuring live performances of original Australian music second weekend in November every year at the Dunedoo Sports Club. Rain, hail or shine-which it usually does, the festival will go ahead!

Support small regional communities!

Friday night features free  live muso jam on the veranda, browse the local Made "n Grown Markets Saturday morning and check out our recently painted silos featuring local jockey Hugh Bowman and WINX;  enjoy a gelato, coffee, cheese platter or picnic hamper, then head to the Sports Club for 10 hours of non-stop music featuring artists from around New South Wales. Finish off the weekend with a relaxing round of golf.

Hot food and cool drinks for visitors to indulge in.  Families are welcome with a playground for the kids to share and much more.

Free camping area for ticket holders, no need to book. 

Tickets available at the gate, on Facebook, and online through 123TIX

title: Dolphins NRL - Black Tie Bingo
description:
Fix your bowtie and join the Dolphins for their inaugural gala dinner that promises to deliver the most entertaining event for you and your guests.

Hosted by Matt Okine and Margaux Parker, Black Tie Bingo is set to be an epic evening that will deliver delicious food, premium drinks, a host of entertainment and the chance to win big across 3 rounds of Bingo.

You and your guests will have the chance to: 

Win part of the AUD6,000+ bingo prize pool 
Bid to take home a brand-new car, thanks to Village Motors
Bid on exclusive Dolphins money-can't-buy experiences
Be the winning ticket holder in the raffle with a prize valued at AUD5000
Meet and mingle with the Dolphins NRL team

title: Christmas Market Corowa
description: Held in the gardens of Gallery 294, this market gives you an early chance to come and buy beautiful handmade Christmas gifts, cards and decorations. All items are made by local artists and craftspeople.

title: 'Significant Others'
description:
'Significant Others' is a selection of 21 favourite artworks that were not selected for Christine Uptons major exhibition 'Outside the Box' at the Hyphen in Wodonga and her minor exhibition at Benalla Art Gallery.
Included are artworks that have not be shown before and a variety of birds, landscapes and semi abstract.
Spend time chatting to the artist about the works and the reason for their creations.
Marvel at the large Wacky bird that was created by local artist Andrew Whitehead from Urana that now is at home at Wacky Bird Gallery.

title: Twilight Markets at The Palms Canowindra
description:
The Twilight Markets at The Palms Canowindra is a craft and food market featuring producers from 100 miles of Canowindra and is held every third Friday of the month.

Come along to the grassy slopes of The Palms in the centre of Canowindra and shop for local produce, hunt for gifts, taste local wines and grab a bite to eat. 

Enjoy local live music or bring along an instrument and take part in the 'open mic'.

title: Christmas Exhibition at Glen Innes Art Gallery
description:
Come along to the Christmas Exhibition at the Glen Innes Art Gallery featuring a variety of local, creative artworks and other Christmas gifts, big and small, available for purchase at very reasonable prices. 

With many pieces for sale, don't miss this opportunity to secure a unique, local, and original work of art.

The Glen Innes Art Gallery proudly represents local artists, hosts exhibitions that reflect our wonderful region and helps artists connect with their audience. 

Check the website or Facebook page for more information and updates.

title: Waggaroos Orienteering Summer Series and Winter Series
description:
Waggaroos is an orienteering club with regular local events in bush and urban environments.  

During the summer months the Club focuses on urban/street events in Wagga Wagga. Events are generally in the format of either a score event using the MapRun app on your mobile phone or a score event where runners nominate a course time of either 30 minutes or 45 minutes during which time the competitor attempts to find as many controls as possible in any order using a hard copy map.

During the cooler months, its focus is on bush events on maps located in and around Wagga and some that are 45 minutes drive from Wagga.

Orienteering is a sport that combines outdoor adventure with map reading and navigational skills. It involves navigating through the bush, parks, or streets with the aid of a specially produced map and an orienteering compass, with the aim being to locate checkpoints (controls) on various natural and man-made features along the way, such as a boulder, track junction, bench seat or streetlamp.

New members are welcomed at all events with courses for all levels of experience will be available for all members of the family to enjoy.

Visit the Waggaroos website for details on the full year’s event calendar, start locations and event times.

title: Wagga Wagga Night Markets
description:
Wagga Wagga are you ready? It's not just a night market, it's an experience.

Indulge your senses with a diverse range of mouth-watering cuisines from around the globe, from sizzling street food to gourmet delicacies. Explore unique handcrafted treasures, from artisan jewellery to stylish fashion, tasty treats, homewares and gifts, as you wander through the market stalls. Immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere, with music, carnival games and rides. Gather your friends, family and loved ones and get ready for a night of unforgettable memories for all ages

International Street Food Stalls
Gourmet Food Trucks and Trailers
Dedicated Dessert Section
Kids Rides and Jumping Castles
Carnival and Sideshow Games
AUD30 Unlimited Kids Rides Wristband
Music till late
Free On-site Parking

title: Author Talk - My Efficient Electric Home with Tim Forcey
description: Author Tim Forcey shares insights from working with thousands of Australians in their homes, as well as from hands-on experience modifying his own home. Come and listen to Tim as he explains best-practice heating and cooling, hot water heat pumps, induction cooktops, draught-proofing, insulation, solar energy and much more.

title: The Greatest Magic Show
description:
This performance is part of the 2023 Wagga Comedy Fest

This multi-award-winning, sell-out sensation of the past four years across Australia and the UK is headed to Wagga Wagga for the very first time - with more whimsical wonders than ever before! Having garnered international acclaim with sell-out seasons in Perth, Adelaide, Edinburgh and New Zealand, the stars Sam and Justin will be once again hitting the stage with brand-new illusions direct from a Las Vegas stage!

It was the winner of Best Children's Show 2019 Sydney Fringe, Best Children's Show 2020 Fringe World Weeklies and Best Children’s Show, 2022 Melbourne Magic Festival.

Joining them will be the enchanting Ringmaster, who after searching far and wide, has finally found The Greatest Magic Show – and will do everything he can to keep it on track!

As an added bonus, every child who attends the show will receive a free magic wand on entry and have their chance to take a photo with the stars of the show after the performance!

This show will sell out, so book early!

title: Childrens School Holiday Program, Best Street Art Studios and Garden Art Gallery
description:
Entering into a magical fairy garden of wonder, children between the ages of 4 to 16 years of age just love participating in this beautifully presented exploration of all types of art. Clay & tye dye creations being the most popular, Best Street holds workshops on woodwork, colourful cookery, mini gardens and a variety of other creative pursuits. 

Kathryn Powderly has over 40 years of teaching experience, starting her career in early childhood and then finding another passion in clay and gaining tertiary qualifications in pottery. Kath shares her knowledge in a patient and kind manner with the children, who continue to return each school holidays, filling their days with joy. 

Intergenerational families have delighted in these very inclusive classes.

title: Out of This World: Australia in the Space Age
description:
Welcome to the dawn of the space age. From the 1950s through to the 1970s, Australia was gripped with excitement as humanity made its first forays beyond Earth’s atmosphere. 

From cutting-edge scientific research to architecture, design, television and more ‘Out of this World’ explores Australia’s role in the space race. Learn about the history of Woomera Rocket Range, see how futuristic architecture influenced Australia’s Expo pavilion in 1970, and meet everyone’s favourite pencil-nosed spaceman, Mr Squiggle.

This exhibition is supported by the Australian Government's Visions of Australia program and the National Collecting Institutions Touring and Outreach Program, a program aiming to improve access to national collections for all Australians.

title: The Smith Street Band - Wagga
description:
The Smith Street Band recently completed their 15th Anniversary Tour of Australia, celebrating their 15th year as a band, selling out shows all over the country.

They’ll finish off the year with 19 more shows, covering four states and one territory, three festivals, and a handful of towns they have never played before, it’s the Odds & Ends Tour. 

The Smith Street Band have recently started writing their seventh album, expected for release in mid-2025. It will follow their 2022 album ‘Life After Football’ and the number one ARIA Album ‘Don’t Waste Your Anger’ from 2020.

title: NSW Rural Women's Gathering
description:
Traditionally, women from all across rural NSW and from all different walks of life attend to meet new people, learn new skills, visit new locations, and enjoy themselves and the company of other women. 

The 2023 theme is 30 years, still going strong and getting stronger, and is it fitting that Orange is hosting the 30th gathering after it also hosted the very first gathering back in 1993.

You can find the event program on the Rural Women's Gathering website.
host: Rural Women's Network and Australian National Field Days

title: Documentary Launch - 25,000 Objects, or how I Learned to Redevelop a Regional Museum
description:
Join them for a screening of their brand new documentary and a Q&A panel, exploring the colossal task of redeveloping the Museum of the Riverina Botanic Gardens Site

Have you ever wondered what goes on behind the scenes of a museum? Or how a major council project might get completed? Well now's your chance to find out. 25,000 Objects (or how I learned to redevelop a regional museum) is a documentary that followed the redevelopment of the Museum of the Riverina's Botanic Gardens Site.

Learn all about the unique challenge of a large infrastructure project, coupled with the technical difficulties of creating an entirely new museum. See behind the scenes and see exactly what it takes to build something new, while moving  25,000 precious objects at the same time.

After the screening, join the conversation during a facilitated Q&A panel with team members instrumental in the museums redevelopment.

title: Learn to Sail on Lake Albert
description:
You are invited to register your interest in the upcoming Learn to Sail six week course on Lake Albert, Wagga. 

Registering requires that you must be able to swim competently and be a minimum of eight years old. If you are under 18 yrs old you must also be accompanied by an adult for supervision purposes.  The supervising adult will be encouraged to participate in one of the six lessons.  All participants must supply their own Life Jacket (PFD) and it must be worn when on the water. 

Please register your interest by completing the online form for each family member. We will contact you with upcoming course details. Numbers will be limited so first in, first served.

title: Cider And Crepes
description:
Cider and Crepes are the perfect food match, renowned in Brittany and the North of France. Join us at Small Acres Cellar door for an afternoon of delicious cider and crepes. Enjoy one of their award-winning ciders perfectly paired with crepes from local legends Romanian Delights! 
Sit and admire the amazing view and enjoy the tranquility of our lovely setting in the heart of Orange's wine country.

Book your table now and don't miss out on this amazing experience.

title: Carl Barron - Just Wondering Why - Orange
description:
The brand new show from Australia’s most popular live comedian!

One thing Carl has heard his whole life is that he thinks too much. He thought about it, considered it, and then realised he was doing it again. What people called thinking though, Carl called wondering, something you are never accused of doing too much of. If you're up for a night of wondering about the sound of a pin dropping, crumbs on your face, or the similarities between dirt and sugar then come along and hear Carl wonder out loud about the small things of life, which may happen to be the big things of life.

It's worth thinking* about.
* Wondering

title: Stella Day Out: Author Fiona Wright - Finding Our Shelters
description:
Stella Day Out is a free one-day literary festival that celebrates and promotes the outstanding contributions of women and non-binary writers to Australian literature. 

Be part of this exciting program at Orange City Library supported by Collins Booksellers, Orange. 

Join them for Finding Our Shelters when Fiona Wright, author of The World was Whole, discusses her writing journey with the Creative Director and CEO of Stella - Fiona Sweet. 

Fiona Wright is a writer, editor and critic. Her book of essays Small Acts of Disappearance won the 2016 Kibble Award and was shortlisted for the 2016 Stella Prize. Her poetry collections are Knuckled and Domestic Interior, and her most recent essay collection is The World Was Whole. She is currently the Judy Harris Writer in Residence at Sydney University’s Charles Perkins Centre.

title: Stella Day Out: Nardi Simpson - Songwriting and Storytelling
description:
Stella Day Out is a free one-day literary festival that celebrates and promotes the outstanding contributions of women and non-binary writers to Australian literature. 

Listen to Nardi Simpson talk about her novels - Song of the Crocodile and her latest The Belburd - and the influence on songwriting and music with Creative Director and CEO of Stella - Fiona Sweet. 

Nardi is a graduate of Ngarra-Burria First Peoples Composers and is currently undertaking a PhD through the Australian National University’s School of Music in Composition. Nardi is the current musical director of Barayagal, a cross-cultural choir based at the Sydney Conservatorium of Music. 

Nardi’s debut novel, Song of the Crocodile, won the 2017 Black&Write! Fellowship and the ALS Gold Medal, and was longlisted for the 2021 Stella Prize and Miles Franklin Literary Award. The Belburd is her second novel. Nardi currently lives in Sydney and continues to be heavily involved in the teaching and sharing of culture in both her Sydney and Yuwaalaraay communities.

title: Peter Godwin - Space Light and Time
description:
This survey exhibition focuses on Godwin’s prints and paintings from 2000-2025, in which he has honed a distinctive, painterly language that immerses us in new worlds. The worlds of Peter Godwin are ever-changing and allusive. In his interiors, still life and landscapes he presents memories of other places. 

Working from his studio on the central coast of NSW, Godwin recalls places, images and objects into his evocative compositions. Over the last 25 years he has distilled and refined his use of light, space and time to create atmospheric paintings and prints that push the potential of an image.

Image: Peter Godwin, Study Government house, Sydney drawing room, n.d. egg tempera on board, 20 x 24 cm, Collection of the artist

title: Parkes Elvis Festival Tour
description:
This five-day tour is jam packed full of activities, all centred around the celebration of the one and only Elvis Presley. Step back into the 50s with muscle cars, Priscilla lookalikes and an Elvis literally on every corner of the lovely township of Parkes. 

You will enjoy multiple shows, concerts, parades, gospel services and so much more! This is a monster event for all ages, there's something here for the whole family.

They will take you to the Parkes Dish as well as a dinner and show here in Cowra, and finish it off in the quaint little village of Canowindra at decadent Montrose House.

Inclusions: 
Sydney and Cowra Transfers, Cowra and Parkes Transfers
4 breakfasts,  2 dinners
Friday ticket to Ultimate Elvis Festival
Friday entry to Parkes Dish  
Saturday dinner and show at Cowra Bowling Club
Sunday Feature Concert Series at Parkes Elvis Festival
Programme Priority Seating at Gospel Service

title: Cherry Festival Photographic Competition and Exhibition - Official Opening
description:
Join in for the Official Opening of Young Camera Club’s 26th Cherry Festival Photographic Competition and Exhibition. It'll display 350 photographs from Young and surrounds, Sydney and across NSW. 

This exhibition has something for everyone and refreshments are provided to those attending. With 13 categories on display, the competition includes a Champion Print, Junior Champion Print, Junior Encouragement Award and other Awards. They invite visitors to choose their favourite photo, to count towards the People’s Choice Award. 

They run prior to and during Young’s National Cherry Festival. So, why not come and discover Young, while enjoying the exhibition and other National Cherry Festival events!

title: Rugby's Eddie Jones at Grove Estate Wines
description:
High profile Wallabies rugby coach Eddie Jones is special guest at an Active Farmers cocktail event to be held at Grove Estate Wines just outside Young. 

Drinks and canapes will be served from 6pm. Listen to stories from the newly appointed Wallabies Coach, Eddie Jones while raising much-needed funds for the Active Famers community.

The events aim to raise funds to help Active Farmers across Australia and to help build stronger and more resilient farming communities.

The event will commence at 6pm and is open to all riders, sponsors, rugby fans and anyone else keen to support Active Farmers.

Active Farmers is a not-for-profit organisation that brings farming communities together to counter alarming mental health statistics in the regions through group fitness in a fun, supportive environment. 

CEO Justin Sampson leads a team of 48 qualified personal trainers in more than 60 small farming communities across the country, reaching some 1500+ participants each month, and says the demand for this kind of community support continues to grow.

title: Mother Country
description:
In 1996, photographer Helga Salwe moved to a farm in North-East Victoria to raise a family, leaving her career as a photojournalist behind her, or so she thought. Here she made a vegetable garden, lived with the beauty, simplicity and peace of country life, as well as with drought and bushfire. Out of this period of her life came these exquisitely beautiful photographs capturing family, nature and life in a small rural farming community. Every image evoking intense emotion ranging from joy to melancholy. In 2015 Five Mile Press published a book of the Mother Country images and since then the images have been widely exhibited to critical acclaim.

Helga Salwe’s work is exhibited both within Australia and internationally. The Mother Country exhibition has been featured at the 'Pingyao International Photography Festival' in China, the 'Headon Photo Festival' in Sydney and the 'Auckland Photo Festival' in New Zealand. Her work is held in both private and public collections, including The National Portrait Gallery of Australia, The National Library of Australia and The Epworth Art Foundation. She has been shortlisted twice for the prestigious Bowness Photographic Prize and holds a Masters in Contemporary Art from the Victorian College of the Arts. She is also a member of Mapgroup, an independent collective of documentary photographers.

title: Rise and Succeed Business Conference
description:
Rise and Succeed 2023, will see nationally recognised guest speakers from across the country converge to Albury for an event unlike anything ever seen on ‘the border’. 

Expect a full-day immersive keynote experience, VIP 'Question and Answer' lunches, photo opportunities and guest speakers who have successfully ran some of the biggest businesses in Australia.

This event is not only for the business owner, aspiring business owner or ambitious employee but also for those looking to improve or change an aspect of their life for the better!

2023 Rise and Succeed Speakers are Janine Allis. Janine Allis is an Australian businesswoman icon who is the founder of Boost Juice and part-owner of Retail Zoo, which is the parent company of Boost Juice, Salsa's Fresh Mex Grill, Betty’s Burgers and Cibo Espresso. Daniel Flynn, Co-Founder of THANKYOU. Matt Purcell. Co-Founder of Mentored Media (now kyu media).

Jacqui Bell, the Youngest Person in History to run an Ultra Marathon on all seven continents. Jackson McGrath, Co-founder of Australia’s fastest growing health food store Greenstreat. Peta Stewart, award-winning conveyancer. Entrepreneur and business mentor.

title: Celtic Illusion - The Magic Returns
description:
Immerse yourself in one of the most unique productions touring the world. Celtic Illusion, the Irish dance and Grand Illusion sensation that has taken Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Canada, and the USA by storm and will tour nationwide in 2023.

Even fans who have seen our previous shows won’t dare miss The Magic Returns tour that is set to raise the bar once again. This exhilarating production has broken barriers by fusing unparalleled art forms and is more spectacular than ever before.

A breathtaking array of experiences, fusing Irish Dance, Magic, and influential flavours of Fosse, and Michael Jackson, with a Broadway style. 
Starring the multi-talented former lead dancer of Michael Flatley’s Lord of the Dance and Star Illusionist Anthony Street, with Georgia May, a marvel in both dance and Illusion. 

These impeccable performers lead a cast of champion dancers recruited from renowned productions across the world, such as Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, into a theatrical masterpiece that will have you mesmerised from the moment the curtain is raised.Celtic Illusion will surpass your expectations and leave you wanting more.

Don’t hesitate, and book now to know the hype of one of the largest and most unique Dance and Illusion shows in the world.

Celtic Illusion is not to be missed!

title: Explorers Bike Ride
description:
The multi-day ride follows in the footsteps of the explorers Hume and Hovell from Albury to Werribee. 2024 is the bicentenary year of the Expedition that explored a route from Sydney to Port Phillip along which squatters later followed to settle Victoria. 

The Explorers Bike Ride 2024 is a 650-kilometre multi-day tour through Victoria following the line of the 1924 Hume and Hovell Monuments. The ride will visit 29 of the monuments and follow back-country gravel roads and four-wheel drive tracks, together with sections of four rail trails, as well as the many bike paths of Melbourne. 

Divided into eight stages, the route can be ridden solo or in small groups, as an epic self-supported adventure ride. For time-poor cyclists, all stages over several rides can be an option. Limited support could be available.

title: Albury Night Markets
description:
Albury are you ready? It's not just a night market, it's an experience.

Indulge your senses with a diverse range of mouth-watering cuisines from around the globe, from sizzling street food to gourmet delicacies. Explore unique handcrafted treasures, from artisan jewellery to stylish fashion, tasty treats, homewares and gifts, as you wander through the market stalls. Immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere, with music, carnival games and rides. Gather your friends, family and loved ones and get ready for a night of unforgettable memories for all ages.

International Street Food Stalls
Gourmet Food Trucks and Trailers
Dedicated Dessert Section
Kids Rides & Jumping Castles
Carnival & Sideshow Games
AUD30 Unlimited Kids Rides Wristband
Music till late
Free On-site Parking

title: Canola Fields Photography Tour
description:
Spring is the perfect time to explore the vibrant canola fields and wild flowers that cover the spectacular Riverina and Hilltops agricultural region of NSW.

Award-winning photographer Ari Rex will guide you on a lifetime experience while teaching you his unique photography skills.

Ari will take you to the best locations, based on the current conditions. Each tour will explore different locations and vantage points, so no tour will be the same.

This small group tour includes transport in a comfortable air-conditioned vehicle.

title: Australian Eagles Show: Dark Desert Highway Australian Tour
Spring into Art at Newbridge
description: Spring into Art at Newbridge is a spring celebration of open gardens, live music, artisan market stalls, art exhibitions and the Newbridge Art Show, held in the Blayney Shire village of Newbridge.

title: Lismore Base Hospital Auxiliary Christmas Craft Market
description: This annual market is on again, but at a new, bigger venue to make way for lots of exciting new stalls. Alongside the wonderful items created by the Hospital Auxiliary there will be local artisans also showcasing their wares. So if you're looking for that special one-of-a-kind gift for Christmas, then look no further. Shop local whilst supporting a wonderful cause.
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Nudge Nudge Wink Wink
description:
Dance under the stars with an eclectic and friendly crowd.

Musically, deep and blissed-out balearic beats, delicious dubs, left field excursions, oddball disco, soaring house and killer obscurities are all in the mix. Events tuned to making a real difference in the local communities.

Using collective artistic skills and community spirit, creating awareness and generating funding for Northern NSW and Gold Coast charities that help residents achieve a better quality of life. 

A diverse and inclusive vibe, connect with beautiful people, outdoor and indoor dance floor magic.   A beautiful old world country pub and garden.

An event with an incredible vibe and outcome with 10 percent of accumulated season profits donated to local charities.

title: Guided Walk of the Useful Plants Garden
description:
Guided Walk of Useful Plants Garden with Andreas at the Lismore Rainforest Botanic Gardens.

Learn about the many uses of subtropical rainforest plants for the First Nation's peoples for over 40,000 years and more recently for white settlers.

Meet at the Visitor's Centre at the Gardens. Enjoy an easy stroll on unpaved paths. Wear sturdy shoes and a hat.

Bookings are essential via email. Join the Friends for morning tea after the walk (Gold coin donation appreciated).
host: Lismore, Nimbin & Villages - Lismore City Council

title: Blues Brigade
description:
Join in for an unforgettable night of Blues and Brews at the Rest Point Hotel, Copmanhurst.

Featuring, Jesse Redwing, award-winning artist from Sydney, Zed Charles, the guitar-slaying talent from Queensland and Sonny James, our very own blues maestro, with Jack Burrito Music on drums.

Don’t miss this incredible lineup of talent. Great music and a great time awaits you. The bistro will be open serving delicious meals from 6pm.

title: Dis-Co Ball
description: Get your grooves ready and back on the dance floor for the ultimate inclusive dance party! Join the annual Disability Community (Dis-Co) Ball where everybody and ability is welcome to shake it, break it and strut it on and off the stage. Dis-Co Ball brings together artists from across Sprung’s programs to perform and lead a celebration of difference.

title: Shadows of Resilience - Art Exhibition
description:
Lauren Hotson’s work, created on Bundjalung country, is inspired by the fragile resilience of the natural world. Her journey with clay, which began in childhood, has been shaped by global experiences in community studios, an internship in Bali, and residencies in Japan and Italy. These influences breathe life into her pieces, reflecting the delicate interplay of light and shadow in nature.

Her latest collection features hand-formed vessels and intricate botanical arrangements, adorned with seeds, petals, and vine-like details that evoke untamed natural beauty. The muted tones of unglazed black and white clay emphasize raw authenticity.

This exhibition contemplates the cyclical nature of life, exploring the strength found in fragility and the balance between humanity and nature. Hotson invites viewers to uncover the resilience hidden in shadows, celebrating nature's capacity for renewal amidst adversity.

title: Matsuri Japan Byron Bay
description:
Enjoy the afternoon and evening in this entry-free annual community event that introduces unique Japanese cultural experiences since 2017.

Bring your picnic mat! Enjoy the beach breeze at an outdoor picnic dinner. YATAI Asian street foods will be served under the lantern, and live Japanese music and entertainment will be provided. Many stalls will sell Japanese goods, including kimonos. 

From the powerful beats of the taiko drums to the intricate craft workshops, this event has something for everyone. Enjoy traditional performances, bon-dance, craft workshops, and kids' games—all with a Japanese twist.

The highlight of this year is the Surf Club Beer Garden.

title: Zoonoses - Polyester Plate Lithography Workshop
description:
Join Nicola for this immersive workshop at the Gallery. 

Through drawing and lithography, Nicola uses fairy-tale iconology and rhymes to explore concepts surrounding zoonoses (animal diseases that can infect humans). 

In this workshop you will draw an image onto a polyester plate, then spread a coating of gum arabic over the finished drawing using a sponge, gently wipe off the gum, then roll up the plate with an oil based ink, place paper over the image and rub to transfer it, and finally wipe over and roll with ink to create more prints to take home. 

All materials will be supplied.

title: Yass Graveside Yarns
description:
Connect with the fascinating stories of early Yass Valley residents, such as explorer Hamilton Hume, pastoralist AB Triggs, and victims of the notorious William Munday.  Share in their triumphs, secrets, and scandals while strolling amongst their headstones.

This 90-minute guided walking tour, which earned NSW Parliament recognition in 2024, will be conducted by experienced volunteers from the Yass Valley History Centre.  It's an amazing opportunity to engage with local History in an unforgettable way.

Please note that the cemetery ground is uneven and unsuitable for strollers or people with mobility issuses.

title: Yass Railway Museum Artisan Markets
description:
Come and visit the artisan markets at the Yass Railway Museum for local produce, handmade crafts, food and drinks, on the last Sunday of the month (excluding winter seasons). Also take advantage of free museum entry. 

For vendor enquiries, please contact the Yass Railway Museum via email.

title: Yass Rodeo
description: Experience exciting country culture at the Yass rodeo.  You won't want to miss the thrilling events, including bull riding, barrel racing, team roping, and many other attractions!

title: Mudyala's 5th Birthday
description:
Come celebrate the 5th Birthday of Mudyala Aboriginal Corporation. Join in on the action-packed day of fun and festivities! 

There's an amazing lineup of activities to keep everyone entertained, activity stalls, waterslides, face painting, weaving, jewellery, rock climbing, giveaways, arts and crafts, games and a free barbeque lunch. 

Everyone is welcome to attend!

title: Mushroom Foraging Workshop - Lithgow
description:
Join professional forager Diego Bonetto as he takes you and your family on a forest walk, uncovering the details of where to look when to move and how to harvest edible mushrooms.

Part treasure hunt, part ecological awakening, this experience is like no other. The activity has been treasured for generations by the eastern European and Mediterranean cultures in Australia, making it a seasonal must-do to share stories and learn recipes.

Expect: a cheerful trip, a learning experience, an outing in the magical pine forest, and take home all the mushrooms that you find.

What to bring: suitable clothing and shoes, water and snacks, a knife and a basket and your camera.

What you will do: You will meet in Lithgow at 8:45 am and you will drive to the forest location together. 

They will provide a thorough tutorial on the what/how/where of mushroom foraging, you will visit 2/3 different locations, you will collect mushrooms and we will quality-control everyone’s harvest. 

You will then enjoy a barbeque tasting of fresh mushrooms fried in oil with garlic and served with parsley and artisan sourdough, in the forest.

Too many mushrooms to go home with? You will have a box each to bring home your lot!

title: Open Day at Historic Merryville Homestead
description:
Yass Red Cross Branch Presents and Open Garden at Historic Merryville Homestead.

Come along to Merryville Homestead and help support the Yass Red Cross.

Drive up the tree-lined driveway towards the stunning bluestone homestead and take in the stunning views of the extensive parkland gardens.

Bring a picnic or get something from the range of stalls which include light refreshments.

You can even bring your furry friends as long as they are on a leash.

title: History Cruise - Clarence River Ferries
description:
Enjoy an informative history tour while cruising the beautiful Clarence River.

Departing from Yamba and Iluka, the Scenic River cruises to Harwood are approximately a 30-kilometre round trip, approximately four-hour river cruise.

A variety of lunch options are available along with light refreshments and snacks, and there is a fully licensed bar on board.
​
Clarence River Ferries was formed in 1986. They operate a daily passenger service between the beautiful coastal towns of Yamba and Iluka on the mouth of the majestic Clarence River.

title: Drawing - A classical Atlelier course with expression
description:
This is the 2nd in the series presented by Sean Hutton.   This workshop is for participants that have no or some experience in Atlelier drawing.

Sean will be taking participants on a journey of expressive drawing using the traditional atelier method dating back to the old masters.

In this course we will cover principals of proportion, line and gesture, and tone. Friday 21st is for new participants that have no experience of Atlelier drawing (or want to continue with getting the basics right).  The 2nd day will include participants from day 1 and previous participants continuing to explore different still life set-ups. Day 3 will explore the world of portraiture through studies of the skull and head using methods shown in previous days.

This is a hands-on practical workshop, with demonstrations to illustrate the various topics.  These learned skills will assist in any art practice.

They will be working with charcoal on paper which will give the opportunity for everyone to express their individual character.

Check out Sean's  work in the portrait gallery ACT

title: Christmas Edition Wollemi Artisan Markets
description:
Come to the Cultural Centre to stock up on local products made by their creative community. Eat delicious treats from a selection of food vendors and the Gallery Café, find special Christmas gifts for your loved ones and support local makers.

To celebrate the exhibition SIXTY: The Journal of Australian Ceramics 60th Anniversary 1962–2022, the Blue Mountains Cultural Centre will be hosting a special ceramics edition of the Wollemi Artisan Markets with a focus on local ceramics artisans.

This is a free event.

title: SIXTY: The Journal of Australian Ceramics 60th Anniversary 1962–2022
description:
SIXTY: The Journal of Australian Ceramics 60th Anniversary 1962–2022 is a special Australian Design Centre On Tour exhibition project presented in partnership with The Australian Ceramics Association to acknowledge this significant anniversary.

The Journal of Australian Ceramics (JAC) has, over its sixty years of print publication, presented the history of ceramics in Australia. It has acknowledged the achievements of so many in that time, as well as educating readers on the importance and position of ceramics within Australian art. The JAC has been at the forefront of addressing significant issues of the time and, in turn, is a dynamic source of contemporary history.

Over the sixty-year history of The JAC what has unified the thousands of artists is their sense of community, as well as the generosity in passing on skills and knowledge to their fellow artists and for the next generation of makers. 

Its a fundamental time in contemporary ceramics. The significant interest in ceramic art is recognition of the accomplishments of Australia’s ceramic artists and potters and The JAC and its contributors have played a key role in this revival.

This celebratory exhibition was guest curated by Anna Grigson and ADC’s Lisa Cahill with design by Studio Garbett and video by Jane Curtis.

title: New Acquisitions Exhibition
description:
Every year the Blue Mountains Cultural Centre Fine Art Collection grows through donations and purchases. The most recent acquisitions include works by: Vicky Browne, Bette Mifsud, Peachey and Mosig, Michael Shirley, Anne Smith, and Leanne Tobin. 

A Blue Mountains City Art Gallery exhibition.

title: River Sounds Festival
description:
River Sounds is a three day, licenced and all ages music festival located in the eclectic village of Bellingen NSW. Comprising of a diverse line up of high profile, emerging and First Nation artists, plus an an extensive array of craft food and beverage offerings.​

For more festival details head to the website.

River Sounds is held on the traditional lands of the Gumbaynggirr people. Paying respect to the Elders of these traditional lands – past, present and emerging - and, through them, to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

title: Bellingen Shire Arts Trail
description:
The Bellingen Shire Arts Trail Weekend presents a wonderful opportunity to explore the beautiful Bellingen Shire whilst meeting and talking to the creative people who make the Bellingen Shire such an inspiring place.

This year’s trail presents a captivating journey through 36 open studios, galleries and shared spaces, showcasing the diverse talents of over 70 local artists and craftspeople. From Dundurrabin and Dorrigo, down to Bellingen and Raleigh, and on to the coast to Urunga and Hungry Head, artists will open their doors for a glimpse into their artistic processes. Visitors have the opportunity to discover emerging talents, meet established artists, and buy directly from the source.

A diverse range of mediums including painting, sculpture, jewellery, wood, weaving, photography, print-making, ceramics and mosaics will be on display. The Bellingen Shire Arts Trail website (bellingenshireartstrail.com) is the ultimate resource for discovering participating artists, studio and gallery locations. There are also printed brochures that have been distributed across the Shire.

Please see the website for further details.

title: Bellingen Shire Arts Trail Weekend
description:
The much anticipated second Bellingen Shire Arts Trail Weekend is back, bringing a vibrant celebration of creativity to the region. The Bellingen Shire Arts Trail Weekend presents a wonderful opportunity to explore the beautiful Bellingen Shire whilst meeting and talking to the creative people who make the Shire such an inspiring place.

This year’s trail presents a captivating journey through 37 open studios, galleries and shared spaces, showcasing the diverse talents of over 70 local artists and craftspeople. From Dundurrabin and Dorrigo, down to Bellingen and Raleigh, and on to the coast to Urunga and Hungry Head, artists will open their doors for a glimpse into their artistic processes. Visitors have the opportunity to discover emerging talents, meet established artists, and buy directly from the source.

A diverse range of mediums including painting, sculpture, jewellery, wood, weaving, photography, print-making, ceramics and mosaics will be on display. The Bellingen Shire Arts Trail website (bellingenshireartstrail.com) is the ultimate resource for discovering participating artists, studio and gallery locations. There are also printed brochures that have been distributed across the Shire.

title: Burrata, Butter and Bubbles Class
description:
Burrata is a perfect blend of textures. A soft mozzarella shell, encasing a beautiful creamy centre of mozzarella strings and cream or, in this class, homemade mascarpone. 

Learn to weave and pull the pliable curd till it is silky smooth then form it into a soft pouch before filling it with the stretched curd mixture then sealing the top to form a cheese money bag.

The burrata, once made will be enjoyed with crusty bread, tomatoes and basil when in season and served with a complimentary glass of bubbles.

Then you will create cultured butter made from fresh cream. Some on the butter you will flavour with either garlic, chives or other herbs from the garden, or a little truffle when available or in season.

After you have created the delicious burrata you will have time to relax and enjoy your bubbles and cheese.

title: Alpaca Experience
description:
Madison's Mountain Retreat is a peaceful farm stay in Kurrajong Heights, on acres bordering the Wollemi and Blue Mountains National Parks. Madison's is about an hour from the Sydney CBD.

Hand feed the animals at the paddock and learn some interesting facts about Alpacas from the knowledgeable staff.

title: Coffs Harbour Craft Carnival
description:
The Coffs Harbour Surf Life Saving Club is hosting the 2024 Craft Carnival, with an impressive cast of over 500 competitors, 50 officials and 1,000 enthusiastic spectators all gearing up for the event. 

Races in ski, board, swim and iron persons will be conducted at Park beach on the sand and in the ocean as part of Surf Life Saving's competition pathway. Racing will start early Saturday morning on the 23rd November. 

In conjunction with the World Ocean Series and The Summer of Surf 5000, the racing will see the best lifesaving athletes from interstate travel to Coffs Harbour for competition. Athletes from across New South Wales, Queensland and Victoria will be taking part.
host: Coffs Harbour Surf Life Saving Club

title: Bandon Grove School of Arts Hall Spring Market
description: A lively country market in and around an old rural Hall held seasonally with  a variety of stalls, fresh produce, craft, food and local entertainment.
host: Bandon Grove School of Arts Inc

title: End2End Festival
description:
The End2End Festival will delight the senses and tickle the tastebuds. Featuring multiple venues, over 15 of Hunter Valley Wine Country’s famous wineries, local gourmet food, live music, celebrity chefs, beef and big reds, Semillon and seafood, and boutique brews. 

Hop on and off the End2End shuttle bus at any of the venues through the day, relax with a glass of wine while listening to some tunes and indulge in decadent gourmet delights.

title: New South Wales Pride vs Canberra Chill - Hockey One League Goulburn
description:
NSW Pride will take on Canberra Chill in their Round Seven clash at the Goulburn Regional Hockey Centre. 

This match will be the first NSW Pride home match played in Goulburn and is set to be an action packed Sunday afternoon of high-quality Hockey with both the Men and Women playing back-to-back. 

This match is also their Pride in Pride match, showcasing an afternoon of inclusion and support to the LGBTQI+ community across the state.

The first game starts at 1:00pm, NSW Pride vs Canberra Chill Women. The second game is NSW Pride vs Canberra Chill Men at 2:30pm. 

NSW Pride are excited to offer a pre-match NSW Pride Hookin2Hockey clinic for children aged five to 12 years, starting at 11:30am.  To secure a place in this clinic you can purchase a clinic and ticket package with this one-hour clinic starting prior to the main matches, and is open to everyone (no Hockey equipment or skills required.)

Plus, the first 30 children registered will also receive a special on-ground experience for both the Men's and Women's matches. Register today to secure your ticket and extra money cannot buy experience.

title: Halloween Screening of The Rocky Horror Picture Show
description:
Join GPAC for a special late-night screening of the cult classic Rocky Horror Picture Show! Get dressed up and 'stay for the night' to do the Time Warp again!

Movie Synopsis: Sweethearts Brad and Janet, stuck with a flat tire during a storm, discover the eerie mansion of Dr. Frank-N-Furter, a transvestite scientist. As their innocence is lost, Brad and Janet meet a houseful of wild characters, including a rocking biker and a creepy butler. Through elaborate dances and rock songs, Frank-N-Furter unveils his latest creation: a muscular man named "Rocky."

Under license from Roadshow.

title: Paint and Sip Workshops in the Lower Blue Mountains
description:
Be playful, get the creative juices flowing and have some fun!

Come with an open mind and some friends to have a laugh with.

Master fantastic painting techniques, then it’s up to you to set sail and let your imagination take you! 

Artist, Corinne Loxton will guide and encourage you along the way so that by the end of the evening you’ll have a totally unique artwork to take home. You’ll be inspired to create a unique painting expressing your personality and vibe. 

Be prepared to be surprised and delighted by the end result!

At Corinne’s Workshop in the lower Blue Mountains.

Includes all materials, a glass of bubbly and nibbles

title: The Hawkesbury Country Christmas Market
description:
Experience the magic of the holiday season at Hawkesbury Country Christmas this November, a Christmas-themed boutique retail market held at Hawkesbury Racecourse from the team at Eat. Shop. Love. Markets & Events!

This festive event is a holiday shopper's paradise; discover unique and handmade products, stylish fashion, and festive decorations to make your gifts extra special this year. Indulge in delicious treats from a variety of food stalls and trucks alongside live music and kids entertainment, perfect for a day out with the family!

This market is free to attend for all customers.

title: Breathe by Debra Jurss
description:
Suki & Hugh Gallery will open an exhibition of new works in glass by Canberra-based artist Debra Jurss.

The exhibition entitled Breathe will be Jurss’ first with the gallery having worked together in a more limited capacity over many years.

Reflecting on the early days of the global COVID-19 outbreak, Jurss created an installation of glass face masks titled "First Fit Your Own." This work serves as a poignant reminder of government messaging around breathing, infused with a sense of fear and moral obligation. Echoing the familiar airline safety instructions to secure your own oxygen mask before assisting others, the installation explores how our individual actions and behaviours profoundly affected the fundamental act of breathing.

title: The Australian Bee Gees Show - 25th Anniversary Tour - Penrith
description:
Celebrating 9 years and over 2800 shows headlining on the Las Vegas strip, The Australian Bee Gees Show will be heading Down Under for the Australian leg of their 25th-anniversary tour!

The Australian Bee Gees Show is currently performing at The Excalibur Hotel and Casino and has been in residence for the past 9 years and have just signed a new 5-year contract that will keep the ABGShow headlining in Las Vegas until 2024. The group has racked up over 2800 performances on the Las Vegas Strip and was recently voted Best Tribute Show in Las Vegas by the prestigious Las Vegas Review Journal and has made the top 10 in the Overall Best Show category, an amazing achievement in Las Vegas. 

After 25 years on the world stage and over 8,000 performances in over 60 countries, The Australian Bee Gees Show has evolved to become the definitive live celebration of the wonderful music written by the Brothers Gibb.

From their first shows in 1996, The Australian Bee Gees Show has conquered Las Vegas and has played to capacity houses around the world, cementing their reputation as an exceptional live concert act and the world's leading Bee Gees Show.

title: Maitland’s True Crime Tour
description:
Small towns hold the biggest secrets, and Maitland, with its fair share of haunted streets nestled amongst its glorious old buildings, is no exception. Take a walk on the dark side and revisit the scenes of the crimes by retracing the steps of Maitland’s most infamous.

Be seduced by the murky world of the past and relive a time that proves that the truth is far stranger than fiction.

The tour will meet and begin at the seated area in front of the Maitland Train Station (Station Street side).

Limited spaces are available and bookings are essential.

title: Birds of a Feather- Twitcher Celebration
description:
Join a fun, feathered and fabulous night to celebrate this amazing summer exhibition, Twitcher! Bop away to some sweet 80’s tunes with DJ Pucko (think Prince’s When Doves Cry), and get your feathers on in this bird-inspired workshop, all while taking in the work of some of Australia’s most celebrated bird-loving artists.

Featuring artists Abdul-Rahman Abdullah, Michelle Cawthorn, Tracey Deep, Philip Drummond, Mandy Francis, Todd Fuller, Anna-Wili Highfield, Martin King, Nigel Milsom, Leila Jeffreys x Melvin J. Montalban, Ginger Riley Munduwalawala, Nyangulya Katie Nalgood, Meagan Pelham, Hermannsburg Potters, Ben Quilty, Michael Riley, Joan Ross, Peter Speight, Bridie Watt, Trevor Weekes, Clare Weeks and Brett Whiteley

title: A League Womens - Newcastle Jets v Adelaide United
description:
Get ready Jets fans, Newcastle Jets are bringing the A League Women’s team action to Maitland, with four home games to be held at Maitland Regional Sportsground.

This match will feature the excitement of Newcastle Jets v Adelaide United.

Join in for the action and cheer along with your favourite team. Food stalls and other entertainment will also be available.

title: A League Womens - Newcastle Jets v Brisbane Roar
description:
Get ready Jets fans, Newcastle Jets are bringing the A League Women’s team action to Maitland with four home games to be held at Maitland Regional Sportsground.

This match will feature the excitement of Newcastle Jets v Brisbane Roar.

Join in for the action and cheer along with your favourite team. Food stalls and other entertainment will also be available. 

Stay tuned to secure your tickets soon.

title: More NRG Music Festival
description:
Come to Maitland Showground this February to experience Newcastle's first three stage House and Techno Festival. The More NRG Music and Arts Festival will be an intimate gathering to explore the possibilities of electronic music, dance and the visual arts.

International headlines across the house and techno realm will perform over three stages. Experience the works of Dr Rubinstein, Helena Hauff, Ryan Elliot, Haai, Pariah, DJ HMC, and Claire Morgan, plus much more.

This is a licensed and strictly over 18's event.

title: Tender by Melinda Schneider
description: The Nulla Nulla Regional Gallery will be hosting the Melinda Schneider 'Tender' Art exhibition. Melinda Schneider is a celebrated Australian country musician, who has released 14 albums and won six Country Music Association Golden Guitar awards.

title: Mushroom Foraging Workshop - Southern Highlands
description:
Join professional forager Diego Bonetto as he takes you and your family on a forest walk, uncovering the details of where to look, when to move and how to harvest edible mushrooms.

Part treasure hunt, part ecological awakening, this experience is like no other. The activity has been treasured for generations by the eastern European and Mediterranean cultures in Australia, making it a seasonal must-do to share stories and learn recipes.

Expect a cheerful trip, a learning experience, an outing in the magical pine forest, and take home all the mushrooms that you find.

The workshop is in Penrose State Forest. You host will provide a thorough tutorial on the what, how, where of mushroom foraging and visit two to three different locations. You will collect mushrooms and Diego will quality control everyone’s harvest.

Plenty of chances to take pictures and selfies in the forest while there will be a tasting of fresh mushrooms fried in oil with garlic and served with parsley on artisan sourdough.

Too many mushrooms to go home with? Diego will have plenty of boxes to bring home your harvest!

title: The National Diesel, Dirt and Turf Expo
description:
The National Diesel Dirt and Turf Expo is a free family-friendly event designed for the earthmoving industry to update their knowledge of the latest equipment, technology and services.

The Expo is managed by representatives of the Australian earthmoving equipment industry, to help construction contractors keep informed about the latest advances to boost their productivity and safety. Still, there is so much more on offer for those not in the industry. 

The National Diesel Dirt and Turf Expo are committed to bringing you the biggest range of earthmoving machinery earthmoving attachments, trucks, trailers, bikes, utility vehicles, earthworks tools, agricultural machinery, mowing equipment and much more.

With food trucks, stalls, entertainment and free entry, it's a great day out for the family.
host: Blacktown Visitor Information and Heritage Centre

title: Let’s talk community workers
description:
Time                              9.30am to 12pm

Accessibility             Onsite Parking (including accessible parking) is available

Cost                               Free

This forum is for local Hunter community workers to tell us about emerging issues in their communities. There will also be an opportunity for workers to engage with invited agencies such as: Seniors Rights Service, Revenue NSW, SafeWork NSW, Services Australia, Australian Securities and Investment Commission, Service NSW and Births, Deaths and Marriages.

title: Let’s talk incorporated associations
description:
Time                       6pm to 7.30pm

Accessibility       Onsite Parking (including accessible parking) is available

Cost                       Free

Incorporated Associations are invited to hear from NSW Fair Trading about the legal requirements for running an Incorporated Association. The information session will include information on the model constitution and management committee responsibilities.

title: Let’s talk retirement village living
description:
Time                              1.00pm to 2.30pm

Accessibility             Onsite Parking (including accessible parking) is available

Cost                               Free

Hunter Retirement Village Operators and residents are invited to attend our information session on rights and responsibilities of operators and residents living in a Retirement Village.

title: Let’s talk building and construction
description:
Time                     7.30am to 9.30am  

Accessibility    Onsite Parking (including accessible parking) is available    

Cost                      Free

Join us to hear all about SafeWork initiatives and targets for 2023, specifically targeting working at heights and silica.

This event is an opportunity for you to connect with SafeWork NSW on initiatives and regulation changes that will affect the construction industry.

From 1 January 2024, the NSW Government will require PCBUs to provide audiometric testing to workers who are frequently required to use personal protective equipment (hearing protection) at work to prevent hearing loss.

One of the focus areas of NSW Fair Trading in 2023 is to ensure that regulation is efficient and fair for the people of New South Wales, including in the building and construction area.
This means reducing consumer risks associated with the building industry as well as having efficient internal complaints processes.

The Customer Experience and Program Delivery team of NSW Fair Trading is interested in understanding the experience of people involved in home building related complaints to NSW Fair Trading and hear how it could be improved.

title: Camden Christmas Festival
description:
Camden Christmas Festival is back in 2024! 

This much loved, free community event will include a range of fun activities for the whole family to enjoy. The program will include live entertainment, Christmas market stalls, food and drink vendors, family friendly amusement rides, Christmas themed activities and more!

There will also a very special guest visit from Santa and his helper.

title: The Killer Queen Experience - Galston
description:
Formed in 2003, The Killer Queen Experience has risen from a local Brisbane-based Queen cover band to an international touring show and is Australia’s most sought-after tribute act today. Meeting Queen in 2020 is the highlight of their career!

Killer Queen has taken their show across the globe, including the UK, Norway, Singapore and India. In May 2019, Killer Queen performed in Russia for the first time. They have also shared the bill with the likes of Jeff Beck, Foreigner, Journey, Twisted Sister, Thin Lizzy and Kelly Rowland. 

John Blunt’s (lead singer) resemblance to Freddie Mercury is uncanny, appearing live to 7 million viewers on the French TV show “Qui Sera Le Meilleur Sosie? -  Who will be the best impersonator” and John was chosen by UK’s ITV Channel 5 for the docu/drama “The Freddie Mercury Story – Who Wants to Live Forever”, a detailed look into the personal life and death of Freddie Mercury, screening in the UK, Europe and North America in 2016.

This two-hour live show consists of all Queen's Greatest Hits (and stage costumes), including Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Somebody to Love, Radio Ga Ga, Another One Bites the Dust and many more.

This will be an unforgettable Killer Queen Experience!

title: Annual Bredbo Sheep Dog Trials
description:
This is grazier country so dog trials are part of the scene. 

Held over three days there are a number of categories from novice through to open championships. 

Come and experience a taste of country life and watch the skills of owner and dog as they work amongst the sheep.

Bring your chairs, picnic and enjoy the free entertainment and watch some of the best sheep dogs in the country.

title: Mona Presents Zodiac with Alessandra Garosi, Adam Simmons, David Jones
description:
Innovative, improvisatory works from Santini and Stockhausen (plus other pieces) for piano, woodwind and percussion, inspired by humanity’s fascination with the stars and the signs we see in them. 

The Wine Bar between set times for those who want to grab a snack or drink between the museum closing and the show doors opening.

title: Kitty Flanagan LIVE
description:
You’ve seen her on Fisk, Utopia and Have You Been Paying Attention. She also wrote the best-selling book, 488 Rules for Life but now it’s time for Kitty to get back where she belongs. 

On the stage, doing stand-up. Kitty Flanagan Live is her brand new show full of hard laughs, good times, handy hints and a catchy little tune about underpants.

title: Cedar Newman & Rio Xiang | St Jude's Bowral
description:
Cedar Rose violin and Rio Xiang piano present

C. Franck Sonata for Violin and Piano
M.Ravel Sonata for Violin and Piano

Entry by donation.

Sonata repertoire draws two instruments and multiple voices into a rich dialogue. Invariably, there are passages where one instrument leads; this holds for most conversations. Like good conversation, sensitive listening shapes the quality of the musical response. 

A recently formed duo, Rio and Cedar, share a musical heritage that gives them great joy in performing sonata repertoire together. Rio has been a long-term student of Natalia Ricci, and Cedar studied piano with Gian-Franco Ricci for eight years. These relationships have nurtured the beauty of communicating stories and emotional landscapes through music. 

Rio has won numerous international accolades for his piano performances, including appearances as a soloist with multiple orchestras in Asia, the United States, and Australia. He recently placed second in the 2024 Australian National Piano Awards and is an accomplished composer. Cedar studies at the Manhattan School of Music with Prof. Lucie Robert and is grateful to be supported by the President's Scholarship. Cedar has performed as a soloist in Australia, North America, and Europe. She was recently awarded the Troussov Award at the Engers Academy in Frankfurt, Germany.

title: Bundanoon Highland Gathering  - "Bundanoon is Brigadoon"
description:
The 44th Annual Highland Gathering!

The annual event has evolved from its 1978 origins into a cornerstone tradition. 

From its humble beginnings of a handful of pipe bands and spectators, is now recognised worldwide and has grown into one of the finest Highland Gatherings in Australia 

"Bundanoon is Brigadoon" continues to flourish and as the gathering is a non-profit, directing AUD1.5 Million toward local causes.

The vibrant street parade features 25 Pipe Bands, Clans, and Floats.

The Oval hosts a massed pipes and drums display, Scottish Country Dancing and Scottish Highland Dancing, individual Pipe Band performances and an Opening Ceremony led by the Chieftain of the Day.

The Southern Highlands Kennel and Obedience Club will be in attendance while the Fiddlers Tent beckons with lively tunes and captivating performances.  The Bonnie Bairns competition is designed for children under five while grannies' storytelling tent and an array of both traditional and non-traditional children's games ensures a joyful experience for all ages.

The Kilted Dash infuses athleticism and humour, while the Australian Highland Heavy Weight Championship crowns the champion after five demanding events. The mighty Kilted Warriors take on the Bundanoon Stones, epitomizing strength and tradition.

And to conclude the event, the Massed Pipes and Drums finale, accompanied by the haunting melody of the Lone Piper, will provide a stirring and unforgettable conclusion to the celebration.
host: Bundanoon Highland Gathering Inc. (Bundanoon Is Brigadoon)

title: Nath Valvo - Live!
description:
The Art House presents Nath Valvo Live! 

This gay can't throw a ball - but he can do comedy. 

Nath is recently married, recently 40 and still renting. How embarrassing. 

Fresh from the invite-only Montreal comedy festival, sell out shows across the country and clocking over 12 million views on tiktok - you’d be silly to miss this one.

title: The Best of Arj Barker: Power Hour
description:
What do you get when you take your very best jokes from over the last 30 years, lovingly restore, refine, and remaster each one, jam them all into a single hour, and finally, sprinkle in some brand-new material and hint of improv? You get the best of Arj Barker.

Also known as...

Power Hour.

All kill no fill!
host: THE ART HOUSE WYONG SHIRE PERFORMING ARTS AND CONFERENCE CENTRE LIMITED

title: Let's Talk Western Sydney - Incorporated associations seminar
description:
NSW Fair Trading is bringing the Let’s Talk Roadshow to Western Sydney and hosting a series of community engagement events. This seminar covers what you need to know when running an incorporated association. 

If you're a public officer or a committee member of an incorporated association, join us to hear about types of association meetings, financial reporting, resolving disputes and more.

Register now

title: Let's Talk Western Sydney -  Scams awareness and fire safety in the home
description:
NSW Fair Trading is bringing the Let’s Talk Roadshow to Western Sydney and hosting a series of community engagement events.

Join us for a special talk and afternoon tea for over-55s, where we’ll cover:

How to identify scams and stay safe – National Anti-Scam Centre

Hear from Scamwatch on how to recognise scams and protect yourself. They’ll share real-life examples, so you know what to look out for and what steps to take if you are affected. Find out more about key Government initiatives aimed at making Australia safer and more secure from scammers.

Fire safety in the home – Fire & Rescue NSW

Fire & Rescue NSW will share practical tips to help keep your home safe from fire. Learn how to prevent common household fires and get important advice on safely using and storing lithium-ion batteries.

Register now

title: NSW Fair Trading Renting and Strata Forum
description:
NSW Fair Trading is bringing the Let’s Talk Roadshow to Western Sydney and hosting a series of community engagement events. If you’re a community service worker, join us to hear about the new rental and strata laws and get helpful resources to help your clients.

Renting and Strata Forum

Join us to hear from the NSW Rental Commissioner, Trina Jones, NSW Strata & Property Services Commissioner, Angus Abadee, and CEO of the Tenants' Union of NSW, Leo Patterson Ross. Engage with experts, network with peers from your local area, and participate in a Q&A session to address any challenges or issues raised by your clients.

Find out more information and register at the event website.

title: Sydney Investigation Ghost Hunt Tours
description:
Are you ready for an exciting spooky adventure in Campbelltown? Join the amazing Jen and Jeanette from the team at S.I.G.H.T as they take you on a mini investigation inside one of Campbelltown’s most haunted buildings. Your tour includes proper investigation, psychic protection, use of paranormal equipment as well as hot and cold non-alcoholic beverages.

Only for brave adults 18 years of age or over and no alcohol is allowed prior to or during the investigation. Wear comfortable shoes and bring a small torch with you.

The spookiness starts in the Koshigaya Park parking area and then continues to Quondong Cottage. Home of the Campbelltown Visitor Information Centre. Best of all, they are Covid-Safe.

Book now via phone or Facebook... if you dare!

title: Spilt Milk House Party - Newcastle
description:
Nothing tops a good house party. Ignite the group chat and drop the addy, because Spilt Milk is having a House Party and bringing Troye Sivan, Glass Animals, G Flip, Artemas and Sycco to Perth, Gold Coast and Newcastle this November. 

Don’t miss out — spots are limited!

title: CraftAlive
description:
CraftAlive Newcastle is a significant event in the craft calendar. It’s packed full of high-profile craft designers and retailers from across the country.
 
A hands-on experience with classes running all 3 days, beginners’ classes available as well as more technical classes.

Now in it’s 33rd year CraftAlive is Australia’s largest craft event series. The event will draw thousands of craft enthusiasts from across the state and all generations. Retailers feature craft supplies, kits and equipment.

title: Dobell Drawing Prize 23
description:
A National Art School Touring Exhibition

The biennial Dobell Drawing Prize is Australia’s leading prize for drawing, an unparalleled celebration of technique, innovation and expanded drawing practices. The AUD30,000 acquisitive prize is presented by the National Art School in partnership with the Sir William Dobell Art Foundation and explores the enduring importance of drawing within contemporary art practice. The winning work will enter the National Art School’s significant collection, built over the past 120 years.


Image: Lori Pensini, Chatterbox Fortune Tellers - The Rare Bird Extinction Series #2, 2022, pencil and ink on paper, 10 x 50cm. Courtesy of the artist and Gallerysmith, Melbourne.

title: Central Coast Watercolour Society Easter Exhibition
description:
The Central Coast Watercolour Society is showcasing the unique translucency of watercolour in a wide range of styles and subject matter at its 2023 Easter Exhibition.

They invite you to visit and enjoy the work of their talented Central Coast artists and the magnificent display of original watercolour paintings. 

Local award-winning artist Susie Linigen is their featured artist, she has generously donated the raffle prize “Maggie Pair”. 

Working solely in watercolour, Susie’s art shows her love of the light in watercolour, with translucent blending colours. She is a member of Central Coast Watercolour, Central Coast Art, Ku-ring-gai Art and Toukley Art Societies. She regularly exhibits both locally on the Central Coast and throughout New South Wales.

title: Vision String Quartet  | Musica Viva Australia
Le Carnivale Dinner Cabaret
description:
Bettie Bang Bang presents Le Carnivale!

Whisk yourself away on a magical evening of burlesque, circus, drag and wonderful oddities within the stunning walls of Bartholomew's. Featuring both local and interstate performers, Le Carnivale is a journey into dreams of old, where burlesque beauties sparkle, aerialists elegantly dangle from suspended hoops, circus tricks leave you in awe and drag artists entertain and delight!

All are welcome at Le Carnivale, step right up and treat yourself to the magical, the fantastical and the truly wonderful!

This is a dinner and cabaret show with 2 hours of entertainment included.

title: Breast Cancer Trials Online Q&A: Side Effects of Treatment
description:
Breast Cancer Trials are holding a free and online Q&A, moderated by Author and Journalist Annabel Crabb, the topic will be the side effects of breast cancer treatment. 

It will be exploring research that’s aimed at improving treatments that have less side effects, strategies to manage side effects both during and after treatment, and we’ll hear personal stories and advice from those who have a breast cancer experience.

title: Indigenous heritage guided bush tucker walk & presentation
description:
Come along for an Indigenous heritage presentation and guided walk through the Ku-ring-gai Wildflower Garden presented by the Aboriginal Heritage Office as part of the Gai-mariagal Festival. Learn about how Aboriginal people lived, Aboriginal figures of the area, bush tucker, tools, weapons and shelter.

You will also learn about the colonisation and changes it brought to the environment and country.

Morning tea will be provided.

title: Rhodes Christmas Festival
description: A festive celebration in the heart of Rhodes, offering stallholders the chance to reach a large and diverse crowd. Join a day of festive fun!

title: Braidwood Airing of the Quilts
description:
The annual Braidwood Airing of the Quilts returns to Braidwood over two days for a celebration of quilting, craft and the historical village of Braidwood. 

Quilts from all genres will be hung from the historic town’s 19th-century verandahs on both days, along with a two-day Exhibition and Quilt Competition hosted by the Braidwood Quilters which will be held in the National Theatre on Wallace Street. 

The indoor quilt competition will see approximately 85 quilts of varying styles, while the outdoor display will showcase quilts both upstairs and downstairs of the heritage buildings on the main street. 

The Braidwood Quilt Store will be running its annual Airing of the Quilts Challenge, encouraging people to create an imaginative apron in a medium of their choosing, to be exhibited during the festival. 

The festival will also feature markets again in the beautiful Ryrie Park, festive cakes and puddings as well as the launch of Braidwood Garlic 2024.

You'll also find arts and crafts displays and sales in a number of the shops along the main street, such as fYREGALLERY, V&M, Gallery 103, Braidwood Clayworks and Born Vintage, as well as The Braidwood Quilt Store which has a curated collection of over 3,000 quilting fabrics on offer.
host: THE BRAIDWOOD QUILT STORE PTY LTD

title: Buena Vista Social Club Tribute Show
description:
Tribute night with 10 piece band

For the first time at The Avoca Beach Theatre, a very special evening to celebrate the groundbreaking ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ albums and artists.

This will be an unforgettable performance of traditional Cuban music with a 10-piece Sydney-based band comprised of some of Australia’s best Latin music musicians.

Following sellout shows in Sydney and Melbourne in 2022, 2023 & 2024 the ‘Buena Vista Social Club tribute’ will bring to the Avoca theatre a very special tribute night featuring well-known songs from the Cuban ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ artists, Ibrahim Ferrer, Compay Segundo, Ruben Gonzalez, Omara Portuondo and Eliades Ochoa.

Formed in 1996 ‘The Buena Vista Social Club’ was a musical ensemble made up of older Cuban musicians. The group’s eponymous studio album was released in 1997, quickly becoming an international success. A ‘Buena Vista Social Club’ documentary was released in 1999 to critical acclaim.

The success of both the album and film sparked a world wide revival of interest in traditional Cuban music.

‘The Buena Vista Social Club tribute’ night will be a memorable experience

Re-creating the authentic sounds of traditional Cuban music and paying tribute to these Cuban music legends.

title: A Farewell To Doris - Melinda Schneider Doris Day Tribute
description:
Following the successful capital city seasons, Melinda created a concert production of the show, Melinda Does Doris: A Tribute to Doris Day, which has toured to appreciative audiences in cities and towns all around Australia.n October 2016, Melinda released a second Doris album, Melinda Does Doris … Again – The Movie Songs. And in June 2017, she teamed up with Tom Burlinson for another sold-out performance at the Sydney Opera House Concert Hall as well as at Melbourne and Brisbane, celebrating the hits of Doris Day and Frank Sinatra in a show called Young At Heart.

Melinda is saddened by Doris’ passing, but proud to present A Farewell To Doris, knowing that Doris’ work will continue to bring joy to audiences of all ages. “Doris was multi-talented, a true triple threat: a world-class singer, dancer and actor.
