But it is her beautiful spirit that will stay with me. Doris was so likeable and exuded such sincerity and joy and all that is good. There will never be another like her”

title: The Australian Barbra Streisand Show
description:
Happy days are here again! In an homage to the show stopping six-decade long career, Rachael Grace presents ‘The Australian Barbra Streisand Show'.

Performing songs from the sensational catalogue of Streisand’s classic films, musicals and hit records ‘The Australian Barbra Show’ honors the endless talent and legacy of this icon of musical royalty. Featuring hits from ‘Funny Girl’ ‘The Way We Were’ ‘A Star is Born’ and many more. 

A stellar line up band with Musical Direction by the incredible John Thorn. 

For a fun and playful night of multi-genre’d excellence, Book Now! What Kind of Fool Would Miss This?

title: Melinda Schneider: A Farewell To Doris Day - Avoca Beach
description:
Melinda Schneider returns to the stage in 2024 to pay tribute to the legendary Doris Day.
The world lost one of its biggest stars with the passing of Doris Day. A legend of stage, screen and song, Doris died aged 97, leaving behind an incredible body of work, including iconic movies and unforgettable songs.

Doris Day “the girl next door”, had millions of fans around the world, none bigger than chart-topping Australian singer songwriter Melinda Schneider, who has recorded two albums of Doris’ songs, co-written and starred in a theatre show based on Doris’ life, and done sell-out tours celebrating Doris’ work. 

Melinda Schneider’s, A Farewell To Doris, is a heartfelt tribute to Doris Day. This nostalgic concert celebration will include such timeless hits as Que Sera, Sera, Sentimental Journey, Everybody Loves a Lover  and Secret Love plus classic songs from the movies Calamity Jane, Love Me or Leave Me and The Pajama Game, as well as a number of Doris’ big band standards.

title: Wonder Mama's Drink and Draw
description:
Spend the evening filled with wine, laughter, creativity and more at superhero drag queen The Fabulous Wonder Mama's drawing class in Sydney! Bring along your friends and learn to draw in a few simple steps.

In this class, you'll get the chance to sit back and relax with a drink as you learn to draw with Oil Pastels from part-time superhero, Glambassador and experienced artist, the Fabulous Wonder Mama. Having published three storybooks books and over 20 years of experience in art and design - Wonder Mama will share some of her best tips and tricks to drawing quality artworks every time!

Get inspired as you learn to draw using oil pastels on black paper and canvas. Wonder Mama will guide you through some simple exercises and then you'll get started on a fun final project. 

Drink and draw the night away at this fantastic drawing workshop!

This is a beginner-friendly class with room for more experienced students to use their skills too. All art materials supplied that you get to keep.

Just bring your choice of nibbles and drinks (dependant on venue) and wear something fun and fabulous!

This is an adult class run by a drag queen, there may be adult themes. This class is not recommended for anyone under 18 years. 
Classes for younger students can be arranged.

title: Round She Goes Women's Fashion Market
description:
Round She Goes is Sydney's favourite market for women’s preloved and vintage fashion.

The market features over 50 handpicked stallholders who will be selling women's preloved designer fashion, quality vintage and retro fashion, handmade jewellery and accessories.

But you only get one chance to rummage these stalls! 

Round up your lady pals, and don't miss this affordable and very fun girls day out!

title: Arj Barker – Power Hour
description:
What do you get when you take your very best jokes from over the last 30 years, lovingly restore, refine, and remaster each one, jam them all into a single hour, and finally, sprinkle in some brand-new material and hint of improv?

You get the best of Arj Barker.

title: 12 Gold Bars - A Celebration of Status Quo - Sutherland
description:
This incredible group of musicians is dedicated to recreating the sound and energy of one of the most beloved bands of the 70s and 80s, and they're taking on Status Quo's legendary album 12 Gold Bars.

Featuring some of the most talented musicians and vocalists in the country including ex-Angels and Choirboys member James Morley, Pete Robinson from Russell Morris Band, along with Eddy Santacreu, and David Kirby from Queen Orchestrated, this group brings a level of professionalism and dedication to their craft that sets them apart from other cover bands. They've spent countless hours studying the intricate instrumental arrangements and harmonies that made Status Quo such a hit, and they're ready to deliver an unforgettable performance for fans old and new.

At their upcoming show, you can expect to hear every track from 12 Gold Bars, including hits like "Rockin' All Over The World" "Whatever You Want” ”Down Down” and "Caroline." The band's attention to detail is unmatched, from the faithful reproductions of the original songs to the signature guitar riffs that made Status Quo a household name.

title: Forged in Fire Workshop
description:
Forged In Fire Workshop, one-day hands-on experience.

Come spend a Saturday with them on this hands-on workshop, and go home with your very own hand forged results to show for it!

You will experience shaping steel with hammer and fire, as well as learn a bit about the forge, anvil, tools and techniques used when making a chef blade.
Included:
Blacksmithing overview: Tools, processes, safety briefing
All materials required (carbon steel, hammers, tongs, anvil, gas forge, PPE)
Forging your own project(s) with hammer and anvil
Quenching the blade in oil and grinding to your design
All instructions and support required

Please note: To send you home with something you can use in the kitchen for years to come in a single day  we attach a ready made wooden handle at the end of the day, you will not make the handle.

 Suitable For:
Anyone over 16 years old with an interest in blacksmithing
Anyone able to lift a one kilogram hammer over the head and hammer  'for a while' (they will help if you get tired).

The workshop will be held in the back yard of their location in Brookvale, Northern Beaches Sydney. This is an industrial setting outside, under roof with basic facilities.
host: The Trustee for Creative Man Trust

title: Blacksmithing Introduction Workshop
description:
Blacksmithing Introduction Workshop, one-day hands-on experience.

Come spend a Saturday with them on this practical introduction to Blacksmithing, and go home with your very own hand forged results to show for it!

You will experience shaping steel with hammer and fire, as well as learn a bit about the forge, anvil, tools and techniques used in blacksmithing.

Included:
Blacksmithing overview: Tools, processes, safety briefing
All materials required (carbon steel, hammers, tongs, anvil, gas forge, PPE)
Forging your own project(s) with hammer and anvil
All instructions and support required

Please note: This is not a knife making workshop but an introduction to blacksmithing and forging.

 Suitable For:
Anyone over 16 years old with an interest in blacksmithing
Anyone able to lift a one kilogram hammer over the head and hammer  'for a while' (they will help if you get tired).

The workshop will be held in the back yard of their location in Brookvale, Northern Beaches Sydney. This is an industrial setting outside, under roof with basic facilities.
host: The Trustee for Creative Man Trust

title: Madeleine Tuckfield-Carrano: Memory is Fiction
description:
With “Memory is Fiction" Madeleine Tuckfield-Carrano explores the intricate relationship between memory and narrative, delving into how recollections shape identities and perceptions of reality. Each piece serves as a reflection of the fluidity of memory, revealing how experiences can be reshaped, embellished, or entirely reimagined over time. 

This work challenges the notion of memory as a static archive, presenting it instead as a dynamic, living narrative—a blend of fact and fiction. By embroidering between the gaps and distortions in recollected memory, she creates sense of misremembered nostalgia.

title: Massive Murray Paddle
description:
The Massive Murray Paddle is back, bringing five days of exciting paddling action to the Murray River. Covering a challenging 415 kilometre stretch, this iconic adventure race supports local community-driven programs, making it a meaningful and memorable event for paddlers and spectators alike.

Each day, participants will travel between key river towns:

Day 1: Yarrawonga to Tocumwal
Day 2: Tocumwal to Picnic Point
Day 3: Picnic Point to Moama
Day 4: Moama to Torrumbarry
Day 5: Gunbower to Koondrook

Whether you’re following along in each town or catching a glimpse from the riverbanks, the Massive Murray Paddle offers a unique opportunity to witness dedicated paddlers in action while supporting local communities along the Murray.

title: Geraldine Hickey – Of Course We’ve Got Horses
description:
I have a new show filled with stories about acknowledging and enjoying my newfound privileges, like getting married and being able to buy a nice camera to take photos of birds. I’m very good at telling funny stories, it’s why I’ve won awards and can afford nice cameras and horses.

Okay the horses aren’t technically mine, they belong to Cath and one of them is a Pony. Although we are married, so what’s hers is mine now. I don’t actually know how to ride them or anything.

It will be a very joyful show.

As seen on Have You Been Paying Attention?.

Winner – Melbourne Comedy Festival Award, 2021

Winner – Piece of Wood Award, Melbourne Comedy Festival 2019

title: McGuffin Park
description: In the small Australian town of McGuffin Park, the local council is thrown into disarray when the mayor suddenly resigns a week before the mid-term election, despite being a shoo-in to keep his seat. When a self-proclaimed ‘sovereign citizen’ with an anti-government agenda is revealed as next in line for the top job, two friends step up and announce their rival candidacies. Complicated pasts, a meddling journalist and blackmail rumours push friendships to the limit – can they handle the mess of politics? Or will their friendship crumble under the pressure? Buckle up for a bumpy election ride!

title: Historic Lunch Cruise Aboard Oosterschelde
description:
Here’s a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make a difference while becoming part of history! This November, the Oosterschelde, one of the oldest tall ships in the world, will grace Sydney Harbour as part of the DARWIN200 global conservation initiative. This inspiring project features 200 future conservationists retracing Charles Darwin’s historic voyage to promote action for a better planet.

Join them for a lunch cruise aboard this historic vessel. Sixty guests will indulge in a cocktail-style lunch with a selection of beers, wines, and soft drinks while enjoying stunning views of Sydney’s iconic attractions. And you could be one of them!

Don’t miss this rare chance to experience maritime history in action aboard a ship that has navigated the oceans of the world. Book your tickets now!

title: Monsieur Camembert at Camelot!
description:
“Simply the best Gypsy band in the land!” (Sydney Morning Herald)

“A brazen and intoxicating blend of jazz, Gypsy Swing, Latin and East European influences – bring your Cossack boots and prepare to dance” (The Age)

With sensitivity, virtuosity, and extraordinary energy, Triple ARIA Award-winning Monsieur Camembert brilliantly weaves Gypsy music with other World Music styles, to create a truly original and intoxicating blend.

From Russian Gypsy songs to tango and klezmer, from Gypsy swing to Latin grooves... "they pick you up and carry you on a wave of energy, excitement and poignancy that never relents…the band play with such cohesion, energy and abandon that I experienced an emotion so foreign I barely recognised it: elation” (John Shand, Sydney Morning Herald).

Monsieur Camembert have received standing ovations around the globe, from the Montreux Jazz Festival to the International Leonard Cohen Festival. Come find out why!

title: Badu Gili: Wonder Women
description:
Badu Gili - meaning 'water light' in the language of the traditional owners of Bennelong Point, the Gadigal people - is a free daily experience that explores First Nations stories in a spectacular six-minute projection on the Sydney Opera House’s eastern Bennelong sails. 

Watch the sails illuminate with Badu Gili: Wonder Women, a new projection celebrating the work and stories of six female First Nations artists, created in collaboration between the Opera House and the Art Gallery of New South Wales, to mark the Gallery’s 150th anniversary.

The lighting of the sails takes place each day at the top of the Monumental Steps from sunset.

*Times are subject to change with the seasons and Forecourt events. Check the website for screening times.

title: The Gentleman Magician's Magical Soirée
description:
Sydney's Home of Magic

#2 on TripAdvisor, Top 60 Theatre & Performances (second only to Sydney Opera House). Now in its seventh year!

You are cordially invited to The Gentleman Magician’s Magical Soirée - an evening of storytelling magic for adults (but not necessarily grown-ups). Experience the enchantment at Sir Stamford at Circular Quay – one of Sydney’s most beautiful heritage buildings. 

Allow yourself to be transported to a place of wonderment reminiscent of the famous 19th-century European salons - with champagne and gourmet canapes on arrival. 

Includes champagne and canapes on arrival. Bookings essential. Dress Code: Smart Casual/Cocktail Dress.

title: TINA – The Tina Turner Musical
description:
TINA – The Tina Turner Musical is rollin’ into Sydney in May 2023. Direct from Broadway, this smash hit musical phenomenon is a celebration of an unstoppable woman who became the Queen of Rock n’ Roll.

With 37 award nominations including best new musical (Olivier Awards) and best musical (Tony Awards). This heart-pumping production is guaranteed to raise the roof at Theatre Royal Sydney

Featuring iconic songs including "Simply The Best" "What's Love Got To Do With It", and "Proud Mary", this story of joy, passion and resilience is as important now as ever.

Tina Turner didn’t just break the rules, she rewrote them and now you can experience her triumphant story live on stage

title: The Theory of Reality - The Universal Law of Everything
description:
The Unlocking Reality Workshop offers a unique experience where Buddhism intersects with science. Attendees will explore a transformative concept: the theory of reality. Throughout the event, participants will engage in practical experiments designed to test the validity of the Buddha’s teachings in their own lives.

This interactive workshop features a blend of informative talks, dynamic discussions, and hands-on experiments that allow visitors to delve into Buddhist philosophy and its connection to modern scientific principles.

The event will unfold with an arrival period followed by two workshop sessions separated by a break with refreshments.

About the Speakers:

Ven. Dr. Mahinda Thero is a highly ordained monk from Jethavanarama Monastery in Sri Lanka. With a background as a research scientist at the Australian National University, he dedicates his life to guiding individuals towards inner peace, addressing issues like stress, anxiety, and addiction through his teachings across Australia and New Zealand.

Ven. Bakkula Thero transitioned from a successful career as a computer engineer and semi-professional cricketer in the UK to embrace a life of purpose at Jethavanarama Monastery. His teachings emphasize achieving serenity and inner peace through the application of Buddhist philosophy.

title: Good Food & Wine Show Sydney Christmas Market
description:
Get ready to celebrate the festive season early at the Good Food & Wine Show Christmas Market! 

Come along to  Carriageworks in Sydney for three delicious days of good food, good wine, and good times. With over 150 talented producers offering an unmatched selection of handcrafted gifts and artisanal products, the market is your one-stop shop for all your holiday needs. 

Experience live cooking demonstrations from Australia’s top chefs in the Harvey Norman Festive Kitchen, sharing tips to elevate your festive entertaining. Sip, sample, and indulge in festive treats, from Christmas pudding to holiday cocktails, all while enjoying a lively atmosphere filled with festive tunes. 

The Good Food & Wine Show Christmas Market is your ultimate destination to discover unique gourmet ideas and find the perfect presents to impress your loved ones this Christmas.

title: Southeast Aboriginal Arts Market
description:
The Southeast Aboriginal Arts Market, curated by Wiradjuri and Kamilaroi artist Jonathan Jones, returns to Carriageworks on Gadigal Country this November, showcasing the creative diversity of Southeast Australian Aboriginal art.

Over two days, 32 independent Aboriginal artists and collectives will showcase thousands of traditional and contemporary artworks for sale, including ceramics, jewellery, weaving, carving, textiles, photography, painting, and prints. 

This is a unique opportunity to meet the artists and learn about Aboriginal cultures across NSW, ACT, Victoria, the Murray–Darling basin, and Tasmania, with 100% of proceeds going directly to the artists. 

In addition to the market, join a free public program of workshops and talks including: 

A walking tour with curator Jonathan Jones 
Cultural weaving and traditional leatherworking workshops 
A bush medicine demonstration 

Admission is free, but places for live events are limited—register early to secure your spot.

title: Mother's Day Opera High Tea
description:
Celebrate with Mum in style!  Discover a stunning hidden-Sydney venue and indulge in some of the opera world's most beautiful music.  

Opera Bites has partnered with The Castlereagh Boutique Hotel to bring you a sublime afternoon of the world's best loved opera complete with a decadent sparkling high tea.  As you step through the doors of this breath-taking heritage listed ballroom, you'll find yourself immersed in the world of operatic splendour.  

The Romance of Opera
Treat Mum on her special day with a luxurious event to remember! From the stunning chandeliers to the glass of sparkling on arrival, Mum will be pampered from the moment she steps through the doors of this beautiful heritage-listed grand dining room. Expect a unique experience to cherish with arias and ensembles from the world’s most adored operas brought to you in fully costumed splendour. You’ll be humming all the way home with favourites you’ll know and love from Turandot, Rigoletto, La Boheme, Don Giovanni, Carmen and more. From the breath-taking melodies of the Lakmé Duet to the soaring heights of Nessun Dorma and beyond, this is romantic opera at its very best.

Narrated in true Opera Bites style, this glamorous event is teamed up with a delicious sparkling high tea for an unforgettable afternoon of decadence.  Experience the sublime, right in the heart of Sydney.

title: Classic Conjuring: Magic At Its Close-Up Best
description:
Enjoy the best of close-up magic with Dr Taliesin, master magician and member of the famous Magic Circle (UK), as he presents Classic Conjuring. Dubbed “absolutely brill” at its premiere at the 2018 Edinburgh Festival Fringe, a sophisticated world of wonder awaits you and your friends, as coins are plucked from thin air, cards transform and the laws of physics suspended, all within reach of your own hand.
 
Presented amidst the old-world elegance of the Castlereagh Boutique Hotel in the heart of the Sydney CBD, experience Dr Taliesin's stylish freeform and highly interactive classic, contemporary and original close-up illusions, which delighted Australian audiences in its 2019 and 2020 seasons. Elegant and timeless, no two performances are the same, with spellbinding magic sure to leave you amused and amazed.

With more than a decade of research behind his close-up magic show, Classic Conjuring is the ideal way to mark a special occasion or simply to enjoy a night out with family and friends of all ages.		

Classic Conjuring is a parlour show with strictly limited seating. Bookings essential.

For more information and to book tickets visit the Official Website.

title: Urban Wine Walk Chippendale + Redfern
description:
The streets and laneways of Chippendale and Redfern will come alive this Spring as a line-up of the best venues transform into an Urban Cellar Door for you to visit on a self-guided trail.

Simply decide which venue you'd like to start from and you're off. Choose your own adventure as you and your friends move from venue to venue tasting delicious wines thanks to the incredible line-up of Australian winemakers.

Guaranteed to sell out, the Urban Wine Walk promises a fun and unique self-guided wine-tasting experience that you and your friends won't want to miss.

title: Resin Art Classes in Sydney
description:
Unleash your creativity at this unique Resin Art Workshop! 

This hands-on experience is designed for artists and enthusiasts of all levels who are eager to explore the enchanting world of epoxy resin art. Whether you're looking to pick up a new hobby or add to your artistic repertoire, this workshop is the perfect opportunity to create stunning, one-of-a-kind pieces.  

Learn from experienced resin artists who will guide you through the process from start to finish, ensuring you create a piece you're proud of. 

All the materials needed for your resin art creation, including high-quality epoxy resin, pigments, and various embellishments are supplied.  

Dive into the creative process and design your own unique art piece. From colourful coasters to mesmerising wall art, the possibilities are endless.  

Enjoy a welcoming atmosphere where you can connect with fellow art lovers, share ideas, and inspire each other.  

Whether you're a complete beginner or a seasoned artist, the workshop is tailored to suit all skill levels.  

Reserve your place now and embark on your resin art journey.

title: The Little Wine Co. Pop-Up Cellar Door
description:
Welcome to The Little Wine Co. pop-up cellar door at The Art Syndicate.

The wines of the Hunter valley are coming to your doorstep. Join them for a unique wine tasting experience in the heart of the city where you get to explore six exquisite wines.

They are sharing their favourite up-and-coming alternative varietals, so don't miss this opportunity to discover new flavours and enjoy a fun afternoon with friends.

See you there!

title: Tasting Topper's Mountain Wines with the Winemaker Jan Taborsky
description:
This is your chance to taste exciting alternative varietals from an up-and-coming wine region. Don't miss out!

High altitude, unique soil and focus on rare varieties. Topper's Mountain Vineyard is one of the most interesting terroirs in Australia. The winemaking is straightforward with minimal intervention fully respecting the uniqueness of the place. 

Among others, the line-up will include Topper's icons - Manseng and Nebbiolo. Wines will be presented by winemaker Jan Taborsky.

title: KV on Show
description:
From the Kitchens of Quay (Sydney), Tetsuya’s (Sydney), The Ledbury (London); The French Laundry (Napa Valley); Qualia (Hamilton Island); Akiba (Canberra); L’Ancienne Auberge (France); The Waterside Inn (Berkshire); Gordon Ramsay (London) and Bouchon (Napa Valley) to now our own Shoalhaven South Coast Southern Highlands Crown Jewels, KV on SHOW brings together five chefs in one spectacular premium ticketed showcase event - on the magnificent, iconic grassed Showground ring at Kangaroo Valley’s Osborne Park, surrounded by the beauty of the escarpment and offering a stunning backdrop for our outdoor food event. The leisurely, long lunch is back.

Imagine what Nick Gardner (Hampden Deli, Dining & School, Kangaroo Valley), Sam Smith (Ponte Bar and Dining, Nowra), Tommy Prosser (recently at Berrima Vault House, Berrima), Damian Martin (Dangerous Ales), and Chris Thornton (Restaurant Mason) can envision together, for a completely different type of food experience. Each chef will be presenting a three-course meal to approx. 20 guests and then joining together to create the final course, a signature collaborative dessert made in full view of the guests. Definitely, an Instagram showstopper.

A “chill-out lounge” also forms part of the layout and atmosphere of this outdoor lunch. 


Thanks to Shoalhaven Food Network for supporting this premium event!

title: Caravan Masterclass
description:
In partnership with the Queensland Government, Caravanning Queensland’s popular VANSafe program is expanding to the Queensland outback across 11 different caravan parks.

The free VANSafe program offers local residents and tourists a unique educative program focussing on essential safe towing practices, proper loading, weight distribution, and compliance with regulations to empower all attendees with the knowledge to embark on their next road trip safely and with confidence.

Please see the website for more details.

title: Simon Taylor - Big Time - Sydney
description:
Simon Taylor has hit the big time. After becoming the first Australian to perform standup on The Tonight Show starring Jimmy Fallon, he toured the States, featured in a Netflix series and then returned home to film a comedy special at the Sydney Opera House. 

Not to mention his standup videos have received over 30 million views online. Despite all this, he recently became a dad so most of his time is spent covered in spew, He’s truly made it.

title: Eddie Ifft - The Natural Stupidity Tour - Sydney
description:
Get ready, Australia! The hilariously candid stand-up comedian Eddie Ifft is heading down under with a brand-new show “Natural Stupidity.” In a world obsessed with artificial intelligence, Eddie is here to remind us all why natural stupidity is infinitely more entertaining. Through true and genuinely hilarious stories of life with a wife and two kids, you’ll be in stitches as he dives into all the trouble he somehow finds himself in.

Described by critics as “wickedly funny” and “a master of the craft” Eddie has been hailed for his razor-sharp wit and ability to find humour in the absurdities of everyday life. The LA Times calls him “one of the most talented comics working today” while Time Out New York praises his “fearless honesty and relentless energy.” Known for appearances on top Australian TV shows and as a podcast favourite in the U.S. including on the Joe Rogan Experience—this is one comedy tour you won’t want to miss! Get your tickets now before they’re gone!

title: Rebecca Rath: Hawkesbury
description: Rebecca Rath lives with her family on a vineyard in Pokolbin, NSW, Australia. While an academic with a strong philosophical bent, ideally, she wants nothing more than for others to experience the joy of art and nature. Working straight from nature and en plein air from her bush studio enables her to fully capture her love of the Hunter Valley landscape.

title: Seaside Foraging Workshop
description:
Learn the what, where and how of coastal wild food. Join Sydney forager Diego Bonetto and wild food expert Oliver Brown on a three hour workshop learning the what, where and how of collecting a meal from the seashore. This is a rare opportunity to learn from two of Sydney’s most knowledgeable people when it comes to sourcing food from the land and sea.

This is an informative workshop designed to empower people with identification skills. Participants will receive material on the day and follow up links so to progress with their own research. The knowledge is old and widespread and this learning experience will empower participants by giving the possibility to meet, touch, smell and even taste the plants. 

The workshop is a family and pet-friendly stroll by the sea. Dress for the weather and cameras and notebooks are recommended. Venturing onto the rock platform is often slippery and will depend on wave conditions. 

Please note this workshop is not suitable for people with restricted mobility.

title: Mount Keira Christmas Markets
description:
Mount Keira Demonstration School is hosting a festive Christmas market with a variety of amazing small business stallholders. 

Shop local and fill up your Christmas stockings while enjoying the fresh mountain air. There will be market stalls, a raffle, barbeque, kids activities, a coffee van, Santa photos, face painting, a bake sale and a special appearance by the MKDS Kids Christmas Choir, plus so much and more!
host: MOUNT KEIRA DEMONSTRATION PRIMARY SCHOOL P&C ASSOCIATION

title: South Coast NSW Wine Tasting Tour
description:
If you’re on a holiday in Wollongong or on the South Coast NSW and looking for things to do, this South Coast NSW Wine Tasting Tour Event will tick all of the boxes! 

Enjoy beautiful scenery, award-winning South Coast Wineries and gourmet local food.  

Event occurs every Saturday * and includes return transfers to and from Wollongong, Shellharbour, Kiama, Gerringong or Berry (other departure locations may be available on request)

Visit three unique wine tasting experiences, indulge in a local cheese and gourmet produce tasting platter, plus a one course lunch served at a winery or popular local restaurant with a glass of wine, beer or soft drink served with lunch.

Meet experienced wine professionals and be guided by their friendly and experienced driver.

Limited tickets are available.  

*Kenny Escapes reserves the right to make changes to the above itinerary. You will be advised of any changes to the itinerary as soon as possible.

*Please Note:  A minimum number of ticket sales are required for this event to go ahead. If ticket sales are below the minimum number required, this event will be cancelled and a full refund provided. You will be notified of the intent to cancel no later than 48 hours prior to your tour date via the email address you provide on the booking form.

title: Music in the Morning – NSW Police Band
description:
Music in the Morning presents:

Music in the Morning – NSW Police Band

Jingle All the Way with the NSW Police Band.

Come see the NSW Police Band perform all your favourite Christmas songs featuring star vocalist, Belinda Parsons. 

From traditional Christmas songs to holiday classics with a modern twist, there is something for everyone to enjoy. ‘Tis the season to spread some Christmas cheer! 

The New South Wales Police Band is regarded as the State Band of NSW. Formed in 1895, the NSW Police Force proudly boasts the country’s oldest concert band. 

It is a full-time unit of the NSW Police Force, providing musical support to NSW State Government and Police events, including Royal occasions and Papal visits, as well as prestigious ceremonies for Presidents and Australian sporting teams and athletes.

title: The Main Line | Diesel Train Rides Family Fun Day
description:
Ride the Diesel Train and then Ride the Miniature Train for a great day out with family and relive the romance of the Railways.

Enjoy Food sales, the Picnic Grounds and Playgrounds and join a Locomotive Shed Tour.

title: Peoplecare Trithegong
description:
The stunning harbour precinct and blue mile of Wollongong City will come alive again in 2023! 

And this will be the biggest one yet.

triTheGong is a festival of fitness, health and family fun that offers everyone the chance to “have a go” or come along and enjoy the colour and spectacle of the sport of triathlon.

The Peoplecare triTheGong triathlon festival offers races for all ages and abilities.

Enter as an individual or get some friends together and be part of a team and taste the excitement, exhilaration and sense of accomplishment that comes with participating in this festival.

title: Recreate a Masterpiece
description:
Recreate a Favourite Masterpiece - for Expressive High School Artists (Teens)

Come along and enjoy hours of ART fun.  All materials provided. 

Great opportunity to try something you've always wanted to! 
You'll be guided and encouraged to create the best artwork you can. 

Limited spaces - Book now - This class will take place at Expressive Art Experience Studio...  be ready to bring home a stunning masterpiece!

What to bring:  a water bottle and snacks (optional). 

IMPORTANT : No nuts - Enclosed shoes preferred and no precious clothing (as we will get messy). 
Aprons provided.

Weekly every Wednesday for 5 weeks

Creative Kids Vouchers
If you wish to use your Creative Kids Voucher, simply complete details when you place your booking. 

For more information regarding the Creative Kids program, or to get your voucher visit Service NSW website.

If you have credit from 2022 Creative Kids Vouchers, please phone.

Bought to you by :

Expressive Art Experience +
Michelle Springett - Expressive Art Therapist

title: Liquid Geometry by Scot Chaseling
description:
Sevenmarks Gallery is pleased to present a highly anticipated new body of work by the acclaimed artist Scott Chaseling. Titled Liquid Geometry, Chaseling has built a reputation for pushing the boundaries of contemporary glass art, and these new pieces continue to innovate and narrate material experiences.

Highly technical, and calling on three decades of experience, Chaseling’s “pots” as he likes to call them, have a playful sculptural quality – indeed they almost appear “liquid”. The exhibition is completed with a series of glass and steel sculptures, and mixed media wall works that explore the interplay of light, colour and form. 

Chaseling's work is renowned for its meticulous craftsmanship and conceptual depth, inviting viewers to engage with the materiality and ephemeral nature of glass. This is his first major solo exhibition at Sevenmarks gallery.

title: Berry Motorfair 2024
description:
Buckle up, because Berry Motorfair will be making its triumphant return. This year, the event will be held at the Coolangatta Estate Winery, reflecting its growing popularity and commitment to providing an even more spectacular experience.

Berry Motorfair will feature over 100 classic, collectible, and cool cars, set against the picturesque backdrop of the Shoalhaven regions' most-awarded winery. Attendees can look forward to an array of stunning vehicles, including the Ferrari F40 and Enzo, rare Porsches, Pagani, McLarens, muscle cars and race cars. Alongside the automotive showcase, the event promises to kick things into overdrive with live music, charity auctions, giveaways, and a pit stop for a delightful selection of food and wine, making it a perfect day out for families, friends, and car enthusiasts.

Berry Motorfair will continue its support for crisis support and suicide prevention organisation, Lifeline Australia and is proud to announce its partnership with the Starlight Children’s Foundation, aiming to raise $150,000 for these vital services.

To secure your tickets, visit the Berry Motorfair Humanitix page.

title: Pottery Wheelthrowing Experience
description:
Two hours of pottery wheel throwing designed to give you a taster of what it's like to create your own pieces on the pottery wheel. 

This one-off experience includes tuition on the pottery wheel by an experienced teacher, clay, use of tools/equipment, light refreshments and a clear glaze firing of three items each.

title: Friday Night Clay Date
description:
Grab a friend/partner/colleague for a fun Friday night of pottery wheel throwing. Or come on your own for some time out! 

Two hours of wheel-throwing pottery, with nibbles provided. Bring your own drinks (18+) We provide the rest! 

What's included: 
 instruction on the pottery wheel 
clay
use of tools & equipment 
light refreshments 
bisque firing 
clear glaze firing of 3 items per person 

Pots are available for pick up or postage at cost 3-4 weeks after the workshop.

This workshops is suited to absolute beginners. 

All one-off workshops are for ages 18+

title: Spirits of Jervis Bay Festival
description:
Come along to the Jervis Bay Distillery Festival, where the heart of the local community comes alive through exceptional spirits and the very best local cuisine! Set against the stunning backdrop of Jervis Bay, this festival is your gateway to savouring the finest handcrafted spirits from the region’s most talented distilleries.

Sample a diverse range of expertly crafted Spirits including whiskies, vodkas, rums, and gins from top distillers, each with its own unique story and flavour. Whether you’re a connoisseur or curious, this festival is your gateway to discovering new favourites and connecting with fellow enthusiasts in the community. Don’t miss out on an unforgettable celebration of fine spirits and good times.

Pair your drinks with mouthwatering dishes from the best local food vendors, showcasing the freshest ingredients and culinary creativity that Jervis Bay has to offer. With live music, masterclasses, distillery and cocktail demonstrations, engaging insights, and a buzzing festival atmosphere, there’s something for everyone.

title: Coastal Forage
description:
After three successful years, the Forage is back and they are going coastal. They have decided to move their foodie trail to the coast in the stunning Shoalhaven and start at Moona Moona Beach Playground and walk along to Plantation Point.

Their Coastal Forage will tell the story, through food and wine, of the Shoalhaven. From the remote reaches of Morton National Park to the cool climate mountain villages and rolling green hills of the highlands that host Fitzroy Falls and the Minnamurra Rainforest, down the hilly terrain of Mt Conjola through to the coastal regions including Jervis Bay and Seven Mile Beach all with access to fresh seafood from the ocean.

This is no ordinary ten-course lunch. The Forage is a degustation meal enjoyed as you stroll leisurely along on a flat, beginners walk and take in the natural beauty of Pacific Coast. 

Parking has been arranged at the start of the walk and is included in the ticket price.

title: Tomakin Community Day
description:
The Tomakin Community Day is an event for all the community to get together, meet new neighbours and catch up with old friends. 

There will be a jumping castle, dancing displays, live music, Christmas themed and hand made product stalls as well as food including sausage sizzle, donuts, Asian food and coffee. 

There will be games and races as well as information booths on local organisations. The Broulee RFS and the Broulee Surf Life Saving Clubs will also be there. 

It is a fun fill afternoon with something for everyone. There will also be a basket shootout and a soccer shootout.

title: Four Winds Spring Youth Music Festival
description:
Soundscapes of Tomorrow: Empowering youth through intergenerational creativity

Four Winds invites audiences to be entranced in storytelling through sound, and the timeless connection between community, nature, and the arts. Celebrating the talents, aspirations and achievements of young people ‘SYMF’ transcends divides to foster intergenerational music making, sharing and learning.

title: Norfolk Island Bounty Day
description:
Join the Bounty Mutineer descendants as they enact the landing of their forebearers. 

The landing takes place at the Kingston Pier, the oldest pier in the Southern Hemisphere. You can follow the procession of the Bounty Mutineers descendants who will be dressed in period costume to the Cenotaph to pay respects to fallen heroes where hymns are sung. 

Then it’s onto the Cemetery where wreaths are laid, local hymns and the Pitcairn Anthem (Norfolk Island’s national anthem) are sung. The Bounty Mutineer descendants then make their way to the All Saints Church for the judging of the best-dressed families. 

You can observe the tradition of the children of the Bounty Mutineers descendants rolling down the Government House hill. Then it is off to morning tea followed by a traditional Island picnic lunch. Before lunch, the Norfolk grace will be sung. You will sample some traditional Norfolk wetls enjoy complimentary, champagne, orange juice, tea and coffee. Baunti Tours will also have an entertainer for their guests.

title: Free TAFE NSW Women in Business webinar: Setting up for sales success in your business
description:
Get practical advice and examples to help you set up your business for sales success by joining us for an exclusive Women in Business webinar with sales thought leader, Maree Kirkpatrick, on Wednesday, 24 April 2024 - 12pm-1pm.

The webinar will show you how to uncover the needs of your potential clients; how to have sales conversations that convert; and guide you on how to implement a sales process into your business.

The webinar will provide you with practical advice and examples to help you set up your business for sales success.

Maree is a dynamic and experienced sales specialist, business strategist and trainer.

She has over 17 years' experience in successful sales and negotiation, providing multimillion-dollar results for multiple corporations. She has negotiated settlements in industries including real estate, the FMCG sector (fast-moving consumer goods), health and fitness, vitamins and supplements, personal development and motor vehicles.

Maree has won numerous awards including the Sales Mastery Top Gun Award and has driven corporate success in winning Supplier of the Year and Perishable Supplier of the Year in the Metcash annual awards.

Maree is also the founder and trainer of Her Sales Club which helps women in business make more income and impact, by learning how to sell what it is that they do, with ease, focusing on connection, relationship building and support.

The webinar will cover the following topics:

  • How to uncover the needs of your potential clients
  • Sales conversations that convert, and
  • Implementing a sales process into your business.

Register now to secure your spot

title: Asbestos awareness and safety training
description:
Asbestos is a naturally occurring mineral found in rocks and was used in over 3000 building products until it was banned in 2004.  It is still present in one in three Australian homes today.  When asbestos is disturbed, asbestos fibres can be inhaled, which can cause life-threatening diseases such as asbestosis, mesothelioma, and lung cancer. 

Unsafe work practices when working with asbestos put you and your co-workers at risk and anyone else that may come into contact with it.

On successful completion of this course, you should be able to:

  • recognise the risk and serious long-term impacts of asbestos exposure.
  • recognise the roles, responsibilities, and legislation for asbestos related work.
  • determine if asbestos containing material may be present.
  • identify asbestos containing materials and hazardous activities that lead to asbestos exposure.
  • identify suitable control measures for asbestos and asbestos containing materials ACM
  • safely handle asbestos and asbestos containing materials (ACM)
  • inspect worksites and communicate asbestos risks and asbestos controls with an informed perspective.

This course is aimed at all NSW construction tradespeople, demolition workers, renovators, handypersons and anyone who is likely to encounter asbestos on the job.  Completion of this course will ensure employers of these workers meet their legal obligation to provide asbestos awareness training.

title: Women in Business webinar: Pricing Your Service-Based Business
description:
Don't miss out on the exclusive Women in Business webinar: Pricing Your Service-Based Business, hosted by multi-award-winning entrepreneur Lisa LaMaitre, Wednesday 9 April 2025, 12pm-1pm.

Join Lisa as she shares her business expertise on market analysis, profit, and pricing strategies. Lisa is currently a Board Director with the Australian Risk Policy Institute (ARPI), and over the past 33 years has developed and owned six businesses across various industries.

Topics will include:

  • Pricing for a service-based business
  • Analysing the market, knowing your breakeven point
  • Pricing for profit and branding, to back your numbers

Secure your place for the webinar, register now and enhance your service-based business!

title: Let's Talk Roadshow Taree
description:
The Let's Talk Roadshow is back on the road this year and in Taree this 30 and 31 October. NSW Fair Trading is partnering with local stakeholder organisations including local council, neighbourhood services centre, youth organisations, disability services and Aboriginal organisations to hold a variety of community workshops.

The Roadshow will feature sessions aimed at educating community groups to:

  • Navigate tenancy issues and manage cost of living pressures.
  • Learn about consumer rights and financial support.
  • Connect with vital services and supports available.
  • Speak directly with essential government and community services.
  • Access support services for Aboriginal community members.
  • Learn about consumer rights and the NDIS.

Sessions are held across various locations and times.

Find out detailed session information and register at the event website.
